review_body: I stayed at Crowne Plaza in February 2020 for 4 nights with my teenagers. Stupidly I left my purse in the safe ( totally my fault). I contacted the hotel upon my return home asking if my purse was handed it as it was in the safe. I completed an online form and submitted. I have not heard anything from the Crowne since submitting the form so really disappointed. My fault for leaving my purse and English cash but it would not hurt for a response. Poor customer service.

Great hotel, great location, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, a Dunkin Donuts, M&M's World, Hershey World, and several Subway Stations! Very nice fitness center too! People were friendly, place was clean! Line of taxis right outside the hotel!

I’ve stayed at this hotel several times. Due to COVID I had to cancel my trip, after receiving an email stating they would refund me my full amount due to the circumstances.That was on March 15. I was told it takes up to 2 weeks.No Refund. I contacted them and they said 21 days21 days passed no refund. I contacted them. They said 6-8 weeks.No refund. I contacted them, they said by May 15.On May 15, I contacted them again and they said it’d be another 90 days.No one clearly knows what they are doing. I can’t get anyone to call back, even after leaving several messages. E-mail responses are just basically form letters that don’t address why I was told several lies. One even had my name misspelled. I understand we are all dealing with a lot right now, as a matter of fact, I’ve been under stay at home orders since early March and have been working from home processing refunds for my job. To be told I would be refunded, then lied to as they kept moving the date shows they do not value customers.I will never stay here again, which is sad as I enjoyed the hotel for the most part.

The Crowne Plaza is a very nice hotel with reasonably sized rooms. The staff were polite and friendly. The breakfast wasn't the best but it was ok. The location was perfect, 1 block from time-square, brilliant. The only disappoint aspect was when we took our luggage downstairs to get a cab to the airport we were offer the hotel van which we declined due to the price and were then told to walk out to the street find our own cab.

I took my 13 year old niece to NYC for her birthday. The hotel was just what we needed. The room was spacious by NYC standards. The room was a little worn, but nothing that should prevent one from staying there. We were upgraded to a higher floor upon arrival and given food and drink vouchers for everyday of our stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Can’t beat the location. Because COVID was just starting to shut things down during our trip, we spent a lot of time in the room and we were very comfortable watching tv (love their TVs so we could watch our own streaming apps). My only complaint would be that you can’t control the room temperature. I like a cool room to sleep and I woke up hot every night.

From the check-in with the lovely and HELPFUL Victoria on Friday morning, March 6th, she taught us what's-what the at the Crowne Plaza and what's nearby to help make our weekend top-notch! We were blessed to have TONIGHT SHOW tickets that night, after touring NBC, then, Saturday somehow got to see SNL LIVE with Daniel Craig and The Weekend, then topped it off on Sunday seeing Beetlegeuse 3rd row at the Winter Garden on Broadway!! Crowne Plaza (and Victoria) know how to help make NYC!!!

This is a very delayed review but needs to acknowledged. The service at the hotel was unexceptional that we both had experienced. I was celebrating my sixtieth with my husband I had a stroller which aids my walking. When we approached the reception desk I was approached by a lovely lady named Onelia G her performance for looking after guests was outstanding. Our room was lovely and breakfast in the morning was gd to. Definetly would stay here again Thankyou.
user_name:
Angela59H
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed here in December for my first trip to NYC. The hotel is perfectly located right in the middle of everything - honestly, you couldn’t pick a better located hotel!The room was basic (as expected for a city hotel) but clean, which was the most important part for us as we were only in the room to sleep and shower. The only downside was the extra charge on the room per night on top of the rate we already paid when we booked, which I wasn’t aware of, but this is quite common in city hotels.When I come back to NYC I’ll definitely be booking to stay here again.

Wasted over one hour on the phone trying to resolve an issue that should have taken 1 minute.. still not resolved . I just won’t take bad customer service any longer. I just can’t, won’t. Too many other places to stay than places that have no interest in resolving even the most minor of issues

My daughter and I stayed here for her 16th birthday celebration for several days we had the 22nd floor with the Time square view the corner windows at first when we arrived they had the rooms wrong but upon calling down to the desk they immediately changed us to the correct room. I booked almost a year in advanceThe room itself is very basic but you pay for the view more than anything the food at the restaurant was a bit pricey but that's what you expect for New York but it was goodThe location was perfect and close to everything you can get in and out and go anywhere you want it quickly the only thing I could say was a negative was that accommodations in the room could be a little bit better for the price but all in all we had a lovely stay

Really great family experience for kids first visit to NYC. Fantastic location, and exceptional service from Tofael at Brasserie 1605. Recommend the breakfast buffet and his service made the experience that much better. Overall, very responsive and friendly staff.

My husband and I absolutely enjoyed our stay at Crown Plaza Hotel in Times Square Manhattan. Although I have visited other Crown Plaza’s locations, this particular location has confirmed that all of their chain of locations are all phenomenal.  From their cleanliness, exclusive lobby area, awesome location, and outstanding customer service (Freddy was the best!); I will definitely make this my number one pick when choosing a hotel in New York. I can return again and again. Therefore, I highly recommend this hotel to someone who loves great room city views, close walking distance to shopping stores/restaurants, and a great atmosphere and attentive customer service! Their text messaging customer service system was very impressive. Crown Plaza is my all-time favorite hotel!

We checked in straight from JFK at the peak of check-in time on 1st January 2020 having been travelling for more than 24 hours (from Brisbane). At first sight the long queue for check-in did not offer much hope of seeing a bed for a couple of hours. The first of our surprises at the Crowne Plaza was how well organised they were. The queue moved astonishingly quickly and we were in our room inside 20-minutes. In New York City you can't expect large rooms but the one we had was more than adequate, clean and fresh.'Snack' time in the bar/restaurant in the lobby was surprise number 2. By NYC standards the prices are more than reasonable. By anyone's standards the portions were huge.Breakfast was the next surprise. An array of fresh fruit, cooked food, cereals and anything else you might want was all readily available in the buffet. Staff were on hand all the time should you need anything.Easy walk to the Christmas tree, Macy's and all the other stores as well as Broadway theatres so no complaints on location either.The only sour note was the imposition of a very heavy "resort tax" levied by most NYC hotel. We knew about it so no surprise but I am wary of locations that export their taxes, No difference, economically, to taxing their exports. Not the hotels fault but it makes for a black mark against New York.Having said that, if you have to go to New York City you won't be disappointed with the Crowne Plaza.

I really enjoyed my stay. The staff is very kind and patient (especially Anna from the dining room!). The rooms are spacious and clean, the food excellent, great location, the conceriage is very helpful. Very recommended!

Nice hotel directly in the heart of times square. Prime location that is walking distance from mostly everything and literally across the street from Junior's cheesecake. Freddy was the 1st person we met during check in and his customer service was phenomenal. Our room was great and the views were spectacular.

This is a beautiful Hotel with an amazing view of Times SquareFull recognition of my platinum IHG membership with free upgrade to a beautiful "corner city view high floor" room with an amazing view of Times Square. Also i received a 25$ coupon to use at their restaurant.The location with the Times Square just around is amazing.Also i got a special price of 16$ for the breakfast which was a nice breakfast full of varieties.Really a perfect stay in the beautiful times square.Big thank you to Mr. GRANT FABER the FRONT OFFICE DIRECTOR who made my stay an Amazing one in Beautiful New York.When i return to New York with my family, this will be my first choice hotel for sure.

Because of health reasons, we needed to cancel our hotel room for March 13 that we already paid in full. Grant F. is now saying that it’s not transferable or refundable even though nothing was on our confirmation. Stand by your product and take care of your FUTURE CUSTOMERS.

Loved this hotel. Stuff is extremely attentive and courteous. I had the best check in experience ever with Victoria! and breakfast buffet is delicious, thanks Tofael who gave us a great service. I would definitely come back.

We recently stayed at the Crowne plaza for 3 nights, and with us being first timers and we arrived in the city late in the evening, we was both tired. My boyfriend emailed ahead of our stay, and upon check in, we got upgraded to a king room and was given some drinks vouchers. When we arrived into our room, we was amazed, nice sized room, very comfortable bed and very clean! The reception staff were always polite and helpful with any query we had! The concierge at the hotel was also amazing, sorted us out sightseeing passes, told us what buses to take and even marked a map for us so we wouldn’t get lost. Then on check out, we could leave our luggage downstairs, and they still allowed us to eat and drink in the bar while waiting for our transfer! This hotel completely exceeded my expectation and would most definitely stay here again if we ever have the opportunity to come to New York again! Thank you Crowne plaza

This was my second time of staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square, the first time being 4 years ago, and this time was hugely disappointing to say the least.I was staying here (both times) with my sister, my mum and my auntie for three nights.We were here celebrating my mum’s 65th Birthday and my aunties 70th so I had emailed the hotel two months before our arrival informing them of this and they replied saying that if any upgrades were available then we would be upgraded at check in. This didn’t happen even though the hotel didn’t seem full but never mind, it was just one of those things.The room we did get allocated was extremely small for four of us but again, just one of those things.On our first night, we hardly got any sleep as the connecting door in our room to the room next door was constantly rattling. It sounded like there must have been a draft that was making it shake. However, we managed to resolve this ourselves by sticking two pieces of cardboard in it (as shown on the picture).The next day, we found that we didn’t have any hot water coming from the bath or shower. After trying for quite a while to get it hot by letting it run, we had no joy so informed reception on our way out.When we returned late that afternoon, it still wasn’t working and wasn’t even sure if anyone had even attended our room to attempt to fix it.After this it was reported another three times and there was only one time we were in the room when an engineer arrived, which was on the last evening. The engineer explained that to get the shower running hot you had to run the sink tap for 5 minutes and then run the bath tap for 5 minutes and then put the shower on and it will be warm. How ridiculous is that?? He seemed to think it was common knowledge of that is what you need to do?? Once the water in the shower was finally running warm, the pressure was terrible which meant the two of us who have very long thick hair were unable to wash our hair as the pressure was just not good enough.To not have hot water for 3 nights and 4 days of being in a hotel is totally unacceptable. The staff on reception were very polite each time we reported it but the service of actually getting it fixed was non-existent, until the engineer attended on the last evening to give us the instructions of how to get it warm.There were no drinks vouchers, or nothing waived from the resort fee, so it wasn’t great having to pay another £100 on check out for the hotel when we hadn’t even had hot water, which you would think is a basic requirement.On our previous visit 4 years earlier, we had no problems at all which was why we returned to the same hotel.Unfortunately, we won’t be staying at the Crowne Plaza when we next visit New York.

We have been staying at the hotel for the last few days and have received great customer service from Tofael at breakfast. He made our stay very pleasant and thoroughly enjoyable as he was very helpful and made sure we had everything we neededThank you

Stayed in a room with 2 double beds which was spacious and on a higher floor with views back to 49 and 50th streets. Locations is fab. Had some tacos night 1 in the bar and pleasant service and cocktail.Handy to be able to get a takeaway coffee and tea downstairs with salads and yoghurts. The foyer is pretty dull but the room was impeccably clean, no noise from below and staff all helpful Plan to return

First time in New York as a solo female traveler Check in easy though I knew about city tax this wasn’t mentioned in check in and I received I billunder room door the night before check out .Small point but maybe mention this at check in The reception,bar and restaurants are lovely , modern and styled beautifully.I found the staff in all areas to be friendly and approachable.They have a small area where you can purchase such things as theatre tickets The hotel is fantastically placed , in the centre of Tomes Square and round the corner to a subway The room , large with the biggest comfiest bed I’ve been in Large shower room with toiletries and a hairdryer.The linen and towels were changed on a daily basis Down side ! There was an adjoining door to the room next door and I could probably join in the conversation with the inhabitants!The windows also could do with extra glazing for sound proofing I was on the 4O th floor The street sounds very quiet however the noise from the air conditioners ( I’m assuming that the noise was this ) sounded on occasion like there was a plane engine outside and I was woken frequently by this noise All in all enjoyed the location , just sort out the glazing and ask guests if they mind having a room with an adjoining door

Well not everything was perfect but the hotel made it right and that is what counts. We had an issue with the air in our room, it kept getting warmer until our room was 76 degrees. The hotel offered to change rooms or bring in a small portable ac, which we chose and it worked perfectly. The great things are the staff, everyone from the front desk to the bar staff and the concierge were great to work with. The location could not be better, everything within walking distance is fantastic. Will definitely stay here again next year for our annual NY trip.

We booked the traditional rooms on 36 floor for 2 nights and 4 nights at the city view room after we returned from Niagara Falls. The location is great with subway stations at a stone throw. The room is cold for our 1st 2 nights even when the temperature shows 27 degree. The warmer is working well for our last 4 nights. The room is clean but not really what I expected for a renovated room. If you order items online and send to the hotel, do note that there will be a storage fee. The hotel doesn’t store luggage overnight when we travel to Niagara Falls and return after 2 days.

The location was great. Awesome view of Times SquareHad a late check-in because of flight and the front desk people were very accommodating and helped us settled quickly so we could rest up for a fun weekend. Overall the staff were excellent and were quick to provide great service.The concierge was super helpful with lots of suggestions for sights and great restaurants.

Staff in this hotel surprised me with their friendliness and even kindness! Breakfast room was quiet and staff attentive and welcoming. I didn’t expect this from a large chain hotel in a tourist spot. Being a frequent traveler, usually avoiding chain hotels, I truly feel I want to recommend this hotel and thank the staff for a pleasant stay.

Spent 4 nights here and it was perfect for us as a family visiting NY for the first time. Right in the centre of Times Square we were 2 mins walk from the square, 10 mins walk from Rockafella tower and 15 mins walk from Central Park. Gotcha’s to watch out for are hotel tax, $35 per room per night, for us with 3 rooms that was a $480 cost we had at check out. Traffic is crazy, if you get a taxi to JFK make sure you give yourself lots of time if you flying in the day, Cars are bumper to bumper. As Brits we are used to tipping but not to the degree that is expected in NY, much higher levels of tips expected and for everything! Didn’t spoil a wonderful trip for us though, we visited 911 memorial, statton island ferry, rockafella tower, ice skating, Hard Rock Cafe, saw a show on Broadway and Central Park. My kids are older (over 21) and went off doing own thing as well. Hop on bus a great way to get around and see the city. NY did not disappoint.

We stayed as a family of 3, my wife and daughter (12yrs). We arrived mid afternoon on a Saturday, check in was quick and easy and the lady on reception was welcoming. We had a room on the 39th floor, two double beds (small doubles though so be warned) which was plenty big enough for the 3 of us as we didn’t plan on spending much time in there. Location is great if you want to be in the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it was our first visit and we wanted this but it may not be everyone’s cup of tea. Coffee and Tea facilities in room which was great, and the food in the restaurant and bars was perfectly acceptable. The Cuban sandwich and chicken wings were awesome from the Broadway Bar... We only had breakfast once and it was fine but expensive and with a million options in the area we wanted to try other places everyday. The bar and restaurant are quite expensive but probably average for the area $10 for a pint of IPA for example so a couple of drinks for the 3 of us after a busy day and we were looking at around $60+ every night. The shower was awful, no pressure and the controls were either ice cold or lava so was difficult to get a decent flow going. But that was our only complaint.Big shout out to Tony in the Broadway bar! What a absolute gent he was. Friendly, energetic he made our evenings when in the bar after a long day exploring, keen to hear what we had been up to and giving useful recommendations - the world would be a much better place with more Tony’s in it. Overall good hotel, and a very pleasant stay. We would likely book again.
user_name:
iamrainsforth
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights Feb 2020. Absolutely no complaints.Check-in was easy and informative, our room was spot on with views over Times Square. It was clean, beds very comfortable, nice bathroom, hot shower and large TV for catching NBC morning news before heading out for the day. 2 free drinks vouchers were given to use in the downstairs bar which was lovely. Fabulous location for getting around the main attractions, easy walking distance of ESB,TOTR,Macy's and right on Broadway.Would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

First time in NYC for me and my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were not disappointed with Crowne plaza hotel. Perfectly placed for anyone wanting to walk to Times Square, Central Park and Rockefeller centre. We used the hop on hop off bus to visit other attractions as we’d bought the New York City Pass. We didn’t eat in the hotel as there are so many places to choose from within walking distance. We did enjoy drinks in the bar in the evening, very relaxed and lovely staff. We booked the hotel car to take us back to JFK and cost us $90 with the 20% tip! Would highly recommend this hotel

I am trying to get any proper feedback from the property regarding my lost and found since more than a month now. I checked out from the hotel on Jan 17 and the very next day I contacted the hotel regarding some items i left behind and asked to ship it to my home address at my cost of course. Since then i have sent numerous emails and filled the required paperwork, called several times however did not receive any proper reply neither the confirmation when/if i can get my items. I asked several times to provide me with contact details of the manager who can assist and do a proper follow up however this request was totally ignored. I even tried to contact the general manager - but did not receive any call or email back. If anyone from this hotel who actually cares about customers reads reviews - i would appreciate if you could get in touch with me. Emre Cankurtaran

The location is excellent! Everything is reachable by foot. The entrance to the hotel is from the garage, however you can enter from both street sides. The hotel has a bar, where you receive a complimentary drink once per your stay.The room was very comfortable with a nice view though there were not enough toiletries for 2 people (of course, we've asked for more). The hotel doesn't have an adapter, so bring yours (charching phone with usb is ok, but quite a problem if you have a laptop).The variety in breakfast buffet wasn't huge, but you can find what to eat anyway. Great green smoothies!City taxes are high.

My daughter and I had a fantastic trip to NYC. We had great service from Omelia G., who went the extra mile to answer my questions and make sure we were settled! The hotel is perfectly located for Times Square and the exciting things we had planned. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating when I had questions about the air. On future visits, we will definitely return to this Crowne Plaza.

Booked the whole holiday through BA & they were excellent including pre-booked airport transfers. Everything 100% through BA. Now the Crowne Plaza, Times Square!! If you expect a warm welcome & friendly service simply forget it. Rooms very basic (only to sleep so no big deal) Although in need of major updating, & cleaning service not great either. As a group of 8 we all felt of the same opinion.Definitely NOT the American welcoming experience you might expect!!

School break at the Crown Plaza and it was amazing we had a room over looking Times Square and the hotel is so clean and beautiful and the staff was amazing ...easy check in and we even got free breakfast which was not included ! room 1601 was awesome

We booked this hotel last minute so had to go for a upgraded room we normally wouldn't have gone for. So room was quite expensive but was lovely and large, modern and very clean. Staff were rude at the best of times. Location was great, right in times square. Would not stay here again.

We stayed 4 days and the room was clean, updated and the staff was fantastic. We ate in the hotel 2 days and the food was wonderful! We ordered room service one night and they delivered it quickly! They allowed us into our room early and offered us late check out. Will return there again. The location is perfect to walk to just about everything.

Stayed at the Crown plaza. It was fabulous. The staff were amazing and the room was incredible. We enjoyed the whole trip, the staff was incredible. It was a perfect fit for our trip. We saw 2 plays and were so.near tonthe hotel

Going to New York, the Crowne Plaza Hotel is the hotel to book. My partner and I were very fortunate to have stayed here for three nights to celebrate our anniversary. We couldn’t have asked for a better hotel that was centrally located to everything. We were able to walk everywhere such as Central Park, the MET, fashion district and the meat market district. We had a magical dinner at Restoration Hardware. The staff at the hotel were absolutely friendly, helpful and ensured our celebration was a memorable event. We were fortunate to receive a “room with a view” on the 46th floor, breakfast and drink coupons and assistance in purchasing two spectacular broadway shows and an unbelievable recommendation to a wonderful Italian restaurant near by called Chazz Palminteri. I defined recommend this hotel to everyone.

Our family was in town to see Frozen Broadway Musical. I chose Crowne Plaza for the location and it did not disappoint. It could not have been easier to get to the show. They also provide valet parking which was incredibly convenient. The gentleman that checked us in was professional, personable and efficient. Room was very clean, beds were very comfortable and the view from our room was great! We had room 1824, nice corner room with views of skyline, some water and some street views. Very quiet for the most part. It was a Saturday night, so of course, a couple of guest came in a little late and you could hear some talking and doors closing, nothing out the ordinary. Room was stocked with nice bath products. I met one of the housekeepers and she was so friendly. Another note on location, this hotel is perfect, right in the heart of Times Square. It will now be my first choice whenever I am in NYC.

After checking out of the hotel and advised that no monies were owed and all holdings against my card would be realised, monies have been taking from my credit card. Before booking the hotel were very quick at responding to my emails with enquires, however they are now ignoring emails asking why monies have been taken from my credit card.

I have to say thank you to front desk staff Sandra Esp. She was absolutely amazing. I was extremely tired and confused when checking in. She took her time b with my family and was very patient and very professional. She made the check in process one of the highlights of our vacation.

Located very centrally has an unbeatable advantage! We enjoyed our stay there and would choose to stay there again! Although it’s location we were not bothered by noise and were close to the metro, buses and taxis.

Okay, so luckily this is a city break and the amount of time spent in your hotel room is minimal and that is a good thing in this instance Good points hotel is in a fantastic location Breakfast was great Hotel manager does sort out problems which is always a plus- at least they want you to enjoy your stay and are happy to deal with any issues But This was a 3 night break and even though I appreciate things can happen and am grateful for the manager trying to put it right I would prefer a great, cry issue free stay without any stress!!Bad pointsFirst room was very basic and in need of a refurb~ dirty stained floors and walls, the bottom of the bath was half peeled away (not very nice!), wall lining peeling off in bathroom and toilet flush not working properly- think basic motel than 4 star hotel. We asked for a new room and were given another room.This room was better but food was all over the floor eventually house keeping came to clean ~ yay! Checked the linen and it was very dirty (red brown stains!!) so we had to get fresh sheets which we changed ourselves Dirty stained towels not great :( Shower leaking Heating not working properly so room was cold. Management gave us breakfast vouchers which was a nice touch etc but would prefer a clean room pleasant reception staff and a hassle stress free stay. There are so many hotels to choose from when visiting this amazing city and next time we will definitely be choosing somewhere else!

Rather unpleasant stay one night due to obnoxious guests having a 4 am family tantrum lasting about 15 minutes in the hallway. No security despite hallway cameras and a phoned in complaint by my neighbor. The hotel is simply too large for security to ensure guests comfort. The second night was affected by noise, this time from adjoining room guests, due to large gap under the connecting door which allowed unwelcome conversation to easily penetrate our room. By the way, adding to the aggravation in the middle of the first night, was the absence of that telephone plastic add on where important hotel service phone numbers are conveniently found in emergencies.
user_name:
AllenFein
Southampton, New York, United States

review_body: Myself and partner have just come home from a 6 night stay at the crowne plaza Times Square, as others have said this hotel is in a fantastic location, near to multiple subway stops, restaurants and shops. We paid extra to have a view of Times Square and the room was very spacious and clean, as others have said, there is no fridge in room, and for price of stay you would expect water in the room. We had a large walk in shower in bathroom, most morning we were up at 7 and had no issues with temperature of shower, how ever when we did get up after 8 the shower went from freezing to boiling hot and back again constantly! As I booked the hotel through British airways the “resort fee” was included so I didn’t have to pay this. However .... I would have been quite annoyed if I did ... during our 6 night stay I couldn’t say we used one facility that would warrant nearly $300 of resort fees!

The Crowne Plaza in Times Square is the best place to go for a visit, to eat, and to stay in Times Square, absolutely awesome, first class in everything, great service great atmosphere great people, go there for sure

Recently I had the pleasure of visiting the Crone Plaza Hotel on Time Square and what can I say, the staff and management were fantastic and very helpful with every enquiry that I had. My room was very well appointed, spacious and yet everything was close to hand, if I have one draw back, it's the sleep quality of the my bed, I prefer a hard mattress but I will not hold that against the hotel.The food, good sized portions, had the steak and the chicken, they were to die for, top marks to the chef.Overall my impression of the Crowne Plaza, 10/10, would I come back again, dont need to ask my twice, yes, in a heart beat

This hotel is absolutly in the heart of Manhattan. If you enjoy walking, you can reach everything on foot. We had a nice and big room and it was very clean. It got daily cleaned. Water is not provided, but it is drinkable from the tub. The beds are very big and great to sleep in. We did not have breakfast. If you want to have something little to eat, there is a special place in the lobby. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square and can only recommand it.

The hotel is directly across from the M&M store, which makes it easy to find. It's just around the corner from several theaters-we walked to see Hamilton and Wicked. We also walked to the MOMA, Hard Rock Cafe, and Ellen's Stardust Diner. Convenient coffee shop downstairs also sold hot cocoa and wine :-) Victoria at the Front Desk was very friendly and helpful.

Actually I am still convinced that for what you pay, you get a decent hotel in a very good location.The location, right at Times Square is prefect to start you're day exploring NYC.Having said that, there are some things you should know. The hotel is getting old. Rooms are very clean, but you hear your neighbors every move.. which is not always as nice..If you go back to a hotel for a second or third time, it's always nice if they notice that.. here they didn't.. its the small things.Overal a good hotel, which is getting dated. Could use a renovation in my opinion.And for everyone who is complaining about the "resort fee": It is mentioned everywhere. Don't come here giving a 1* review telling you didn't know... For that fee you can use the pool, fitness,...

This hotel is nice. Rooms are a good size and kept clean. Beds are comfortable. Location can't be beat. Within walking distance of everything in Times Square, Hells Kitchen, etc. Close to great restaurants and shows. Service is great.Two cons that stood out to me were: 1. lack of a mini fridge/microwave in the room. No place to take leftovers from the surrounding restaurants. For the price paid, this should be standard. 2. Excessive fees. There is a resort fee of about $40 per night regardless of whether you use the gym and/or other facilities or not. Also, the breakage deposit is $150 per night if you use a credit card. It goes back to your card at check out, but it's ridiculous...I would come back to this hotel only if I can find a deep discount or special rate.

Had thee best time in nyc , this hotel was best experience very central great location , the staff go over & beyond especially Anna she made our experience that more special treated us like family thank you so much ... Danielle , Ellie & Ollie

Every around holiday time we spend a night in NYC.This year we stayed at the Times Square Crowne Plaza. All aspects were top notch. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was friendly and professional. We drive in so we took advantage of the valet parking which was easy, from drop off to pick up. At the time, the hotel was undergoing some renovations, but to their credit, this did not impact the visit in any way. Excellent stay.

First time stay in NYC and at the Crowne Plaza. On arrival it was quite busy but expected for that time of the year. Check in was efficient and room was quiet, comfortable and clean. On site gym was good and had plenty of equipment to use.Location is amazing, central to everything.We tried getting something from the bar area downstairs once but seemed very understaffed and ended up leaving after about 10 minutes of not being seen to, other people waiting were also commenting on the delays.Still our stay was enjoyable and would stay again, the staff we interacted with were professional and courteous.

The first encounter upon checking in was very rough. Arrived at 1 am and got a very bad room with 2 queen beds (requested 1 king bed). The next day, Omelia G. fixed the bad experience, and assigned a much better room. Thanks, Omelia! Over all, decent hotel and in a central area of NYC.

I had to come to NYC for a work conference and needed a hotel close to where the conference was being held. Unfortunately this meant staying in Times Square which I always try to avoid when in the city. Booked this place because I found a good deal on hotels.com and wow, my expectations were far exceeded. The staff were all so nice, especially Omelia G. who made me feel so welcome and at home as soon as I checked in. I was very pleased with the system they have of texting you to ask how everything was going, if there’s anything they could do, etc. Had this been an automated service it might have felt intrusive. But it seemed to be real people on the other end and that made it feel like they genuinely cared. I only had one request (to leave a couple water bottles in my room) that I asked for via text and when I returned that evening, there were the water bottles. Room was spacious and comfortable, particularly for a mid town hotel. Shower was great. The Grind and Go area was very convenient. Room service was quick and the food was pretty good! All in all I was extremely pleased. While I likely won’t stay in Times Square on future trips, if I ever do, I would absolutely stay here again.

This was an absolute disgrace! I stayed there with my wife and 2 toddlers. It was by far the worse hotel experience we've ever had! The room was dirty! Unorganized & unsafe! Our first room had broken glass on the floor putting my children at risk, and if that wasn't bad enough there were exposed electrical live power cords which our child discovered, God knows what could have happened if we didn't see it in time!!!! The amount of time we had to wait for these matters to be attended to was ridiculous, included broken door locks.. cabinet door broken.poo on the floors.. The list goes on and on.. you could even say that they don't care! The kids were uncomfortable and unable to sleep until my wife cleaned up the room and made it safe enough for our children to be put to bed. I highly do not recommend this hotel. The staff are uneducated unprofessional and rude, they offered us a compensation of 50% which we never received.

I’m so impressed with how friendly the staff is here at the Crowne Plaza, particularly Onelia G. I didn’t expect that in New York City, but she’s from the Dominican Republic where everyone is friendly and outgoing.The room is great, the lobby bar is fun and the view is fantastic. And being right in Times Square gives access to everything.

The hotel is located at very close center of time squares, I spent a wonderful new year eve with my friends. When we checked in at front desk, I found I get the bed type wrong. While Evelyn was so helpful to help try to correct the room type and upgrade the room to a fantastic view for time square side, with lot of vouchers and coupons for membership benefits. The room is standard and the service was good, even at the very busy new year eve period. It is very convenient to go to time square, Moma, and subway stations take you to NY anywhere.

This hotel is in a great location when visiting New York. Had a room directly looking over Times Square. Staff were very helpful.Room was clean and comfortable, would recommend as a base when visiting this city.

We stayed at Crowne Plaza for our 4th year anniversary and we had the best time staying there. Great view and staff! Sofia made our anniversary even more awesome. We really recommenced this place to everyone!!

We stayed in the CP for Christmas, and sadly found it not up to scratch with the majority of reviews on here. While the hotel discounted our stay by one night one in recompense, I really wish we’d stayed elsewhere. After arriving 23 Dec I found the shower cold in the evening which I reported. The same again on the 24 Dec on which day we reported it twice, followed by another cold shower on Christmas Day. We were finally moved after reporting it for the fourth time, to a smaller, noisier room opposite the lifts, with little help offered to move our belongings. The shower in the original room was also dirty with hair on our arrival. There was clearly no communication between different shifts on FOH and no communication with us about why the problem had not been rectified. Each and every time it was down to us to raise and no one followed up to ensure it had been fixed. Apparently attempts had been made to fix it but no one had bothered to communicate with us. There are better places to stay in Manhattan.

I have mixed feelings about the CP of Times Square. Let’s start this out on a very strong positive: the staff. Specifically, Grant, John and Krisch. I hope IHG knows what assets they are to these men as they are exactly the type of people they should strive to employ. I was pleasantly surprised by their extreme professionalism when assisting me. I didn’t expect a text to reach out to me checking in, seeing if there was anything they could do to make my stay better. Sure, being and IHG Gold Elite member ensures a little extra recognition but these are just great guys who know how to make you feel like you’re at a 5 star hotel even when you’re not. Speaking of not, the rooms really lack here. Unfortunately, the HVAC didn’t work and the room was mid 70’s as opposed to mid 60’s where we like it. We had several other troubles with the room, too. We would’ve traded rooms but my son was too tired to deal. The phone line to call Valet went right to voicemail and a full voicemail at that. For the extreme prices they charge to park, that’s frustrating. There is no real lobby as far as lots of seating for people watching, relaxing. Just the bar area. The adjacent restaurant has the advantage of having a front seat view of Times Square yet it’s a plain white room and empty..and closed often. So odd. The location of the hotel is certainly a plus. Near everything! The no-frills coffee grab-n-go area is well stocked with some delicious Italian coffee and very fresh croissants. No place to sit and eat which is ashame but really well made stuff and not awful price points, especially compared to the very high prices at the Broadway Bar. I really felt welcome here. It makes me want to come back. Until they update and repair the rooms, bathrooms specifically, I am thinking I may try another IHG run location for now but I am hopeful to return here at some point. Thanks again to the people who made sure I’ll never forget the Crowne Plaza to be a worthy option.

Upon my arrival at the hotel on Jan 14, 2020, I learned that my room would be sightly delayed because the last occupant checked out late. The front desk employee was Donald Mei and he was extremely gracious and helpful. When he learned that my room would be not be ready for another 30 minutes, he came over to me in the lobby and provided comps for drinks and breakfast. His personality and attention to the delay was extremely appreciated. I would stay at the Crowne Plaza again since the culture of the hotel is to provide superlative service to its guests. My stay at the hotel for three (3) nights was outstanding and this employee's attention to detail was greatly appreciated. Sincerely, John McLernon

Room was lovely - good size for downtown New York. Everything you would expect from a Crowne Plaza and most important to us was the location - we were right beside everything. Just across the street was the stop for the sightseeing bus which was really handy as we used it to go to the various attractions.

Although I have been to NY and Time Square many times, for this visit, I wanted to stay in TS and the CP was a great choice.Hotel is big, very busy and loud, but staff try to do their best with this organized chaos in this mega hotel. Check in was great, I was given a drink voucher and a discounted breakfast due to being an IHG member. High floor, corner room with lots of windows and natural light and a small view of TS . Room was comfortable, very spacious and what seems a fairly recent renovation. Bathroom was simple, modern and functional.We slept like rocks due to all the walking and sightseeing, but beware that there is a lot of street noise, but that is the small price to pay for fantastic view and location.

Excellent place to stay based on location to Times Square and Broadway. Check in was ok and getting to room was ok. Room was about average. Shower in the bathroom was better than average. Bar and Food area were good. Concierge was very helpful. If the wind is blowing elevators are sketchy but not bad. Other than that elevators are very fast. Over-all not bad because of location.

We visited in July (so Apologies for the late post) - but I only found the card of the Manger yesterday which prompted me to write a review.I can’t praise this hotel enough! We stayed in New York for 9 days in the summer as it was our anniversary and also a treat for our 21 year old son, who had just graduated from University.We’ve stayed in Times Square four times previously (at the Millennium, Belvedere, the Riu and Hilton) all very good establishments, but this hotel was perfect. The location was awesome - great views of Times Square , the room was large clean and spacious - even though there were four of us. We were on a very high floor - it’s 46 storeys high, which was great for a views of Manhattan. However, don’t worry - as there’s an express lift to cater for all.This hotel is huge, but the staff still manage give it a personal touch for every guest. The Manager Jonathan Rodriguez was amazing, always out supporting his staff and speaking to guests. He and his team ensured we had a great time at the hotel! Thank you!The bar and the restaurant are pretty cool and the breakfast is pretty awesome too.Definitely recommend - Five Stars!

Loved that there was such attentive and friendly check-in staff on hand. We were provided with water and a glass of champagne on check-in. Sweet! We had a couple rooms for our group, and we came early to drop our bags to do some sightseeing. One room was ready and they let us put our luggage there and gave us a chance to freshen up before spending the afternoon touring. We were so grateful.

Great location to Time Square and Broadway, we had a great view from our window. The staff and service was very professional and the rooms were clean and tidy. I would recommend and we will definitely stay there again.

I had 2 night at this place as part of a work trip. As you would expect, the location of this hotel is its major selling point. Just outside Time Square and Broadway theatres, this place is busy with people. The room I had was decent. Good size, clean with a limited view of the city views. It served its purpose well for me. There is a nice bar at the lobby level and heaps of food/drinks options within 15 min walk.

After been booked into a shocking hotel round the corner we called in the plaza hoping we could book in straight away ! Freddy was amazing ! Booked us in at a great rate , what a room ! The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are clean , very well looked after and the views are amazing , every staff member we spoke to and saw were all very helpful and happy , I couldn’t recommend this hotel enough it’s brilliant and I can’t wait to go back ! They give you vouchers for free beer ! And money off your food ! Why would you not stay here !!!

I enjoyed every minute of it. Very clean and spacious. The bar is beautiful and the service is impeccable. This is my first time ever staying in the Crowne plaza and when I come back I'll stay here again and I'll tell all my friends and family about it.
user_name:
MrCruz196
New York City, New York

review_body: Visited my favorite NYC Hotel mid-December and remembered why its always been one of my favorote places to stay. Not just locaton which is right in the middle of Times Square with acess to all the shows, shopping, Christmas Tree and restaurants, but the Property itself and its people who are all super. From Executive Assistant Sylvia Geronimo who has always been my go to person that takes care of everything good at the Hotel, Ana the Hostesss at the Breakfast Buffet and all the employees who remember my family and I whenever we visit, the front desk that’s fast and effieicnt with check-in and out and ensuring vouchers are given out, the bar which has a great view with friendly bartenders and servers and the Assistant Managers who are always there to help. I almost forgot Housekeeping and all the other employees who really make this place hum. Thanks to GM Sanders for making this stay for my sister wife and I another awesome stay. Just a couple of updates. The Breakfast Buffet has now incresed from $10 to $16 but still a good deal.I receive questions about lack of a gym. Actually through its afiliation with one of the sports club, it provides access to a huge variety of equipment as well as classes. And finally lets all hope Sylvia remains in place as she really does help GM Sanders with outreach to IHG members that make us want to stay again and again (as well as recomemnd tis propey to others as I continually do)

Traveled to NYC for my daughters birthday. Fantastic location right at Time Square. Our room 1701 was a corner and had a great view! Victoria at the front desk made our check in special- she is amazing- happy birthday month Victoria!

I am an IHG member so I like to stay at member hotels for points. Crowne Plaza Times Square is always a great place to stay. On this trip in particular, my check-in was with Sandra, who went out of her way to make me feel welcome. Upon arriving in my room, I received a text asking if my room was acceptable. They even sent up some bottles of water for me.The beds are comfortable. The pillows fantastic. I do love this hotel.

Stayed here for 2 nights nice hotel lovely staff and right on times square would stay again place is spotless and very close to theatres and restaurants all around the times square area staff were very helpful

hotel was easy to find. Deak staff was helpful, bar staff was super friendly and accomodating, and the concierge was patient an humerous. literally the only issue with mt stay was that my room key was deactivated. 5 minutes and the problem was solved. everyone should stay here!

The hotel is nice. They have a nice view, very central. The only thing I was taken aback is the fact there is no fridge in the room, if you want one its chargeable.The hotel was nice enough to give us one for free as I need it from my meds. Over all one of the best hotels and location in New York to stay at.

What can I say the Crowne Plaza really looked after me and my husband for my surprise 50th birthday. As soon as we arrived for my birthday they gave us free drink vouchers for a couple of alcoholic drinks and also some free cocktails and also gave us two When we arrived as it was for my 50th birthday the reception team were lovely they gave us some free drink vouchers for our stay and two free breakfasts which was so lovely and made the beginning of our trip extra special so thank you. When we arrived at the hotel we couldnt believe how big it was with either an escalator or lift to take you up to the reception area. The hotel was lovely so modern and right in the heart of Times Square with fantastic views. We were on the 35th floor and the views were amazing. The room was so clean, modern and big. The rooms have black out curtains, are warm and the rooms are made up with clean bedding every day. Big TVs with hairdryers too. The beds are so big like super king size so we had a fantastic sleep all week. Fresh towels are put out in the bathroom each day and such a nice touch the complimentary small toiletries in the bathroom. The showers are so large and hot water so quickly. One day was so magical as it was snowing all day so the views from our room was amazing looking down from so high up. The hotel was lovely decorated all for Christmas and we ate in the hotel restaurant once and the food was nice. The bar area was extra special as some lovely views so sit near the front to look over Times Square. Lovely touch near the lifts was a food/drink area where you can buy wine, coffee and other refreshments, fresh danishes for breakfast, lunches like sandwiches and baguettes and salads, lots of yummy cakes. We took a couple of cheese board boxes to our room one day which was lovely and the hotel are very flexible if you take food back to your room which is nice from outside places. The concierge was extremely helpful and helped us book some sight saver passes which saved quite a bit of money and they helped out with us getting to and from places and provided maps too. When we checked out the receptionist asked when we were leaving and gave us some more free drink vouchers for the bar to get a drink each until our transfer picked us up directly outside the hotel for the airport which was very kind. So all in all the Crown Plaza we can’t thank you all enough you made this 50th birthday for me extra extra special and anyone wanting a fantastic stay in the heart of Times Square, New York we recommend here as the staff are lovely and friendly and the hotel is so modern you’d struggle to find somewhere as good. Thank you we loved it but so sad to leave but you made a couple from Nottingham, England have such a special memory that we will treasure always.

Obviously the hotel's location is unbeatable. Right on Times Square. Restaurants, pharmacies, stores...everything is right there. The rooms are clean and spacious by NYC standards. We spent 10 nights there with two children and we were all very comfortable. We were also given a complimentary fridge when requested.Issues: heating. It's central. Rooms are HOT and the only way to cool them is to open a window. Yes, an open window in Times Square. It didn't pose that much danger for my children but with younger I'd be nervous. The sounds of the city didn't bother us but sirens can be loud and bother others. Also the staff isn't nice, at all. I had 2 separate reservations to cover the 10 nights and I was first told we wouldn't need to switch rooms, then we had to switch and in a hurry. We lost some stuff because we had to leave the room. The general manager was very rough and not interested in helping the situation. We were given a higher floor and TS view to compensate but their attitude was a definite turn off. I'd rather stay at the other hotel we've used before where we've never been treated badly. Hotels aren't cheap and you expect a level of professionalism that this hotel apparently doesn't have.

We enjoyed our time here. Walking distance to many famed NYC places & the staff is great with advice. Comfy beds, clean rooms, and good food. The gotcha is the built in 18% tip in the bar and restaurant which they say is for parties of 6 or more but apply when there are 1,2,3, or 4 people. Given the expected NYC higher prices for food that 18% can add up quickly. Other than that, I recommend this hotel.

This Crowne Plaza is in a great location to lots of activities and sights seeing. There are positives and negatives to being in Times Square though! Everything is at your fingertips but it’s more expensive, including every meal you’ll eat, and there’s lots of noise and crowds. I was here for work, and needed to be near the 1 train and the E train (to get to and from JFK’s AirTrain) so this fit the bill. Was the hotel clean and comfortable? Yes. Did I sleep well? Yes. They had free WiFi and a gym. But it was just average for me. It didn’t have some of the basic things I expect when I travel (I should say I usually stay at Marriotts). It didn’t have a mini-fridge, which would have been nice and seems to be almost a given. For the large size of the lobby, I was really surprised and disappointed that they only had a handful of chairs for guests to sit in. The hotel is 30+ stories, not sure how many guests it holds, but the only place to sit other than your room is in their bar/restaurant seating. To me that’s very inconvenient, especially if you are in town with a large group and you are waiting for people to assemble in the lobby. There were always just groups of people standing around, and I don’t know about you, but when I go to NYC I put on 15-20,000 steps a day, so I like to sit when I can . Another thing I thought was strange was that the shower water took a very long time to get warm. I called maintenance and the guy who came up told me I just had to run it for a long, long time and it might get warmer (doesn’t this go against their “sustainability goals”?) If not call back tomorrow and they would change the cartridge.... um why would I have to call back tomorrow? Put in a work order, that’s your responsibility not mine. I also requested that the ice maker on my floor get fixed, and he showed me that it was making ice but not spitting it out. He let me take as much as I wanted but I was told it wouldn’t get fixed, there were other things to do. Previously, the front desk people were apologetic about the ice and told me I could go up or downstairs... of course I can, and that’s why they are getting an average rating.

We stayed here over New Years.Friendly, helpful staff, good housekeeping. Obviously location is good for Broadway shows. Short walk to Radio City and 5th Avenue; subway not too far away. A great place for a party or event in the middle of things. Fire dept around next corner that lost many firefighters on 911 and a Staples two doors from that to mail home all the stuff you bought in NYC !

We stayed on the 22nd floor and had a corner room with a view of the river (if we had ever had time to look out of the window). The room appeared to be recently updated. It was very clean and comfortable. We asked for and speedily received several extra pillows, so service was great. (We like lots of pillows but most people would find the standard four to be sufficient.). We also like a well-lit room and this one had more than adequate lamps and wattage. The check-in was efficient and friendly. The location is convenient to theatres, restaurants, the subway and even delis and shopping. One more thing - the elevators were fast and there was virtually no waiting. (I attended a conference a few hotels away and their elevators were a nightmare. So the Crowne gets an A+ for theirs.) I would definitely stay here again.

Perfect place for a late lunch or brunch. A great view from a window table, a nice selection which even worked for Our pickiest eater. The drinks are strong, but some creative new options. Tofael gave 5 star service!

The breakfast buffet was very good. Tofael my server was excellent! The Staff member who helped me with questions on how to find things with my phone was exceptional. A great way to begin your day. I would recommend staying at The Crown Plaza, Times Square, New York City.

This is a great location if you are going to the theater. I stay in hotels 10-12 nights a month, I have had my share of uninterested, personality challenged front desk agents..Onelia who checked me in did a fantastic job making me feel welcome, answered all my questions put a smile on my face.

This hotel has become a go-to hotel for my trips to NYC for work. I often go to several Broadway shows while I am here, and this is so centrally located for that...and close to all the subways! Plus you can walk to midtown or central park, or enjoy good food in Hell's Kitchen! The front desk staff has always been so friendly and engaging, which is not always the case in this city. On this particular trip Brunilda was the awesome person who checked us in and welcomed us back home! She was super fun, personable and made checking in a delight! This is one great example of the encounters I've had while staying here.

The only good thing to say about this hotel is his location direct on the Times Square. After great experience with Crown Plaza hotels around the world we werde expecting a prefect stay, as usual. Unfortunately it wasn't. The hotel has an ugly, dark lobby. Check-in was distant and it seemed we were disturbing. The we got the first room, which should have Times Square view. Well, the view was on the Times Square - if you press your face on the window. From the 40th level you don't really see anything but the windows of the opposite buildings. The other thing was the room itself: wallpaper came of the walls, bathroom was dirty, all furniture were damaged. The windows was not closing completely. The room was tiny and so was the bathroom. After complaining we have got a similar room on the 36th level with better view on Times Square. The furniture were not as much damaged as in the other room. The bathroom was cleaner, but the wallpaper dissolved of the walls.OK, there is one more good thing we can say about the hotel: the breakfast was good.The price-performance ratio was unacceptable. Never again!

For a romantic weekend getaway (romance optional) to NYC to see some Broadway shows, there is no better place to stay than this hotel. We were seeing Hadestown and the line to get into the theatre was literally right outside the hotel door. It took all of 5 minutes to get from the hotel lobby to our seats and that's because we stopped for drinks at the theatre bar. Two drinks cost us $58 but that's a separate review...The room was amazing and the services was top-notch. I ordered room service and it arrived fresh and hot in under 15 minutes. I was impressed.

Hotel is in a great location, proximity to Times Square, Broadway, shopping...(and oh yeah my business meeting)....is perfect. Clean updated andlarger than your usual NYC room. Bar is nice too! I checked inamd was greetedby the nicest front desk rep, Brunilda - thanks for the welcome!! I even get my IHG points..... all-in-all a successful visit. Looking forward to returning for pleasure! ;)

Great location, poor service. Rooms were too hot with zero ability to control temperature. Called down for service and it took hours and multiple calls for someone to come up. Charged extra for Time Square view, not worth the angle

We booked this hotel based on location and price, we were not disappointed. We could walk everywhere from here, Times Square not ideal for everyone as it's so busy but this was our choice and we're glad we did. It's so close to all attractions/subway/buses etc and you really are in the heart of it all.We stayed 5 nights, had a lovely warm welcome at reception who gave us some vouchers to use in the bar/restaurant, had upgraded us to a room overlooking times square and arranged for a complimentary fridge in our room which was a welcome touch.The room was smaller than expected with 2 double size standard beds for 3 of us, including our teenage daughter. I would have expected king size beds but it was fine. A very small wardrobe, ok for a couple of nights but we struggled for space for 3 of us over 5 nights, we had to hang 3 or 4 things on each hanger.A good size bathroom and great shower.The room had fabulous views overlooking times square, we were on 44th floor out of 45! This did mean we could hear no noise.All the staff we came across at the hotel were very friendly and informative, they all went our of their way to help you and give you information on local attractions/ directions and other helpful tips.The hotel bar and restaurants always seemed busy, we did take advantage of our free drink, the service was great and the wine was excellent, a nice vibe and atmosphere in the bar.The room was cleaned every day and was spotless, all public areas also very clean.The lifts were always in good working order.My only disappointment was the check out, this was chaotic and we queued for over an hour to leave our bags with the concierge, this meant cutting into our time on our last day.Overall a great hotel, great staff, great location, great value and I would definitely stay again.

This is our first stay here but we regularly use crowne plaza hotels. This hotel was good but not the best one we have stayed at. BUT still up there in quality and cleanliness. We had one issue with one of the two rooms but the issue was quickly sorted out without any fuss. My only real complaint was the price of drinks in the bar, drinks in New York are expensive but they seemed to be higher than I would of expected (and yes I know hotel bar drinks are more expensive).Over all a good hotel and extremely convenient for Times Square.

Smack dab in the midst of the city that never sleeps! Valet Parking onsite no in and out but you won’t need the vehicle $(70.00)Subway steps away. There’s an app on the phones to help you get from a to b.Heart of Times Square/theatre Freddy was a delight at check in and took care of us very nicely!Thank you !!!! Although the line was lengthy it moved quickly . Bar area was facing the busy street fun to people watch.Rooms were adequate clean and quiet.Views are amazing! Have fun!
user_location: New Hampshire Lakes Region, New Hampshire
user_name:
13mapleridge
New Hampshire Lakes Region, New Hampshire

review_body: I have stayed in this hotel multiple days, several times a year, for several years. This trip was a sun-wed. I have always found the location convenient, the hotel clean and maintained, and the service good. However, this trip was a series of disappointments. There were 3 issuesFirst, on arrival at my room, I found myself disappointed in the cleanliness of the room. Crumbs and food debris on the desk, the floor had not been vacuumed, and there were water stains on the sink vanity. The worst feeling was when I opened the dresser drawers and found items and paper waste from the prior occupant. But the linens and towels were fresh and having had good experiences in the past, I thought I would wave it off and it would be cleaned the next day. I carry sanitizing wipes with me when I travel so I cleaned a bit myself. Unfortunately, it was not. For the entire trip housekeeping was way below par. While the bed was made, towels replaced, and the toiletries replenished, the floor continued to be an ongoing problem and surfaces were generally left uncleaned. Second, maintenance has been allowed to fall behind. The lamps had shorts and blinked if the table was bumped. Wallpaper was stained, paint chipped, etc. But the final straw was when a loud customer moved into the room next to me, others in his party in other rooms on the hallway. It went on with arguments, doors slamming, loud music, screaming, TVs blaring, etc. from 10:30 pm to 4:30 AM.I called the front desk, the line had been turned off for the night. I tried concierge, bell stand, housekeeping, lost and found, even room service. Every line either went to an answering machine or busy signal. I tried calling from my cell to the local phone number-busy signal. I called the 800 number for the chain, they put me on hold then hung up on me. This went on for hours. I finally called another IHG hotel on Times Square and asked for security and explained the scenario. To their credit they contacted the hotel and someone came up and told them to quiet down. Not fifteen minutes later they started back up with the noise. I tried all of the phones again- same problem - answering machines and busy signals. I finally went to the people’s doors and threatened each one with calling the police. They then settled down for the night. Needless to say, they have lost my business.

We had a great time staying here during our first visit to NYC. Onelia went above and beyond making us feel welcome and provided us with great customer service. The room we had was nice and spacious. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Great location of the property but the rooms and facilities are old ..so if you are looking for best location at Times square no hotel can beat this place but the rooms are really old style and facility and people are the same as well !!

Stayed here from Xmas eve for 5 nights ,this hotel is perfect if you want to be in the centre of Times Square for us it was far to busy to get to the hotel from afternoon onwards in the streets leading up to the hotel  The hotel itself is very busy room was a good size with 2 very comfortable beds which we needed as we walked about 40 odd miles in total .Being a platinum elite member I was given various vouchers for breakfast etc which was a great saving as we used breakfast every day apart from Xmas day as my daughter wanted to try Hard Rock Cafe just 5 mins walk away which we all enjoyed as well good to visit . All in all the hotel is great needs updating in some rooms which they are doing at the moment they are refurbishing the entrance at present . I would recommend this hotel for future travellers and you know what your getting with Crowne plaza

I want to thank the staff at the Crowne for a wonderful stay. Elvin greeted us and helped secure our luggage before check in time, imran was a fantastic representative at the front desk- polite and professional! Kim, the bartender, was so much fun that we really didn’t want to leave! Ritchie made us feel like we were the only customers, even though the area was busy! Finally, we got to see Ali at breakfast, always so nice!! There is something special about this place and it’s all about the willingness of the staff to create relationships, even if it is brief! For us, we keep coming back for the very reasons mentioned. A special thanks to Mr. Sanders and Ms. Geronimo. Their kindness made our visit the best ever!

We took our niece to New York stayed here love the views of the Hudson River!! Staff very helpful!! Location location Time Square down the street ,could not be beat for the price walk out the door and lots to do!!!

The crown plaza is grand, it offers great views with friendly staff and easy check-in. I'm glad I chose this place it's very good for what I was looking for, they offer airport transportation and everything I need is available.

This hotel is central in Manhattan for exploring the city. Close to everything and all very walkable. Great room with very comfortable mattress and nice sized bathroom. Friendly staff. Good and fast check in and out.

We reserved 5 rooms for 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza located at 1605 Broadway. I have nothing but good to say. We arrived earlier than the check-in time. We were 13 adults and 4 children.....we had all our luggage and needed to leave it somewhere to begin exploring New York. RHODA at the check-in counter was amazing! She was professional, courteous, and very nice and was able to give us 2 of the 5 rooms. Rooms are super nice with the City view which is what we reserved. Beds were extremely comfortable and rooms were large and very clean and nicely decorated. We will definitely stay here again.

This was our first trip to NYC and for a long weekend. We were in the perfect location for all the things we wanted to see or do. Everyone at the hotel from check in to check out were helpful and friendly. We were always greeted with a “good morning” or “hello”. We were always offered help or direction. I think the only complaint would be that it was hard to regulate the heat in the room and there was no hot water for early risers to take showers. It just took awhile. And the friendliness of the staff made up for all of that.

Winding down our “holiday” weekend stay in NYC..... shout out to the fabulous Crowne Plaza Times Square. This is the fifth year we’ve stayed here and just are so at home here..... we love starting our days with the breakfast buffet overlooking Times Square....then wandering off easily to Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Bryant Park...and the Theatre (TKTS booth is 1/2 block away) and restaurant districts. Everyone from reception, to lounge staff, house keeping and guest relations has been top notch ..... i will add I had read a few negative reviews before arrival.....we were aware that if our room seemed warm for our taste we could crack open a window and we could call and request a fan be brought to our room. We did call housekeeping for a fan and had it within 15 minutes of the call ....our room temp was comfortable and we liked the circulating air. My travel chatting friends know I am a big fan of the IHG hotels branded CC and the platinum elite status that comes with having that card is the icing on the cake when you stay at properties like this which go out of their way and tell you they value your membership and being part of their family!! The greatly discounted vouchers for the buffet breakfast are a favorite status related perk for us..... and we always appreciate the room upgrades often offered.

Everything about this stay was perfect! Check in, the room, the location, the security, the bar, the internet, the TV, the bed, pillows, toiletries, etc. We will be staying here again!!! We were so lucky to even receive drink vouchers for the bar upon check in, as well as free phone calls anywhere in the world. THANKS!!!

ALSAH/ABAH! I can't say enough about her. She provided such effortlessly superb custom service with concern of my needs. The line was long and she had been working on her feet for over 12 hours..(I asked her..it was Jan 1)and she made me feel as if I were the only person in line..without holding up the line. Her smile was warm and welcoming. Her customer service should not be without acknowledgement or rewarded. She's is the reason I will choose this hotel again. Thanks again for your superb service..keep it up. Jennifer:Columbus,Ohio

Stayed here in early December 2019. Great location, lovely hotel but most importantly the service was excellent. Onelia on reception greeted us and set the tone. She could not do enough for us and ensured we were well looked after. Will be returning for sure!

Spending Christmas in time square was amazing for my family and I. But the cherry on top came from our room service attendant “Claire”. She provided great service and went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. I would recommend Crowne Plaza Time Square and don’t forget to ask for Claire. (L’union fait la force)

We booked here as a family , a good base for what we intended to do on a short trip. The check in was ridiculous, after a long flight & journey this just tipped us over , queuing to check in , couldn’t use toilet until checked in or get a drink. Finally got checked in & made our way to the room. I booked a family room. The beds must of been the smallest doubles ever ! The room was very very basic , the bathroom was not nice and the taps were hanging off , a shower in the bath with a vile curtain & walls were not cleaned well, toiletries were a joke & the towels while a few were not freshly laundered, more like they had been left days. The coffee machine didn’t work & had missing parts , the beds made me itchy & the lighting was dull even though 4 lamps couldn’t see well. The light switch was wiggling all over not looking very safe !The bar was busy , however we all had a burger which was good. Drinks overpriced & hotel while in great spot totally overpriced. The only great thing was our server jodane.... the only staff who smiled & she made the short stay bearable!Being a crowne plaza I thought we’d get a save bet but totally not worth it.

We stayed in a corner room (3313) and it had an excellent view ! Abah at the front desk was so friendly and helpful , she really made our stay so much better . She was so funny - I was actually laughing out loud during our check in process . Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable. We love the location and the hospitality Crowne Plaza and Abah, we will definitely be back

We visited NY with family and stayed at the hotel from the 28th December for 5 days. The hotel is very central and very welcoming. As an Elite Spire member, my husband was gifted a daily $25 voucher towards food / drinks to be used in the hotel - we used it for breakfast at the cafe and just made up the difference with cash. We also received 2 drinks vouchers per room which was a nice gesture.The rooms are spacious and light and perfect for a city break. We generally spend very little time in the room when we have such a short time in a city so we didn’t have any complaints here. If you’re interested in using the gym, it’s really good. I used it twice. It has so much equipment, I just wish I’d had more time and energy to use it more!On New Year’s Eve we did the Starry Night package which was truly awesome. Our waiter was extremely attentive (sadly didn’t catch his name), which meant that our glasses were never empty. The food was delicious and there was more than enough choice for everyone. David Kanters, the Hotel Manager was brilliant, a real credit to the hotel. He couldn’t have done enough for us. His continued care and kindness enabled us to have the best night ever with so many amazing memories! Thank you David!This was a bucket list trip and New York, Times Square, you did not disappoint!

We stayed during the Christmas holiday. We arrived early (at 11:00 am) and couldn’t check in until 2:00, so we checked our luggage with the bell captain. The line was about 75-people long, but moved so quickly, the bell captains were fast and super friendly despite the constant line of guest checking luggage. We checked in very smoothly, the room was clean and nice, the cleaning staff did a great job each day. The rooms were very quiet, I never heard a sole despite the hotel being at capacity. Overall a very pleasant stay.

The hotel was nice a bit noisy so try and get a room up as high as you can, but you are located in the middle of Times Square so walking is most convenient to most sites. The room was nice and very comfortable bedding.

So disappointed in The Crowne Plaza Times Square! It had three things going for it, the sweet lady who cleaned our room, the bartender, and the view! Their lack of customer service amazes me! We were told that we would have complimentary breakfast, that was not the case! I was also told that there was a shuttle, just call when we landed and they would send one, not the case! Anytime we asked a question we got 3 different answers! The hotel was excessively hot, no AC. The front desk said if we were hotel, top open a window! We were on the 37th floor! I called back down and they brought up a box fan. The room itself looked like it needed updating and the hotel lounge chairs were worn and torn! I guess I was expecting something more from a 4 Star hotel at Christmas!! I would never recommend staying here to anyone!!

First the positives :Great location - right in the heart of Times SquareRoom was OK - clean, although took ages for the shower to run hot waterNegatives :The restaurant is awful - overpriced (well over $100 for very average burgers and french fries and a couple of beers). More disappointing is the staff attitude, which is awful. Went to the bar to order a drink, only to be told to find a table from where I could order from and then wait over 30 minutes to actually place an order. This continued throughout my stay, again awful attitude, given the wrong bill. If you stay here, avoid restaurant and bar at all costs.Saying that the check in and check out process wasn’t much better, with staff attitude very disappointing.There is also the issue of the blatant con of charging over $35 a day for a gym you will probably never use, phone calls when you use your mobile and a one off free drink in the worst hotel bar I’ve ever been in.My advice is avoid. There are other hotels in within close vicinity and would recommend trying these before going to the Crowne Plaza.

Eager to escape to NYC for a pre-Christmas holiday week-end ,we wanted to try some place new that had a good locatioin. The Crowne Plaza Time Square certainly fills that bill but unfortunately there were things that added up and distracted from what other wise was a wonderful trip.+On the positive side, the Crowne Plaza is perfectly situated on Broadway and 48th in the heart of mid-town. The property is impressive with a great bar that overlooks Times Square. The rooms fine and the sports center is terrific.However, the service lacked on several counts.1) Before arriving , we had trouble getting through to the front desk. I attempted to call the hotel directly to find out where to check in with a car. (including while on route) and finally was told to just pull in on Broadway. However , when we arrived we discovered that construction blocked entrence and it took 25 minutes driving around the block several times to find the unmarked entrance. The lack of information by the staff handling the phones, given the hectic Manhattan pace, was upsetting.2) The concierge desk was a joke. Either no one was there, or there was a long line or when you left a message which they promised to return they did not (three times) (Thank God for the internet.)
