I was able to book the room in CrownPlaza last minute and it was great without the doubt. For $200 (plus city fee), we got huge room with view, but quite enough to sleep through the night. I guess the trick is to ask for high floor. In any case, if you member of IHG you get the breakfast for $16 all you can eat and 2 vouchers for free drinks. Hotel has swimming pool and several bar/restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel due to the location, room space and great service.
user_name:
AnastasiaP
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I've stayed at this property numerous times over the years and the service started out great in 2014 and slowly deteriorated until my recent visit. I was in town for a long weekend with my sister and decided to give this hotel a final try due to it's location. After my initial confusion entering as they have lost their first floor entry on Broadway, I was pleasantly surprised to find a short wait time to check in. I am allergic to down and usually have a hard time finding a hotel that will remove the down before I arrive. My room was down free and ready upon my arrival! The staff texted me almost immediately upon check in and continued to monitor my stay throughout the weekend. I relied upon that text connection for a few requests and was pleasantly surprised and delighted at how easy they made my stay. I hope they continue with their new and improved customer service as I will definitely be back!!

We had originally booked a room at The EconoLodge, Times Square. Within 20 minutes of check in I knew I could not stay there, it was beyond terrible. I checked TripAdvisor and contacted Crowne Plaza. Spoke with Wanda in customer service. I was so distraught, we had planned this trip for a year and traveled for many hours. I was concerned that we had no hotel in New York. What a miracle worker! She managed to get us a spectacular room for less than the original room we had at EconoLodge. Everyone at Crowne Plaza was great and Wanda really turned our trip around. I will never stay anywhere else. Kudos!

After my last visit that Isis Arruda helped arrange for me I decided to contact her again as we wanted to return as we were celebrating our 23rd Anniversary. Isis made sure we had a great room and we did. We was on the top floor looking out to the Hudson River. Our stay was perfect in every way. WiFi is good too! Even though we absolutely love this hotel we was out exploring so much that we were hardly in the room. We used our vouchers at the bar and it was nice to see that the bar staff hadn’t changed from our last visit in 2015! Had a good chat with them and you’ll get lots of tips from them too. The hotel was under some construction work I think as the front of the hotel was closed off, not sure if that’s a permanent thing or not?!?As much as the hotel is lovely and in the best location I’m wondering if they are going to be updating the rooms any time soon? They’ve not changed in the last 9 years I’ve stayed there. Apart from that, I really can’t fault this hotel. The staff are all lovely and accommodating, the facilities are fantastic and you won’t get a better location than this. Subways are just minutes away, theatres on the doorstep and some fantastic places to eat too!! If you pick this hotel you really won’t be disappointed!! Massive thank you to Isis and everyone at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Gemma & Michael Bailey xx

We flew in from Florida and booked at Hotel Pensilvania for $289/night, WHAT A DUMP! We got our money back and just decided to treat ourselves to the Crowne Plaza, which ended up to be double but...WORTH THE MONEY. We went to the hotel to check availability, found a room, booked it over my iphone and in less than 20 mins, I was in my beautifulllllll hotel room. I was serviced by this PRINCESS named Victoria at the front desk. I accidently put 2 people instead of 3 on my reservation, but she accommodated all of our extra needs and explained each voucher and benefits. She was super helpful and lovely. Checking in was such a positive experience. Hotel room is sparkly clean, the view is amazing and the beds are clean and fluffy. The location is AMAZING as well. We will book here for every visit to NYC. We'll make sure to plan in advance next time to get better rates, but we gladly paid double, so worth it. There are actually few hotels in NYC that are decent, this one is probably the most impressive!

Great hotel from the brilliant staff at check in to the fab housekeeping staff nothing is to much trouble rooms were a great size bed was lovely and comfy which is what you need after a long day walking to sites food was ok . Drinks in the bar were good not bad prices we will definitely come back

Our flight was cancelled and Onelia at the Front Desk helped us to stay another night in the hotel. All in all very nice people and a good tasting breakfast and dinner there. The hotel has a good location and you can get to all your favourite sights in just a few minutes.

My husband and I visited NYC for dinner and a show for our Anniversary.i selected the Crowne Plaza in Times Square because it was close to the show and restaurant.The stay was excellent! Becaus it was our Anniversary and we are IHG honors members we got a corner king room on the 46th floor! The view was incredible! The room was super clean and smelled clean.And it was a huge room on the top floor.We had the breakfast buffet both mornings we were there and the food was delicious and a nice variety.The staff was very nice. and accommodating we received vouchers of $20 each for drinks at the lounge both dates The hotel is in the perfect location in the middle of all the action of Times Square and we were 2 blocks from theater. Everything was excellent! The only thing that was missing was a mini fridge. We would definitely stay again!

Great hotel. Very convenient for getting around. Rooms were clean and well equiped and breakfast was plentiful. It was very busy when we were there in Dec 18, but we had a fab time and the views from our room were spectacular.

I’m not a stranger to NYC hotels, I come here almost every week but this is my first time in the Crown Plaza Times Square.Everything here is great but I’m writing this review mainly for the check in process with Onelia G. She was great and she was able to accommodate all my requests quickly and with a great smile all the time. Best check in process in NYC I’ve ever seen.Thank you Onelia!!

Arrived at the hotel a little earlier then check in time and was greeted at reception by the IHG members check in, they had noted my request for early check in and were able to offer a room straight away, the check in agent was very helpful and gave all the information needed about the hotel.The room had a view towards the hudson on a high floor and was a good size by New York standard, the decor of the rooms is a little more traditional and will probably need a freshen up soon to keep competitive. Room had a large tv, coffee maker and storage space enough for a long weekend trip. Bathroom had a shower above the tub. The hotel itself offers facilities you would expect from a full service hotel including a gym in partnership with the New York Sports Clubs (was huge) and use of the pool (hours are a little restricted if you are out sightseeing all day). The dining options of the coffee shop and bar both offered good service and quality a price expected for a crowne plaza. All members off staff we encountered over out stay were helpful and friendly. Check out was very smooth and quick

Everything was lovely from start to finish for our stay here. It's not often you see photos from a hotel advertisement that actually match the room you booked. Our stay at Crowne Plaza was just that! Evelyn at the front desk could not have been more helpful, especially since we needed to add an extra day. Highly recommend room 3301 for the BEST CITY VIEWS! Overlooks Times Square with a wall of windows, but noise isn't too much of an issue. Comfortable beds and fresh linens daily that were top quality. Location can't be beat for theatre lovers like ourselves. There were no hidden fees like we've experienced at similar hotels down the street during checkout. Excellent stay all around. Five stars!

Nice roomsgreat locationvery good breakfast good bar and loungeif you choose to stay in midtown around times square, no better choice than crown plaza. for 250$ per night, it's the best you will find. 2 times we tried other hotels, that didn't compare to this. Nice staff. hotel is normally fully booked so don't expect any special attention or upgrades.

Since we were only staying in NYC for one night and my sons are older, we decided to stay in Times Square. We typically stay at the Marquis but it was very pricey for the date that I had in mind. I called ahead to make sure we get a roll away and that you could have one in a room with double beds.I was checked in by an unfriendly front desk employee who informed that I could only get a roll away in a room with a one bed. I explained to her that a person from the hotel told me otherwise. She was not apologetic and then proceeded to charge me for the roll away! We came in late and ordered room service - all of which must’ve been sitting under a lamp. Typically, I would’ve chosen to eat out but we were exhausted. The quality was poor.Lastly, we valet parked our car for which they charge a premium - I expected the charge and have no complaint for the charge they quoted me. That was fine. Parking is for 24 hours. (However, in my past experience hotels will let you stay a little over the exact 24 hour period- The Marquis for example. They charge less and they allow for some wiggle room about departure.)When we were finished with our sight seeing, I called the number on the card for our car. They instructed me to call when I was ready for the car. The number was out of service. I called repeatedly from my own phone and from my son’s. Eventually, I went down to valet where they charged me another $30 for being late . Thirty minutes - all of which was spent trying to contact them. I explained this to the cashier and he said too bad. Pay for your car or we won’t get it. I’m sure the hotel will say the valet is separate from them. However, when you partner with another business you have the responsibility of ensuring that they provide good service on your behalf. Overall, I was unhappy with my stay and feel this hotel nickels and dimes you. Did I mention that the shampoo and conditioner was the smallest bottles that I’ve ever seen?Crowne Plaza, do better.

The location of this hotel is right in Times Square so great if you need to be in the thick of things. The rooms are very dated and in need of modernisation. Breakfast was lovely but quite expensive without vouchers. There is a $6 fee to receive a package which is not great to be honest. My husband had a small accident when we were there and the staff were amazing by organising a taxi to take us to the ER and advising which hospital to go to. They phoned the next day to check that all was ok.The room was dusty and I think that the servicing of the room during the stay was the bear minimal to be honest. The bathroom had mould growing round the sealant

This is our 5th time staying here, we visit the city every other year. We absolutely love it! The hotel is clean, great views, the staff is so nice! The breakfast buffet is great and has options for every one! Tofael, one of the servers, remembered us from 2 years ago. Welcomed us every morning with great conversation and recommendations if new places to visit! We can wait to be back!

We booked via booking.com because the reviews were good and the pictures show nice rooms, not very luxurious but with normal furniture looking new.And we paid an extra to have view on time square.We got the room advertised but 10 years after the picture taken.The carpet was extremely old and consumed,. All the wooden furnitures with the surfaces eavily damaged as well as the tub surface (this was really really bad for the money we payd over 350$ per night). The bathroom was very old too and the wardrobe was very very small.The cleaning workers were good and the position is perfect if you want to fell the life in times square.But definitely it doesn't worth the money we paid.

The hotel is in a great location and the rooms are clean.It is starting to look a bit worn;the pool is particularly shabby.That said, the staff make up for it.Travis in particular in the breakfast restaurant was excellent. Really helpful going out of his way for me. The front of house staff and the bell captain were faultless. I’d definitely return.

The hotel is in a great central location. All the staff are fabulous, especially Oneila and Victoria at the front desk who helped out with a few things over the course of our stay. The view from the room onto times square was great, the room itself was big enough and overall clean, the only negative was the carpet had quite a few spillages and sticky marks on it. But overall a fabulous hotel and would definitely return.

Onelia Green is an asset. Understanding going the extra mile for the client will produce revenue for the firm. Will definitely be returning. Looking forward to a follow up visit, recommending other clients as well. Thank you.

Great hotel, large comfortable rooms some with excellent views. Very good location with easy access to Times Square, Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Centre. Restaurants and shops close by including Ellen’s Stardust Diner.

We have always enjoyed staying at the Crowne Plaza Hotel when visiting New York. However, this visit was especially lovely due to the superior service of Omelia, the desk clerk. She helped us with some special requests and was friendly, professional and helpful. Thank you, Omelia, for giving us a nice start to our trip.

Very happy that the Crowne Plaza at Times Square was in policy for my business trip. Great location right next to Times Square. The room was comfortable; though the mattress was old and probably needs to be replaced. I loved that there was a NY Sports Club (NYSC) location on the 15th floor; worked out every morning and that really helped start my day with more energy.

My first time visiting New York and I’m so happy I picked this hotel. It was perfectly located to everything I wanted to do. The service was 5 star. The employees under the direction of Agathe are very professional and personable. They deliver that 5 Star experience that make you want to come back again and again. I know I could have stayed anywhere in the city but the value you receive at this hotel and the friendliness of the employees from the bellmen, the front desk, concierge, and servers/bartenders in the restaurant are what separates this hotels from their competitors.

Imran was very helpful in checking my wife and me in for our honeymoon trip. Helped us get into the perfect room so we can rest after long trip. We had an amazing view of Times square. Appreciate his customer service.

We had an over all nice stay, but if I were a first timer, I think there are a few things that could be clearer. There IS a valet parking service on site but the price isn't easily found while looking on the website. BOTH onsite restaurants have gluten-free options though the prices are higher than area restaurants. The highlight was an awesome bartender named Martin! He was helpful, pleasant and professional.

Absolutely perfect from check in n to check out! Victoria at the front desk was friendly and knowledgeable! Our room was larger than any room I have had in NYC, nicely decorated and our beds were extremely comfortable. Perfect location, walked to Macy’s, The Lion King and dinner! Our Girls’ Weekend couldn’t have been better!

Picked this hotel based on proximity to Hadestown and could not have been more pleased. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Clean, comfortable rooms and close to everything. If we return to NYC, we will be back. Thank you!

The hotel was clean and located perfectly. This has been my favorite stay in NYC so far. The breakfast was amazing with so many options for meals. Tofael was an excellent server, very personable. He kept things clean and was always attentive. The concierge was quite helpful as well. What a great time already! I will definitely return to this hotel.

Omelia was extremely helpful and I will for sure come back here again because of her! She has made our stay in New York that much better. We will definitely come back to this hotel! Thank you Omelia!!!

I like to stay at this hotel when I’m in NYC as it’s central to everything and of course Times Sq! The IHG rewards offers guests amenities like vouchers for food and drinks and makes the stay a bit easier for a business traveler. The front desk experience is always nice and friendly which I appreciate after a day of travel and work.I’d recommend getting the Breakfast with the room as they have a very good buffet with a lot of choices and fresh offerings.I also like the bed and bedding, very comfortable and always spearmint clean baths rooms are stand outs!Enjoy!

Realice un pedido por Amazon, y vino en diferentes paquetes. Y me cobraron 6 dólares por cada paquete. Pedí un cable usb que salió 3 dólares y me cobraron 6 en el hotel. Hable con el manager del hotel, explicándole que no lo decía en ningún lado en la reserva el cargo(sino no hubiese hecho el envio)y la falta de lógica de lo que estaba sucediendo, y de manera burlona me respondió que esa era la política del hotel y que ellos cobraban porque debían pagarle a los empleados. Le explique que deberían tener en cuenta el tamaño o peso del envio para realizar el cargo y ademas, DEBIAN COMUNICARLO DE FORMA CLARA AL HUESPED. Nuevamente, de manera burlona, me manifesto que el cargo iba a efectuarse de todos modos ,que debia quejarme con expedia, que era donde habia hecho la reserva. CUIDADO CON LOS CARGOS OCULTOS DE ESTE HOTEL. BAJAN LA TARIFA EN ALGUNOS SITIOS WEB Y DESPUES COBRAN CARGOS EXTRAS. LAMENTABLE.I place an order through Amazon, and it came in different packages. And they charged me $ 6 for each package. I asked for a USB cable that came out 3 dollars and they charged me 6 at the hotel. I spoke with the hotel manager, explaining that It did not say the charge anywhere in the reservation (if I had not made the shipment) and the lack of logic of what was happening, and mockingly replied that this was the policy from the hotel and that they charged because they had to pay the employees. I explained that you have to take into account the size or weight of the environment to carry out the load and also, YOU MUST COMMUNICATE IT CLEARLY TO THE GUEST. Again, mockingly, he told me that the charge was going to be made anyway, that I had to complain with expedia, which was where I had made the reservation. BE CAREFUL WITH THE HIDDEN CHARGES OF THIS. LOWER THE RATE IN SOME WEB SITES AND AFTER EXTRAS CHARGES CHARGES. REGRETTABLE.

I would like to commend the staff of Crowne Plaza Hotel for doing an amazing job to return a package which was left behind last April, 2019. I would like to especially thank the Director of Security Mr. Al Valdes for handling the package with great care and also Ms. Sylvia Geronemo for taking extra effort to contact me and find a return address for the package. For all your help I am most grateful. It is always nice to know that you are in good hands staying in a hotel in which good service is a priority and the care they put into their job. For that alone, I would not think twice staying and recommending your hotel to family and friends every time we visit New York. God bless you guys for the good that you do!

The front desk worker, Victoria took care of us from the moment we came to the hotel, and was so kind, and professional, and started our vacation in the most marvelous way.The hotel and Victoria in particular started our vacation on the most amazing way.We wish that in every hotel we will visit we will meet workers like Victoria.

You cannot beat this location as I had a view of Times Square from my room on the 38th floor. I thought the maid service was excellent and the breakfast buffet was alright. (Be sure and get some discount tickets at the front desk or breakfast is very expensive.) I caught cabs right outside the hotel and got around the city just fine by taxi and by walking. They offered to take me to the airport in their private car but a taxi cost much less. I was also able to use their business center to print off my airline tickets. I would stay here again when visiting NYC.

This is not the only hotel where I have encountered the resort fee - did not make use of any of it. A few days later I stayed at another IHG hotel, the Eventi, which does not charge these stupid fees. Just incorporate it into the rate and dispense with the foolishness. Having said that, otherwise my stay was fine, other than I prefer smaller and less gigantic hotels with over bustling lobbies and public areas. My room was quite attractive, and I liked the chaise chair. I was on the 42nd floor, the highest I have ever stayed in a hotel and enjoyed the views looking out over the Hudson. The employees I encountered were friendly and welcoming. The current arrangement makes the main entrance hard to find. It seems there is some construction going on, but I was expecting an entrance on Broadway, and had to hunt around for the entrance off the side street driveway. Poor signage.

Great location and we had a really nice room, good size for the location. We had a late dinner and the meal was excellent and affortable. Also the bar lounge was really nice and the drinks were reasonable priced.

Came with friends as a sidetrip after a week-long medical convention in Nashville. My 5th time in NYC but my first time to stay in Crowne. The entrance at Broadway is getting fixed so take the 48th or 49th St to get to the main entrance. The lobby is one floor up, check in was fast with the friendly front desk clerk. Our room is on the 42nd fl overlooking Barclays bldg and Broadway Ave. We booked a room for 3 with 2 queen beds. Cost is roughly 400usd per head except resort fee everyday which amounted to 50usd per head for a 4 nights. Inside the room, there is a small wardrobe cabinet where you can roll 2 med size suitcases. It has an ironing board and iron inside. There is a coffee maker, a safety deposit box, free wifi, drawers for clothes, hair dryer, toiletries, bath tub, but NO mini ref. For the complimentary water bottles, you have to dial guest services for them to bring it to your room. There is a busted vendo machine outside our room and an ice machine. We didn’t avail of the free breakfast because the hotel is right in Times Sq where breakfast places abound. M&M world is across it. Parking is pricey during weekdays till 8pm. The hotel offers SUV service (huge Chevy Suburban) to the airport which is an hour or so during peak hours (we left Wed 8am) and costs 128usd except tip. An additional 10usd for every extra airport terminal (my colleague got off at Terminal 8 first before my friend and I were brought to Terminal 1 of JFK).

The location was great. Room was not up to my standards. The bathroom was dirty, the towels were dirty, and the shower was old and had patches missing from the bottom. The room also smelled musty. The staff was more than helpful. Took our bags before the room was available and assisted me with questions. The valet was joke. It said to request your car by calling a number and no one answered. When I called the front desk they said you must go down and ask for the car. I have never been to a hotel where you had to physically go to valet to get your car. Otherwise the hotel was nothing fancy.

Crowne Plaza Times Square is a very comfortable upscale hotel, located in the theater district and also right beside the conference meeting space I was attending. The view from the room was phenomenal - city view of Times Square. Room was clean, staff was courteous, bed was comfortable.

Time has an excellent selection of wine and cocktails to chose from. Great service and the music, the art and the environment is inviting, stimulating and comfortable. I am visiting Spoleto from America and I wish there was a place like this at home. I highly recommend it!!!

This is my 5th time at the Crowne Plaza and i have to say the last, this hotel is tired, rooms are not nice, i was in room 3205, my room was only made pleasant by the house keeper who came in every day, on entering the room on arrival there was a very damp smell which could have had something to do with the fan in the bathroom not working so the ceiling got covered with condensation, there was a double socket on the wall near the bed and when plugging in a charger the whole outside plate swivelled round, my main issue with the hotel was the staff, never have i been so rudely spoken to, couldn’t name one member of staff behind the desk who actually talked to me or my friend politely, I definitely don’t pay good money to be treated like that, i also think that all customers with a reservation should be informed that there is major renovations going on outside and that the front door is actually closed off so entrance is in the car park where taxis are dropping off and picking up. Me and my friend travel to new york every year for a girly trip we spent the last day of trip looking round for a new hotel for next year. Having said all that the staff in the bar/restaurant are very sociable and the lady on the ticket desk (Corinne) is great, so helpful, maybe you should get her to give your staff at the front desk a few pointers on how to speak to customersIts such a shame as this hotel is in the best location and in the past has been great.

Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is a terrific location-location-location for work and fun. It's in the absolute heart of Manhattan and a quick walk from almost anything you'd want or need. I was there in late September (perfect weather - balmy evenings, beautiful days). Absolutely every hotel room was booked because it was UN Week & POTUS Trump was in town. Great room on the 39th floor with a great view. Great staff. Great B'fast buffet.

Tony at Bar 49 added the personal touch that the registration desk lacked. He was personable, attentive and went the extra mile. Thanks so much Tony! I think you need to train the other staff especially the front desk.

WOW! first I would like to say is i haven't stayed here yet so I can't say thing about staying here yet.I'm trying to so the easiest thing ever and that is just add a NAME to my reservation I called 3 times.The first time I was just on hold and was never answered and it just clicked.. The second time it just clicked was never even out on hold.The third time I was transferred 4 times until finally I talked to someone. He told me he was front desk i asked to add a name he said ok that's fine I gave him the name I wanted to add and then put me on hold and never came back to me and just clicked after being on the phone for 35 mins waiting. I am really disappointed of the costumer service so far and I'm not even there yet!! wow this is just giving me bad thought about this hotel already! I WILL SHOW PROOF OF THE CALLS I MADE WITH THE PICTURE I HAVE

Not done with our trip yet.. but I couldn't wait to leave our review. My wife, kids and myself have to thank and commend Guy Seth at the Brasserie 1605. I cannot remember any other single time where we specifically looked for someone to attend to us. If the food were to be described as a creme dessert.. Seth's is what put it over the top and made our experience creme brulee!!! It's the little things that he offers that count the most. If it's his choice that's fine.. but if our voice sways or counts.. Seth needs to be made a permanent full-time employee!!! We will be back this summer and you better believe that we are going to be looking for Seth. Do the right thing Crowne Plaza Time Square. NYC and the world in general needs more Seth!!!

I stayed at the hotel for a business trip and really enjoyed my stay thanks to the location, hotel service and amazing staff. Particularly, Adaliz who is a member of the front desk team. She went out of her way to ensure we had a smooth check-in and out. In addition to recommending local sightseeing. I will definitely return.

Great location to get about NYC. Perfectly adequate room but no view of Times Square. Comfortable bed and pillows. Good breakfast. Ana always got us a good table. Only downside was scaffolding all across front of hotel so had to use back entrance.

We stayed here for four nights. Loved this hotel. Clean, comfortable rooms. The housekeeper really paid attention to detail, and the staff was friendly, efficient and attentive. Our server in the lounge, Joanie, was truly amazing. We came back every evening because of her. She was friendly, helpful and very attentive. Highly recommend this hotel.

I had decided to stay here despite negative experiences in the past. Room was quite small and price remained expensive. Was on a high floor nonetheless. Had no issues with anything in the room, except this was the smallest room in this hotel I stayed in.Overall though it probably was still not worth it. I would rather stay at a cheaper hotel e.g. Holiday Inn Express or elsewhere. Also what is wrong with the pool! Why is it so cold? Isn't the heating apparatus working?

Stayed at this hotel beginning of September 2019 to celebrate my wifes 50th Birthday and our tenth wedding anniversary. The hotel is centally located with easy access by either foot/bus/tube to all the major attractions (hotel is right next to Ambassador theatre where we watched 'Chicago'). Going into our room we found a hand written note from the hotel manager wishing us a special stay which was a very nice touch. Hotel and room were very clean and the staff wre extremely helpful. We just had a fantastic time here and would recommend the hotel to anyone. Also on this trip we stayed at another IHG group hotel in San Francisco (Intercontinental, Howard Street), which was also of the same high standard.

From the moment of our arrival until our departure, everything we experienced was fantastic. We had the pleasure of having Victoria check us in. She was personable, efficient, and answered all questions we had. The friendliness and expertise of staff continued with Corinna the concierge. Thanks to her we had great seats to Lion King and easily found our way to the US Open in Queens. Even though I never had direct contact with housekeeping, our room 2608 was immaculate. We will definitely stay here when we return and will recommend to others.

Very well located hotel. Room is big for Manhattan standard. very clean. Breakfast is very good, with fruits, cold cuts and cheese, salmon, eggs. Very convenient. The concierge service also is very helpful and the ladies there very polite and kind.

Check in was speedy and because of my IHG membership we were given an upgrade. We were also given drinks and food vouchers which was an unexpected but welcome surprise.View from the 36th floor was amazing, food in the restaurant was good. Really nice bar area.A word to the wise about the pool, it is part of a gym and usually pretty packed so not suitable for a relaxing swim.Really good stay overall.

Spending 4 nights at Crowne plaza Manhatan. it was really our perfect stay during our US Visit. we have a comfy room and a bet huge for our family.reception was to crowded due to many guest but still they able to accommodate all their guest.Memorable stay at we spend on new years eve.looking forward on our next US visit.

Pleasant room overlooking a city intersection where live music is played. In addition to the table area there is also a bar counter where you can sit for an aperitif.Varied menu and generous portions cooked with good quality ingredients, the service is friendly and polite.For a dinner, 30 usd is enough, excluding drinks and tip.Booking recommended
user_name:
Actarus D
Island of Hawaii, Hawaii

review_body: Stayed here with my sister and mum for a five night break in September 2019. Hotel is in a prime location overlooking Times Square. Modern style, brilliant sized rooms and sparkling clean. Staff were all friendly and welcoming. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

When booking a hotel in New York the main thing my family look for is location.....this hotel has it, across from Times Square in the centre of everything it’s the perfect position for exploring the city, 4th time staying and heading back in December, clean good size rooms, fantastic amenities and amazing views, been to other hotels in NYC previously but wouldn’t even consider looking at others after we found Crowne Plaza!! Customer for life

In addition to the room rate advertised online, there's a mandatory $40 per day fee for access to wifi, gym and two drink tickets. This is terribly overpriced and kinda shady. But typical for Time Square NYC.The room is clean and comfortable, and would have been happy had the hotel staff not have been a nightmare throughout the week long stay.The cleaning staff took all of our stuff out of the room and put it in lost and found thinking we abandoned the room. When I came back to discovery my items, wallet, bathroom supplies were gone, it was a shock. Went to hotel front desk and they said that if there's not a lot of stuff in the room they think it's abandoned. They assured me they would notify the cleaning staff to not do it again.They did it again.Needless to say it was very frustrating.

While staying here my husband took ill and Sandra helped me to extend our stay and organised a kettle and bottled water to be brought up to our room.Catania, who serviced our room was very sympathetic and cleaned our room immediately so my husband could get into bed as soon as possible

Came here with my wife and two sons, 21 and 14 and we had a great time. Hotel was a big part of why we loved New York. The service from checking in (Rhodda) the bar staff, the house keeping and the breakfast people was outstanding. Also the guys downstairs who looked after our luggage on our last day and sorted out a cab for us to the airport. We had a lovely room on the 38th floor with plenty of room for 4 of us with lovely comfy beds with a view of the city and the Hudson River. Best of all is the location! Unbeatable for anyone visiting NYC for the first time. Will definitely return in the future.

We just stayed here this past weekend and had an overall good experience. We stayed on the 20th floor room 20-16. We originally booked a king size room but for some reason when I got there I was put in a double room. They quickly fixed that but I ended up getting a joining king room instead. The joining king room's door was extremely thin and we could hear conversations from the other side of the room, 20-18. Our neighbors for all 4 nights kept us up. The room was clean was extremely clean for the stay. The price for the room was just right with all accommodations you get with it. This includes cleanness of the room, being next to times square, by subway station, and a couple of places to eat inside. We canceled our Hilton reservations to stay here that's how impressed we were with the room along with the price. I would gave this hotel a 5 star if they didn't try to put me and my wife in a double bed room and the joining room which has a very thin joining room door.

Evelyn, at the check in made my day n my whole stay superb. Quick check and very corteous and friendly and proactive. i got a room view that I wished for, elite floor upgrade, complimentary buffet breakfast, vouchers n recognising gold elite members n all of that makes one feel special. Thank you Evelyn. The hotel is perfect location, a block away from noisy times square yet quiet n peaceful. A very busy lobby but superbly managed, from valet to security n room service all great. The guest service quickly took over a minor issue I had over my earlier booking confusion and as always IHG has always given good surprises to loyal guests. At the price n value for money we pay, I can easily say Crown Plaza is a cool place. Grind & co burgers a must try n breakfast at ground level is good too. Keep up folks n hope to catch up soon.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza on a long weekend with work colleagues. The rooms were spacious for Times Square. The 25th floor doesn’t afford views of the city but we found the location ideal for Times Square and the subway connections.

Didn’t disappoint! Loved our well-appointed corner room over looking Broadway & Times Square! Convenient to everything that speaks NYC! The customer service was exceptional! Will be back for sure sooner than later!

Great hotel, perfect location and cleanliness and service was fantastic. If staying in Times Square, this hotel is great!!! Would highly recommend!! Make sure you see a Broadway show, we saw Chicago and the theatre was just steps away. Also grab a ticket for the hop on hop off bus, there are plenty of guys selling tickets on the corners close to the hotel.

There is a great view from the dining room overlooking Time Square but they stop serving food way too early -- too bad because I was starving when I arrived. My room was no big deal and it was $550+/night. Overall, I was not impressed with the place other than the fabulous location.

I just stayed here for a business conference.This hotel is outdated and needs a major renovation. I would never stay here again.I had a room on the 38th floor facing the Barclays building (I had blackout curtains thankfully). Even on floor 38, you can hear the street pretty well.As soon as I opened the door to my room, there was a weird smell. The room was just perfunctory with nothing special about it. There were stains on the carpet, dust everywhere, the wallpaper was peeling, and there was no refrigerator in the room. The furniture in the room was nicked and dented, it smelled like old wood, so I didn’t put my clothes in the drawers. The hangers were even ratty and the iron had limescale all over it. The sheets were damp. The thermostat was odd too-no matter what I set it at, it was stuck at 69 degrees F. The coffeemaker was in the cabinet and at that point would never use it. There was no minibar or any snacks.Even the luggage rack was taped with a gauze bandage.There’s a Starbucks across the street and Duane Reeds and Walgreens everywhere, so you can get what you need. There’s no sundry shop, but there’s an ok Grind & Co little shop they give you 2 $25 dollar daily vouchers for. They also give you 2 cocktail vouchers— I didn’t even bother.I’m not a tourist, so I wasn’t into all the other Times Sq stuff.When I have to go to this conference again, I will not stay here. The WiFi is slow and the conference area is outdated as well.This is not a 4 star hotel... this is a motel with hotel prices.

Surrounded by dazzling lights in the heart of Times Square but a quiet place to return after the hustle bustle of the city. We were on the 26th floor so all was peaceful. Breakfast was good and you have the choice of breakfast in the restaurant or buying from in-house counter and using the hotel lounge. Staff very pleasant and very helpful with any questions or information needed. Would certainly come back to this hotel.

The reception staff member was FANTASTIC, made us feel at home, the room overlooked Times Square, it was a good size plus clean and tidy, beds were much better than most hotels, nice reception area with well stocked bar and plenty of tables, bathroom very clean with lovely soft towels, breakfast at hotel was excellent

I recently had a 5 night stay at the Crowne Plaza in Manhattan NYC. On my arrival I discovered that through a mix up with the agency I used in the UK and their US counterparts my hotel booking had been cancelled.The hotel, instead of washing their hands of me as the mix up was not their fault. Not only allowed me to stay, but helped me sort out the problem and the following night, having fixed the mix up with the agents I had used, gave my wife and I an even better room to stay in for the remainder of our stay.This is such a wonderful hotel in every respect, from the rooms to the amenities offered, with such friendly staffWith regard to the members of staff, I wish to give a special thank you to Victoria Martin, Val Henry and Juliet Chang for the help they gave in making our stay one of the best ever. They were so professional, so friendly and their help went far beyond what could have been expected. So i can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Manhattan. There is no better place

I had flight delays and was supposed to arrive around 3p-4p. I ended up not getting in until 5am. I called several times to see what my options were and the staff was rude and said I could give up my room of 4 nights or pay for the night I wasn’t actually there. Ok fine. I’ll pay for 4 full nights. When I arrived I was given a room that had mold growing on the ceiling above the bed. I requested another room. I was given a temporary room and told that my room with two double beds would be reassigned to me the next day. I went down at 10am and made sure that it’s was known what my room situation was and that I would be back in the afternoon to be given keys to my new room. Came back at 4:30pm and was told that no room was approved for me because I booked through booking.com. I had to have a long conversation with the Assistant Manager who told me I booked an ADA room and I couldn’t just ask for a two double bed room because I messed up. I told her I didn’t that I was given an ADA room because of mold on the ceiling in the room assigned to me when I arrived. I had to show my booking reservations to show I was not lying about my reservation. I finally got a room and was told they would waive the $35 daily service fee that covers Wifi, etc. Well good thing we could never even get on the WiFi because it was so bad. The new room I was assigned to had mold all over the bathroom. See pictures below. After so much trouble and poor service previously in sucked it up and didn’t complain. When you stay at a hotel such as the Crown Plaza it is known for its prestige and cleanliness. I’m paying $1800 for 4 nights for a dirty room with mold. I will never stay at this hotel again. I’ve stayed at LaQuintas that we’re nicer than this and more than half the cost. Don’t pay for a room with a view because the hotel really doesn’t have a direct view of Times Square. You have to lean over and look way down the street to actually see Times Square. It’s a good location, but don’t pay for the view it’s a waste of your money. They also do NOT offer airport transportation.

We enjoyed yet another wonderful visit to the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. Front desk staff is AMAZING! I received frequent texts about my accommodations. I needed my room serviced at a specific time, which was not a problem. Beautiful rooms. Excellent service.

The receptionist Evaline literally said to me and my wife that third party reservations come with a "resort fee" of 40$. WTF is this fee for. The price was advertised for 160 a night but I actually paid 260$. Nothing on the website said anything about a resort fee. I will never stay here again in my life with this predatory hotel. Overrated and overpriced. Very basic value for money.

Wonderful hotel in wonderful location.Such a lovely place with fast and pretty good service.The rooms are clean and design is stylish.We spend lovely moments there. We are recommended this hotel for our friends and relatives, will come again.

Very good location on Times Square. Easy access to subway station. Friendly and helpful check in staff. Excellent breakfast. I am a repeat guest at this hotel, my children love visiting this hotel whenever we are in New York.

The hotel is situated right on Broadway / 7th Avenue, just 50yds north of Times Square so the location is fantastic. The rooms are fine but the reception decor is looking is a little tired. They have a little cafe inside (closed on Sundays which is a bit annoying) and a bar. I’d definitely stay here again purely because it’s right where the action is.

Stayed here from Sunday to today 5 days , it was a swift check in with a lovely gentleman on the reception desk, he welcomed us and also had a bottle of wine sent up to our room for my husbands 60 th birthday. We were in room 3119 as we entered I did think the double beds were quite small at first glance but actually we really settled in well with a lovely view of time square looking down onto juniors pancake house. The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the bathroom was very clean as was the whole room , in-fact really impressive how the staff came in every day cleaned the room , made the beds to a high standard . There was a lovely cafe with beautiful cakes, coffee etc every single member of staff were very happy to help and said good morning or evening and what was so nice is they didn’t push the ill so everything for you as long as you give me a big tip like some hotels in NYC that we’ve stayed at but made you give them more as they weren’t rude about it . Mike took out cases to store them who was such a lovely man a real gent . Also the hotel kindly gave us a late check out . All in all we really loved this hotel and especially the staff . Well down team , I’m very fussy and you all did great ! The restaurant and cocktail bar looked great bit didn’t try them as we were out most of the day thanks from the roberts family !

We always stay at this hotel whenever we arrive to New York. This time we came for 5 nights. The location of the hotel is great, & the rooms are comfortable. We appreciate especially the worm welcome & great help & attention we got at the reception from Ms. Sandra ESP, who helped us to get the room that we liked. Thank you!

We stayed here for a quick week in the city, and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. It’s perfectly situated in Times Square, close to theaters, restaurants and subways. Our room was very spacious. The hotel staff texted us shortly after we arrived to inquire about the room. This means of communication worked wonderfully when we found our room short a towel and later when we had a problem with a clogged sink. Both issues were resolved quickly. The wifi was quirky requiring a renewal each day, but that was a minor inconvenience. The room was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We’d stay there again.

The location is amazing and convenient. Rooms were clean and nice. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. You are right in the heart of times square where all the hustle and bustle is. Theaters just a hop, skip and walk away. 8th street has many restaurants that are amazing. Morning coffee and breakfast, just a short walk with, too many choices. The metro is pretty much, right there to get you to wherever else you want to go explore!

Fantastic place to stay in NYC. All staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms had great views. Pool was good for our children. Price was reasonable compared to similar hotels in the area. Thank you for being so accommodating. We would recommend.

Hi! I have had really bad experiences with the hotels in New York. This time I stayed with Crowne plaza! It’s amazing hotel with nice aroma , it’s very clean and most importantly the staff is really nice. I wasn’t feeling well, but they provided me help with everything. The guy at the front desk names Imran, upgrades my room with nice time square view. Also Mahfuz made sure I got special tea for my sickness. Very highly recommended this hotel! Do try, they won’t let you down .

Two co-workers and I stayed at the Crown Plaza for an education conference and had an amazing time. The hotel is centrally located right in Times Square and within walking distance of everything (Rockafeller Center, Central Park, Broadway, etc.). The hotel itself was modern and the rooms were very clean and had a great view of the city. There is a fitness club within the hotel, which is a nice feature; however, the pool there is definitely for lap swimming only (not to leisurely hang out by the pool).

Lovely hotel in the heart of Times Square. Nice clean spacious rooms friendly and prompt check in. Bar really nice for a drink. No problem I’m leaving your luggage if needed. Nice restaurant to eat in. Great views of the city from the rooms

Let me start out by saying I had booked the Marriott Marquis for two nights that weekend at the $255 teacher rate, due to unforeseen circumstances we couldn’t stay two nights and I had to modify our reservation to one night. When I did that the room price skyrocketed to $750 for the night!! So I canceled and started looking at other hotels. I remembered I had always wanted to stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square so I checked there first and became and IHG member, for free, to get the best rates and some extra perks. Their price for the night $245 senior discount rate! So I booked it right away without looking at the TA reviews because you could cancel the room up to 24 hours in advance so I figured if the reviews were bad I would just cancel. The reviews were pretty decent except for a couple of them talking about the front of the hotel having construction. So I called ahead to make sure it wasn’t going to interfere with our stay. I spoke to Sandra who assured me it wouldn’t and she would put us on the higher floor to alleviate any concerns I had about noise. I also told her we were celebrating a BD. When we got to the hotel we had to enter through the side of the building, which is not a big deal at all. Our check in was quick and easy. Special thanks to Victoria who knew her job, was professional, kind and enthusiastic that we were there! Our room was not ready because we had arrived early but they texted us when it was ready and that was great! I texted back if they could make sure the AC in the room was on blast because it was a hot day and we were walking around a lot and they replied: “ Yes of course! Is there anything else we can do to make your stay comfortable?” Yippee!  We got so many freebies! We each received one hotel voucher for buffet breakfast worth $35 each, a $20 voucher that we could spend anywhere in the hotel including bar and restaurant, and four drink vouchers valued at $15!!! We were so happy!!!!! When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised that they had upgraded us to a corner suite!! The room was icy cold as just like we requested! The room was very nice, bathroom a little small, but big enough to move around and feel comfortable. The bathroom does not have a separate door from the shower area, it’s all together. We had forgotten our toothbrushes and they came to the room immediately with complementary brushes and tooth paste. All hotel staff was pleasant and able to answer any questions we had. The hospitality and the feel of being in a smaller hotel for being such a big hotel was incredible! Our normal stomping ground is usually the Marriott Marque in Times Square but the service we received here outweighs their service! So next time I book at the Crowne Plaza!

Such an amazing place to stay . You are literally on Times Square . Ideal location . Rooms were big for family of 4. Service was good . Staff were friendly . Easy access to basically everything . Breakfast is expensive, I would suggest eating out as there are plenty of places to eat at a quarter of the price . Tons of shopping places around the corner also !! I’m going there again without a doubt

JAMES on the check-in desk (on 21st Aug 2019) was my first encounter with the Crowne Plaza, Times Square’s team - what a SUPERSTAR! He was polite, welcoming, listened & heard. James made us feel that nothing was too much trouble. Perfect check in, excellent customer service! We didn’t eat at the hotel but the bar staff were really efficient and pleasant too. We regularly had drinks and occasionally had dessert there. LIFTS were in full working order and fast. ROOM: I’d booked & paid extra for a Times Square view room & got a corner double double (Room 3601) with a fabulous view of Times Square, including the Empire State Building. Really pleased. • Beds (& pillows, 4 per bed supplied) were very comfortable but are a small double. • Hairdryer provided in a bag on the bathroom shelf, it’s a proper fairly powerful one not one of those wall hose things! • Bathroom, well lit & clean. Fixed shower head over a bath tub. Clean heavy shower curtain. • No issues with the air con, worked perfectly throughout. • Lots of power points provided. All the lamp stand bases on the desk, the TV dresser & the bedside drawers (which also included a couple of USB ports too) had the facility to plug in. • Two luggage stands included. • Small closet space with around 10 wooden hangers provided (we used one of the clip ones to hold the curtains together were they met in the corner to prevent that light gap!) • Usual laundry Bag provided (we didn’t use the service) • Corner arm chair, small coffee table & a desk plus chair provided. • No kettle but a drip machine that you could use the provided tea or coffee bags in (or your own teabags if you’re British!) Cups are disposable, wrapped in plastic. White sugar sachet, sweetener, packet creamer (no milk), plastic stirrer & a paper serviette come packaged up (in more plastic...!) feels wasteful, should be provided separately. - No water bottles provided. - No fridge included but available on request. - No Iron, available on request I think (I pack in a way where I don’t need to iron when I arrive!) CLEANLINESS: excellent, well maintained room, not tired or dated. • The usual toiletries, tea/coffee & towels replaced without fail, housekeeping were great and done by lunchtime or earlier (we were always out during the day to be fair). LOCATION: fantastic on the doorstep of Times Square TKTS red steps (which is the section our room view was of) with the Subway on 50th just a couple of minutes walk away. Scaffolding is still up so entrance is to the side, under the tunnel. SUMMARY: Some of the reviews had worried me but I honestly couldn’t fault it. It’s not the highest end luxury & my expectations for city hotels, given the numbers that go through them are low but this was certainly not a shoddy hotel in my experience & did live up to the Crowne Plaza brand. We had a jam packed itinerary for the week, you really just need a place to lay your head in NYC but even the kids started calling the room ‘home’... lovely to return back to each evening with our tourist sore feet and buzzing heads. Thank you to the CP team, you excelled!

An excellent choice for visiting NYC! Fantastic location, clean, and comfortable. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the pool experience. We chose this hotel specifically in part because it was one of only a few in our price range with a pool, but when we went to use it, we discovered it is a lap pool that is part of the health club with very specific rules. Not at all your typical hotel pool (no lounge chairs, no shallow end for kids, etc.). In spite of that we loved our stay and I will recommend to anyone who asks!

Wonderful location. The hotel's health club was my most favorite. The breakfast needed the availability of more vegetables which I was looking for in the morning. I believe the management of the hotel should look into it.

My husband and I stayed there a week for the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The location was perfect. A long block from multiple subway stations, a long block from a huge grocery store, two long blocks from the parade & Rockefeller and reasonable walking distance to Central Park, Macy's and everything else you want. The staff were all so nice and gave us great tips on places to ear. This was my husbands first trip to the city so I wanted to keep him in the center of it all. He loved it! Bonus we had a view of Times Square from our room. Only small down side was the heat was a bit to hot for our room and you cannot control it with a thermostat. The beds were super comfy and the room was very clean.

Me and two of my daughters stayed at the hotel for four nightsEveryone was very nice and helpful specially the lady at breakfast (Ana?)Had a great time. Location is perfect I was also given vouchers for drinks that I was able to exchange for other beverages

I stayed 5 nights in July - and had a marvellous time! The hotel bar/restaurant was the highlight. Tony was our server every night and treated us like family - gave us tips about what shows to see, what cocktails to order . . . I will definitely be back! Thanks so much, Tony@Bar49!

Stayed in NYC on August 31 & September 1. Quick 2 night stay. This hotel is amazing. From everyone at the front desk to the wonderful bar & breakfast brunch. Everyone had a smile on their face. Wish I remembered the name of the bartender on September 1st but recommend Barbacon because we wanted a dinner out that we could walk to & did not disappoint! Had a corner room 3102 that actually had a hallway. Lol. Beautiful view of Times Square. Definitely will stay here again

Located at the Duffy Statue end of Times Square the entrance is tucked away underneath the hotel which makes it less busy and frantic than it otherwise might be.The service is main chain efficient and orderly. Room was very clean and comfortable having a view of both Times Sq and the Hudson River.Obviously this part of NYC is busy 24/7 but the noise was never really intrusive even with a busy FireHouse just one block away behind the hotel.Can't vouch for the restaurant but the bar wasn't madly exorbitant.

In the middle of building work which made things very difficult, staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful, putting luggage in storage till room was ready meant that we had to go down in a lift out of the building and round the block to get in at the back of the hotel, no offer of help. Room was tired and sheets on beds were damp,

Crowne plaza time square. Walked in to hotel reception when we arrived and thought really nice bug it ended there. The lifts feel like there going to break down and then we got to our Hotel rooms which were very poor. We were moved rooms 3 times so far. All the tables and units were all damaged with doors on cupboards not closing properly. Dirty carpets and in one room the bath had the enamel coming away and over all the paint work in hotel and room was very below par. So in general not a 4 star hotel in my eyes, far from it

Always wanted to visit New York The Marriott Marquis was the best. This is a very nice place to stay. Right in the middle of everywhere we wanted to see and and everywhere we wanted to go. We had a great time!

My reservation was made through a well known website, and all was fully paid in advance. However once at the hotel an additional charge of $35 per day was charged to my credit card prior to check out. The reason given was this is a standard “service fee for gym access, welcome drink at the lobby bar, and high speed internet”. I claimed to the customer service of the hotel as I never asked for this, had no drinks at the bar, and internet was included in my paid room rate. The guy in charge of customer services (Chris) confirmed this fee was not applicable when I claimed. However at check out they kept the service fee charge of $35 per day. Had a long discussion with the reception manager (who was very kind) but the charge remained and their excuse was “this is charged by all hotels in New York”, which it’s completely false. They charge this “service fee” to everybody in addition to whatever you have paid or rate you have reserved (and this is not a city or county tax, simply a overcharge of Crowne Plaza). Be aware of their trick and assume you have to add $35 per day to your stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square. Very unfair and tricky.

We celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary. Check in was fast, Great room overlooking Times Square. The staff couldn't have made us feel more special, especially Ruben Hernandez in the Security Department. We would stay here again.

This hotel was perfectly fine, but I was a little underwhelmed. We were a party of 10 requiring 4 rooms and were told that the rooms would be ready by 3pm, which was fine. However when 3pm came only 3 rooms were ready resulting in 2 people having to shower in someone else's room. Several hours later a room was offered, but had 1 king sized bed when it was supposed to be a twin room, so we were left waiting again for the final room, which obviously wasn't ideal. The rooms were fine when we were in, our view was of the river which was lovely. The rooms were quiet and clean, with plenty of room and a large bathroom (with a great shower). The lighting was good which is always a bonus, with plenty of mirrors. The location was the reason that we booked this hotel, as it's literally in the middle of everything. There are plenty of bars and restaurants a stones throw away with plenty of choice. The hotel is in Times Square so you are surrounded by the hustle and bustle of New York which is great. Taxi's were easily available, and the hotel will request one if not. The staff were very helpful with recommendations on what to see, when to go and we managed to get discount tickets within the hotel which was good. I would recommend staying here, I think we just got a little unlucky with the room situation because there was a convention on so the hotel was more than likely to be fully booked.

Stayed here for five nights while visiting NYC, and while I wouldn’t spend too much time in Times Square itself (too many beggars, oddballs and hucksters for my liking, especially after dark), it was perfectly located for all of the places I wanted to visit in midtown Manhattan. My room was located on the 20th floor, and while I heard the occasional police siren or traffic horn in the night, otherwise I could not hear any noise from Times Square. I generally wouldn’t pick a hotel that has so many rooms but I enjoyed my stay here and have nothing to complain about.

Very comfortable room with view of the Hudson. Excellent restaurant, snack and bar service. Efficient reception, despite large amount of guests. Best experience at breakfast time. Travis is so welcoming at breakfast time. He works hard to ensure you have all the food and drinks you require and that you are completely satisfied. He is a great source of information for tourists new to New York like us.Hotel is very central, easy to get to museums, Broadway etc. Vibrant.

Went to eat here with my daughters while on an 8 day trip to New York. The food was really good although we did wait abit but it was really busy. Our server was friendly polite and so cheerful. Plenty of stuff to look at here aswell,only downside was it was super noisy but there was alot of people there. Definitely will visit again
user_name:
Eva B
Dumfries and Galloway Scotland uk

review_body: My son and I stayed here because we were seeing Hadestown at the Walter Kerr Theater right next door. This Hotel definitely didn't disappoint. Parking on-site, comfortable beds, great views from our room, and a very knowledgeable and friendly staff always willing to help. What more could you ask for? Thank you for making our first NY experience and unforgettable one!

The hotel is a few steps from the Times. There is an ongoing renovation at the entrance on broadway so we had use the vale entrance. The hotel has a nice view rooms available. Our check in was very nice and smooth. Thanks to Rosa from front desk, we had a kind surprise of a drink-set for our anniversary. It was a cool surprise for us waiting at the room after a long day in the city. We had booked a times square view room and we get a fine room overlooking the square. This was my second time visiting the same hotel.

Just spent six fantastic nights in this top quality location and hotel. Excellent throughout from reception to the young gentleman in the fashion bar who was the most polite young man I have met in a long while. I do wish you can pass on my regards to the young man. The cleaning staff also excellent with a very high standard of customer service firm just a good morning to any help that is asked of. Hotel is spotless with a good breakfast. Superb location. Will be very highly recommended to family and friend and also my large workforce colleagues. Anyone from the United Kingdom would be foolish to book anywhere else in Times Square than this magnificent hotel.

Overall my partner and I were extremely satisfied with our experience at the Crowne Plaza. We were given an amazing corner room and the front desk staff were very friendly, kind and helpful. The location is easy to find as well. When we were checking out, we asked if they would be able to check our luggage for the day so we could sight see and come back to pick it up. The front desk staff said they were happy to take our luggage and to check it downstairs. When we went to check it, the staff there asked us “where we had heard that lie” when we inquired about checking the luggage. When we replied the front desk, they begrudgingly took our luggage. Other than that unfortunate experience we had a great stay and are happy to come back.

This is my 2nd time staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square and I was very happy we did. We were a group of 7 and fortunate enough to have adjoining rooms which made the whole trip easier. Unfortunately I did not get names of the staff that we interacted with, but everyone was so helpful and friendly and if any of them give you recommendations for food listen because both of the ones we received were phenomenal.With great service and an unbeatable location (especially if you plan on seeing a show, they are in the middle of most theaters) I would highly recommend this hotel.

This is a real shame because until you get to the room, this hotel is fine. Staff are friendly, service is good and breakfast is wonderful, though do make sure it's included in the rate because it isn't worth $35 per person - no breakfast is.Also be aware they take a $75 per night pre auth on check in, even though there's no mini bar in the rooms. Seems like a racket to encourage you to dine in their one food outlet. Because they could easily put a block on room charges.The problems really start when you enter your room.It's probably the worst housekeeping I've experienced in any hotel at any level before.The rooms are shabby, in need of some TLC. The taps are loose. There are holes where light bulbs should be but worse than that, they're just dirty. Layers of dust on shelves on entry and not cleaned throughout our three day stay, toilet had urine stains on the rim etc. Coffee cups and refreshments not replaced.It all points to lazy housekeeping. We didn't even get a bed. It was a tired old job lot sofa bed that really had seen better days.The hotel was undergoing major refurb works when we stayed. Would've been nice if we'd been informed.

I booked this hotel for two rooms months in advance and even though everything turned out okay, we almost didn't get the rooms I requested. I knew our flight was a late night arrival so I called the front desk the day before to let the front desk know. It seems to me this should have taken 2 minutes, but the woman kept putting me on hold with horrible music playing until she finally hung up on me after I was on the phone for 1/2 hour. I called back the 800 number and they made sure my rooms were flagged for a late arrival. Due to weather delays we arrived even later than I thought - about 3:30 in the morning!! So the woman tells me she has my two rooms with king beds. I told her that one room was supposed to be two queen beds. She asked " how many in my room " I said "two - but I'm with my son and he gets his own bed!!!" She said the room had a pull out bed!! I told her no - for that kind of money he gets his own bed. She said I should have told them and I explained that I actually booked these rooms over the phone and DID tell them exactly what kind of rooms I wanted. She said I should have called the front desk and booked it! I then told her about my experience calling the front desk about the late arrival and she said they outsource that stuff!?!?! I was trying to maintain my cool since I was so tired and just wanted this to work out well!!A man at the desk next to her mentioned a couple different options she could give me so she got me the double room and then tried to make me feel bad by saying " now you messed up the room for someone else arriving later"!!!! I just kept smiling because I was tired and wanted everything to work out well!!The beds are very nice but the bathroom had hairs in the shower and on the floor!! I was too tired to worry about that. There is no refrigerator or coffee pot and the cleaning staff gets very loud in the hallways very early!! The location is perfect so I guess I need to focus on the positive!!

I stayed from 20 Aug. to 24 Aug. at Room 3207. It is a very stranded hotel and very comfortable. The most touch me is Ana who is served in Brasserie 1605, the breakfast restaurant of Crown Plaza. She worked very hard and touched.She is very patient with my sons. Her service is very professional and keeps it very clean. She is very kind to receive my sons, so that my wife and I can enjoy a wonderful breakfast.She is also very familiar with New York and gave us many practical suggestions for the journey. I am a Marriott member. This time I was very surprised to book the Crown Hotel, but because of Ana's service, I will use this hotel as a resident choice for New York.

Super location right on times square, our room was over looking the Times Square.Breakfast was included in our room stay and the staff there were very courteous and helpful, Ana & Mahfus were exceptionally courteous and helpful and ensured we were comfortable and would help us with any of our weird queries. Would recommend to any person with a family to stay here

The location of the Crowne Plaza Times Square is excellent. You can walk right out of the hotel and you are in Times Square. The only reason I can't give a 5 rating is because the room was not ready at specified check in time. When we came back hours later, it still wasn't ready. I know sometimes things can happen out of our control, but we had dinner reservations and wanted to get in our rooms to change. Other than that, the hotel was clean and most staff was pretty friendly. I would go back.

Our time at the hotel was made enjoyable by some of the staff we met but most especially Anna at the restaurant during breakfast. She was such a pleasant individual and lovely to a fault. We enjoyed the view of the time square and because of its strategic location, we were able to visit different places by foot! Overall, our time there was good as we looked out for Anna everytime we went to breakfast.

This hotel is the perfect spot, located in the Theater District, between the 48th and the 49th street, right in Times square. When you exit the hotel on any of these streets you are just facing many theaters where are performing some of the famous and best Broadway shows.Very busy hotel in Summer time with the tourists, it is very convenient, good accommodation and provides a nice coffee shop restaurant with good food and good service. But avoid the kind of deli corner at the reception floor, very expensive for what you get, getter have a short walk on the street!Rooms offer large space, despite the furniture and the carpet are somewhat worn out, but it is ok. Bathrooms are large and clean. I had a little concern about the floor structure that you can feel worked somewhat and is not flat anymore and this is a concern especially when you are staying in a high rise.The price is reaching the expensive range but not the luxury range and it is a good value price compared to some other hotel in the area with better prices but a very bad experience I had 2 years ago.

This hotel is located at the north end of times square.Perfect for theaters and restaurants. 46 stories high and every floor is great. We have used this location for many years and everytime we are pleased. Contributing to our happiness this year, were some noteworthy staff members: James at check in; Milton at the concierge desk; Jason, Kim, Philip, and Anthony - the great bar team; and Travis in the dining room. All made our stay enjoyable. Special mention also to Chris for his attention to our well-being.We highly recommend this location for your best stay in Manhattan. Marvaand Bruce Topping

Celebrating a birthday so chose TGI’s .... good choice! The steak was amazing as was the accompaniments. A wee bit pricey but couldn’t fault the food and the service. Waited 20 minutes to receive the food from ordering it which I thought was good considering how packed it was

As you can see from the photos, pieces of paint were falling from the ceiling and the smell in the room was very nasty.We stayed in this hotel for eight days and had daily problems with hot water. We hardly managed to shower because the water was always cold.At the elevators it was always crowded and you had to wait for good minutes to get to the room or to leave the hotel.One day we had to go down 28 floors on the fire staires because the elevators were blocked and we waited more than 15 minutes.We asked for our room to be changed, but we received one just like the first room. In this hotel there is no refrigerator in the room which is inadmissible for a 4 star hotel.The two beds in the room were so small that the children could hardly sleep.The Internet was pretty hard and was disconnected after a few minutes.In short it is a hotel too expensive for the services it offers.

Our whole reason for going to NYC was for my husbands birthday. I called the hotel two days prior to arrival to arrange an amenity to be left in the room for his birthday. I was sent a credit card authorization form and a guest amenity form. I filled those out and faxed them to the number I was given. I called to make sure it was received which the fax never was so I emailed them to the person I spoke to on the phone and she forwarded to the food and beverage manager. The next day we’re driving to the airport and my husband receives a phone call from the hotel asking to speak with me. He already knows something is up now because I had to try and explain what I wanted the surprise to be over the phone. They told me they never got the form and I was transferred to someone in food and beverage. They also told me the my never got the fax or email and I told them the number on the amenity form I wanted which was a six pack of beer and chips and dip. Well apparently the form they had was different than mine because the choices for that number was different. I kept telling her what I wanted and she kept asking if I wanted a birthday cake. I was getting so frustrated I was ready to cancel everything and that’s when they told me they’d handle it. The next day we’re checking in and we go to dinner and realize our door doesn’t lock behind us. We go downstairs tell the front desk they apologize and call security to fix it right then. We leave for dinner and come back 2 hours later to find it had not been fixed. We’re infuriated now because our things had been unlocked for 2 hours. We get a hold of the manager who apologized and said she can transfer us to another room. So I pack everything up and during this time security comes and fixes the door in less than a minute. Why wasn’t this done two hours prior? By that time the manager shows up and asks if we want to stay in the room since it’s fixed now. Um NO I’ve already packed everything up. So we take the elevator to the different room only to find that room ALREADY HAD PEOPLE IN IT. By this time I’m just thinking all of it is a joke so manager comes back up there and sends us to another room with a “better view” we now go to the third room which doesn’t have a better view but whatever we were tired of moving. While we were in our first room we went to get ice and the machine didn’t work. I called the front desk and asked if they could bring some up and I was told to go down to another floor to get ice. Really?! I shouldn’t have to do that. This hotel has poor customer service and is not the luxury you expect when staying in Times Square. I will never be back to this hotel and will never recommend it to anyone.

Booked this hotel as my meetings were directly across the street. The room was nice and clean and well appointed. I was very late for all my meetings because of the elevators, you couldn’t get on an elevator to go down. I think 2 of the four high rise elevators were out of commission. Tip, take the service elevators behind the employees only door, elevators were immediately available. Don’t dine there, food is just ok but the service staff are extremely unprofessional and cranky. So many nicer places to stay. Chris addressed my concerns by giving me a free late checkout, which was really appreciated, but not enough to make me go back. Location Awesome.

The property is ideally located in times square..Pls do not even consider keeping a car in NYC.. it will get very frustrating..Most attractions / places are accessible by walking and Subway.. plenty of Subway options in close proximity to the hotel..I would recommend the hotel to all visitors (individuals and families) planning a trip to NYC..

As mentioned in the title, the location is everything about this hotel. Being at Times Square is a great plus for this hotel, close to several attractions, sub-way station and city tour buses. As a matter of fact the Times Square is a good hub to start an activity or to return to at the end of the day to spend nice time. Major concern is about queen bed size which doesn’t fit by any means to two persons! We tried same bed type in other hotels at USA and found those to be a bit larger! We booked 2 Queen beds room for 2 kids and two adults and unfortunately a queen bid didn’t fit even the two kids!Cleanliness is good but rooms are a bit old and need renovation. Hotel staff are helpful though they are also quite tough but still professional :) maybe due to the workload ! Checkout is sharp at 11 am, one hour extension is 25$ !! Tried to extend one hour and they insisted to charge 25$ per hour. I understand this is due to hotel is maybe fully booked. Check in was easy. WiFi is good inside the rooms. Overall experience is fair.

This hotel is big (nearly 800 rooms), a fact that makes any personal treatment impossible. The guest is a number, just part of the flow. It seems easier to get tourist information via social media (TripAdvisor) than through the staff, always busy. The rooms are clean, standardized, ceilings low. No particular charme nor view. Times Square is a busy place, full of tourists and we will not stay there again.

I’m being pretty generous here with 3 stars, the hotel location is extremely awesome and central we get to check-in early which is great the room is decent size but no bar fridge so if you need cold water at night you won’t have it. The check out was easy but the bell man Kam is terrible to dealt with I felt like someone force him to be at work no smile and terrible manner which wasn’t nice to dealt with when you are on holiday.

For a quick 2 nights visit to New York I thought it was best to stay as central as possible, and booked 2 nights for 5 people. Booking and room location was as asked for, and off course you can’t really complain at the location.However the first impression when you arrive is not very good, and I guess it didn’t help when we waited in a line for more than 20 min to get checked in.
