Especially when you have just arrived in the US and want to go to bed. The rooms we had was typical the US , two large queen beds per room, big telly a long desk and one armchair. The room was booked to have a view to Times Square, and yes if you leant on the window and looked right you did see it, was that worth the extra money? No.Woke up early next morning and no warm water in the shower, so it was a cold start for us all. Made the reception staff aware of this and it was fixed by morning 2, however not much of a compensation was offered for this inconvenience.... the bathroom and bedroom could do with a refresh, especially the bathroom where railings where hanging off the wall.Breakfast both days was superb, and it I would highlight any staff groups it would be the breakfast staff. Great cold and warm choice selections of all you could want to eat and drink for breakfast.We used the bar downstairs one late evening and it was pleasant enough. The hotel also had a good bakery / snack shop at reception level which was very good.Would I stay here again? Based on the high price and other options of global brand hotels nearby, I guess I would try another one.

This is a decent hotel right in the thick of things in Times Square. There are several food options and the prices weren’t ridiculous. Overall the staff was friendly with the exception of one person in the restaurant-I believe she was the hostess or manager. She was downright rude and could be reminded how to properly treat customers. There was an anime convention while we were visiting which was a bit overwhelming but it was only for a couple of days so tolerable. The rooms are big for NYC which was great but a little tired with ripped curtains and musty smell.

We stayed at the Crowne for almost a week while in the city. Loved the location. Close to great restaurants and theatres. Our room was ready when we arrived so we got to check in right away which was great. Staff was friendly and attentive. There were four of us (all adults) sharing a room and it was very comfortable. Slept like a baby every night. Have stayed here before and will definitely come back!

First off I know location is king, especially in Manhattan. But with that said you charge a certain amount your clientele expect their monies worth. Nowhere was I told this building was under construction made it hard for an out of towner to find the building. Once inside things where much better. Cleaner and more up to date, other than all of the lobby area windows covered in construction tarp. Check in took a bit as they were busy and there wasn't a large waiting line area so we all felt cramped. The check in process itself went fairly quickly but it the rep had to call someone to switch a room fro us(?) they did was give us two drink coupons for the small bar they have in the check in area. The room itself was clean and has an amazing view for times square.(which we had purchased). But the toilet paper holder was falling out of the wall. The shower on/off handle would spin and didn't seem to be bolted in?!?! We had reserved the room for 3 days and we were a family of four, they always seem to give only enough towels for three. So we called down and had some more delivered and they did promptly deliver them. But each day they cleaned our room they gave us less and less of everything. Started with 4 coffee pods and the final day we were there they left only one. Started with three sets of towels final days was left 2 sets. Just seemed very odd. Again the location was great being only steps away Times Square and a multitude of attractions and shops. But not worth the price we paid. Not only was the hotel expensive but we ended up paying more than $240 just to have our car valet parked through the hotel for three days. Again I know NYC is expensive but at some point you need to feel you got your monies worth somewhat.

We had stayed at a Crowne Plaza in Lake Placid a few weeks ago and were not entirely happy considering what we paid. Still, we thought we would try this one figuring maybe the last stay was a one-off anomaly. Well, the place was fairly run down. I don't think there were any problems that could have been rectified by the staff, certain things were too far gone. Maybe the mold on the shower ceiling, but nothing else. When we checked out, we learned of all the taxes. Many of them. Not the hotel's fault; that's New York for you. Nickle and diming the tourist. You have to park in the parking garage which is a part of the hotel. I'll say it again because this is important. The parking garage is part of the hotel. We checked in on Sunday and out on Tuesday. $140 for that time. We hadn't gotten the car at any point so it just sat there. This is not advertised anywhere and it would appear the cost is part of your hotel stay. It is not. In checking out, we paid almost $200 more than we expected to after already dealing with high prices for everything over 2 days. The deal clerk said it's a different company completely and they have no control over it. EVEN THOUGH IT IS A PART OF THE HOTEL! I get it. It's New York and they can get away with it because there's no shortage of tourists. I would say stay away from the city entirely unless money is no object to you.

After staying at another hotel a couple of years ago I thought I would give this one a try as nearer to Times Square.I am disappointed with the standard of decor in the rooms and public places. Some of the areas are ok and some need a good clean and modernisation.We had a problem with our TV and the engineer responded quickly only to be scolded that a cable had come out from the back which clearly he thought we should know. He had to pull the unit out to sort it - that’s something you do on holiday - NOT! The guy who seemed Russian needed a course in how to speak to the hotel guests and provide the best service to customers. It was appalling how rude he is!Safe is actually missing in our room so nowhere to store valuables unless we want to go to reception 33 floors down every time we need our money or valuables.Carpets are tired as are some of the blackout curtains which have tears in them and windows are shabby.On the plus side the location is good and that’s the best I can say on it. Will return to the Sheraton next time on 7th Avenue in a heartbeat for comfort and cleanliness. Very disappointing.

Rooms are stinky and not clean.. Don’t surprise seeing a piece of cookie under your bed waiting you. You can smell and feel the dusty everywhere..Exactly you like inhaling the dust while you are in the room.. cover sheets noticed with dirt marks from previous resident..this reminded me of a two stars hotel in an area called Albat’ha back at the downtown in our country.. my people understand what’s I am saying.. guys it’s of the same style and concept of a two stars hotel.. my advise: they hacked you by the nice pictures on the websites. Or some people could be attracted by the location....It’s a trap! Get rid of your dreams. Don’t even think about it. Believe me, location is not always everything, especially with well connected dots all over the city

We stayed with your 2 kids at this hotel last july. The hotel is idealy located right on Times Square! Staff was really friendly, especially Donald at the reception who did everything to make sure we have a pleasant stay! The down side is the pool, really not as you see on the website... We went as the end of the day and the attendant said we couldn't go because we did not bring swimcaps... We decided not to go anyway as it is really not a nice pool and not kid's friendly. For the rest evertyhing was great, as i wrote in the title, you go there for the location! Ask for a corner room, you will have an astonishing view on Times Square!

The location is really amazing right beside Times Square and has comparatively large rooms with amazing views.We were a family of four and were very comfortable in a traditional double with two double beds. The room was spacious and we had a great view to the north.The downside is that the hotel, just like the surrounding area is crowded and often hectic. During our stay there was renovation going on on the main entrance so we had to enter through the "back" which was a bit annoying.There is a swimming pool at the hotel but it requires the wearing of swimming caps and is mostly geared towards lane swimmers so we were discouraged from taking our children there although it would have been nice in the summer heat.I would recommend this hotel for families and leisure travelers to NYC, would probably stay somewhere else for business.

Popping in to say that Jonathan sorted out my reservation fabulously.I made a mistake when I booked my rooms. What I wanted wasn’t available but Jonathan worked front desk magic and made it happen.So far a great start to our weekend.

I was visiting from UAE and the Manager Jonathan helped me so much with getting me a connecting room next to my 2 daughters when my travel agency failed to inform me that I needed a connecting package to guarantee this kind of room. Thank you Jonathan for swooping into action and making my stay IN NYC very comfortable. If you go to the Crowne Plaza ask for the Manager Jonathan he is kind and will help you with whatever you need.

Nice hotel, clean, fresh, great location, nice view. The lowest is 28th and still good. Jonathan at check in was 5 star. Very nice! Nice bathroom with soft lighting, fast elevators, plenty of outlets.

The service was professional and pleasent, you could get coffee and a pastry at the coffe shop not having to run out first thing in the morning. It is near shoping and the theather district. I would stay there again.

Sandra at the IHG Member front desk was superb! She was a pleasant moment amongst the hustle. Quick to help and make us feel welcome. Joanie and Anthony at the bar crafted an excellent espresso martini! Quite delicious.

Had really wonderful service from Sandra, who welcomed us at the front desk and gave us an early check in! The room’s great and the location’s wonderful too! :) will be back the next time I visit New York!

After arriving from the UK we arrived at the Crowne Plaza the front main entrance is currently not in use which meant using the back of the hotel to access entry. Our room was on the 36 th floor it was adequate although slightly cramped for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We slept well and the beds are comfortable. We wrongly choose to eat breakfast the following morning in the hotel restaurant thinking of convenience to start the day of sightseeing. The food was of good quality with all the usual fare, the coffee however was bitter and unpleasant. The cost of all this amounted to $173.43 including service charges and the mandatory tip. This was the most expensive meal we had throughout our stay in New York and for a 4* mid range hotel we though it was extortionate. Needless to say this was our one and only meal experience at our hotel and it left us feeling underwhelmed about this place. For this reason I will not be recommending the Crowne Plaza Times Square yes it's location is the best thing about it but there are so many others to choose from and we just felt ripped off.

I loved Time square. The city that never sleeps. Arrived very late in the evening. People enjoyed gathering. Late night souvenir shops open. If you're feeling hungry shops open too. Every few min, the huge big screen (if you're postioned ) shows you on it. Great night life

We were so excited to stay at the Crowne, big let down. Called to say we were checking in late, they were rude on the phone. Checked in and the gentleman checking me in was so incredibly rude, I’ve never been treated that way. He spoke over me when I asked a question and treated me like he didn’t have the patience to deal with us. When I got to my room I was even more disgusted. It was so old, out dated, and dirty! I refused to use the shower due to the black mold and dirty towels in the bathroom! We stay in the city year, enjoying every place, and this was the worst experience I’ve had! I will not be returning!

Sandra Esp was amazing and really friendly at check in. Because we arrived early Sandra was super kind and let us check in early, so we could sleep after our long flight. She was also talking to us while we waited!Thank you so much Sandra!From Jess age 11

The hotel was in a good location in Times Square. We were on the 33rd floor, corner room and had a lovely view of the Hudson River. Room was clean and comfortable although the air con wasn't brill. We didn't air this issue with the hotel as we weren't in the room too long and the window was sufficient for night time. Sirens are to be expected and you soon get used to them! The reception was very helpful as was concierge also the doorman. The bar area was modern and comfortable, prices pretty average for NY, 2 wine, 2 Bacardi and coke, 2 cider and 1 mocktail, $98.00. We didn't eat here as plenty of eateries in Times Square. Be aware both sexes need to cover their hair if you wish to use the pool. Lifts worked fine whilst there. Coffee machine in the room is vessel whereby you fill the top back part with water (one cup full) place cup in the hole in the front, you can place a tea bag or coffee bag (yes coffee bag!) in the pull out holder above the cup area, press button and hey presto a drink! Only powder creamer so we took our own milk pots! You can pop dwn to the canteen and get some milk and extra cups.

Having been up since 3:00 a.m. and completely exhausted from travel, we were disappointed to find that, although pleasant enough, the front desk staff could not provide us with a room anywhere in the hotel. We went to get something to eat and then returned to the front desk to request a small refrigerator in our room, whenever it should become available. However, this time we had the good fortune to speak with Sandra at the IHG Platinum Elite desk.When I asked about the refrigerator, her immediate response was “Let’s get you in a room first, so your husband can get some rest”. Within less than one minute, she had handed us a set of room keys and called to have a refrigerator delivered to the room at no charge. Sandra then thanked us for being Platinum members and sent us off to our room. Within five minutes of entering the room, Sandra personally called to ensure that everything was to our liking. As soon as I hung up the phone, there was a knock on the door, which turned out to be the refrigerator with two complimentary bottles of water.Sandra is professional, thoughtful, and empowered. Rather than telling us what she couldn’t do for us (as her coworkers had), she utilized her resources to show us what she could do. Rarely have we encountered such courteous efficiency, in any hotel around the world. Someone with her customer service skills should be in management, but that would be a terrible loss to the hotel’s guests.

Spent two weeks here to fully explore New York. Service was good accommodation n was good for the high price but expected to pay a premium because of the hotels location. Ate out every day so cannot comment on the food offering. Try The Blue Fin Restaurant just down the block towards Broadway. Supeb

Visited this hotel with my family of 4 whilst travelling to various cities in the US and Canada. Location was excellent. Considering the size of the hotel and it’s location, the noise was minimal. The only bad point was that the front entrance was out of action. I would have thought that repair work and renovations would take place out of high season. They kindly offered us 2 free drinks from the bar during our stay and we were able to order complimentary water to our room.

Great location close to all the action. Very clean and comfortable. Fairly quiet for NYC. The bar staff was excellent and knowledgeable in all things New York. Overall good value for the location. Comparable to most Crown Plazas

The best experience. While it was expensive and packed during Christmas holiday they upgraded my room to top floor and the view was amazing. The location was perfect. Service was great, too. One staff by the elevator was very nice that he warned me about the phone hanging in my pocket I might have lost. I would definitely stay again.

I’ll admit this is kind of a weird review for me in that as Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Elite members, my family almost exclusively stays at Marriott properties. However, last night my son and I found ourselves in the lobby of the beautiful Crowne Plaza Times Sq Broadway hotel and needed a small favor. Front desk agent Freddy went out of his way to help us and I wanted to recognize him and the hotel, because I had disclosed I wasn’t a current guest at the property. In any case, thank you Freddy and the entire Crowne Plaza team for saving our Saturday in NYC. We will be staying at a Crowne Plaza in the near future thanks to outstanding customer service from people like Freddy!

I spent months researching every hotel in the immediate vicinity of Times Square and finally selected Crown Plaza and I am so glad I did! If you are looking for the best location on Times Square while being close to the theatres, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and 5th avenue and a good value, this is your choice! You are close to the subway stations can walk to many of the local sites. There's no need to stay at any of the more expensive hotels on Times Square as the crowds are far worse the closer you get to 45th-42nd. This one still has all the views with a little breathing room while you walk! Those on the side streets, while convenient, don't have a view at all since they are shorter building facing side streets. While the hotel does have a little wear, it's really trivial. Unless you are used to and expect extremely high end experiences only, you will find this one clean, well kept and perfect for your stay. They are doing a bit of construction on the front entry which means you enter on the sides, but that seriously doesn't matter. We had a bit of a snafu with our Booking.com reservation, but Crown Plaza took care of everything. Big shout out to Val who contacted me while I was en route and reassured me all was still booked and we'd be taken care of and to Donald at the front desk who was super friendly, helpful and really a great representative of their hotel! In the end, they honored our rate and gave us some complimentary food vouchers which was a huge help and got us to eat at their hotel each day. Their restaurant, Brassiere 49, has a great view, good food and is the perfect place to sit and take a break during the day or a the end of the day.If I had anything I would suggest they work on it would be 1) The older gentlemen staff at Grind was NOT friendly, bordering rude and made me dread getting my morning coffee. 2) When booking large kids groups, keep them in their own part of the hotel. We had a room next to a kids group where clearly there were no chaperones as the kids were running around wild for hours in the evening and super obnoxious. I had to call the front desk one of the nights and they sent security up...who handled it quickly. But still, young teens should not be left to roam these hotels so freely and obnoxiously. This could have happened anywhere, I just think the hotel should book them away from their other guests.

We got dinner at the restaurant hotel and it was absolutely wonderful! We had a wonderful server--Rahi-- who went above and beyond. There was a birthday in the family and he tended to that as well, making it extremely special for our family. If you happen to eat here, make sure to ask for him; he exemplifies incredible customer service.

I stayed here for two nights while I did some sightseeing and a conference. I’ve stayed at other New York hotels and this one is definitely the best. So clean, so friendly, and so convenient. I was traveling by myself but there were a lot of children and families. I would definitely bring the whole family here. The price might look more, But it’s actually a value for the quality and service you get.
user_name:
msmge
New York City, New York

review_body: Poor hotel! Stayed here many years ago and was impressed, so I decided to return with my children. What a mistake! The Receptionist was rude upon arrival and appeared annoyed I asked what was included in the resort fee, which is added onto the room cost upon arrival. Apparently, it entitles us to WiFi and two free drinks for the duration of our stay. There are four of us travelling! Two free drinks on a four night trip? Would I only get half a drink if we’d stayed one night?!The rooms are run down and outdated. We’re currently sat waiting for somebody to deal with a blocked bath at 11pm when I was told they’d be with me straight away at 10pm. I think the fact they’re so busy dealing with problems shows how dilapidated the hotel is. Save yourself and go elsewhere...!

Stayed for 5 nights - room only. Great location, nice big rooms would definitely stay again. Plenty of restaurants at your doorstep with reasonable priced food and drink and a walk away from shopping and theatres.

Whilst drinking in the bar one evening, we got talking to Rahl, mentioned it was mine and my grandmothers birthday present to come New York, he quickly organised a massive slice of chocolate cake to be bought to the table free of charge. Friendly staff and great location for all things to do in New York. Allison on the concierge was great, helped us a lot!!

I took my daughter down to NYC for a one-night stay at the hotel so she could see Wicked for the first time. After mentioning that it was an early birthday present for her to the front desk check-in clerk, Rosa, she asked us whether my daughter liked chocolate, and had me write her name on our check-in paperwork. While it felt like she was making small talk about visiting the Hershey's Store or M&M Store (which are nearby), we said yes, and then completed the check in. Later that night, after we returned from the store, we entered our room and saw that Rosa had sent up a slice of chocolate cake and two sodas, along with a very nice note wishing her a happy birthday. This amazing customer service made us feel very special, and we enjoyed our stay even more. Thank you, Rosa, for making my daughter's birthday trip even more special!!!

The Crown Plaza was a great place to stay on Times Square. We had 2 rooms and both were very nice. One looked at the Hudson River and the other viewed Times Square. We saw three Broadway shows with each an easy walk from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.

The beds very comfortable and location is brilliant. Very disappointed with our view from our room we were looking onto another tower block....the room didn’t have a fridge or mini bar.. resort fee we thought was $20 per night per room but it was per person per night so we had to pay over $320 for 4 night stay. All the staff were friendly and helpful except the guy we checked out with, not even a good morning from him. Overall the hotel is in a good spot with easy excess to great places but wouldn’t return. We’ve stayed in the empire, the Sheraton and Belvedere on previous visits which is just round the corner and it wasn’t as expensive and had great views from our room.

The hotel is located right at the Times Square, a perfect location in the middle of Manhattan. Rooms well maintained, bed comfortable. Quite busy hotel, the lobby bar, the front desk and especially the elevators can be crowded at times. The staff is excellent, their attitude is great and they are very helpful – be it at the front desk, in the bar, or at breakfast. In particular, Sandra Esp. at the front desk was amazing, she helped me a lot with my complicated booking and billing requests. Thank you, Sandra!

Had a great time here! The hotel was connected to a studio I was visiting and it was very convenient and cool. our front desk associate Donald, was very nice and accommodating he also had a super nice tie 10/10

The service at this hotel is awful and the manager is shifty and charged me more than my guaranteed rate I am filing a complaint with the Attorney General's Office for Consumer Affairs, Check your bill or better yet, book a well managed and trustworthy hotel elsewhere.Buyer beware!
user_name:
piefighter
New York City, New York

review_body: My daughter and I just completed a 3 night stay at this property and the location was perfect! We saw 3 shows and loved the convenience of being so close to all the theaters. We had a King room and for NY, the room size was nice. We ate at the Bar 49 restaurant one evening before a show, the waiter was good, but had too many tables, it took forever to get our check paid and we were almost late for a show. Also, we had the spinach and artichoke dip, which was very good, however you get a generous serving of dip but only 5 small slices of baguette...we had to ask for more bread, they brought 3 more slices, there was a lot of dip left over...what a waste!

When I made the reservation I was told 2,276.00 Arbitrately the hotel withhold 300.00 The bill says 2927.00 I I will never stay in one of the hotels. Poor customer service. The only nice people are in the buffet.

The customer excellence from Evelyn at the front desk was just outstanding She helped to make our vacation amazing and the hotel itself is in the perfect location. Highly recommended and we will definitely look to return.

Rosa at the front desk really made us feel welcome. This was great as I had called the hotel 2 days prior to my arrival and was given all sorts of incorrect information.I did find the rooms to be over priced and I used a discount that was available to me. The room seemed a little worn. The food and drinks were great. The location was perfect. I would most likely stay here again.

This hotel is in an EXCELLENT LOCATION right in the middle of everything. Arrived late and was able to jump into vacation mode Juniors is right across the street and is a MUST!!!! Beds were very comfortable and room was very clean. I would definitely stay here again!!!!

We had a great experience checking and each night the room was clean and ready to start over. Great location. The food prices reasonable but window seats limited. During the loss of power we were still able to get to our rooms. Over all, great experience. I would say don’t book shows from here there are better ways and less expensive. the picture was taken at the corner from the hotel.

I've spend the last two weeks in this hotel and as I'll be returning to the area 2 more weeks next month, my reservation is happily made. From check in to out it has been a joy to stay here. Beds are the most comfortable around. Rooms are less claustrophobic than others in the area. Very quick walk to surrounding areas with plenty of options for everything. Do stop by and see Travis Sherrod in the Restaurant in the mornings. He is quick with a coffee pot, smile and pleasant quip as well. Really made my mornings.

Visiting Crown Plaza for the first time - however definitely not the first time in NYC.Arrival: despite arrival at 6 PM, room was not ready. Took a while - and only after a talk with the manager, a room was magically found.Rom: Nice, clean and large for NYC. Black-out: The July black-out of NYC happend while we were there - and the staff handled it like a charm. Water available at reception, one elevator servicing some fælles working, and we could actually get into our rooms. Breakfast: The in-house cafe is good - with an okay selection of Pastries. Avoid the breakfast buffet! Even with a discount from 140 USD (4 adults) to around 70 USD is extremely overpriced. Quality of food was really not amazing, bagels not fresh (they were way better in the cafe!), and fruit without much taste. Not worth the money!All in all an okay stay - but there are plenty of “okay stays” in Manhattan with a better mix between overall price and quality.

We love this hotel. The service is great--housekeeping is first class. Front desk staff is welcoming. Location is great for those of us attending theater.A word about the toiletries. LOVE LOVE LOVE BEEKMAN 1802 products. Because I have sampled them here, I have bought shampoo, lotion, shower gel

Overall I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms were clean, the elevator was super fast, the check-in / check-put process was smooth, they gave to free drinks at the bar, there is a cafe on site, the location cannot be beat. You are in the heart of the theater district. Walking distance to every touristy place in NYC. Since everything in NYC is so expensive it was nice not to have to pay for a taxi. The one con is the parking situation. When we arrived it was backed up and we had to wait 20 minutes for a valet to be available. Also it took 20 minutes for them to get our car when we were leaving. The biggest issue is the price per night for parking...$70!!! I know that is standard for parking in NYC but it really hurts.

My wife and I came In on June 30th. My family and I have been coming to this hotel for close to 15 years. This means we have made some great friends at the bar haha! Not only did we make friends with other guests but with the staff. Karim is one of the managers who is super friendly and a snappy dresser. He always treats us so well and always makes us laugh. Behind the bar Jason, Phil and Martin make amazing drinks while making us spit them out because we are laughing so hard. If you sit at a table Tony is the man to see, great service and very fun. The hotel itself has amazing views of the greatest city in the world! It is very clean and modern. We will continue to return and excited to make new friends!

Perfect location for a week or weekend in New York. Wonderful helpful staff. Front Desk efficient and friendly. Special mention of Victoria and Sandra . Both were very helpful. Morning buffet was great. Our waiter Ali started our day with great friendly service. Looking forward to my return.

We stayed here for 5 days in July. Location - Cannot get better than this! so central. 50th St subway station close by for getting around. Room - Spacious and clean, huge bed and lovely bathroom - though no bath. We didn't eat here so can't comment, although as it was my birthday they did leave a huge slice of cake and bottle of prosecco in the room and the cake was delicious! We also received 2 bar tokens on arrival and instead of having to sit down at the bar, the barman offered for us to take them back to our room which we were delighted with. Resort fee - We were prepared for this when we arrived - so no biggie. Please read the small print before you book. $40.16 per day that you are there. Swimming pool - On a hot day we decided to come back to the hotel and use the swimming pool we had paid for. You must have your own padlock for the lockers. Quite strict, lane swimming and had to wear a shower cap. The swimming pool needs some TLC. Not great. Considering we paid $40.16 a day for it on arrival. Would definitely stay here again!

Location near Time Square was very convenient and was well within walking distance of many Broadway theaters. Also, plenty of restaurants and shops to choose from. Food Emporium on 49th St. just down the block was excellent.酒店位置佳，出门就是第五大道，几步就到时代广场.无电冰箱、无送两瓶免费矿泉水。check in 前台人员态度冰冷，但checkout时另一前台又很热情。

When we checked in at the first day,Donald helped us a lot.He was so kind and helpful.Besides Crowne Plaza had good location,nice service,good restaurant and bar.We had a wonderful time for staying at the Crowne Plaza.

The rooms are old and need a good clean. It’s a very busy hotel. The staff were very Helpful the location is good. The room was not what I would expect from a Crowne Plaza. We had dinner at the hotel every night, the meals were great and the staff work really hard to deliver great service.

Great location and staff at this Crowne Plaza. Tofael is great for service in the restaurant for breakfast. Evelyn and Sophi take good care of you at the front desk. Bar is wonderful after shows. Just wish they stayed open later.

For our first time in NYC, this was a great place to stay. It is a reasonable walking distance from everything we wanted to see and we loved having breakfast at the restaurant every day. The waiter was kind and the food was good (waiter Tofael). We would stay here again!

Right at the Time square. Good location. Good restaurants nearby. Responsive staff. At midnight,I asked for water, the staff readily gave water bottles. Was lucky to get river view room.Rooms are little but small , i thought. But neat and clean.

Good location, currently my family of 4 is staying here for 5 nights with the city view of Time square, Corner view. Guest assistance was so fast to accommodate our needs. The only thing they forget is I requested a special thing for my daughter for her birthday in our room ( a simple cupcake or baloon)when we get to our room but unfortunately nothing was done. The room was a good size and bed was very comfortable. The housekeeper today that clean our room 3102 was so kind to return my wallet that was left unattended. It was so nice of her/him. We we're also given a military discount.

Hotel was nice . Good location to Time Square, theaters and Some food places - We wanted to add another day to our reservation before coming . We called spoke with a couple different people - long story short - they booked us another 3 days and did not cancel the first one. So we have been talking to management every day- they keep reassuring we will not have to pay but no Refund yet - Also, the men at the Grind & co store in Crown Place are not very kind. Did not find that any staff was really friendly or helpful.

After a long drive from Florida, upon arrival we had an issue with valet parking, the manager on duty fixed that problem, and we were introduced to Evelyn to complete our check-in. Evelyn was very kind, which helped ease my frustration with valet, and made our check-in a very smooth process. We stay here often, and the service has always been good, but today with Evelyn, service was exceptional.

My husband and I travel 6 times a year, 3 internationally. Our experience with IHG has varied from excellent to disappointing. We rented two adjoining rooms with granddaughters on June 19, 20 and 21 at the Crown Plaza Times with points and cash. I had called and e-mailed at least two times to secure adjoining rooms with children. They assured me there would be no problem. The receptionist was short and rather curt indicating no quarantee of adjoining rooms although she did give it to us. Points cost 60,000 (a lot) per night, plus $23 property fee and $40 destination fee per room per night. That is equivalent to about $550 per night. The lights went on and off, faulty bulbs, in both rooms, the shower was either very hot or very cold, carpet was dingy. The room was a good size and the bed was very comfortable. No room refrigerator or make-up mirror. We will continue to make every attempt to stay at Hyatt (our favorite) and Hilton when possible after this experience.

We returned to this wonderful hotel & was greeted by Evelyn. She was very friendly & made us feel like VIP’s, thanking us for returning & being loyal customers to IHG. When we went to the bar we met Joseph, Alvaro & Marcos. We returned to the bar after dinner & Amanda was also tending bar. All four bartenders were great! They helped make our evening enjoyable!

I stayed at the CPTS with my two daughters from July 2-6th, 2019. From start to finish, this hotel gets 5 stars from us!! Check in was a breeze, and they had our room ready even though we arrived before noon. The check in staff were very friendly and answered all of my questions with a smile.Our room was clean and surprisingly spacious for NYC!! Our bathroom light stopped working on our first day and after notifying the front desk it was fixed within minutes.You are truly within steps to everything here, you cannot find a better location!! We ate a few times at the hotel and the food was delicious and the service was impeccable.Thank you Crowne Plaza for making my daughters first trip to NYC so memorable. 5 stars all the way!!

It is ideally located in the heart of the action! Walking distance to Manhattan's main attractions!!Busy staff who do not really care about you.It would have been nice if they provided a bit more room cleaning.Costly parking.

We stayed for 4 nights, having booked a package of a Cunard cruise and this hotel. Before we even travelled I had a bad expereince; as my wife is diabetic and needs a small fridge in a hotel room to store insulin, I e-mailed the hotel to ask if rooms already contained a fridge; they couldn't even be bothered to reply. On arrival at the hotel we had to wait an age for our room to be ready, when it finally was I phoned down requesting a small fridge; they promised to bring one ""in a few minutes"; it actually took nearly 3 hours! Then I discovered that the safe in the room didn't work; I followed the instructions faithfully but nothing doing; on phoning down for "service" I was told in a very condescending way that I must have swiped my card the wrong way round; when after yet another long wait - an hour and a half - someone came to our room to look at it, he spotted straight away that it was broken and sent me down to the reception to ask for a safe deposit box at that level - hugely inconvenient. On the second day they removed all the large towels from the bathroom, even though we had not placed them on the floor and were perfectly happy to re-use them; this took well over 2 hours to sort out. The restaurant - an absolute embarrassment given the charges. The evening menu is seriously limited, they showed no understanding or concern when I pointed out that my wife as a diabetic had to be extremely careful with food; some of the waiters were absolutely incompetent. Ask for a milky coffee and they fill the cup with coffee to the brim, leaving no space for milk; when I asked them to bring me a piece of cake together with my coffee so that I could enjoy them together, that proved to be too difficult. I despair. I am used to 4-star Swiss hotels, so I expect high standards, but given how expensive the Crowne Plaza is this should not be a problem. I wouid never return to this hotel even if I were given free accommodation - it is absolutely shambolic, a complete rip-off.

I booked the CPTS for my birthday again and was lucky to have Donald check me in! He’s always the caring professional and allocates my room preference - this time a wonderful corner room on a higher floor. It is greatly appreciated. After arriving in the room, Grant rang to make sure everything was okay and a Birthday amenity was delivered from Christine. This property has the location but these employees make the difference and make you want to return! Thank you again for an incredible stay and your hospitality and kindness!!

Very impressed quick check in nice polite staff and in an excellent location to get around and see everything. The only bad thing is the cleaner locked us out off our room on the morning off departure but this was quickly sorted out would stay here again

Top location and all staff are very professional and nice all the time. I am quite impressed by their service. I want to give them 5 star but I cannot due to that they charged double that comes $18k for 9 nights with two rooms. I found this strange charging issue while I stayed in Crowne Plaza Times Square, so I visited the counter to discuss about it and the gentleman spend several minutes to resolve the issue. He told me the charging issue has been resolved but actually it has not been resolved. Now, I get $18k charge on my credit card. WHY?I returned to my country and I found $18k is still there. So, what I am not happy is about the credit card payment issue that has killed my credit card usage due to double charge, $18k, and it has cause limit issue. Now I am unable to use credit card anymore due to limit issue even though I should have enough room to use credit card if Crowne Plaza Times Square did not charge twice. I received full payment on my card on both 2nd and 3rd July, and my check out was on 4th July. This must be caused by time difference between NZ and NYC. I need to pay some other important payments but unable to use my credit card anymore that made me very upset. I called Crowne Plaza as soon as I returned NZ but I was told I need to contact Billing department of Crowne Plaza Times Square; however, it was Friday night in NYC at the time due to time difference between New Zealand and NYC. Due to long holiday in USA and weekend in NZ, I cannot use my credit card for 3 days at least that has been causing major problems on me seriously.
user_name:
Jay K
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: My family and I came to the hotel for a two night stay and we were treated very nicely during check-in. The ladies at the front were very accommodating and friendly. (Wanda & Rita)After check in we were getting cleaned up to go to a show and ran out of hot water before everyone could shower. Considering the size of the hotel and the location and of course the amount of guests that this hotel would have I never thought that they would run out of hot water. Sadly I dismissed talking to anyone that night and since we were in a hurry I left it alone until the next evening when it was time to have a shower. This time there was absolutely no hot water and we were running out to another previously planned engagement. I called the front desk and told them how disappointed I was and that I would like the situation dealt with ASAP for the amount of money I paid for this hotel I expected some service. When we returned to our hotel room later that night, the message to maintenance was lost and nobody showed up to fix the problem, I immediately went down to the front desk and the lovely ladies there called the appropriate maintenance staff and sent him to the room. I went to talk to the front office manager John Acosta and he dismissed my complaint because he was busy doing other things. After the maintenance staff fixed the problem and was rude to my children I took the two drink certificates we received at check-in and decided to take my two daughters to the lounge for a non-alcoholic Shirley temple. When Micheal in the lounge was rude to us once again I decided to warn others about my experience. It surprised me how super friendly some of the staff were and how super disrespectful and rude the other half were. Our visit to New York City was awesome and it was amazing the whole time except for the bad experience at this hotel.I assume that every hotel has complaints and this hotel is no exception. Just 2 pieces of advice, make sure you have hot water and lock your valuables in the safe.

I stayed here for one night after arriving from London, access from the airport (JFK) is fairly straightforward on public transport and with the traffic in NYC I chose the subway as a fairly painless way to get to the heart of NYC.The hotel is currently undergoing renovation and the access is off a side street which isn’t that easy to spot, I appreciate there were lots of billboards on the temporary hoardings around the building which would have been easily visible from across the street but if you are on the same side of the street they are almost impossible to spot and eye level sighs would have been helpful!Once I found the entrance although busy the hotel was very calm and relaxing, a welcome change to the streets outside! Checking in was fast and efficient and the staff were very welcoming. My room was on one of the highest floors in the building with limited views of the Hudson River and some of the city. Perfectly acceptable for my needs as after a long flight I just wanted to sleep! I would suggest requesting a room that isn’t next to the lifts though as the noise which is almost constant 24hr a day was somewhat annoying but not enough for me to complain and I slept to I guess not that bad! The room itself was very nice, large very comfortable bed, nice furniture and gear en suite bathroom, I have added an image below. The room was very clean and had plenty of space for what I believe was just a standard double room. Breakfast was served overlooking Times Square and was a very good buffet with superb service from very friendly staff. It was also very good value for money! If you want to be in central NYC then you won’t go far wrong with this hotel, I would certainly stay again if visiting New York.

Tofael was great and made breakfast a pleasure! He was always willing to do anything he could to make our experience even better! The breakfast was great and we will come again. Thank you Tofael! You made it a better experience.

other than the odd hotel entrance via the parking garage the interior was clear, bright and nice. quiet rooms and so close to Time Square and all the places we were visiting. traveling with high school group of 37 people went seamless.

We stayed for 4 nights in Crowne plaza and were a family of 8. Our check in experience was not too good even though the reception was quite and all receptionist were by themselves. They were not welcoming at all and didn’t really provide any information of the hotel or it’s facilities the staff’s attitude is very unpleasant. We booked a strip view room and when we checked in our room had views of building garages with literally no view at all I contacted reception and the manager on duty advised there is no other room than what we had and if we are to change rooms it wouldn’t make much difference hence we decided to stay in the given room.The rooms are really old and tiny.The gym is pretty big with lots of machines but again very old the only good we liked about staying here was the location and nothing else really is appealing and if anyone’s looking to stay in Times Square there’s much better options with better price options.

Great location in Times square. Easy walking distance to many of the main attractions, bars and restaurants. Friendly bar staff, good service all round. Reasonable bar prices. I didn't eat here, so many restaurants of all varieties and prices close by. Very quiet room, good soundproofing and aircon. Good nightly rate given the location. Recommended!

I asked for a mini bar and they brought me with a medicine that another guest had left. I called the room service and complained to her and she said she was sending me a farm to clean my room. A guy came to me only with a bathing cap and told me he would take it over. What he saw to his manager ... I wait and we still see how long I will have to wait ..

My kids and I stayed at Crowne Plaza Time Square for a couple of days. The hotel was good until someone decided to help themselves to a package that was delivered there for me. I made several enquiries but I kept being transferred from one person to another. Eventually my issue was never resolved and I got tired of making the long distance calls to find out what happened.

Well we had six days at this hotel and it did not disappoint, in fact it was fantastic. We got a yellow cab from JFK which dropped us down in the parking lobby of the hotel. Bags taken care of and up we went to get our keys. Seen to straight away and allocated a Double room on 33rd floor best bit it was a corner room with a view down to Times Square and along 49th. Could not have asked for a better room. Bed comfortable. Serviced daily. Nothing but praise. Concierge arranged out transport on our return to JFK at 0400 in the morning.Thanks Crowne Plaza it was brilliant

I’ve stayed at a number of Crowne Plazas over the years and I remember them almost always being a good experience. And while the location truly can’t be beat for wanting to be in Times Square, this one feels stuck in a time warp. While the lobby feels very dark and dreary in stark contrast to the bright lights and excitement of Times Square, the real fail was the room. Paint chipping around the windows; every piece of furniture gashed, chipped, scratched, and worn; bathtub glaze severely chipped (I felt like showering in my flip flops); tub took forever to drain and shower difficult to fully turn off; and the ceiling showed the scars of every piece of patchwork and repair that had been done over the years. Another minor, yet telling, sign of the age of this hotel is that the desk in the rooms do have power supply but not straight USB ports...a true sign the hotel is dated.Oh, and the elevator call light button on our floor was out so you were never really sure if the elevator was coming to get you when you pushed it.C’mon Crowne Plaza! This should be a showcase property for you and it’s sorry and depressing. Sink some money into the place and show some pride. I expect more from your brand.

The location was prefect and our room was adequate. Our shower did not drain very well, had to stand in water entire time. Other than that it’s a basic hotel with several restaurants in the hotel. It’s about a 25 min walk to Penn Station and 15 min walk to Central Park.

If you want to stay close to Times Square this is a pretty good choice. We reserved a King bed city view in mid-June 2019 and was given a corner room at the top floor (46th floor - Northeast corner). This corner room gives you nearly a wraparound view of the city. In other words, the windows wrap from the north side continuing to the east side of the room. This was pretty nice for staring out into the city from up high. Noise was about what you'd expect in the middle of Times Square. Even from the 46th floor you can hear sirens and car horns. If you're a light sleeper, might I suggest not staying in Times Square, maybe consider not even staying in Manhattan. It didn't bother us much at all, what was annoying was the bright blue Barclays building sign at night. Luckily the room has curtains to block out most of the outside lights. Other than that, for the most part everything was in order. The bathroom is a bit on the smaller side than I'm used to and the closet basically shares that space as well. Plenty of room for 2 people. For the price you pay a simple continental breakfast would've been nice. We did not get to try their restaurant/bar. (Why bother when you're in Times Square?) Elevators were pretty quick most of the time. Not much waiting or stops except for the mornings. Subways are 1-2 blocks away depending on the station. One small gripe, if any staff from the hotel reads this, might I suggest reversing the toilet paper holder. It's mounted in such a way that when you pull the toilet paper out the whole roll starts to come off the holder. If the holder were installed in reverse, that would solve the problem.

This is a great hotel because of location and room quality is great for the price. There are a few things that very much annoyed me enough to write about it. So here is my story. I reserved my room on the 27th of this month and due to issues with my flight I got to this hotel around 2 or 3am the next morning. When I made it to the front desk to checkin I realized I forgot my wallet in the shuttle that dropped me off and ontop of that my phone was dead. The front desk agent was very nice and told me where I could charge my phone to call the shuttle service to get my wallet back. She saw that I was an IHG member and knew I had a reservation but I still needed my credit card and my ID. While waiting for the shuttle service to come back i wanted to let her know that i would have my wallet in 30 to 40 minutes and to thank her for her help. Unfortunately she was not there but her supervisor was. I decided to let him know about my situation since the woman u was speaking with earlier was gone. I was also going to see if a picture of my ID and credit card would be enough to get me in my room until the shuttle driver arrived with. Y wallet. While e playing my situtation to the Supervisor he got a very nasty attitude with me and very rudely cut me off while I was talking and told me to wait down stairs next to the bellman. Then he just ignored me and went about his business. I wanted to get his name but he had his name tag covered by a jacket. At that point I decided not to make a big deal out of his attitude and continued to wait for the shuttle driver. I had gotten. My wallet about 30 minutes later and went to checkin. The same Supervisor's attitude was very short and impolite. I felt like he thought I was below him or I did not deserve to stay at this resort. After he gave me my room key I proceeded to my assigned room and the keys did not work. I had to go back to the front desk which was over 30 floors down and get new keys. The same Supervisor was there and seemed shocked that the keys didn't work. So for some reason he told security to check the room and he also called the room to see if anyone was in there. That seemed strange to me because any other hotel or resort I have stayed in would just give me a new key. That is how i knew that he already knew something was wrong and was trying to hide it. After he called the room he said someone picked up and had to assign me a new room. He did not even apologize to me for the mistake. After I got the key to the new room I proceeded to it and when I got in there was cloths and bags all over the place (picture is attached to this post). I went back to the front desk which now was over 20 floors down. The same Supervisor was there again and i told him and showed him the picture I took and now he was shocked. He called out the person assigning the rooms to take care if it and offered me a free breakfast voucher. The person assigning the rooms came out and was very nice. He apologized to me and told me that the day was a little hectic and that he would take care of thg e problem. The Front Desk Supervisor seemed to catch an atti5with him as well eventhough he was doing his best to fix the problem. While the room assignment person was off making sure a room he found was clean and empty, the Front Desk Supervisor handed me 3 more breakfast vouchers and finally apologized to me. The room assignment person came back and told me every5was good now but the room type I had reserved was not available. I overlooked that and told him it was ok since I saw how hard he looked for a room for me. He then offered me dinner for the inconvenience and I accepted. AS I WAS WALKING AWAY THE FRONT DESK SUPERVISOR TOLD THE ROOM ASSIGNMENT PERON HE JUST GAVE ME BREAKFAST VOUCHERS AND WHY DID HE GIVE ME A COMPED DINNER? Very nasty and rudely to the room assignment person. I could also tell he had made a few more comments but could not hear everything because I was walking away. Bottomline, the Front Desk Supervisor working overnight from June 27th to the 28th had a very nasty attitude and made me feel uncomfortable about staying there. The room assignment person was awesome and had a fantastic attitude when under pressure and dealing with the negative attitude of the Front Desk Supervisor. The rest if the hotel staff was great.

Paid an arm and leg per night ($350-450) for a room then was hit with $35 service fee which was told could be waved but they didn’t. Front desk wasn’t willing to help either. They really do like their “fees”- service fee tax, city occupancy tax, occupancy tax, Javis Center fee which I never saw and don’t know what it is. Just not worth the money and charges. Due to dust mites and mold my allergies flared up probably cause of the super old rigs in the room so I can’t get out of here soon enough. I’ll stay elsewhere for my next visit which I expect to be very soon. I will say concierge was super helpful and hotel food and food service were great! Might stop in to eat but otherwise can’t wait to leave.

We booked two double beds for our stay however upon arrival they did not have a room available and so they upgraded us to a room with a king size bed and a sofa bed for the kids with views of Times Square as well as free breakfast which was greatly appreciated. The location is central to everything however we did have trouble getting to sleep so I would recommend ear plugs.

The hotel is a block off Broadway where we saw Wicked. The next day, the concierge, Corinne, helped us to know what we should see in Manhattan and steered us away from an expensive ridesharing service to the MET advising us Manhattan is one of the only places where taxi is a better choice.

Stayed in this hotel for five days and four nights during a recent trip to New York. The best thing about this hotel is the location - it's right at the heart of Times Square where all the action is.The room was clean, modern, and actually spacious by New York standards. There were plenty of sockets and USB ports for us to plug in our devices, and WiFi was pretty good. Our rooms were cleaned daily and toiletries were regularly restocked. However, the room did not have a minibar or even a refrigerator, which is odd for a hotel at this price range. The hotel's facade along Broadway was being renovated, so there was a bit of a confusion locating the hotel entrance when we first arrived. Although there was a sign directing people where to go, it was too small to easily notice. Also, given the hotel's location and popularity among large groups (like student tour groups and large families), the elevators can get a bit busy at times.Overall, this is a very good hotel and highly recommended!

New York is one of the cities I love to visit. I decided to stay in the Crowne Plaza this time to see how things are here. Let’s start off by saying excellent excellent customer service by the receptionist Sandra. I travel a lot for work and stayed in a lot of hotels across the US but never had such service like I did today with Sandra.she made my daughters day and my day and all I can say is thank you and hopefully management will notice this and do something special for her. The hotel is conveniently located to Times Square and restaurants. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Stayed here for one night as my friend and I were having a girls night out in the city. We had actually booked a cheaper hotel but on arrival could not stay there as it was so dirty! We then booked the Crowne Plaza online at the last minute. It was such a relief to find our room was clean, comfortable and well maintained! The hotel has a fantastic location, right on Times Square. Despite this, we didn’t find it noisy and got a good nights sleep. The only reason I have given 4 stars instead of 5 is because there was no bottled water in the room. Unusual for a quality hotel.All in all, would thoroughly recommend! And if you’re swithering between this and a cheaper hotel, don’t! You get what you pay for in Manhattan and this hotel is definitely worth the price.

Rahi not only offered great bartending services, but he also gave us useful information, helped us get the most out of our vacation, and booked us a reservation close to the venue of our evening activities

Rahi is a waiter at the bar and lounge in this hotel. he gave us very useful information for restaurants to visit and sights to see! he was a friendly face to see after long days of touring the city! he even called a restaurant and made a reservation for us at an amazing french restaurant!

Rahi served us in the lounge every night we stayed at the hotel. He was very friendly and suggested what to do on our trip. Rahi was very helpful and even made us a dinner reservation for one night of our trip!

The Crowne Plaza was an ideal location. We walked to so many things. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and CLEAN! Some of the staff were less than friendly but our overall visit was fantastic. The breakfast buffet was average. The lounge/bar area was nice.

As a platinum ihg member I expect decent treatment and usually receive it. Good points. Just off broadway and decent sized room (elite level). Breakfast is good.Poor pointsSome reception staff are brusque and come across as if they don’t care. My room was missing a comfortable chair, it should have had a chaise long in it. Nothing but a plastic desk chair. I asked receptionist. A plastic chair on wheels was delivered. I tried again but was told they were refurbishing so there wasn’t a chair available. $300 per night and nothing comfortable to sit on. Had to go direct to ihg to get it sorted. 3 out of 5 days with no chair. Not good enough! Perhaps if the beds were being refurbished they’d expect me to sleep on the floor or a camp bed. Very very expensive but I guess that’s nyc. And tips expected rather than earned.The place is being refurbished so the only way in is through the car park around the side. Wouldn’t stay there again because of the reception staff. Perhaps it’s just nyc in general.

The check in was quick. This was important after a very busy day. The room was clean and comfortable. The location of the hotel is near everything, dining, shopping and the downtown area. There is a mall right next to the hotel. The parking lot can be accessed without difficulty in inclement weather, which was the case during my stay. I would stay again when in the area.

Time Square is crowded and it is a spectacle for tourist but the Crowne Plaza was a great place to come back to earth and feel comfortable. The room was comfortable a great view of all the excitement and the beds were also pleasant.Id like to give props to the security staff as I departed Sunday, I realized I lost my job phone and had no idea where it was. It was turned in and the security staff has been very helpful in getting it back to me. I live in Upper Marlboro Maryland. Albert Valdes of the security staff has been my contact and very helpful. This along with the amenities and food at the hotel made this Crowne Plaza, a place I would like to visit again.

When was checking out of the hotel sandra esp of the hotel she was excellent agent very kind and helpful, I enjoyed in the hotel thank you all and have a great day , Ahmed from saudi arabia nice to meet you .
user_name:
D8858JUahmedh
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a room for four of us on the 33rd floor overlooking the Hudson River. No noise, we all slept very well following our busy days in NYC.Good sized room with 2 comfortable double beds, lovely clean fresh bedding.Room furniture was dated but didn’t bother us.Bathroom was clean with a bath/shower which worked really well.Fresh towels provided daily.Some bottled water in the room would have been a welcome touch and some biscuits to go with the coffee!Reception staff were very professional but didn’t feel that personal, had to ask where to find the swimming pool/gym.Didn’t eat in the hotel restaurant. Great location for exploring the city of New York and enjoy all the local restaurants! Be prepared to walk loads.....

Had a bit of trouble parking but after that it was great! Enter through the parking garage drop off. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was nice, stayed in a king on 36th floor. Noise wasn’t bad. Concierge was also helpful getting show tickets. Ate at the bar and had good service one night and bad the next. Overall great experience and enjoyed the location.

Very comfortable room with a great central location in Times Square The bed almost made you not want to get up and everything was clean and spotlessBreakfast buffet was good and staff were always happy to help

This is probably our 3rd stay at this property, this time using our points for a single night stay. Location is incredibly convenient for tourists - which we are not, but we still find it best because we go off in all sorts of directions using this as the center. Rooms are very generously sized (for NYC where they're typically teeny) and the windows isolate sound well. The bar is very handy to meet or for a quick something but the service is pretty lacking. We had to ask several times for something because our server wouldn't come back, so I asked the bartender who said "I'll tell your server" rather than just getting the water herself. Then the server never came -- she wasn't slammed, it was just lackluster service. Prices are typical for NYC.Check in was surprisingly slow (not the line, the actual check in) but the desk agent was really nice and helpful. Have never eaten in the main restaurant and with all the choices nearby, I can't imagine choosing to do that. Luggage hold is very well served too.We'll stay again especially if the points value from IHG makes it worthwhile.

Our family stayed here when visiting NYC. A very pleasant stay and so close to everything. We walked everywhere because it was close to all we wanted to do. Staff was nice and friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable. Price was high due to graduation week so we only stayed for 2 nights.

We stayed in a corner room on 41st floor and rarely heard any noise from others in hotel. Outside street noise was minimal. I asked for a couple of things regarding housekeeping and was supplied with them very quickly. - Water from faucet in bath is great. Tastes good and I drank it.- Mocha from Cafe by elevators was not. I’ve had better from circle k. - sports club is nice; I swam once while there. It is a lap pool - not an indoor play for kids pool- location is near multiple subway stations and theaters- they will kindly hold your luggage before checkin if you arrive early - the elevator doors close quickly; be forewarned :)

Spent 6 nights at the CP just off Times Square. Great location. Easy access to all areas. Decent rooms. Very busy place but efficient. Rooms are fine. Can recommend. Didn’t do the breakfast as plenty of options in the local.

Location is the USP of this place! Located right on Times square overlooking the M&M's world and walking distance into the best shopping and most happening places of downtown NYC, it is also near to most of the Broadway theatres, so one can do the late night shows without having to worry much about commute and others. The Central terminus is also within 100 metres. The rooms are decent, amenities useful and adequate, breakfast spread very satisfying. The breakfast location is wonderful overlooking the times square and its neons! You cannot ask for more in that budget in NYC. My stay was quite comfortable.

My wife and I stay at this hotel several times a year and have recently returned from our latest visit. The hotel was VERY busy but the service did not suffer. Of course the location is still perfect for sightseeing, theater and shopping. Special mention must given to the front deck personnel. We had a small issue that was quickly resolved by Evelyn and as usual Hajar took care of all of our needs.

I was there for a business trip. Location is awesome right in the thick of the manhattan. Rooms are comfortable and decently sized. Breakfast served at the brasserie is a bit expensive but the spread is decent. Overall service is excellent at the hotel. Would definitely recommend

My husband bought me tickets for a Broadway show for my birthday so The Crowne was the perfect spot for all of the planned events! It was easy to get to Penn Station, the Empire State Building, and Central Park! The hotel was clean and everything was well kept! We had a great city view and a comfortable bed!

Would have received 5 stars if the service in the bar had been even satisfactory. Great location and considering the huge scale of the place it is well run with friendly and welcoming staff. However, we visited the bar three times after long days out. First night on arrival was perfect. Fast regular service by a friendly and super efficient waitress. Second visit we were served quite quickly but then ignored despite frantic waving. Decided not to wait for a second drink despite 20 minute wait. Another couple just gave up and left without ordering! Third time waited 20 minutes to order and then another 20 minutes to get the check. Didn’t bother going again. Shame because it’s a nice space. The hotel is missing out in revenue due to not having enough staff. Bad economy!

Hotel is in Time Square on Broadway. Perfect location for sightseeing and seeing Broadway Shows. Hop on Hop off bus picks up right in front of hotel. Great customer service. Clean and comfortable rooms.

Yes, I do enjoy it everytime. The higher floor rooms with corner locations, that is what they put me in every time. The view, see my pics, breathtaking and no match. The rooms may be old but very clean. The spirit is Manhattan. And last but not the least, starting with the nite shift front desk mgr, the whole staff is nice and friendly. They do their best to take care of you. I am a regular every year. It is very NYC:)

Very disappointed on arrival. For such a prominent hotel, the room looked like it hadn't been decorated in over 20 years! Furniture all scrapped and dirty cupboard. The carpet was disgusting!! Dirty tissue on bedside table on arrival. Temperamental shower had no pressure. Up side. Bed was OK. Towels and sheets were clean. Bell hops very helpful and friendly. However reception staff could use more training, especially concierge on people skills. Was a shame as a great location but I think for what people pay the hotel needs to seriously up their game. Unless their aim is to overcharge and under deliver!!

The service at this hotel is impeccable! Every single employee I came into contact with exhibited genuine care and consistent great hospitality! Traveling alone, I wasn’t interested in checking out the local food unless the hotel food wasn’t up to par. I NEVER once ate a meal outside of this hotel! The fool was incredible!!! My server, Tofael went above and beyond. Offering to take a group picture of one of his tables. Cleaning other tables when not busy serving. What a blessing he is to CPTS I’m sure!
user_name:
marciasmiles
New York City, New York

review_body: What wonderful service we got from the time we got here. Donald Mei was so accommodating at the front desk and made us feel welcomed from the start. Kim at the bar was also incredible!!! She went out of her way for us. What a wonderful trip. The service from Donald and Kim makes us want to come back again and again.

I spent two nights with family in May at this hotel. The location is wonderful you can walk to everywhere and the subway is close by. The room was clean and felt updated. The beds were comfy. I did not use the lounge or other amenities while there so I cannot comment on them. I would recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Plastic plates for room service dinner i paid over 100 for dinner served on plastic with plastic silver wear.i couldn’t believe a high end hotel would dare do this. This is my last stay with this chain.

The lobby and other public spaces of this hotel are dated, shabby and need an overhaul. There is construction on the outside of the hotel, so maybe that is in the works. There is really no lobby, just a lounge, so nowhere really to sit while waiting for others. The main entrance is through the car drive-through. Some of the front desk staff were brusk, while others were very nice. The room was clean, good size and pretty nice, with a comfortable bed and linens. When we entered the room, the maid had not removed 2 opened bottles of water that the previous guest had used.

We arrived from Delhi after a 20hrs.Flight, Immigration and New York traffic at the Hotel, which is located bang in the heart of the famous Time Square. they have a nice private Porch for pick up & drop off in this, busy district. Rude shock starts now, nobody 'welcomes' you, Here, and the guy manning the entrance doesn't bother to explain, that the front desk is two levels up, nor does he offer any help for it, when he saw us with three big Suitcases ( not Business Travellers). After figuring out the whole thing one reaches front desk. Here Mr. Gerry informs me wrongly that we have a room on triple Sharing but the Breakfast is Only for Two. For this I again have to request him to confirm from his office, which he reluctantly does, but doesn't admit that it was a mistake on their part. We found it was an average room, with just manageable facilities. Back home I would not pay so much for "such" an average accommodation & rude treatment. Is this the Price one pays for staying at Time Square.  Final assault was at Check Out, they charged me $40:00, per day,(Total $200:00) extra as Service Charge for (non Existing service ) which they never informed me at Check In, nor was I told if these charges were mandatory or optional.

We recently stayed for over two weeks just this May til June. Our family was there in New York on holiday. Initially skeptical about it because of the location but have learned being at the center of everything is better. It’s the best location for tourists who want to go to the theater. You will never be late for a show! Also ubers and cabs were available everywhere, not counting the nearby subway stations. But so many places like Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and Grand Central Station are within walking distance. Everything in the area is open til late so if you need last minute shopping or just convenience store supplies this is the area to be in. The hotel does tend to get busy on weekends so lines for breakfast could get long but then the service fairly fast enough that you get a table fast enough. Breakfast is a buffet and they do change it up every few days.Sandra at the front desk was very helpful especially since we checked in at about 2 am. Rooms are large and comfortable, some furniture is a bit worn down but clean. I liked that the TV is new and they have enough charging ports for devices. Bathrooms are modern enough and clean. Our only issues were with the airconditioning and the hairdryer but they did help us sort it out. The hotel is under construction but did not inconvenience.The bar/Lounge at the lobby is a decent place to have a midnight snack. Fast service and good food.Price as compared with other hotels in the area is competitive and for the time we booked, was in fact cheaper considering we booked quite late.All in all i would recommend it for anyone wanting a convenient stay in New York City!

Room was full size, not tiny like some NY hotels. It was nicely furnished, with comfortable beds and it was very clean. The view from the 30th floor was nice, and we were within easy walking distance of many restaurants, subway stops and the Jumbotrons of Times Square. Freddy checked us in and he was delightful! He provided several breakfast vouchers and restaurant vouchers for bar or evening dining. I was traveling with two kids under the age of 10 and appreciated the lower prices for kids meals. All in all, I’ll go back again.

The Crowne Plaza is right in the heart of Time Square. First of all - it is a first class hotel and offers everything you could ever want. Then, just getting to walk out the door to see the lights of Time Square or walk to a show just a block or two away. Priceless!

Stay Report - 5/31 - 6/2Location: Seemingly every hotel between 33rd and 51st, 10th Avenue to 6th Avenue claims to be "Times Square" so that's a meaningless term.  Specifically, this hotel is located on Broadway between 48th and 49th (the hotel takes up the whole block and has entrances on both 48th and 49th).  48th Street has an entrance to the 49th Street N/R/W Station, 49th has an entrance to the 50th Street 1 Station and a block away on 8th Avenue is the 50th Street C/E Station.  There are a number of theaters nearby and plenty of restaurants and the like.  LGA is about a $40 Uber away in no trafficHotel: The hotel itself is a massive high rise.  I was happy to find they have separated the elevator banks into serving the lower half and upper half of floors which means shorter waits than at other high rises.  The lobby is one floor up from the entrance and has a large restaurant which does a buffet breakfast, a coffee shop and a bar as well as a lot of meeting space another floor up.Check In: As a Spire Elite I was given a coupon for the buffet breakfast for just $16 instead of $40.  Room: Much, much larger than many Manhattan rooms I've stayed in.  While it was nothing all that special, having the space for me and my travel companion was really nice. The bathroom was also big enough and the shower got really, REALLY hot if you wanted it to.  Wifi worked well as well.I was just here for a Points and Cash Accelerate rate but I found myself pleasantly surprised.  I'd be happy to return.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan provided a solid hotel experience. Nice corner room, excellent bed, and conference facilities. Overall, the staff were nice but service was a bit mixed. A great location. Thanks for an excellent stay!

What a location. Our room was on the 44th floor so the view over Time Square was excellent. The location on Broadway/48th allowed for easy walking access to everything you might want to see and to the Broadway shows. The room was comfortable (though we were hardly in it) with an excellent mattress.

Jewellery was stolen from bedside table. Reported with no response. Went in to discuss with security and was told an investigation would take place. This did not happen. Followed up again - no response. Emailed head office - twice NO RESPONSE. Avoid this place. And the rooms smell putrid.

This is perfect if you want to be in Times Sq / Theatre land . We chose the hotel to specifically be near the theatre as we had splashed out on tickets for To Kill A Mockingbird ( excellent production by the way )Check- in was efficient and helpful . We were in room 3627- quiet , spacious and great views of buildings, yet with the Hudson in the distance . The concierge was really helpful in helping us identify getting from A to B.The bar area is surprisingly pleasant- lots of windows and a nice relaxed atmosphere . Staff are friendly (but not intrusive ,as can happen in the US sometimes - which , although well intentioned ,it can be mildly irritating to be asked repeatedly by complete strangers how your day has been so far !Normally we would avoid crowded touristy places like Times Sq but this hotel is a really good compromise .

Nice hotel, very busy and a bit faceless but nice rooms with very comfy beds. Great views from our room. Helpful staff but the best thing about this hotel is its position right at the heart of Times square.
I love NY ! Such a cool place so many things to do. The city never sleeps. Didn’t really get much sunlight though. Benihana‘s was really good had to wait an hour even when we made a reservation ‍♀️

Fabulous for a conference as hotel rooms are easily reached from meeting rooms, equally perfect for a visit to Times Square for out of towners. Food was great, much improved since last visit last year, I understand there is a new chef. The shower drain was sluggish, and engineering was sent up at the time I requested; this is such a rarity in hotels today, I was thrilled. I had an amazing view of the river from my corner room. Recommended.

This is my first time review for a hotel. The whole staff at the hotel was so helpful, polite and the best service. Rahi at the bar area was the nicest person in the hotel, I had a cold and he recommended an Indian tea "Bombay Chai" which helped me to recover. The best service ever! The location is excellent to stay at Manhattan for tourism. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy every minute at the big apple, you will not waist time in transportation, you can walk almost everywhere and if you want to take the subway there is an station just cross street.

The hotel was great in most every way. Wonderful staff and service, but the star of the show was our bell boy, Ming. He was soo cheerful and helpful. Took care of the luggage, got us water and then filled us full of tips and ad advice on the city that was invaluable!
