We’ve stayed here several times over the past several years and will continue to do so. Comfortable rooms. Friendly staff at front desk and breakfast buffet. Great breakfast buffet. Special thanks and compliments to the breakfast staff, especially Samantha, Tofael and Peel. Can’t say enough about their friendliness and service to guests!!!

The corner rooms are nice the others are pretty average on par with most 4 star hotels. The bedding is very comfortable but the windows are not soundproof so you do get some street noise (I was on the 16th floor). Just FYI the king rooms only have showers (no tub) so if that is important be sure to reserve a room with two doubles. The lobby area is small in comparison to other large resort hotels in the area. It is mostly made up of a bar area. There is a nice coffee/snack counter on the same level, with amazing pastries and lunch items. The real selling point to this hotel is it's smack in the the middle of time square location. Fantastic if you plan on taking in some broadway shows. It is also a easy walk to Rockefeller center (NBC, Top of the rock, Radio City etc.)

While the location of the hotel is great, the maintenance of the rooms and the response to the issues was poor. We booked 4 double rooms at a cost of more than $1600.00 per night. We could not use the bath tubs in two of the rooms as the porcelain was cracked or missing patches. One room had a leaking toilet, safes were missing or not working. I spoke to the front desk clerk who responded that the hotel is booked every night, so there is no opportunity to fix the rooms. I then spoke to a Manager who volunteered a complimentary drink for our issues. Our trip was fabulous and the only negative feedback was that we would choose a different hotel to stay the next time we traveled. Lots of choices for hotels, I would not recommend.

I stayed here for a quick overnight stay. Room was above average. It was pretty clean. Shower was great and service at the concierge desk was superb! We had a great corner room over looking Times Square. I would stay here again!

Fantastic staff in a perfect location. This is a hotel that knows it’s customer needs and basically responds through a staff that are never in your face but who always deliver at the right time. I could not recommend this hotel enough.

We booked this hotel via a package with BA Holidays and so resort fees etc were all included in the price. We chose this hotel because of its location and we were able to book a room overlooking TS. On our previous visits we have stayed just off 8th Avenue and TS but this was definitely a great choice, especially since I have mobility problems this hotel is right in the centre which for me was ideal and the room overlooking TS allows me to rest and at the same time have a view. We ate in the lounge a few times and the food was excellent although not a big menu the food on it satisfied both of us as vegetarians and our son who is a meat eater. This a busy hotel but we never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a lift. There is also a coffee shop selling good coffee and fresh bakery items, cheese plates, and hot breakfast sandwiches only 1 day was there a bit queue but they put extra staff on and we were quickly served - the corn muffins and almond croissants are delicious. Would I stay there again yes in the blink of an eye and we are certainly looking to book again
user_name:
Hodgee234
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Beware of the additional hidden fee, the resort fee $40/night. When you search this hotel it will show you a lower price, then at the very bottom small section you will see that the resort fee is $40/night. For us, who are staying 11 nights at this hotel. This is totally ridiculous. However, the managers are helpful. The manager is very helpful and great in providing solutions. The front desk is also a nice lady who is also very helpful in accommodating my needs. They also have a customer service to handle your matter quickly by phone. Basically, they have a great team here. If you want to use the pool a shower cap is needed, they don't sell it. but at the shop downstairs they sell it for $10. It is unfortunate that the hotel still practicing the hidden resort fee $40 charges/night. They have hidden charges for other things too. $7 for accepting a mail. $5 for using the computer for 5 minutes. It makes the hotels looks sneaky and tricky. Thus, I would not come back here again.

Our Texas Family Group had a wonderful visit to New York City staying at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. The location was perfect for getting all over the 5 boroughs via the MTA. Hotel service was excellent from check in to the room servicing staff. We were upgraded from an interior room to a corner room overlooking Times Square - what a view! We owe special thanks to Travis who was our Brasserie 1605 Breakfast host everyday. He rendered to us the most professional, attentive, and kind service. We felt like we had our own private concierge! The Texas Family Group

We moved here for our last night in New York.We had a great corner room on the 32nd Floor with views of Times Square.The room was spacious, very clean, well appointed and had the most comfortable of beds. However it’s worth noting that the bed was quite high and might not suit everyone.The room included a coffee machine, iron & ironing board and great blackout curtains (especially good given the light from Times Square). The room was well insulated from noise too.Although on the smaller size the bathroom had all that we needed but no bath but we didn’t want one.The only things the room could have benefited from was a long mirror for dressing in the bedroom / hallway and additional charging points.We would definitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again and can recommend it.

Despite a reservation mixup on our part, Michelle at the front desk solved our problem with humor and good cheer. After checking with the manager, our problem was solved. We were also helped by Imran at the front desk, who also guided the six of us smoothly through our registration. Also cannot say enough about Michael, who handled our luggage and helped us with transportation and answered a myriad of questions. The employees at concierge were also incredibly helpful. We would definitely go back. Perfect location!

Our stay was great everything was top notch, felt like it was 1st class. Michelle at check in was very helpful at getting us a early check in for me and wife. She gave us the 5 star service plus. Hotel is close to everything!

We travelled to NYC to celebrate a friend's special birthday so a central location with a brand name was selected, the Crowne Plaza Times Square.Upon arrival the check in was swift and efficient and my credit card taken as a guarantee with a holding amount that would be released at the time we checked out.The room we had wasn't overlooking Times Square which we were happy about as when we went to our friend's room (that did overlook the square) the outside noise was apparent. I don't think you'll need to worry too much about noise keeping you awake (unless you're a REALLY light sleeper) as I didn't struggle at all - the alarm woke me every morning!The room was as expected of a Crowne Plaza; decent size, large king size bed, clean bathroom, TV, in-room safe, coffee maker, hangers in the wardrobe, iron with ironing board and bathroom amenities. There wasn't anything wrong with the room however I wasn't wowed either. I think this is because it's older decor; warmer browns/creams in colour rather than the fashionable silver/greys. I would say that the hotel could benefit from some TLC throughout as rooms and public areas are beginning to show signs of wear and tear.The location is what sells this hotel - literally step outside the hotel and you're in the centre of Times Square, overlooking the M & M's store. The front entrance is currently undergoing refurbishment so all access is via the rear doors where the cars/taxis drop off customers.When we checked out the bill showed the resort fee as $5 more than we were expecting. I pointed this out to the reception staff who rectified the bill. Our friends were also incorrectly charged and hadn't noticed the difference until we mentioned it.The only source of disappointment was the amount of time it took for the funds to be released back to my card - almost 2 weeks. This I find unreasonable as well as unexpected.All in all I would recommend this hotel however you'll pay a premium due to it's location.

Stayed here last week for a night and paid for room in advanced. We get there they say it's a $40.00 resort fee. We had proof of what we paid and where it had nothing about resort fees. Spoke to manager Lyonnel about waiving fee and he wouldn't do it. Third party site offered a refund if he would make an exception and he wouldn't. Basically was forced to stay there or lose money. Hilton around the corner didn't have any resort fees where I really wanted to stay at. Won't EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. We didn't need free wifi, to use fitness center or two beers that they said the fee was for. Don't like paying resort fees, used to it in Vegas and they are up front with them. We would have chosen another hotel if site listed that.

We are IHG reward members from inception & using our points for reward stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is our perfect choice & use of our points. for shows. Excellent location on Broadway between 48th & 49th -walking distance to Broadway Shows/Restaurants & Shopping. Our room on the 30th floor w/well appointed furnishings,spacious by NYC standards,corner room,perfect city views. Front Desk managerJuliet C. Helped us plan our Anniversary stay. We stay every year.In house restaurants are excellent fr breakfast/lunch-brunch to afternoon cocktails/lite or small bites to evening cocktails dinner/ after dinnerdrinks or just Grab & Go Highly recommend.Alwsys look forward to our next stay

We stayed 5 nights, it was really excellent so without exaggeration I would recommend to everybody it will make the visit much worth it.You are able to see and feel outside activity from every position, and quick be part.

Stayed at this hotel. Great location in the city all the theaters were only a few blocks away. The hotel room is very clean and roomy. Very safe hotel security in hotel lobby. I would go back and recommend

Stayed two nights. Great corner room overlooking Times Square.Room spotless, huge bed all you could need in a modern hotel except milk for the coffee in the room.Staff very attentive and friendly. Special mention for Audra the concierge. I had a mix up with my booking for the shuttle bus to Newark. She stepped up to the plate and had it sorted in no time.I was booked to see Chicago on Broadway, to my surprise the theatre was directly across the road.If I am ever in NYC again that’s where I would be staying.

Thankful to Ana & personnel from restaurant and front desk for your good service, the breakfast is very complete and variety every day. I stayed three nights during spring break with my husband and 2 kids and the Hotel was very confortable and good location. I highly recommend the Crown Plaza Times Square.

We stayed here for 5 nights while we were in a family vacation. The staff are very friendly, especially Sandra Esp, who kindly assisted us with a smooth check in and check our process and made sure our stay was comfortable. We had a great time here at the Crowne Plaza Times Square!

Stayed four nights at The Crown Plaza Times Square.Final stay on a four week tour of the USA.From check in to leaving services shown by all staff from concierge to management were excellent.A special mention must be given to Karim Sharif [food and beverage outlet manager] and his staff Jason Robert and Mark in the bar and restaurant.Every evening on our return to the hotel after a busy and long day,s sightseeing we were welcomed and genuinely asked how our day was.Room was very clean and well appointed.Defineately will be returning to this hotel on our next visit to the Big Apple.Michael and Colette Belfast Northern Ireland

Great Hotel.comfy beds.friendly bar,lots of staff around who are helpful especially Rueben who was great with directions to places.Ideal location.will definitely be back in New York and will stay here again.

Booked 3 rooms with this hotel due to its location. But utterly disappointed with its dilapidated condition. The lobby has a greasy smell, the elevators are dated and move unsteadily. One room experienced a malfunctioning mattress on the 1st night, so had to change room the following morning. My room experienced a clogged water closet, busted light bulb and damaged bathtub drain stopper. Moreso, the window ledges were dusty.On the day we checked out, the bell captain on duty was quite wreckless in handling our luggages. He was literally throwing them into the trunk. Omg! Another bellboy looked on and quickly apologized to me for the incident. I would highly recommend to stay away from this one to rid yourself of the stress. And if you're after the location at Times Square, there are many other options.

We toured New York and time square was an amazing place to be and to see . Rode a double decker bus and it was so cool . I will be back for sure . Make sure you have time to see New York ... lots to see and do that cost little or nothing but don’t think it’s a cheap trip because it’s not ,but totally worth it ;

I have been an owner with IHG/HI properties for 25 years. I live in PA and try to get to NYC several times per year for both day trips and overnight visits. I love to stay at the Crowne Plaza because out of all of the IHG properties I stay at, Crowne Plaza treats me wonderfully and always offers the best experience-even well beyond where I own my timeshare property in Florida. I always have a perfect check in experience and they always thank me for being a platinum elite member. Earlier this month, I was in town for the day and decided to stop by Bar49 at CP for a glass of wine before a concert I was going to. I want to give a big shout out to my most amazing server TONY and to the manager KARIM for taking good care of me and being such wonderful hosts. This hotel is in the middle of Times Square, has comfortable and clean rooms with super comfy beds, an amazing breakfast buffet and they treat you extremely well. Highly recommended! Until next time Crowne Plaza!

This hotel was a disappointment from beginning to end. I've been visiting NYC for several months and have stayed at other hotels that are in the same area and are much better for the cost. The service desk was horrible, and they rape you for everything including a refrig in your room, parking, you name it. They grab you because the price seems relatively bette online but when you compare to others in the very SAME great location, this place is a rip. Hampton Inn, for example, is only a few blocks away, gives you free breakfast, and the concierge and people at the desk are so welcoming...here, they screwed up my check-in, never apologized, made me wait endlessly when in fact it was their error! What kind of a hotel does this, except for one that packs people in and doesn't care. By the way, only a lap pool.

Second time in this hotel having again an excellent 4 days stay in New York just a few steps from Times Square. Perfect location of the hotel, staying in a great and quiet room on floor 33. Excellent and friendly staff with a special attention given to us by Adeliz at the Front Office.

Wonderful experience, gorgeous views. Parking is ridiculously expensive but it’s expected in the city. We left on a Disney cruise out of Manhattan cruise terminal and it was a short drive right to the port. Nice stay of you want to see time square without worrying about the subway!

We arrived 8:30 AM and we were given early check in , that was much appreciated ! Front desk was really friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. My first trip to NYC and location of this Crowne Plaza was perfect . Theaters were just around the corner and lots of restaurants to choose from .

Great central hotel, staff friendly and helpful. Greeted by Evelyn on reception who made us feel very welcome. Had a meal in hotel one evening and whilst not a large selection, food was lovely and at a competitive price to on street. Had breakfast one morning with a complimentary voucher which was nice but I wouldn't want to pay $28 for it. In all cases staff were brilliant.Whilst the hotel was expensive, you have to realise that everything is in New York so overall was happy.

The hotel needs some renovations but it was ideal for what we wanted.I you want to be right in the middle of the broadway this is the right place.The only complaint is the breakfast is bloody expensive 130$ for 3 breakfasts.The rooms where clean, well stocked with towels, the coffee facilities in the room ain’t great but at least there is some bad coffee in the room.

Stayed here for 4 nights in April, had corner room 2601, full view of Times Square, but oh my god, insulation was none existant, you would think being on the 26th floor it may be a little quiter, but no, the people in Times Square could have been in our room it was that noisy. The beds so uncomfortable and so bloody small. We tried to use the restaurant and for some reason it was closed up, not quite sure why but we ended up having to go out for food, probably a lot cheaper than the hotel though. They had a luggage holding room, but when our cases were delivered to the room, my sons back pack which had been hooked onto one of the cases was missing, eventually found it but not the point.Sink was broken, we had to climb under the vanity unit to unplug it when we needed to use it, shower...would have had more of a result standing in the rain..... A/C incredibly noisy too.

I missed a connection in NY and this was the only hotel with early check in that day. Front desk personnel was really attentive on the phone and also in person. The restaurant food was really good and the place is good to rest. Recommended!

If you’re having any doubts about staying at Crowne Plaza Times Square - let me squash them! We were looking at this hotel prior to our trip, however we made the mistake of trying to save some money by staying at a nearby hotel (The Gallivant) only to regret it INSTANTLY! After one awful night and almost on the verge of tears, I jumped on booking.com to see if Crowne Plaza had any rooms available and thank goodness it did! We were greeted by a lady at the front desk named Rhoda who made everything better instantly. She was so kind, helpful and accommodating. While I’m still on the verge of tears, Rhoda put us in a nice & spacious room and gave us vouchers for a complimentary breakfast and drink! Rhoda has remembered our faces every day since arriving at Crowne Plaza (note: we still here, currently on day 5 and never want to leave). Crowne Plaza is perfectly located in Times Square, yet is still quiet and classy enough to escape the hustle and bustle of the surroundings to get a good nights sleep. All the staff here are so friendly and willing to help. It’s been a fantastic experience from the moment we stepped through the doors.If you can, spend the extra money to stay here. It’s worth every penny. Our time in NYC was almost ruined after our first night at the other hotel. We are so glad to be spending our time in NYC at Crowne Plaza. It’s allowed us to fall in love with the city the way it deserves! THANK YOU TO RHODA for being our saving grace and welcoming us to this wonderful hotel! Good luck getting us to leave ;)

Stayed here on our visit to NYC great check in very quick rooms were nice could probably be up dated bathroom was a bit grubby but to be honest we weren’t in hotel for any length of time. Wouldn’t pay for an upgrade as you are so busy out and about why pay for a view not as if you are going to sit at your window.Beds were comfy and room was clean. You could get food which was nice but there is so many places to eat there you are spoilt for choice. This hotel is great for location you are right in the midst of it all Broadway theatres are right on your doorstep minutes to walk to in fact we walked nearly everywhere from here and it was so easy.Coffee and bagels or cake in hotel in morning not overly expensive and very nice.I would definitely stay here again if I were visiting New York
user_name:
Annette M
Alness, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: Lovely hotel with superb location on Times Square in Manhattan.Helpful and friendly staff.Well appointed rooms.Renovations were in progress during the visit but this did not spoil our stay at the Crowns Plaza Hotel.Received a free drink on arrival when we checked in. A central location for accessing the main points of interest on Broadway and Times Square.Great choice of theatres, bars and restaurants near by but take loads of money...

This was my first visit to NYC and chose this hotel for our 6 night stay because of its location. After a long flight and taxi ride, the hotel check in was lovely and smooth. I had a corner room on the 38th floor with a great view of times square and partial view of the Hudson river, high enough not to be bothered by the noise. The room was lovely and clean on arrival and was serviced very well every day. We ate at the Bar49 in house most nights as the price was not too bad and the food was delicious. My tariff included the buffet breakfast which was delicious; plenty of choice and as much as you want. Staff service was excellent, very polite and attentive. Would my wife and I stay again ... without a doubt. An excellent hotel; a bit pricey ... like everything in New York ... but the hotel and it's location made our visit.

I travel a lot. My average flight number per year is ~140-200 flights per year across the continental U.S., Europe, Asia, and sometimes South America. Needless to say, I am seasoned when it comes to living on the road.This past weekend I was traveling not for work, but for pleasure. Once a year, I visit a large city with some old colleagues of mine to relax and enjoy local activities. NYC for us is a mainstay because of the great food, and most of all, Broadway.As such, the Times Square Crowne Plaza is usually my top choice given the location and amenities the facility offers. Though some Crowne Plaza locations have a reputation for being a little aged, this location is definitely well kept and a great option for a weekend trip in the city.This weekend was special for us as I decided to bring my parents along, as my father had never been to New York, or seen a Broadway show.We arrived Friday morning at LGA and took a NYC Yellow Taxi to the Crowne Plaza. The Taxi Driver was named, "Freddie" and he and I had some great discussion while he was driving us to the hotel. He was discussing how long he had been in NYC, and that he came over from Ecuador with his wife and mother. The conversation was very pleasant, and Freddie was a very nice guy. This will be important later.For the first time in my career (5+ years of 100% travel), I left my laptop in the NYC Yellow Taxi. It's my fault. I was sidetracked ensuring that my family had their bags while assisting with the payment method. Needless to say, I left the laptop in the front seat. This is a work laptop, and I needed it to complete some tasks before stopping for the weekend. Once I realized (in line at check-in) that my laptop was missing, I ran back outside to find that the driver had already left.I have several remote lectures to give next week, and I cannot host the meeting without this laptop, as the data is encrypted. I'm completely stuck, now.This, is a complete nightmare. I called NY Taxi, but was advised that they do not accept calls on lost property. I was directed to their website. I submitted a claim on their website, and the contact my work IT team to discuss options.After discussion, it was decided to plan as though the laptop is gone forever. As such, I was required to submit a police report before the company can consider the loss covered and allow me new laptop hardware.After much fumbling on the web with my cell phone, I approached the front desk of Crowne Plaza and spoke to Michelle. Michelle was kind and provided me with the address and telephone number to NYPD 18th Precinct 3C. I called NYPD who advised that I must make the report in person only. Fine.I walked to the NYPD precinct office and made my report in person. With this, I had the case number to provide to work IT, and to get my new laptop hardware. Hopefully, this would only disrupt one day of my lectures next week. Outlook = grim.By this time, it was early afternoon and I was ready to be finished with the day. I had done everything in my power to correct the situation, and mistakes do happen, I was pretty bummed; what a stupid mistake!The rest of the evening was uneventful, with dinner and our first Broadway show of the weekend (Come from away). We spent the rest of the evening walking around and trying whiskey bars. Saturday morning: I receive a call at 7:46AM. This was an officer from NYPD precinct 18. Freddie, the taxi driver, was there with my missing laptop and wanted to give it to me personally. WOW.I dress and uber straight to the Police office. I'm met with some laughter and the NYPD officers saying, "wow, you are SO lucky!". I look and behind me is standing Freddie with my laptop, and the guy is all smiles! Freddie then tells me, when his shift ended he cleaned his car and found the laptop. It was in the front against his middle console. He knew that the computer was mine, and he himself was distraught.He remembered our conversation during the ride.Freddie, on his own time, went back to Crowne plaza at 6:00 AM, and spoke to the front staff. This was when Michelle (whom helped me yesterday) remembered speaking to me. Michelle advised that she remembered me, but that she was remiss in taking my information down (and I was remiss in giving it to her). Both Freddie and Michelle know I'm there, but they have no way to know my name or how to reach me.Michelle DID remember, however, that I went to the 18th precinct office of NYPD. Michelle advised Freddie to go to NYPD, which he did.Afterwards, Freddie drove me back to the hotel and was SO GLAD to have found me.Needless to say, I was very touched and showed my gratitude to Freddie and team.Were it not for the kindness of Freddie, my work would have been disrupted. I work in the medical field, which means this disruption could have caused delays in patient care (indirectly). Were it not for Michelle's kind attention and keen memory, Freddie would have been unable to take the laptop somewhere I could be reached. The staff at NYPD also were extremely helpful as well.If these stars had not all lined up, my week at work would have been pretty rough.The stars, though, aren't really stars that line up, they are people.Freddie, Michelle, and the folks at NYPD are the stars here. Your hard work and kind attention, and overall good nature lead to this excellent outcome for me, and salvaged the rest of my visit to NYC. By taking the extra time, you eased my mind for the rest of my trip with my family, AND you ensured that my work was not disrupted this week.I wanted to share this excellent story, and thank Freddie and Michelle for their kindness. I will absolutely recommend this location to my friends and colleagues, when I tell this story.Thank you SO much!

This was my fourth visit to this hotel! Great location since most of the theaters are to a waking distance! If you are IHG member don’t forget to ask for your breakfast discount coupons! The staff at the restaurant is super! Tofael, Christina & Aly! Thanks

I visited this hotel from 3/23-3/27. I had stayed there before and it is in a great location and a very nice hotel. However, after the first night I began to itch and my legs were covered with a rash. I went to the nearby Walgreens to get some lotion but it continued toget worse. By the 3rd night I was miserable. My entire body was covered with large red welts and the itch was unbearable. When I returned home my dermatologist said it was an allergic reaction to the detergent the hotel uses. She gave me medicine but the rashis slow to disappear. It appears to be scarring. I stay at hotels about 10x per month and have never had this happen. Beware!

Highly recommend Crowne Plaza Time Square, our room overlooking the square was on the 42nd floor. The room was clean, modern with great space My hairdryer didn’t work but my GHD straighteners did the room came supplied with a good hairdryer, iron and board, coffee/tea machine. We could hear noise from time square but it was faint noise, apart from the police sirens but like other posts have mentioned, you’re too shattered to even notice The hotel had an AMAZING bar (Broadway 49 bar and lounge) the food was SO good so we ate here 3 nights. Customer service was great! On the lobby floor, we had a coffee stand (Grind & Co). This was expensive but handy to have for the odd evening munchies ‍♀️ we only took advantage of it once, 1 slice chocolate cake ($9.95) and 1 bag of crisps ($3.50). The same floor also has two vending machines. The hotel gym was well equipped we were very impressed.

We arrived late because of a flight cancelation and the front desk was so helpful getting us settled.Then we had brunch at the Brasserie 1605 and the waiter, Ali, was so kind and friendly. He discovered it was my daughter’s 13th birthday and did everything possible to make her day special. He even surprised her with a piece of cake & some treates waiting in our room after the matinee we attended. There should be more special individuals like this in the world. It absolutely made her beam in what was already a lovely trip!!The hotel is so clean & the most convenient location we have had!We will stay again!!!

I was there in May 2019 with my daughter and granddaughter to see NYC. We chose this hotel based on reputation and proximity to Times Square where we planned to board the hop on Bus (Big Bus) for touring. I would give it 5 stars if it had not been for the shabby furnishings in the bathroom and the problem with getting hot...or even warm water in the shower. Apparently you need to run it for about 15 to 20 minutes. Hot water in the sink was no problem. The coffee shop was wonderful and I enjoyed a cup of coffee and a pastry every morning. beds and bedding very comfortable.

I had reserved 2 rooms and they didn’t end up to be on the same floor which wasn’t ok but then Freddy at the front desk did all kinds of magic!The Birthday Girl and her friends had a corner room with a wonderful view of Times Square and I was in a room a couple doors down with the younger sisters of said Birthday Girl. I was given coupons for complimentary beverages for each room. Between Freddy’s professional & friendly demeanor to help me and the condition and location of the Crowne Plaza; we couldn’t have been more satisfied.THANKS FREDDY & CROWNE PLAZA

Only wish it could have been for longer. We had a room on the 35th floor. It was clean and quiet and the bed was perfect. Our room came with 2 complimentary drinks in the hotel bar (Broadway 49), 2 international phone calls and access to the fitness club. Checking in and out was quick...maybe 2 minutes each time. Next time we visit NYC we will stay at the Crowne Plaza.

Convenient to theaters and exceptional service from the staff, especially Victoria who made our check-in experience pleasant! We also received two free drink coupons upon check-in which we used at the lovely bar. Highly recommend this hotel!

We recently spent 5 nights at the Crown plaza. Our trips to New York alway focus in seeing lots of theater and this hotel could not be in a better location. It was our third stay in this location. And the bed In Our room was really fabulous. The sheets were so soft and the mattress was just divine. One of the best hotel beds I have ever had. We had a lovely river view. We could see way into New Jersey. The service in the hotel was spotty. The bar /restaurant was noisy and the service was slow and sometimes our orders were wrong. Fortunately there are a lot of other places to eat. The entrance and lobby were frequently very congested with people. The concierge desk told us a Harlem tour we booked was in a mini van and it was in a huge tour bus. Not sure why he said that but we were very disappointed. (Don’t book the Harlem gospel tour, it was not much about Harlem! Very disappointing with a horrid guide.) All in all our stay was pleasant.

If your aim is to be in the centre of the busiest area of New York, Crowne Plaza Times Square is the place to go, very busy hotel in a very busy location, hotel room costs are little over priced for what you get but I have seen worse and it is New York. A good variety of restaurants & shops close by & again iit’s the centre of New York so a little over priced also.Hotel is well located to many of the central New York attractions, close to the Hop on Hop off bus stop, Check In is upstairs 1st floor & busy but reasonably quick, hotel rooms are a reasonable size, comfortable & clean, the one thing that the hotel lacks is good coffee/tea facility in the room, they provide a basic (and I mean very basic) a coffee machine, they use paper cups instead of real cups (but I found that with the 3 other USA hotels I stayed in on this trip), there is no refrigerator and you get a couple of coffee bags and creamers, there is a Starbucks round the corner, but sometimes after a long day of walking you just want to relax in the room with a coffee. The Bar downstairs opposite reception is a good choice for simple food and the occasional drink or there is the restaurant opposite the bar, the downstairs concierge area can get crowded on check outWould I stay again, probably not, if I were to do another trip to New York I would stay out of Times Square (you can walk or catch the bus there), I think I would look to stay around either 34th or 57th Street, a little quieter but still lots to do.

This was my fourth time coming with a group this year of 122. We love the Crown Plaza, accommodations, location, service, all staff friendly and helpful.Mr. Sharif, there to greet you, always with a smile.Ana in the dining area for breakfast, can't be any friendlier, all make it a most pleasant experience.Great food too!!I can't say enough, and I may be back to post more...Tina

Sandra Esp. Was great checking us in. She was super nice and helped us with our questions. Quick service and nice hotel. Quickly got up to the room and found it to be nice and clean with a beautiful view.

You are right in the middle of the theater district at the Crowne Plaza. We walked to everything. Check in started poorly. A woman at the desk finished with the person in front of us but did not make eye contact or tell us that she’d be with us in a minute as she shuffled papers for quite a while. Finally the woman next to her who was very friendly and vivacious, checked us in. Kudos to her for doing her job so well. Our room was large, especially for NYC. The bed was very comfortable, the sheets grey (ugh), the towels were a good size and nice and white. We were on the 34th floor and it was nice and quiet! Had the full American Buffet breakfast. It was so so - eggs Luke warm. Personally, if I’m paying $35., I prefer a plated breakfast not a buffet that you’d get for no additional cost at a HI Express.

The whole experience was fine, but What made a real difference in our stay is that we got excellent service from Sandra Esp. the front desk officer, professional, considerate, and helpful, we extended our stay online, and were initially told we had to change the room to keep the rate of the first booking, Sandra Esp. was engaged and dedicated to make sure that all guests have the best treatment possible and spent time and effort so we stay in the room.5 stars Sandra

I've stayed at several hotels around Times Square and the Crown Plaza is my favorite. great rooms, comfortable beds and nice amenities. Love the breakfast buffet too. Thanks Travis for remembering me too.

This Crowne Plaza has a great location at the north end of Times Square and the lobby lounge is a great place to relax and has great burgers. That said, the quality of the sleeping rooms and the level of service are sub par. I stayed here for two consecutive weeks. The first week a drain in an adjacent mechanical room plugged up and my room took on a lot of water, soaking the carpet in the entry way. The hotel sent up an engineer and a housekeeper who got the drain unplugged and put plastic and towels over the carpet, so that got handled. When I was at the hotel the next week the air conditioner in my room did not function, the room safe was broken and the room had no coffee or water. When I asked for help the only thing I got was water. The safe was not fixed and the air conditioner for some reason that was not resolvable could not be fixed. When I arrived back in my room the message light on my phone was blinking and when I touched the message button it only rang a busy signal. When I asked to have the phone reprogrammed I was informed that that could not be done. Then, to top off the whole experience, for some reason the hotel decided not to service my room the next day. Ah well, I can make my own bed.Seriously, I'd suggest care in the decision to use this facility and be ready for problems.

Firstly best view for Times square. Our room 45. Floor for our room help us Evelyn thank you from Cappadocia :) we stayed for honeymoon holiday. We very happy to choose this hotel. We hope to come again
user_name:
alihan ş
New York City, New York

review_body: We are so pleased staying in Crown plaza hotel. The front desk Victoria Martin was very helpful, respectful and kind. I have 3 kids with me, but she made me feel like I have extra hands. She definitely went far and beyond simply checking us in. Excellent employees like her will make me book over and over again to this hotel. The hotel room is very nice, clean, and big and nice view. The location is just perfect, right at the middle of Manhattan, and accessible to everything. The security in the hotel is very good, and they hold luggage for you before and after check in so you can still roam around the city. They even bring the luggage to your room. This a great hotel!

My wife and I visited the Crowne Plaza as we were celebrating our son's Birthday 2 weekends ago and after MD Niles Harris left I was really curious to see whether anything had changed especially with employees, many of whom we have known for years.No need to worry especially as Sylvia Geronimo as Exec. Assistant still there and keeps everything flowing even when she isn't at work. Our preferred room was made available and they even remembered my wife's favorite wine which was a real bonus. Sylvia is awesome.Checking-in was a breeze and although our room wasn't ready at check-in time, John and Grant, Managers moved things along really fast and took care of refreshments while we waited. A nice touch.It was great to see the Restaurant hostess Ana still there as friendly as ever and always looking out for a great table for us and many of the servers were still there and remembered us and we them. Comforting. Not sure who runs F&B there (I used to get cheese and crackers every time) but I'm sure with Agathe still there (didn't get to meet her) things are very smooth.Location is hard to beat right in the middle of Times Square. Looks like some construction so the entrance right onto Broadway is closed. The access to the 3rd party Gym on the 15th floor is awesome and there is nothing else you need for a great work-out. Lobby bar is great for cocktails and the service is super. We received some vouchers but had no time to use them.Employees miss the former MD, as I do, but they all had great things to say about MD Sanders, which is always the mark of great Leadership. I gave a reference for an upcoming conference mid-June and will continue to tell everyone it’s a super place to stay whether on business or pleasure.

This is the place to stay if you want to be at the centre of it all! Close to all amenities and especially handy if you’re hoping to go to any theatre shows or visit tourist attractions. We had a lovely stay there made even better by Evelyn at reception who was always so helpful and greeted us with a smile. My only criticism of the hotel is that it is somewhat dated in some parts and needs sprucing up generally but I understand that they are in the process of refurbishing it.

Everything was good. Times Square is the pleasure place. Breakfast was greatly. But in the restaurant wan excellent Rahi! The best dinner in NY, at my wife ´ s birthday! Rooms was very children friendly. Housekeeping personnel is hopeful. Thanks very much!

Gorgeous hotel with a fantastic little pub and restaurant that has prime seats to view Times Square. Rooms are clean and very comfortable with excellent amenities. Loved our stay. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Very conveniently located hotel. Mutiple subway stations very close. All the amenities of time square on your door Breakfast very expensive in hotel restaurant. Hour extension to checkout time given free and without hesitation.

I had the best check-in experience from Evelyn. She was fantastic & very welcoming. Gave me my handicap room w/the most beautiful view. The room ended up looking great but it was freezing even w/the heat on 80 the whole time & the removable showerhead didn't work. Which isn't good considering my condition & I fall often. Not good for the handicap. Olger T At Broadway 49 Bar & Lounge was Fantastic & friendly. He even took care of my daughter's chicken pesto dinner when she cut into and it was raw pink. I thought this place was going to be much better for the $501 I paid for 2 nights but it wasn't.

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza with my significant other from April 12 to April 18th. I have stayed here before with my children and it was a pleasant stay. Not this time though.The A/C in the first room I received did not work so they sent a person to fix which of course did not fix anything. They left a machine to cool the room down but of course the sound was terrible and I could not sleep with this machine. Then I was changed to another room after pretty much BEGGING the front desk to change me. In this new room the A/C did work. I left in the afternoon to visit NYC and when I came back to my room I found a piece of underwear which was not mine on the couch. I repeat, a piece of UNDERWEAR WHICH WAS NOT MINE on the couch. After reporting this to the front desk they mentioned that they could not show me the cameras and after talking to a nice colombian manager they said that they had not found any trace that could lead to the underwear arriving in my room. So basically I was now a liar and I had made all this up. Incredible lack of empathy, poor customer service and resolution of guest problems in this hotel. The cherry on top was when I went to the Hotel Bar with a bag of crackers i had bought downstairs by the parking garage, i was approached by one of the waitresses (red haired waitress) and she said that I could not sit there because I was not consuming anything. So basically I am a guest at the hotel but i can not sit in the empty bar and eat a bag of crackers I had bought downstairs since I was not consuming anything at the bar.. can it get worse? hopefully not. I will definitely not stay here or any Crowne Plaza ever again and if you are reading this I recommend that you dont either. (just to note that after all this I was not offered a free night or such, I only had some minibar bills and laundry taken out of my bill) WAY TO GO CROWNE PLAZA!
user_name:
gzb1983
New York City, New York

review_body: Tofael (and everyone in the breakfast area) was so helpful and accommodating! Very friendly and kind, wonderful service each day. We have a big family and he made us feel very welcome and comfortable! And the breakfast itself was delicious!

We received excellent service from Evelyn and Rosa! Our flight was cancelled with no further contact with the airline for over a day and they went out of their way to make us feel at home during our stay. We've stayed at Crown Plaza Times Square a few times and they are the reason why!

As a former New Yorker now living in the south, I’m coming back to New York on a regular basis. Sometimes I stay with friends and sometimes I need to be at a hotel. My last trip to the city I said at the Park Lane Hotel on Central Park, and was very disappointed This time, I’m staying mid town in time square at the Crowne Plaza. What a welcome surprise to find such a lovely hotel in the middle of all that’s happening  It all started when I went to check in. Imran was at the front desk and took amazing care of my reservation. As a traveler, you learn to love the little things that people do that make you feel good. Imran welcomed me to the hotel in the most polite and professional manner. And my room is just as I expected it to be, clean...nicely furnished and very very comfortable.Jackpot!My son came to meet me for dinner and was also very impressed with the hotel,..the look of the hotel, and my accommodations. We had dinner at the lounge and much to my surprise the food was incredibly delicious. I mean who would’ve thought we would have a memorable dinner at this hotel. (New York has many many restaurants to choose from, and to have such a quality restaurant in your hotel is a rare find) And is it that wasn’t enough praise, I had a special request that the food and beverage manager Karimtook care of on the spot.To top it all off, we had two waiters. Not one, but two waiters, Jordan and Victor, and both of them were as nice and as attentive as you could ask for Somebody pinch me! Travelers, look no further. The Crowne Plaza is a fabulous find in the heart of Manhattan

Been to New York many times, but unfortunately this time we had booked a hotel last minute.We chose this place because it had ajoining rooms.When we reserve we originally requested king beds, in ajoining rooms.Unfortunately upon arrival we were offered only double beds.Doesn’t seem like much but when you make a special reservation and you’re arrive, and it’s not correct it is pretty disappointing at 400$ a night. The manager was pretty kind and offered us breakfast vouchers.This hotel is fairly dates and other than the pillows and the beds that are very clean and comfortable and everything else is dated. But this is a high volume area. We had to wait 5 to 10 minutes to get hot water in our room, and the breakfast area there is huge in service probably about 200 people has a very small buffet area which ran out of food. On the last day which was a Tuesday they ran out of croissants at 10 AM?The location was great and the in-house restaurant and bar was pretty good but was always kept it very cold.We had some burgers and salads and those were pretty good.

Great location, especially if you'll be seeing some Broadway shows. Clean rooms, excellent & friendly staff, neat city views (recommend a corner room if you can get it).It seemed like we'd step out of the hotel and be in the heart of it all. There's multiple access points for the subway to get you where you need to go and being in the middle of Manhattan, your never more then a 20 minute subway run from all the sights you want to see. Definitely recommend it for the first time visitor, ideal location!

A very good location to go around Manhattan. They have clean rooms, comfortable beds and always better if you get a deal that comes with breakfast. Great value for money and Steps away to all tourist spots nearby.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room clean and comfortable. Great location for top attractions. Food on the breakfast buffet was mediocre but warm smile if our server Tofael was a great start to the day. Would definitely recommend to others to stay here.

The service is excellent and the employees are very nice. The location was perfect. April 2019 was my son's 17th birthday. At Breakfast Ana and Tofael was excellent. They make my son have the best birthday ever. Singing happy birthday with me for him. At anytime in the future I will recommend this hotel to any family and friends because of those two people. They are very welcoming, friendly, respectful, helpful, Ana and Tofeal have a smile in them face to make anybody feel welcoming.

It started with the folks at the front desk, they were so and accomadationing that I have to admit they made me feel special. The staff throughout the hotel in well tuned into providing great customer service. If you want to experience Time Square and surrounding areas you won't find a better location. If your also into meeting travelers from all over the world this is your place. We also stayed here for New Years a few years ago and bought the package that put you in front of the hotel at 11PM ish to watch the ball drop. Its a bit pricey(check it out on line) but worth every penny of it vs standing outside from 3PM to wait for New Years !

A nice hotel at the very heart of Big Apple! Very close to all best places in Manhattan, just a few steps away from the Times Square. Hotel offers good buffet for breakfast. There's a swimming pool, but we didn't have a chance to visit it. Sandra Esp. at the reception was extremely helpful, courteous and kind. She's a valuable asset to this hotel.

There was a line when I arrived. However the check in process went quick. Sandra's provided excellent customer service. She asked questions to make sure that I had everything that I needed. Also, she made recommendations for things to do while I'm here. Definitely recommend this place.

Excellent service at the front desk by Sandra Esp. Very nice rooms with magnificent views over Manhattan. Make sure you go for breakfast! Top location, in the liddle of Times Square! Highly recommended!

Crown Plaza was great. Sandra Esp was very nice and extremely professional. She was kind to all guests before me as well. Because of her I will book the crown plaza again. The location is great. Very convenient for shopping

I regularly stay at the Crown Plaza Times square for business trips to the city. This time I brought my family for school vacation week. Like many other visits I chose to add breakfast to my stay as they have a great buffet better then most hotels! One of things I like as a regular guest is that they are always friendly and seem to remember me from my last visits. This time Ali our server came over to say hello and greeted me with a smile and asked if I was here this time on vacation and was very happy to meet my family. When my wife mentioned it was my Birthday he wished me a happy birthday. Later that night we had a knock on the door and room service showed up with a huge piece of Chocolate cake and a bottle of red wine with a card from Ali wishing me a happy Birthday! I was shocked at the gesture as it was totally unexpected and very thoughtful. He has waited on me many times and always friendly as I’m usually eating alone before starting my day if client appointments.So I was truly taken back by his thoughtfulness. We stayed several more days and never got to thank him, but he added something special to my birthday and my wife, kids and I all enjoyed the cake together! The wine was just for the two of us and made for an even more special night.Overall this hotel is comfortable, great showers, comfortable beds, good food options and as an IHG member they often give you extra vouchers for the cafe.Overall we had an amazing visit to NYC made extra comfortable by Ali, and the front desk staff, and other waiter Tofael who also provided friendly service.This is the way all hotels should treat their guests and why I always return!Kudos to management for creating such a positive environment for the staff to rest guests so well!

This is def my go-for hotel whenever visiting Manhattan. Perfect location, great gym and amazing staff. Always a pleasure to return. Special thanks to Sandra from the, front desk. So helpful, carring and looking into the extra mile to make are, stay even more wonderful.! Thanks and, see you soon!!

The hotel is great! Check-in was very easy with pleasant service provided by Sandra Esp. If her attention to the hotel guest is typical of all Crowne Plaza staff we will have a very pleasant stay. We recommend this hotel for the great staff and the ideal location to enjoy this great city!!

Having just returned from a 4 night stay we were pleased with the accommodation itself. We were on the 44th floor at the rear of the hotel and were generally pleased with the room itself - good size, clean, amazing beds (temporally eased my lower back pain!), other reviews have mentioned it was either too hot or cold, we found the temp to be just fine, so much so it didn’t even cross our mind. Windows offered a relatively good view out to the river, no doubt it would have been better with the Times Square view but that’s an extra cost. Could have done with a fridge in the room and the shower would have benefitted from more water pressure.The one sticking point is the service fees. Although we were aware of them at the time of booking I still find it hard to justify the hotel actually charging them to guests. Several booking sites state that the WiFi is free (as you may expect) but apparently this is part of the service fee and at $35 a day seems excessive. Yes it includes other ‘benefits’ but I would expect and have received these at other hotels at no extra cost. I would have happily paid $10-15 for the WiFi each day but the rest is surplus to demand and I expect many guests don’t make use of these extras. Either include it in the price of the room or break it down into optional extras that you pick and choose to pay as you use them. The member of staff who checked us in ‘conveniently’ forgot to mention the service fees and gave the impression that the WiFi was indeed free.I would happily stay again if the service fees were reconsidered and more transparent to guests.

Well, what can I say about the Crowne Plaza, Times Square, fabulous and superb staff that you just cannot fault, I had a few favourites, which I have to mention because they really did go above and beyond any of my expectations. Tony from the Bar/Restaurant (my fav – 5* Stars), Ali from the Dining Room, Kareem the Restaurant Manager and Adaliz from Reception, all totally fantastic people. I have walking disabilities and they all went out of their way to make things so much easier for me to manoeuvre round the hotel, without me asking and with absolutely no fuss. I highly recommend this hotel to all, it is rare to find a hotel full of excellent, helpful and genuinely lovely staff, makes it all worthwhile and very enjoyable.
user_name:
Diane S
Banchory, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: This was our second stay here. As on the previous occasion it was a great experience. The installations might not be the newest but rooms are big and comfortable and the beds are a dream, so very comfortable. Most important of all the staff are exceptional and go out of their way to be helpful and solve any issue you may have. Thank you Victoria and so many others for making our 5 days away from home so great. We will be back. Did miss the temple spa toiletries.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square with a Broadway Group tour and had a great stay. It is centrally located and an easy walk to all the theaters. An abundance of eating places around the hotel and also in the hotel. We had a lovely buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant and had excellent service from Ali. He even asked if we wanted our coffee and tea in "to go" cups which he provided for us. Thank you, Ali. He was so attentive and friendly. Our rooms were clean, roomy and efficient, and housekeeping service was also very good. We had a great stay!

overwhelming in all aspects! from the initial check in (which I was able to do early) every aspect of my visit was completely satisfying! The room was not only spacious but comfortable and the guest amenities were greatly appreciated! I cant wait to visit again!!!

This hotel is ideally located for a central New York experience. The room overlooking Times Square itself (with a nice view of the Hudson too) was pricey but brilliant; due to the height, there is a little wind noise at times but it didn't keep us awake. The vouchers ($25 per night) off food and drink in the hotel restaurant helped! The gym is top notch run by New York Sports Club with a super lane swimming pool. The entrance can be a little hard to find because of the renovations happening at ground level. Special thanks to Sandra on check in who sorted out early check in for us, Yuhui our maid who cleaned the room while we were at breakfast each day, and Michelle and Tony in the hotel bar / restaurant both of whom got us fed and watered quickly and cheerfully so that we could get to shows on time.

Great Location, Room excellent size, Plenty of Restaurants and Diners nearby.Perfect location for catching Hop On Hop Buses and Theatres.Special mention to Rahi at"Bar 49" hotel restaurant bar. Friendly, efficient and so welcoming.

We spent a week site seeing in New York. Although we have stayed in other hotels in Times Square, this one definitely was the best. The staff was attentive and friendly, the rooms were a little larger than most NYC rooms, and the location cannot be beat! We made a few requests to staff members and they always seemed happy to help. We will definitely use this as our go to hotel on future trips.

First stay in New York and booked The Crown Plaza with Times Square view.Stayed in room 2701 with amazing views of Times Square.Room was very spacious and clean.Beds were clean and comfortable.Staff were very polite and friendly.On our last day we asked to book a taxi to return to the airport, no need as hotel car was available for the same price as a taxi...so driven to airport in a luxury car and in style.Would book this hotel again without a doubt.

I have stayed 3 nights for business on 22 floor. I have chosen this hotel as surprisingly despite the hight of the building the windows can be opened to safe degree which allows fresh air in. As for NY standards my room was spacious with proper sofa against the window. The view was to Time Square which was fun to watch and with the window closed I had good night sleep. The room warms up up to 80 degrees if you a cold person like me. There was a shower, no bath.For over $400 a night and being Crowne Plaza I expected there would be more things in the room. There was no sleep spray like in other locations of this chain, no bathrobe or slippers (on third night I requested it but got only bathrobe), filter coffee maker was faulty, housekeeping was inconsistent, staff was indifferent. It is a tourist machine. I had to chase drink voucher at the check in for IHG gold membership as I have not been offered one. At the end I got two vouchers. I have been to the breakfast once and the choice is basic (hot plus cold buffet). He took my credit card although my company agent has provided them credit guarantee and I had to clarify it next day.Overall I would not mind staying there again but I am not going to recommend it either.

We went to this hotel for my daughters 16th it was lovely friendly staff good breakfast one evening we had light meal at the hotel bar with drinks we was served by a lovely lovely gentleman call Robert he was lovely friendly chatty really nice man seemed to be the only one if the staff to make a big effort with the customers honestly I would come back to this hotel and hope Robert would still be there ❤️❤️

I have been to New York a number of times before but we have never brought the kids before. Ordinarily, I would avoid staying in Times Square, but, we thought it seemed like the right place to stay for a first time visit with the whole family. In many ways we were right - there’s so much to do and see, even late at night and all the lights and hustle & bustle are fascinating to children who normally live in a small, quiet town. The Crowne Plaza is located just off Times Square - we could see Times Square from our room on 34th floor but it wasn’t too close so the city noise didn’t keep us awake. The room was fairly quiet (a bit of corridor noise and you could hear the shower etc in the room next door) and very standard for a New York City hotel room. Two double beds, a bathroom and the usual facilities of a kettle, air con, tv etc. We just felt that the room was really quite tired. The decor seemed quite old fashioned, the beds were soft and quite small, the drawers and storage in the room were limited and needing a little bit of TLC. There was nothing majorly wrong but there certainly wasn’t anything interesting, exciting or out of the ordinary either. To be fair, it was a great base for us - we were out exploring and doing all the usual touristy things all day that we only used the room to sleep in - didn’t spend any time in it just chilling out etc. The staff were nice and friendly and the maid cleaning the room each day did a great job. Would I stay here again??.....probably not. If it upped its game a little then I could be tempted back though.

What a place NYC is. We are here celebrating my 50th birthday and it’s been on the bucket list for a long time. After a very long day we arrived at the hotel to find that they had made a mistake with the booking and we were a day early. The staff were fantastic however we had a pay for an additional night. After contacting our travel agent Letsgo2 and Caroline Moore we started to get it sorted. The team at the Crowne Plaza were brilliant including Sandra Esp and before lunch the following day everything has been sorted. Crown Plaza have been great and we’d recommend them for both their friendly staff and great location. We can’t recommend Caroline and Letsgo2 enough. This is the 3rd holiday we have booked with them and they are awesome.

Second time to the big apple and this time was with family.If you get over the smaller real estate, roomwise driver by location, this hotel is a superb choice.Everything was within reach and was quite enjoyable for late night exits from hotel and smack into times square crowd...

Hotel very well located, close to Time Square. Very clean, quiet. Rapid checkin even thought the system was down. Because of that they gave us double welcome drink. Confortable room with long chaise, coffe and tea bags all days, very clean sheets, nice shower, and several towels. Various elevators with fast service. Nice housekeepers.

Recently stayed as a family of four (with a 15 yr old and 18 year old) in a family room. Our past experiences of New York accommodation was of being packed like sardines into the room. Not, however here. Our room consisted of two double beds (comfiest ever), desk, bathroom and views of Times Square. Blackout blinds ensured we weren’t kept awake by the flashing lights of Times Square. We all slept soundly. Although the hotel is undergoing renovation, it had absolutely no effect whatsoever. We didn’t do breakfast as felt the price was over the top. Couple of lovely eateries nearby at a fraction of the price. Location was perfect, walking distance from almost everything. Couldn’t have been better. Room provided coffee/tea machine although our cups weren’t replaced each day so we had to ask for these. A minor niggle. I also left a note for the cleaning operatives asking for extra tea/coffee and toiletries as there were four of us, but this didn’t happen! Maybe it’s hotel policy! Our room was cleaned to a high standard each day which was appreciated. The only problem we had was that we couldn’t pay and watch a film, but having gone downstairs, it was sorted within minutes, plus a free drinks voucher for our trouble. Overall, would we return? Absolutely. Would we recommend? Absolutely. A great stay.

Ottimo Hotel veramente ben organizzato, pulito, con tutti i comfort che si cercano in vacanza, in una posizione ottimale (l'ingresso si trova in Time Square.... di più non si può); stanze accoglienti e letti comodissimi e, dulcis in fundo, indimenticabili colazioni dove Ana, la direttrice di sala, ci ha sempre fatto sentire a nostro agio.Spero di tornarci. - Excellent Hotel really well organized, clean, with all the comforts you are looking for on holiday, in an optimal position (the entrance is in Time Square .... more you can not); cozy rooms and very comfortable beds and, dulcis in fundo, unforgettable breakfasts where Ana, the dining room manager, has always made us feel at ease.I hope to come back.

Located spot on Times Square, this property offers great view of Manhattan. Choose floors on higher floors (40+) to enjoy the view. Ask specifically for times Square view if you are looking for the best.The place is crowded, you can expect a queue to check in. Unless you have booked the right room, it might be difficult to get a selection during check-in. The restaurant serves good breakfast.

We have just returned from a 5 night holiday at this hotel. Great location. 2 minute walk from the Red Stairs at Times Square. The rooms are large with very comfortable beds. Every member of staff we came in contact were very pleasant and helpful. There is a carry out deli just round the corner from reception next to elevators where you can purchase breakfast. We did not have to pay resort fees. They did hold 200 dollars on a credit card for extras which has been refunded. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel on our next visit to New York.

I booked a room for my wife and her best friend back in November for a birthday trip and they had a great experience. So when we went back to NYC this past weekend we booked a room here again and it was just amazing. The staff was friendly and very courteous. We were treated like family. Do yourself a favor and opt for the breakfast buffet. It's excellent and worth every cent. The room was clean and spacious, probably the biggest room we've ever had in Manhattan.We travel a lot and stay in all kinds of hotels AirBnB's and it can be hard to find a nice place to stay, but this hotel will get our business every time we come to NYC.Make sure to talk to Ana or Carmen at the front desk, they are fantastic hosts.

This trip was much needed. The hotel was extremely comfortable, clean, and spacious for NY. The housekeepers were amazing. Everything clean and in place during this 9 day stay. We had an amazing experience in the hotelS restaurant, Tony our waiter, was amazing. He was friendly and made us laugh. Such a great personality.. He was so good that we went back on 2 different occasions just for his service. They are lucky to have him.

We stayed here because friends we were meeting stayed here. When we checked in we were given a room on the 15th floor. Once we got settled we heard a roaring from machinery across the hall, so we scurried down to the front desk for a room change. They were very accomodating, putting us in a room on the 24th floor. It was quiet and roomy (for New York), with good, comfortable beds. The bathroom could have been better. The mirror, with no overhead light, was the worst I have ever used for shaving, and the shower was weak. On the other side, the maid service was excellent, and, frankly, everyone we met on the staff was friendly and helpful. Prices vary from night to night here, but if you stay for a few days you will find the overall bill reasonable. And if you are in town for plays you can easily walk to all of the major theaters from the Crowne Plaza. They also have a nice bar, with a good selection of appetizers and desserts. We would certainly stay again.

We rocked up here courtesy of WWE and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. They really got into the spirit of the event and truly looked after us. Plenty of lifts for the size of the hotel and everything was clean and tidy. No complaints at all.

We’ve stayed at the Crowne Plaza on Time Square and we must say the location is to die for. It is walking distance from many of the places one would want to visit in NYC. The service, the breakfast buffet and the restaurant are great. I came here for my birthday and the receptionist, Freddy, made sure to make us feel EXTRA welcome! The view from the our room was straight onto time square. The only negative points are that there is no mini bar in the room and it is quite dark (not much lighting and hard to have sunlight as it is between tall buildings). Overall, it was a very pleasant experience and we would recommend!

Long day. Waiting to go to dinner and stopped at the bar and met the best bartenders. It’s like walking into the TV show Cheers. Keith the bartender introduces himself and you to everyone. I always stay here because of him. Such a great time. Hotel is very nice and you don’t feel like you are in a strange place. I highly recommend this hotel and thank you Keith!

The hotel is in a great location. Rooms are clean and pleasant, hotel is generally clean and tidy.We booked a times square view which was worth the extra money the view is amazing. Unfortunately our break was let down by a couple of issues which were staff related On saturday we went into the bar to get a drink, we finished our drink requested the bill and put it on our room and left. Upon our return to the hotel approximately 1 hour later, we were confronted rather aggresively In front of a few people in reception by the guy who took our drinks orders saying "you did not pay your bill" we told him we had put it on our room and a lady had took the signed bill he then said again aggresively "which lady" so we pointed out the lady he then walked off leaving us a little embarrassed and spoke to the lady and then just Continued with his normal job. At this stage we would have expected him to come apologise explain it was a mix up but there was nothing. This left us upset and actually a little fearful to return to the bar. On the same evening we also requested a hair dryer to be bought to the room which never came, when we called to chase it up we were told that they were busy and it would come but it never materialised. One member of staff who stood out at breakfast as exceptional was alli, the most friendliest person we met on holiday a real credit to the hotelSo would we stay here again. Probaley not which is a shame because the location is great.

This hotel is exactly what you’d expect it to be. It’s right in the heart of the Times Square district, so if that’s what you want, that’s what you got. A short (but crowded) walk to all major subway lines. During the course of our stay we walked all the way up to Lincoln Center, and all the way down to Greenwich Village. It’s clean, although the housekeeping is rather slow (room not serviced by 3:00? Really?) For where it is, and the volume of street noise in the vicinity, the room was fairly quiet. That being said, we were on the 46th floor, facing west (away from Times Square) and I sleep with noise-canceling headphones. But my wife slept peacefully also. The exercise facility is actually a NY Sports Club, which has positive and negative aspects. The variety of equipment is much greater than in any hotel I’ve ever visited, but the place is usually packed with über-serious athlete-types, not tourists looking to get in a workout in between indulgences. Incredibly, in “The city that never sleeps”, the facility was shut down at 6 pm on Sunday night. This was unacceptable and the hotel should do something to rectify this for their guests. There’s no lobby area to speak of. My wife was attending an oncology conference, and she was pleased with the conference facilities. Overall we enjoyed our stay, it served our purposes, but generally we would prefer to stay in a quieter location.

Excellent location! Your right in Times square district. Not far from the subway stations. Probably 4 miles from Central park. Nice, welcoming, friendly staff. Which makes it more inviting. Nice, update rooms. Clean too. The famous Junior's Cheesecake is right across the street. We will definitely be back! Thanks again Crown plaza-Times square!!

I stayed here 2 years ago on business and Tony B @ Bar 49 took such good care of me that when I came back for fun I had to come back so my husband could meet him. Tony is great and you should stay here just to be taken care of by him.

After hours in airports and diverted planes, we made it to the hotel in the wee hours of the morning to our favorite, often visited Crowne Plaza. We encountered inhospitable person on duty and disinterested night manager with incorrect accommodations. Voila!! The next morning all was changed: the day manager was so gracious; we went to the Brasserie and met Tofael WHI WAS DELIGHTFUL, good, and happy! We received 5 star service!! We will continue to stay here and to dine at the Brassetie and hopefully Tofael will be here!!! What a way to start the day!

The staff was very friendly and the whole place was spotless. The view we had from our room was simply amazing. Given the amazing view of the room and the location as well as the price I would definitely with out a doubt stay at this hotel again.

We had a great time at this hotel. The staff were all so nice and welcoming. The rooms were nice and big with very comfortable beds. We had a lovely breakfast every morning and was always made welcom by Ana she was so lovely and our waiter was so good Tofael. Thank u Crowne Plaza for a great time.

I recently stayed at the Crown Plaza and have to say that Sandra Esp. made my day with her delightful attitude and energy. Time Square might be one of the most "peoplie" places on earth and there tends to be a lot of tension, but Sandra is an all star when it comes to dealing with people. Room was great, bed very comfortable. It's not the newest, but if I have to be in that part of the city, I'll be staying there again.

I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. I left behind some personal belongings. I contacted Al Valdes, the Director of Safety and Security. He went above and beyond to return my items to me. He was kind, courteous and extremely efficient. I was truly grateful. I look forward to staying at this hotel again.

I was a chaperone on an 8th grade east coast field trip from California. Two kids fell ill and I stayed back all day to care for them. I missed the city and a Broadway show. Needless to say, I was terribly disappointed. I was able to go down to dinner and Tony B at Bar 49 provided excellent service and put a smile on my face. He was gracious, accommodating, and his positive energy was a breath of fresh air. He made my day. Customer service through the roof. What an asset to your team.

We had a great stay at this hotel The location could not have been better, the room was great and Rahi at the bar made us feel most welcome. His service and eye for details was extraordinary☺️Thank you!Best regards,Jonas and Ann Karin❤️

We had and excellent check in experience from Sandra Esp. She took the time to explain all the amenities and details of the hotel. The hotel is great has many nice restaurants and bars, location is about as good as it gets

We had a large group (coming from different countries for a seminar) booked for about 4 nights. They had a couple of meetings and dinner at the hotel. They truly enjoyed their stay. Thank you to all who have helped us, both for sleeping room and meeting room to make this a success!

Stayed at this hotel it was fantastic. Great location clean comfortable rooms good service the bar/ restaurant area lovely. The room are comfortable WiFi was good the staff very helpful and the maids left the rooms spotless stay was floorless.

We picked the Crowne Plaza for location so that we could easily walk to most of the things on our must see list. Ask for one of the higher floors with view of Times Square; express elevators get you there quickly and very little wait for an elevator in a large holel. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.

I have been to New York many times and have stayed in quite a few different hotels, including the Crowne Plaza. This Christmas I gave my two daughters and two daughters-in-law a girls trip with me to New York this spring. They live in 4 different cities and among them they have 12 children so there lots of logistics to work out. When they gave me a date I chose the Crowne Plaza for several reasons. Their rates were fair, the location was perfect and I’d had a good experience in the past there. We arrived at 5pm on Friday afternoon, close to shift change time. This lovely lady named Evelyn offered to check me in and I told her a little about our trip and asked if we could be put on the same floor. We different types of rooms so I didn’t hold any hope for adjoining rooms. She got to work, left the desk for a few minutes and came back with a big smile. I think I can put you in adjoining rooms and I’ll waive the up charge. She stayed an extra 25 minutes past her quitting time to make sure we had everything we needed she even threw in complimentary breakfast vouchers for OUR patience! Wow! It made such a difference in our trip by being able to be together the whole time. I would say Evelyn was truly exceptional, and she was, but the entire staff was also so friendly and helpful! I will never stay anywhere else again. And, Evelyn, if you ever see this, you’re an angel! Sally R.

I’ve been here since Friday and I’m here for 2 more days. When I arrived there was no soap in the bathroom. They brought us soap. We asked for an additional luggage rack. After 24 hours we called again and it arrived. After our room was cleaned it wasn’t restocked with conditioner. They brought us conditioner. Tonight we wanted a cab. We asked the man at the podium beside the desk for help and he sent us downstairs. We went and waited. No one. Back upstairs. The woman at the desk literally told us it wasn’t her job to call cabs. We were sent downstairs again and we finally gave up on the cab and called an Uber. This hotel is overpriced for what little it offers other than location. Choosing this hotel was a mistake. We won’t stay in any crowne plaza again.

Just returned home this evening and my husband and I can't stop talking about what a great find this was. Right in the heart of Times Square. Great rooms. Clean. Wonderful staff. My daughter and her children were visiting from Georgia so we got 2 rooms on the 28th floor. My husband and I got a King room and were pleasantly surprised when we walked in to this large corner room with a great view of Times Square! My daughter and her children had a Hudson River view across the hall. We were given 4 tickets for drinks in the lobby bar which was a nice touch. We will definately book this hotel for our next trip to Manhattan.

Great location, right in the heart of Times Square. Within walking distance of attractions, dining and subway station. Plus all of the Broadway theaters are close by. We arrived early and was able to check in. Staff was nice, Concierge was very helpful. Room was clean.

So.....where to start. New Years Eve in Time Square. Had to do it I once. Yup it was busy, loud, expensive and totally as expected! It was a great time. Hotel is ok. Could us some updating. Headboards in rooms disgusting. Room size was good and overall clean. For NYC it was right in the heart of the action. IF we ever did do the ball drop again we wouldn’t hesitate to stay here. Expect long lines, expensive nightly parking, around the clock noise and a million people in party mode. Geez it is NYC.
