If that’s not your scene I’d suggest you avoid NYC, especially the touristy Time Square. Restaurant in the lobby is actually pretty good. A view of the ball—that will cost you. No view of ball from inside hotel. They offer dinner/party packages that will take you outside in a gated off area just for guests to see the ball drop. $$$

Whenever I travel to New York City, I try to stay here. The location is perfect, it's easy to drive to from New Jersey (as long as you can dodge the construction and double-parked vehicles to get there), the staff are all friendly (special props to Sandra E for her help in getting us situated this time around), the rooms are nice and clean, and while there are probably a million places to eat in NYC, if you're too tired to go out, the food there is excellent.

Stayed here in February and the location is excellent.Room was on the 35th floor and lovely view of Times Square.Clean and tidy beds were made every day.Helpful staff.Never ate there as better value outside.Would defo stay again.

We would definitely NEVER EVER would stay here again. Parking 75 usd. 130 usd taxes for 3 days of staying, we booked 2 rooms. Try to go to Pool with the girls , was impossible (you need a reservation). Sirens go all night long and most important, beds are double and SUPER UNCOMFORTABLE FOR THE PRICE. Save your money!

Amazing breakfast and service at the 1605 Brasserie in the Crowne Plaza Times Square! Huge buffet and great atmosphere. Restaurant staff is so friendly! Ask for Tofael...he makes sure everything is perfect!!

We really enjoyed our stay! Great breakfast and you can walk to anything and everything. The rooms were clean and just big enough for our group. The bar was clean and the drinks were really good. Over all very enjoyable!

Excellent hotel, great views and amenities. Sandra esp made stay as accommodating as possible. this is probably one of the only spots with a pool and gym in such a tight space. Definitely recommended.

We had a fabulous trip, with the hotel being only a short walk to the theaters and numerous dining experiences. Karim Sharif, bar manager, was very engaging and hospitable. The service by Japhat was personal and attentive. We will be back to visit and enjoy our new found friends!

Sandra Esp helped us check in and was a good help! She told us about things to see and how to stay safe! Just checked in but it is a great visit so far! Looking forward to our stay here! All the staff has been friendly so far.

The Crown Plaza Times Square has beautiful rooms right in the middle of New York fun! They have wonderful staff, especially Karim Sharif and Japhat, who made my experience in New York even more special. Highly recommend!

We had a corner room looking out to Time Square. Sandra was so wonderful checking us in. She started us out with a very welcome smile and gave us some great recommendations. We will definitely stay here next time we’re in New York City.

Amazing stay particularly the service and cleanliness of the hotel. More importantly, the entire staff was accommodating and very professional. I would like to single out Karim Sharif, Food and Beverage Manager and Japhet, our waiter that were extremely hospitable and engaging. It is employees like this that make your stay at a hotel rewarding. Our group wants to sincerely thank them for going above and beyond to accommodate our requests.

We had the BEST breakfast buffet! The staff was friendly and accommodating and gave us great seating with a view. We had wonderful conversation with Tofael along with the wonderful service he provided. I highly recommend the hotel and the breakfast buffet.

I've been coming here for 6 years and always enjoy seeing Keith and the rest of the team. Central location, good for business or leisure and the rooms are always impeccable. Grab a bite to eat at the bar when getting off a late night arrival!

Awesome breakfast buffet. Service by Ali was wonderful. Very attentive and helpful. Much more than I expected.Also, hotel bar was perfect with view of Times Square and sports on several TVs. Hung out there a lot. Very pleased and highly recommend.

I booked this place because of its location without knowing anything about it, but after staying there, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The location was amazing, it was close to everything. The service was exceptional and everyone on the staff wanted to help make your stay better. The breakfast was fabulous and our waiter Tofael made sure we had a great experience. If I get back to New York, I would stay here again.

This place has gone downhill dramatically I think he last two years. The bathroom mirror was broken. The toilet was broken, there was yellow stains on the wall with peeling wallpaper. Cracks in the ceiling and dritry curtains. It pains me to leave this review because I stayed here for a few nights 2 years ago and it was great. But this time I had to check out a day early because I couldn’t put up with the room, the staff were very rude and the bathroom close to the bar had urine all over the floor.

Not a bad word to say about this hotel, they’re always so friendly, the rooms are always so tidy. There’s a little food place downstairs to go to if you’re on the go! The beds are comfy, would highly recommend if you’re planning to stay in Times Square!We paid extra to have a view of Times Square, and it was well worth it!

I had the pleasure of staying at this gorgeous hotel. My corner room was spacious and modern. Came with the most amazing views. The bed was comfortable and shower had great water pressure. I also loved the restaurant. Will be back!

We had a wonderful experience each morning thanks to our waiter, Tofael. He introduced us to his lovely manager who was engaging, as well. Tofael went above and beyond to accommodate us. Very friendly, huge warm smile and phenomenal service.

We had a lovely stay, the staff was helpful and friendly. If you book your stay through a third party be sure to understand the extra “service fee” charges. We were charged for WiFi without being told the terms upfront, the management did refund the fees but we will definitely clarify first. Overall we will definitely come back!

Extremely courteous and professional. Made sure all our needs were met making it a phenomenal dining experience! One of the hallmarks of Mr Tofael was his timely assistance ensuring that we had a hassle free breakfast experience.Thank you Tofael and thank you Crowne Plaza for the amazing stay!

From Check-in to Check-out, everything was great. Rooms were clean and roomy. Location was awesome. We could walk to most things and had plenty of access to the subway for longer trips. Restaurant staff were extremely helpful especially Tofael. Would stay here again.

I Check in was easy. room was clean, spacious and surprisingly quiet. Only problem we had was getting the view of Times Square we paid for but that was resolved on our second day and they gave us free breakfast at the hotel which was very nice. Very close by to restaurants and shops. Very good location!! Loved staying here.

Came back to this hotel for nostalgic reasons to celebrate my 50th birthday. I was greeted with a warm friendly check in from Erika who I shared my reasoning for coming to New York. Was pleasantly surprise when coming back to my room to have a nice card and surprise from her. Her thoughtfulness and caring goes beyond a job expectations she’s a gem!! I also wanted to mention Wanda from customer service and Michelle the manager The both of these ladies were so accommodating and wanted to make sure I had the best experience here again some more gems!! Finally I like to mention the wonderful service I had at the breakfast brunch Tofael was very sweet, friendly and attentive.. The staff here is amazing the hotel is wonderful can’t say enough thank you Crown Plaza I will definitely be back!!!Margaret from California ❤️

Great hotel! Loved being in the middle of NYC. Nice rooms with a beautiful view of Times Square. The breakfast was also great, and our waiter Tofael provided excellent service. Would highly recommend!

Excellent, especially service at breakfast restaurant, the staff are very friendly and professional, Tofael is excellent server & great guy, he cares about customer experience as whole, I wish I can Hire people like to work in my company

We came here from Vegas Friday 1st March we stayed here before twice a few years ago and never had a problem but this time god how disappointed we were rooms are very out dated and very worn carpets and the telly was terrible couldn’t watch anymore because of the signaling was very poor and to add to the insult we were charged taxes per night disgraceful when you’ve payed premium costs to stay there already not again thank you

Loved the hotel as it was in an ideal location for the subway & tourist buses as well as stepping out pretty much directly into Times Square when walking out the door. The staff were very obliging, especially Rahi, who ensured we enjoyed our evening whenever we spent it in the restaurant & ensured we were okay for drinks, etc. Not much choice with the food but the quality was excellent, especially the steak. There was plenty choice with the drinks. Room was a reasonable size & had a view of Times Square. There is a cafe type area (no seating) for if you require sandwiches, cake or a coffee/tea, etc. The only thing that was missing was a fridge in the room. If I go back to New York at anytime, I would be happy to stay here again.

Super location! Room was adequate but not luxurious. Food in the restaurant was delicious. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Our view was great, looking uptown. Most of the theaters that we wanted to attend were within walking distance and the others a short taxi drive away. Many great eating establishments within walking distance. All in all, a great visit.

Tofael was very ittentive to detail, he went out of his way to make sure My Mom did not have to go back and forth to the buffet. He even packed us pastries for our plane ride home. He made sure we had economical transportation back to the airport by setting it up with hotel transportation. He was very friendly and made sure to check on us every few minutes to make sure We had just what we needed. Tofael made our visit and experience the best when visiting New York. This will forever be our New York hotel and I will make sure to tell everyone how amazing our trip was and recommended people there way! Thanks Again Tofael!!!

There is no doubt about it, the location is PERFECT. I absolutely loved walking out right onto Times Square. I had a room on the 41st floor with a view of TS, which was quite beautiful.The room was quite spacious. The design however, needs an overhaul 10 years ago. It's so utterly tasteless and old that it's almost charming. Plastic toilet seats, plastic and paper cups, wallpaper coming off the wall, finishing starting to crumble, a stench of chlorine for the first night of my stay...at some point the sideboard came apart. I am currently staying at the CP in Berlin- which is everything this hotel should have been. Sleek, modern, airy, calming and sexy- as opposed to dark, dingy, outdated and dusty. The staff was warm and welcoming, did a great job.I was given extra drink vouchers, as I had a long stay.My coffee maker was mouldy, but I received a new one quickly. I got stuck in the elevator on the Ground Floor for about 20 minutes. The hotel didn't at all seem proactive in making an effort to find out who we were and maybe offer us some compensation.This caused me to miss my show. I complained about this and without hesitation three nights worth of facility fees were removed from my bill- this covered the cost of my ticket. I still feel that this is not enough. Being stuck in a small elevator with 8 other people is NOT a fun experience. Do your job and make us forget this ever happened!! Later I heard reports that others, who had stayed here had also got stuck in the elevator.

Family friendly location and highly convenient to Time Square. Couldn't have asked for a more premier location for our stay in Mid-town New York. The breakfast buffet I must admit was a very delicious fare to say the least. I highly reccomend this property.

Stayed 5 nights from 14/03/19. We booked two rooms for a special occasion trip & our request for Times Square view rooms wasn't honoured as 'the hotel is full due to Spring Break'. So what, we booked a whole year ago?? Check in was coldly professional & we weren't offered help with our bags, just told where the lift was. Ok we are capable but still. Our room was tired, old, dark & in need of a refit. Furniture covered in scuff marks, bathroom very dated with a leaking tap, not enough sockets & none with USB ports in them to list a few. There was no fridge, no slippers & robes & no water. Not the room I envisaged spending my Silver Wedding in. Ok in New York you only sleep & shower in it but not the point. Room was clean and we had plentiful towels all week & sheets were changed. Bed was clearly old but it was ok due to massively thick mattress topper. Checkout was again coldly professional - told to 'take your bags downstairs to the luggage guy' when our friends bags were taken away at the desk by a helpful chap and all done for them? Bar staff varied, again very cold, but the guy who served me last night who wasn't a bar server was lovely. This place really needs to up its game as the rooms are awful (unless you are a favoured American guest on Spring break) and it has nothing going for it apart from the location. Will not return (even if it was free) and wouldn't suggest anyone else goes either. Too many other, better hotels in the vicinity. If client services read this and question why I didn't complain whilst there, what was the point when I know I wouldn't have been given a better room as I was told twice that the hotel was full.

This was our families first time to New York City, needless to say the City is beautiful but the service at The Crowne Plaza Time Square Hotel is AMAZING! Ali at the breakfast buffet was so sweet in making sure We had exactly what we needed. We were here for a week and every time We walked in we had drinks and everything we needed waiting for us. Ali was off our last few days of the visit and Tofael picked up right where he left off, making sure to check on us everything few minutes and made sure My grandma did not have to get anything herself!!! AMAZING SERVICE! When We visit New York in the future this will be the hotel We visit. Thank You to Ali, Tofael and the rest of the staff to make our stay and this vacation the BEST one yet!

First room we got was 3 stars at best. The shower wasn't even glass screen but a sliding plastic sheet that did a bad job keeping the water in. The room showed it's age with no fridge, slippers or tooth paste. After our first night, we ask for a room change as the room was right next to the lifts which was preventing us from having a good sleep.The second room we moved into had slightly better layout. The bathroom was alot smaller but at least it had glass screen and doors like a proper shower, no fridge or slippers again. However, the sink had a leakage and was clogging up everytime we used it. So off we go to our third room.The third room was away from the lifts and the bathroom was working but I'm contemplating another change. Why? Well, everytime the neighbour uses their water I can hear a very loud vibration noise as if someone was hammer drilling the wall. Oh and no slippers or fridge, I'm seeing a pattern here.I'm here for 7 nights and this is the 3rd night. So far the only thing good about this place is the location as it is in the heart of times square and the friendliness of the staff as they were very acommodating with the room changes and offered us a complementary breakfast voucher.I'm not sure if I should ask for another room change. I'm starting to doubt myself. Is it me or you Crowne Plaza?

The Crowne Plaza is right in the heart of Times Square. The staff is very friendly and especially Tofael who was our server for breakfast! So helpful and pleasant each morning and gave us great suggestions of places to visit during our stay. Would definitely stay here again.

I travel a lot and I stay most often at IHG or SPG properties. Currently IHG Platinum (previously Spire before I took a sabbatical). This was the worst experience I've had at either.I stayed here one night, then went to Philly. On the way back, I booked a room around 11pm before going to a friend's late night birthday party. When I got to the hotel at 3am, waited in line for 20 minutes because there was only one person at front desk and one couple took forever to process. About to pass out when finally got to the front and was told the reservation was canceled by them because credit card was declined (the number had recently been changed by BofA due to them having a security breach). So here I am at around 3am with no where to stay and they didn't even try to help locate another room elsewhere. I had to book myself at the Intercontinental nearby which was 50-60% more expensive.When I called the front desk and asked to speak to a supervisor to complain about this I was told in a monotone, rude robotic voice that they can't do anything, not even a refund of my first night or even any bonus points. I've been better treated for a coffee maker being broken. I don't write reviews often, but this was the WORST customer service at an IHG or SPG property I've experienced. These people can't even muster the human empathy to apologize for a terrible night and no decency.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Randy X
New York, New York, United States

review_body: We have stayed in New York four times now and decided to try the Crowne Plaza for 6 nights. On arrival at the hotel, after a 16 hour flight, I discovered that I left my camera at the airport. The customer service provided by concierge Melvin was exemplary and he helped us navigate our way to retrieving our camera many hours later. The service provided was, outstanding and this continued for the duration of our stay. Location is perfect. Close to transport, theatres, restaurants. Rooms were a great size, clean, comfortable. Highly recommend and will return again.

Crowne Plaza is a great location to all the attractions that are centrally located in downtown NY. I would definitely stay there again. Clean rooms, wonderful customer service and had a great breakfast every morning. I highly recommend this hotel.

We were here overnight and was greeted by Vanessa at the front desk. She was so sweet & friendly, we knew we chose the right hotel. The room was spacious and clean. We went to the bar before dinner and had wonderful service from Keith. He was very personable, knowledgeable & great to talk to! Since we enjoyed Keith so much, instead of going to our usual pub after dinner, we returned to continue our evening with Keith. It's so nice to go to a hotel bar and receive great service and good conversation!

It is amazing how such a large city hotel can make u feel welcome and special...from front desk check in (thank u Beverly) to bellman, breakfast restaurant servers (Talout?) and the fantastic bartenders, Martin, Phil and Jason. The service is truly exceptional and it shows management has got it right. The room was very clean and comfortable, our wine and cheese order done up very classy. Thank you for giving us another memorable experience at the Crown. I am an IHG Platinum member and this hotel makes me thankful that I am!

Visitng NYC for a sporting tournament at Madsion Square Garden and to attend the theatre. Victoria M. at the front desk was awesome in resolving a reservation issue at check in. Excellent service! Our room was well appointed, immaculate and beds comfortable. Location is central to theatres and within walking distance to the Garden. With all the excitement of TimesSquare. We had breakfast at the hotel; food was good and price comparable for city and size of buffet. The lounge was a great place to meet for drinks. We plan on returning.

Excellent Front desk staff. We requested corner room upgrade, which worth every penny and loved the view. Whenever we asked for anything it was delivered to our room within minutes. We tried room service one time only, food was fresh and tasty. Rooms and rest rooms were clean.

Quiet expensive including meal costs but for a large hotel the staff were great and the overall efficiency good. The rooms were of a good size. No water or fridge in room though. Well located. Absolutely fine.

Free upgrade and 4 free drinks vouchers - can't complain. The hotel is nice enough but you spend 99% of your time away from it anyway. One minor thing that did get on our nerves was the street sellers harassing you every time you want out the front door. We ended up using the back door after a few days.

Reservation cancelled!!! GASP- but I was rescued by extra effort. Sandra Esp. is the greatest. Even though the hotel was heavily booked Sarah found me a very nice room after my travel agent had somehow caused my reservation to be cancelled... in triplicate.! I was returning from an overseas trip with 20 hours of travel and very little rest. Arriving at 5:30 in the morning Sarah worked and worked at trying to determine the problem and come up with a solution. Much to my relief I was able to nestle in for some much needed rest.

Stayed 2 nights. When I arrived in my room ESPN and ESPN2 didn't work. I called to inform guest services. Eventually I was told they are having problems with the carrier but they would try to resolve. The following morning I finally got ESPN2. ESPN never was fixed. On the morning of checkout I couldn't get the NBC affiliate - frozen screen. Twice a manager was going to get in contact but never heard back. People were nice but couldn't get the issues fixed. Thus my rating.

I was there for 3 days and service of the hotel was very good. Tofael was the best server in my trip. He just took care of all his guests very warmly and gentely. The food was also amazing. Thank you Tofael

Very good hotel located in the heart of N.Y., 3 minutes from 50th street subway stop. The room was nice, comfortable and clean: Wi-Fi worked very well, the safe was available and easy to use. Included in the price you have phone calls from the room, use of the gym and swimming pool (book in advance, free allowed time half hour). I have just missed a couple of things: smart tv was only allowed to be used with hotel channels (not possible to use Google, YouTube etc); the fridge was not available. My feedback is for sure positive, I suggest this accommodation!

I had hopped in for a quick business breakfast - the buffet was sumptuous and the waiter - Mr. Tofael was prompt in his services. He took personalized care of me and also ensured my requirements of being near a power outlet was met to attend my business meetings.

Having a great time at the Crown Plaza Resort, thanks to Tofael & Victoria ! Everyone has gone above & beyond to make my trip special & because it is my birthday they threw in a free drink voucher & breakfast buffet. Highly recommend.

Great stay. Really loved Ali at breakfast. He helped get every day off right. The rooms were very clean and when we needed some additional sheets and blankets the assistance was quick. Great location to be for a vacation.

I truly am enjoying my stay and Tofael and Ana were extremely kind and exceedingly helpful. When traveling one wants to feel welcomed and accommodated and they went out of their way to make sure I was pleased. Carita Council

I can highly recommend this hotel , we stayed 7 days we a family of 6 and were unexpectedly given adjoining rooms which was very handy the spacious rooms were beautiful cleaned every day All the staff were always polite and helpful in particular Rahi at the bar who recommended lots places worth a visit but best of all he always knew our drinks order upon arrival with a simple nod even though it was a very busy bar/restaurant We chose this hotel mainly for its location and the fact it had a pool . The gym sauna and changing areas were excellent well equip with all you need but I would advise them to pay more attention to the upkeep of the actual pool it’s a bit shabby and would benefit with some more cleaning especially the side walls but all in all brilliant place to stay . Pio B

Let me tell you about customer service. Donald Mei is IT. This company better never lose him. Period. Due to this crazy cyclone bomb storm, my flight has been canceled three times. Not only did Donald go out of his way to get me back into the same room the first time, he got me the same rate that my company had previously secured, gave me new drink and food vouchers AND was overall invested in helping me feel as calm and comfortable in the given situation as possible. When I found out that yet again my flight was to be canceled tomorrow, I tried a different agent because Donald was busy, and was told the entire hotel was booked and that nothing could be done. I thanked them and said I wanted to just check something with Donald.....who worked his magic...and got me into my same room for one more night andddddd with coffee/drink/food vouchers! Whew! I seriously have never felt this level of accommodation at any other hotel, and I travel for work frequently! I feel so at-ease now, even given all of the hectic travel issues I’ve had!I just wanted to make sure that this man got the credit he deserves, because I can tell he goes above and beyond for his guests frequently! Any establishment would be blessed to have him!

The hotel was awesome in almost every way except for the temperature in the room. We could not get it cool enough, but in every other way it was great. One of the main highlights is the service staff, especially Rahman, who is in the dining room during breakfast. He takes great pride in his work and was fantastic to each of us every morning. He and the staff started our day off in a great way.

Tofael made our breakfasts enjoyable with his light hearted conversations. The rest of the stay was absolutely worth the money. The location is very central and accessible. Absolutely recommend the hotel.

Excellent service from our room to our waiter Tofael in the Brasserie restaurant! This is our second time staying at The Crowne Plaza and we will definitely be back again. The City is AMAZING! We toured The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island tour was awesome. We had a wonderful room service meal at The Crowne when were too e hausted to go back out!Great Mother/Daughter trip!

Stayed in a 2 bed room with my son on spring break. When we checked in we were told room wasn’t ready and they took my phone number to call when it was. No problem. Unfortunately we left our luggage with bell hop, took off towards subway and within 5 minutes they called saying room was ready. Awful timing. Once we got back to room my son opened bedside table drawer and was grossed out to find about 6 used tissues from previous guests. Yuck. When i just rearranged pillows on my bed I noticed what appears to be blood on the fitted sheet where the pillows were. Disgusting. Itself too late now to call and ask for a new room. I will unhappily strip the fitted sheet, try snd sleep and get out asap in the morning. It’s sad the lack of cleaning has to ruin such a great location. Will not stay at a Crowne Plaza again after this experience.

This hotel is wonderful. The staff were attentive however, one person really like to thank is Milton, concierge for the hotel. He guided us through out our stay. He's very knowledgable and very patient. He made our trip worth it.

This hotel is heart of times square. All the attractions were walking distance. Milton, concierge at the hotel is just a pure diamond. He really made our trip the best possible experience we could've had. We truly like to thank him for everything he'd done for us.

If you really like a hotel and the staff who give it "personality" and make it come alive, when you arrive, you're already feeling great. And what makes this property special are my friends, the Managers and servers. And while I don't know everyone's name, I always recognize those who consistently contribute to the quality of my stays.Sylvia Geronimo in the Executive Office always takes my reservation, offers me the best possible rate and insures that any reasonable request is satisfied. And any Front Desk services I might require are always promptly organized and delivered by Juliet Chang and Yoaquina Rollins. And anything to do with my breakfast, lunch or snacks is the domaine of Agathe Texier, the Director of outlets. And as I always have breakfast at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan in their fabulous "Brasserie 1605", all of the servers are simply amazing. And after several years of returning, I even know their names by heart: Ali Rahmat, Tofael Chowdhury, Rahman Mohd, Travis Sherrod, Mahfuz Chowdhury, Tareq Mohammed and Ana Gonzales (hostess). They are now my "Long-lost cousins". They keep an eye on my table for two (I dine alone) and appear as if from nowhere anticipating my every request. And they never ask if I would like an orange juice to start, because they know I prefer not. And they efficiently pour my initial cup of black coffee, because they know I do not take cream, milk or sugar.So, as I said in my previous review of my residence at the Crowne Plaza Times Square, I always feel appreciated, but now as well loved as a "Member of their Family". And needless to say, I'm already counting the days until I return to New York City in November and rejoin my NYC family. Life is good, especially when I'm at my Home Away from Home, the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. Amen.

I treated my folks to a trip to NYC as they have both retired and never been. As January is low season I managed to find an amazing package with Aer Lingus flying from CWL to JFK via DUB and as it was their first time I thought Times Square would be a good place to stay, although its certainly not my favorite area of New York. The hotel is brash and impersonal but this is what I expected. There was a bit of a queue at check in but it seemed to go fairly quickly. Check in staff were ok by New York standards. We had a double double which was big enough for the 3 of us and the room itself was fine. The shower was a little temperamental and took a bit of practice getting the water between ice cold and boiling hot but we got the hang of it after a while. Beds were very comfy though. On the negative side we really did not like the outrageous service charge. I would prefer you pay for what you use so if you use the gym/pool then pay for it. In reality we paid $150 for 5 days of Wifi! There is a nice cafe in the lobby area which was not too expensive but the cost of breakfast was a bit too high. Instead we found a fantastic diner called Times Square Diner behind the hotel and went there every day for a proper NYC breakfast saving us $$$.Would I go back? Not really as its not a location I would choose again and its not my style of hotel but the main reason - the service charge just feels like daylight robbery.

I stayed here from Feb 8-10 and have nothing but good things to say. I requested for an early check-in and got to my hotel around 10am and my room was ready. This was so great, I went with my mom and brother and we were able to freshen up after our flight and put our bags away so allowed us to enjoy the rest of the day! Victoria Martin at the front desk was so lovely, I shared with her that it was a family trip because my brother was now healthy after having a double transplant of kidney and pancreas and she just really set the stage for our time there. The hotel was perfect, right across from the M&Ms store and great view of Times Square, within walking distance to everything. The room was just perfect, slightly dated but are you in your room when your in NYC anyways. The beds were super comfy, the location and view perfect, I would definitely go back again and recommend this hotel! Right down the street from Ellen’s Stardust diner, Juniors Cheesecake (best burger I’ve ever had), across from Hershey’s store, walking distance to Rockafeller Centre, Radio City Music Hall and Magnolia Bakery, plus Chicago is playing right behind the hotel. I would definitely recommend staying here when in New York!

The Crowne Plaza Hotel is right in Times Square - If offered an upgrade to a Corner Room, take it, it's certainly worth it. One window overlooks Times Square (Father Duffy Statue). The other a picture window the length of the room looks out over Manhatten towards the water. The staff are excellent at the front desk, the restaurant & also housekeeping. Would definately return. Highly recommended.

Tofael was such a great waiter at breakfast! Very kind and attentive. Good selection at the buffet, full of options for everyone. It is a better idea to include it in the price of your stay vs pay a la carte.

Imran took very good care of us. Wanda was also great in Guest services . We received a 2 drink vouchers, 2 grab and go meals, and a $25 Food coupon. It was so helpful. We loved the corner room with a southeast exposure and gorgeous view of Times Square on the Executive Floor. What a great way to celebrate our 41st anniversary of our first meeting. We will definitely return to Crown Plaza Times Square. I am sure they will treat us just as well on our return trip.
user_name:
Yaakov S
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing hotel the staff is amazing Tofael has been really good in service. ALI is also one of the amazing staff numbers they have. One of the best places to stay near Times Square walking distance to the Main Street

this hotel is right in times square with easy transport links near by.The breakfast was good, lots of choice. the bar was nice and we used our drink vouchers.the hotel rooms are tired and need updating and are very basic, no nice touches.we requested a quiet room but ended up next to the service floor and drilling from the floor above.the hotel did a good job at fixing this and i cant fault them for their response.i enjoyed my trip to NY but i don't think i would stay here again due to the old fashion feel. i personally like a more modern hotel and i think there might be better options for the same price.

The room was according with what we reserved. Great cleaning service, and good isolation from the outside. We were on 26th floor and could barely hear what was happening on Times square while we had a great view to it.

Really enjoyed our stay at the Crowne plaza . Excellent location , wonderful service . The breakfast buffet has a great spread . Tofael was very friendly and went out of his way to provide us what we needed. Highly recommend!

The location is what makes the hotel so fabulous. I did find that that staff put it the minimum effort while working with their guests. They definitely did not go above and beyond. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for a girls trip to NYC. It was fabulous for access to the subway station and Times Square. We went to see Chicago and it was literally right next door. The room was old, but very clean. My only complaint about the room is that not all of the lamps were working and hotels already have limited lighting. I would still recommend this hotel for your stay in NYC, the location makes up for the staff's bad attitude.

Sorry but I have to say that this hotel is terrible. My window is seeping cold air, the carpet is really gross, dirty and old and I am very sad that I have pre-paid and cant move to another hotel. Smells of bleach, as the cleaners have tried to scrub the old out but this tired hotel needs a re-model....

My first visit to NY staying at the Crowne Plaza at Times SquareThe location was excellent. Right in the heart of theatreland. Although the room was a little small for the family that didn't spoil the trip. How much time do you actually spend in a room while in NY anyway? The amenities at the hotel were great. A small deli type bar for snacks and a great bar that overlooks the street. We had a couple of drinks and a wind down after each full days activities. The reception staff were helpful at both check in and check out.I would have no hesitation staying here again if I do manage another visit to this great city

We've been there twice, you can't argue with the location. The breakfast was pretty good. The concierge was great, she made our trip with thoughtful meal and sites choices. I wish I could remember her name but it was 2 months ago, I think Corrine. The main issue is the property could use a good renovation. Check in is uber busy so try to arrive early.

This hotel is in the perfect location. Especially if it is your first time visiting NYC.On arriving at the Hotel I was met by a lady behind the front desk by the name of Rosa. She was so welcoming and kind to both myself and my son. She was more than happy to answer any of my questions and nothing was too much trouble. This is the sort of person you want to greet you at a hotel after a long flight! Even if she was sick of checking people in or out that day - you would never have known. A bright smile and big welcome. Thank you so much Rosa!Hotel room had a fantastic view of times square. The room was clean, warm, spacious and welcoming. The best night's sleep I've had in a long time. Beds are soooooo comfy!A few issues with the shower trying to regulate the temperature but it was easy once I got the hang of it. Everyday on our return to the room the bed was made, fresh towels supplied along with shampoo etc. Personal belongings were exactly how you left them too. I wasn't aware there was a coffee/tea maker until two days in as it was hidden in the cupboard but we made the most of it once we came across it. Perhaps this would be useful on show for the guest like me who doesn't look in every cupboard unless I'm going to use it. On returning to the hotel in the evening on my sons birthday, there was an ice bucket with some refreshments in, a huge slice of cake and a card for my son wishing him a happy birthday and a great stay. Thank you again Rosa. This was so thoughtful and it really did make my sons day. He was so pleased with it!In the mornings we would head down to the restaurant where we would be greeted by a waitor called Ali. What a fellow! He is just the chap you need in a morning. There he was, every morning, with a welcoming smile and a pot of coffee a hand. Again, nothing was too much trouble. Ali would take an interest in what plans you had for your day and would openly offer help and information if needed. Then the next morning he would remember you and ask you about your day and how it went. It's the little things like this that make all the difference. Just by being polite and helpful. By taking an interest in people and wearing a smile. Thank you Ali for your first class service. You are a credit to Crowne Plaza.The breakfast menu was more than enough and had plenty of options to choose from. Self service makes it even better, as much or as little as you want!Overall the stay was great. Except from the morning of leaving. The conciere gentlemen had mistakenly informed my shuttle bus provider that I was going to JFK wheh I was actually going to Newark. An innocent mistake. When I informed the lady on the front desk that the driver of the shuttle bus had left because he was given the wrong information her initial response was 'so, what do you want me to do about it' The obvious response was help!!!!! She then told me to take a cab to the right airport and failed to acknowledge the conciere/hotels mistake. I found her very stand offish in the first instance. However, she did get the hotel manager after some discussion and he was great. He immediately arranged new transport and luckily we made it to the airport on time.If you want a central hotel. Comfy bed. Great breakfast and a clean room everyday then the Crowne Plaza is the place to go. Whoever was cleaning room 3813 between the 28th of Feb and 5th of March - Thank you for working so hard. Your bed making skills are on point too!See you in the summer Crowne PlazaNote:The outside of the hotel does not do the inside any justice.

Arrived at the hotel at 4pm and our room wasn’t ready. Staff member gave us an upgrade and we had drinks vouchers to use in the bar whilst we waited. On arrival of our room we had a large room with windows looking over Times Square... fabulous view. The only downside to our roomWas it was right next to the cleaners lift shaft so we were woken up very early in the morning by the noise. Facilities clean. Shower wasn’t great, couldn’t seem to regulate the temperature very well. Cleaners came every day to make bed however bins weren’t always emptied and on a few days dirty towels were taken but not replenished. The bed was amazing... so comfy. The light in our bathroom and our bedside lamps were a little temperamental and sometimes wouldn’t turn on but we didn’t mind. We went to New York to elope and this hotel is in the best location to central manhattan. Everything is on the doorstep which made the holiday very easy. It is our second time to New York. One morning we were told we could get a coffee in the breakfast seating area without eating but then another member of staff, Fergus was quite rude and told us off for being there despite another member of staff saying it was ok. You have to pay a resort fee at check out which totalled about $32 per day. We only used the WiFi and no other facilities so this was quite steep I feel. You have to pay an extra $10 pp to use the spa. The nicest surprise we had was the day after we got married a bottle of Prosecco and a cheese board was delivered to our room by the hotel. This was a lovely gesture, thank you. Overall the hotel is clean and is a great location. The check in staff and check out staff were most helpful and very polite. Thank you for being part of our wedding break!

My boyfriend and I and another couple stayed in Crowne Plaza Hotel for 4 nights, returning home today. We had searched through hundreds of hotels before booking this one and the location was the decider when booking, this was not wrong. The location of this hotel is fantastic, located in Times Square, you can walk through the Broadway district and you are walking distance to bigger attractions such as Empire State and Rockefeller Building. The hotel room was clean and spacious. We were lucky to have a corner room so got 2 large windows with great views of Times Square. The bed was huge. The hotel has a bar and restaurant, we did not use the restaurant and there is many of places to eat around the hotel and in NYC, however, we used the bar and the service was excellent. The staff take your order quickly and bring your drinks over. The hotel has a service charge which came to $137 at the end of our stay, I didnt agree with this charge, the only benefit we used from this was the wifi, we did not use the gym or telephone in the room, so I thought this was a bit of a con for guests like ourselves.The showers in the room are not great, the temperature would never stay at the temperature you set and you'd often find yourself being scalded by the water after 2 minutes of being in there. Towards the end of our stay, we had a problem with noisy neighbours at ridiculous hours of the morning, which the staff said was a 'school trip', this was very disturbing and annoying but was eventually sorted. My boyfriend and I were lucky to have an end room, however, the other couple with us had a 'inter-connecting' type room, doors obviously locked in the middle but this meant the noise was very loud from inside their rooms and they could hear their next door neighbour snoring through the door! Whilst in New York we did:Helicopter tour - Must do, amazing Staten Island - Free ferry, going past Statue of Liberty9/11 Memorial and Museum Ellen's StarDust Diner Hard Rock Cafe Planet Hollywood Empire State - Top floorRockefeller - Top of the rock (Id say only do one of these buildings, and go with the empire state, the views are exactly the same)Macy's and shopping Be aware that EVERY place you go to expects a tip, even if they haven't done anything for you and you won't get a thank you after giving one as its expected in New York.Overall, an amazing time in New York and loved every minute. I'd come back to this hotel if I revisited the city.

Before I being this is the first time in all my travels I have every left a review. Building older as expected but bathroom was filthy, sink would not drain and it took several tries to flush toilet. Couldn't regulate temperature in room. I had to pay for a second room so we all could be comfortable and that room was so hot. Their suggestion - open the window!! It's March and I like the curtains closed to sleep!!! They put in a portable air conditioner that literally stuck a tube outside and left the window and curtains open... DAY MANAGER GRANT SABAR WAS RUDE, ARROGANT and CONDESCENDING. Don't know if it was that I am a woman or handicapped but he talked to me like I was an idiot and tried to trip up what I was telling him. I just had to shake my head and laugh at him for his feeble attempts. Granted, he was very fortunate there were children in the lobby or I would have not been nice. He actually called my room and asked if I was leaving so he could rent the rooms. If my daughter had not just injured herself I would have been gone but moving her was too painful. The night manager Jason McPherson(sp?) was extremely nice and tried to help all he could. I must say the rest of the staff were very nice and made every effort to make up for the managers attitude. I could have lived with the inconveniences if he had not been a - well let's say not nice person. Saving grace of trip was we had a nice view of Times Square.

We had a mishap with our neighbor smoking all night and stinking us out. The hotel sent someone immediately and brought us an air purifier. To go one step further they paid for us to have breakfast before we left to catch our plane. Ali was Super helpful, friendly and professional. Great views to time square.The restaurant was clean and the breakfast was tasty. The hotel is so lucky to have Ali on the team

You walk into this hotel, which is at such a great location, and the lobby is gorgeous! That sets the stage for a great experience but then we were met with a rude woman at the front counter who seemed more annoyed with our questions that anything. The rooms are okay but small and the bathroom could have been cleaned much better and did not include a coffee pot, microwave, or mini fridge which have become pretty customary (even LaQuinta has them). Our biggest complaint was ac in the room. It was so hot that I was awake most of the night. We were told an engineer was going to come take a look while we were gone but that never happened so the second night we were unable to sleep well again due to the temp in the room. We even tried opening a window to let some cool air in and that didn’t help much at all. Here’s the thing, the hotel is nice, the beds are comfy, but if it’s so hot you can’t sleep-I’ll take my money to one of the other 9,039 hotels in NYC.

We are stopping at the hotel at the moment 4th March and so far we have had to move rooms as the tv didn’t work air conditioning didn’t work so we spoke to the manager and they moved us up to the 44th floor and tbh this room is just as bad the carpet is filthy the tv channels flicker the air conditioner doesn’t go any higher then 21 this wouldn’t be to bad but it’s snowing and it feels like -5 outside we stopped at this hotel a few time but haven’t been here for about 6 years and it’s definitely lost it 4* sparkle and WOW factor we had received on our previous visits we also told the front desk we would pay our service fees in cash and they have still charged our credit card I definitely wouldn’t recommend at the moment as it’s very disappointing once it has a re-vamp I’m sure it will be like it was

The service in the hotel was excellent, all the people I spoke with where very friendly. We had booked a Times Square corner room but we had the back corner which gave more of a view of the Hudson River and only a small opening to see tunes square. The bed was comfy and the room was clean apart from the chair which was very dated and had red stains on which looked like blood. The bedside table also looked old and worn and could do with being replaced. I did inform staff about the stained chair and they informed me they where currently replacing them throughout the hotel.

We periodically go to Manhattan for a show or a Philharmonic concert and often stay overnight at the Crowne Plaza. Everything was perfect in our most recent visit. The location is perfect - directly on Broadway in the heart of the Theater District. Our corner room (on the 44th floor - available to IHG members which anyone can be) offered views to the East river on one side and Broadway to Central Park on the other. The room itself - modern, super clean, and wonderfully comfortable. The Crown Plaza's bar offers window seats overlooking Broadway. Just the best. We were greeted by Victoria who was able to allow us an early check-in and exemplified the friendly and helpful staff.

Great location, very busy as you can imagine, staff in most locations with in the hotel are great , IHG status not really appreciated . Breakfast staff are great and go all out to make your stay great , especially Tofael and Ana . Bar area good and polite as well .

Crowne plaza was an awesome stay they are very accommodating. I especially have to say the waiter Tofael was very sweet and caring. He went above and beyond his job I can now call him a friend. I would definitely stay again.

The service is very kind and welcoming. Specifically, Tofael is very gracious and makes sure that you are enjoying your experience. The food is always fresh and tastes great. You are never rushed out of anywhere and the hotel overall is extremely clean and well taken care of. Great Location in general, and great views from times square and city rooms. Overall, the stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square Manhattan is great, highly recommend.

We came for a girls weekend and from the first day everything was amazing! Our room could use a little more attention to details with cleaning, however service at on site restaurant made up for those imperfections. Our server Tofael was so attentive, helpful, pleasant and made it an experience to remember! He immediately seated us and provided service with a smile. He really made us feel welcomed in a city that is so busy. Thank you Tofael you were amazing .

Used to be decent hotel but my last experience there was absolutely horrible and the follow up by both their local management and IHG guest relations made things even worse, and this is when I am a platinum ambassador, so just imagine what you get without it..... To sum up- their web site is effectively deceiving you to a bad deal and following human interaction, they even switched me to even worse conditions and then haggled like peddlers in the flea market. I moved to a different hotel nearby ( Hyatt centric which is ten notches better on all domains). An experience you would not agree to tolerate at an otherwise reputable chain (my experience on their hotels in China for example is so much better).
user_name:
orfu1
New York City, New York

review_body: We arrived at the hotel on thanks giving and were met with a warm welcome. The room was a little small for 3 people but the facilities are all there and the hotel is beautiful. The hotel is located just across from M&M world at time square - great location! The coffee bar in the lobby is to die for especially in the morning. Highly recommend.

I stayed here for a quick business trip with my co worker. Nice hotel in a great location. It's right on Times Square in the Theater District. You are surrounded by food and shopping, but the hotel has a good dinner and a great breakfast (w/ a great view of the city) if you don't have time to leave your hotel. The rooms are clean and overall the staff was nice. They also help you to hail a cab from downstairs in the lobby. I'd definitely stay here again!

On a "weekend getaway" to NYC for my "Valentine" we stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. The location is fantastic and the accommodations were A+++. The staff could not be more supportive and professional and the experience was fantastic. Ms. Sylvia Geronimo, Executive Assistant, made sure our accommodations were great and that our special requests were met perfectly. The lobby bar is a fantastic meeting place with excellent food and drinks. Our room was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff made sure our amenities were kept stocked. I highly recommend the Crowne for accommodations when in New York. The central location in Times Square provides access to so much of what makes the "Big Apple" great.

My family and I decided to drive to NYC for a night and needed to find a last minute hotel upon arriving to the city. The Crowne Plaza had availability and I was very content with this hotel. The room was cozy and clean. Beds were comfortable, shower and bathroom was clean! Overall very happy with our stay at this hotel. Would stay here again and would recommend it to others!

We booked this hotel last minute, just driving around time square and saw it! Perfect location. I was with my husband, daughter and son, we literally walked out of the hotel in to Times Square. The price was amazing for the service, cleanliness, location etc. Would return to this hotel over and over and DO recommend it 100%

Rooms are small but your not really In your room that much. Clean and prime location . Great value for the price, would totally stay again and again. Loved it!! Get a view room, totally worth it!!Close, walking distance to most sights, easy access to subway.

Loved this hotel food was amazing staff were helpful rooms were clean and tidy and would definitely stay here again .the rooms were very modern and loved the view there was everything we needed in the rooms and another room near us to get ice and a vending machine which was handy

This was our second visit to this hotel. It was an incredibly busy weekend, with unfortunately some guests lacking in good manners. Loud arguments, drunk behavior and overheard throwing up episodes in the middle of the night. The hotel staff was very apologetic, provided extra drink and food coupons and offered a late check out which was perfect. It is a great hotel in a perfect spot to be in the middle of the NYC excitement. It is just very busy, but the staff is very accommodating. Some guests however, don’t know how to behave which happens everywhere.

My wife and I again returned to the Crowne Plaza Times Square on what was the coldest weekend of the winter, The hotel is perfectly situated with theater, restaurants and transportation nearby making the weather less of a problem. The staff, especially Robert and Sandra Esp. at the front desk were really helpful. Can,t wait to return

Great location & service. Close to many attractions & rail stations. Our breakfast server, Tofael was great. Very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean. We stayed for a weekend but wished we could stay longer.

A great place to stay. Highly recommend. It is clean. Convenient to everything. Nice bar and restaurant. The indoor pool is nice and clean. You have to pay for parking, it is the same everywhere around there.

We arrived at the Crown on Friday around 5 PM and had no problem checking in. Although the front staff girl seemed less than enthused to be there,she got right to the point and made no small talk. I found this unusual as the front staff is usually very courteous and kind. I mentioned that it was my anniversary and she couldn’t have cared less LOL Being patrons of the Crowne Plaza quite often,as my son lives in New York City, I just kept the momentum going. We are Platinum Elite Members as well. She gave us the usual drink vouchers and breakfast half off vouchers that we are entitled to. She also offered us the points as well for arrival. I must note the highlight of the trip dining in the restaurant for breakfast both days was meeting Tofael, our waiter. He was a gem! So happy and kind and genuinely cared if you were enjoying yourself. He is a star employee.... please know he is definitely a keeper! We will ask for him when we come back in March! Only disppointment is the 30.00 service fee! I hope Crowne can find a way to waive this for their elite members. To pay 30.00 extra per night for perks that should be included in a hotel rate is a bit ridiculous. If members reach platinum Elite status perhaps that should be a perk.... no added service fee.Lastly, housekeeping was wonderful on our floor. Room 3314 needs a new faucet but was spotless when it comes to housekeeping! Great job Crowne! Now please go check tht faucet and look into that service fee!!

Enjoyed a 5 night stay here in December 2018. Nice room, great location and really good food in the bar area. Great place to sit with a bottle of wine & a nice dinner watching the world go by outside. Well equipped clean room and very comfy bed. Usually stay in the Hilton Times Sq but we preferred this due to the location and the restaurant.

Our breakfast in the morning was always delicious! There was always plenty of food and nice hours to make sure we got our first meal in! Our waiter Tofael brought us drinks to gon and checked on us regularly. Definitely a good place to start your day!

I stayed here for 3 nights. You cannot beat the location. Central for everything. Ana staff member of the breakfast team was so helpful. She gave directions and assisting in answering my questions. On the last day we left our bag at our table, she called up to our room and secured the bag, all was there, nothing missing. Try and get the higher floors much quieter. Thanks Ana.

We stay here each year while we are in town for IHS. The rooms are clean and comfortable.We enjoy a delightful breakfast each morning which gets us ready for a long day. Our server Tofael is courteous and does wonderfully taking care of us in a fast and friendly manner. We will be back again next year!

This hotel desperately needs maintenance and guest services overhaul. An hour after checking in, the twin bed literally pulled away from the wall and collapsed. Front desk was apologetic and moved us to another room. New room had a broken lamp and the shower control was falling off so that it was an adventure finding a temperature between freezing and scalding.$20 room service hamburgers were served on plastic plates. The location was great and the employees friendly, but the hotel needs a renovation to make the rooms functional.

My husband and I stayed here for one night when in town to see a show. The room was neat, clean, and well appointed. The views were great! While we didn’t take advantage of the many amenities the hotel has to offer - the service was lovely and kind and we would certainly return! It was easy to walk to the theaters and plenty of great restaurants. As someone who has always taken a train into the city I was a little nervous about how the parking would work. While not cheap (70/day but all parking is expensive), it was super easy to park at the hotel. We went right from the highway to the avenue the hotel was on and right into the garage! A valet did the rest. We never had to drive through Times Square which I was nervous about!

Stayed in this venue for business meetings. Although everyone is the staff was amazing, I can't say the same for the Front Desk Agent Erika. We asked for a room extension and rather than politely telling us we couldn't keep the rooms she responded with a bad attitude. It honestly made the Business reconsider our options for future business meetings. Erika was on duty 2/21/2019 at 8:00 AM.

Came to NYC with my parents for a 3 day trip. Got here at 9:30 am. Sandra Esp helped us out. She thought my parents might be tired and checked us in early. She was very friendly and courteous. A very good experience :)

We arrived in New York in a early flight and arrived at the front desk asking about early check in. Sandra esp was very helpful and even got us in our room early. The room is very clean and has a great view of the city. Will definitely be back

Just got home after 4 night stay with daughter and granddaughter Christmas gift for me. 26th floor great view of Times Square. Perfectly situated. Rooms a little tired but were clean, bed so comfortable and plenty choice at breakfast. Staff very helpful and Ali at breakfast a delight.

Was booked to stay for three nights starting February 15, 2019. Lobby was a bit run down but not horrible. Opened the door to our room and the odour was obvious. The room was very hot and the thermostat didn't work.The carpet was filthy and the walls were stained. Furniture was dusty and sticky. Checked the beds and discovered the sheets and pillows case were dirty and had brown smears. Called the front desk who advised us that they didn't have housekeeping staff on in the evening so nothing they could do. Said they would bring clean linens and we could make the beds ourself. Linens didn't arrive. Called around and made reservations at another hotel. Forced to stay the night but left in the morning. This is at best a two star hotel and that is just for the location. Wasn't expected luxury but this falls into the flop house category of hotels.

Great location and it is easy for me go to office in Manhattan by feet. The staffs are so nice and understanding. If you book a room, I highly recommended you add a breakfast as the hot buffet is one of best in Manhattan. The smoke salmon and vegan juice so good. The room I stay has a corner window. The beautiful time square night view just in front of me.

My brothers girlfriend booked this trip so that we could meet for the first time... The Room was gorgeous...and Staff was outstanding, especially Kim the friendliest bartender in Manhattan. Thanks for a great trip crowne royal and staff!

We are IHG Elite members and stayed for the first time in the Crowne Plaza Times Square. From the moment we were treated "like gold" from Evelyn at the front desk - we knew that our stay was going to be a memorable one. The hotel was clean, conveniently located to Broadway shows and restaurants and service was exceptional. Thank you Evelyn and staff for making our stay enjoyable.

We are IHG Spire Elite members and have stayed at this location many times; it’s our go-to hotel in NYC, for its excellent midtown location and very good service. The manager, David Kanters has been particularly helpful in providing attentive and friendly service. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Average hotel, great location near to attractions, restaurants, etc. Spacious bedrooms, very clean and very comfortable beds. Could do with carpets renewed. Lovely views in the Times Square rooms. Good bar, staff were great here. Only down side was some of the reception staff were off hand, unhelpful and had an attitude! Arrived after 3pm. And our rooms were not ready, no sorry.Then had a problem with checking out which had to be sorted out by British Airway holidays in uk, no sorry again. Even the reception manager was no help.Used the hotels suv’s To JFK airport good price for 5 and the driver was excellent.

My family group stayed here for 3 nights in four rooms. Each room was very comfortably furnished with excellent coffee machines, wide screen TVs, toiletries, hairdryers and comfortable beds. The views from each of the rooms did differ but two of them offered pretty amazing Times Square vistas. Some of our group used the on-site facilities of gym and swimming pool and told me they found them to be very good. we did not eat in the restaurant but enjoyed the bar area for early evening drinks and a short rest before heading out into the big wide world of Manhattan! we also grabbed a quick on the go breakfast from other barista which was more than adequate.Location wise you cannot fault this hotel and I should mention that one of our party was disabled and had to use a wheelchair, which did not prove to be an issue in the slightest. The concierge was very helpful and she had good, sound advice. Perhaps not the most inexpensive hotel to stay at but considering it's location and the accommodation I have to say I think we paid a reasonable nightly rate.

We stayed in CPTS for 4 nights and had the best time. We were able to walk to so many big attractions. Staff were so friendly and helpful but especially Trevis who made us and our children feel so welcome. He gave us so many tips/advice for our trips out and we just loved him. My children miss him already. Thanks again Trevis

Couldn't beat the location of this hotel. Right on. times Square, handy for all restaurants and subway. our room was large, very clean and comfortable. Bed was huge and very comfortable. A bit dated in parts, could probably do with a freshen up. Plenty of sockets and usb's. Staff were friendly and helpful. Nice little coffee shop in lobby also selling cakes, salads etc Resort fees were quite high but did include the wi-fi and a free drink each. Would recommend this hotel for convenience and location.

Stayed here for a 4 night stop.. fantastic views of Times Square,Rooms are comfortable and spacious, Food was great, hospitality was superb,, Donald Mei on the front desk couldn’t do enough for you.. will I be back ??? 100% Yes.. so much better than previous hotels I’ve stayed in.... a little gem ...

People like Rahl made for another great experience. Not only was his service great, but his attitude and caring for customers reflect the overall professionalism of the Crown. He deserves more than a five star rating. Overall another wonderful weekend at a first class hotel. Well managed and exceeds your expectations. I would highly recommend. Location is fabulous.

To begin. This hotel is centrally located across from the M&M world in Times Square. Great location and easy to get around to subways, and stores. Check in process was great and efficient (be aware if you book third party they put a hold of $75/night on a credit card. Otherwise it was wonderful. Our room was good. Bed was comfortable, shower clean and towels refreshed. Only problem was the curtain was ripped which caused lighting to come in from the sunlight and tv screens. Informed front desk and they sent an “engineer” who put new hooks and said they had to replace it. None the less for 3 days no fixing was done.If you happen to stumble at concierge the lady working there namd Carina will probably be one of the few most helpful there. If celebrating an event avoid speaking to most people there as my partner spoke to Trish and she said she would send up a bottle of something the day of and that never came. Luckily my partner also mentioned it to Carina and she came to the room with some goodies which had put a smile on my face.Lastly housekeeping. Will tell you now be aware of them. I had good service day 1. Second day a new maid came in upon asking for a change of sheets she huffed and puffed. Not to mention secondly there are no refrigerators as expected so i used an ice bucket to keep things cold. The morning before stepping out i left an item in a bag and in that ice bucket to keep cold. Upon returning i was reasy to end my birthday celebration off with some good expensive desert i had cooling down, and come to find it was thrown out. The bucket was emptied and put back in its original place. The maid claims she touched nothing. Yet there were 2 eyewitness to know that item was left there in the morning. So if they do that who knows what else they may do. Just a heads up that housekeepers name was Kathalina S. I hope they follow up with her on this matter. That could have been my insulin had i been a diabetic or who knows. Lastly, thank you to Wanda from Guest asistance in inroom phone for being able to get me through to resolve the housekeeper issue. She called me back throughout the time to make sure i was getting a resolution and managers were calling me. Thank you again. Overall aside that issue i would think of staying here again, but ensuring to speak or leave notes for housekeepers.

Had a great family stay, celebrating our son's 21st birthday; it was our 2nd time staying here but his first; from the moment we arrived and were greeted by Freddie (amazing personality and great charisma) we knew the stay would be fantastic; he provided many recommendations to supplement our trip and was spot onthis hotel is in a great location, not only in Times Square but very short walks to many of the subway stations that will get you anywhere in New York City; the gym is fantastic with everything you'd need to maintain your workout routines; the bar and restaurants were always busy and served some good drinkswhenever we return to NYC we will stay here, has been amazingthank you Freddie for helping us have a great 21st birthday celebration

We came in after an extremely long flight very tired and Sandra greeted us with the biggest most warm smile and energy. We had a little issue trying to check in and she went out of her way to make sure we did not have to worry and stress. She went above and beyond for us we were extremely grateful if you ever plan to stay here and have Sandra check you in you are extremely lucky!

In the heart of the city (Times Square), short walk to Broadway playhouses, Radio City, Central Park, Etc.. Great deals available here as well. Parking $70, but that’s really not bad. Beds and linens were very comfy. Good value! Second time here, certainly not the last!

We came into New York for business and we were using our business cc, that was in my bosses name on it. I had emailed over what I thought all the paperwork, but I missed some things. I brought hard copies of a couple things, and my company emailed one thing, and Vanessa went up to the billing office with this extra items to make sure it would all work and went through. Vanessa went way above and beyond to ensure that we were all good. And the whole time she was smiling as she was working on it. Thank Vanessa for all your help, I really appreciated it.

We arrived today 8:30am and the room was ready for us. The Check IN was quick, and Sandra at front desk was nice and kind. I hope we will enjoy our stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. Thank you!

Great service from Sandra Esp, she was very helpful and kind. We love the room and view. We got a room with the view of the Hudson. The hotel is in the perfect location and would definitely come back again.

In the centre of NYC The hotel is $150 dollar ride from JFK Airport, that's where the badness ends. The front of house staff Are fantastic and really helpful! The facilities are brilliant 24hour bar, room service, brilliant breakfast! The whole hotel Is really clean! The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortableNice job Crown Plaza

We will never return to this hotel under any circumstance. Living in CT we frequent the city with our children. I see why this hotel was at a steal. You get what you pay for. The hotel was dirty and dated. Our thermostat was broken. After returning late at night from seeing a show with our children, we snuggled up and got right to bed only to be woken up in the middle of night drenched in sweat. Our room was close to 80°. Having 2 small children calling to deal with maintenance or moving rooms was not an option. When I expressed my concern the next morning while checking out, the lady was extremely rude and told me in a snarky voice "Our service is 24 hours, you should have called. Nothing I can do about it now." Then called for the next in line while I was standing there. She didn't even take note of it. Feel sorry for the person who has the room after us. I have NEVER dealt with such poor customer service. We did not get a chance to use the pool, but check the reviews. It's a lap pool not a fun family friendly pool. Horrible horrible experience.

I really liked my room at the Crowne Plaza. Great location and good space in the room itself, and the lobby bar overlooking Times Square is cool. They have some great incentives for travelers - like a free drink at the bar, and free breakfast. I used the gym which was outstanding. It's a real gym for the community, and hotel guests have free use of it.

We had a wonderful stay at the Crowne Plaza Hotel. The rooms were lovely and clean, and the staff couldn’t be nicer. A special mention to Ali who seated us and assisted us with breakfast each morning. Nothing was too much trouble, and he ensured we had everything we needed. Would highly recommend and will definitely return in the future.

My mother, my 15 year daughter and I came to NYC with an extensive list of what we were going to accomplish. It was the first time we had stayed at this hotel, and we loved it so much that we are staying here again when we go back in a couple of months. The room was, well “roomy”. Two double beds that were quite comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with double sinks and large tub/shower. The bar has great views and attentive staff. We enjoyed cocktail hour (which included Shirley Temples for the underage drinker) each afternoon/evening. The breakfasts were AMAZING. The restaurant opens at 6:30 which was when my mother and I would go and enjoy a peaceful and quiet breakfast buffet. This buffet puts other ones I have seen to shame. I cannot stress how enjoyable it was to only have to go to the dining room in our hotel to have a great breakfast with no crowds - to sit, enjoy coffee leisurely and plan our day. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The hotel is in a great location, right across from Junior’s, near Del Marino restaurant (LOVE THUS PLACE), across from many shops and walking distance to lots of theaters. I am very excited to go back soon!

Great time of year to visit! Crowds were average, and the Broadway shows, food, shopping were awesome. We also visited the major sites along with the 911 Memorial...there are NO words! Can't wait to visit the city again!

Great central Hotel. Very quick check in. Staff were all friendly and accommodating. Great room size with a view facing the Hudson on the 31st floor. A little noise, but not enough to loose any sleep and your in central New York City. Lovely food in the bar area with drinks and food pretty reasonable. I was a bit worried about this hotel from reading some of the reviews, but I was really impressed and would definitely recommend to my family and friends.

When we go to NYC, we always stay here. The rooms are clean and comfortable, though showing some wear. The location is super convenient and the service is always top notch from check in, concierge, housekeeping and wait staff at the Brasserie. Shout out to Tofael who aways remembers me (which blows me away considering the number of people he must see on a weekly basis!) and provides excellent service!

Wife and I booked here for 5 nights.Hotel is fine, starting to feel and look abut tired. Resident toilets on ground floor , if you wanted to sit down on a loo was very poor. All but one door didn't lock, very hit and miss with the loo paper.Bedrooms were ok nothing more.Drinks expensive but to be expected considering the area.Staff very helpful, Great location,Would I come here again yes.Didn't eat there so can't comment on

The Hotel is in a very good location, it has everything around such as restaurants, tours, shows, theaters, and more but we had some issues at the beginning such as dirty clothes forgotten of the previous guest in the dresser and one hour waiting for a change not working safe. The hotel Manager Julia helped us a lot to changed the bad image we took from the beginning and at the end we had a good experience. The worst part was a maintenance staff who stopped to watched our tv while he “was repairing our safe “ of course after the dirty underwear man clothes forgotten in the dresser. We had to wait more than 1 hour to all this to be done. We appreciate very much the effort of the management to erase these issues and try to make a difference experience. We would like to recommend this hotel because of the location and the good intentions but not of the excellent service of the maintenance staff.

Perfectly located in Times Square with all major attractions just a short walk away. The times square views are amazing! The room was nice, clean and very comfortable, but would benefit from an update. Every single person I encountered on staff was very nice and helpful. Really a pleasant stay.
user_name:
Lisa S
West Palm Beach, Florida

review_body: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza from 3-8 Feb arriving at JFK mid afternoon after a long flight from London. We took a Yellow Cab from the airport to the hotel, the traffic was horrendous and took about 1 hour 15 minutes but the yellow cab from the airport is a fixed rate of $52 then tax on top and tip we gave the driver $70. When we arrived at the hotel we could not believe its location, it really is in the heart of everything. We were checked in very professionally by Freddy and allocated room 2027. Although not on the front with a view it was a corner room with good sized bathroom with shower, safe, tv, iron etc - no issues with the room at all. Free wifi throughout the hotel with exceptional strength. Our room was serviced daily to a very high standard. The hotel has a sports bar, coffee shop, restraunt, concierge and direct access onto Broadway. We wanted a good hotel which was central to the New York amenities, with good facilities, clean, with very friendly and professional staff and the Crowne Plaza delivered what we wanted. I, without doubt would recommend this hotel to any visitor and if I returned to New York I wouldn't bother looking at another hotel. Crowne Plaza every time!A personal thanks from myself and my wife to the Crowne Plaza for making our short trip a memorable one.

This hotel is absolutely awesome! First and foremost, it is located in the heart of Times Square, and is a short walk away from all the major Broadway theaters, and all the shops of Times Square (Forever 21, the Disney Store, M&M's store, etc.) Not only is the location outstanding, the rooms were clean, the beds were cozy, the staff was friendly, and my family and I just had an overall awesome stay! We would gladly go back, and recommend it to anyone who plans on seeing several Broadway shows and spending time in Times Square!

My Boyfriend Surprised me with a trip to NYC for my 21st Birthday. This hotel is in perfect position! You have Time Square on your doorstep! The hotel was kept very clean and the staff were lovely. We never ate in the restaurant so we couldn’t review that! The bedroom we were in was huge. It had two double/king beds and two massive windows that looked right over Times Square. We had an amazing stay here and would definitely return!!

My partner and I stayed here on a recent trip to NYC. The Crowne Plaza in Times square was a great location! Food and drinks were great before we headed off to a Broadway show. Will definitely be staying here again in the future.

As usual, I do thorough research for a hotel prior to staying there. Since it wasn't my first time in NYC, I allready perfectly knew where it was located. Checkin was very good, we got a room at floor 39, the views were amazing. Room was very clean, bathroom as well. Very spacious! We just had noisy neighbors, but that's not the hotels fault.
