The price you pay for the combined - location - spacious room -cleanliness,... is perfect! If you look for prices and compare them to other hotels nearby: you will notice that you will pay not much in comparison to similar hotels.

Stay was pleasant, but not outstanding. Checkin was less than efficient and staff was not overly friendly. Rather than being friendly was standoffish. Checking in with my daughter who is a platinum level and it should have been welcoming and friendly atmosphere. Drink coupon was not honored as it was a very specific time. I would not recommend or stay here again... There are many hotels and it would be easy to find one that was more friendly and welcoming. Room was small, clean and ok.Temperature in room was not good and could not really be control to increase or decreased in the cold conditions of the Thanksgiving weekend. Restaurant was less than what I expected in NY. Food was only mediocre.

Nice clean rooms. Beautifully located. If you like to be near all the action in Times Square, I highly recommend the Crown Plaza.Bed was comfortable, room was spacious. I honestly have nothing negative to say about the place.

The stay at the Crown Plaza at Times Square was amazing!!! The play Chicago is right across the street from the Crown and a must see! Friendly staff, great service and the best location in Manhattan ... shout out to Sandra Esp!!

Wasn't very impressed and wouldn't stay there again. A few annoying things happened such as the safe didn't work, so I had to go lock my valuables in a lock box at the front desk - needing assistance every time I need to lock up my stuff (like my laptop) is kind of annoying to begin with but worse because I had to wait in the front desk line every single time. Also, we had to have our shower drain fixed two times. They were quick and efficient in getting it fixed but should have been fully fixed first time. Water collecting at feet when we got there. Fixed first time and it was better but still pooling at our feet (gross after a day in NYC grime all over). Had to request a second fix. Pool is definitely NOT for kids. We called the front desk before we made our reservation to make sure kids could swim there - they were like "of course, all guests can use it". We get there and they did everything in their power to discourage us from having girls swim. First, they tell our girls they have to have a swim cap or shower cap on at all times. We left and went and bought swim caps. Then they tried to tell us that if they were under 16 we had to swim with them (a lie, rules state you need to accompany them - we were in there watching them), they tried to tell us it was full yet only two people were in there, and they told us the lifeguard wouldn't let them in (no reason given). We ignored them and walked in anyway. The pool is small and 4 lane lines fill the pool. So our girls had to swim in a "lane" while lap swimmers acted annoyed we were there. The worst. Do NOT go there for the pool. Lastly, do not go there if the outside temperature is in the 40-60 degree range. They do not have a way to control the temperature well in that range. I am always freezing and I was sweating like a crazy person in our room - it was a sauna. They had maintenance try to fix it but couldn't. So, we had to open our window which was not sufficient. Our room was a balmy 78 degrees and we couldn't do a thing about it. When it was colder outside on our first day (below 30), our room was fine. But for some reason they could not turn the air conditioner on in our room alone?!? They said air conditioner works fine in the summer but they couldn't turn it on in our room and obviously our thermostat just didn't work. It was pretty awful but thankfully really only a huge problem on our last night there. They did compensate us by giving us free breakfast buffet in their restaurant (average hotel breakfast) but I would have preferred a cooler room. I didn't sleep well. Room is also in need of renovation - it wasn't terrible but there is visible dirt on the baseboards, wallpaper peeling in the bathroom, and noticeable wear and tear pretty much everywhere. We appreciated the location as we went to several shows but there are just so many other hotels in that area, we'll stay somewhere else next time. (And also kind of annoying - they're front door onto 7th avenue is shut down?!?) Overall, I'd recommend finding somewhere else to stay on Times Square.

This hotel has a great location just steps from time square. We were impressed with the great service the staff were friendly and the room was comfortable and clean. This hotel is right in Time Square which put all the tourist areas at our fingertips. We enjoyed our stay and will go here again

Not what I was expecting, staff quite rude and not friendly atall. Everything overpriced, 30 dollars a day for Wi-fi !! Bar prices are awfull 25 dollars for 2 glasses lager Rooms are ok. Beds are super comfortable. Our room was opposite the lifts so was very noisy when people useing them all the dinging when lift arrived. The lady on the tour reception is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is best part as it’s fantastic

Excellent hotel! I recommend to anyone who wishes to be dazzled by the lights of Times Square in NYC and wishes to stay in a very neat , comfortable, and pleasant hotel! The staff at the hotel are super!! I would like to mention especially Ms Ana from the breakfast restaurant who is always with a big smile and ready to wait on guests with pleasure!! I have stayed at the hotel a couple of times before and I’ve always met very nice staff!!

Checked in 7pm, found room with noises. People came checked and said would do something. Came back from dinner, nothing had been done. Asked to change room, no more double room, only one king size bed for three people! Worst experience ever. Will never book Crowne Plaza again.

Crowne Plaza on Broadway is fantastic! You are in the center of the universe there right at the beginning of Times Square. It is in the Theater district and directly across the street from the Ambassador Theater and a couple of other theaters as well. It truly is in an incredible location. Very safe and clean. Rooms could use a coffee maker, a fridge, and a microwave. Also, we went in winter so the A/C was fine but, I noticed that it doesn't drop lower than 68 so if you like to sleep cold, it may be a problem in the summer. Bathroom was fine and views from the room were good. At the Crowne you are in the perfect location to begin your NYC adventure.

We returned to our room to find our keys didn’t work anymore. The family next to us were given keys to our room, came in and saw our luggage, and returned to the front desk. This could have ended very badly had we been in the room and the wrong person walked in. Management didn’t seem too concerned about it except wanted to give us new keys.

Just checked in and Ms.Sandra at the front desk was amazing! She got us all checked in with a room with amazing view of Times Square!! The location and finding is great!! Thank you so very much!! Great place to stay!

Heater doesn’t work properly, tried to take a shower but no hot water coming out on both shower and washstand. I had to wear my jacket before I go to sleep.I dont recommend this hotel.Glad that I only stayed here for only 1 day.

It was worst experience I have ever made. I called the room service like 2 hour to ask for water, few times they said okey we'll send but they never send it and the other ones they didn't even answer.

This hotel is super affordable, in a perfect location and is very hospitable. Especially want to thank Sandra Esp in guest services, she was very polite and helpful when our flights were canceled due to the polar vortex! We had to make last minute changes and she helped us without any attitude which is sometimes hard to find on NYC! Can’t thank her enough. And I’m IHG all the way!

Excellent service, kind workers. Helped me a lot.I would recommend this place to all my friends an people that i know. Looks pretty clean and organized. Breakfast is a ++++. Price is really good and accommodations.

My husband and I have just stayed at the crowne plaza Times Square. I would like to recommend the breakfast here . Tofael the waiter really looked after us , was very kind and kept our coffee hot and topped up ...and made it very enjoyable. Would recommend a visit

The hotel is wonderful, but the bartenders make your stay over the top. They made us feel like we was their top concern. Please ask for Martin, Phillips or Martinez the manager. They all was extremely caring. I highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here from 19th to 23rd January and loved it. It is exactly as described and in photos. We were upgraded to a corner room overlooking times square on 36th floor and the view was amazing. A big thank you to Freddy who checked us in. He was great. The only thing I could criticise would be the lack of a fridge in the room and the coffee machine isn't great however there is a lovely coffee bar downstairs. There was one lady on reception who was a little rude however all other staff were fantastic. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again and we hope to return next year.

The hotel is in a great location if you want to be at the heart of the theatre district, lots of attractions nearby. Good size and nice rooms with great views of the city. The lobby is very busy all the time and they have good food and drinks at the lobby bar.

We booked this a month before a 5 night stay in January, hotel looked nice in all the pictures. Check in was smooth and told at the time we had to pay $75 deposit per night of our stay for a service charge which sat pending in my account the whole week. Hotel lobby, reception and elevator room was lovely and clean as well as the hallways to the rooms. Once in the room, it was clean but dark and had to locate all the light switches. Beds were very comfy no fault there. Big armchair looked a bit tired and a metal panel which looked like heating on the wall had fallen off so was wedged closed by the armchair. Had quite a bit of disruption from neighbours going into rooms, lots of door knocking and ding dongs from the lift during the night which was quite restless. Hearing a knock on the neighbours door kept making you think it was your own door. Also not a nice wake up call to hear “SECURITY” shouted through the hallway when they knocked on the neighbours door at 1am. Bathroom was nice and clean however the shower was very powerful and the water was so fierce it hurt to stand underneath for too long. Got free drink vouchers for the hotel bar when checking in which we used at check out waiting for our shuttle home, glad the drink was free because an orange juice cost $5 !!! The newly recruited waiter was quite blunt and rude counting out his tip we gave in front of us at the table... which felt quite intimidating. On check out all we were told was that I had to pay $172 in service charge and resort tax which they’re taking off my card on file and then got a thank you goodbye, which felt quite rude. As well as the doorman and bell boy who looked after our bags were quiet and huffing and puffing at us when we requested to leave our luggage for the day until our evening shuttle to JFK. Overall, the location of the hotel is amazing and is so easy to access wherever in the city you are. Just a bit of extra friendliness needed from the hotel staff and few details needed to update the rooms in the hotel which start to look dated , old fashioned and panels falling apart. I would come back to Crowne Plaza but only because of the location of the hotel and not for amenities or service.

This is a well located, well appointed and comfortable hotel right in the heart of Times Square and very close to the theater district. Our room was upgrades due to IHG Rewards status- this included discounts on breakfast buffet, drink discounts, etc.

Outstanding visit as always. But the best part is having Tofael as a waiter. I always ask for him. He’s the best waiter in NYC. Outstanding service. Great personality. Pays attention to details. Be sure to ask for Tofael. He will make your day special. A+++++++++++.

The location of the hotel cannot be beaten. We were able to walk to almost all places we wanted to visit. Having Broadway shows on the doorstep making it all the more ideal. We requested a room with a Times Square view which was honoured - the view was amazing! The room did feel a little tired as others have mentioned however it was spotlessly clean throughout our stay. All staff encountered were helpful and efficient. The lady who checked us in was particularly lovely, (I didn’t get her name) she gifted us free breakfast vouchers upon realising we were celebrating my 40th birthday. This was a nice gesture which we appreciated. The breakfast itself was lovely, a window seat in the restaurant giving us a perfect view of Times Square made it feel quite special. We ate in the bar one evening too and the food was good also. All in all we were very happy with our stay.

When we where shown to our room we where missing some peices of furniture such as a chair and mini fridge that other rooms seemed to have but the staff here did not care to fix that for us. The staff were very blatantly rude and very reluctant to help or answer our questions. They did not seem to care about costumer satisfaction at all. The rooms were not cleaned well and the carpet was smelly. I don’t advise staying at this hotel especially at a price it does not deserve, there are many more hotels in Times Square with similar rates and much better quality for what your paying.

We stayed Jan 17th -20th. The Crowne Plaza was great. You cant beat the location, its right in the middle of everything. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was clean and plenty big for 4 girls. The bar are was nice and we had a few drinks..only complaint was that the woman bartender was a little rude to us. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to the city!

My husband and I stayed at the hotel whilst visiting NY for my 30th birthday. Unfortunately the hotel was unable to accommodate my request of a room with a view however gave us some breakfast vouchers instead. The hotel was a standard 3* however does need up dating. Our bedroom window did not close and was letting in cold air. We had to keep chasing the repair and it was finally improved. Apparently the hotel will be undergoing works in 2020 which I believe is much needed. We spent most days out so found it fine for what we wanted.

I had a free rewards night with IHG so decided to stay here. It was close to all the Broadway shows and let you use the sports club upstairs with pool and fitness classes/equipment. The staff was very efficient and helpful. The only bad thing was the resort fee which I didn't know about until checkin so be forewarned.

I love staying here when I’m in town just to do shows. Usually not a bad price for the location. It’s also close to the subway for easy access to the rest of the city. Times Square views are preferable to the back of the hotel.

The staff is amazing. We had Tofael today who remembers us every year. We love him! The food is great but the service is memorable. Tofael is so personable and waits on us hand and foot. The location of this hotel is great. Make sure you get breakfast included in your stay. It is economical for New York and will hold you until dinner.

I got to NYC for the ball drop. I ended up staying an extra week. The Crowne is in close proximity to all the shows. Right across the street is St. Malachy's the actors chapel. I saw the Phantom of the Opera, Chicago, King Kong, the Jersey Boys, Beautiful, Pretty Woman, Cher, the Rockettes, and Mean Girls. I left the second week in January 2019.

Like an idiot,I accidentally booked my business stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square for the wrong night through hotwire. Hotwire customer service is horrendous and don't count on them to care about your issue. After waiting 45 minutes while hotwire talks to the hotel to honor my purchased stay with no success. Then I waited the next 30 minutes with all my things to talk to the manager myself. Jerry Maquire whom I assume is one of the managers saw me waiting and directed me to meet front desk manager Yoquina and David Kanters and with no question, they accommodated my purchase for the night I needed it. Was extremely grateful because I had a long day of business meetings and I thought I didn't have anywhere to go. Though hotwire customer service sucks, I would book my next business stays and recommend colleagues to book directly through Crowne Plaza Times Square for it's VIP customer service treatment. Thank you Jerry, Yoquina, and David for my relief!

Great hotel in a fab location. Helpful staff. Lovely breakfast. Decent views from the room. Rooms were quiet, we couldnt hear the lift or any street noise and the beds were SO comfy! Would definitely stay here again if we return to New York.

All the amenities you could ask for. Excellent staff, clean rooms and beautiful view of NYC. Can't wait to go back! Staff accommodated requests. Bar tenders were great and attentative, we were there to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday.

Arrived early before the check-in time and was pleasantly surprised to find the room was already available. We checked in and Sandra on the front desk went above and beyond to help us and make us feel most welcome. The room is spotless with great views over Times Square. Great location and staff. Arrived today and already been out exploring, so much within walking distance and a subway station a minute away if wanting to explore further.

We had a wonderful time in the area and the Crown Plaza hotel is perfect for being in NYC. You are close to a lot of shopping and entertainment. Rooms are clean and comfy. The staff is also very helpful. Sorry don't remember the name of the staff we talked to but I will say everyone always had a smile and treat you with helpful things to do. Enjoyed every day and time in the city.

We celebrated New Years Sve with a big group at The Crowne Plaza. We choose to participate in the Bubbles on Broadway! The evening went off without a hitch, even the torrential rain (which was unique to say the least) the hotel Was prepared with Ponchos & clearance in the Penn Viewing Area making it safe, enjoyable & memorable all at the same time. From the amazing ice sculptures to the incredible performances by the contortionists the event was superb! Security was well organized & adequate and the bubbles poured all throughout the night! What an experience it was & we will certainly go back again!

As a family we stayed six nights at the hotel. I would have given the hotel five stars as the rooms were very comfortable, well presented and the cleaning was excellent, the breakfast service was tasty with plenty of range, and the breakfast staff were all also very patient and accommodating. The concierge was also very good and helpful.The detracting of one star comes from our dealings with a couple of the staff. We arrived late at night and the gentleman checking us in was not friendly in the least - whilst he did get us checked in efficiently, his manner was very efficious and ungracious, we almost felt very “lowerclass” and that he was doing us a favour. From one or two other staff during our stay, I asked for information about minor things eg whether the hotel had weighing scales for luggage as one example- their reaction was very much indicated I was rudely interrupting them. I also noticed a couple of male security staff making inappropriate comments about a female guest they found attractive when she was waiting for the elevator - in her earshot - I felt really embarrassed for her and not sure whether Americans still think it’s appropriate to make slimey comments to women, especially in what should be a professional establishment.I think I’d happily stay at the hotel again though.

My partner and I were very fortunate to have met Ellen Douglas (Housekeeping Manager) at a restaurant in Toronto while she was vacationing. While waiting in line for a table we stuck up a conversation with her and discussed our interests in travelling. After she pointed out the many positive attractions of NYC and about the Crowne Plaza Hotel, we decided to pay a visit to NYC and stay for three nights. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were treated exceptionally well. Her coworker Juliette Chang was incredibly welcoming, accommodating and friendly. We were fortunate to recieve a beautiful, corner room on the 40th floor overlooking Times Square. Ellen continued to keep tabs on our stay ensuring everything went well. This hotel was not only perfectly centrally located permitting us to walk everywhere but the staff were always friendly and made me feel like I was a home. Not only will this trip be remembered for many years, I made a life-long friend in NYC.

Just back from the most amazing time in nyc. Stayed at the Crowne Plaza Time Square and it couldn’t have been better! The location can’t be beat. The room was spotless and the view was perfect looking onto Time Square! The staff was absolutely incredible! Ellen the housekeeping manager was beyond amazing. Juliette at the front desk was soooo wonderful! Ali in the restaurant was so accommodating and friendly! I couldn’t have been happier with our stay! Honestly, we couldn’t have enjoyed our stay more! This is the perfect Time Square hotel! I can’t wait to go back again and again and again!

Crowne Plaza in Tines square is usually my "go to" hotel. Unfortunately over the New Years eve period I couldn't book here so stayed at a hotel a few blocks away. I noticed that the Crowne Plaza was hosting New Years Eve functions and immediately booked the "New Years Eve Starry Night Package". New Years Eve is also my birthday and my wife and I wanted a special night. It wasn't just special, it was fantastic. From 9.00pm to 2.00am there was an open bar (with endless amounts of champagne) a fabulous buffet menu, live DJ and dancing.We were seated at the best table in the house, in the corner overlooking both Times Square and Broadway. The view was awesome. The staff were great and I had the best New Years Eve/birthday EVER. We were looked after from the very start until the very end. Big thank you to the Food and Beverage Manager and the regular bar staff at Broadway 49 who looked after me on each and every visit to the hotel. Happy New Year to you all.

Directly opposite the M&M store and where the ball drops at new year this is a brilliant location and a good value hotel.The rooms are very spacious which is great for NYC, and the bed is pretty comfortable.Our house keeper even wrote a thank you note for leaving her a tip!What is very useful is different elevators for different floors so your not always waiting for the same one as everyone else.The only let down were the bell hops when we were leaving our luggage after checking out as they were pretty rude.

Despite being a platinum member, and pre requesting an early check in I was not given a room until 3pm, what made this worst was while I was being told this, I could clearly see that guest checking in on the other 2 counters where being given their room keys, and far from being offered an upgrade, i was actually offered a downgrade.Eventually when I did get a room, it was old and in much need of a refurbishment, No Robe or slippers, No bathroom scales, No Fridge, torn and worn out chairs, plastic cups. Frankly I have stayed in far better 2 star hotels. Staff too, reminded me of the New York of old, grumpy and couldn't be bothered, only the staff at Grind where friendly.Sadly I have to say that, having stayed at countless IHG hotels, this is the worst one so far, both in terms of service and quality of roomDespite it's perfect location, I will not be returning here, and I will not recommend to any of the 20,000+ staff that work in my organisation to stay here either

We booked this room for a Christmas vacation for our family of 4. The location is perfect, close to the subways, and step right out on Times Square. The hotel staff was always friendly. While we did encounter some small issues, it was all reconciled by hotel management. Thanks for caring about your customers.

Very central, perfect location, front desk really helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We had a high room, views of the Hudson were stunning. Ate in the bar a couple of times, good food, reasonably priced.

We stayed at this hotel for a week just before xmas. I had to phone down for an extra towel 9 times, receptionists were rude and upon checkout I complained about various things that made our stay unpleasant and they agreed to knock off some of the additional fee per night that was charged. But because the this had already been charged to my account I was told I would receive a refund, I STILL have not received a refund!

Ok, I booked a great deal on Expedia. That deal turned out NOT to be worth it. I was put in a room very high up which was great but no Times Sq view. Not expected if that was the only issue. The bed was not a real bed, but a Murphy’s bed and extremely hard to get in and out of since the “couch part” which is very hard surrounds 1/2 the bed length! I have a bad knee so this was really tricky. Then reaching for water on my bedside table caused me to slam my forehead into the Murphy bed frame. The chairs were stained. I was here for work, but no desk, just a desk chair which was bizarre. No fridge or microwave. The sink was leaking and dripped all night. Lousy sleep as bed tilts slightly backwards which is disconcerting. Then on top of these issues was the fact that the key cards did not work, the front desk put the wrong room # on my card packet, then I got up at 6 am bc I could not sleep and went down for a muffin. I waited 9 minutes while the staff finished setting up for the morning before they waited on me. Then I took the muffin back up 37 floors only to have the key card not work again. I had to go back down and wait 10 minutes to have a “manager” in a ripped shirt reprogram it very very slowly and accuse me of having an outstanding balance. Yes, for the food I just bought and there was an active credit card on file! No apologies and twice he selected the wrong room number! I would not stay here again and urge people to reconsider and use another hotel. Lesson, if the price is too good, then there is a good reason for that and you should steer clear. It’s a shame bc I stayed here years ago and it was awesome so I was looking forward to it.

I been coming here for or years am a platinum member and every time I come there I always have to ask for aminties under my membership then I ask for late check out there's always a problem with that lovely hotel but service from front desk is horrible

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza after it was recommended to us by a travel agent. Me and my partner normally stay at quite a trendy hotel in Times Square which we love but as we were with in-laws we thought we should stay somewhere more 'traditional'.I have to say we didn't get off to a very good start as we were put right opposite the lifts but that was soon (and begrudgingly!) remedied. I have to say the rooms were fairly clean and the bed was DIVINE but we had various issues (the phone never worked which was a real pain as we couldn't contact said in-laws apart from on WhatsApp plus we couldn't contact reception either which made me feel really funny. 2 men were sent, one useless and silent, one slightly better but the phone didn't work the whole week plus we had a constantly dripping tap and a leak under the sink which was never remedied.)Every time we went down to reception (we obviously couldn't use the phone!) which was no mean feat in a hotel that size we were sometimes dealt with by rude people, sometimes by quite friendly people but none of the reception staff were really 'on it' and obviously none of our issues were sorted the whole 5 days we were there.Don't get me wrong the Crowne Plaza certainly isn't a bad hotel and as mentioned it was clean and comfortable but it genuinely is the attitude of the staff that makes it an ok hotel as opposed to a great hotel. Because of that sadly I wouldn't recommend it to anyone and we'll stick with trendy (and friendly and helpful!) next time!

stayed at grand plaza hotel three nights on 29th floor room 2915 corner room looking directly down broadway, could sit up in bed at night curtains open and look straight down broadway at all traffic and hustle and bustle saw three shows whilst there went on top of empire state building fantastic views as it was clear day, very cold on top of empire state building, (advice) get priority pass from travel agents before you fly to America as they look at your pass on arrival see you are priority and walk you straight to front otherwise would have been waiting over an hour. food in hotel was good did not use room service, ate out in evening nice restaurants within walking distance hotel has very impressive gym and sauna 3 nights was not realey long enough as there is so much to see.

We stayed for 3 nights just after New Year. The hotel was busy but nothing felt rushed. The room had a Times Square view as we requested. The location is perfect for exploring the city with most things in walking distance or a short sub way ride away. Breakfast service was excellent. We arrived fairly late each morning and it was still fully stocked. Special mention to Tofael who was welcoming and engaging throughout.The porters, bar staff and front of house couldn’t do enough. I like hassle free hotels and this was one of those. Only slight negative, we had a family of 4 and the rooms are small but we only slept in it so it wasn’t a huge issue.

The hustle and bustle of NYC NYE party keeps going on! Jan 3,2019 one night stay and confetti was still falling off the buildings a few blocks away! Excellent front desk staff. No room ready, no sweat! (if was 10am and all) Check your bags at luggage lock up down on street level entrance! Need to use the restroom off lobby, no sweat! Just ask Concierge (?) desk for a key to use! Check in, give them your phone number, enjoy the city, come back to get your room! Albeit waiting in line again, which is normal for any hotel. Don't sweat the small stuff. Call customer service and get Prish! You are lucky! She Rocks! Checking out? Drop keys off at elevator. $30 charge for a small fridge if needed in room. This is normal for majority of hotels without this basic in a room. Free if you have meds or infant. We didn't utilize any in hotel amenities/restaurants/etc. Room is dry, meaning if you have a travel humidifier to use it! Weird thing in hall maintenance was a customer dropped spaghetti sauce on carpet when we checked into our room at 2:30pm. It was still there in the morning at 8:00am even though I seen 4 staff at random times in hall throughout our stay.

On the spur of the moment we decided to spend Christmas Day in NYC. I was so happy to see that the Crowne Plaza had rooms available at a decent price for the night. We arrived and checked in and went right up to our room. It is definitely a busy hotel, for the location and the time of year I was surprised how quick we were able to check in. Our room was pretty spacious for a NYC hotel. While it could use some updating or deep cleaning the room for the most part was very good. It did appear that something had either spilled or was splashed against the wall in the bathroom and in the entryway. Not sure why it wasn't cleaned. Out side of that the room served all our needs. We didn't have a times square view but we had a nice view of the Hudson and into NJ. Noise wise, yeah its NYC so you can hear sirens go by in the middle of the night. Didn't disturb any of my kids sleep so no big deal for us. I will say my one complaint is the grumpy man who works the coffee shop downstairs. He wasn't very helpful or personable at all. But thats not the hotel's fault. Hopefully he was just having an off day.

This hotel is a good place to stay on Times Square. The view is great, and entrance to Broadway makes going to shows easy and convenient. Two restaurants and a coffee shop make for easy breakfast. Shopping and sightseeing on Times Square is quick and easy as well. We have stayed twice and have enjoyed both stays.I will say that service at the front desk is not exactly red carpet style, and the rooms are small and aged; however, the location makes the stay great, and it's a comfortable place.

Very tired hotel - bathrooms especially. Not ideal traveling with kids because the darn comforters are so noisy, every time your child moves it’s sure to wake you up. Pillows are stiff as a board or polar opposite - nothing in between. AC can’t cool the room enough - always stays at a nice mediocre out of bed temp but under the covers - “for-get-about-it!”Time square views are technically there but it’s not really on time square.

We arrived in on January 1st in the evening. Our check in was fabulous and our room was wonderful. Clean sheets and all. We had two great days sight seeing and taking it all in and coming back to a freshly serviced room. On our last night we decided to use the vouchers we were given for a free beverage down at the bar in the lobby. We had to seat ourselves which was fine and dandy but took over 20 minutes for the waitress(Michelle) to come over and acknowledge us, meanwhile she had served people who sat down after us first. She was not very polite and didn't engage in much conversation. When she finally did take our order as she walked away she mumbled under her breath. Also, when she walked past she didn't take a second to make sure we were doing alright or to see if we would have liked something else. As we were sitting we noticed her taking an order from a couple who had a language barrier and once again as she walked away mumbled something under breath. All and all our experience was fantastic minus the waitress who clearly needed to take a break and change her mind set.

The front desk staff at this hotel was outstanding. We had 2 rooms, using FF miles, during the busy holiday season 12/20/2018. Victoria, who checked us in, was pleasant, efficient, and knowledgeable about the city. I would stay here again without question.

Brasserie- served by Ali, a very warm, friendly, humble/meek, approachable staff member that works in one of the restaurants. He shares his personal tips with colleagues.Hotel room was ok- furniture, carpet and bedding old looking and stained.Location directly in the city- exciting and lively.

I arrived after a long New Years night cold and wet and had a snafu with my reservation. It was very frustrating but the care and attention paid by front office manager Jonathan was appreciated. He didn’t just tell me what I wanted to hear but set expectations and followed through. I also saw his demeanor with other guests - he single handedly changed my experience and impression. The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are nicely appointed - good views on higher floors

The hotel is located only a few steps away form Times square and the room at the front of the building have Times square view. It has 46 floor and rooms start from level 15 so almost all the room have good view from high level.WE arrived at midnight and the receptionist was not very welcoming and she gave us vaushers for breakfast for only two people instead of four and when I questioned it she said that the room comes only with two breakfast per day. I explained that we booked this room via IHG membership and they assured us that we have breakfast for four and then she only gave me two extra vouchers for one breakfast (two people one day).The day after I approached one of the senior staff and she gave us the rest and she said that the previous person made a mistake.The room we had (Level 41) was a bit run down and needed some TLC due to its age. It might be for top floors room still waiting to be renovated because it i a very tall building. The carpets were old and the furniture was quite outdated.Room service was regular and good and the bed sheets, towels, etc were changed daily.Our window was very drafty because it did not shut properly and being at that sort of height close to the cloud was not helping the situation. The first night we had a very rainy and windy night and the noise coming through the gap in the window could not let is sleep. I reported this to the front desk the day after and they promised to send someone to repair it but it did not happen and we had to bear with it for the whole week.Breakfast was good and very generous. it started from 6 in the morning until 11 a.m. which was very convenient for both early days or a late lie in day.The Brasserie was good and had good variety of small platters and sandwiches. The price is not cheap but com[pare to what you pay outside in restaurants around Times Square it is worth it. The quality of the food is at least better than sandwich vans and restaurants around. Overall, food in that part of the town is not very impressive so I recommend the food from the hotel.Staff at the breakfast section were very polite and hardworking and they deserve every penny that they earn. We left tips as it is quite customary but there was not any pressure to leave tips like some other places in USA.Overall, we had a good time at this hotel and for the price we paid I was expecting a better quality hotel in terms of decoration and appearance.

Times Square view from the room is amazing. Jonathan (front desk) went above and beyond to ensure we had the most amazing New Years. Exceptional customer service, a great asset to the hotel - if you ever need anything during your visit here I recommend you ask for him. :) Also, special thanks to Ana. Again, excellent customer service!

Terrible customer service. Not enough staff, one person checking in arrivals, 15 person queue. Too many people at the hotel then they sell tickets for more people to come to the hotel. Reception toilets are dirty and disgusting with used toilet paper over the floor. They did not give clear directions as to what would happen at New Year other than you can buy packages for food. No clarity that if you didn’t buy the package then you would be treated like a second class citizen. No detail that the front door would be closed leaving hundreds of dissappointed guestsWill never come back and having ruined our family holiday I will probably not use holiday inn again.

Worst Customer Service EverArrived at this hotel around 10am in the morning on the New Year’s Eve, the front desk checked my document first and asked for my credit card to pay for the service fee about $34 for gym, WiFi, calls from room etc. etc...which is usually included for free for Elite members at other IHG hotels. Checked my reservation details, nowhere it was mentioned about such service charge at all. The receptionist recognized my Spire/Ambassador member status, but still asked me to go back to check in at 3pm. At 2pm, I saw people were already in line, so I walked up to IHG elite member check in counter, but the staff named Freddie told me to get in another line with other non-members, told me everyone is elite member on the New Year’s Eve. If they have different elite member policy on the New Year’s Eve, the hotel management team should send out the email notifications for such change of policy, so we know what to expect and decide if we want to stay at a hotel with no elite service.For not being able to check in appropriately and I don’t want to get in the long line, I then called the IHG customer service, the agent was surprised to hear such behavior from the check in staff at this hotel and she tried to call the hotel manager to help me to resolve this issue. Finally, after about an hour, the manager named Grant called me and came to the elite member counter to finish my check in at around 4pm. Without saying anything, not any form of apology, instead, the manager repeated saying the same thing just like the staff Freddie, he told me they have over 500 Platinum members on New Year’s Eve, then I asked him how many Spire/Ambassador members he has tonight, he told me Spire/ Platinum is under the same group. No word to say if the manager is thinking this way.As to the king size room is average, clean, with a bathroom not very appealing, hearing people talking while passing by, and even other’s door closing. Spacious room good for a couple, but found no luggage stand. Slippers and bath robe are available upon request. There’s house keeper who is very nice and humble, Not that kind of room design would wow you when entering the room, so no next time I guess.I’ll only stay with hotels with good customer service and recognize their elite member with respect, there’re so many good hotels to choose in New York, why bother this one with an arrogant attitude towards their guests?

The Crowne Plaza is a lovely hotel right in the heart of NYC. Near everything from Times Square to the theater district. The biggest downside was hidden fees. "Free in room wifi" means a $30 daily fee which includes gym usage. Should have been optional. Overpriced restaurants onsite. The rooms are average.

Had the most wonderful time. Restaurants inside make meals a breeze. Staff are attentive and very helpful. Ana is outstanding in terms of customer service and genuinely caring for guests! Perfect location near Times Square, the subways, theaters etc.

We stayed here for six nights over Christmas. The staff weren’t at all friendly. The rooms were quiet and warm but not overly clean.Every day we had to phone for towels, bath mat, coffee etc.Very expensive but you pay for location, that’s it.

This hotel is right in Times Square, great location with walking distance to many attractions, shopping and restaurants. This was a business trip, the food provided by the hotel was very good. The hotel bar is nice with big windows to view times square. This was my first trip to New York during the holidays and I absolutely loved it!!

Close to EVERYTHING! Perfect place for the value! Beds were comfy, everyone was awesome to deal with and the proximity to food, Broadway and shopping was fabulous!! The location is also close to subway!!

Have stayed in the past and hotel is great. Just outside the heart of Times Square. Spacious rooms, High speed elevators, and easy access on 3 sides of the hotel.Had breakfast both days in Brasserie 1605 and it’s your typical cheap breakfast. Waiters and Manager were horrendous and oblivious up to and including even knocking over drinks on our party trying to reach over the table (to get a voucher). A stand out was Christopher(Black Male, All Black uniform in Brasserie) who raised the rating from won’t be back to dine to will consider dining there again.After waiting 10 minutes for the waiter and manager to try and find a high chair Christopher who had his hands full noticed my frustration, asked what he could do and beat the Manager and Waiter back with the high chair within minutes! Great worker and showed what the waiters should strive for when asked what customer service should be.

We arrived on the 23rd of December, check in was good they moved the line quickly, we was checked in by the guy with the big blonde hair, wish I could remember his name. He gave us a free upgrade to a corner room with time square view. The views were incredible!!!!! The room was plenty big enough for the 3 of us and clean. I've stayed at the sheraton before but the crowne plaza smashes it into the floor in every way. On our second day our key card wouldn't work so we trundled down to reception, we was greeted by a lady who wasn't to interested and said she had reset the card and sent us back up to try it but again it didn't work so we trundled all the way down again we got the same lady who said your lock must be broken, go out and come back later so we did!! When arriving back the lock was fixed but later after dinner it was broken again so trundled down to reception again and we got the guy with the big blonde hair who originally checked us in, he was once again great to deal with explaining to us why the keys do it and gave us some free drinks vouchers he's just so smooth with really good customer service. We would definitely stay here again and can't wait to come back. TOP FOOD TIP FOR YOU BRITS VISITING. Go across the street to juniors you can't go wrong you will love it
user_name:
hollywood1338
Poulton Le Fylde, United Kingdom

review_body: I definitely recommend asking for Tofael to serve you if you use the restaurant. He is by far the best waiter I have ever encountered throughout all my travel experiences. Courteous, accomandating, and attentive are just a few surpurlatives that describe him.

That's all, not awesome, not terrible just ok, like many others said. We did a Christmas getaway with our 2 teenagers for 4-days. The price was good and location. We were very busy, as was the staff so I can't say customer service was was good or bad. We did work with the concierge quite a bit and he was awesome. The rooms, were, tired. Many non-working outlets, wallpaper pulling off the wall and the extra blanket we requested, I could have sanded the table I am refinishing with. House keeping was good for us. The rooms are of good size, although having stayed at the Marriott Marquis previously, the room size and quality and superior public spaces, tip heavily in their favor. My main suggestion (bordering on complaint), is really you can't print anything in the business center but a boarding pass? So we would purchase tickets for a show and be told to go to the business center to print them and they charge to print anything like that. Come on, it's a minimum $7.50 to print anything. Also, we were on the elite level, not sure what that meant other than we had a view, we never received water or bar drink coupons like others had spoken of. Lastly, the hotel just isn't very welcoming if that is how I want to describe it. The lobby is small and you can't get through any spaces because the check-in/check out desk is always packed and they do not have one seat anywhere in the lobby so people crowd around everywhere making it difficult to get through. The bar which takes up most of what could be the lobby is corded off and there are signs not allowing patrons in there even when it isn't open. I don't how they can fix this, but a chair or two would make people feel more welcome, especially for the family while mom or dad wait in the long check in/check out lines.

Right on Times Square makes this hotel perfect for location. We had booked a room with king size bed and view of Times Square. We got exactly that on 32nd floor. Room was very comfortable and clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We were room only but tried breakfast on the first morning- it was nothing special and very expensive so we ate out after that. We had a late flight home and our luggage was left securely in the Luggage Room.

Stayed for 5 days with family, very accommodating for children, friendly staff (particularly Victoria). Hotel is in a great location, rooms are a good size, a little dated but generally the hotel is in good condition. Was a real pleasure to stay here.

A very centrally situated hotel on Broadway and in close walking distance of major attractions: musical, theatres, cinemas restaurants, bars and more. The hotel is very busy with a bar on restaurant on the flrst floor by the reception and lifts. Check in is not until 3 o'clock and therefore you may have to leave luggage in store on arrival. Some of the public areas are a bit tired and the breakfast restaurant is a bit chaotic.Rooms must have been originally very comfortable, but again they have become a bit tired with use and the one we were allocated to on the 24th floor had doors that would not close, light switches that were broken and taps that would not shut off completely. Leather chairs and bedheads were worn. Good service was provided by the main desk, but again these areas were busy and the staff rushed.

Booked this hotel because we heard alot off good things about it we checked in late at night as our flight was delayed so thought we would just get the left overs rooms what is left but we ended up on the 16th floor facing the rear which we wasn't bothered about the room was massive compared to others we stayed in the walk in shower was a bonus bathroom big aswell the only problem with the room was the tv picture wasn't good and you couldn't get all the channel's and the room needs a better coffee machine you can't make coffee with a tea bag so was having to go downstairs for a coffee every morning and paying 5 dollars for one and be aware when you check in about the charges they charge you as we was not aware off this and didn't get told about it or how much it was for maybe telling people how much it is not just asking for our credit card but other than that the hotel is close to times square

Good location Old tired rooms Old tired bathrooms Good service overall This is one of those hotels that you would want to stay in just for the location more than anything else as it does not really have much else to offer. Rooms are noisy and you can hear the doors of other rooms banging throughout the day and night. The mattress are old and warped. Shower is old and needs an owners Manuel to make warm water come out of it. At $330 per night inclusive !!! It’s not really a good deal but again the location is top of you want to be in Times Square

We stayed here over Xmas with our two young children. Room was spacious, but I agree with other comments the hotel needs updating. Our safe did not work, was never actually rectified as requested. Our AC also broke down whilst staying. Linen on bed was only changed once. No milk for coffee/tea, instead powered cream was offered which made a cup of tea impossible. Staff on the whole were friendly. Except staff in the bar. Dreadfully slow and when I tried to order a drink from the bar on Xmas day, I was rudely fobbed off by the woman behind the bar, who was busily gossiping with other customers. Very poor show. I would not stay here again, although the location was fabulous.

I have just returned this morning from New York after staying at the Crowne Plaza Hotel in Times Square, with my wife and two teenage daughters. This is the second time we have visited New York and the second time we have stayed in Times Square.Before we left, I had looked at the reviews on trip advisor, and despite the multiple positive reviews, it was easy to focus on the small negatives, which made us sceptical.However, I have to say, our whole experience was extremely positive and I would have no reservations in recommending this hotel for a family or couples.We were on the 34th floor with a room viewing North. Some of the bad press for this hotel involved comments about rooms at this level being noisy, even during the night......well, you are in the city that never sleeps and all I can say is, yes you could hear the sirens of the emergency services through the night and the odd car horn, but none of which was enough to keep us awake.Other negative comments were for the tired furniture. I found our room to be very presentable with nothing to complain about. The beds were very comfortable and had fresh linen every day. The bathroom was very clean and again with fresh towels every day. The actual desk had some wear around the edges, but certainly nothing to complain about. I found all the staff that we interacted with to be very friendly, welcoming and accommodating. We actually required to print tickets off for an event and were told we could use the business centre. When we went to the centre, it was under construction. However the staff simply asked us to forward our electronic tickets via email to one of the backroom office staff and they kindly printed the tickets for us. A perfect service which was greatly appreciated.Overall, we found this hotel to be a great base for our week in Manhattan, with friendly staff, clean, tidy rooms and a very central location for uptown and downtown attractions. Will definitely visit again!! Thank you!!

Close to all attractions we stay for eight days and enjoyed the nicest service. Big rooms and a indoor swimming pool with a complete sports club at the 15th level Room Service and very friendly staff is so helpful and comfortable Our “breakfast buffet “ waiter TOFAEL was competent and always helpful.thanks for all

Tofael always takes great care of us on our trips to NYC! He is an outstanding server! He is friendly and goes out of his way to make sure we have a pleasant experience each time we visit the city! We make sure we find him each time!

1 week visit to New York for Christmas, my third time here and first time stay at Crown Plaza and by far the best I’ve stayed in. From checking in everything was very easy, staff were all nice helpful and friendly, room was just as expected and location amazing. Room is very spacious, shower is always hot. Room can be as warm or as cold as you like as you are in control. Great values for money for location and time of year. Definitely recommend a stay here not a negative word to say about anything. And priced very reasonable.

Very convenient location, check in was quick and the staff was very friendly. We ordered room service, the food was great and arrived at our room quickly. I have to compliment the WiFi as well, wasn’t expecting much as it’s a big hotel with a lot of guest but it was really fast. The room was clean and comfortable. We had a great view of Times Square. Very impressed and definitely recommend staying here.

Stayed here from 7th to 11th December for a Short Christmas Break - 3 people sharing 2 queen beds - room was pretty big enough for 3 people including luggage.Check in was easy, staff very helpful and fully manned. We were unable to use our Safe in our room, we did raise this but it was not sorted during our stay. Breakfast was good at the hotel, lovely choice, maybe slightly expensive given you have other options in the City close by. Excellent location you can be on the edge of Central Park within 10-15 Walk and down to Macy's within 15-20 minutes. Brilliant location to Radio City, Rockefeller Center.  Room was cleaned daily, and fresh towels provided. Only complaint I will raise is our room had an adjoining door to another guests room, and this became very noisy at times so I would recommend request room without an in connecting door Check out was easy and we used the luggage storage which is manned and ticketed, very polite and good service Wonderful stay though, would definitely stay here

My husband and I have stayed at numerous IHG hotels around the world and this was the worst!I rarely write bad reviews liking to see the best in places.Positive points1: Great Location2:Given an upgradeNegative points1: Bearing in mind my husband is a Spar Elite member you would hardly have known. Book in was polite but lacked the normal really welcoming greeting we receive.2. Room was OK but for a premium hotel and room really should have been fully serviced, no shower gel on first day and shower control kept slipping which my husband solved by using a piece of cardboard.Probably should have reported but staff hardly friendly.3: Again rated a 4 star hotel no water or robe in the room.4: Breakfast staff quick to give bill and tip request not so quick to clear used crockery. 5: No dedicated Premium users checkout desk.6: When asked for extended check was told “ Quite aware of your membership status come down tomorrow for request” Not the answer was a problem but the manner it was delivered in. Rude.6: After extension rejected as hotel was full that day directed to FREE and it should be luggage hold were greeted by sour unwelcoming staff.7: All this and to be charged €30 service charge for the privilege of getting services that were or should have been included.The hotel was very busy and it was raining not an excuse for poor and expensive experience.

Have been staying here for several years, keep waiting for it to go south but instead it keeps getting better. When they closed the club lounge I though tit would be the beginning of the end but that did not happen. Biggest part of that is the staff - absolutely all are friendly, efficient, and welcoming. Management must be good to inspire such great customer service. Front desk is particularly great, especially Sandra Esp. on the elite desk. As an IHG Platinum I stay at properties around the world, and this is among the best urban properties in the portfolio. Even if we only get here once a year for a Christmas visit, it remains a destination we look forward to secure in the knowledge we will be welcomed, comfortable and appreciated. And the beds are super comfortable!

We have stayed at this hotel several times. Our stay last week was very disappointing. The room has so hot we had to sleep with the window propped open. According to the hotel maintenance worker, that was our only choice since the AC would only blow hot air??? The sink was stopped up and the ceiling in the bath was peeling. To top it off, the floor was slanted and the drawers wouldn’t stay closed. The head of our bed was lower than the foot. Would not recommend.

Musty, Dirty, Unhelpful, Excuses & apologies GALORE - their MO! Carpeting around bed wet-put dry towels over to walk on.First night, sheets had shoe imprints & hair on them.Room stunk-musty/mold.Closet so heavy w/ same smell couldn’t hang clothes in it. Reported problems to mgt from onset & dailyafterwards. On 3rd of a 5 day stay offered to move us. Upon chk-out offered a $60 credit- PLS! At base, Rm rents for $144 p/night. ONLY. Mgt is not customer friendly or attentive w/ needs/any issues.

You can't beat the location, the front door opens on the heart of Times Square and all of Broadway, mid-town and Rockefeller is within a few blocks. The front desk staff was extremely helpful. Only drawback was a $30 "resort fee" that I knew nothing about until I checked in. But the front desk clerk gave me coupons for free food and drinks that more than made up the $30. The hotel is huge and most of the rooms face the back or an internal courtyard so even though the location is great don't bank on getting a good view.

Have enjoyed many stays at this usually wonderful hotel. This time we were broadsided by their new RESORT FEE of over $30, but were given coupons for drinks and food at their bar/restaurant to soften the add on fee. Our reserved room was not available so after a five minute wait at reception, we were given an "upgrade" to the 45th floor. The room was nice, until very noisy neighbors arrived after 1 am and we were woken by their happiness through the thin connecting door. Then the radio alarm woke us up at 6 am, thanks to some previous thoughtless guest. The coupons that we were given was a mixed blessing because the one remaining bar that was open in the early evening, was overfilled with throngs of guests hoping to use their coupons, so finding seating was a challenge. As usual, the food and beverages were excellent, but the whole experience of being forced to pay this new Resort Fee was a total turn off. Note that there was no advance notice given to me when I booked this room using the Annual Voucher that goes with the paid for IHG credit card that I use. Also I recently booked a couple nights stay in February and was not told about this new RESORT fee. The hotel has dropped the ball on how this new and controversial welcome add on fee is being implemented and creates distrust from this otherwise loyal customer. One Star at this time.
user_name:
AllenFein
Southampton, New York, United States

review_body: This hotel is centrally located in Time Square with the holiday madness awaiting you right outside the hotel door. It's an easy walk to many of the sites and the subway is a block away. However, the hotel never seemed overcrowded. Check in was a short line on a Saturday. The staff we encountered were friendly. Parking is listed as $65/24 hrs but, it's $85 if you have an SUV of any size.

Check in was fast and the location couldn’t have been any better. The rooms clean and comfortable with an amazing view. On check in you get 2 complimentary drinks per person at the bar which is a nice touch. I will definitely stay here the next time I’m in newyork
user_name:
Irishsky14
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: I have been a regular guest at Crowne Plaza, and I was shocked to see there was no IHG check in desk. Upon inquring I was rudely told they have gone on break, and during the day I observed no one came there,The check in staff was rude and so was the Surpvisor.As I had arrived early, I knew I was not going to get a room, but the check in staff was most unfrendiliest Staff I have ever seen or met. She was rude and did not even wanted to tell me what time to call back to check. She took my number and when I returned at noon, couple of hours later, another staff gladly checked me in and no one had bothered to call me to say room was ready.This is for Spire Elite member that I am.Besides location, this is most unfriendly hotel to stay in.

Lovely hotel in a great location. Had a problem checking in because the computers were down but the staff dealt with it and were friendly and very helpful.The room was a good size and very clean. Will def go back again.

It is not the first time for us to stay in this great hotel - in the time square area in NYC - near all the great places of NYC - nice rooms, good restaurant and friendly service - if one looks for RS functional good hotel in the big Apple this is the place

Customer service honestly was appalling! Please avoid this hotel. Never felt so degraded ever to be spoken to like this in front of other guests! Other than this - hotel room not cleanliness. Stayed here twice and definitely deteriorated and in bad need of updating. Alarm went off which we never set. Construction work every morning woke us up. Wall so thin we could hear neighbours and conversations from people outside our room. Heck in can take ages! Food very very average. Drinks over priced. Bar staff very slow. Managers and customer service very bad. Security doorman - asked for a taxi we were told twice to call über. However then seen him offer other guests help for taxi! Lots of other hotels nearby. Location isn't everything especially when this hotel is more expensive. Thsi is in no way a 4 star!! No fridge in room. Air con / hearing system not working therefore unable to manage room temperature. Layout of hotel Very out and rooms very small.

Room was cozy, clean and a value for the dollar. Location, Location, Location. Hotel is centrally located affording you the ability to walk in any direction and be within the hustle and bustle that makes NYC such an awesome place to visit.

Crowne plaza hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the city , very comfy room and bed was really comfy, food and drink in the hotel was to a very good standard can’t fault the hotel at all I will return one day !! Nice cake courtesy of the hotel for my bday nice touch thank you it was lovely

This review is for the bar and lounge , not the actual hotel. My colleague and I stopped here for some dinner after a long day at a conference.. We were told the restaurant was closed but could get food at the bar. It was busy but not packed so we decided to try it out. It took at least 15 minutes for a server to come to our table. When he finally did come my colleague ordered wine. He showed us the menu and then left..20 minutes later..she finally got her wine...and the server stepped away with out asking if we were ready to order. Then he started serving people who had arrived after us. He even took their orders.. At this point we decided to go elsewhere for dinner. Another waiter asked if we were going to order and we said we just wanted the check for the wine. We waited for what seemed like 15 minutes and he never came back with the check. At this point we got up and approached a man who said he was the manager. We said we needed the bill and if could take the money for the wine because we has been waiting long enough.. He was very rude but took the money regardless and we left. This seriously was the worst service we got during our conference in NYC. We went to another place with great service and better prices too.

Perfectly placed for everything you want to do. Lovely rooms, spacious and comfortable .We were on the 39th floor and the view was amazing. Staff, especially the Concierges were so friendly and helpful. I would recommend staying here.

Minor Signs of wear & tear apparent everywhere. Bar, restaurant, lobby, elevators, hallways, rooms, etc. The faucet in our has a fast leak of about a gallon per hour. Bathroom cabinets are pretty beat up. But again, just minor things.We’ve found the staff to be very friendly. This morning at breakfast my server was Ali. Breakfast wasn’t busy yet, so Ali & I were able to chat for about 10 minutes. If you stay, make sure to say hi to Ali.All in all, we must like the hotel.... this is the third time we’ve stayed over the past 12-14 months! Unfortunately we have to relocate to another hotel today - because this hotel is sold out.8321

Beautiful hotel with great amenities. Evelyn was wonderful. She was friendly and professional! The rooms are clean and spacious. The bathroom was immaculate. Very impressed with everything so far! Looking forward to trying out the hotel restaurant.

Stayed here for 4 days this week for a small getaway trip. Amazing hotel! We had a bit of an ordeal getting checked in as the hotels check in system was down, but management was incredibly giving and the staff was helping get people manually checked in as fast as they could. Very grateful for the service provided during this. The best part about the hotel was the restaurant and bar in the lobby, Broadway 49. The food and drinks were INCREDIBLE and the service was even better. We made sure to keep going back to the same section each time we went so we would get the same waiter, Tony B. He provided incredible service and made us feel so welcome. He was kind, helpful, and fun and overall improved the quality of our stay. He provided amazing service that should not go unnoticed!

It is first time a lazy person like myself want to spend hours to write a revew on this wonderful hotel that bring me memorable experience to whoever want to stay here, think again!As a frequent traveler, Crowne Plaza was one of my favorite choice not only for the room facilities but also for their service. However, this does not apply to this very Time Square one, very much an outlier or anomaly.The first shock came right at checking. I need to stay 6 nights, and instead of being treated nicer, the check in staff told me that they will charge full amount immediately. Excuse me??? Should the normal procedure to pay desposit and charge only took place at check out? Anyway, I will pay, so no big deal, i paid, and then came another suprise (this place is full of surprise). I found the room is twin bed room, not King bed room I wanted, so I ask for change. The answer is you need to come early tomrrow morning to apply for the change. Excuse me, I ask for change, and if there is room, it should be you help me change room, not me going to lobby the second moring to see my luck. After these 2 pleasant surprise, I decide to stay away from any of these staff in this hotel, just to finished my stay. But, Murphy's Law applied. In the third day of my stay, my credit card stop working, as my 6 nights hotel expenses got charged again, and well over my credit limit. WTF...The less you want to interact with them, the more you got to. So I have to bring that to hotel staff, and here is the answer: Let your bank call us....Sure, thanks, that is so helpful!The next day, luck me, I know New York will have a big snow (turned out to be the biggest in Nov for 136 years), and I need an umbrella for outside activities. I serached the room without finding one (shouldnt a 5 star hotel have an unbrella in room for use), and I call guest service. The answer is We Dont Provide Unmbrelle, but you can buy one from kiosk in B1...What a marvlous hotel that I stayed in..They even have umbrella for sale in kiosk..so convenient....All of that, still not enough to trigger the motivation for write a review, but it seems this hotel loves me so much, they feel obligated to make me remember them in a certain way. After a rush check out and feel great that I finally left this abnormal hotel, I found I left my suit jacket in the room when I land home after 15 hour flight. Unwillingly, I phoned the hotel right away, and luckily they found my jacket (where else can it go). I provide them the shipping address, and that is it...NOBODY is doing anything to ship it back. For 2 weeks, I called several times and no progress. I write email to complain, and all I get was that I need to use a link from their webpage to launch a Lost Report. Excuse me??? I already called and you already found my jacket. Fine, I launched the lost report. Again... nobody is doing anything. I write to complained, and THIS HOTEL did not respond to my complain. What a Excellence Award Hotel that I am dealing withRight now, I have call my colleague to pick the jacket up. Guess what, they did not respond to my colleague, and not responding to the request for fix a time for pick up. Is this CROWNE PlAZA？？？ 2017 Exellnece Award winner？ potential 2018 Excellence Award Contender？？ I should help you fulfil that dream with this revewNormally at the end of review, you will be asked two question:1. How would like to stay in this hotel in the future 1 - 10.. My answer is 0 2. How likely would you recommend this hotel to others 1 -10.. My answer is you gotto kidding me!!!Up till now, my collleague still not get any response from them, and let's see how this end.. Maybe they alreday keep my jacket as a gift, god, why they love me so much....

A great place to stay for a Breakaway trip to Times Square. Close to everything. Room was well appointed and very clean. Coupons for our status covered breakfast at a coffee/bagels place. I would stay here again simply for the location!

We had a wonderful time in The Crowne Plaza Hotel in December.The hotel is fantastically situated on Broadway and Times Square, with all the bars and restaurants in a short stroll away. The hotel is ideally situated for all the shows and shopping in midtown Manhattan and the bars and restaurants in Hell's Kitchen.The bar and restaurant attached to the hotel were excellent places to sit down and enjoy the atmosphere of Times Square.Staff at the hotel were lovely and very welcoming and fantastic at providing information about New York.A 10 out of 10 from us, we would have no hesitation in booking again in the future.

Came here for 5nights stayed End November begging of December. We had two double bed room! Couldn’t fault the cleanness and tiredness of the room. Bed comfy and also had a nice size bathroom. Room had a safe kettle, tea coffee and iron/board and hairdryer. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Before we booked we looked at a variety of hotels and while we were there went past them as touring around and honestly could say we knew we picked the best hotel. Location was ideal and there were bus stops and tube stations close by. The hotel has also an onsite place where you can buy tickets and attractions if you haven’t already purchased or you could even purchase as you go people everywhere selling attractions etc. The hotel was massive and couldn’t complain about anything. Considering by/in times square you wouldn’t know rooms quite could only hear sirens and the odd horn which considering as soon as you come out of our hotel it was busy I was surprised. The room had blacked out curtains which was great until the alarm went off and had to get up to make the most of your day. Also on your departure day they have storage room on the bottom floor and really impressed with the organisation and the care they took with your bags. If I get the chance to go back New York I would stay in this hotel hands down. Couldn’t fault.

lovely big room with great view of the Hudson, toiletries all included, nice staff, especially the guys who look after the luggage, bar looks over Broadway and has great cocktails, bathroom quite dated, fantastic location

I’ve stayed here a few times. The stay was okay. Everything was okay. The shower had used bottles of shower gel and shampoo in it when we arrived. The carpets on the side of the bed were dusty. The front desk clerk had a very rude attitude, as did the bartender. But besides those issues, the stay was okay! It is in a nice location.

We stayed 6 nights at the Crowne Plaza, it was extremely busy when we arrived as the New York marathon was the next day. We arrived at 9am in the morning so I wasn’t expecting to get a room so early but the receptionist was able to get us a room and check in was fast. The room was really clean and it was cleaned each morning so we had a made up room when we returned after breakfast.The front of the hotel is on Times Square so everything was very convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

This is the second time to this hotel, the first was a girls trip in 2016, we loved it. Great location if you are wanting Times Square.This trip was with my daughters and other family members, 3 rooms in all and it was just ok. Concierge was wonderful with last minute dinner reservations. The rooms were warm, even after opening the windows, they close automatically and we had to prop them open with the room service menu. The bar in the lounge, if busy, the service will be very slow, and you cannot get a drink from the bar and sit down, you have to wait for service as it is their policy. Overall, great location, clean rooms and pretty hotel.

This guy is a legend. Hands down the best service I have received in 27 years of existence. Warm hearted, excellent service, and made us feel at home. Somebody needs to get this guy a raise because he is the heart and soul of this hotel. From Chicago to Times Square... Tony C... you sir are the man!

I’ve been to NYC several times over the years. I have never stayed at this hotel and will never stay again. Our first room had some minor issues and we were moved to another room. Unfortunately, it went from bad to worse. Mildew/mold in the bathroom, the only way to cool the room of was to “open the window.” Exactly the words from maintenance. A large wet spot on the carpet, from only God knows what. When we called to guest services to report the mysterious, large wet spot we were told a manger would contact us right away...... two days later and we never heard from anyone. Also, we were told we would have a Coke and Sprite delivered to our room..... two days later and we never received it. The rooms are outdated and certainly not the cleanest. I could go on and on about other things, but I think you get the point. I will give them an A+ for the elevators. The wait time was minimal. However, everything else gets a D-. Never again, will I make the mistake of staying here.

New York is a city which must be seen :) At first, I was wondered with tower blocks and was just watching the above. Times square is a an extraordinary place to know other people and see an international environment.

Will never stay again, does not provide even basic facilities, never pay extra for city view, nothing is there as city view. Rooms are too small and dirty carpets, the rating is not more than 2 stars whereas prices are much higher and cancellation policy is rigid.even ask for the small refrigerator in the room they asked for $30 per night.

This was my girlfriends first time to NYC. I kept telling her to be prepared for hotel rooms the size of a closet. We fortunately had reserved a corner room on the 45th floor facing the Hudson River. Huge room, very comfortable bed. The staff upon check in was extremely friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is perfect. You are within minutes of everything that is downtown NYC.

Great location, clean, quiet for NYC. Vanessa at the front desk was very friendly even though there were were unreasonably angry and stressed people just before us. Only negative is extra charge to use the pool and you have to have (buy) a swim cap. That is garbage for the rate you pay to stay here. Otherwise very pleased

We stayed in room: 2 double beds, Times Square view and I can only say good things about it! From the minute we arrived staff were always so helpful and polite. The room itself also couldn't be faulted; the beds were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was very clean at all times and the view from room was outstanding (it's well worth paying that little extra for). The room also had a Bluetooth speaker, which we thought was a nice touch. It was nice to have a TV but you did have to pay for the films; however we made do with the channels we had and that was just as good seeing as the majority of the time you are out exploring anyway. The hotel is perfectly located as it is literally on Times Square, so you really are central to everything and there is even a subway just across from you. Overall, the hotel made our first ever trip to NYC extraordinary and I really don't think we'd choose to stay elsewhere now. We cannot wait to come and stay again!

We just got back from a two-day visit to NYC, and stated at the Crowne Plaza TSM because of its proximity to everything we needed to do during our visit. Front desk staff was great. The room is decorated very simply, but everything appears clean and neat.No mini bar or fridge. The housekeeping staff is great, as well. Our only issue with the visit was the cost of the restaurant - specifically Brasserie 1605, which even after using the voucher the front desk gives you when you are a Platinum Ambassador member was $40+ for 2 people. Other than that - there are plenty of places that are walking distance, they have a Bar separate from the restaurant that is also great. Would definitely recommend.

I just came home from a three night stay and I have to say, I expected a lot more from this hotel for the price that my friends and I paid! First off, the room was very janky!!! The shower kept shutting off when you tried to turn the knob from hot to cold. There was chipped glass on the bottom of the mirror In the bathroom. The shower rod was broken and the toilet paper holder was hanging by a thread. The desk chair had several rips and tears & we even found pieces of old food stuck in the chair! The window to the room did not close properly and let in a lot of cool air. you could hear tons of noise from time square! oh and not to mention that the clock alarm went off randomly at 6am daily and we didn’t even set it! I see a few other folks on here are complaining about this also. The hairdryer was weak and the toiletries were awful. The conditioner made your hair feel like straw! Food prices at the cafe downstairs were astronomical. We didn’t eat at the breakfast buffet because it was over $30 a person. Forget that!You can’t beat the location though, but there are other hotels in the area I will be checking out the next time I come back to the city!

We ve had a fabulous week visiting New York. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and polite. The waiting staff were very attentive to our needs. The food was great and the room was very comfortable (46th floor) I usually have a problem sleeping in hotel beds but ours was so comfortable we slept really well.
