The location was great too for sightseeing by foot as the traffic is terribly slow moving. I would recommend this hotel

Make sure you have a drink in Broadway 49 Bar and Lounge. Try their Mojito. Divine. Food and snacks good. Service is adequate and attention is given when needed. Times Square just a 5 minute walk from here. We always stay here. Hotel is pricey because of location but that’s want you pay for.
user_name:
projectm885
Saldanha Bay Municipality, South Africa

review_body: We would have given the Crown Plaza a higher mark had we not had some issues during our 8 night stay. First day, my wife fell during her shower because there was no bath mat in the shower. After telling the front desk, we were provided a mat, along with the missing bathrobes that we were promised on the phone prior to arriving. The electrical outlet did not work in the bathroom and after a technician supposedly repaired it, the repair only lasted two days when it was no longer working. Light burned out on the desk. Prices were exhorbitant in the snack bar that we used for our morning continental breakfast. Having said the previous, the hotel is located within walking distance of all the Broadway shows and only a 40 minute walk to the Natural History Museum near Central Park. Bring your ear plugs, we had our silicone ear plugs as the nights are filled with the wail of sirens and honking horns despite being on the 27th floor. Upon checking in, we asked for the "quiet" section and the clerk assured me we were getting a room in the quiet section. I'm convinced there is no place that is quiet near Times Square.

Just got back from a four day stay , the hotel is in an excellent location and if you pay extra you can have a view of Times Square, check in staff were very welcoming and polite , on Sunday afternoon ( my birthday) we were having a drink in the bar when the waiter came over and said “ time up “ he wanted us to settle our bill immediately as he was going off shift and he wanted his tip ! , bit embarrassing really! . On our check out day the alarm clock we hadn’t touched went off at 6 am and then housekeeping knocked and walked in at 830 am when asked what she wanted she replied your checking out today! , it felt like we were an inconvenience to her routine I spoke to another guest and strangely their alarm had been set for 6am also maybe a coincidence! , lastly the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable but the room didn’t have a fridge there’s a pool on the 15th floor looked nice we didn’t know about it so didn’t have swimwear,

We traveled to New York with two of our children for their first trip. We read reviews, shopped for the best price and searched maps for the locations we preferred. We were between settled on the Crowne Plaza due to location and a decent deal on price for a Christmas weekend in the city. We ended up arriving early- around 11am on a Friday morning- and found a long line. When we reached the front the very friendly lady helped us with a room allowing us to check in early with our two young kids! We had an awesome view of Times Square and two good sized double beds. The room was not anything fancy. The bathroom looked a little outdated and we did have some trouble figuring out the temperature gauge. However everything was clean and the housekeeping staff was incredibly friendly and attentive! We were in and out quite a bit and the hotel was everything we needed. We did use room service one night for desert and it was very quick. We also tried the coffee bar. They didn’t have a large range of desserts but the coffee was fine. I would recommend this hotel on price and location alone. If you’re looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a couple, family or business trip close to Times Square, Broadway and multiple subway stops- this is your place!

This hotel is perfectly located for Times Square and all the Broadway shows. It has an excellent bar, "Broadway 49", which also has a good food menu - Quesadilla recommended at 15 US dollars or a Turkey Club sandwich at 17 US dollars. There is a breakfast and lunch restaurant; Brassiere 1605, serving a full American buffet breakfast for 34 US dollars. The staff are excellent and engaging throughout this hotel. Highly recommended.

Absolutely great room as far as location. We were able to walk to everything from Central Park to The Empire State Building. Room was very spacious and clean, shower was phenomenal and beds were very comfortable. My only complaint would be the room was INSANELY hot (I’m talking never got below 75) when we called to ask the front desk for someone to come check on this we were told that the building runs on a two pipe system and there was nothing to be done however we could have fans brought to our room we did that and also opened the windows and this made it bearable to at least sleep. Would definitely recommend though.

We had a great 4 night stay here. Hotel is well positioned pretty much in the centre of times square. There are two entrances - one that leads right onto Broadway and the other that heads onto the drop off area.First impressions were good - bell services offered to help with luggage immediately whilst we went on up the escalator to check in. Reception were helpful and we were allocated a room on the 31st floor (and given some vouchers for 2 drinks as a result of the resort fee)The itself was large for new york standards. Yes - it probably needed some TLC in the bathroom where some fixtures were slightly loose and wonky - but overall cleanliness was high.The king size bed was also super comfy. We slept really well and were rarely bothered by noise - yes, you'll hear some noise that's to be expected of a huge city such as New York. Overall, a great stay and would recommend to all those considering a stay here

We booked two rooms at The Crown Plaza months ago and now regret that decision!We are here now, trying to sleep but our rooms are hot! After 3.5 hrs of calling guest services and being offered a portable fan ...we are still sweating. We have had to speak to 4 different people 5 times, and still waiting for a fan. We booked these rooms based on the information on their website stating the rooms had AC. However, now we were told that they cannot supply any AC to the rooms if it is cold outside (winter time) and only HEAT comes thru the vents if you turn on your room ac unit , no MATTER WHICH SETTING YOU USE! WHAT?!?! ...and I quote...”Yes Mam, even if you turn on the AC or Fan Mode, you only get Heat!” That is false advertising if you cannot provide any air conditioning!! We were instructed by the engineering department to open the window to let cool air in and turn off our Ac unit completely. The window barely opens& after two hours, still not much better and still no fan delivered as promised by 4 different people. Also...the room photos were misleading. The wall paper is peeling off the wall , the desk chair looks worn and ratty...and the window they told us to open for our “air conditioning” has a thick layer of moldy dirt and dust all around the inside edges that is now what we are breathing...

I will admit that prior to my stay at this hotel I read the reviews and had some minor concerns.  I am happy to so that my stay was just perfect!  I was in New York on a girls trip with 3 friends.   Check in was very smooth, and were accommodated with an early check-in  and a room with a view of the river and partial view of the Times Square area.  Our room was very clean, comfortable and cozy.  We had an issue with the vanity lighting in the bathroom and maintenance came up right away to fix it.  Every request to housekeeping was filled within minutes during our 4-day stay.  The hotel was completely booked during our time there due to it being a holiday weekend (Veteran's Day) however there was never a long wait for the elevator or assistance.  We were on the go so much that we didn't get a chance to order room service or eat at one of the hotel restaurants.  We did enjoy a complimentary glass of wine in the bar area.  The staff was very nice and even took photos for us.  This location was perfect...right  on Broadway in Times Square and directly across from Juniors and M&M World.  I enjoyed everything about our stay and I would definitely stay here again!!  Special thanks to Brunelda and Michelle for being so wonderful at check-in and for making our girls trip weekend stay even more amazing!!

Annual trip to Time Square after spending two weeks at our time share in Orange Lake resort, Orlando. We love this hotel because of its position to Time Sq and the Broadway area. and the hotel is always busy and a hive of activity. Always a pleasure to come back and stay there. Staff are great, especially at the concierge desk where they go out of their way to help you.

Words cannot express the gratitude and level of excellent service that i got from VAL at the TIme Square location of Crown plaza. I am so grateful for the service she provide myself and family during an unexpected event. She was such a pleasure to work with and would definitely recommend this location to all travelers in NYC when I tell you that they go above and beyond, they really do. Can’t wait to go here when I return back to NY

Stayed at this lovely hotel for 4nights. Checking in was breezy and the room we got was quite near the emergency exit. It was quite noisy as we had noisy neighbours with banging of doors & loud conversations and maybe the walls was not concrete. Otherwise we really enjoyed our stay there. The beds was comfy and room smelled cleaned with hardworking n friendly housekeeping making sure the rooms are clean every day. Just a note, hotel do not provide disposable toothbrushes but other toiletries like shampoo & shower gels are available. Also airport shuttle is easily booked at the concierge. Just approach the pleasant staff there.Will definitely come stay here again as Times Square is just at the doorstep.

I have to say overall that the beds were comfortable, rooms very nice, hotel and staff fantastic. However the time we were there 500 teenagers were staying in the hotel, and were in the corridors not being monitored shouting until all hours. We complained to the guests directly, the duty manager, and the reception staff. Security came up numerous times to no avail they continued til 5am most days, this left us exhausted.The staff overall in the hotel were amazing, I think we were really unlucky. They gave us a late checkout on the last day to try and eat as were exhausted before our flight, gave us a free snack -‘so we really get they tried! However the rating had to go on experience and staying in New York with days walking 10 hours u need that rest and it totally effected our stay.

Wow! We loved this hotel! We had a corner room on the 24th floor facing Times Square. The view was wonderful! We walked everywhere, even to Macy’s on Black Friday! The breakfast was delicious . Everyone was so friendly, especially Lou, the hostess at breakfast. We really enjoyed talking to her, she was always smiling! A wonderful asset to Crown Plaza! It is located close to many things, we never took a cab or the subway. Priced very reasonable, we will stay there again! Thank you all!!

The location was perfect! In the middle of the action on time square! Many tourists places are close by like the Rockefeller centre if like me you wanted to see the big Home Alone 2 Christmas tree. The subways are very close too and east to navigate around the city. Big shoutout to Victoria on reception on the day I checked out on 15/11/2018 she is an amazing person! Crown Plaza is lucky to have her! The service was fab I had an issue with the curtains in the room and they changed my room straight away, comfortable beds. The hotel has lots of cudtomers and is busy but thanks to people like Victoria the efficiency is really good!

My family of four stayed at this property for the 2018 Thanksgiving Macy's Parade and weekend trip to NYC. Our two young kids are ages 5 & 7. The property location is excellent & is in "child friendly" proximity to everything...lol We had a short 10 min walk in each direction for all of of our planned activities; off broadway Gazillion Bubble Show, Ice skating at Bryant Park, American Girl Doll Cafe, Time Square, etc. Also there is a super close Starbucks located a block up on Broadway that my kids loved to stop in and get hot chocolate and brownies. The property arrival & parking were easy to navigate but crowded so plan that time in for departure and arrival. We had the two bed plan on the 15th floor. The room was nice and clean. We did not spend a ton of time in the room but in the mornings I heard a consistent knocking sound in the roof area of the 15th Floor in the vicinity of the "Salon" room. When I called the front desk sent up maintenance immediately & he informed us that there is a commercial fan in that area and that every time it comes on that is the noise you are hearing; evidently this is a common complaint for this floor on that side. Be aware of the noise issue if you are given a room on the 15th on the "Salon" side; its convenient because the pool and gym are also on that floor but maybe ask for the side opposite of the "Salon" meeting room to avoid the early morning knocking noise. The staff for all areas were extremely nice and professional. I took the kids to the pool & they had complimentary noodles and life jackets that the kids enjoyed using. Despite the knocking noise we truly enjoyed this property & its location. I would definitely recommend this location if you are traveling with young kids.

Stayed here in late october, was delighted with the reception staff. They were polite and helpful as i had just arrived in a long flight from dublin. Ideal location and hotel is tastefully decorated and designed. I always stay with crowne plaza and they never disapoint!

Sandra esp , the front desk lady who is a very nice and helpull person should be more recognized . She was very attentive and kind. Ill recommend. This hotel for everbody if youre looking for a place to stay come in here you wont regret it.

The location is an ideal for anyone who is visiting New York for the first time . You feel you are in the heart of everything and you can walk just few minutes to reach all the attractions in New york . Broadway is on your doorstep , M&Ms world , Disney store, etc.The room is good , wifi is excellent,hotel is big and busy all the time . Overall I would recommend it but don’t expect a luxury 5 stars hotel .

First visit to NYC and our hotel choice was ideal for what we were looking to do. Sitting right on Broadway, in the heart of Times Square the location was in easy reach either by walking or subway for all the things on our itinerary.Rooms are very clean and comfortable with everything in working order. We were on the 37th floor and views from hotel looking North were amazing seeing all the skyscrapers. Staff very friendly and helpful and if like us you have to check out well ahead of your departure time then luggage can be left with the porters by one of the entrances.Was a pleasure to stay here and would recommend if you are going to New York and want to be in the heart of the Times Square action. Central park, Empire State, Hell's Kitchen and 5th Avenue all within easy walking distance. Subway stations are also close by.

We cannot say enough about the great service we received during our stay! Upon checking in we were given great service and allowed to chose a different type of room that was more comfortable for our group. The rooms were clean and given attention each day. The hotel was in the perfect centralized location. . We want to give a special shout out to Corrine, the concierge. She was absolutely amazing!! Each day she took our plans and figured out the best route to see all of the things on our list. She alerted us to special show/dinner deals that we thoroughly enjoyed. She served us with kindness, humor and her city expertise! Make sure you find Corrine to help plan your best city experience!! She is the gem of the Crowne Plaza!

we have been to NYC many times i can not praise this hotel enough, we have now stayed 5th year running. its perfect location but above all its clean, comfortable, and welcoming. staff are great a lovely coffee shop and bar. the rooms are quite big compared to some in manhattan with comfortable beds. we have booked a corner times sq view room for jan 17th 2009 as these rooms are lovely over looking times sq.we were there a couple yrs ago when there was a very heavy storm the staff could not get in but they managed to keep everything running as near to normal as they could. what a gem of a hotel in a perfect location.
user_name:
joe1811
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Like many NYC hotels, it's busy and it's expensive but hey - it's NYC!! The hotel rooms are very nice, very big and quiet. I was on the 36 floor and view was very nice. Location is superb and I would recommend this hotel.

Had two rooms on 20th floor, one with Times Square view. Rooms are spacious and well maintained. Would have liked a fridge. Service very good. Lobby area very busy, but easy to check in. Times Square is just outside the door. Well situated if you want to be within walking distance to the theatres and many top attractions such as Rockefeller Square, MoMA, 5th Avenue shopping. Lots of restaurants in the area. While hotel restaurant is decent one can get better value close by.

New York weekend of sightseeing, shopping and Radio City Music Hall. Expecting to take in the sights and sounds of New York at Christmas time. Great hotel and close to all amenities,especially Times Square. Victoria at reception was most friendly and accomodating. She welcomed us and was very efficient! Certainly a nice way to be acknowledged as a guest at the hotel!

Situated right on Times Square, you couldn’t be closer to the action. The rooms are good sized and nice and clean but probably not as modern as I was hoping. We were actually on the IHG Elite level (floor 43) but even then we didn’t get a fridge in the room or bottled water. Price was ok, the bar was good. Breakfast wasn’t great, I think the cost was $32 ph which I believe is quite good compared to others around but there are so many eateries within yards of the hotel, is recommend going elsewhere

Our room on the 32nd floor overlooked Times Square and the view was great. The room itself was a little tired but still good. Probably in the refresh rotation. I have left two messages for billing and they will not call me back to take my question.

This hotel was recommended by both family and our travel agent and now I know why. Brilliant location. Amazingrooms. We were on level 25 . a corner room -overlooking time square. Best bathroom. Wonderful shower - andthe bed was amazing. Breakfast was sensational with a huge selection . Location wise it was the best. A top hotel

From start to finish, comfort, cleanliness and service is what makes this my favorite Times Square, NYC, hotel. Fantastic views from room, room service classy. The bar is the Bomb...with Jason and Martin, service was impeccable and fun. Sunday buffet was a great value too, and our server, Rahman, could not have been more gracious. Even our front desk staff was wonderful. Management is doing a great job there. I had th ed pleasure of dealing with Karim, F & B Mgr, an absolute valuable entity to this property. Thank you all!!!

Just back from a 4 night stay, great location, rooms were fine if a little small especially when there was 4 of us sharing but we were only in the room to sleep so no big deal. Lovely and clean and staff were very welcoming and friendly.. Free drinks voucher for the bar which was a nice touch.

The location was perfect and within easy walking distance of every musical and play we attended. Room was spacious, clean, and well-maintained. Front desk staff were helpful during check in and check out. House Cleaning staff were exceptional.

Arrived November 8, 2018 and were pleasantly surprised with the convenient location in the heart of Time Square. The last time we were in New York we stayed at The W, a block up the street, and found our room at the Crown Plaza much more spacious.Our check in was quick and efficient and we had requested a higher floor, which the clerk without our request, upgraded to a premium floor. Awesome! The room was fantastic with a great view. I would have no hesitation booking my next stay at the Crown Plaza. My wife and I were thoroughly impressed.

The hotel was nice! The room was clean, bed was comfortable food was good and the staff were polite and helpful. If you want to be in the heart of Times Square this is the place to stay. The location is great!

Great location on the doorstep of Times Square, good rooms specious, beds comfortable, bathrooms good size and full of the usual amenities, breakfast good selection at the buffetSpire member so you are offered a good amount of vouchers to spend at the hotel,

I have stayed at this hotel every year for many years. I used to enjoy the stay and never had problems. For whatever reason, I had several service problems this year, which suggested that the service is slipping.On the positive side, the standard king room is very spacious -- much larger than the normal NY hotel room. The bed was comfortable and the TV was fine. The service at the front desk at check-in was good, though when I checked out around 7 a.m., there was only one person at the front desk of this very large hotel. The internet was ok.My major gripe is the nonsense service/resort fee of around $30 per night that the hotel charged. As best I can tell, the only value you get for that is a free coffee or water per day and maybe some breakfast which I did not want or need. It is clear that this fee is just a way to make the quoted room rate look lower than it really will be when this fee is tacked on. If it was intended to cover internet charges, they used to provide free internet to member of the frequent guest program (like me), so this is just a hidden price increase. Apart from that, i had several problems and noted several deficiencies that I had not previously experienced, including:1. When I got to my room, there was no lamp on the desk, which made it impossible to work. When I called the desk, they sent up a lamp quickly, whIch I appreciated. The staff member who brought it up and had no idea why there was no lamp in the room. That is a major housekeeping breakdown.2. In addition, when i first went to my room, there was no cover on the part of the door where a guest would swipe the room card -- the innards of the security lock were showing. This was not a practical problem because the card still worked, but it reflected inattentive service.3. The alarm clock went off in the middle of the night on my first night, awakening me. That should never happen.4. The TV froze on my last night so that the remote could not change channels or even turn the TV off without a lot of maneuvering.5. The bathroom seems tired -- older fixtures. Instead of glasses, the bathroom has only plastic cups. Very low-end hotel-like.In all, the hotel is generally ok, but not much better, and the nonsense fee they charge is inexcusable. I'll have to re-think staying here in the future.

We have stayed here a few times and it is very well located if you want to see shows in the theatre district!! Our room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were all very nice and special thanks to Brunhilda if I remembered her name correctly and the concierge who got us great seats to a show! The hotel bar and restaurant was also very nice with attentive staff- which we were appreciative most at breakfast. The location is a short walk to Rockefeller center and not too far from the high line if you like to walk. We had a great trip and had no issues with our room at all.

Generous sized room, especially for NY and specifically Times Square. However, my bathroom counter was dirty and the sheets had a few spots on them. VERY expensive, I traveled for work and would not stay again.

Had a great stay. Staff very efficient, and polite. They responded quickly to any problems. Stayed with a group of 25 none of us had any problems. The rooms were clean and well decorated. The bathrooms were clean and the hair dryer worked. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

This hotel is over priced for the rooms you get. It’s filthy, bathrooms are disgusting, counter seems to have never been wiped clean. You are better off staying probably few blocks away from time square with cheaper price & most likely better rooms. As it is, everything is close by & you end up walking quite a lot. I even asked our maid to vacuum the carpet in the room which looks about 25yrs old filthy carpet. I would not recommend staying here. It got 1 Star just cuz of the location being in time square.

After arriving at the Crowne Plaza without our delayed Baggage it was great to have a warm and friendly greeting and upon hearing of our baggage problem having us supplied with slippers etc. until our luggage arrived (34hrs later). The staff at the Crowne Plaza we encountered were all very friendly. Our room was facing Broadway/Times Square and very clean.

Nice hotel. The view was amazing. The elevators were so fast they made our ears pop every time The staff was very friendly. The heating system was not working correctly. It was extremely warm even when turned down.

Everything was so good. Clean, tasty food, good people!Especially Miss Ana from restaurant, so kind, so professional, very present in everyplace.We chose this destination for our future trip.Congrats!

This hotel is right in the heart of Manhattan and only a few steps into Times Square. Rooms are comfortable and well maintained. The bathroom has a short bathtub so anyone over 5’ tall cannot stretch out in the bath. The hotel, because of its location, is very busy but staff are helpful and efficient.

A+ We really enjoyed our stay. They were very accommodating in our room selection, which was well furnished. All the staff that we met were very helpful and friendly. The restaurant staff was absolutely great, as was the cocktails and salmon.

Me, my boyfriend and our one year old son stayed here October 20th-25th. The hotel is nice enough. It’s in a perfect location though. One block from Juniors(get the plain cheesecake) and a 25hr store called Duane Reed, which is like Walgreens or CVS. Our rate was $2200+ tax for 5 days in a corner room. Room 3002. The view could’ve been better though. I just feel like for the prices of the rooms, the least they could do is not have broken furniture. The desk AND one of the chairs were broken. The chair actually collapsed while my boyfriend was sitting in it and we had to place it outside in the hallway so they could come get it. Other than that, this hotel is LITERALLY near everything and in the heart of Times Square. The breakfast buffet sucks though. We had complimentary vouchers though. They should not be charging. It’s exactly what you would get for free at a Marriott or Comfort Inn. In addition, everyone that works in the hotel was very nice and helpful. They arranged for me to have a bottle of champagne, a fruit tray and an amazing slice of chocolate cake for my birthday. Last but not least, you have to go to Dallas BBQ and get the Hennessy wings and the Hennessy Colada!

Despite being gold member of hotel chain and having stayed in the chain's hotels for 26 days so far this year, this was by far the grubiest room I have stayed in , in a four star hotel....we opened the window and there was thick dust and grime around the frame , some of the tiles in bathroom were cracked , taps were loose and furniture was shakey with old hinges.... Breakfast was average with no live chef doing fresh eggs or omelates...Myself and my daughter are gluten intolerant , and only breakfast item marked GF was scrambled eggs with the exception of Apple's and oranges , which I am not kidding , they have marked as Gluten Free...On plus side tv was new and modern and beds are fine .We stayed here same week last year and despite my wife's protests I booked same place again ( I gotta stop chasing points) ...I payed 2300 dollars for 5 nights , I guess I payed for location rather than nice room...We will use IHG hotels again but not this one...For hotel staff  Room was 3805, Please give this an overhaul and proper clean and modernise for future guests.

We were traveling with our two children, stayed 4 days and this hotel was excellent! First of all, always sign up to join the FREE club for any hotel, because you never know what bennies you could be passing up. This hotel gave us $20 off Food & Beverage coupons for each day we stayed, 20% off Food & Beverage and also a complimentary drink coupon for the adults! The bar location, is a nice place to hang out and unwind after being in the battlefield of NYC! Just about everything is in walking distance. Parking is hassel free and $70pn. The bed was so comfortable!! The weather is just getting a cooler and I snuggled in that bed like a bear hibernating. LOCATION... LOCATION... LOCATION!! Loved being in the midst of Times Square and staying at a wonderful, updated and clean hotel. The staff was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I am a travel consultant and will recommend this hotel for NYC visit, business and leisure!

We had a Times Square view on the 32nd floor. We stayed for 5 nights. Central for everything. Subway nearby. Friendly and helpful staff. We found Eileen’s stardust diner and Juniors restaurant a block away.

nice hotel, perfect location for night life, sightseeing and shows. Times Square tends to get very crowded at night and if you don't like big crowds, better go 1 block further. Staff is friendly and helpful, also Ali in the restaurant is very kind.

Just in the center of everything inside the Times Square. It is a fully booked hotel, big rooms and very suitable for 2+2. Breakfast is normally not included and the price is a bit expensive. You can find better choices out side. Excellent gym with lots of options and swimming pool which is quite rare in midtown NY.

Great location, easy subway access - really comfy beds and quiet rooms and perfect Mid Town location. Loved the extra couch to sit and look out at the sky line. Only draw back, no mini fridge, which is important when traveling with kids.

This is a great hotel for families. Listen, any hotel that gives free drink vouchers for any beverage is a winner. I was able to enjoy a coffee and my husband had a beer...both delicious. The Hotel room had two queen beds, hot shower, fridge and if you called down to guest service you can get free bottles of water. We came with our two kids,age 4 and 6. They loved the quick elevator.The fridge was a life savor so we could store juice and milk and have some quick breakfast items to save a bit. Restaurants, quick stops and sit down ones within walking distance. Subway is close by and all the bus tours are a block or two away.We paid more to have the time square experience with the kids and it was worth it to us to be able to just step out of the hotel and cross over to time square. The kids loved it. We had no complaints at all. We were able to check our luggage into storage so we could enjoy our last day without dragging them around.Loved it and will be back!

Stayed here for 3 nights, October 23rd to 26th 2018. When I had booked my stay, I received a notice with my reservation stating that a $30 fee per night was added and that this entitled me to 2 welcome drinks, use of the pool, unlimited local and international calls and complimentary wi-fi. When checking in I was told that this was not the case and that the hotel had not charged me the fee and that I was not entitled to the above. I was not made aware of this at any point between the time of booking and check-in. I even e-mailed the hotel and guest services reassured me. I do feel that the way this hotels runs is in a dishonest/shady/poorly forthcoming manner.At check-in I was also told that I couldn't pay the $30 per night fee either. The other problem was a constant drilling noise heard in my room on one of the mornings. Clearly there was some work being done within the building because there was vibration. When I reported the issue to guest services, I was told that no construction work was being done within the hotel. What she didn't acknowledge was that the building in which Crowne Plaza was situated has other businesses and one is responsible for the comfort of their guests regardless. I wasn't offered anything for the inconvenience e.g. no IHG points, no partial refund or anything like that. And I definitely did not pay $1500 to experience drilling and vibration as part of my vacation. On one of the other days we experienced a problem with the stopper in our sink which was rectified. Overall standards in this hotel have dropped in a "money-saving" fashion yet room rates have soared. The quality and quantities of in-room amenities have dwindled - the coffee offered is very mediocre. I mean this hotel used to have Keurig coffee makers...now they have some filmsy brew basket 1 cup coffee machine. Many lower-end IHG hotels e.g. Holiday Inn and Holiday Inn Express have Keurig Coffee Machines.... this is a $500 per night hotel..that says something. There wasn't even any breakfast room-service menu or advertisement! Plus their restaurant has ceased the al a Carte breakfast menu...only a breakfast buffet which is overpriced and has many stale items! I used to stay here quite often but I am convinced to not stay here again!

The Crowne Plaza is a Great spot. It is in the middle of Broadway / Manhattan. The rooms are very clean. The view's are Amazing .We have booked here two times and will always stay here when we go to New York.

Our first trip to New York, we stayed for five nights at the end of October.Staff were polite and helpful from check in and throughout our stay. The day of our arrival was my partners 40th birthday, the hotel had placed a lovely ‘happy birthday’ slice of chocolate cake in the room - a fantastic touch.The room was clean, modern and spacious with a good bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet - aiding a good nights sleep every night.We ate breakfast once in the hotel, a buffet style with a good selection. We used the bar most evenings, reasonably priced and again staff were friendly.The location of the hotel was perfect for us, making all of the sights we wanted to see very accessible.The luggage storage was very useful for the late checkout and was efficient. The guys were helpful and hailed a taxi for us - no problems.The only negative for the hotel for us would be the service charge. I guess this is common across New York but is new to us - it should be made very clear to all guests that this is an additional charge and it is not optional. $172 is a large sum to pay on checkout when you’ve already paid for the hotel and left tips for staff throughout the stay.However - that’s one negative which is vastly outweighed by the positives. We would love to return to the Crowne Plaza!

Stayed here for 5 nights; beautiful hotel and very central; breakfast was 5 star; we also ate in the bar and would recommend it for the food, service and price. We were checked in by a very friendly and helpful Evelyn; and the lovely Corinne (concierge) helped us plan our itinerary for the week. We were on the 23rd floor and it was very quiet every night. I would highly recommend Crowne Plaza Hotel if you are planning a visit to NY.

Like any hotel in Times Sq, this is a busy hotel. Nonetheless, personnel make you feel comfortable, at home, going the extra mile to achieve it. The perfect example is Mrs Ana from the Brasserie. My wife, my daughter and I spent 2 nights at Crowne Plaza. We are New Yorkers, we were just playing tourist in our own city. We know about hotels in the city, and let me say, every time we found Mrs Ana she did everything she could to make my 6 year old happy and comfortable. Very nice lady. I highly recommend this hotel.
user_name:
NYC666
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here recently on a birthday trip with my grandson. Location is good if you want to be close to Times Square, but the rooms, at least ours, are looking tired. The carpet was quite dirty and clearly hadn't been hoovered as there were quite a few bits and pieces from previous guests (although to be fair they were cleared up after we complained). Lots of nicks and chips on the furniture and big black scrape on the wall. Hallway carpets are quite threadbare in places.Having said that the bed was clean and comfortable, but glad I took some slippers !!Bar was always busy, but very expensive, even for just a quick G&T, and I had to pay about $35/night resort fee, which certainly ramps up the total bill, but I guess it is New York

Two words: BED BUGS! Do not stay here if you want bed bug bites. I woke up one morning with TWELVE bed bug bites. My boyfriend also had some. Took the mattress cover off to find old blood remenents from previous bed bug infestation. DISGUSTING! We told the front desk, they offered us nothing!!! Terrible customer service! Will never return! don’t waste your money!

We stayed for 5 nights in the plaza on recommendation from friends. It was our first time in NYC , the hotel was central to everything , Victoria checked us in and gave us vouchers for drinks and food to go which was much appreciated .We hadn’t booked breakfast with our room and it wasn’t an issue , we just turned up every morning and added it to our room charge .Breakfast buffet was marvellous and lots of choice ! Recommended .We ate in the bar also and that service was great too .Beds comfy , lovely pillows , couldn’t fault the cleanliness of the room . Which had a nice view over the Hudson River on the 21st floor and was quiet .We used the hotel car to travel back to JFK as it worked out the same price as the yellow cab and was far more comfortable , very easy to book via concierge .We would stay again !

We traveled to this hotel for my 60th birthday- a couple of of days. Im glad we stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. We had nice, adequately roomy hotel room, and a nice view=good location in the middle of fun activity. It was all very comfortable!They have a real nice breakfast buffet, and Ali, our server, had a very pleasant disposition. Sandra Esp and Adaliz at the check-in and check-out were professional and accommodating. There is a nice 'grab and go' coffee and food area, and the folks running the baggage area were great. It was easy to get a cab, also. You can't go wrong at this hotel. and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again! Id be remiss if I didn't add that the hotel bar is staffed by some great people too! (you get a couple of free drink coupons at check-in).

Brilliant base to see all the sights in New York right in the heart of Times Square! On check in we were greeted by Sandra who speeded through the check in process, explained the resort fee and 'daily bond' however failed to tell me that the 'daily bond' of $75 was debited instantly from my Bank Account. On enquiring a couple of days later after checking my Bank Account, the Manager agreed to waive 2 days resort fees for the inconvenience and to cover any exchange rate fluctuations.Rooms are comfortable and the beds extremely so. Some of the furniture in the room is getting a little tired looking, however room only used as a base to sleep in. We never had a meal in the hotel although did use the take way stall in the hotel for coffee in the morning as coffee provided in the room is not a great quality. If buying water for your room, it is expensive from the hotel so suggest the supermarket up a little from the hotel. We received 4 complimentary vouchers at check in for drinks from the hotel bar which was a nice touch. The resort tax includes international calls, leisure facilities and Wi-Fi. We booked a hotel car to take us back to Newark airport on departure for a flat fee of $95 on recommendation of the porter of the hotel, a fantastic service. Yellow Cabs from JFK airport into Manhattan were all a flat fee of nearly $60. Going back to airport could range from $85 to $120, depending on traffic conditions as meter keeps running in Yellow Cab if stuck in traffic. We would definitely stay at Crowne Plaza, Times Square again due to the location, the duty manager's willingness to listen to correct issues which is very important for customer satisfaction and our overall experience of the hotel. Thank you to all at the hotel for being so welcoming and accommodating.

I had just returned from a trip to NOLA where I stayed at the Crowne Plaza. I was treated so badly that I thought I'd never give them my business again but this NYC trip had already been booked at this Hotel. I must say that I can't remember being treated as well at any other hotel as I was at this one as soon as I walked up to the counter to check in. Kudos to Victoria Martin! She changed my opinion of this hotel chain. Beyond that, we had a great corner room overlooking the City, good service from the restaurant and Bar on the, help in getting directions and cabs as well as excellent and pleasant room service staff. We will return here on our next trip to NYC. I give them an A+

Went here for a quick weekend getaway. We usually stay at a different hotel right down the block. I was hesitant because it was a new hotel to us. But it was great. We arrived Friday pm, the check in woman (I wish I could remember her name) was very friendly engaging, laughing and was nice.We received two vouchers for either a free drink at the bar or non-alcoholic at any of the places to eat within the hotel, (great for coffee in the a.m.) Plus a $20 dollar off voucher towards food at any place within the hotel as well. We had a double room, it was very clean. If there was anything negative, it was just the caulking behind the bathroom sink starting to peel...Not a big deal..My biggest positive thing was at check in we asked if they have other pillows besides down pillows as one of us is allergic to down. They said the got rid of all down pillows, so no allergy worries!The best restraunt ever, Juniors, is directly across the street!Will definately stay here again!

Stayed here for 4 nightRoom was okay, but the hotel staff just do not listenI SPECIFICALLY asked that the charges be charged to my credit card. My partner was arriving earlier and although giving my credit card when I checked in, the room was still charged to the wrong account.We had the do not disturb sign on our door. That’s fine didn’t get serviced but then house keeping phones is to see when I wanted my room serviced. I just flew in from Australia and wanted a nap. Do not disturb should mean DO NOT DISTURBbecause of the change in seasons, “management” decided to change the air conditioning to heating. The room was unbearably hot and very hard to sleep. Checked with the front desk and said they would send maintenance up but nothing they could do. Made the four nights in redials difficultUpon check out the person asked us how our stay was. We explained the first issue re air conditioning and he was completely disinterested .. more important for him to put paper in the printer so no point saying anything else.The buffet breakfast was mediocre at best. Pillows were way too soft for us with our heads sinking straight into the pillows.Bathroom / shower were good. Room was clean.

Right in the middle of Times Square with multiple entrances. Has a nice bar/lounge area. They do charge $30 service fee which will cover 2 drinks and gym (didn’t use the gym though). The hallways are very bright. The room & bathroom was quite clean and large (King bed). Will return.
user_name:
PYLI19
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is massive and right on time square, ideal for broadway. The room was on the small side but adequate and comfortable. Staff were helpful and check in was quick and efficient. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. transfer from JFK took 45 minutes.

Really busy hotel with helpful staff. We were offered an upgrade as a result of it being a special occasion for which we were really grateful. The location is absolutely spot on for Times Square and to pick up the hop on/off bus tours. The coffee bar (Grind and Co) offers lovely food and drinks to go. The bar offers great views of Broadway leading in to Times Sq.i would definitely recommend it to visitors. I would have given 5 stars but some of the bedroom furniture just started to look slightly tired, however it did not detract from the enjoyment of the visit.

The location was great. The room was much bigger than anticipated. The food was good at the bar. The breakfast buffet was $35 which is on the high side. There is an exercise room that is more than adequate.

Firstly I’m a travel agent so have access to a lot of different properties which everyone has. I picked this hotel due to location, my previous recommendations of this hotel to my customers as well. I also love America and will visit all the time. I’m travelling with my husband, 2 young kids and my mother. So we had two rooms. Firstly the check in line was long with only two people working. My kids became very tired. We get to the desk and I asked if the two rooms could be side by side. I had requested this before arriving. The woman at the front desk began telling me how I haven’t requested it straight away. I’m like no I did but I do understand sometimes it doesn’t come through and that it’s no guruantee anyway. She also mentioned how it was booked like it was a crappy way to book it.She said my room for my husband and I had been upgraded so if I want the rooms next to each other I’ll have to forfeit it. I’m like ok if there next to each other that’s more important.We go up to our rooms and they are not next to each other at all but around the corner. Having two small kids this isn’t great. We go back down straight away. She goes on about how we never request it and that at least we are on the same floor. I’m like that’s not the point, you told me next to each other. She responded with they are and I go no you except it to be physically next to each other not around the corner.I then spoke to the manager on duty who apologised and said it was human error but offered nothing else. As a travel agent I understand how important words are and how sometimes mistakes can happen. But this mistake firstly wasn’t handled properly where the woman was passive aggressive and muttering stuff even as she walked away to get the manager. Secondly something should of been done or looked into without just saying well nothing I can do when they didn’t even look.I will definitely be questioning further recommendations which will be dependent on the rest of my stay here.

Very noisy outside. Our room had thin windows with draft which meant we heard every beeping horn, music, row, emergency vehicle. Would have expected sound proof for such a location(and price) of hotel.Check-in painful with issue with booking becoming my problem for me to sort out with tourist company. Also meaning i had to pay for breakfast at over $100 per day for 2 adults and child.Location fine, no staff at front of hotel and very impersonal.Room service - specifically asked for no cheese with burger at least twice when ordered - burger came with cheese!!Can hear lift bell whenever it hits floor so front doors of rooms not sound proof in any way.Once negotiating noise outside we were met on 3 occasions with a 6am alarm set in our room (not set by us). After first night we turned it off only for it to off again meaning cleaner must have been setting it for between 6 and 6:05. Ha ha if this was a joke but having been kept awake all night this was not welcome and very frustrating, especially when it appears to be deliberately set.Drinks and food expensive and only 1 small bar plus $30 per night additional tax only adding to feeling of being short-changed. Plenty of better hotels in area!

The check in was exceptionally easy. The staff at the front desk were awesome, especially Victoria! Our room was slightly dirty, but the immediately upgraded us to a different room with a view of Times Square!!! Highly recommend this hotel!

Stayed here for 5 nights last month with my wife and 4 year old daughter .Check in was a breeze with the staff at the desk extremely friendly and full of great information about NYC .We were given a room on the 45 floor with amazing views of the city and you could even see central park between the buildings .On first inspection of the room though we found there wasn't a fridge in the room . For a high end hotel chain and for the price we paid to stay there we were quite surprised there wasn't one . My wife needs a fridge to store medication so with one call to reception to explain this , a fridge was delivered and set up within ten minutes at no extra charge . we were incredibly impressed with this level of service .There is nothing like NYC and times square , so to be able to step out the front door onto broadway was incredible , this hotel is so well located that you are right in the heart of the action with one step .One place i would recommend to visit is the Stardust Diner , just one block north up broadway , this restaurant is famous for the singing waitstaff . Go early as the line can stretch around the corner though .We didn't use the restaurant or bar here as there are so many options in the city for food but we did get a coffee/smack at the grind & go cafe outside the lift lobby which was quite handy but there's an older guy who works there that was quite rude , not only to customers but to his young female co worker . All the hotel staff we dealt with were always very friendly and eager to help and that is what you remember the most about hotels i believe . All in all a great stay and we will return .

Excellent location, convenient for all areas of Manhattan using the two subway stations nearby.Our room was very good with excellent views, spacious, well enough equipped and kept very clean. We felt our stay was very good value consisting it's location, but you do have to budget for the service charge payable on departure which covers things like internet access and free international phone calls.All staff were very personable, helpful and efficient.

The room was a normal hotel room and had a pretty good view of Times Square. The issue was the thermostat was not keeping the room cool. We were told by the engineer that the hotel turned the air off when the temperature outside reached a certain level and we just needed to open the window. Sure...open the window on the 42nd floor with no screen...that’s what I’m gonna do. Also, I understand it’s New York, but the convenience store on sight had ridiculous prices. Paid $7.00 for a can of Pringle’s chips. Do yourself a favor walk out the Broadway entrance...turn left and walk to the Walgreen’s (one block down)...normal pricing!!

Varias veces por año viajo a Nueva York y siempre me hospedo en Crowne Plaza Times Square. Me hacen sentir realmente en casa, pero mas alla de la calidad del hotel y su ubicacion privilegiada, debo destacar la excelente atencion de la Sra. Sandra Esp., en el front desk, quien siempre esta pendiente de los detalles con su buena disposicion y hace que nuestra estadia sea optima. Estas pequeñas diferencias hacen que uno siempre regrese al Crowne Plaza. I travel to New York several times a year and I’ve always chosen to stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. You make me feel at home with the hotel’s overall quality and exceptional location. However, beyond that, I must recognize and highlight the excellent customer service provided to us by Ms./Mrs. Sandra Esp. at the front desk. She is always on top of every detail with heir outstanding disposition, making our stay a truly optimal one. Her tiny gestures make a big difference in encouraging us to continue staying at the Crowne Plaza

The Crowne Plaza staff was amazing from start to finish. Evelyn checked us in and upon hearing it was my first time in the city found an amazing room with incredible views for us. Keith at the bar had the best recommendations for restaurants and things to see and do. A wealth of knowledge. Paul at the bell hop stand has an amazing memory. Just after holding our bags prior to check in he remembered us every time we left the hotel. He recommended car service that not only showed up 30 mins early, didn't give me a heart attack in NYC traffic. Even completely sold out, every single employee created an amazing interaction. I can not say enough about this hotel.

Sandra assisted my husband and I with checking in. She went out of her way to ensure our stay was as enjoyable as possible! Sandra is a rare gem and I look forward to seeing her on our next trip.............................................,,...,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,...........,.,,,,...........
user_name:
johnlanier82
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently stayed for business and really liked the hotel. It was clean and comfortable. Great location - lots of restauarants and things to do. The Staff was friendly and accommodating. I would recommend staying here.

It was in a fantastic location, walk straight out into Times Square . Coffee making machine in your room , staff where all great couldn’t be more helpful, I would highly recommend and I would return here again if I am ever back in NYC

We had a last minute trip to NYC for 2 nights and the Crown Plaza fit our needs for location and cost. It’s a great bargain in NYC even though we typically stay in upgraded hotels. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was a good size, views and clean. Some things need an update but again a good deal. The only downside was staying in Times Square which is very crowded but for some that’s the excitement. Also make. It’s the hotel only does late afternoon and dinner room service

The CPTS was much better than I expected it to be. I knew it was a large hotel but I expected it to be touristy and dated. The outside of the building is dated and doesn't stand out, think 80's pink glass. The Times Square entrance wasn't open, had to enter through car port on either side of building. The inside of the hotel is nice and up to date. Checked in with Victoria and she was very helpful and gave us a choice of rooms. Picked a Times Square view on the fifteenth floor. If I remember right there are 68 floors. The fifteenth floor gave us a good view of the TS action without the noise. There is a bar and restaurant on the second floor lobby level which looks out over Broadway. There is also a grab and go coffee counter which is quite busy in the morning. They have a lap pool on the fifteenth floor which is part of a health club that hotel guest have access to with a resort fee. Valet parking is $70 per night, I found a garage for $30 through SpotHero 10 blocks away. Typical garage parking in Theater District is $100. Plenty of restaurants nearby and we enjoyed a ten minute trip downstairs and across the street to Juniors for cheesecake. We enjoyed our stay. Great location.

Front desk check in is was fast and the person who attended me was very friendly. Arrived after 7 pm but my king bedroom was ready. Very clean and spacious. Comfortable bed and linens. Bathroom was clean and spacious too. Right in Times Square. Across the street for the M&M's store and steps away from the Times square steps. Great location, definitely will be back again and highly recommend.

We have just returned from a 4 night stay, which was very good. The location of the hotel couldn’t be better, you could walk to most of the major attractions. The room was spacious and spotless , the cleaning staff did a great job. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Check in was straightforward and they even said we could change rooms the following day if we didn’t like our allocated room. Although we found the breakfast expensive compared to other Crowne Plaza hotels, we decided not to eat there,but we did manage to sample the drinks from the bar,which were very good. We did notice an error our bill after we got home, after emailing the hotel they sorted it with the minimum of fuss. Excellent customer service I would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay.

Typical chain hotel in a great location. We were on the 41st floor with great views through town to the Hudson. Our room had two beds, larger than a single and smaller than a full-size double, and was comfortable.The only bar is off the lobby and lacks atmosphere but has good views over Times Square. Drinks are reassuringly expensive but the complimentary elite member drinks only covered beer and house wine. The sharp price, for elite members, breakfast buffet was good and excellent value.Staff all round are polite and efficient although a reception person telling us it would take at least 90 minutes on a Saturday to get to Newark was a bit off - it took 30 minutes!

I visited New York on4/30/18 and stay at Crown plaza time square manhattan hotel for about 10 days.The hotel is magnificent, in fantastic location,in the heart of Manhattan,a short distance from any site.The rooms are large and spacious and the service is excellent.I wish to commend tow workers who seemed to enjoy providing an extraordinary service:Mrs.Ana at the dining room and Mrs.Sandra at the front desk.Breakfast was exceptionally varied and the standard of cleanliness exemplary.In short,revisiting the hotel is strongly recommended.S. Apel

Hotel is ideally located tourist visits around New York. It was expensive to stay there but understandable as it was Times Square but what was really disappointing was on departure we were presented with a bill for $31 per day for maid service.

My 12 year old played baseball in cooperstown and the family decided to visit Manhattan before heading back top CA. Crown Plaza was a great, central location to almost all we wanted to do while in the city. Check in line moved fast, concierge was very knowledgeable, bar had a great view and solid bartenders. Food was easy to get and the lobby was clean - although very crowded. (Like the rest of Manhattan) The room was suitable. Clean, with good pillows and ac. We had a good view and could have paid a bit more for an even better one. The pool was being renovated whoke we were there, so we didn't visit it or the gym. Altogether, we enjoyed the stay and would recommend it to others. Cons - packed lobby. Daily miscellaneous charges that need dispute. Bed wasn't great, but acceptable.

We visited New York in October for 1 week. During our stay we got engaged and decided to celebrate in the hotels bar & resturant. We were served by Rahi who made our celebration very special and we can’t thank him enough. New York is one of the most amazing places we’ve visited and we’re very happy we choose to stay in the fantastic hotel! We most certainly be staying here again on our next visit.

Spent 4 days at this hotel. Location is right on times square. Bedrooms where excellent. Very modern. Clean and comfy. Coffee shop on site as well as restaurant. We did not eat in the hotel as there is so many other options outside and cheaper too. Felt very safe during day and night and so nice when girls got tired that the hotel was just there.

Great location. Friendly and professional staff. Classically appointed rooms. I got a good rate on a travel site and was satisfied all around. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NYC

My new husband and I spent the first 8 nights of our honeymoon and first ever trip to NYC from 8th Oct to 16th at the Crowne Plaza Hotel. We absolutely loved this hotel; the location is the main draw - you simply cannot be any closer to Times Square and Broadway. We were lucky to have a room with a view overlooking Times Square on floor 32. All the staff (with the exception of the two gentlemen covering the counter at Grounds Coffee bar who were totally miserable and didn’t listen to my order) were very friendly and eager to assist in any way they could.Our room was spacious with an extremely comfy large bed and fabulous shower. We could hear some light traffic noise but not enough to keep us awake at all (and I’m a very light sleeper). We didn’t personally have any issues with the lifts, they get a little busier first thing in the morning but we never waited more than a few minutes. Our bed was made every day and fresh towels provided.We only drank in the bar once (to use our vouchers) but the atmosphere seemed nice and the staff friendly. We didn’t eat at the hotel following advice from others that turned out to be correct that breakfast was quite expensive and nearby delis cheaper. The Business Centre worked well, we were able to print off some tickets without charge (as long as you didn’t go over 5 mins then charges would apply). We utilitised the laundry service after getting caught and drenched in the rain; it was quite expensive but cannot fault the quality of service - we just missed the 10am deadline however the items were collected, washed, dried, ironed and returned within 8 hours. We loved our stay at the Crowne Plaza and will be happy to stay here again and recommend it to others.

Excellent location in Times Square.We were in room 3122.room had good size rooms with large bed very comfortable.hairdryer in bathroom. safe and coffee(pod) machine in room.We had to buy teabags and extra milk(no fridge)Escalaters and lifts to all floors.restaurant and bar.small shop in hotel.very clean and staff friendly.Check when booking ALL charges as we had an extra hotel service charge of $172 per room that we didnt see on booking site.Highly recommend Harlem Gospel Tour that you can book in hotel that takes you on tour around Harlem and Bronx and onto a Gospel Church(EXCELLENT)$65The people you see offering hop on off boat tours are legitimate and some offer good deals ($19)Head out of Times Square for cheaper but very good food and drink.

Being NYC and reading past reviews of this hotel which weren't the best I was a bit concerned staying here. I decided to roll the dice and take the chance. I'm happy I did, it was a good choice. I surprised my daughter with a weekend in NYC to see the Harry Potter play. I also thought this hotel was a good choice since we were mainly going to be in the theater area. The hotel is super close.The reception staff were niceand welcoming. One of the employees in the morning took her time in explaining where certain things were located and marking on the map places we were interested in seeing. The room was bigger than I thought it was going to be. It was very clean too. The bathroom was small, but that's a given in NYC. The only thing I did not like about the room was where the AC/Heater vent was located. It blew directly onto the right side of the bed. It was either too cold or too hot most of the night for me since I was sleeping on that side. It took a while to figure out which temperature was the best to set it at. Not sure the hotel can do anything to fix this problem. There is a restaurant downstairs which is opened for all meals. Food is served until 10pm. After that its only drinks. Crowne Plaza should offer complimentary water bottles to the guests especially guests who are IHG members. I was expecting water and asked for it, but she didn't want to give it to me at first. Finally she did. I would stay at this hotel again if I want to be near the theater or Time Square area.I hope you have a great stay.Keep On Traveling!

1st time in New York and could not have stayed anywhere better than this. Central to everywhere, restaurants galore, shops, bars, theatres, subways, buses, cabs, quiet rooms, attractions. Huge rooms, large bathrooms, big flat screen TVs, daily tourist fee included sauna/solarium, all calls including international, wifi. Great stay abd would definately come back here, slept great cos the beds and pillows were perfect!

This hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Manhattan and beyond. The rooms are nice and big and the views are, of course stunning. We found all the staff to be most helpful throughout our stay and we would recommend

I have visited this hotel multiple times over the years and it remains my hotel of preference in New York. Superbly located on Broadway it is a 2 minute walk to Times Square itself. The nearest subway station is 50th Street, served by the 1 train.As a Platinum Elite member I was given a corner room on a high floor. These rooms provide windows on 2 sides and mine gave me good views of Times Square and Broadway. There are some rooms that offer a view of the Hudson River on one side. There was a king sized bed that was very comfortable indeed and which benefitted from a thick mattress protector that was very soft. There was a spacious, powerful shower in the bathroom. All areas were clean and well maintained. The Crowne Plaza Times Square experiments with different incentives for elite guests from time to time and at the moment offers a $20 discount against food and drink purchased in any of the hotel's outlets by way of vouchers issued at check in. This is an excellent benefit.Breakfast is of good quality however the range of items available is a little less than might be expected. Whilst the restaurant entry desk was often unmanned and leaving guests waiting, the serving staff were quite excellent in their commitment to customer service. Travis, who has been with the hotel for 20+ years and whom I instantly recognised from previous visits, was again a delight to deal with. He was extremely helpful and chatty each day he was on duty.For guests wishing a lighter breakfast or snacks during the day, there is a facility in the 2nd floor, near the lifts, where Items might be purchased.There is a lively bar area where there is a food menu available at certain times of the day. This area was always busy and the service was quite efficient.There is a large gym facility on the 15th floor that is operated by a company separate from the hotel however guests can use it for a small fee and there is complimentary access for IHG Priority Club members. It is a nice facility with a large selection of equipment and classes available. The lower level is currently being refurbished and the temporary changing room/shower area wasn't really adequate for the footfall.Given its location the hotel can be exceptionally busy, particularly at weekends. It seems to function very well and there appears to be strong focus on security.There is a Business Centre, where guests can check in for flights and print airline boarding cards at no cost.I enjoyed a very pleasant and comfortable 5 night stay in October and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in New York. I stay in hotels in a private capacity in excess of 100 nights a year and this endorsement does not come lightly. It has been earned by the management and staff over the years.

We stayed at this wonderful hotel for 4 nights for my 30th birthday. On arrival the lady at the front desk was so helpful and pleasant. As it was my birthday trip she gave us two vouchers for grab n go breakfast as well as two drinks vouchers for the bar. The layout of the elevators is perfect. Only certain elevators take you to certain floors so you are never waiting too long for an elevator. Our room was huge considering its New York. I've been twice previously and stayed in different hotels and the rooms were tiny compared to this. The bed was really comfy. There was a safety deposit box in the room. There was lots of storage and the bathrooms were huge. The cleaning staff were excellent also. I will definitely be staying here again.

Arriving early, we were delighted to be given access to our room immediately with no extra charge. Our room was on the 27th floor, with a view towards the river. The room was spacious, clean and well equipped. The beds were comfortable, although the seating offered was less so (only one armchair and one work station chair). The shower needed several minutes to reach temperature, and the socket in the bathroom (for the hairdryer) was not working, but other than that we had no complaints about our room. The staff were all very friendly and helpful (it is possible this was due to our English accents, but everyone seemed very welcoming). The hotel location was perfect for our theatre visit, and with several bars and restaurants in the area we had plenty of choice for dining.

My wife and I stayed here on a recent trip to NYC for our anniversary. I have to say for the price and location, it was really hard to beat. We were across the street from Junior's Cheesecake and the M&M store. We had a corner room with great views, especially at night. The service was really great as well. It's very convenient to times square, Broadway, and many other attractions in the area. There's a nice coffee bar right off the elevators. Wifi is included in the hotel price.

still the same failings but this time even worse nobody ever at the platinum check in so have to wait in a long line then they now charge even platinum members a 35$ fee per night for what they call a resort fee which is a disgrace as a platinum elite member one gets internet free then they give you all sorts of vouchers the $16 credit to spend at breakfast is a con they dont tell that the moment you take an orange juice or apple there is a $32 charge a disgrace ive stayed here many many times and am in new york again in 2 weeks but will look elsewhere where frequent travellers are wanted not conned

Upon arrival, I was notified that the room I reserved for my 3-day stay (a suite w/King bed) was not available, so I was assigned into a two-Queens room on 19th floor. The good: the room was spacious by NY standards, with comfortable beds. The rest was disappointing: the work chair that was not adjusting, the shower-head nearly falling off the wall, the drapes that resisted closing, the scratches and frills on just about everything that could be scratched or frilled. And yes, internet is super slow, so FaceTime with the family was not an option. I expected better from an IHG hotel.

First of all I would like to thank to receptionists, Freddy and Sandra Esp. They were of a great help and truly dedicated assistance. I also loved breakfast selection. Great food and excellent morning staff. Great and friendly people!!!The hotel rooms have fantastic view, however weren't any special nor exclusive by european standards.

Stayed for three hours central location handy for the theatre shows. Girl on check in was friendly and helpful. Large hotel 795 bedrooms 46 floors I was on the 34th didn’t hear any noise. Wi fi worked fine. Room service arrived quickly. Bed was comfy. Thanks

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for three nights and 4 days in October 2018. The hotel was pretty average for the amount I paid. The lobby was nice, the room was average, and the amenities were ok. I wasn't looking for a fancy hotel as I knew I would be spending most of my time in NYC outside of the hotel (other than sleeping), so I wasn't expecting much from my experience. No complaints about the physical building or the room/room service (i.e. cleaning). The front desk and customer service, on the other hand, was not ideal. On the last day, I needed to print something in the business center but the computers were not allowing me to open my email to print. I called over the manager (who was very helpful) and she offered to reverse the charges on my credit card and print what I needed on her computer. A couple of days later when I returned home, I went to check my credit card statement to make sure I was refunded and I wasn't. Instead, I was charged 3 times (once by the hotel and twice by a 3rd party service) 75$ for the printing. I called the hotel and on the first call I made, it sounded like whoever was assisting me was reading off a script and did not even attempt to try and understand what I was asking. She told me she couldn't do anything because the manager needed to investigate and check the charges to my account on their end. When the hotel called me back, they were even more useless and told me the only charge they see to my account was the resort fee (which I already knew I was charged for). They couldn't see the other charges and didn't even know the third party that charges for the printing service. She then told me she could reverse the 3rd party charges (without knowing who charged me, which is fine with me as long as I get my money back) but they "couldn't" see the other charge the hotel made to my account. She told me the accounting department had to call me back as they are "experts" in this. Here is my problem with this 1) I live outside of the USA so I have to call long distance to figure out this nonsense when the manager should have done it days ago. 2) No one at the hotel seems to know anything and they have to keep passing me on to another incompetent person to figure it out.3) How can the front desk see the resort charge they made but not the second charge? every hotel I have ever stayed at were able to see ALL the charges they made to my account (3rd party or not) 4) The staff doesn't know who the 3rd party is charging my account. This baffles me the most as I was about to report my credit card for fraud until my boyfriends reminded me it would be the printing. This is just stupid. Educate your staff (or at least the ones I spoke to) and learn how to properly help your guests!!

This is our second visit to this location and we HIGHLY recommend it. Outstanding customer service, great location, the rooms are newly renovated and large. The elevator is extremely quick and more than enough elevators for this hotel. We will definitely be back

Through the IHC website I found a great rate for a Christmas visit to The City. We were close to so many iconic places in the middle of the city and could even see some of the morning broadcasts on the street if we squinted.The staff was great.The breakfast buffet was awesome and a great way to start a day of adventure in such a great city.

They are few hotels on main Times Square and Broadway and Crowne Plaza is one. It’s at great location. Come out of hotel you are in heart of NYC. Many restaurants around. Very convenient for taxi or uber.

This hotel is in the heart of times square so the location is perfect. The hotel is fairly basic nothing special and the staff were pretty unhelpful when we were checking in and out. Worth staying here for the location though.

We were there with family for 3 nights and the hotel is beautiful, quiet, vibrant, clean and COMFORTABLE....the most important thing...comfort.Everyone we came in contact with was very helpful, courteous and pleasant. Would definitely go back there again.

Victoria Martin checked us in and could not have been nicer!! Could have talked to her for hours!!! When we got to our room she called us to make sure everything was good which is was. The bed linen was amazing and I want to buy it for my home. Location was perfect. We were in walking distance to all we wanted to see. Would and will go back to The Crown Plaza Time Square.

This place is very middle of manhattan and close to time square.Very approachable and easy to reach place through bus and subway.Very lively and happening place all around.Lots of big showrooms and restaurants around this place.

Very nice hotel and a terrific location at time square like many other hotels. Staff was very friendly, hotel offers a full restaurant and bar. Conveniently located coffee shop within the hotel. Terrific rooms with great views of time square we had the 22nd floor room closest to the elevator which had a side and front view of time square. We arrived earlier than expected, the hotel was more than happy to hold our luggage until we checked in later that evening. Definitely would stay at this location in the future.

Stayed in this hotel at Times square, location is very nice and close to times square. Just a minute walk to times square. Sandra at reception was very cool and supportive at check in with ever smiling face. Rooms were good spacious with good amenities. Keith at bar was very nicely attending to guest taking orders.Overall a very nicely located hotel with good supportive staff.

Fantastic option of a hotel in Manhattan. Having been to NY before this compares well to others. The rooms are a decent size which can be a premium in NY. Room reasonably well equipped with big comfy bed, huge tv, free safe, iron& board.Location is fab, bang in the middle of Times Square with so much to do on your door step. Our room looked right over the square and made for some great photos.Staff were friendly and helpful!Only slight issue we had was that the bathroom looked quite dated. Our room was clean and tidy and bathroom was also well equipped but didn’t have the luxury appearance to warrant 5 stars. Shower was to lie for someone over 5’10 and not to powerful. Bathroom good do with a refurb to improve the score.

Great location, situated at the top of Times Square. The rooms are spacious, however the beds, while comfortable enough, are the old "double style" like our parents slept in for 50 years - I'm over 6' and Michele and I could have used the space afforded by a queen size bed.Water pressure and temperature were excellent. Nice iron and ironing board located in the room, with enough space to iron comfortably. Enough electric outlets for all of your devices.They also could use a sit down restaurant that serves breakfast off a menu, instead of offering just a continental or full breakfast buffet. DG

Perfect location for all amenities in and around Times Square. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We were looked after by Tofael really well and always made to feel welcome during the Breakfast buffet. The selection of food avaivlable was really good and should accomodate all tastes. We stayed for nine nights, we enjoyed our time staying at the Crown Plaza, we had a room on the 45th floor, the room was nice and quiet. The only complaint we had was the hassle we received from the Nigerian Bus sellers at the doorway as we travelled to and from the hotel. Two of the men were pushing everyday, when we did buy tickets from another vendor a third man started to complain, when we ignored this, he started shouting in the street that we didn't want to speak to black people ( this was not acceptable, he was very angry and agitated as we didn't buy tickets from his team) This is not really the hotels fault, we did highlight this to reception, as we feel no one should be hassled like this after spending a lot of money on a New York City break. Hopefully the management will take this up with the bus company.Would stay again for sure! excellent friendly staff.Thanks, Crowne Plaza!

We found all the staff to be pleasant and polite. Nice sized room - could have done with a better selection of coffee making facilities. Not a complaint, just an observation! Sometimes the lobby restaurant filled up very quickly, but we had a really nice stay for four days. Would use again.

We came for some drinks to this large hotel. Unfortunately not enough seating opportunities on lobby level so we had to move on fast. Is a helpful review? Then please give me a "Thumbs up Thank FrankGeisler" by clicking the button below.
