My wife and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza NY in mid July.The hotel deducted a security deposit of 159 dollors that should have reimbursed withinin "5 to 10 working days".Almost 3 months have passed since that date and despite making two rather annoyingly long phone calls (within 10 days of eachother) directly to the Hotel whereby i was ASSURED the matter would be investigated and resolved ASAP i am furious, irate, fuming etc that i have not received as much as an e mail.The most recent call was almost one week ago where the guy on reception assured me the manager would get back to me very soon. How soon should i wait, a further three months.I will never visit this Hotel or recommend it whatsoever and my vousin and his wife and children who travelled from Boston to spend time with us were also charged a similar fee ( for an updraded room that they never received) although there issue was resolved during their stay.I am disgusted with the way this matter has been completley ignored, particularly after my most recent phone call whereby i mentioned if the matter was not resolved urgently i would be taking the issue further.ABSOLUTLEY APPALLING.

Perfect location, great accommodations, friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast buffet will blow your mind. Stayed for three nights last week. Sometimes hotels that are older, renovated spaces can have problems like poor AC in rooms, weak WiFi in rooms, or poor water pressure in upper floors' showers. This hotel made sure no one could complain about anything - our room was cold (just like we like it), we got a great connection to the WiFi even though we were at the back of the building (view of the Hudson and quiet), and my showers were hot. Couldn't ask for better amenities or location. Will stay again for sure! Thanks, Crowne Plaza!

Have stayed in Manhattan many times. But this hotel is perfectly located, has very friendly and accommodating staff and the room was large, exceptionally clean and the shower was lovely. Will definitely be staying here again

With all the hussle and bussle in Times Square I didn’t my welcome at check in to be such a fun and pleasant experience. Michelle ensured we were going to enjoy our stay and because of her we absolutely did!

There is so much to say about my stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. For starters, the location is EVERYTHING! The location puts you at the heart of things whether it is your first time visiting the city or your 300th time visiting. The views are magnificent! You get a real "new york" feel! We arrived before our check in time and went to the hotel bar to grab some food and a drink before the Yankees game. The food was so good! What was even better was the service. The food & beverage manager, Karim, greets you with a big smile and lots of knowledge of the "to-dos" in the big apple. His hands on managing really makes the restaurant flow and guaranteed amazing service. Along with the other staff members. We even went back for a bite after the game! Just that good! The breakfast buffet provides a large variety of food to start your day before heading out in the city. My favorite part? The beds!! SO comfortable and hard to get out of, like sleeping on a cloud. We will definitely be back!!!!

Overall great hotelRooms are clean, elevators work, check in process was quick and easy, bar/restaurant/cafe all on site. Rooms offer great view of time square (if you choose that room). Location:Close to several metro stops. Makes it convenient to get ANYWHERE. Streets feel safe around the perimeter. Plenty of shopping and eateries very close by. Several musicals around the perimeter as well. Recommended on several fronts

We booked here through recommendation. WE WONT be returning to this hotel again ever. We paid luxury hotel price and got mid-range quality, which for America is poor. Room quality was not to the standard we expect from an American hotel, the place needs a refurbishment as do the rooms.We were throughly disappointed with the hotel's staff because of an incident that occurred whilst we were there. We entered the hotel and came up on the escalator which then smashed into pieces whilst both me and my husband were standing on it. We were lucky to not have been injured. No-one came to our rescue, we reported the incident in and yet no-one even came to speak to us about the incident let alone apologise. This wasn't a minor problem, it was a major incident as we saw when we looked at the steps whereby the metal steps had actually shattered. The escalating was closed off and remained out of action for the rest of that day and the day after when it was repaired. The hotel are lucky no-one wasn't seriously hurt!It would have been nice if the staff had shown some concern, after all we were paying guests at this hotel! I have never received such poor treatment in an Amercian hotel.

we were 4 people, (couple with 2 kids), the room is very small, thy always give us wrong number of towals (2 or 3 towals, not 4 as expected), they correct the mistake once we called them. the room is clean. very expensive. great location,

I stayed here in 2016 and it had me telling everyone about it, writing a brilliant review and feeling I couldn't wait to stay again! So naturally, a year later (2017) I booked again... Wanting this to be my home away from home with my yearly visits to NYC. I was SO disappointed.The staff: This time, aside from the amazing lady at concierge/guest relations and initial reception member, staff I encountered were sub-par. Reception had this chaotic vibe going, I dealt with 3 different people trying to check in because the room wasn't ready> 1st gentleman - Polite, welcoming, knew we were there for a special occasion - Said we got an upgrade and we’d be ‘very happy with the room’… just had to be cleaned... come back soon.> 2nd staff member - Rushed and rude female - Said room still wasn't ready, didn’t know where the gentleman was didn't see any upgrade note.> 3rd staff member - Flat tone, lackluster attitude - Said room was ready. I get up there only to get the exact room I booked and paid for (no loss as obviously an upgrade is a bonus - it just doesn't seem professional, like they didn't know what was happening).The room (Times Square view): Was not as clean and felt stuffy. The shower was somewhat dirty and had hair from previous guests in the drains. The furniture was falling apart. Literally had maintenance up to fix the issues while I was eating my dinner (Room service from Grind & Co was great).The view, well…….. I can’t fault that, it’s amazing. The Location: Can't fault it. The action is right outside the door. From the fun M&M's store to the famed red TKTS stairs. It's a great choice for that reason and also for the saving grace score/rating given this time.A huge shame, I wanted to love it - Sadly, last month on my annual visit, I opted NOT to stay here again.

Took my husband to New York for 5 nights for his birthday as it’s something he has always wanted to do, I’ve been many times before. We has a fantastic room, the hotel is expensive but you expect that in NY our room was huge with a very comfy bed and a huge bathroom in a brilliant location dead opposite the m&m shop recommend this hotel a lot

In the middle of all the action, room was very comfortable and clean. Great place to stay. The Big Bus was a block from our hotel which we rode to get to different places like Central Park, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and also took the night tour to Brooklyn.

Just home from a 6 night stay in the hotel , arrived to a dirty room with dirty towels , stained bed linen , hairs on the sink and layers of dust around the edges of the carpet. Went down and reported to reception without even an apology from the staff member which isnt acceptable she didnt seem bothered , she advised she would get the room cleaned and we went out for the evening. Arrived back near midnight to find the room had not been serviced. Was changed to another room and given a voucher for breakfast. The new room had clean bedding and linen but condition was the same . Used the breakfast voucher and glad we didnt have to pay food was awful. Got a mandatory facility bill leaving for wifi , gym , drinks vouchers etc used the wifi other than that the rest wasnt needed. Ended up an expensive stay for a few minutes wifi used in the evening Most hotels you dont need to pay for wifi this was a let down . Location is brilliant but based on everything else we wont be staying again.

This is our second stay at the Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan. We stayed for 4 nights this time. Both times we have received excellent service and the rooms have been wonderful. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet is outstanding, with a great variety of dishes to choose from, and each day some of the selections change. We also enjoyed the Broadway 49 Bar and Lounge, with it's nice view of Broadway and Time Square, and wonderful staff. They have Football menu specials on game nights, specials on Ithica Beer Company, and a menu comprising of favorites like Nachos, Veg Hummus Plate, and Steak and Stout sliders. The Bar features a relaxing atmosphere with high top tables, table seating, couches and lounge chairs. The hotel is also situated near metro stations, so traveling to other parts of the city is convenient. Great hotel, we will definitely stay here again on our next visit to New York City!

Right in Times Square, excellent location and clean rooms. Pricey but you are paying for the location. Our room on the 39th floor looked right out on Times Square. I would look to go up high as I would say the lower floors may be quite noisy. Starbucks 1 minute walk away ☕️☕️

We stayed two nights. The rooms were spacious and we even had a small view of the river. The lobby staff were great. The bar and restaurant next to the lobby was delicious. So convenient to everything and not the slightest bit noisy. I highly recommend this hotel!!!!

The hotel sites right in the heart of New York's Times Square and therefore is in a central position. Transport from buses, metro, cabs, bycicles etc are nearby although you can walk to many of the places of interest. There are numerous theatres located within easy walking distance. So the hotel itself. It does not have a very imposing entrance and the check-in area is quite small. Our first dealing with check-in was unhelpful. I know we arrived early, but I had contacted the hotel prior to let them know and had also indicated on our booking an early arrival. The girl just told us to come back at 3pm (we arrived around 09.45), there was no initial recognition of my Elite Status although I did present my card. We came back around 12 to be told that our room was indeed ready and had a very pleasant guy who was more than helpful. We had a room on the 43rd floor, which we changed as my wife preffered a bath to just a shower, this took some time but the hotel was very good at arranging this. There was not much difference in the standard of the rooms. The beds were comfortable with a selection of pillows, the bathroom ok and the furniture serviceable. Some of it was a little tired. Breakfast was just ok, nothing special and not brilliant for a Crowne Plaza hotel, but this maybe the location. We then had a further issue with the reception when I asked for a late check-out, I was told to ask on the morning of departure, normally Spire members get this, I did ask another reception staff member and was given the extension straight away. So in conclusion a hotel in the heart of the city, reasonable rooms with good beds, a little tired in places and ok food. But you do need to ensure etter consistency in your reception staff's awarness of customers status.

My family have stayed the the Crowne Plaza Times Square through IHG quite a few times and have always enjoyed our stay. From the location and view from our room, to the breakfast and bar services, we are in LOVE with this Crowne Plaza. This time around our stay was even more special because of an enchanting woman named, Victoria at reception. Victoria made our check in process delightful and fun, it was the perfect way to start our stay in New York. She made sure we felt welcomed, checked on us during our stay and helped us with so much. Like she says, "we felt like we were staying with family". Victoria went above and beyond to accommodate our needs and made our stay so much better than any other time before! Our family can not thank her enough and we can not wait to plan our next trip to NY.

We arrived around noon on a Saturday and were able to check-in to our VIP room on the 46th floor. Since our room was on the corner of the building, we found the panoramic view of the city beautiful. There were robes and slippers in the closet for us to use, which was a really nice touch. Later, a tray with a slice of chocolate cake, strawberries, and whipped cream with a plate iced with,"Happy Birthday" along with a bottle of wine was delivered. We were very impressed with the hotels accommodations and amenities.The one time we called for assistance, the attendant was very helpful and courteous.We enjoyed our stay very much and recommend this hotel for your next stay in NYC!

Great hotel in an amazing location. Lovely restaurant with great food. Very good facilities and friendly helpful staff. Everything you could need from a New York hotel in the centre of it all. Very comfortable rooms with good amenities.

My daughter was getting married in Central Park and we stayed at the Crowne Plaza. We arrived around 6 pm and check- in was fairly quick and easy. Our room and bathroom were clean.The bed and pillows were amazingly comfortable. There is a coffee pot in the room, but the Grind Coffee Shop downstairs behind the lobby opens at 6 am and their coffee is really good!!They also offer a variety of muffins, fruit, breakfast items etc. Elevators are fast. Location could not be any better! I did call several times in advance and ask if there was something special they could offer for the wedding guests and/ or the bride and groom to no avail.It seems like a hotel of this caliber could have something! But... bottom line it was a great place to stay!

the location is excellent. Close to underground stations. Walking distance to many places.The hotel itself is very, very big. Too big to our taste.Service is good. beds are okay. showers are okay. Furniture looks okay. Linen is fresh and new.Yet, the hotel is old, and you can feel it.It seems that the bathrooms have been refurbished, yet this is not enough to make it feel new.

We arrived very late after a disastrous flight , Staff were very friendly and especially helpful at 1 am in the morning . Brilliant location and a newly refurbished hotel room , I would stay again without hesitate at this times square location

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to New York and staying at this excellent hotel near Time Square. The staff were extremely friendly and provided excellent customer service. The hotel room was clean, tidy and fairly roomy. The restaurants and diners were close by.Managed to see most of the famous sites.Absolutely brilliant

Only downside was had to eat Dinner in the Bar no separate restaurant available. Breakfast room was closed which would have been ideal.Room was clean Service excellent, everything you'd expect from a top quality hotel

I stay in a lot of Crowne Plaza/IHG/similar chain hotels and there is an expectation about the quality of decor, set up, facilities etc. This hotel meets all of these on the surface but my reflection is dominated by the awful guest relations experience in trying to recover a suit jacket that i left in the room. Within hours of leaving for the airport i contacted the hotel, reported the item description, colour, size, my room number, via the the appropriate online form that that I was referred to. Seems a simple process - 'someone from the team would be in touch' ... AND my brother in law was staying in the Novotel a few minutes away 3 weeks later - he could collect it! Easy.What a painful experience followed over the next 3 weeks. Many emails from myself followed, that several different named representatives responded to with bland 'cut and paste' sounding phrases, including requests to fill in the form again whose ID I referenced in my emails (!). Several times a request for the Managers email was ignored. None of these confirmed if the item had been found. Perhaps unrelated, but it was interesting how my final email directly referred to my pending TripAdvisor review and my dissatisfaction. Hours later that day I received confirmation they had the item and they sent the form to FedEx it to me with payment details to complete...failing to reference my brother in law. My takeaway here is that the hotel is fine if things go well .... and in my stay of 4 nights on a mix of business/holiday, it worked fine ... until guest services got involved. It was slow, unfocussed, uncoordinated ... and way below what i expect of a Crowne Plaza.

My sister and I experienced New York City for the first time Aug 24-29th and had a fantastic stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. We loved this hotel from the moment we checked in with super friendly agents and given room 4519! The room was spacious with large windows and a view all the way to the Hudson River. The location of the hotel was perfect too as Times Square was right out the front door, the theatres where we saw Book of Mormon and School of Rock were within walking distance as well as Rockefeller Center, 30 Rock, and wonderful restaurants. Every one of the staff of the hotel we encountered was very friendly and helpful and we're looking forward to returning next year to see the sights we missed on this trip and enjoy another stay at the Crowne Plaza.

The rooms were spacious and comfortable. Hotel is situated in a lovely location close to all attractions. Buffet breakfast was very nice.We were are on the 30th floor and our housekeeper Lucyna did a sterling job looking after our room and was very pleasant to say good morning. Lucyna gave lots of useful information.The breakfast staff we thought were very accommodating and the restaurant was very clean. A particular mention to Peel who looked after us. Again Peel provided us with some useful information.Front of house staff very efficient and friendly. We would really like to visit again.

Stayed here and LOVED the room size and organization. Staff is excellent, maid is fabulous and great storage. We stayed in Embassy Suites in July and disliked the tight  small size of the room among other issues. Crown Plaza tho - This location is right in the middle of it all too! No complaints here. Will stay again for sure.

Nice hotel for couples. Great views and location. Friendly staff. Nice quiet rooms even though it’s in the heart of Times Square. The breakfast was good and the drinks were great. Would definitely recommend

For the first time visitor to NYC, the Crowne Plaza Times Square is a great location to base yourself geographically. It's close to most attractions including Central Park, the Theater District & the Hop On/Hop Off Buses. The Hotel itself is OK with a good bar & restaurant and has a excellent Cafe called Grind & Co. The staff won't exactly woo you with their charm, but they make great Italian Coffee @ acceptable prices for NYC.The rooms at the Crowne Plaza are tired & are needing some renovations. Our toilet sometimes didn't work, the tap come off our shower/bath & sometimes the hot water didn't kick in until after a few minutes. There was no bar fridge in the room either which, on a hot humid NYC day is a must for storing cold beverages. The TV remote was not user friendly and quite frustrating to use.The positives were the beds were comfortable & the room was quiet & the staff were friendly & helpful.In summary, for the price we paid (including all the bullcrap resort & city taxes on top of the sales tax) and for the quality of the room, I would stay elsewhere next time - more likely an airbnb.

If it was not the excellent location of this hotel I would have given it three stars. The beds are clean and comfortable but the rooms and bathrooms are quite small for North American standards. The room is clean and well equipped. The internet worked well. I got different information from front staff but in general they were nice and helpful. The hotel is dated and needs a renovation.

I went to NYC to play and had such a great time. This hotel was perfectly located right close by Times Square. The service was great and especially liked Ali in the dining room. He remembered us each morning when we went to breakfast and made us feel so welcome. The hostess was also very special, but I didn't get her name.

It was my first time to New York & I was by myself travelling for business. After a long day of travel I checked in dropped my luggage in my room and went directly to the restaurant. Sat down not knowing what to think of all the buzzing people coming & going so fast. I was so nervous and out of my realm; then Ziggy my waiter came over, it was like he could read my mind,,,,, he put me at ease & with great service I knew I would eat dinner there again tomorrow night & hopefully get Ziggy as my waiter.Ziggy's professionalism and quick responses to my needs is what Every 1st time New Yorker needs! Thank you Ziggy from the bottom of my heart. When I come back I'm staying at the Crowne Plaza in hopes you are still there!

Customer service bad very large un friendly hotel. Checked into hotel and was given a card which the guy at reception said was four complementary items 1 Use of Gym 2 Two complementary drinks3 Free international and local calls4 Free WifiThese items were not free at all they charged me US$30.00 per day for these four items. For a four star hotel I would expect the use of the gym and free wifi. I did not make one call and did not use the gym and they dictated the so called complementary drinks. Customer beware of these charges. On check out this was charged to my Mastercard and I only found out once back in Australia. I paid for this hotel 12 months prior to the trip in full with no mention of other daily charges. They took AU$650.00 for two room out of my mastercard within one day. It has taken me two months to get my money back and they only credited AU$602.00. All I can say is beware of hidden charges at this hotel.Outside the hotel entrance every day there were people trying to sell you bus tours of NY city on exit and entry what a pain this was.In the reception area there was no where to sit and for a large hotel this was pretty bad.All in all a very bad experience and would never stay here again

Picked this hotel at random and it happened to be an IHG hotel for which I have a loyalty card. This did give me a couple of drink vouchers and 2 x $20 food vouchers. The hotel is right on Time Square and many attractions are in walking distance. It is close to the subway system and many of the hop on hop off bus tours leave very nearby. It was reasonably quiet despite the location. The staff were helpful and the breakfast option that we chose was pretty good. There is a gym and a pool (skull caps required).Despite it being exceedingly pricey it was fine and cheaper deals may be possible.

I was in NY for work and chose the hotel because it was close to the venue I needed to go to. I had not been expecting much and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. Rooms are spacious and very well maintained. The pool in the gym is awesome and really swimmable. Hotel staff were competent and friendly, in particular bar staff is super friendly. Food was fine (had the sliders at the bar).All in all a great experience.

It was such a great experience ..!The quality of the service was outstanding..!A special comment goes to Mr Rocco ( Customer Service Manager) who gave me a terrific deal and to Mr Travis( at the breakfast buffet) who did his utmost maximum to make me feel at home..!THANKS A LOT to both of them!CDAntwerpBelgium

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for two nights in a city-view room on the top floor. It was our first time staying here but will not be our last. It met our needs very well:Great customer service: Victoria at the Front Desk was wonderful. Her warm reception and friendliness set the tone for a great stay. Early check-in: We arrived early and got into our room immediately. That always starts a visit off well. Fantastic location yet quiet room: The hotel was in a perfect spot for hitting the theatres, museums, Central Park and variety of restaurants. Yet, while being in the midst of the hustle of bustle of Times Square, our room on the upper (46th) floor was quiet and comfortable. We also had a nice view from our room.Nicely equipped fitness center: The gym is located on the 16th floor and is full-service, with tons of equipment, a lap pool, and saunas. Convenient bar and grab-n-go service: We received complimentary drink vouchers which we used at the lobby bar. It was a nice environment. The grab-n-go store was perfect for us in the morning. You can get coffee/tea, juice, pastries and light breakfast items if in a hurry. We did not eat lunch or dinner in the hotel, but the restaurant looked nice. Off on a tangent: We had a great vegan dinner at P.S. Kitchen which is right down the street on the same block.My only downside comments are that our bathroom was a little dated. Also, parking is expensive ($85 per night for an SUV). I have stayed at a wide variety of NYC hotels over the years while catching Broadway shows. I wish I had stumbled on the Crowne Plaza sooner. It is just what I was looking for but never quite found. In the future, I will stay here in a room on an upper floor.

When I am in NYC for a few nights I have to make my way to the bar lobby to get my cocktails from Keith who is the master of drinks and Phil who always makes me laugh.Both work very well together and make me feel very comfortable.Management should know they are an asset to the organization.Sincerely, Max
user_name:
mnuziale2018
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is a great location and I have stayed there before. The front desk associates are wonderful and friendly! Unfortunately my room had ants in it. When I told the desk of the issue they said because I booked with Hotels.com they could not help me or offer a discount. I notified Hotels.com they to didn't care about the ants. I did reach out to a manger who offered me 25% off the price of a room for my next stay. The funny thing the price was way more then I had to pay previously. I am not sure if its worth a try again or not?

We stayed here for 5 nights, we being myself, my husband and my sister. We had a double room (2 double beds) and it was perfect as there was plenty of room for us and our luggage. The room overlooked Times Square which was great as it was our first time there. The front desk staff were the best. Nothing was to much trouble - they were there to help and they did, from printing off tickets to shows/tours and giving directions or advice they were just fantastic. The hotel is in a great position. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will definitely be back!!

I give Evelyn 5 stars for her willingness to accommodate and make sure that we had everything we needed/asked for. She was very friendly and offered recommendations about what to see and at what times. Thanks Evelyn. 5 stars.
user_name:
gingasassin
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is too good,staff is efficient & cooperative,conceirge is helpful,restaurant & bar at lobby very lively,good view of Times square from room.Hotel lobby seems very much commercial.Neon signs outside hotel at night are amazing

We travel to NYC quite a bit, and have stayed in lots of different areas. This was my favorite because of it's location and when introducing my teenage son to NYC, I wanted to be in the midst of it all. Steps away from a subway station, close to everything we needed. Noise wasn't bad, we were on 29th floor. Resort fee is ridiculous, but hotel itself is nice and clean. Elevators are so fast our ears popped every time. Returning in the spring to see Hamilton again, may well stay here again. Would have liked for the coffee bar/snack shop to stay open later.

Fantastic few nights in New York for special wedding anniversary celebration and chose Crowne Plaza with a Times Square view based on previous experience for location. Booked a Times Square view double room with breakfast and nothing disappointed! Found the staff to be very helpful from reception, restaurant and bar. We pre-paid for breakfast and the selection and freshness of the options available every day was delicious and I would recommend as you can set yourself up for the day! Special thanks to server in the bar, who when he found out that it was also my husband’s birthday, he bought him dessert- a lovely gesture (I am just sorry that I didn’t catch his name to thank personally on here). We didn’t use the pool or gym as didn’t have time and wasn’t the focus of our visit. Great base for a New York short stay and I would certainly stay again!

Staying in such a central location this clean, tidy and well staffed location is a dream. We thoroughly enjoyed the gym and other amenities. Staff were helpful and polite, all areas clean and tidy and plenty of options to venture out nearby. Will definitely be back.

Very friendly reception staff. Rocco was very helpful. Hotel is very busy and lots of coming and going but no problem getting to sleep. Had a great corner room which was roomy and comfortable. Bathroom was clean with nice toiletries. Got 2 free drinks and a discount voucher for food for being an IHG member. Remember the service fee.

I just have stayed in this hotel. It is located in the heart of Manhattan 1min away from the Time square. The Rooms are good and very clean. The room facility service is fast and very good and the reception as well. However, only the shower could be Abit higher-up. For me as a 180 tall person it is Abit low.Another thing was the fire alarm, here the hotel crew needs to learn how to handle the scared guests. But I guess this was also not a daily situation and the alarm is working well.However, by my next visit in New York I'll take this hotel again.

I came over to visit friends already here and having stayed in several hotels over the years in New York was willing to pay more for this one as I knew location was great.Two free drinks given at check in, paid for Times Square view which was breathtaking and king sized bed. Honestly cannot fault the room at all - bed amazing, good sized TV perfectly placed, tea and coffee supplied, a safe and all the basic toiletries and towels you could need. Only a shower but that’s pretty standard in NYC.The reception and concierge were lovely without exception.The ONLY thing stopping this from getting 5/5 was a fire alarm went off on my last night (early evening)It kept sounding and then a breathless, extremely panicked sounding man told us over the tannoy to stand by for further instruction. He said this twice and on the second time I decided I did not like the tone and made my way down the fire exit stairs (I was on the 36th floor)I wasn’t the only one as several people were walking down. Once outside we got more info from firefighters than any staff members. We started going back in and still nobody was making any announcements as to what was happening.I realise the alarm was NOT the fault of the hotel and they were probably scared themselves but I do find it odd that nobody could have gone on the tannoy again to say “thanks for your patience, firefighters are still checking”. It would have eased the panic.Once the lifts were working again there was a “it’s fine now” announcement but a drinks or food voucher may have been a nice gesture. Again, not the hotels fault but perhaps could have been handled a bit more delicately.This next part is in no way a reflection on the concierge as they were all gents but one got me a licensed yellow cab and once inside (out of earshot of the hotel staff) the driver obviously could tell I wasn’t American and asked if I was paying cash. When I said yes he said “I won’t run the meter then”Thankfully I have been here numerous times and know it’s a flat $58 plus tolls so made that clear that’s all I would pay him.I wonder if the hotel could start some system like they do at the airports where you get a slip of paper as you get in stating what you will be expected to pay.There’s no way the hotel could know this cab was going to do this but I know it was wrong and I’m sure he’s conned many tourists prior to me getting in his cab.All in all I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again. A special thanks to the housekeeping who kept the room spotless.Many thanks

we stayed for 2 nights, we pre-paid in March via Expedia £502. had to pay the resort fee only. we arrived about 3.30pm. were told - no room booked. we were offered a free beer whilst we wait. luckily , i kept the proof of booking and proof that expedia said - all booked, no need to reconfirm with the hotel. so we waited and were given a room. the room was okay. we were given 2 free drinks. beds super comfortable. but room nothing special. location perfect, especially being across the road from the amabasssor theatre for Chicago. Would stay here again

Room has good bed, desk to work at. Comfortable bed and well equipped bathroom. Extra costs for accomodation os just a sham to make it more expensive for little to no added value unless anyone intended to stay in hotel much .. despite many things to see in neighborhood or wider

This hotel and there staff was awesome Evelyn at the front desk took really good care us GREAT customer service As a former now retired hotel chief engineer and Executive board member awesome customer service Very well done Evelyn We stayed there the night of the 16You made this extra special for my wife and IThank you

So we stayed here 5 years agoNothing has changed!It’s more than OK but is starting to get a little tired.We have no regrets returning All was good Service CleanlinessThe sorted quickly the cockpit over breakfast which I paid lastminute for B&B but hotelSaid no.They quickly issued brekkie coupons upon sight of emails.Talking of breakfast sadlyThey’ve moved to all you can eat buffetI’m not a fanIt used to be table Service is from menuOh wellLifts as goodRooms are cleanDisabled friendly Nice barGreat location for NY tripsI think we may try somewhere else next time

We chose the Crown Plaza because we wanted to be in the most happening area in New York City as close as possible to Times Square. No matter what I had read and after all the “don’t stay in Times Square” advices from friends living in New York City, I felt that if you are visiting New York City, this is the best place to stay. I write this after visiting other areas like Soho, Chelsea, Brooklyn. As a tourist Times Square is indeed the place to be and there cannot be a better located hotel than Crown Plaza. This place is buzzing 24x7. There are plenty of Cafés, bars, restaurants, kiosks serving street food, pharmacies, utility stores, supermarkets, bakeries all within walking distance. Empire State Building, Central Park, Grand Terminal, 5th Avenue can easily be reached by walking from the hotel. We walked to all these places and loved it, despite the weather being hot and humid. This is a super busy hotel, yet we were instantly assisted with our luggage by the concierge and they did not charge us anything for bringing our luggage to our room. Yes there was a queue at check in but Donald who checked us in was very efficient and gave us an extremely nice corner room. We booked the hotel on Expedia.com which meant we paid everything ahead and only paid Resort fee of $34.43 per night of our stay at the hotel which was not only mentioned in our expedia.com itenary but also we were clearly told about this at the check-in. They do keep a breakage deposit of $75 per day which is totally refundable at check out.Wi-Fi is free and there is no limit to the number of devices that can be used. They place two bottles of complimentary still water too everyday in the room. The room was bigger than we had expected. The view was a 360 degree view which was spectacular. The room was clean but could have been better. I would recommend a little improvement in this department. Room service is good too but this being a busy hotel you need to show a little patience. Concierge was quite helpful in guiding us whenever we asked. There is a cafe in the building on the same floor as the reception which my husband made use of every morning as the amenities for tea and coffee in the room was not very satisfactory. These are some of the very minute details which I am sure, will be taken care of by the time I visit again. Check out was very quick and absolutely hassel free. The hotel concierge not only helped with the luggage but also got us a taxi for our onward journey. The concierge did not charge us anything for this service also. Not only will I stay in this property in my next visit to New York City but also I am strongly recommending this hotel to anyone reading this review. If you like the buzz, for which New York City is known for, there cannot be a better located hotel than this.
user_name:
Piyali M
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

review_body: Stayed for nearly a week at this hotel which is the heart of Times Square and proved to be a great base from which to explore New York. We never ate at the hotel as we preferred to eat out so can’t comment on food. However we did sample the breakfast bar/coffee shop on occasion which did have a good choice of drinks, cakes and pastries. Overall our stay was comfortable and convenient for what we wanted. On our last day my wife was unwell after we had checked out. The hotel Front Desk Manager helped us greatly which meant she recovered sufficiently for us to fly home. Thank you JC.

We enjoyed our stay in the Crowne Plaza as a family of 4. The rooms were a decent size with 2 double beds. The location was perfect for the places we wanted to visit. We walked everywhere over the course the the 3 days and only used Uber on 2 occasions. The theatre we were going to was literally a 3 minute walk away. We ate and drank in the hotel bar which had nice windows seats looking out over Times Square. The hotel staff seemed friendly and efficient with exception to x1 lady who we dealt with on arrival who could have been friendlier and less stern! We had breakfast across the road at ‘Juniors’ which was amazing and set us up for Long busy days out and about in the city. I do agree the hop on hop off bus sellers outside the hotel door every time you go in and out gets annoying and the fact you are made to pay for a gym and pool (which we did not use) is a bit rich. Maybe if more value was inbuilt into these fees for people who do not use the pool and gym it would be received better. Overall our stay was very positive and we would stay here again.

I was skeptical about four friends sharing one room but it worked quite well. The room and bathroom were spacious for New York. Our rate included breakfast. The buffet food was good and the service in the restaurant was excellent. Ali and the other restaurant employees were friendly and helpful. They were quick to bring hot coffee, etc. We were also impressed with employees at the front desk and the lounge area. The hotel is very conveniently located and is close to Metro Stops, theatres, and restaurants. I’m so glad we chose the Crown Plaza.

This location is in the center of "Time Square" and was such a great location especially since it was close to all the Broadway Shows and a lot of great restaurants. The hotel itself was so nice & we stayed on 45th Floor with an Amazing city view, it was Beautiful. Room Service was Great, very clean room & yes, I inspected every detail of the room & it was spotless.... I stayed in a King Bed Room & it was so spacious, but I was also in a room by myself my sister & husband were next door but with more than enough space to not be cluttered. I would have love to attach some pics but for some reason it didn't give me the option but anyway overall Great Location....Thanks Eye Travel

I have stayed here before and had no issues the first time around 7 years ago. The resort fee is not clear in Expedia booking process (Expedia issue) but is not discussed when checking in clearly - I dont have a problem the charge as such, it just needs to be clearly explained, rather than 'you have free use of the gym and pool, 2 free beers, free international calls' never mentioned it was given as part of the resort fee you have to pay. So not really 'free' is it?Location is great, couldn't be better. The cleaning of the rooms needs some serious attention. Window sills NEVER cleaned in the 6 nights we stayed and had a growing collection of some sort of flies daily. Skirting boards filthy, and a significant amount of dust and fluff behind all furniture and at the edges of the carpets, even clothing tags from a previous occupant behind the bedside table. However the bathroom seemed to be cleaned ok. I did think about complaining but the non friendly faces from the reception staff and dismissiveness when I did speak to them, the lengthly queues when I really wanted to be out enjoying New York really wasnt worth my effort. Would I stay again? No, I know there are better hotels out there and wished in hind sight I booked another. It didnt spoil anything as I chose to enjoy rather than complain but really not worth the money. Standards have changed since I was last there.

Beautiful hotel right bang in the middle of everything.Expensive, but so is New York in general. The room was lovely, everything we could want, staff were great, but a hidden charge of $35 per night for use of 'amenities' was a bit of a shock. We got married while we were there and so, the whole trip was amazing, but .... 10 nights may be stretching your sanity a little if you are just having a city break. .Can't fault the hotel for anything, cleanliness, room amenities, bathroom ( an extractor would of been good as the mirror steamed up badly), towels and bedding all lovely. Would stay here again, once we have saved up enough cash !

Stayed 7 nights on our first visit to New York, chose this hotel mainly for its location and the size of the rooms. The first day we found the location very confronting but by the end of the week we hardly noticed the crowds, but would have liked to be able to walk out the front door without being hassled to buy bus tickets. Enjoyed the overall experience of the hotel, rooms spacious and clean, the hotel is busy but runs smoothly, the bar staff were friendly and the food good. My only negative comment would be about the resort fee I think this should be included in the price and when checking in they could include a little info on where the pool and gym is, I had no idea and the two free drinks should be daily not once per booking if I’m paying daily fee.

Well where do I start. Our stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square was made exceptional due to one person – Emily. I do not commonly writer reviews but I was compelled to write a review because of how amazing Emily was. She took such good care of our family. We began our visit to NYC staying at a different hotel, which was not good and was making our NYC experience unpleasant. They had poor customer service and the hotel itself was not nice. So we came by the Crowne Plaza Times Square hotel to take a look. Emily happened to be the one who helped us at the front desk and even showed us a few rooms so we could compare to the hotel we were staying in. The rooms were great and the customer service that Emily was providing was fantastic, and so much better than the hotel we were staying in so we decided to cancel our other hotel and move over to the Crowne Plaza Times Square. Now, we did have some minor issues during our multi day stay with them but each time Emily quickly took care of things for us. She was simply amazing - superb customer service. I do not know if she is thinking of moving up into a managerial position but if she is they should definitely promote her. She really knew her stuff, and was quickly able to address our questions and find solutions to any issues we had. Also she was simply a pleasure and joy to work with. She was very personable and seemed to truly care about our experience and wanted to make sure everything was perfect for our stay. Thank you Emily for making our stay in NYC much, much better than it otherwise would have been!

This hotel is the best location in New York I really recommend it you have restaurant Broadway Central Park and is in the Heart of Manhattan but the really difference Rocco at the reception did it! He Give Us a warm welcome and change our room for a one with an excellent View!!!! Things like this change the perspective for your whole trip.

The room was fine, minus the bathroom door not shutting, which fine for myself as a solo traveller but potential for issue, location was good for what I needed, two complementary drink vouchers for the bar was good but the issue came with the parking staff. The couple in front of me had a taxi called over for them, I asked the same and he looked at me and said "just go over there to the street and call an uber". Clearly my backpack traveling style didn't fit with what he felt appropriate to be dealing with, the experience made me feel terrible given he'd sorted a cab for people in front of me and after me.

Not impressed with the "Resort Fee" $30.00 per day for Wifi (which was advertised as "free" on the initial page of the booking! Therefore this fee is for the "Gym" which we never wanted to use as we were there to explore the city and got our steps in that way, the "Pool" which we never wanted to use as we were out and about so much, and "Bottled Water in the Room" which was never there and we had to phone down for every day of our stay - and it was limited in quantity too, and "two drinks at the bar".Check-In was disorganized and took about 30 minutes - the line went around a pillar and other guests circumvented the line and just went straight to the end desk despite us and others waiting in line.Room was clean and comfortable, the hotel was in a great location. Did accommodate a late checkout.No fridge.Only ever left shampoo and conditioner for one person despite knowing there were three guests.

Upon arrival we asked for an extra baggage stand as there was only one. None arrived despite us being there for a week. The standard lamp over the coffee table had a loose connection and could have been dangerous. We asked for a replacement, after 5 days they unplugged it but still left the lamp. The handbasin tap dripped continuously meaning we had to use a facewasher overnight so we couldn't hear it. Lastly the shower ran cold very quickly. This too was reported so on day 5 they sent a maintenance man. He turned it on and of course it ran hot.(probably thought we were stupid women! The location of the hotel is good, the downstairs areas are efficient and the breakfast shop is a godsend. Rooms were clean and beds were comfy.

Comfortable room-staff very helpful! We did have a long walk to the room-you might want to request closer to the elevator. We enjoyed a late lunch in the bar-same menu as the restaurant. Would definitely book again. Shuttle to the airport was prompt.

I booked this hotel because of its location - nothing like being in Times Square! The room was clean but plain. We didn't have a chance to eat at the restaurant, but did grab a coffee and treats in the lobby on our way out to explore the city.

Arrived late due to traffic from Newark Airport and front desk was quick and efficient getting us on our way to our reservation. They even handed us two cold bottles of water while we were checking in due to the heat and humidity. Nice touch.Room was 3701 and a corner view with peek-a-boo of Empire State Building. Quiet, upstairs location. Only heard one or two sirens. Very clean. Fresh smelling. Comfortable beds. Good water pressure. Perfect.Also provided a coupon for a free beer, house wine, or soda from the bar at the hotel, another nice touch. We used the coupons with an appetizer of Mac-n-Cheese before heading out on our second night. Lovely stay. Recommend.

The hotel is old, and inside it can be noticed. In the rooms there is a permanent stinky smell, likely due to the very old carpets.Also the linen, and pillow cases do not smell the freshness of a just made laundry, and is unpleasant. The furnitures inside the room are very old, squeaking when open/close the door. There is no frigobar, but it can be requested, so a person will bring an old empty refrigerator.Shampoo and conditioner are given upon request only; I had to complain, to have it refilled. There is no shower gel provided.The wifi in the room is very good and stable, no complain for that.We didn’t like the breakfast; the food is low quality, and even worse, the food is exactly the same every day, with almost no change. We stayed more than 8 days and we had to eat the same low quality food.One day we asked to have an espresso and cappuccino, instead of the usual americano coffee, and they asked to charge additional 17 USD by saying that was not included in the standard breakfast (normally charged at 35USD when purchased separately from the room).The restaurant has windows on a nice view on the 7avenue just near times square, but the glasses are dirty, so you can’t really take a good picture.In the business centre the computers can only be used free for airport checking in. Everything else, including the use of windows office, internet, or printing, is to be paid; first time I see it in an hotel.ATM machine inside the hotel charges 12 USD, and you only know after getting the money, without pre information. I used an ATM machine in the JFK airport and it is only 3USD; I think in the city is even less that. They kept charging my credit card every other day, without my preapproval and without informing me. I had to call the bank and block the card, to avoid continuous charging, despite I asked them to not do it.The staff at reception is not friendly at all, sometimes arrogant. It seems they are the Clients and we need to adapt to the rules.However the staff of the brasserie nearby (brasserie 1605) are very kind, they have good beers and good food.I am sorry but for approx 400USD per day I am used to have better facilities and services.If I will be back in New York, there is no chance I ‘ll be back there, sorry; hope this will drive an improvement.

Spent a week here on a couples holiday. Good location. Good sized room for New York. Staff excellent. Room was clean and comfortable. Coffee maker provided but only issue was no fridge for milk. We had to use the ice bucketWould recommend to anybody looking for a hotel on Times Square

Three friend and I went to NYC to celebrate our 60th. This was perfect! We arrived around 1 and our room was ready (we were prepared to store our luggage). The staff was friendly and helpful, and this was without exception the entire weekend. We had a package and therefore had vouchers to eat breakfast in the restaurant. (I honestly may have hesitated to pay that price-$30- otherwise) Breakfast was wonderful, and the service was great.( Our favorite server was Ali, who remembered us from the day before and kept us in coffee and cream!) We had a drink in the bar the last night and once again, impeccable service.The room was just as pictured and the beds comfortable. (And they didn't have those heavy covers that weigh you down-my pet peeve) Only used the concierge once (our travel agent made good plans) but she was friendly and helpful. We stored our luggage the last day, and the bellmen there were helpful and nice, and ordered us a car for the airport. The car was a bit expensive, but we knew that, and since it was raining, we made that decision. And the location is perfect-cheesecake across the street! It is a bit pricey, but well worth it if you can make the $$ work. If we get the chance we will stay again. I am not exaggerating, I promise.

Love how the hotel looks, had a great experience and the front agent Donald Mei made it even more enjoyable. He assigned me a great room with a great view. As well as recommended the restaurant and provided us coupons to save at the restaurant. Donald Mei is an awesome person. Hopefully he see's my review.

Located in Times Square, I chose to pay a bit more for a room with a view. The room and hotel décor is modern, which fits with the location. The rooms are not large, but they’re not a closet either. Obviously, this hotel is the place to stay if you want to be in Times Square, but the hotel itself felt a little hectic at the entrance & in the reception area. My only complaint would be the entrance on street level feels more like you’re entering through the service entrance; there’s almost always a line of guests trying to get their luggage to the bellman, blocking the escalators (that lead to the reception on the second level). It would be nice if they had someone at the entrance to greet or at least orient the guests as they arrive.

Very good hotel and great location about one minute from Times Square and metro stations very close. Very comfortable room with a tea and coffee maker in room. Staff were friendly and helpful with a quick check in and out lots of bars and restaurants very close a great stay in Manhattan if you don’t want breakfast in the hotel a all you can eat place right opposite hotel for 11 dollars

This was my first trip to the USA and found service at the hotel to be great. All the staff were very professional, helpful and friendly. They provided whatever extra that I asked for but I have to give a special mention to Rocco. From offering on my first day an upgrade - to a very comfortable room with a great view from the 33rd Floor - to recommending local restaurants, he was a great help. I'll certainly go there again.

Great hotel and staff fantastic location just spent five nights there with our friends fab corner room on the nineteenth floor with an excellent view the beds are so comfortable rooms cleaned every day with fresh towels brought. My only small criticism would be that the bathrooms could do with a refurbish we would definitely stay again though..

From your shopping bag stolen at reception, to bugs in the room, to total irresponsiblity of shipping a left behind article back. to total irresponsive management. There is not one thing good I can say other than yes the location!

We choose Crowne Plaza because of the location and the great deal they had on Priceline. The room was clean, beds were comfortable and checkin was super easy. Location is perfect, it was great to walk out the door and be close to everything.

I spent one night there waiting for my connection flight. the location is grea. in the middle of all the fun. the staff are very helpful. As memeber of IHS hotel, they waived the resort fee for me which was nice.

Fantastic hotel in the centre of everything. Staff very friendly couldn't do enough for us.Great view from room. Beds exceptionally comfortable. Right in the heart of all the shows on Broadway. Very central for all the local places of interest. A subway station just across from the Hotel.

I've stayed in Times Square many times, each time at a different hotel and Crowne Plaza is definitely my favourite by far.The room was massive (by New York City standards), it was clean, the staff at front desk and coincerge were incredibly friendly and super helpful. Location is everything!

The hotel has all the conveniences most folks would expect and require. The location is close to numerous restaurants, shows and subways to easily get you to all sorts of places, such as Battery Park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. Sandra Esp. checked us in and was extremely helpful.

Great hotel near Times Square with a great view of Manhattan. Clear prices and friendly staff all around. We had two great rooms, one on the 43th floor and another on the 38th, both excellent. The first one had a great window and two wedding beds (beds for two people), the second one had a smaller window, buy great nonetheless.We had vouchers for the breakfast and non-alcoholic drinks when we arrived and the doors was good.The most helpful, most professional, kindest, most careful, most full of humanity assistant of them all was Peel James, who helped us in each of our necessities!Great hotel, recommended!
user_name:
Alessandro C
Casal di Principe, Campania, Italy

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights last month as part of my 50th birthday celebrations. Having been to NYC several times before we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room. It was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We were on the 39th floor and had a great view of Broadway. I would like to mention that one day we were out and I suddenly remembered I had forgotten to lock the in-room safe. It was an anxious couple of hours before we could get back to our room which in the meantime had been serviced. All our valuables, including over $2000 cash, had been left untouched. Your housekeeping staff are to be commended.

From the moment we walked in we were treated great. The staff waa so friendly and accommodating. All our requests were accommodated without hesitation. Rooms very clean and roomy for NYC. Location was great! Will stay again!

This was our nineteenth year going to the US Open Tennis Championships and our first time staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square. We usually stay in this general area as we love the convenience of the subway to Flushing Meadows and the vibrancy of Times Square - the hotel certainly is well located! We were greeted promptly at checkin and were very pleased with the room being ready for early checkin. The staff were wonderful: pleasant, friendly, professional, courteous, and personable; in spite of the fact that he introduced an UNEXPECTED SERVICE fee which was NOT disclosed upon booking the room. As a Platinum Ambassador, I was shocked at this disclosure at checkin! The entire hotel industry has started to introduce all these hidden fees (they are not openly disclosed when making a reservation) and deceptive pricing practices. I guess they are going the budget airline route which I do not expect from a hotel chain such as Crowne Plaza. But I am sure they are giving these fees directly to their staff for their wonderful service. Note to hotel chain, if you need a higher price, simply propose a higher rate - if I encounter this again, I will not darken your door or the door of any hotel in your entire chain again. The service throughout the hotel was excellent, very friendly and timely service. Our city view room was great with nice size and comfortable bed - I need extra pillows for sleeping and this was immediately accommodated upon request. One thing I will complain about is the large screen TV over the lobby bar area as it cannot keep up with the speed of broadcast so action scenes are always distorted (must be a 60hz refresh rate)! This is unbelievable and I teased the bartender to please stop at a Best Buy on the way in to replace this antiquated set! We could not watch it as it made me ill. Outside of the unexpected “Service fee” and lousy bar TV, we loved this stay and will look to stay here again next year (hopefully they will replace the TV in the bar area).

We decided to take a last minute trip to NYC for Labor Day. We got a great rate for Sunday and Monday nights. I’ve stayed here several times and jumped at the rate which is half of what I usually pay there. The service was awesome as usual. Housekeeping friendly and prompt without being in your face constantly. The room was pleasant, clean and up to date. With our room, we got free breakfast buffet both days. The food was tasty with great variety and servers attentive. My only comment is the food was cold both days—this doesn’t bother me as I don’t like very hot food but it might be less enjoyable to others.
user_name:
Beth M
North Smithfield, Rhode Island

review_body: When one goes to Manhattan, there are several features and amenities a hotel should have (location, cleanliness, courteous staff, etc) in order for one to have an enjoyable, pleasant stay. The Crowne Plaza Times Square checks all the boxes. My wife, son, and I stayed in this hotel Aug. 29-Sept. 1 and were absolutely delighted with our stay. First of all, the hotel is in an excellent location. It is directly in times square, within walking distance of many fine restaurants, as well as Central Park and the Rockefeller Center. We used the excellent Big Bus Hop On-Hop Off bus tour that we ordered directly in front of the hotel. The tour begins in Times Square. The front desk was terrific, specifically the two young ladies we dealt with Victoria and Vanessa. They were accomodating, courteous, personable, and patient. We were on the 43rd floor on the IHG Elite level with a spectacular view of Times Square. The floor was very quiet despite being across from the elevator. The room was spotless, well maintained, and quite spacious for a Manhattan hotel. The cleaning ladies were efficient and friendly. All the toiletries were replenished promptly, and the shower and toilet worked flawlessly. As part of our reservation, we received 2 free drinks at the hotel bar located in the spotless and meticulously clean lobby. The bell hops graciously flagged down a taxi when we needed one. I highly recommend this hotel when staying in New York City. For us, it was the perfect Manhattan Hotel. Rest assured, we will be staying here anytime we are in NYC.

My stay at CP Times Square was amazing. Check in was so easy. My friend and I were assisted by gentleman- Donald Mei - He was very kind and helpful. Our Room was very Nice. Nice view no interruptions we slept like babies. It was definitely a Great first time Experience.

Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights with my sister and aunt during our first trip to NYC. My sister booked the hotel on her credit card, then we all split the cost. We just got back from NYC and discovered my sister was charged an extra $172.10 for a $30 daily “service fee”!!! Supposedly this fee is for gym use, internet uses, and 2 drink vouchers! We thought the drink vouchers were complimentary bahahahaha WOW! We never even used the gym! I used the wifi briefly, but stopped when I was told it was not secure! What a scam! Just be honest UP FRONT with your rates!!!NYC is already very expensive where every person who helps you expects a tip. We tipped our maid daily bc we didn’t want a dirty room, and she shorted us towels on our last day, so I guess what we gave her wasn’t enough haCrowne Plaza should do the right thing and refund that $172.10!

I stay here often on business. This is a perfectly good hotel in general but what makes it great is the people who work here. Rocco at the front desk in particular is fantastic. He is very friendly and helpful with any kind of issue or request. Thanks!

The perfect location! I love this place, I've been to NYC multiple times and I always make sure to book here first. The lobby is nice too for a chill night if you're coming in from a long flight. The service is amazing too - the staff is always super helpful.

I came into jfk airport and took a cab 65 flat rate came to the hotel and there was a function in the street so one entrance was closed. So the cab let me off at the corner with was wrong. Then we walked wrong way to the closed door. Walked around to the under inside entrance. Checked in right away. Very fast. Went to the room 3715. Was a Fantastic view!! On the corner!!! Everything was clean. Walked into the bathroom and there was mold on the shower ceiling. Later that day around 6 pm we requested a change of towels. We came back around 9 pm and still no towels. We called again to find the front desk gentleman to have the typical ny attitude. “ I’ll check into it “ so we went out to a show and came back around midnight and still no towels. Called again. Same attitude. So we went out to check time square and enjoyed ourselves. Upon return there was no security which I didn’t like. Anyone could come in and out. So back to the room and still no towels. Called AGAIN AND FACED WITH THE SAME ATTITUDE! 15 minutes later at approx 230 am I received my towels. There was no breakfast or room service till 439 pm. So we ordered from a local Resturaunt and we had to go down to pick up our food. Last upon leaving the older black bellhop with the white shirt was on his phone. I told him we needed a taxi but he was on the phone. I went to get a taxi myself and wow wait till u hear this! The first taxi driver told me he had been waiting for three hours for a fair and to go to the second taxi guy I then proceeded to go to the second taxi guy in line and he told me to go to the last taxi guy which was four cars away I went to the last taxi driver and he told me that I had to go back to the first driver because that was the rules. If I’m going back to the first guy he said no I’m waiting for this other guy for hours and he’s going to take the fair because it’s an out of town fair. I then went back to the bellhop and yelled at him again to get off his phone and he wouldn’t so I yelled at the taxi driver and then went and he helped me hail a separate cab that was not even in the line. This was a four minutes screaming session between me yelling at the bellhop to get off his phone me yelling at the taxi driver that he’s the first in line and you take me and at the other taxi drivers that didn’t even want the fair. What a horrible experience. I later found out from the taxi cab that we held that we should’ve called the city to complain but we were already late for the airport.So all in all the hotel was nice just a few quirks.

At the doorstep of Times Square this hotel was perfect for our short stay in New York. Staff was friendly, room had everything we needed. We paid extra for a view of Times Square but wouldn’t bother next time as we were so high up that didn’t really feel like a worthwhile extra (the hotel has about 45 floors and the boards at time sq only cover about 5 storeys).Complementary beer and deli on ground level were a good way to start the day.

I was here for work for two days, then my Wife and Daughter joined me for the 3-day Labor Day weekend for our 28th year Anniversary. All Crown Plaza personal - Bell Captains and his team, Housekeeping, Front Desk and more specifically Sandra Esp. After a tough day of travel/work, Sandra was super nice and super helpful. She gave me tips to to help us get the best out of our stay, made sure we had the best room accommodations and few complementary drink tickets certainly helped. Really can’t beat the location, all the excitement is right out the Crown Plaza doors and lots of great stuff within walking distance.

Just returned from a five day trip to New York with our family. Staying at the Crowne Plaza was the best choice for us. It was in Times Square, within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see. The check in staff were friendly and very efficient. The luggage storage people before and after check in to the hotel were very friendly as well. But the friendliest and helpful person was in their restaurant, our waiter Travis. Not only did he serve us well, he also gave us tips to enjoy New York even better. Thank you to Travis for making our visit more enjoyable.

just returned from a 6 day visit to New York staying at the Crowne Plaza stayed between 26th and 2nd September! Perfect location well situated ...front desk very busy upon arrival but very helpful service from Freddy with the blonde amazing hair who managed to source a room on 36th floor with interlocking room for my mother next door to my daughter and myself concierge were excellent tall Spanish gentleman helped me on Friday sort an issue out with my MasterCard dialling within the states was stressful and I was grateful for that help! didn’t have a name badge on but it was around 1.30 pm on Friday 31st AugustRooms were good bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in No shower gel take your own! Sad end to the holiday though as my daughters Ted Baker glasses were we believe taken from the room sometime between the Thursday and Saturday they were on the dressing table room 3618 very upsetting she had put her contacts in and found them gone despite searching the whole room very upset by this incident to be honest. Was reported to the front desk be careful when staying

We were in Manhattan to visit our daughter doing her college summer internship. Convenient location for visiting Times Square and other mid town sites. Yet quiet inside the lobby and rooms. Easy subway access. Never received text message when room was ready - minor glitch. However, do recommend hotel.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights for business.As a platinum IHG member I was upgraded to a "deluxe city view room" on the 45th floor.The room was outdated, had old furniture. The "City view" was the view into windows of another highrise building which was blocking my windows.The shower took 15-20 minutes to get warm water in the morning and in the evening.The room wasn't cleaned on the second day and I had to complain and still nobody cleaned the room.When I complained to the front desk manager at the checkout, the manager didn't appear to be interested in my comments and complaints and offered 10,000 IHG points, even though each night at this hotel costed me 60,000 points.Also, be aware, this hotel has a hidden fee of $30 a day for services, which is not disclosed at the IGH website and none of the employees at the hotel could explain as to what this "service charge" is for, since hotel doesn't have a spa or any other amenities that you would expect from a hotel that costs about $400+ a night and charges "service fees".I would not stay at this hotel ever again, because there are several better hotels in the same category in the Times Square ares.

We arrived at the hotel at 7 a.m. Victoria at the front desk was very attentive and did everything to find us a room at that hour... and we found ourselves in our room on the 43th floor at 7 oclock in the morning! Victoria -a personal thank you from Israel !!!!

If you want to be in the centre of everything Times Square is the place and the Crowne Plaza is a great choice !We stayed here for a week last week, room was cleaned daily, fresh towels daily, staff were polite and very helpful especially Concierge lady and Mike the doorman. We left our cases on the last day to go shopping and came back to them - take care of. Also booked a car for the airport - a great sedan, as cheap as the yellow cabs - would highly recommend - I usually stay at Millenium Broadway but this was as good - the only complaint I have is that I booked this hotel for the pool for my young daughter - very few hotels have them - it was out of service for out whole stay and no one informed us that this was the case - a very disappointed ten year old !

Great place to stay! 1 block away from the busy part of time square! It was a great approximation to the fun of things, yet 1 block away, we were able to get to our hotel. close to Caroline's... food options near by.Our cleaning lady was very nice! Overall... a clean and safe place to stay!

We stayed at the Crown Plaza Times Square, which is a wonderful spot, right in the middle of all the activity on Times Square. Great breakfast buffet, which is a perfect start for the day ! Many thanks to Ana, the friendly lady at the breakfast, whose smile was a fantastic to see in the morning ! Thanks as well to the staff Anna, Adaliz and Victoria, who offered perfect service for us. nice and clean rooms, really a very nice place to stay !!! regards, Dieter Pillen Belgium

Good hotel main attraction of this hotel is its location its on times square.I stayed there for 4 nights in last month.I took two queen beds room.Room size is pretty decent around 30sq m.This hotel is surrounded by everything for e,g restaurdants,cafes,clubs & grocery shops etc.If anyone likes to ride bicycle citibike stand is exactly in front of this hotel.So its little expensive but because of its location if you want to stay in the heart of New York city this is a gr8 option.

This is my second time stay with Crown Plaza Times Square, I am still very satisfied with this hotel. Hotel lobby is nice and spacious. Jiselle, the Front Desk Agent, is very professional and helpful, I really appreciate the service I got from her.

I visited this hotel twice in the past two weeks. Both times I was treated really well by each of the staff I had the pleasure to meet. The property was located centrally right in Times Square and is comfortable and safe.Great hotel, great deal and great staff.

We came to New York to bring our 17 year old daughter for her first visit in between radiation treatments. We wanted a central location to be able to feel confident walking to activities. The hotel is perfectly located! The staff is courteous and welcoming. The room is very comfortable. We’re very happy with our choice and will definitely come here again. The drink has ginger beer in it! Yummy!

When you visit NYC you don't spend that much time in your room. The beds are comfortable, but the bathroom, in fact the entire room, could do with a bit of modernising. One thing we had to be wary of was the window! We were on the 31st floor and the window didn't fully close and actually felt like it may fall out if you tried to close it. Bit scary!

After disembarking off the Queen Mary 2 early morning and arriving at the Crowne Plaza a few hours before check-in, I was initially well looked after being advised my room would not be available until 1.00pm which was fair enough. My wife and I left to visit the Empire State Building and then walk around Times Square before having lunch. On returning to the hotel at 12.00 noon to see if there was an update on my room availability Sandra Esp at check-in couldn’t do enough to assist me, and I was kindly upgraded to a corner room overlooking Times Square and received a few complimentary hotel vouchers as compensation for having to wait for my room to be available. Sandra’s check-in procedure was most efficient as was her briefing on the hotel facilities and my stay at the Crowne Plaza did not disappoint, it was a great stay!

We stayed in this hotel for four nights. We had a room on the 20th floor facing the Hudson which we could see through the buildings opposite. We had planned three evening theatre trips so the location of the hotel was fabulous, right in the heart of Broadway. Although we could hear sirens while awake, they were not loud enough to wake us during the night and we did not hear any other noise despite the proximity of Times Square. Room was larger than others I have stayed in in New York. It was clean with plentiful fluffy towels in the spotlessly clean bathroom. We were on a room only basis and did not eat in the hotel. The man on reception who checked us in was friendly and polite, as were all the staff we interacted with, especially Victoria Martin, who was incredibly helpful and friendly when we went to query something.I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I return to New York.

My father and I stayed in this hotel for a few days on a spontaneous trip to New York City. We had been years ago, and the hotel was really lovely so we decided to come again. My last review was a 5/5 and it has dropped to a 4/5 due to the overly expensive food buffet for breakfast. If you are staying here please go to Juniors across the street! Just the two of us had a buffet breakfast and it was nearly 90 dollars for cold, tasteless pastries and subpar warm food. We went to Juniors the next morning and the food was 100x better, and was nearly $70 cheaper which is crazy! Drinks and all! The customer service was rather lousy and the people working at the restaurant didn’t give us a kind smile or welcomed us, in fact, they just stared a lot. We vowed to never have breakfast there again. The rooms were nice and large, the view was mediocre for such an expensive space and the rooms were pretty clean, apart from a few spillages up the walls in the bathroom. If you don’t have thousands of dollars to spend please do not come here. Otherwise, if you don’t mind ignorant staff, you should visit.

Great location. Great for Broadway and Great for seeing Tomes Square. .Very busy, of course but vibrant. We had a street view from the 7th floor. Breakfast was a little frantic but a good mix of tastes . Something for everyone. Also had a busy bar with great staff .Recommended.

Our flight from Toronto arrived at La Guardia at 8am. We took an Uber to the hotel. We knew check-in would be much later, but the head receptionist was really helpful and allowed us to “Pre check-in” which meant we had a key to use the facilities in the public areas. The doorman was also really helpful and held our luggage securely until we were allocated a room. We visited a few tourist attractions (Central Park wasn’t too far away) and had a coffee in Times Square. When we returned at noon, we were informed that the two double room we booked was still unavailable, but we could opt to have a king size room with a temporary bed for our 15 year old daughter. We were assured that the temporary be was comfortable and would be large enough for an adult. We were so tired, having been awake since 3am, that we agreed. Our luggage was to be brought to our room. The room was totally below the standard I expected from a hotel of this calibre. The duvet was grubby and there were what I can only assume were claw marks in the headboard. The pillows were propped up against the worst of the damage. I’m amazed the hotel felt this room was adequate for paying guests. We immediately called guest services to request an alternative room. They were apologetic and agreed to have reception call us to arrange another room. Communication between departments appeared not to exist. Within minutes, a bed was being delivered for our daughter. We sent it away. Then our luggage was brought up. Guest services agreed we could use the bathroom to freshen up while we waited for another room and that they would transfer our luggage for us. To be fair to the hotel, they did arrange another room and they did transfer our luggage while we were out for the afternoon. The two double room on 27th floor was both clean and spacious. However, I was surprised that we could still hear traffic noise through the window. The public bar was lovely and the cafe by reception looked fantastic. I’m disappointed that I didn’t get around to sampling the most enormous cheesecake I’ve ever seen. All staff were really helpful and the hotel is in a perfect location for tourism. I would definitely visit this hotel in future.

Loved the hotel and the area. Great hotel to be at night. Close to broadway shows. Great places to eat. There are diners that are not that expensive just ask around. Subway is right there and pharmacy. It’s was a little expensive but there were other hotels in the area that were cheaper if your on a buget

We had a great time in the middle of the excitement of Times Square. Every staff member we encountered was very happy, friendly, and went out if their way to assist us. The room had a magnificent view of Time's Square. It wasn't fancy but it was very clean.

Excellent service and location. Spectacular view from the room. Very spacious room with a very comfortable bed.
