In the buffette breakfast service, thanks to Ana for spoiling my son with the table of his predilection. Those details will always make the difference between returning or not to a place.We will return :)

We just returned from another fabulous stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. We arrived too early to check into our rooms. . . .Victoria at the front desk was most helpful. She took all of our information and my phone number to call me when the rooms were ready. Mike at the bell mans desk stored our luggage (and even took it upon himself to lock my personal computer in his office for security). Impeccable service; beautiful rooms; we cannot wait for our next visit.

I never really do reviews on places but as I’m so disappointed I will on this occasion.We travelled from London to New York for our bank holiday weekend.After a considerable amount of time looking to find the right hotel for us we chose the Crowne Plaza Times Square mainly for its swimming pool and location.After a long day traveling we were looking forward to taking a dip in the pool and chilling out, for us to soon realise that the pool was closed for a Refurb and wouldn’t be open until the first week of September which was no good for us as we would be home by then. When we made our booking there was nothing mentioned about no swimming pool or about the building opposite having a major refurb.I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anyone at the moment. .

Sandra at the front desk/check in was so nice and helpful! Got us checked in early and made us feel welcome. Love our room, lovely time square view out our window. Great location! Everyone has been so friendly. Sandra made sure our bags got up to our room right away and we are ready to explore the city we love.

Clean, professionally managed hotel right in Times Square. Rooms are large by New York City standards. When he arrived at 9:30 AM to check out bags, they gave us our room. Great views of New York City. Great price too!

reception service was the best ,we reach there at 8.00 am where as check in time was 3.00 pm but the reception staff was so good they handed over the keys then & there vieu of time square was superb food was good

My husband & I stayed for 5 nights to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary & couldn’t have been more pleased with the staff, service & rooms. Upon checking in with the very friendly Rosa, she saw from our booking that our trip was for a special occasion & upgraded our room for free to a kings size room with a view of Times Square. The room was fab, very spacious & clean & the bed was very comfortable. After returning to the hotel that evening, we found a huge slice of chocolate cake & a bottle of prosecco (both of which were delicious!!) along with a hand written card from Rosa wishing us a happy anniversary! We were thrilled, it was a lovely gesture that meant a lot......thank you again to Rosa & the Crowne Plaza for making our trip so easy & memorable ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

Great drinks and food - great service with a big shout-out to Rahi (a credit to the hotel). The food menu is not huge but great quality. Steak was very good. Recommend the Angry Orchard cider. Very relaxing space with great window views of Broadway

I just checked in to the hotel and the lady that checked me in was the true epitome of customer service. Very patient, knowledgeable and professional. Well done to SANDRA ESP and I really hope the hotel management reward you for your outstanding customer service.Thank you Sandra.

You can’t fault the location of this hotel as it is right in the heart of Times Square. If you want to stay in Times Square you need to be cautious as there are loads of hotels with a Times Square address but are not in what everyone thinks of as Times Square ie where the NYE ball drops!! We went for a Times Square view room which was more expensive but worth it for the view. It was also not noisy at night which was great. The hotel itself is the most basic CP I have stayed in. The rooms as very basic with no frills- no mini bar, no free water etc. At just over $400 we expected a better room to be honest but the location made up for the basic room. We are in the bar restaurant and the food was great and the service was also very good.

Se stayed very well in this wonderful hotel. Thanks a lot to SANDRA ESP, who take care of us very kindly and satisfied all our needs. The hotel was very central and with Greta views of Times SquareDaniele e Silvia
user_name:
Danist200965
New York City, New York

review_body: Our experience at this Crowne Plaza was fantastic! The costumer service was excellent, and we didn't run into any problems. The food was delicious and the service was amazing. Our waiter Tofael was very kind and helping towards us. He must meet a lot of new people everyday but never gets tired of his job and would always speak with costumers going above and beyond his expectation. The location is perfect right in downtown and in walking distance to everything you would want to see as a tourist, including Broadway. No need to worry about tickets if you're in a pinch the hotel's got you covered. Natalia Gaeta was very helpful and efficient at getting us tickets for the Aladdin show, which was spectacular! We will definitely be staying here the next time we are in NYC and I certainly recommend it!

Crown Plaza Times Square used to be my 1st choice and would recommended it ... no more! From the jack hammering to no hot water to no towels to poor customer service ... I can no longer recommend it. I couldn’t even speak to a manager. The rooms have damaged fixtures and rust stains in the bathrooms from lack of cleaning.

We LOVED staying here. It is So close to all of the theaters and amazing lights etc. We had a corner room with amazing views. It is noisy in times square, evern though we were on the 18th floor we could gear taxis beeping, but we still loved being here. It was an especially clean and friendly hotel, in the middle of everything that we wanted to be in the middle of.The room( again a corner) was bigger than many we've seen in NYC. Being a member of thier priority club was definitely worth the loyalty that we've maintained

I finally was able to snag a room for 2 nights at my favorite Hotel in Times Square. It’s been so busy that its sold our status means the hotel has been doing great (no surprise given the location and service) and I couldn't get a room. Fortunately on our Anniversary Week we were able to get a room and MD Niles Harris, even while on vacation, reached out to assure me a corner King and really generously helped my wife and I celebrate in style with an awesome cake!Kudos to Sylvia who always follows up with all details and ensures a great stay, Manager Juliet ( a favorite of ours) who came by to see us; Hostess Ana Gonzales who EVERYTIME we are there greets us with a friendly welcome and takes great care of us; F&B Karim who came by to see us and deliver an awesome cake along with one of his staff; Tofael Chowdhury , Ali and others in the restaurant, including Agathe who arranged for French Toast to one of my sons.Just to remind folks deciding on where to stay, it doesn't get better than this Property for location, service, access to everything around you including shows, restaurants, transportation; and a great jump on point for touring. You have Managing Director Niles Harris who even when on vacation and is made aware of an issue (our room was really hot given the heat outside) got on the phone to get things fixed right away (could not get the Manager on Duty Graham's attention).For anyone that wants to work out while there, you have access to NY Sports Club on the 15th floor and there is no piece of equipment that is unavailable! if you want to run outside, it’s a brisk 10 minute walk to Central Park and early in the morning you have 2 routes to jog an inner and outer circle. Great view, protected and lots of company. A real boost to your morning.A really nice Lobby Bar that is nice to spend evening time with friends or colleagues.I am a upper Tier Member of Hilton, Marriott, Starwood and other programs and in different cities and locations, have my preferences. In Times Square it’s the Crowne Plaza both for Business as well as Personal stays. Congrats MD Niles Harris for another awesome stay!

We arrived on 4th July, so it was very busy. This is a good base but don’t expect too much of a personal service, it’s just too busy and has a high turn over of guests. That said staff were helpful and friendly. There is a daily resort fee which includes WiFi and telephone calls worldwide. The telephone however was a nightmare for gaining international access and we had to get the switchboard to connect us each time. There is a secure luggage store at the entrance of the hotel. The pace at this hotel is frenetic, just like the city but it’s right in one corner of Times Square and the location cannot be faulted. We found the hotel bar to be quite expensive but it reflected prices elsewhere. There is a local convenience type store (turn left out of Times Square entrance) called Duane Reade ( I think) which is good for bottles of water etc. Our room was on 21st floor and was very clean with good facilities and a view of Times Square. The shower was draining slow and that was fixed swiftly. Yes the hotel rooms need updating but it’s perfect location was good for us! It’s close to subway stations, McDonalds, Hersey’s, Hard Rock Cafe, NFL experience, bus tours (you will get fed up of being asked because they stand right outside the hotel entrance) and several theatres. We found it cheaper to go to the theatre box office rather than the hotel concierge. If we go back we will probably stay elsewhere but only because there is so much to see and experience.

Staff polite and prepared, in guest care. Hotel with nice atmosphere, very well located, with excellent maintenance. Modern and fast elevators. Large, quiet room with adequate furniture, excellent bedding, clean and very clean bathroom. I recommend.
user_name:
dantaspjr
New York City, New York

review_body: You will find anything you need in crowne plaza hotel to feel like you are at home while visiting New York city!! The rooms are beautiful, view to the time square, perfect location, excellent service , great dinning options , huge fitness center and friendly staff. We loved staying in this hotel and definitely will come back on our next visit.

We travel to NYC several times a year and, in the past, have stayed at multiple hotels. However, the last few years we have stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. The rooms are furnished nicely and spacious. We have stayed in both the back and the front of the hotel - the views are great! The in-house restaurant has a great breakfast buffet. The staff is always friendly and very welcoming. Last Sunday when we checked in the person who checked us in, Rocco, was both friendly and efficient. He made sure our room had the preferences we liked. We truly felt like we were visiting old friends instead of checking into a hotel.

We came to new York for 3 days. The hotel is located in times Square. We got a room on the 41 floor . The view from the corridor is amazing. The room is nice and clean with king bed and sofa bed. Big enough for the 3 of us. The best thing is the location we go out and we are in the middle of everything

We've stayed at all of the IHG properties in the Times Square area and this one is the BEST!!! We went to watch Chicago and it was actually faster to return to our room to use the restroom during the intermission that it was to wait in line at the theater! walking distance to SOHO and the Brooklyn Bridge as well as close to 30 Rock and Radio City. Countless restaurants and clubs around make the nightlife exciting too!Checking inn was a breeze. The staff was very accommodating as always. Edith helped us greatly and check in and gave us a room with an amazing view! I have said this before but this is the level of service that has kept me an IHG Spire Ambassador member since 2000! Keep up the great work IHG! The rooms were clean and well kept. The beds were very comfy and the variety of the pillows on the bed was nice.

This hotel is in the heart of the Broadway district. Rooms have been recently remodeled. Reasonable priced for this area if Times Square. We stay here because of their wonderful bartender, Martin, very good service.

Our room was on the 21st floor and overlooked Times Square. However, despite the room location, it was quiet in our room and the curtains were heavy enough to block out the billboards when it was time to sleep. Perfect location to get to all tourist places. Good breakfast! Staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. Would stay here again,

We stayed here in July. Room was a good size for 3 people. Great onsite restaurant for breakfast. Excellent food options at the bar as the restaurant wasn't open for dinner. Good location in the heart of times square. Lots of great local restaurant options and easy walking distance to subway stations.

Easy check-in with pleasant desk staff. The location on Times Square is fabulous! It is easy walking distance to everything. Great restaurants and Broadway shows all within walking distance. Will definitely stay here again.

Crown plaza at time square Manhattan is a very good people friendly hotel.concierge is very supportive and because of them we could see my fair lady and lion king. The best par t is brasserie service and mr Tofael was outstanding in his sevice and made our start of the day pleasant. Only drawbacks was rush at the reception and water bottle must be kept in the rooms and customer should not ask for it. Overall stay at hotel was memorable due to location at time square Manhattan

Good hotel. The best part about this hotel is it's location (Broadway, Times Square). Special thanks to Tofael from the Brasserie for providing exceptional service. Breakfast buffet has two options American and continental. Try their Bagels.

Amazing 3-night stay! This location is right in Times Square and my wife and I had an amazing stay for my birthday weekend, Isaac at the front desk was so helpful at check-in and made us feel welcomed. Housekeeping always serviced our room before we got back for each 3 days. Had drinks in the lobby bar 2 of the 3 nights and the bar team was so friendly! Truly recommend this property!

Fantastic hotel where all the staff were so friendly and were eager to help with any queries and ensure that we had a great stay. Will look to recommend to friends and family! will definitely look to to stay here again. Special mention to Imran at front of house who went the extra mile. Thank you for a memorable trip!

Super accommodating new it was our anniversary gave us an excellent room with beautiful views ! Beds are super comfortable and the linemen’s are really soft the way we like them. Gave us a few free drinks to enjoy definitely a place to try
user_name:
Paulie9999
New York City, New York

review_body: I Recommend. Good sleep. Good location. Waking distance to sites. Staff helpful. Rooms clean. Comfy room. Felt safe. We enjoyed it. Good choice happy with the accommodation. Will recommend to others. Thank you for our nice visit.

It’s all about location, location, location.Couldn’t fault the central location, it was just perfect. The lobby is extremely busy all the time. The rooms are ok but in need of an update. Don’t bother with breakfast as there is always a queue and there are plentiful deli shops on your doorstep. If you want smack bang in the middle of everything, this is the hotel.
user_name:
Stay651078
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I always stay at this property, have been for 11 years...nearly everyone who works there is helpful, friendly, engaging and accommodating. Kudos to the rock stars - Tony and Elvin downstairs, Martin and Keith behind the bar, Vicky at the front desk......these are the people who bring the customer back. Special kudos on this trip to Imran Khan, the man that checks me in when i arrive. I had a few special accommodation requests and he took care of me in a big way....very grateful, awesome team....if you stay there once, you won't stay anywhere else in NYC.

This is a mediocre hotel!!! Do not waste your time or money at this hotel! Second time at this hotel and will not be back ! Staff at front desk are very rude! Appear to think that the guest should be grateful to be staying at this hotel! We have 30 + years experience traveling in USA & Europe!

4 nights at room 2522, very comfortable. Despite a housekeeping issue upon arrival where everyone was very graceful, helped fix it and I was compensated umpromted, everything else was a good experience. Upon check in Rosa was excellent, Ruth my housekeeper was a sweetheart, the gentlemen at Security were fast when I locked myself out twice and Tofael at breakfast was always attentive. Thank you all. *Remember to tip your housekeeper daily (just like your server) and at check out, you might get a different housekeeper every day and they work very hard for our comfort.
user_name:
Dia S
Rio Grande, Puerto Rico

review_body: This is a nice hotel, average price but check in is a nightmare, the escalators don’t always work making it difficult to get from street level to reception with suitcases and there’s no alternative available to the public. The reception level is very loud and crowded, difficult all around. On the positive side, gym. Facilities are available if you can’t check in, but don’t expect help with your bags.

We loved the hotel it is in the middle of everything. Just across the street of the M& M store. Only steps away from Times Square and the Broadway theaters. Everything clean, nice, good size of rooms and bathroom. I would recommend to everyone.

Room was fine, but one of the reasons we chose this hotel was for a relaxing swim at the end of the day. We were informed that the pool was closed for renovation until 8/20. We were not comp'd in any way, unfortunately.

My husband and I have stayed here last year and we liked the experience so much that we came back this year.We are really happy that it is located in the heart of Times Square. Our room was nice and had a city-view, and we had restful sleep because of the very plush and comfortable bed and pillows. It's walking distance from the subway so it's very convenient as well. We will definitely come back here the next time we visit New York City!

Location is great. It's really Times Square.I had asked for early check in as an IHG Platinum but that didn't work out. Well it happens. So we went downstairs to drop off the bags and it's pandemonium: the line reaches almost out the door. Took us almost half an hour to get rid of a small roller board. Same pandemonium at check out, but fortunately we didn't need to store our bag. Lobby is cramped, often overfilled and the front desk has significant wait times even at the Elite desk (if it's staffed in the first place). We later get into the room and it's fine. Reasonably spacious with a functional layout and some view of the river. Some furniture like the desk or the "office" chair showed some severe wear and tear but overall ok.Here is the main downside. The hotel was advertised at $160/night and ended up costing almost $230. That's more than 40% on top of the price that showed on the IHG website. Most of this is due to that bogus "resort fee". To be fair, it's disclosed before you hit "book" but not before you actually do a price comparison to your budget and other hotels. They try to justify it with some fringe benefits that even Motel 6 will give you for free: WIFI, free calling (really!), use of the gym. The only thing of some minor value is a drink coupon. But beware: it's only good for beer for house wine, none any of their fancy drinks. If you think these benefits are so valuable: charge extra, but let the customer decide what they want to buy or not. These fringe benefits actually makes the practice even harder to stomach: it assumes that the customer is stupid and doesn't get what's really happening. Let's be honest here: The resort fee serves one and only one purpose alone: to be able to advertise an artificially low room rate which has nothing to do with the price the customer is supposed to pay at the end. The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has received multiple complaints about this practice and strongly discouraged hotels to advertise rooms this way. It's not entirely clear whether it's legal and the FTC is considering updating their regulations. (I can't post a link here, but it's easy to google)Advice to management: don't do this. Your hotel is in a great location, so be proud of it charge what you want to charge. Intentionally misleading customers may get you a few extra clicks, but it also aggravates existing customers, potentially deters new ones and results in bad reviews. Is that worth it ?

This hotel is at busiest place in NYC and you will like it. The rooms are not that big like on the picture (but pictures always don't look like in reality). The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is enough for 2 people (2 sinks are there!). Plus you got a really big TV to watch some sports. And you look for a gym near you? It's in the hotel, a club from NYSC chain is on the 15th floor. To sum up?Thumbs up!

Fabulous stay in New York. The highlight for me was the 9/11 Musuem and Memorial. Times Square Crowne Plaza was comfortable as long as you get rooms on top floors. Grand Centraal station is worth a visit and dinner at the oyster bar restaurant. Best way to travel is walk or metro.

We arrived late, but my request for a fridge for medication, was immediately sorted,( within minutes.) We ate in the restaurant, twice, with our children and baby grandchildren. We were served by Rahi, who was extremely efficient and helpful. Another lady, who also served us, ( name unknown), both went out of their way to make our meal comfortable and memorable.Any requests, were were quickly sorted to our satisfaction. Enjoyed the large room, and view.

After a disappointing move by my company's travel service to pry me away from the fun Yotel, I have been relegated to actually spending some money on a bigger hotelI've lived in NYC for about seven years and I had to begrudgingly cross Times Square daily to and from work. Knowing I had to stay here now for work still makes me a bit iffy. Look, there's only one rule for tourists..."Don't stop and keep moving."Now getting back to this hotel. I suppose the price is right for NYC, everything here is expensive. On the other hand, for what you pay, the quality is outstanding. I'm biased to the West Side and Hell's Kitchen. For me, there's not a better spot to be in that is an easy escape from the Vegas of the East Coast.I also want to add in something about the food/room service. I stay here enough that I don't need to order in, but I have to say that the quality of the food that's delivered from "Grind & Co." is damn good. What's often missed on in room dining is simplicity. Sometimes all I want is a nice deli sandwich and why not? I'm in NYC.So if you're coming here for work or your working through a vacation, it's a great place. Accessible to every place that you need to be near. Once you get going to wherever it is you want to see, don't stop...just keep moving. I guarantee there's someone right behind you that is going to roll their eyes while yours are stuck to one spot.

We spent three nights at the end of July 2018 at this hotel and it was the best experience we could have imagined. Imran was the person at the front desk who helped us and he was amazingly helpful and made our stay very special. We had two rooms and he made sure we were on the same floor as the kids and had spectacular views. The rooms were very comfortable and well equipped.We arrived on an early morning flight and he managed to get us one room earlier than the normal check in time which was a great help after a red-eye flight. He gave us some food and drink vouchers and made sure that we felt welcome and special. This was our first visit to this hotel and we would gladly recommend it and stay there again. Kudos to Imran for taking care of us and making this trip so much more enjoyable.

Location right in the middle of everything you could want or need! Local to theatres, bus tours, good restaurants.Hotel breakfast absolutely magnificent if you want a good start to your day. Endless coffee too!Hotel driver also available who was fantastic as we were attending a black tie event at pier 60.From the moment we walked into Crowne Plaza and was greeted by Freddie checked in our trip has been one that we will hold in our hearts forever. Thank you
user_name:
Fiona Q
New York City, New York

review_body: I want to say that the staff at Crowne Plaza hotel times square 7th avenue are beautiful, diligent, so attentive. I want to give a particular focus on staff at the breakfast dining. Ana took care of us n got us a great table with a view where possible. I want to thank in particular waiter Tofael who looked after all our needs and his dedication was top. I hope u will meet him. Thank you to Agathe for her terrific staff. Noelle O Neill

We stayed here during mid February for 5 nights. The location is absolutely perfect for a short break to NY. Right in times square and in the hustle of the city, and close enough to catch the buses to the other sightseeing places. Rooms nice, spacious, clean and quiet despite being in the a busy part of the city. Would definitely stay again. Breakfast is very expensive, and we only ate there once on the last morning. Bar is nice, is a real hive of activity in the hotel day and night.

Breakfast selection excellent and especially helpful waiter Tofael in the Brasserie 1605 Great service should be rewarded. Rooms a good size for a family and great views of Times Square. Excellent location for seeing the Big Apple
user_name:
Darren3129
New York City, New York

review_body: Summer in NY the city that never sleeps,Chatter rises from the sidewalks, roads all noisy with toots and peeps.So at the end of a busy day and your looking for a rest,I can heartily recommend the Crown Plaza Hotel, they’re the best.The staff are so helpful and polite, every question met with a smile,These guys never hesitate to go the extra mile.Guest accommodation is comfortable, clean with loads of room,From the top floor the views are spectacular: at night you feel as though you could touch the moon.So would I return to the CPH again, for sure that is a given. Great trip great City

My wife had never been to NYC so we decided to spend our Anniversary there in July of this year. Of course she was blown away by Times Square. The Crown Plaza was the perfect hotel for all the obvious reasons....location, service, cleanliness, etc... Could not have picked a more perfect hotel. But what stood out and made it fun when we came in from all the madness that is The City, was the staff. They were all so welcoming and helpful. Even the house keeping staff went of their way to greet us with a smile. Hats off to them because our room was always freshened and immaculate. In the bar we met Martin who was fantastic...a great mixologist, conversationalist and vendor of helpful advice on getting around the city. In the restaurant we me Annalisa who is from Italy and as sweet and nice a person you will ever meet. And Rocco at the front desk was the pinnacle of professionalism and tended to our every request. So I guess my point is there are many hotels with great location but I have to believe what we experienced at the Crown was exceptional. My thanks to the entire staff for making our anniversary a fond memory!!

It may not be the best ever experience I had it in the hospitality industry but in NY and in Times Square that was one of the best experience you may get in this area.I had a nice room on the 35 floor, the room space was really good compared to my previous explore with many hotels @ Times Square. The room was clean and the amenities was good. Our check in and checkout expired was good.They have distinguished cocktails at the bar.The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Times Square.The price / room / night at that time of the year was very good taking into consideration the location and the quality of the hotel.I’ll definitely stay again on my next visit.

the best place to stay at the times square.breakfast is really good, staff are helpful.rooms are big and very clean. the only thing is the way out with the stairs , could be improve with direct exit from the elevator. would reccommed it for sure!

We stayed here with friends for four nights. We came with kids and found the rooms were a little small. We did not expect a very large room due to the central city location but when staying with kids, it got a little congested at times. Even though we got a room high up, we experienced a lot of noise. Most of this was however, the room next door. The walls are quite thin! The service was good. The bar staff were friendly, one gentleman in particular whose name I can’t remember. The check in staff were good, knowledgable and helpful. The cleanliness of both our room and the hotel itself was of a good standard.

my experience at crowne plaza was amazing as expected. The staff was super nice and very helpful especially Tofael who was so sweet and unlike other staff I’ve seen at hotels is extra helpful. If you treat him nicely he’ll take you out of lines and he’ll help you with food and because we can’t eat food that’s not halal. He told us already and told us what’s halal and hat was great help also. I really like this hotel and if you’re looking for something where you’re close to every place, this is the hotel for you. 15 minutes from Macy’s. 2 minutes from Times Square. 20 minutes from the ferry for Statue of Liberty. It’s near everything.

This is my personal experience at Crown Plaza. I went with my family and I already had high expectations because of the hotel being at main Times Square Manhattan and I wasn’t disappointed because the room was great. We didn’t get the Times Square view because it was sold out however if we booked in advance we would have gotten it. The staff is amazing. Specially Tofael from the breakfast staff. Do go for breakfast btw. Very luxurious. Tofael helped us out and gave us nice place to sit and little secret, if you be nice to him he would actually help you out in long lines. He’s an amazing man and very sweet and helpful. The entire staff is very helpful in the hotel.

Tofael was great at breakfast this morning! Getting me a diet coke even when it wasn't on the menu. He just said, I'll take care of you, no worries. Everything has been excellent. Thanks for the little things.

Our visit to New york is amazing and stay in crown plaza Times square is wonderful specially during breakfast we met Mr.Tofael who served us happily n he as a person is friendly ..took care of our eating needs n spoke with us like family member...Overall experience in new york is memorable bcz of Mr.Tofael in coffee shop...

Great location n good service. The reception staff is very efficient n friendly. Concierge helped us with the bags and also guided us on few places we planned to visit. We enjoyed our breakfast at the hotel.

They have the best food and the best staff. Our waiter Mahfuz was the most helpful, genuine and nicest waiter who I've ever met! The staff will instantly make you feel at home and guide you through everything.
user_name:
HMSALM
New York City, New York

review_body: Spent the weekend in NYC taking in a Yankees game, Hamilton, and Zach Brown for my birthday. We stayed at this hotel on the 34th floor. We received an early check in (around 1pm) and proceeded to explore the city. We also received breakfast buffet coupons, beverage coupons, and a few $20 credit coupons which we used for iced coffee and snacks at the coffee shop. Breakfast buffet was great thanks to Ali and Toufel (my spelling may be off). I felt like we were friends after a few meetings with them (some of the best parts of the stay.) The hotel is clean and convenient to most things touristy! Thanks Ali, Toufel, and others for making our stay very enjoyable!

Had a great 4 night stay here with my wife for her 40th. It has everything you need, clean, great friendly staff and an excellent location. It was our first visit to the big apple and we loved it, although it was hard work trying to fit it all in. The prices for drinks or food at the bar are fair and the cakes from the bakery are extremely nice. The staff are friendly and more than willing to help if you have any issues. We had a great view of Times SQ from our room and just found it a great place to stay and recharge for the next day. Everything is easy to reach even the subway is close. TOP MARKS

This is our first time in NY City. Maybe this is the standard for hotel cleanliness but this place is gross. The floor towel is stained and there is hair EVERYWHERE. I am sitting in this room with my daughter, who is 12, in the shower yelling GROSS! When we got in the room my wife took a rag and started trying to clean the bathroom to get rid of some of the hair that is all over.  Secondly, the guest checking in before us had an issue. The other worker got involved to help while we waited and waited. Then he ran off to get a manager to help them. After some time passed he came back with information from the manager and continued to help them to get issue resolved. If the manager had just come to the front to help we wouldn’t have had to wait for the other guest to get their issue solved. Maybe there is some reason the manager didn’t want to come help but it was frustrating sitting there watching two employees and a manager behind the curtain work on another guest while we stood there unacknowledged. I have only been here an hour and already regret staying here.  Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. This place is DIRTY!!!

Had a GREAT stay! Room was awesome with good view of time square. The bartender, Jason, at the onsite bar was wonderful (I can’t say enough how much he made us feel right at home). The hotel is within walking distance of numerous Broadway plays (we saw Wicked and the Book of Mormon), as well as restaurants and many other attractions. We used IHG rewards points, and were super happy with our stay. If possible, get a high room, corner view (that’s what we had and it was fantastic)!

Great location near Times Square; nice bar but pricey like all NYC hotel lounges; excellent continental and full breakfast buffets served to almost noon time, so you can sleep in and have brunch; great front desk staff and concierge staff, very helpful and responsive to your concerns and any issues you may have; spacious rooms; good water pressure even for showers on the higher floors, we were on the 25th floor; pricey lodging like all near or in the heart of Times Square and Theatre District.

Lovelovelove it! Great place to stay while ya are at Manhattan. Service and everything was grate for the prices. And ofcourse Manhattan is expensive one, but that place is worthy. See you soon guys xx
user_name:
VicDaviss
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stopped in the hotel just to have a drink before we saw the Broadway show, Chicago. Tony was amazing and gave us all kinds of recommendations on restaurant Row. Just a genuinely kind spirit, he went out of his way to make our first time in New York special. We were so appreciative of his suggestions and kind heart. Nic and Harold

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza two nights in July. A standard king room on the 45th floor. A comfortable king bed with an upgraded bathroom. The hotel itself was clean, well laid out and bustling.We visited Bar 49 for a drink and appetizers. Tony C took excellent care of us. The prices were good and the food delicious.

As a young woman in NYC for the first time by myself I cannot begin to explain how grateful I am for the receptionist Emily that assisted me the night I stayed at this hotel. I just missed my flight heading back to my hometown in London, my cab driver was rude so I did not want to stay in the car with him all the way to the hotel I was staying at during my stay in New York. I walked into this place looking a mess(because of the rain) and frustrated because of the cab driver. I’m sure I gave Emily a hard time at first but she was nothing short of helpful, friendly, accomodating & very informative! I truly feel like Emily is the epitome of what customer service should be! Even in my hometown I have never ran into such amazing service. Emily sure turned my frown upside down as you Americans like to say! If Emily is there, you better book this hotel mates!

Every time my wife and I stay here we feel like it is our home away from home. We are always given the VIP treatment. Karim is so fantastic at everything he does for us and always makes sure things are to our liking. At the bar, Phil, Jason and Martin, are always on point. They always make us laugh and make great cocktails. Tony and the wait staff are amazing and make us feel so welcome and happy. We do not just come here to sleep, we go here because the quality of service is always great and we never have to worry about anything. It is always a great time and the rooms are always clean with great views of this awesome city. We will return as usual in the near future.

We had a lovely time staying here. Although there were previous complications with the booking, the rooms were comfortable and the breakfast was delicious. An employee that was particularly outstanding was Ana Gonzales, an absolutely lovely woman who was so kind and welcoming to us and the whole family loved her! It is obvious she loves her job and we all became friends by the end. To anyone who wants to stay here - I would highly recommend it!

Seconds from Times Square. Only movements from Central Park. Staff was fantastic great service. Front desk was very proactive even allowed early check in. This is my new favorite location in Manhattan.

If you are looking for a hotel in the centre of New York, then look no further. The hotel offers easy access to Times Square and all the main facilities are close by.Central Park is in easy walking distance and there is a good choice of local eateries and restaurants within two minutes. One to avoid is McDonalds which was nothing like the ones in the UK, and certainly low on cleanliness. Ellen’s Stardust Diner is a must if you like good US food and entertainment whilst you eat with singing waitresses/waiters. The city tour bus is also great especially at night. The stop is in close walking distance of the hotel.We enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza and would recommend it to others. Staff are friendly and welcoming.

We spent two days in New York as part of a stay/cruise package. We chose to stay at the Crowne Plaza and even paid extra to change our hotel due to the location, which is excellent. It is literally right on Times Square, the hub of all the action, We were allocated rooms on the 39th floor (my sister in law cannot easily take heights so she found this rather distressing).The lift made our ears pop. Our first shock came when we were told that we would have to pay $30 per night per room "service charge". This apparently is to pay for the 'free' internet, 'free' local and international calls and 'free' use of the spa. We had not been advised this by our travel agent. Apparently it is in the small print of a number of NY hotels (so beware when you book). It cannot be waived. We complained to the reception manager - he gave us two free breakfasts and advised us that he would upgrade our rooms next day. My sister-in-law was offered a room on the 20th floor; the desk manager advised us to stay in our corner room as it had a great view and would be better than any other room he could allocate. We thanked him and said we would leave our room as is. Imagine our shock when we found a chambermaid cleaning our room which had been cleared of our cases (it was 7pm). The receptionist was very apologetic; referred this to a senior colleague who found they had been moved to a room on the 18th floor. Another two breakfasts and a complimentary drink were offered as compensation. We were so relieved to locate our luggage (and to find that the safe containing our valuables had not been opened) that we accepted the 'gesture'.The irony is that upon checking out we found that there was nothing to pay; apparently the 'service charge' had been paid upfront - so was part of the package deal that we had already paid for. If only the communication had been better we would not have been subject to such annoyance and stress and our review would have been so different.

Four of us stayed here in July and it was all we wanted and more! The beds are to die for and the staff were fabulous from the reception to the lovely bar staff (especially Philip). The rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are modern and the location is perfect. Smack bang in the middle of times square on Broadway and when you get into bed at night you can't hear a sound. Thank you. We will return. Natalie and Steve from Wales

Stayed for 3 nights with family of four. 10 year old kids. Caught two Broadway shows so this location is excellent. Staff was very accommodating and friendly to include Corrine at Concierge desk who we booked Aladdin tickets and Big Bus tickets with. We had a double room which was small by most city standards, but about average size for a NYC hotel. It was a little worn though. The carpet was a bit stained and headboards were somewhat tattered. No refrigerator which would have been nice. Everything worked though. Had a ‘uptown view’ which was average. The hotel is a convenient walk to most things in the Times Square area, however when we come back we will likely stay 2-3 blocks further from Times Square for a hotel with bit more space and less worn feel - and at likely the same or lower prices.

Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan was our home base for our trip to New York City. We couldn’t have been happier. Sandra Esp provided exceptional service at check in and information about the facilities and provided a room with a fantastic view of Times Square. The room was clean and beautifully decorated too. I couldn’t have asked for a nicer bathroom and shower. I know where I’ll stay next time I’m in NYC. Thank you!

This is my second stay at CP Times Square in several months; probably my fifth in an IHG property since May. Last time I checked in, I was upgraded (paid for city view) to a gorgeous room with 360 views of the city; this time, no upgrade. But the city view room was nice - roomy, nice bathroom, comfortable. Since I travel for biz, I'm pretty specific about what works for me. If you are a tourist and want to be in Times Square, this is a great place. I only stay in Times Square because I want to be walking distance to my client. But this is definitely my preferred hotel in that location. Prices are reasonable for a nice room.PROS: The staff. I think they were even nicer than the first time. From my check in to getting me a cab, just so helpful and nice. I wish I remembered the name of the waiter in the lobby who was so wonderful to my visitors and me. I have had a lot of negative experiences at upscale hotels, so I really appreciate when the staff cares about what they do and their guests. Plenty of outlets in room. Nice shower. Great air conditioning - not noisy either. Comfy bed. CONS: Frequent biz customers really like to be recognized. None of that happened. Walls of room were pretty thin - could hear TV next door, but not terrible if I put the a/c on which muffled the sound. 4.5 stars for this visit.

This hotel has the best location if you want to visit broadway shows, Times Square, Rockfeller center, and many other atractions because you can do it all by foot. The staff is very helpfull (we had a problem with our flight and we needed to extend our stay in one more day - so the receptionist Sandra helped us with it). Room was clean and big. The only negative point was that the furniture in the room was worn out.
user_location: Caxias do Sul, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
user_name:
EleonoraP152
Caxias do Sul, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil

review_body: WOW! My name is Lauren and I am the Destination Manager for a nationwide teaching facility that trains students to be laser technicians/injectors! We travel around the country and set up "pop-up" medspas and our most recent one was at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square! Jerry- Jerry is WONDERFUL! He was attentive to our needs and constantly went above and beyond to make our stay and experience better than we could've ever imagined! He was prompt and professional. HE DESERVES A PROMOTION!Karim- Karim had NOTHING but customer service in mind! He met and exceeded our requests without question or hesitation. HE DESERVES A RAISE! Karim was an excellent member of our team and the hotel's staff! There were so many other incredible staff that we had the pleasure of working with, Julia, Greg, and Agathe (to name a few)! It was such an overall wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anyone!

I only ever write honest reviews, and here is mine ... We picked this hotel for location and we were right (and wrong) to do so. The location is right next to Times Square so you are handy for most things, especially the subway (for all directions).However, there are a couple of points (that other visitors have made too and I noticed before we left) that make this not an "excellent" review and instead a "very good" one - our room whilst a good size and the AC was amazing (the time we went New York had a heatwave and so it was a pleasant respite to get back to our room at the end of the day), was a little dated looking and there were things like the headboard was scratched (when you moved the pillows), the room looked a little "tired" overall and when my son dropped a small piece of Lego on the floor (and I had to put on the torch on my phone to find it) I saw that there was litter behind the bed that obviously had been there for some time - making me think, when was it last hoovered?? These are only minor points though but its the little things that catch your eye that make you think "hhm?". The other point was the people standing outside the doors trying to sell you tour buses - we lost count of the amount of times we had to say "excuse me" to get in the doorway - there is another side to the pavement that they could stand at, and not be right outside the doors ready to pounce as soon as you exit - and this was EVERY day.One other point would be when checking in, that maybe the staff could tell you which floor you were staying on, as we didn't know and didn't know which lift to get to our floor (although it was pointed out to me when I returned to reception to find that out).We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food, but we did have a drink most nights in the hotel bar, where the service was great, staff all lovely and ready to help with anything we needed.Overall we had a good stay and I would recommend it.

We spent 5 days at the hotel and loved it. Requested a high floor and got a room on 42nd floor. View of Times Square was "as advertised', awesome. The room had everything we needed including comfortable beds. Rooms got cleaned well every day and staff was very professional. Did not eat at the hotel, but did have a few drinks at the bar. Bartender Phil was awesome. Very personable, made my wife's mojito perfectly (she likes it not sweet). Gave us some suggestions for great places to eat. This has been one of our best experience at an IHG hotel.

Ok it was a forced stop over due to cancelled flights. The hotel although a tad pricey was a great point for walking/ subway tour in a short time. Hotel itself was good. Bar and food area good, we got some good vouchers for food and drinks. The rooms were great and comfortable. For me fine, the staff we came across were also good.

I booked the standard king room, and was upgraded when I checked in w/out being asked. I had a beautiful 28th floor corner room with both a view of downtown and the Hudson River. Hotel is very clean, with an excellent location. Employees were very helpful. Subway is close 2 blocks away if you venture away from walking distance venues. Wonderful location for the Broadway shows we saw while visiting.Only complaint I had was the water while taking a shower didn't stay hot for long. I would up taking a "cold" shower at the end of the shower.

Good location, was convenient to get to shops, restaurants, theatres, and to central park!The hotel lobby was very strange, very busy, like a rush hour train station. However the service was good, it did not take long to get up to our room. The concierge desk was useful.We only had 3 days to see all NY had to offer, and being in the right location helped us do that!

Perfectly located for just about everything. Lovely welcome, really good service, couldn't do enough for us. Fantastic view over Time Square from our room, and all the facilities in the hotel were working, clean and accessible. THANK YOU!

Our second vacation stay here was as good as the first, and we'll stay here again next time in NYC.The hotel is very well located on the edge of times square, and an easy walk or subway ride to anywhere, and is in the heart of the theatre district.The rooms are generally well appointed, although we were on a higher floor last visit, and that room was in better condition.The breakfast buffet is good value and available until late morning, in case you've had a big night beforehand.There is an extensive gym, but it is also heavily used, and I gave up waiting for equipment to become available. The swimming pool was also closed for repairs, and this was the only real disappointment.Staff were professional and friendly.It's a good staging spot from which to explore the city and its attractions.

Travelled to New York for business - software training. This hotel is busy, this shouldn’t be a surprise since it is right in Times Square and it is the peak summer season. Service was fantastic, rooms clean and updated. Staff are all pleasant and helpful. The lobby bar is ok - service here was ok at best - not sure what the bar staff were doing but they would all “disappear” for several minutes at a time. We went there twice for a drink and both times it took 15 minutes to get served - the bar was less than half full. We gave up and didn’t go back the other days. I was in one of the meeting rooms for three days and the service here was great - always made sure our coffee supply was replenished, which you need when you are doing three 10 hour days of software training. Would I go back? Definitely. Great place and location for the price.

So stayed here for 6 nights between 15 July and 22 July 2018 was travelling with my 2 sons 21&17 checked in by a guy called Rocco was quick enough probably bit rushed if I’m honest was given a complimentary drinks voucher for two people a soft drink wine or a beer but there was threeof us remembering my 17 yr old is classed as an adult and I pay fullcost for him do the crown plaza not give all guests a complimentary drink ????? Your guest and my son felt little bit confused as to why he had not been given a voucher by Rocco tut tut thank goodness your mistake Rocco which I presume was a mistake didn’t ruin our holiday the rooms definately need decorating they are grubby so be prepared the bath is probably older than my eldest son who’s 21 we used the bar in the hotel 3 times first time pleasant enough guy next time youngish bald guy rude rude rude no p,eases no thank yous tut tut the next one was the worst a middle aged woman my youngest son didn’t get a complimentary drink this time she forgot about him ! My drink and my eldest sons drink was brought down we asked about David’s yes it’s coming asked again yeah it’s coming never arrived we had finished ours when I called her to take the drink of the bill she apologised I gave her no tip said thank you to her on way out no thank you back tut tut bad mannered staff at crown plaza I’m plsnning a trip back to ne2 york in October 50 th birthday I will not be staying at this hotel nor would I recommend it I think for what I paid I could get better in Times Square mayb the staff would be better trained and better mannered havestayed at many crown plazas this is the worst

This hotel is located in the heart of timed square very convenient to everything great views from the hotel restaurant, clean,modern rooms. Great recognition foir IHG rewards members, i would definitely recommend this hotel
user_name:
sean D
New Bern, North Carolina

review_body: Perfect for families, all staff are so obliging and eager to please. Great location, really clean and rooms are spacious. Definitely recommend this hotel. Food is lovely and there is a great atmosphere in the hotel.

This hotel was nice. The location was phenomenal! In the midst of all the action. We got there at 9pm at night due to 2 delayed flights. The hotel was accommodating to this need. We checked in and the room was waiting for us. We were on the 17th floor with a view of time square. The room was clean. I do think a little make over wouldn’t hurt as the headboards are made of a material that is tearing and looks a little shabby. The bathroom was regular. Nothing too bad to complain about. The beds were comfortable for me and my family of 4. We were also offered 4 $20 vouchers for our stay for food at the hotel. It came in handy for water that we got daily to stay hydrated while on the go in New York City! The hotel is located right in time square. All the attractions were in walking distance and the hop on hop off bus for the further attractions was at the corner of the hotel. So all in all I would recommend this hotel. I didn’t have hidden fees because I asked when booking for the total cost with all fees included( a lot of reviews say they weren’t told about the daily charge so I made sure to get that information up front). The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Any request we had was honored in a fast manner. This is a good stay if you want to be near all the action! And the price is consistent with the cost of all the NYC hotel cost.

I have been staying at this hotel for the past 3 days and it has been pretty trashy. The bathroom has stains everywhere,there is yellow stains in the ceiling and I don’t even know how it got there. There are also some stains behind the night stands that are colored yellow. Also, there is no mini fridge so I can’t store anything. I hope they renovate this hotel and clean all this disgusting mess.

Spent 7 days at this joint and what a bitter disappointment Everything from the word go was shabbyOur overall feeling was a hotel that fully knows that's it's going to be booked all year round regardless of its services , purely based on its proximity to Times Square .Here is my litany of complaints about this "motel"Filthy shabby carpet in our rooms well past it's use by dateBathroom door lock broken Hardly any water pressure in showerToilet that refuses to flush fully Lamps that had notoriously difficult switchesNO BAR FRIDGE!!A damp obnoxious odour that permeated the roomA truly uncomfortable bed that just sinks(Had a week of aching back due to the awful mattress)The lowest quality one ply toilet paper I could go on and onThe sad thing is that the staff were actually wonderful. Ricco at reception was friendly and engaging . Annie the housekeeping lady also exceptionalThe problem here is MANAGEMENT!!!they have adopted a business model of profits before customers.Their line of thought is , why should we reinvest in the motel , when we are fully Booked all year roundThey have a monopoly of fixed hotels near Times Square so why should they careIt's a blight on Crowne PlazaYour paying 4 star prices for a 2 star motel, so if basic comfort means something to you , I would advise you ditch this placeWe had another family with us and they felt exactly the same way
user_name:
Ross P
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Due to location, this hotel attracts visitors and therefore can demand the rates. Hotel is basic rooms are small. No breakfast. We paid $30 + taxes, which includes free wifi, gym accessOn checkout I was charged $31 for purchases at the bar. We never stepped into the bar. I have been told they will investigate and provide an answer in a few days. I've written to them by email, but not had a response. I'm $31 short.

If this is your first time to NYC and want to be in the thick of the insanity, then the Crown Plaza is a PERFECT home base. The hotel is very clean, safe, and quite comfortable for the price. The double room was spacious and the beds were above average. As our prime objective was Broadway and not the hotel, I did groan when I had to shell out $30 each night for amenities I never even saw. Now that I’ve been to NYC multiple times and not weary of the subway, I will be in search of a boutique hotel away from Times Square. As noted above, if this is your first trip and want a touristy home base, then you can book this hotel with confidence! Enjoy

I was welcomed by Victoria after a "bad taxi ride" from the airport. She turned our frown upside down as she was most helpful and we would like to thank her for all she did for us. Would recommend this hotel and she is the cherry on top.

We were visiting with out-of-town guests, including children. Luchelle checked us in quickly and both rooms were upgraded, as Spire members, to include an INCREDIBLE view above Times Square. Rooms were comfortable & CLEAN. Concierge services helped me plan our activities quickly and the restaurant/lounge concocted delicious cocktails when it was time to unwind. Centrally located, visiting our favorite sights was a breeze. Would be a great place to stay if you were seeing a show as well. Would definitely come back.

I was greeted by Victoria when I checked in. She couldn't be any more helpful. It was before check in time, and she was instrumental in having our luggage stored until the room was ready.The room was very clean. Bed comfortable. Amazing shower.The hotel is close to everything in midtown Manhatten.Would definitely recommend the hotel, and if you can, ask for Victoria.

Located right on Times Square, can't get much better than that. The room is clean and spacious and very comfortable as expected from a world class hotel. Good vantage point, though in Manhattan it's a view of other buildings - whether that's a good view or not is open to interpretation. At the time we were there, the parking was $70 per night in the underground parking lot. Of course there are plenty of dining option around.

We checked in to the Crowne Plaza and it was an amazing experience. The staff at the front desk are so friendly and helpful. The room was a beautiful corner room with a view of the river and the city. It was very clean and bedding was very comfortable. We also went to the lounge and the staff there was so great. Martin, Jason, Philip, Tony and the others are just the best bar staff you could ask for. They make excellent drinks and they make you laugh as well. Very friendly and personable. We also met the manager of the food and beverage, Karim and he went above and beyond to make our stay very pleasant. He even sent us wine and cheese for our anniversary which we found so very thoughtful. I cannot say enough great things about this hotel or the staff that work there. The all went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Like we were part of the family. Great hotel, staff and food. I would highly recommend Crowne Plaza Times Square to friends and family and I will definitely be staying there every time I visit NY. No other hotel compares to the treatment we received. Thank you all, Karim, Jason, Martin, Phil, Tony and all the others that made our stay an enjoyable one. Looking forward to our next visit and seeing all my friends again

We stayed for 3 nights. Everything was ok. Our room was on 40th floor, and view absolutely stunning. Quite “tired “ furniture, but all room was very clean. Location more than perfect. All employees very friendly. I’m definitely recommend.

This large hotel located in the heartland of New York’s theatre district on Broadway Times Square. It is a busy hotel with large rooms. Check in was efficient and friendly (thank yo for the ace room Mohamed) th EPROMs were well equipped a little tired in places ripped curtain, but all good amenities, shame ther is a no fridge in the rooms. Great shower. Although we did not use the pool on the 15th floor it’s $10 cover charge and there is a gym. The concnerige is brilliant at sorting out baggage and Al on security was very helpful in sorting us out when we were leaving! The staff are great.

My sister-in-law and I came to New York City to see a play, and what better place to stay than in Times Square? The young woman who checked us in was very friendly and fun, and nice, and tried very hard to find exactly the right room for us. The room is small, no refrigerator or microwave, but it’s quiet and clean, and the view of the river is beautiful. I would easily stay again!!

We loved our stay but the only thing it needed was a fridge & for that matter a small microwave...Although it was crowded I noticed that security was always watching, Everything was neat and clean.If we had a small fridge we could have kept some cheese and fruits ( and the milk for my granddaughter )it would have been perfect.

This is really nice place too see and the food is really good. Beautify done.the drinks were great to have at this place. Loved this place.this is worth the trip from Michigan. Loved this place and I miss it the waitress and waiter are sweet and kind too have around.

A great location if you want to enjoy the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the Theatre District. Very clean rooms, decent size, and very comfortable beds. Very nice restaurant but sadly it is not open for dinner. only open for breakfast and lunch. Cannot understand why it is not open for dinner. But plenty of places to eat around Times Square.

Our stay here was wonderful. I cannot imagine a better location for a trip to NYC. Every member of the staff that we encountered throughout the hotel were friendly, accommodating and professional. The room was more spacious than I expected for a city center hotel and our view, while not of Times Square, was pretty because we could see the Hudson. Pick this hotel!!! You won’t be disappointed.

Hotel was in a great Location, Very Clean & wonderful staff. Thank you Karim, Kim, Rocky & Martin for taking wonderful care of us & treating us like family. Food & drinks were fantastic. Can’t wait to visit you again soon.

The location is in the heart of Times Square and ideal for sightseeing The service at reception and the bar was excellent and nothing was too much troubleThe rooms are adequate, clean and tidy but in need of a refurbishment Read the small print as they do add a daily service charge for a complimentary drink, wifi and any other service.A little annoying when you end up paying for the free welcome drink and free wifi

My wife and I travelled to NYC for New Year, as a couple from the UK. Whilst NYC itself was packed (think streets blocked off and queues just to get into Times Square), the hotel was a haven from the madness and ideally placed so you can sit or stand with a drink and watch the chaos below. Excellent views of Times Square, although on the night there was a surcharge to view the ball itself drop (which you'd expect). The rooms were spacious, bright, well stocked with amenities and the beds were spacious and comfy. This was by far the best hotel we have used on a visit and would highly recommend it again. When we come back, we will be staying here.

This hotel helped make a trip in New York! Front of house staff were wonderful having arrived after a dreadful nights stay in another hotel. Freddy on front desk was fun and efficient..his hair magnificent! My mother needed a specially adapted room with a ‘roll in shower’ which she got. Very spacious and clean. My parents and I were given rooms on the top floor of the hotel which were not only quiet but also had spectacular views over the River Hudson. Restaurant staff were efficient and helpful. The food was good, especially breakfast. The hotel really sets out a banquet! Staff who handled our luggage were helpful and patient. Rooms are decorated to a high standard and serviced every day if you so wish. A big thank you to everybody and I’ll be staying here again when I come to visit family.

It was our first time in New York. This hotel is in a great location right on Times Square. The hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable. It is in a good location to get to other places. Would recommend if you are visiting New York.

Our first trip to NYC was fantastic. The Crown Plaza was the perfect place to stay - close to the theater, restaurants, and shopping. Staff were so friendly and accommodating! Room was comfortable and surprisingly quiet!

This hotel is located across the street from the M&M store at Times Square. This hotel has a great location. Located in the center of Times Square within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller, Empire State, and grand central. The check in was fast and efficient and we were given a beautiful king size room on 44th floor overlooking Times Square which was fantastic. The hotel is clean neat, very friendly staff, and the hotel wifi was excellent throughout the entire hotel. Overall, the hotel was a great experience.

Our family vacationed in NYC for the first time in June. The location of this hotel could not be any better! Central to many popular attractions and the cruise port (did a four day cruise to Bermuda from here) was perfect for us! The hotel was clean and the staff was professional, unfortunately until the last staff member we had to interact with. After a four night stay, on the morning of check out we (family of 4) with all of our luggage needed a larger van type taxi to the cruise port. We asked the gentleman at the podium of the garage entrance to the hotel if he could help us with that. He said he would, only to find him helping other guests that approached him after us. He then sent us outside with all of our luggage (5 pieces) to seek the help of another employee that we could not find! When my husband went back in to tell him this person wasn’t out there he proceeded to try and have us take one of the hotel cars which wanted to charge us $60-$70!!!! We knew that option was the more expensive choice which is why we asked for a taxi! We’ve traveled all over the world, what we were asking was not unusual. He literally just did not want to help us and left us standing there to fend for ourselves! I was absolutely shocked by his dismissive demeanor toward us. From the garage of this hotel, it is not easy to simply flag down a taxi cab especially when you need the larger van cab but that’s exactly what we had to do BUT it only cost us $17 versus the $60-$70 the hotel car service wanted! Sorry but the one bad incident took away the otherwise pleasant experience we had here. Thankfully we chose to stay at a different hotel upon returning from our cruise!

Decided to stay at a different hotel for our sixth visit to New York and we weren't disappointed. Really nice hotel - don't be put off by the noisy reception area - with spacious rooms that are kept clean and tidy. The hotel is central for everything. Would definitely recommend.

What a great experience for my first time at The Crowne Plaza Times Square! My friends and I felt welcomed from the moment we walked in. The bar staff managed by Karim were awesome, Kim and Martin behind the bar make a great team! Rocky our server did an awesome job making sure our food and drink orders were correct and that we had everything we needed. We had the breakfast buffet the following morning in the Brasserie Restaurant, Tofael was so nice! I never had a bad meal while there, all of the food was delicious and the amenities were wonderful! This hotel is in the perfect location in Times Square, convenient for walking to shows and many shops. I would definitely recommend The Crowne Plaza to anyone visiting the city.

New York is a place where you will either love it or hate it. I personally did not care for it...life is just too fast no time to chill and take in the sights. Hotel was right there in Times Square and boy literally no time to sleep, sit or breathe. Sirens, honking and lights 24\7. As I see it, it's just a check off my travel list. More than likely will not return at least not by choice.

Visited New York in May 2018, Crowne Plaza is situated right in times square where all the action is. Donald Mei checked us in and was very courteous and upgraded our room which was great !! He gave us plenty of advise about restaurants and things to do. Century 21 is a great place for bargains. Do not forget to walk the Brooklyn Bridge. Statue of liberty cruise is awesome to visit the statue of liberty.

Sandra E. Checked my family and I into the hotel. She was so personable and wanted to ensure that our stay was immaculate. It is my grandmothers 80th birthday and Sandra came around the counter to hug my grandmother. We felt so welcomed and taken care of. This woman deserves a raise!

We stayed at the Crown Plaza for a week on our first visit to New York. The hotel is right in the middle of the action and literally a stones throw from Time Square. Great location! Unfortunately there is not that much more positive to say, except that I thought the hotel restaurant was reasonably priced and the food was decent! It felt a bit like one was staying in a boarding hostel as there isn’t really a normal foyer or reception area. When you come off the street there is an escalator that takes you up a flight and one inevitably passes straight to the lifts to your room unless you are visiting the restaurant or bar. Our one experience at the bar was also pretty strange as the barman didn’t want to serve anyone at the bar unless you were sitting at the bar, if you were sitting in the restaurant you had to wait for the waitress to take your drinks order...which frustrated a few guests in the short time we were there after we had moved from the restaurant to the bar so we could be served. The room was also not very clean on arrival and on one day our room hadn’t been serviced by 4pm, and we had to call for it to be cleaned. Overall the room is not too bad and the bed is comfortable.If you simply want a comfortable bed to sleep in near Time Square and you are not too fussed about what I have said here, then this is your spot.

Right from the getgo at check-in, we had a friendly and warm reception. Being in Times Square the hotel is close to many attractions. We dropped the car off at the curb and only requested it when we left two days later (As to be expected in NYC, it is expensive at $70/day). The view from the 40th floor offered an incredible vista of the city and Times Square. The full bar across from the reception area offers delicious cocktails and a menu that entices one to eat right there. The breakfast bar offers a typical high-end hotel buffet with espresso drinks to boot! At the bottom of the elevator bays, the Patisserie offers a full assortment of espresso drinks, pastries, and other refreshments in which one can indulge, in a moment of need. Overall a very nice stay!

We were handy for all the shows, the underground, Times Square and lots of bars and restaurants. Prices were much more expensive than other areas but you have to expect that. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Make sure you tip at least 10% or you will be held up to the wall by the waiters.

If you’re visiting NYC this hotel is in the heart of Times Square so a fantastic location. The hotel itself is a little bit tired but it’s almost understandable with the amount of traffic that must go through it.Would recommend if you want to be at the heart of the action.

Corner room had a great view of Times Square. Only bad thing was the windows did not open as advertised - or I just couldn't figure it out?Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was delicious and our waiter, Tofael, was THE BEST!

Upon arrival it was super crowded, however the staff was very attentive and was able to handle it with ease. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Location perfect right in the middle of everything.

I visited NY recently with for a "girls weekend." We stayed at the Crown Plaza. I will stay there again. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms where clean and the location is perfect!

This hotel is sensational from the moment I stepped into the hotel I felt the family atmosphere. The reception staff are totally committed to giving first class customer care. They cannot do enough for you and always with a smile. My whole experience in this hotel for 7 glorious days was superb. Greetings every morning from the smiling room service to the fantastic reception team. I made a point at the end of my stay to speak to Grant Fabor I do hope I have the correct spelling of his surname he is the front house director. Who I felt needed to hear how brilliant and outstanding his team are. He informed me that it touched his heart to hear my words however, this hotel will touch yours like it has mine if you visit NYC. The hotel does have a resort fee but you do receive this back in so many ways, a fantastic gym with swimming pool, 2 drink vouchers, free wifi and free calls using your room telephones. The rooms are up to date with fantastic breathtaking views. My room was extremely clean and spacious with a huge view of the Hudson. This hotel with its amazing team is a MUST I have been visiting NYC for over 12 years and never felt this pampered in my life. I will definitely be returning to the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan next year and would highly recommend it to all including families. Calling all you travelers to take a good look at this hotel if you Wish to experience the NYC with the special touch. Congratulations Grant Fabor and your team there is not enough stars to rate my experience I look forward to visiting you again next summer. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

My wife took me to New York as a surprise for my 40th, she booked us into the Crowne Plaza and paid extra to have a corner room with a view. Once we got to the hotel and checked in we were very happy with our room, it was pretty high up and had an amazing view toward the Hudson and into Times Square. As we got there fairly late we just wanted to get to bed, when I pulled the sheets back the middle of the bed was wet, I called down to reception and they said someone would come and change the sheets, this didn't happen as we waited over 20mins, there was also a strange noise like a lifts going up and down but our room wasn't near the lift...anyway I went to reception and asked if we could change rooms as the mattress was also wet and the noise was loud enough and constant enough to be annoying for the next five days. I was given three choices two rooms without a view which looked onto brickwork and another corner room a few floors below ours. I chose the corner as my wife had paid for it. I thought the noise had gone but unfortunately I could still hear it and did for the duration of our stay which put a bit of a downer on the experience really. We wanted to print some tickets for a day out we were having so we used the computers in the lobby which you have to pre pay for but you don't get charged until you go over 10 minutes. We didn't go over 10 minutes but still got charged. We went to reception to ask for a refund but were given a number to call and would a get a refund over the phone. No one answered although I called multiple times, and the reception staff were not interested. I thought the water from the café was really expensive too. Overall the hotel is nice, the rooms are clean and like I said we had a great view in a great location. The noise was just the let down factor for me and obviously having a wet bed was a bit rubbish.

About 30 min from LGA. Location was everything. Felt like I could get anywhere and everywhere. Front desk was polite and very helpful in helping arrange a car service. Pool was also great for laps. Asked for a room on a high floor and had an amazing view. Also thanks to the bellman whose name i unfortunately forgot for helping me out plenty of times during my stay. Looking forward to coming back next time i am in the city!!

Girls weekend was a success thanks to The Crowne Plaza Times Square and it's wonderful staff! After a delayed flight and late arrival, Sandra was very kind and helpful during checkin. Prior to our show we had cocktails and appetizers in the bar, the food and service was great! Karim one of the food and beverage managers was wonderful making sure we had everything we needed. The bartenders Kim and Martin and our server Rocky were top rated! Even the GM Mr. Niles Harris stopped by to greet us! The following morning we had a delicious breakfast at the Brasserie 1605 restaurant, Anna greeted us with a huge smile and Tofael was awesome as always.  I love visiting The Crowne Plaza in Times Square and will not stay anywhere else while in New York. The rooms are spacious, the beds are comfortable, and the staff is great! If you're celebrating a birthday or anniversary while visiting do share with the staff at checkin, they enjoy making you feel special. Anxiously awaiting my next visit!

Good spot if you’re in NYC for a short break and want a good location to get around and see a bit of everything. Subway station is nearby to travel further around Manhattan and surrounding neighbourhoods. A busy hotel but check in and check out was speedy. We didn’t spend much time in the room tbh but room was a decent size, clean and the bed was comfy. Unfortunately the room did have a strong musty odour, decor was a bit dated and it could benefit from improved lighting but this wasn’t a major problem for us as it was a short trip and a good price. WiFi was good and great gym facilities are available. A service charge and tax of around $30 per night was applied so be prepared to pay at check out!

Girls trip to NYC; stayed in this hotel for 5 nights together with my 2 daughters. Location of the hotel cannot be better, it’s literally at Times Square. Staff at reception was friendly. We loved our room with Times Square view; double beds were small but it worked for us, cleaning of room was excellent. Did not hear a thing from the adjacent rooms. Only thing I missed was a small fridge. All in all, a super stay and we definitely will return.

The hotel has a great location. It was clean and comfortable. The front desk and Concierge’s were very helpful. The bellman went above and beyond to take care of our needs! If you are needing help with booking a car let them help you instead of the concierge. They saved us $60 on our trip to the cruise port in NJ.

Bought Tickets to see "Summer" for my wife's birthday and stayed overnight at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square as we normally do. Love the place and stay there whenever we go into Manhattan to see a Broadway show. The room was beautiful, clean, spacious ... the only downfall was we had to ask for towels for the shower ... there were none and my wife and I were very surprised to see this for the first time ever. Had to be an oversight but made us call the service desk to deliver two towels ... other than that I loved the hotel.
