Right in Times Square so it was easy to get to the tourist attractions. Room was a great size and so comfortable. Really good amenities and really helpful staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there and can’t wait to go back. Would definitely rebook the hotel.

I would definitely stay at this hotel again. My room was very roomy, comfortable and clean. the location is convenient to most downtown landmarks. The bar and restaurant were good, too. with very friendly and good service!

loved this hotel from the minute I stepped into it's air conditioned foyer. Our room was lovely with a lovely view of the Hudson. Room air conditioning great. found housekeeping staff really helpful as was the lady in the concierge. Everyone was friendly really. Location was perfect. nothing bad at all to say and we hope to stay here again. highly recommend this hotel.

We have been using the Crowne Plaza for some years now for the Fasion week Sep 2016 when we came to the USA with the Queen Mary 2 and stayed then 3 or 4 times until 2017 - 2018 New year. The Service was always Top, the staff friendly and helpful.We used the house Car to come and go to JFK (Chevy Sub) The Driver was super nice and helpful. Bett as a limo Service we used one time that was more expensive.We have a top breackfest in the 1605 Buffet super to start the day.When I have sent emails to Service or for bookings it was always a good reply and feed back to FAQs with very good Infos.The bar is good and Service very nice. I like to go for a few Drinks at Emmets Irish Pub that is not to far away, which is ok but the Hotel is a super good bar to relax in also.To be here in the mid of Brodway and Times square is perfect to use also to go to a Close Subway for SOHO NOHO etc and walk up to Central Park or over to Madison Ave. It is a perfect HQ to be in to conect to all of Manhatten.Super thanks to all and a happy 4th of July from Germany were I live.We are to be back for a Christmas visit with the Grand Kids.Thanks

Hotel is conveniently located. A little expensive for what it was. Rooms are small and there is no small refrigerator in rooms. Watch out for the extra fees they tack on. Pool definitely not centered on hotel guest more for the locals that use the facility for the gym. It is a lap pool not playing pool. Beds are comfortable.

We stayed from June 27-July 1. This hotel located across the street from the M&M store at Times Square. The lobby is on the second floor and is right next to the bar. There is not a lot of seats for family to wait for the person to check in. We were on the 23 rd floor facing Times Square. View was pretty cool. You can see the steps over the TKTS booth and the Good Morning America studio window from our room. They must have just replaced the mirror in the restroom because it was blue painters tape on the corners of the mirror. Two days in a row we had to call down to ask for wash cloths as we had none. They brought up a whole set of towels up. They didn’t have a floor mat two of the days we stayed. And the second day we were there the shower head was facing outward so when we turned on the water it go the floor wet and had to use a towel to soak it up. The second night we were there we realized how thin the walls are. We heard our drunk neighbors clear conversation and how mush of a sailors vocabulary they had. We could hear their voices moving from one side to the room to the other. They also sounded like they were right outside our window, imposible because we were on the 23rd floor. It took me a moment to realize that the windows can open inward a little and that they were by their window smoking. This is the reason we could hear them so clearly on that end of the room. You could smell the sweet smoke from out room. One of the nights we woke up with the sounds of the female guess puking her guts out. They did give out $20 food vouchers for everyday we were there and two drink vouchers. The restaurant doesn’t stay open late and their continental breakfast buffet was $40 per person. Use the $20 voucher and get some pastries, coffee and fruit instead at the grind &co next to the elevators. We were able to set up a car to take us to the airport that same morning we were leaving. Concierge was not open yet and the bellhop was able to set it up for me downstairs. Very helpful. It was $95 for a large SUV to pick us up and all of our luggage.  Great location just be ready for lots of noise and crowds.

Best service ever ! Sandra Esp was extremely accommodating !! We arrived early and she pre checked us to ensure our room would be available after coming back from a long day of shopping. There was a small hiccup with our room and she kindly gave us free buffet vouchers and upgraded our room for the next 2 nights. Amazing service !

We’ve just returned from a five night stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square. The hotel location is slap bang in the heart of all the action with theatres all around and Juniors just across the road.We stayed in room 3201 which was a double Queen Bed room on the corner overlooking Times Square - so the view was perfect and with no noise from other guests.The room was comfortable with excellent air conditioning and comfy beds - a couple of minor niggles were the shower temperature knob was very precarious and was loose from the wall and the toilet was also a little bit loose from the wall.We didn’t use th hotel that much other than to crash out at night in really, a couple of times we used the bar which was always busy with a great view of Times Square. Most of the staff were pretty helpful and the bellboys in the lobby were good company and nothing was too much trouble for them. I also found one of the receptionists whose last name I think was Faber also very helpful as I needed to urgently print off my U2 ticket which I’d just bought and downloaded. Paying the local tax is a bit of a pain having paid for what seemed everything already through Virgin but hey-ho.All I would say is that I would recommend packing some earplugs to help screen out the noise of the city outside which as I would expect given the hotel’s location is pretty rowdy at night.We had a wonderful stay and enjoyed our time at the hotel.

We ate lunch the the Crowne Plaza before seeing Wicked. It is the perfect location to visit before or after the show. We were seated promptly and the staff was friendly and helpful. They made sure our meals came out right away so we had plenty of time to get to the theatre. The food was very good and the portions were large. There were six of us and we had a variety of sandwiches, salads and burgers. We are not from NY so we had never seen the cute little individual glass bottles of ketchup, mustard and mayo before! The prices for lunch were less than I expected to pay in NYC. I would recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone wanting to eat before going to a show.

We stayed here for 5 nights. We had requested in our booking 2 adjoining rooms as my daughter has Autism and I needed to have her in the next room. As we checked in the receptionist quite abruptly said your rooms are on different floors even though we had phoned them 3 times and had been told the rooms were adjoining. Anyway after having to make a scene all of a sudden the rooms were available. Why not just give them in the first place. Also when we booked we were told that internet was included in the price. IT IS NOT. Actually we got charged $60 dollars a day extra for 2 rooms service charge, even though we did not use any other facilities apart from WiFi. This is our 6th time in New York as we love it but have never had this experience in any other hotel here. This so called service charge is hidden until check out. Crown Plaza never again.

We stayed here for 3 nights from the 25th June, from the moment we checked in to when we left we were given friendly and efficient service from all areas with in the hotel. This is a very busy hotel but that is what you have to expect when in Times Square NYThe room was on the 19th floor with a great views over streets below and the river to the side. It was clean and comfortable with a king size bed.There is a coffee shop where you can buy pastries and drinks from 6-30am .There is a restaurant but we did not use this, there is also a bar where the service was excellent as was the choose of drinks. We loved sitting at the bar in the evenings watching and chatting to the bar staff. It was a wonderful place to celebrate my 60th birthday and thanks to all the staff who made it such an enjoyable time.If we ever came back to NY we would consider staying here again

We last stayed in this hotel 2 years ago. When we checked in this time we were welcomed back and thanked for our loyalty. The check in was fast and efficient. We were given a beautiful king size room on 46th floor overlooking Times Square. The room was spacious and very comfortable. It was very quiet at night and we slept like babies every night for the 14 nights we stayed. The room was spotless. We received a welcome gift of a bottle of wine and fruit which was delivered to us in the room. We really appreciated this.We had breakfast most mornings in Brasserie 1605. On our first morning we were greeted by Tofael who also welcomed us back. How did he remember us? He made sure we weren't waiting for a table any morning. Ana made sure we had our favourite table at the window overlooking Times Square with a view of the Empire State Building. Towards the end of our stay Ali returned from vacation and greeted us like old friends. Staff like these are priceless and we really enjoyed chatting to them every morning. Breakfast was delicious and the introduction of smoothies on the menu was genius.There is a snack area open during the day "grab n go" I recommend you try the red velvet cake, it is delicious!This hotel is perfect for us, the location is second to none and the staff are welcoming, friendly and efficient.

Mike H. was awesome! Thanks for being amazing and taking care of our bags - from the beginning of our stay, to the end!! Thanks to the valet for making traveling to the city with our car super easy. You all are amazing!

The room was very quiet on the 23rd floor amidst the hustle of Times Square. The view is incredible from the hotel restaurant and bar lounge. Our server Felipe was terrific about expediting our food in time to get to our Broadway Show! Fantastic service with a smile! The breakfast buffet was terrific with a huge variety, a terrific value and convenience. Hotel wi-fi was excellent throughout the entire building. The location was excellent for either taxi or subway service, with trips both north and south made easily and quickly. This hotel was an excellent value with a very comfortable king size bed!
user_name:
Rick B
New Hill, North Carolina

review_body: Hotel is located just a short walk off Time Square. The hotel was well kept and clean and tidy at all time. The room was clean and tidy and in very good condition, maid service was daily and was good.Bar areas were really nice with views of Broadway and time square.

Great location to shows and area shopping. Nice price and views as well. Good food at outlets and staff were friendly and accommodating. Didn't park a car but easy enough for an Uber. Just make sure you tell the driver which side of hotel to pick you up on.

This property offered a Times Square view room- which made it clear that it was not a "ball drop" view, but spectacular nonetheless. I booked about eight months in advance with a free cancellation option, and checked frequently to get a lower rate. It didn't happen, so I would advise to book early. The location was a quick walking distance from numerous Broadway shows and, of course, the TKTS Times Square location, which can likely be seen from your window. The windows opened a teeny bit inward should you want fresh air, but wouldn't enable even the tiniest of toddlers to slip out and fall. The seal on the window left something to be desired, as the road noise was almost unbearable, and I fall asleep easily. We arrived prior to check in since we got off the cruise ship in the morning, but the bellman gladly checked our bags and stored them until we returned to the hotel once our room was ready. The stay was uneventful, as the room was made up efficiently during the day in our absence, but there was an error where the front desk clerk only put a two night stay on our room keys rather than three. This made it interesting when we were on the 19th floor and pressed for time, and had to trek back to the lobby to rectify the mistake. No big deal, but..."you had one job." We summoned a bellman the morning of our departure when we had an outgoing flight to catch, and after waiting 15 minutes at 6:30 in the morning, we finally lost patience and schlepped our six bags and two teenagers downstairs to the cab stand ourselves. At that point the bellman asked us if we would like the convenience of a hotel car to transport us, for much more than a cab would cost. No, thanks. The cab was there in a flash. Checkout was a breeze and our stay was overall pleasant and conveniently located.

This was my second time at this property, this time with my family. The location is very convenient to subway access and attractions around Times Square. Just a few blocks from 30 Rock. And a short walk to Empire State Building. The room was comfortable but a bit tired aesthetically. The headboards were really worn (why? Never mind. Don’t answer that!). There was a decent amount of mold in our bathroom. But the service was great. The front desk was very helpful. Bartenders were chatty. And they do a great job of giving perks to Elite status holders. We were there 4 nights and had a $20 credit every day, plus a number of free drink coupons; so we had a free drink every night, which was awesome. This is probably a 3 star property that is elevated to 4 stars because of their quality staff. Once it gets updated a bit....

I was at a 2 day conference in Times square, and decided that I was too tired to drive home after the first day. I used my hotels.com app, and got a room at the Crowne Plaza for about $170 for the night. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. This is very hard to come by in Manhattan. Great views from the windows. The resort fee of $30 included use of the gym, wifi, and 2 drinks at the bar. The gym was by far the best hotel gym I have ever seen. It was a full health club, with weights, aerobic machines, classes, everything! Huge! The room was whisper quiet, even in the heart of times square. I went to the 2nd day of the conference refreshed and ready to go. Great value!

If you like to be in the thick of NYC activity, this is the place for you. The room was adequate, the location great if you want to be very close to Times Square and the theaters. Food prices in the restaurant are high although the food is good.

Just spent time at crowne plaza and had the best time thanks to Travis a waiter in the restaurant. He gave the best advise on where and when to visit the area. We would highly recommend staying at the Crowne Plaza and ask for Travis if you want fabulous service!

Rooms were lovely and big especially for New York! Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is great and quiet even though your right on Times Square.Very clean and comfortable hotel, I would recommend.

Ok the location is fantastic. The bed and pillows are very good.Watch out for resort fees ... some supplementary costs for ... what they call Free WiFi ... the gym and swimming pool you’ll never use when you visit New York ... phone calls you’ll never make ... 35$/day / room ... that’s way too much for nothing

We were part of a group of 300 coming in from Birmingham AL to sing at Carnegie Hall plus other locations. It took six buses to carry us to all of the locations. The Hotel doesn't have much "street space" but they utilize what they have to perfection. Our buses had no problems getting us into and out of the hotel. This is a HUGE hotel that lives up to its four star status (or should be). Our room (4212) was ADA compliant had had wheelchair access in the toilet area. The fold down wooden seat and adjustable shower head was extremely nice. The curtain rod at the top had a "peg" that held a ring and kept the water in the shower. The room had a wonderful view that included the part of the Hudson River where the airliner that landed on the Hudson came to rest. The windows are "one way" so there was no problems with privacy. This room is a handicap accessible room and right next to the elevators -- we never heard them. Even the street noises were minimal and we were one block from a fire station. There was plenty of room inside the room to park the electric scooter out of the way. Housekeeping kept it spotless. The hotel met all of our ADA needs without any complaining. We could not have asked for a nicer hotel staff -- especially Johnny (Concierge), and Kelly and Grant on the front desk). One of the nicest things about this hotel is the full Concierge service during the day and 24 hour accessibility to "bell hops" to help with luggage. It was their Concierge service that connected me with Big Apple Mobility so I could rent, for a very reasonable rate, an electric scooter so I could keep up with the group. (Note: even the hop-on-hop off "topless" tour buses accommodated the scooter -- as did the street corners). The hotel accepted the scooter before I arrived and held onto it after we left for pickup. Can't ask for better service than that. The beds were extremely comfortable and faced the huge picture glass windows. There were also plenty of electrical outlets (however, we do recommend that you bring a "gang" set of outlets if you have a large number of "things" that need power. The desk area was very functional and the office chair comfortable. I'm glad the tour group picked this hotel for our mission trip. It is close to everything (especially the diner "Juniors" across the street) and a wonderful place to stay.

I'll get the Pros out the way:- Bed was comfy- Javier/Xavier came to our room to deal with an issue and was absolutely lovely.- Convenient ice machine- Location is very convenient, although right outside the doors you constantly get bombarded with ticket sellers. Have to walk through 5-6 men which is not nice!- Concierge got a taxi for us after we asked, pulled our suitcases along and put them in the trunk for us. Cons: (This is what you most want to read)- Unexpected 'Resort fees' at time of checking in. $30 per night to use the gym and international calls pretty much. Never used either, but still have to pay. We were told we may have to pay this if it was included in the room rate - it wasn't. Managers were very unaccommodating about it and very rude. None of that American 'Customer is always right' or even 'customers get smiles' malarky. Rude, grunting and unhappy is the best word I can use to describe them.- Came home to this bill, been charged the new $34 fee. This was not what it was meant to be when we booked.- So we've now had to pay out an extra £186 for something we should never have had to pay for.- Hotel is used by locals for the gym and pool. Good luck trying to get a lift at lunch or after they finish work!- We had a room near Times Square near the top floor. You could still hear sirens well into the night and early in the morning.- The room itself is not worth 4*s. We had a room with cupboards that were falling apart and did not close properly, and were the old dark wood that most homes had in the 90's. - Requested our linens be cleaned most days, but they weren't. There was a mark on one of the sheets which was there for at least 3 days.- The headboard of the bed was old and scratchy where the leather (I'm assuming leather) was starting to crack and peel.- 'Premium TV' is not accurate. 3 channels didn't work, you got 4 news channels who only ever spoke of Donald Trump, HBO, History and National Geographic were the only okay ones.- The on-site restaurant is okay. Expensive, but most of NY is.

We could not of been happier with the excellent service we received from the staff at the Crowne Plaza in Midtown. After a lot of unexpected delays we didn't arive at the hotel until 1am. It was very refreshing to be greeted by a friendly smile. Isaac was very kind and understanding. He really went above and beyond our expectations. Our room is very clean and has an amazing view of the Hudson River. Spencer was also very helpful. These two gentleman really personalized our service. My daughter and I really felt welcomed from the moment we arrived.

When I’m in the city for shows this location is perfect- just steps away from everything. I received an excellent reception from Donald at the front desk- very kind and welcoming. He noticed that the exact room type I prefer was not immediately available & offered several options. I took a nice corner room on the 36th floor. Donald offered to move me if I wanted the next day and called shortly after I arrived in the room to check the satisfaction. The room was perfect and what excellent service!! Thank you ( did I hear a colleague say Don Juan?) great job CPTS!!

Each time we are in NYC we come back to the Crowne Plaza Times Square, best location ever, comfortable and super clean rooms, and amazingly friendly staff! I have to specifically mention Sandra from the front desk who actually remembered me from my previous visit with girlfriends! With a huge smile she helped me get settled in quickly and efficiently. As a spire elite member, I always feel like I am truly acknowledged for my choice in returning to the Crowne Plaza. So excited to be arriving for yet another stay on June 28th!

We enjoyed our stay at Crowne Plaza Time Square. We are close to everything, the view is superb, everything is very clean. Rosa at the front desk was very nice in having a cake and a bottle of Proseco delivered to my parents who were celebrating their birthday. One thing is for sure, we will be returning to Crown Plaza on our next trip to NYC! Only negative point, the hotel's convenience store is really, really expensive!

Ms. W. Davis, one of my best friends, gifted me two rooms with double beds for a three-night stay for my 60th birthday. I would like to take this opportunity to thank the entire staff at the Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan who provided excellent customer service. The hotel reservation was from Thursday, May 24th through Sunday, May 27th. I was celebrating my 60th birthday with six other guests at the hotel who traveled from Texas, Florida, Maryland and Washington, D.C. I could not believe how spacious, clean and comfortable the beds were in both rooms. The rooms overlooked Broadway Time Square which was amazing. The spectacular night lights from all the tall buildings and visitors walking in the streets kept everyone awake each night in awe about New York City. My guests and I were treated with dignity and respect throughout our entire stay at the hotel. The staff maintained a level of professionalism and superior service. Whenever we contacted someone in maintenance or requested additional towels from housekeeping, it took less than 15 minutes for someone to respond. The entire staff was consistent in making every guest feel welcome as you entered the main lobby. Their uniforms clean and pressed with each person’s name tag visible. I usually stay at a comparable hotel when visiting New York City. After my stay at Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan, I plan to switch because the hotel exceeds my expectation. This was the first time three of my guests visited the Big Apple, and the staff left a lasting impression. The management team and staff should be rewarded and recognized for their performance and teamwork.I wish the hotel continued profitable growth in a competitive industry.Thank you for making my 60th birthday very special and memorable.
Excellent service, food was great!! Drinks were premium and the view was amazing, Times Square 42 st, And we had a great evening and the manager and staff are excellent, I am definitely returning

We stayed in June 24 for one night only. First time staying in this Crowne Plaza and this is our impression.RESERVATIONS: This time, IHG Central Reservation and Ambassador Customer Service left us with a bitter taste. I don’t know what happened, may be it wasn’t my day or I wasn’t lucky this time. I called several time and talked to Sheryl, Zack and Bryan asking about the resort fee or facility fee of $30 that it was mentioned in my booking, their response was vague, I asked them if being loyal to IHG chain for more that ten years (stayed at IHG in different cities, just to mention, Prague, Rome, Mexico, Bogota, Barcelona, San Francisco, Chicago, Miami, Paris and soon Lisboa…) and for being Platinum Ambassador member “as courtesy” they can do something about it, their answer were NO, they said "everybody pays for it", not satisfied with their answer, I asked to speak with someone else, and the just limited to say.."Contact the hotel" that was like brushoff off their responsibility. For me more than unapologetic, it was like " I don't care". I had to contacted the hotel and the answer was.."You have to pay for it", after all these unsuccessful attempt to speak with someone nice, I just told my partner, "that's ok, it's just $30 bucks".CHECK IN: We arrived around 1pm; We were running kind of late for a Broadway show, the lady at the counter checked us in a very fast and efficiently way, I barely remember her name, I think is Elizabeth, she was so charming and professional, very friendly and with a nice attitude towards us, even those we were in the hurry ( we had to catch a Broadway show), she took her time and had a little chit chat with us and… guess what?..She informed us that we don’t pay for the facility fee because we booked this hotel room months ago before the IHG change their policies and, I asked myself…why I didn’t get that answer from Central Reservations, Hotel Receptionist and Ambassador Customer Care when I called???...mmmhhh....Anyway, the room that she gave us was stunning, clean, perfect for our Anniversary celebration, yes, we were celebrating 25 years of being together and we decided to stay one night in the city. The view from the room was breathtaking. Nice job...!BREAKFAST: At check in she offered us a Breakfast voucher with a discounted prize of $16 per person (usually breakfast is $40 per person) for being Platinum member, in case we wanted to have Breakfast at the Brasserie 106, but we didn’t have time to stop by. Nice gesture..!THE CONS: The AC unit did not work well. We literally woke up sweating trying to adjust it, but it was impossible, if this happens to you, please report to the Reception,don't let it pass as we did. Check out was ok.Overall, we recommend this Hotel because of the cleanness of the room, also for being close to the theatre district and restaurants

We visited New York for Christmas with the in-laws. We chose the crowne plaza as it's very central being in times square. We had a great time and the hotel was very nice. The only issue was that the room was a little dated and could do with being updated. Other than that the hotel was fine. Restaurant was great and the bar staff were good fun. Would stay again when I'm back in new York.

What a great hotel. The hotel staff were all so friendly and amazing in their duties, which is reflective of their manager. Oh so comfortable bedding was a big plus. Looking out at Times Square just begged you to get outside. Fun location with so much right outside the doors. We walked almost everywhere.Only one drawback was that housekeeping never replenished the in-room coffee or tea. But, plenty of places to get morning beverages right outside.Defnitely would recommend this hotel. Just perfect.

This hotel is all about the location. Right on top of times Square, really great to experience this part of the city at night and then head back to the hotel and crash. Room was nice and clean and comfortable. Front desk accommodated request for a good view and put me in a corner room at the back of the hotel overlooking Broadway. Would stay again if the price is right.

My sister and I stayed here 3 nights while touring NYC. I'm a platinum IHG member so we used points for our stay. I was shocked at check-in to learn that we would still have to pay some expensive service fees and taxes despite the use of points. I've stayed at Hilton, Marriott, and IHG properties all over the US and Europe using points and have never paid an additional dime for my stays (unless I accrued other expenses). I'm actually still confused about some of the charges on my credit card, even after talking to the front desk twice. We were given some vouchers and discounts for food and drinks at the hotel for being platinum members, and we only used a few of them to get breakfast from the little bakery area (the chocolate croissants were yummy). The main selling point for this hotel is certainly the location. It is right in Times Square and couldn't be more convenient. We walked to restaurants, the Empire State Building (about a mile), and to Phantom of the Opera. Subway stops are also well-located which we used to go to the 9/11 Memorial and to come back from Little Italy and Chinatown. We did pay $12 per night to be upgraded to a room with a view, and we were put on the 45th floor (second highest floor) with some city views. We never had an issue with the elevators and they worked quickly. We could hear street noise all the way up there, but it didn't interrupt our sleep. If you're on lower levels, you may want to pack a small sound machine. The room did have some wear and tear. My sister initially thought the bathtub hadn't been cleaned, but it was actually stained, mostly with splattered paint! The headboard of my bed also had paint on it! Very strange. The internet was down for almost a whole day which was frustrating. Overall, our stay was fine but not impressive. I would probably look for somewhere else if I returned to NYC, but I wouldn't have a problem staying here again if the opportunity presented itself.

Going to New York with friends, we picked the Crowne Plaza for our hotel. I’ve stayed there before, and had no complaints, but aside from the location, nothing stood out to me. We picked the place for convenience.Well, the folks at the Crowne Plaza have upped their game since that 2015 stay - big time. From the moment Erika checked us in till the moment the bellman helped load our luggage into the cab, the service was notably friendly and helpful. One of our rooms was ready the moment we arrived - at 11:00, even though check-in isn’t until 3:00. The hotel had made us adjoining rooms - even though we hadn’t asked for it. The concierge was helpful with handling the subway, and handled multiple people efficiently.The room was fine, and if I want to nit-pick, the electrical outlets in the lamps aren’t convenient for all shapes of chargers. We were all comfortable. It was the service that gets the hotel the 5-Star ranking, although it could have earned it on location, as well.Well done, folks.

Great View with a great price to match. A lively hotel with a possible view of Times Square. The cost for the view was not that much and we were able to see the snow flurries swarming around the square.

Great location, wonderful staff. The best waiter I have uncounted it a long time. His name was Tofael. Very polite, eager to answer our questions even as busy as he was. The location to time square was great. I would stay there again on my next trip to the big Apple

Spent 5 days this week, with my family there. A very decent hotel that has an amazing location, just on time square and broadway. Location is key to all the attractions, theaters, and restaurants. The room sizes is not big, but decent. The staff were helpful. The hotel is clean and neat. Highly recommended for NYC Stay if you want time square. Would go again.

i absolutely loved my time at the crowne plaza hotel in times square. it was so convenient in location, being in times square. it was very easy to get around. Sandra at the check in desk made life so easy for us and made us feel at home. she even was able to upgrade our room! she definitely was the cherry on top of the great service this hotel provides. i will absolutely stay here again the next time i’m in new york city!
user_name:
Morgan A
New York City, New York

review_body: Just stayed at crown plaza for 5 nights.good professional front desk ,check in check out was smooth and quick,helping staff,rooms are a bit small but considering location and staff efficiency I will definately visit againP.s. good pressure in shower

Crowne Plaza was a quick 1/2 mile walk from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. It is located right across the street from the recently opened "Opry-City Stage". Check in was quick; room was everything that was advertised; complimentary drink/beverage at the bar. Lots of places to sit, relax, read, watch people come & go. Outpost for Bruce Springsteen souvenirs, since his shows are sold out till the end of December-one can still purchase items, without being crowd crushed.

I loved my stay at the Crowne. I had what turned out to be a "handicap access" room. It had a king size bed but was very spacious for a wheel chair to move around. The bathroom was huge as a result as well. The best part was the view to the west towards the Hudson River and New Jersey. The only complaint with the room was I had a towel rack over the toilet came off the wall and the sink didn't drain well. The restaurant food was very good and priced well. Felipe was a wonderful waiter who took care of all our needs, as did all the servers we encountered. The location was central to where we wanted to be and convenient for walking to most locations. A very nice "house car" was available for more distant trips, although a bit pricey compared to a taxi.

Lovely room upgraded for our 40th wedding anniversary by Rocco on reception excellent location in Times Square.All the staff were excellent from barman to concergie travelled back to JFK in hotel limo which was a real treat but remember to cost in hotel service charge of 30 dollars per night.

Room needs updating. Charges for Wi-fi, international calls and sports club, should only be charged for, if one uses them, NOT $30 Dollars per night, when not even used!!!! Dining Room prices very expensive. Broadway is close by for shows etc.

This hotel have the perfect location just in the heart of time square, we hace an amazing view, the subway is in front of the hotel, you can just walk to all the broadway shows, the chicago show is in front of the parking lot of the hotel, grat for vacations

the hotel location is GREAT! The rooms really need help, wall paper peeling off, broken marble on sink top, head board stained and worn. We made a reservation a year in advance for a special occasion over the Christmas holiday, requested a nice room with a view, and got a not so nice room and a view of a wall. Very disappointed, when I called after our experience they did give a small refund for partial night.... that was better than nothing, it just would have been nice to have a better room and the view we requested a year in advance.
user_name:
Athena S
New Port Richey, Florida

review_body: Great locationGreat roomsGreat price. We have stayed here at least 10 times and never fails to disappoont. Thia is the only place our kids want to stay. Clean rooms and every thing works all the time

Had a great time staying here , room was clean and comfy , staff very helpful, and location is amazing . Bar is great place to have a drink and watch the happenings in Times Square . So near broadway for the shows .

We had a great time at the Crown Plaza Times Square in Manhattan. We met Evelyn at the front desk who gave us a great customer service. She made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived. She upgraded our room and gave us a great room with an amazing view to the city. In the morning we had breakfast and also met Radman at the restaurant who also gave us an amazing customer service. We live in Florida but we travel frequently to NY because we have a house here. We will always recommend the Crown Plaza hotel. We had stayed in the one in Dominican Republic and the one in Florida and they both gave us a great service. Thank You Evelyn and Rahman for an amazing customer service!!!

Was a little concerned with the size of the room after hearing horror stories but the Crowne Plaza delivered a decent size room. We would stay there again, highly recommend it. Hotel was pricey but I guess everything in New York city is. We loved the people, very friendly, felt very safe, cops and emergency people everywhere.

We had been at many nice hotels for our different ocations but so far this time at this location in the capital of the world NYC where we created our family raised our 4 children before we moved to Hollywood Florida and now on our 26th university it's so emotional to us. I like to encourage everyone to book at any Crowne Plaza hotels specially here in Time Square facility quality and services are above and beyond customer satisfaction. P.S. prefect location and beautiful priceless city view!

Can not fault the location of the hotel, perfect for exploring with so many sights a very short walk away. We stayed 4 nights and found it a good base but just too expensive to spend any down time in the bar or even breakfast at almost $40 each. Service was great but room a little tired. Def not paying extra for the Times Square view
user_name:
ArmadillosRock
Dumfries and Galloway, United Kingdom

review_body: Sandra gave really good guest service. i am really impressed and am happy i chose this hotel. we had to originally wait 2 hours for our room to be ready, but Sandra, knowing it was our first time in Nyc, she made some arrangements to get us in a room rigjt away, and also a room on a higher floor. Thanks Sandra! Made our stay much better.

Location was great and the service was amazing! Our room wasn’t ready and the wait would have been 2 hours, so they hooked us up with another room that was available right then and there. Thanks for helping us out Sandra E.

The room and view was great. We were comfortable but when we needed assistance with the services provided (valet for instance) they do not answer the phone. After a trek of 26 floors to get a luggage cart I was told employees only get to use them. The desk attendant told me she would send one up with an attendant but after 30 minutes another attempt was made. My calls to retrieve our vehicle that cost $70.00 a day to park went unanswered every time. We waited outside for our car after we finally had our luggae toted down 26 floors for quite some time. The door man gave up and helped others because he didnt know why it took so long for our car. The stay was fine but the customer service not so much. Ridiculous pricing for poor customer service but great views of Times Square.

Just like staying in a premier inn back in England. Very average standard. Double beds are small. Wouldn’t stay here again, but we have stayed at the Renaissance hotel opposite last time and was much more luxurious and better so we compare it to that.

Great location for Times Square, Central Park etc , rooms are a little tired in fact we changed rooms 3 Times ! Eventually a lovely lady called Isis sorted us out a tidy room. Breakfast was good but we just loved Ana , she looked after us every day . Always smiling and welcoming - a credit to the hotel!

Stayed at the property for 5 days, the service is pathetic. No one receives calls on Service numbers, the numbers are always busy, and if not, no one picks them up. You have to go all the way down to the front desk to get your needs fulfilled. I would not recommend to stay at the property, if u are on a leasure trip with family especially if traveling with small children. Location is just perfect.

We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Upon checking in, we were greeted by Victoria, who was very kind!! We informed her that we were new to NY and were celebrating our 25th anniversary. Because we were an IHG member, she offered to upgrade our room to a time square view!!

Booked a 4 night stay here for my husbands 50th birthday after a great stay 6 years ago.After a tricky start due to some questionable rooms which one the managers (Amanda) dealt with very well we had a really good stay.I would say though I do think free access to the internet at least for a few hours a day or just in the hotel lobby would be an added bonus to this hotel. Also although it’s great to stay in Times Square be prepared for noise no matter how high up you are you can still hear traffic etc! Would definitely recommend and would stay here again.Mr and Mrs Shaw
user_name:
janette s
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights as a group of 3 girls. This hotel is in an excellent location in Times Square. The room was clean, spacious and had all amenities needed. (Toiletries, hairdryer, iron, Bluetooth cube speaker/alarm clock) We were located on the 17th floor; yes you can hear sirens and the buzz of Times Square but this is to be expected here and does not affect the quality of sleep at all. We booked tickets for Aladdin and the hop on hop off bus (which included entry to our choice of 7 attractions) via the concierge desk. A special mention here to Milton on concierge; an absolute diamond with fantastic customer service :) Hotel is within close proximity to Bryant Park, Rockefeller Centre, Radio City Hall and obviously Times Square. Approximately a 20-25 minute walk to Macy's and the Empire State Building, Last time we visited NY we used the subway but this time chose the hop on hop off bus. This was a great choice as you get to see plenty of the city whilst you're travelling around. The bar area in the lobby is lovely and you can get great coffee/pastries on this level also. Just a quick note that a taxi from JFK to here is approximately $75 and takes about 1hr 10 mins in traffic: NY rush hour is between 15:00& 22:00! All in all a great hotel in an excellent location and would not hesitate to book again in the future. Thanks Crowne Plaza :)

The location of this hotel is amazing if you are looking to stay in Times Square. It is located on top of the Hershey's chocolate shop (the shape of the hotel is actually a chocolate bar) and its 2 steps into Times Square. The atmosphere is truly amazing would highly recommend.

We checked in here after a bad experience in a nearby hotel which wasn’t up to the standard we expected (or payed for). This place was a real contrast with the service, quality of the room and amenities all being exceptional. A great location very close to Times Square and the Subway. I was fortunate enough to be served by Sandra at reception who looked after us and was highly efficient and friendly. Will certainly stay here again on my next visit.

My husband and I had a week stay in Crowne Plaza last month after being recommended by a friend and it was absolutely great. The hotel is new with basic decoration, located in right in Midtown of Manhattan, close to Times Square and in walking distance to other famous destinations. The staff are very friendly & helpful. Highly recommended!

Ideal location for sightseeing close to Broadway and Times Square. Check in was without eye contact or a smile however lass did say she had upgraded us. Room on 45th floor. View of Hudson. Even up this high you can hear the sirens all night but other than that it’s quiet so worth the height. Furniture is dark wood and old fashioned and had at some point been cleaned with a damp cloth leaving white marks. Large bed spotless white bed linen which was changed at least twice during our weeks stay. Plenty of towels which were changed daily even if not needed. Bathroom clean but slightly tired. We had a chaise sofa which would have been lovely however it had a very unpleasant nasty stain which hadn’t been cleaned. We had to use guest services who were very prompt and helpful but the servicing of the room was poor. Every day we were short of coffee cups/water cups/water and had to request them.Had a meal and drink in bar. Didn’t find staff friendly at all. No smiles or eye contact. Food was good and arrived promptly. Great view if you can get a window seat. Didn’t spoil visit as we were out all day and evening however sadly I don’t think this hotel is worth the money - we’ve stayed in same location in better hotels. Sorry!

We spent two nights at a roof top room with a view. Clean room comfy bed. Bathroom was fully functional with amenities. Linen changed daily. Wifi was good. Courteous staff. Will stay again ! Easy access to subway !

We stayed for 6 nights, we were very happy with our room. This hotel is in a good location close to broadway and times square. As with all large hotels I find them very in personal and staff not very friendly. The concierge was very helpful booking transport to the airport.

Vacationed in NYC for a "girl's trip" which was on my 78 year old mother's bucket list. After hours of trying to find a good location, nice sized rooms, we settled on this property. It was a good decision. We had 2 rooms, each with 2 beds. They were extremely comfortable with 4 pillows each both softer and firm pillows to choose from. The room was clean and spacious. Not like most NYC hotel rooms which are small and cramped. There was a safe that fit our electronics, jewelry, etc. with extra room. All we missed was a refrigerator. We were told if it is required for medicine it is free but if you want to rent one it's $3.00 per day. We received a coupon for a free drink in the bar (house wine, beer or soft drink). We later found out it was also for juice, soda, etc. in the small grab and go café (Grinder) near the elevators. We used one there for a bottle of orange juice in the morning. Housekeeping was great about leaving soap, and shampoos. Twice we came back to a clean room with no washcloths. I'm sure it was an oversight and easily fixed. They delivered free water bottles upon request a couple of times. The air conditioner was independent so we were able to turn it down and up and it felt like we did rather than centrally controlled somewhere else on the property. We did not hear our neighbors. The location is great. We walked to the two Broadway Shows we attended. We walked to the Hop on Hop off bus. Even walked to the Today Show.If you use the concierge and order Show tickets through them, pick up your tickets from that desk. We opted to pick them up at the theatre and they were not there until 30 minutes before the show began. We were told that is standard. It was cause for some anxiety. We will plan on staying at this location again.

Comfortable, efficient 4* hotel. Close to most of the common tourist attractions. Lots of restaurants round about. Hotel has a nice bar which serves well priced good quality food. Rooms large & comfortable & well cleaned. Bathroom could do with a revamp but was perfectly adequate.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights. Our experience from start to finish was fantastic. The staff were always so friendly, the rooms were so clean and spacious. Location was perfect! Right on Times Square. We slept so well considering we were right on Times Square. Breakfast was delicious! Honestly couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel. We'll be back to New York for sure and when we do, we'll be booking the Crowne Plaza again. There's nothing nicer than coming back to a fabulous hotel after a super day in the city. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay so relaxing and enjoyable.

My wife and I stayed here for our 1st wedding anniversary, a nice change from London, with lots of similarities.The location if perfect for time square, 5th Avenue, Macy’s, subways, everything really.We walked to Central Park in 10mins, subway to Ground Zero in 20mins, and loads more.The room was fairly standard, larger than I expected, but decor was ok - nothing special but acceptable. Staff were friendly, in the bar especially, and on check in.Took 15mins wait to check in, but that’s ok.Gym is massive, but need a hat to use the pool

We visited the Crowne Plaza for a Broadway week, and were delighted to find that "400 feet" away from our first Broadway venue actually meant the hotel was attached to the theatre. The location was fantastic--right on Broadway at Times Square with all its lively, chaotic, cheerful, crowded, good-natured entertainment. It surprisingly had the feel of a neighborhood, despite being a very populated commercial district, and we really enjoyed the whole scene. Everything was perfect--from the first encounter with Sandra Esp at check-in; to the beautiful, spacious and clean 45th-floor, Broadway-side room with the great view; to the small restaurant, with good service and good food for good value. We'll definitely make this our first-choice hotel for all future visits.

We recently stayed there for my husbands Birthday and we don’t regret it. They had new beds and they were really comfortable. The rooms were very big and spacious. The bathroom could use some reno on the walls, but besides that were more than comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. It is perfectly located so you can walk to anything quickly!

Hotel overall was ok,reception had nice staff, clean and tidy, but rooms could do with a renovation. Was a little disappointed on there condition. Probably wouldn't stay again because of the condition of the rooms are overpriced.

Musarat checked me in. Not only was she friendly, she got me an umbrella for the rain because I'd forgotten mine. Everything was quick and easy, which made my annual trip to MotorCity Pride that much better. Thanks, Musarat!

I was in town for the Jeffries life sciences financial conference at the Grand Central Hyatt. Stay at the Crown Plaza because on Monday nights when I am in town I hang out at the bar with long time bartender Keith. I feel like I’m in a neighborhood bar. Keith knows everyone and goes out of his way to introduce the guests to each other. He makes the whole experience fun. He never forgets things about you from your previous visit. He loves people and loves what he does. He should open his own bar. He would be a huge success. The hotel is smart to realize how their dining and entertainment options make a difference in an undifferentiated market. Thanks Crown Plaza!

Great location to be close to all the popular attractions. This is clearly what you are paying for. The rooms are older, especially the bathroom. Our mirror was cracked. The location of the toilet paper to the toilet is weird. Why put it on the wall behind the toilet and not on the wall beside? And speaking of toilet paper... For $300+ a night you'd think you would get two ply, soft paper and not the crispy, recycled single ply. No fridge in the room which was very strange. Again, clearly you are paying for the location and not for a fancy or even modest hotel.

My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the beginning of May. The location of the hotel couldn’t be better, close to all the action! We were on the 40th floor with a Times Square view. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I am looking forward to my return in December with my Mum for her 70th birthday. The only issue was that we were charged to service fee having previously confirmed this was included in our rate. This was quickly rectified when we checked out and the fee refunded. I would definitely recommend when staying in New York

What a wonderful 5 nights we spent in the hotel in our favorite city! Our room was located on the 32nd floor overlooking Time Square and it was a fantastic view. This was our 6th stay here and everything was perfect! We received 5 star service from every staff member we came in contact with. Once again our trip to NYC and our stay here was perfect! Already planning our next trip!

Above all, the staff was helpful, patient and EXTREMELY kind! We chose this hotel based upon it's perfect location on Broadway, right at Times Square. Most everything was within walking distance...Broadway shows, Central Park, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center and many more "must see" locations. Very easy to take either a taxi or the subway downtown for more beautiful sights. Although this hotel is located in the middle of all the excitement, we had no issues at all with noise and were able to get a great night of sleep every night.A particular highlight of our stay was meeting Victoria while checking in. She is an exceptional employee with a beautiful personality! We explained, while checking in, that we had come to NYC to celebrate our daughter's 16th birthday. She went above and beyond to make sure our stay was extra special! We were able to check in early, she made sure that we had a room facing Times Square and gave our daughter extra vouchers for the cafe. She spent time getting to know us and told us a bit about herself. She even called our room to make sure that all was well once we were there.We highly recommend this hotel to all!
user_name:
Michelle S
Saint James City, Florida

review_body: Great hotel In the centre of the action, surrounded by Broadway theatres, restaurants, bars and on the door step of Time Square. Clean and comfortable rooms with views of the Hudson and Time Square. Easy access from front and back with undercover garage.

Location is everything for convenience. The hotel is right on the edge of Time Square on Broadway. It is directly across the road from many eateries with short walking distance access to theatres, restaurants and tourist attractions, including hop on hop off bus operators.We loved the convenience of this location. Our needs were met very well, including access to supermarkets and other shopping.We walked to many of attractions and even Central Park is only a 10-15 min walk away, as is Grand Central Station, the Empire State Building.The rooms can be a bit pricey, including the additional Resort Fee of USD$30 per night, but once you get over the cost, you will reap the benefits of convenience without the need for taxis.The staff are great, rooms are comfortable and relatively quiet, even though you will hear sirens 24/7, something that is unavoidable anywhere in Manhattan.You are only a couple of doors away from breakfast spots with many vendors on street corners. We loved being a part of the NYC buzz of times square.

My stay was fatally marred by run-in with an obnoxiously rude and not-very-bright--always a winning combination--member of the security staff. A joint of these pretensions should really impress upon their employees the importance of basic courtesy. The property itself is not particularly well-maintained, but my room was fine. Still, there are lots of hotels in New York and in the future, I shall be choosing one where the staff does not abuse the guests.
user_name:
Timon88
New York City, New York

review_body: I brought my two daughters to NYC for a 5 night trip and we stayed at the Crown Plaza Times Square and had a wonderful time. It was a great location, a very nice room and had no complaints. A bit pricey, however it is NYC and the location was key to everything we wanted to see.

This hotel was amazing for our first overnight in NYC! Everything we needed was in walking distance, and the view of the city at night all light up was spectacular! The staff is super nice and helpful. It was our 1st trip that included storing our luggage and valet parking (we're simple folks!). The hotel has an on-site health club, and because of that we were forced to pay extra at check in to use it as a day guest. The pool is considered part of the club, so it closed at 6pm, which was upsetting. We also had to pay for wi-fi, so between the health club and wi-fi, it was a lot to add on, plus we didn't use either one! Parking is under the hotel by valet, so that was an additional charge as well. I did use Priceline and totally lucked out on my room though. My "standard room" was actually on the 22nd floor- a king bed with a chaise lounge and still large enough for a twin air mattress. Plus, we got vouchers for 2 free alcoholic beverages as well! No micro or fridge though. Very clean, and spacious, and the bed was sooo cozy! Could easily have spent more than 1 night there. Check in was 3 pm, check out 11am, but you pay parking by the 24 hour period. We left at 11am and had the bell hop hold our luggage while we wandered around NYC until 3pm. When we returned they pointed to our luggage, but when I handed them a tip, they were more than happy to get our luggage, cart it, and wheel it out the door! Car arrived within 30 seconds. What a wonderful experience.

Wife, and I decided on this Hotel to stay on our visit back to NYC for our 50th wedding anniversary.. Nice hotel with a convenient location with clean, comfortable rooms.. food, and beverages very pricey for its quality.. We found it very strange that with the cost of our stay for 3 nights that we could not get a simple "Wash Cloth"! Even after several calls to the front desk, and them telling us they noted it, we were never given a wash cloth??? One call to the front desk, we were told to use a HAND TOWEL lol! We have an upcoming trip to NOLA using the same hotel chain, and packing our own wash cloth!!!! I want to extend a personal Thank You to Rosa (Front Desk) who went above and beyond with acknowledging our special ocassion, and Raiti (Server at the Main Bar / Louunge) who also went above, and beyond for his acknowledgement of our special ocassion..

First trip to NYC. No worries when selecting this hotel, It’s right in the middle of everything. Very nice place to stay and got a great deal on a last minute booking. Donald Mei at check in was awesome! Thanks Donald!!!!
user_name:
debnjay1
New York City, New York

review_body: The room location was great! You're right there in Time Square but the rooms are VERY quiet. Couldn't even hear other rooms. Right by both uptown and downtown subway entrances. Like all hotels, the restaurant was very pricey but the food and drinks were superb! Rahid (sorry if misspelled) is a FANTASTIC server and was soooo tentative to us. We usually don't go to restaurants in hotels so this hotel should truly appreciate him because we wouldn't have spent hundreds of dollars there otherwise. Would have given this hotel an excellent rating except for two things:1. They sometimes had someone checking hotels cards at night to ensure the safety of their guests and make sure nobody was coming in if they weren't staying there. Considering there were homeless people fighting outside twice (it's time square, expect to see these things anywhere you stay), they should have been there the whole night. Only saw them checking twice out of our 5 night stay.2. They should be much clearer that there is a fitness club with a pool that they give their guests access to use. Not a hotel with a gym. This is not a fun leisurely pool to look forward to after a long hard day. Have to wear a hair cap and swim in the lanes. Do not stay here for the pool. Would definitely recommend this place to couples, business people, and families all. Great stay, great location, great hotel. IHG rarely disappoints.

Victoria Martin is a delightful person and an asset to your company. She was pleasant upon check in and made me feel like she wanted me there. The hotel itself was clean and located in a great location. The Times Square view from our room was a major plus as well. I would definitely stay there again. Truly, Mr. Barnes

Love this Hotel, friendly staff, quality service, best location to get around town, see Broadway Plays etc. They have a very nice Breakfast Buffet as well as Excellent Bar area for food and drinks. Always easy to get a cab or other car service, also includes a Business Office Center for use.

Me and my couple were staying this hotel for our Honey Moon, the staff was incredible, specially one of the front desk agents Evelyn, she took care of me and my partner very well, she gave us an amazing costumer service, and I will stay there anytime we are in town!!! <3

Stayed at the Hotel for a week in May 2018. Hotel is in an excellent location right in the middle of Times Square. Our room was 4011 on the 40th floor, room was lovely & clean, the maid left it spotless everyday. We used the bar on a few occasions and the bar staff were really friendly as were the front desk staff. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.
user_name:
Hayley M
South Wales, United Kingdom

review_body: This was one of the best trips ever. A huge thanks to the management and Rocco at the front desk. I was treated exceptionally well and was extremely comfortable. The hotel staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. With a close proximity to Times Square I felt safe traveling alone in and around the hotel property. Thank you so much. I look forward to visiting again. You all made my Birthday so special

This is the second time I've stayed at Crowne Plaza, Times Square. Outstanding location with great view of Times Square from rooms. Good service but lacks warmth that a hotel should have. No room service available post mid night is not what is expected in today's day and age. Even small hotels offer 24 hours room service. Rooms are good size but not modern. No shower stalls available. No mini bar available.

The property is reasonably (for Manhattan) priced and in a fantastic location. The service was first-rate. The bar overlooking the street is a great spot for happy hour or a late nightcap after a Broadway show.

This month my wife and I decided to take a mini vaca in Manhatten. Choosing the Crown Plaza at Times Square after reading the reviews was no mistake. The staff was more than friendly and helpful. The property was very clean and my high expectations were met. I tend to set the bar high when looking at hospitality businesses. I was, many years ago, a hospitality employee so I can be somewhat critical. Not only did the property meet my expectations, but the staff I encountered were awesome. Including the housekeeper that taught me how to use my room key (in my day we actually had keys) and the bellman that watched our bags and offered the help we needed to navigate our way around. I especially want to mention Tony at the bar. After a long day of walking the city, my wife and I wanted to sit, have a couple drinks and snacks before starting our journey home. Tony was a server made to order. He was very friendly and uplifting. His service was magnificent; nothing I asked was any trouble. There is a way that a person presents himself that is rarely seen in the service industry today... Tony brings it back. He is a professional at his craft. All I can say is, on our next trip to NYC, we won't be staying anywhere else. To the GM... Tony is a model for what a hospitality professional should be. Don't lose him. See ya next time. -Charles

I stay at this hotel a few times a year and have always found it to be quite good. It is NOT The Four Seasons or Peninsula but neither is the nightly rate. This is a well run hotel, clean & friendly. The location is convenient to Times Square and mass transit. I will continue to stay here when overnighting in NYC and recommend it highly to anyone looking for a reasonable rate (by NYC standards anyway!) and a nice hotel.

We had a great visit coming to NYC this past week. The hotel’s location was great, our room was clean & beautiful and the staff were so helpful. Victoria Martin was especially helpful, patient and thorough when getting us checked in. Thanks for an awesome trip!

I’ve come with my parents to visit family several times the last few years. We stay here and Sylvia Geronimo Has gone out of her way to make sure our stay is excellent every time. This last stay we had the pleasure of meeting mr. Karim sharif (manager) and he also went out of his way to make our stay excellent. As spire elite ihg members we take great appreciation to this.

I stay at this hotel because I can swim each morning at the health club pool on the 15th floor. Special thanks this trip to David and Kevin at the healthy club who did a great job of keeping everything running smoothly on a holiday weekend.

My room was clean and spacious, with a great view of Broadway from above. The second floor bar/restaurant was outstanding. The staff was extremely courteous. I want to call out Felipe who was exceptionally thoughtful. I returned on Thursday night and enjoyed a fantastic Brazilian live music group.... Monika Oliveira & the Brazilians.

If you are fine with the overcrowded Times Square area, the Crown Plaza location is great. A few blocks from Central Park and Columbus Circle, and right on Broadway and Times Square.The service is very good for NYC standard. We requested a crib at check-in and was delivered within minutes. As a platinum member I was awarded late check out until 1pm, and I also received a discount for breakfast and a free drink at the bar.The property, however, need some updating. The furniture is worn, the carpet gives the impression that is far from clean, and when we walked in the room it was humid (the ventilation system is mediocre).This is a good hotel for one or two nights, but I would stay somewhere else if I’m in NYC for a longer period of time.
user_name:
MesaPuyo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Had a great time this past week staying here, clean rooms and quick service. Got check in wen we arrived at 1100 AM rather rare today in any Motel or hotel you stay in. Great central location and a awesome gym to train at with no additional charge

Service oriented people,that's what I found when I stayed almost 5 days in this hotel located in the heart of times square in NY.I had a group of almost 200 people for a business conference in Crowne plaza hotel.The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful,actually they made my job much easier.Everyone in the hotel who was involved with my group was assigned particular work to make the operations part smoother.Here are some of the departments I would personally thank for their outstanding service and understanding towards my Indian group(as it always requires patience;)..)*the duty manager ..Ms.Pooja and Ms.Emily.....thanks a ton ladies..you made my life easier:)*F&B manager...Mr.Kareem...sir,you and your staff managed my group breakfast really well. Thanks to all of them from the breakfast department,great service!Concierge department...All of the porters helped me thoroughly,I had lots of luggages and stuff for my conference and these guys were a great help for me to place all my stuff in the conference room.The banquet manager...My conference with dinner and hi tea went smoothly without any complaints. Thanks guys!Will definitely suggest to all of my friends to stay in this awesome property where service is at it's best!!!Pooja and Emily u guys rock!!!

We chose the Crowne Plaza Times Square for our home base for a 60th birthday trip because of the location. We also liked the advertised size of the rooms and the Crowne reputation. Though a minor speed bump at the start, resolved speedily and eloquently by Vanessa, our stay was purely delightful. Upon arrival we were disappointed to learn that the room assigned us was a smaller double, and the hotel was booked. With poise and professionalism, Vanessa relocated us to the 44th floor and a king room overlooking the Hudson. For a 5-night stay, the smaller room would have been claustrophobic, but the larger was perfect. It was adjacent to the elevator--and we never heard it! The shower in the upgraded rooms is to die for--water pressure and shower head are phenomenal. The bed, though I thought it looked like it would be far too soft, enveloped my body for perfect nights of rest. And not to end there, on the birthday girl's special day Vanessa had delivered a mouth-watering piece of Jason's Red Velvet cake with a bottle of champagne. Classy.I used the concierge a number of times. They too were courteous, knowledgeable and thorough.Last is the location. While some might shy away from Times Square, this hotel is maybe 5 blocks north, right in the theater district. It was perfect for the theater, access to key subway lines, and a pleasant walk to Central Park or around Manhattan. It served as a perfect central base camp. Thanks to all for a wonderful stay!

Very comfortable room, easy to control temperature. Roomy shower with textured tile floor, so I was not afraid of slipping. Roomy bathroom countertop - I easily spread out all my toiletries, contact lens solutions, etc. Lighting on the sides of the mirror - great for applying my makeup without wondering if I looked like a clown. Needed to store my luggage after checking out - friendly helpful service. Only hotel glitch: I tried to print my return trip boarding pass - couldn't make the printer work (printed it at the airport instead). Concierges were very helpful in directing me to the subway entrances I needed to reach my destinations, and yes, the entrances were close to the hotel. Several restaurants to choose from. Would stay there again.

We stayed for a week in 2 standard rooms, which according to the hotel site includes 2 double beds.Well, rooms indeed had 2 beds but far from double and not convenient for 2 people to sleep on.Besides the beds’ size, the bathroom is not a 4 star hotel bath.Hot water were sometimes not functioning and in general - taking a bath wasn’t convenient at all.Rooms were cleaned everyday.

Always have had a good nights sleep when staying at the crown plaza in times sq. I was there again a few weeks ago for a short stay. The rooms I find of ample size for one or even two people. Comfortable beds, and linens. Great staff, and always find front desk attended and helpful even late at night. I travel for work and have many late night check ins so thats essential for me. The bar in the lobby is great for a quick drink, or to meet colleagues.

My wife and I stayed here for our 25th anniversary weekend, and to see Springsteen on Broadway (right next door). This is my regular business travel hotel when I'm in NYC, and I hoped it would be just as good for our celebration weekend. It met those expectations and more!First, the room selection was good (as it usually is for me) - top three floors, corner room facing Broadway and 48th with the wrap-around windows. The bed was one of the best I ever slept in - may be the best in the hotel! (sorry, I won't tell you the room number or I may not get it again!).Second - a warm greeting and offer for extended checkout on Sunday - allowed us to leave all our stuff there till 2:30 - very considerate (disclaimer, Spire status will get you some of these perks).MOST IMPORTANT - shout out to Martin at the bar. Martin is one of the regular bartenders when I'm there during the week, and always remembers me by name with a friendly greeting. He made us feel VERY welcome when we got there late Friday night,, so much that we were there after the show as well on Saturday. Martin took great care of us, and my wife and the rest of our party said it felt like "Cheers" at the bar. So a big "thanks" to Martin for all the great service!It's a busy, sometimes chaotic mid-town hotel - but it is really fun and a really great place for a regular. Thanks for making our weekend special.Mark & Crystal

If you want to be at the heart of Times Square, the Crowne Plaza Hotel is the place to stay. It is a big hotel, recently renovated, with spectacular views of the city. It has a gym, New York Sports Club, with a 4 lane lap pool. It is near attractions, across the street from famous Broadway musicals, shops and restaurants.

We stayed for 8 nights whilst visiting New York for the first time on the recommendation of a relative who stays there regularly for work. It is perfectly located in Time Square and central to all the tourist icons and broadway shows , most of which are in a short walking distance. Hells Kitchen is a couple of blocks away with a good selection of cafes, bakerys and restaurants for breakfast or dinner. Mrs Greens laundry does an excellent job of same day washing and folding , highly recommended on 9th Avenue, near 46th.The room was on 38 floor and whilst it didn’t have a view over the square or the Hudson River it had nice big windows with view of the buildings and streets below so you access as best as possible the weather for the day. The room was a good size with two double beds and was very clean. The hotel is big with lots of guest but the staff and concierge was very helpful with all our queries.

The hotel is situated ideally with a minute walk into Times Square. Decor is in need of some refreshing, but all in all a clean and neat hotel. The staff could really do with some cheering up, only received some attention and smiles when they realised I was a platinum IHG member. The breakfast is average and not worth the price, rather go get something outside the hotel. Get a room with a Times Square View, really awesome watching the activity till the early hours of the morning.

Arrived after a long flight from the uk to be greeted by a efficient check in. We were a bit disappointed with the room as we felt the standard of cleaning to be a bit poor. Everything was very dusty and there was dirty clothes left in the drawer. I threw these out and cleaned the room myself.The location is amazing.The concierge was very helpful.Our stay included breakfast which was lovely and the waiters were friendly and helpful.There was a nice bar in the evening too.The hotel would have been perfect if the rooms were a little better cleaned.

Crowne Plaza at Times Square! Supposed to be one of the finest hotels in this part of the town however, has proved to be otherwise. If not go above and beyond guests' expectations, the hotel should atleast try to provide us with basic services when it's charging us $400 per night. It's 10 am in the morning, there's no hot water in the shower, it's not there since 7 am. When called the guest services a couple of times, they were oblivious about how long it would take to fix it and said there's some problem in the heating system. When my daughter went to the front desk and asked to be spoken to the Manager on Duty, the agent told her she was in the morning meeting and asked her to come back later (that's rude). Did not even bother to ask what the problem was until she mentioned upfront. It seemed she did not care about it at all. We were supposed to leave for sightseeing at 9, thank you for such a not-so-wonderful start to the day, Crowne Plaza. Oh,forgot to mention, two light bulbs are fused in the room as well.

Excellent location it is close to most of the shows , all you need is time to go and see many of them. The hotel is very nice , clean , we had very nice view from room . The service was excellent , people are very nice and will help you right away.

The location is perfect for those wanting to stay in Time Square. Room was large, quiet and clean. Friendly staff, with quick checkin/checkout. The free internet was surprisingly fast. Location is close to many great restaurants and the theater district

Great Location if you want to be right in Times square, easy access to buses, subway and within walking distance to many broadway shows, shopping and restaurants. We were on the very top floor and had a great view of the city. Plus its probably not as noisy if you stay on the top floor.

This hotel has a great location just off Times Square. The rooms are a decent size for such a central location and has everything you need. The WiFi is free and fast. Don’t use the tea pods in the rooms as they are pretty terrible. The bar is nice but the service a bit slow. My biggest comment is that the rooms and corridors are just a bit dated and in need of a refresh.

This is a very nice (and very big) hotel in NYC. Staff is very friendly, rooms are clean, quiet and spacious. It is close to the midtown action - theaters especially and great restaurants. We stay there all the time using our IHG rewards.

While we weren’t in the hotel that often, it would’ve been nice to see the view when were there.... and not a view of others changing!!! I guess the description needs to be updated. The hotel itself was fine and the room was good it was just the view. We wanted to be wow’d by the lights and that didn’t happen...we were there at 7am to check in so i would think we could’ve gotten something nicer!!

Victoria at the reception was very helpful finding a room to check in early as we were with a toddler and a grandparent in a wheelchair. She also found a closest second room to check in later. She also provided complimentary tickets for drinks, which we used to get bottled water and juice for the kids and grandparents.

Perfect location making it so easy to walk around and tour Times Square. Hotel staff was fast and friendly especially Donald Mei he was phenomenal. He was able to accommodate me with ease when I made a mistake on booking the wrong room. He switched it out for me at no extra cost. We had a suite with a great view overlooking the city. The hotel is modern and clean. Whenever I called guest services for towels, they came up within minutes. I’ll definitely be back.

Higher grade rooms quite nice. Lobby a bit small , crowded and noisy. Staff helpful and friendly except at checkout.Location could not be better, centrally situated in the heart of Times Square. Overpriced though.

I have tried calling the hotel number for 30 minutes and no one answers the phone this evening. I called earlier and was placed on and off hold for 52 minutes trying to resolve an issue. This is pathetic!

31st floor we paid for a Times Square view which was fantastic. Doulble aspect room also offer a view over 8th Avenue and the Hudson River.From checking in to checking out all staff were very polite and helpful, loved the accents. Had occasion to meet the hotel manager, what a charming fellow.The hotel decor is a little past its best but that did not detract from the experience.Cliche to say good location, but it was, only yards from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. You could hear the authentic sound of NYC particularly the Fire Trucks.Would be more than happy to stay there again.My only criticism is that the hotel need a lobby where you can just sit and relax, not just a noisy bar.

Ideally located just north of Times Square this place is ideal for getting around as there are 2 Subway lines within a block or two.We stayed on a corner room the 36th Floor and had great view of Downtown and to the Cruise ships on the Hudson. The rooms were excellent and spacious with toiletries refreshed daily. They have a strict check-in time and as we were early we were given a drinks voucher for the bar which is airy with good views down to Times Square. Plenty of lifts make it little waiting time to get up to your room and all the staff were very helpful and friendly.There is a small breakfast bar where you can buy coissants and take back to your room.Certainly not the cheapest hotel in town but you pay a lot for the location.

Stayed there from 3/21-3/29. Very accommodating, meeting rooms were good, except one that the a/c would not work,got warm but they found us another room. Food was awesome, especially feeding a large group, we ate great. Staff was awesome and worked very hard. Ordered a refrigerator and had it in minutes. Close to Times Square, all in all a great place to stay.

I travel to New York frequently for work, and this is always my go-to hotel.
