The rooms have excellent views of the city and Hudson River.Food and Bar: I'm usually skeptical of hotel food - and being in New York, there are plenty of amazing restaurants so always a great reason to go out - but I find that at least one night during a multi-night trip, I'll have dinner at the bar (broadway 49 bar & lounge) because the food is outstanding! My favorite items on the menu are the grilled chicken sandwich with cheese, avocado, and bacon; the grilled steak salad; quesadillas; and basically everything for dessert! Truth be told - I'll usually stop for a drink before heading to bed if I went out for dinner because the bar is really unique (the bar actually lights up!) and the staff is always amazing.I knew the staff was something different about the staff on my first trip 6 years ago when they greeted me by asking for my name - and 6 years later, they haven't forgotten it. Traveling alone can be boring (and stressful) at times, but the personal touch the bar staff adds helps make it feel like I'm on vacation in the middle of a work trip. From Martin, Jason, and Victor behind the bar who are always making everyone laugh and feel welcomed (and make THE best cocktails) to Karim who greets every guest to make sure they're having a pleasant experience. I cannot give them enough accolades and always recommend the hotel to my friends and family based on the positive experiences I've had at Broadway 49 with the staff. Looking forward to my next trip in a few weeks!

Thank you so much to all the team and specially to VICTORIA this morning. My son and I, have a new home with the way you Welcome us. Wonderful, we're in heaven in our room 3001. Thanks to the very lovely Gentleman Mr Miles, who manage this top hotel.

This was the 2nd time the 3 of us booked 2 rooms us here. We were so taken with the property the 1st time, we didn't give any other property a 2nd thought. This time the hotel put us in adjoining rooms on the 30th floor, which gave us the feel of a suite. Ana working the Brasserie 1605 discreetly shouted "Your Back!" when see eye contact with my sister. The little coffee bar was perfect for fresh barista brewed coffee. The Broadway 49 Bar and Lounge met our lunch needs on are final day. The business center was accommodating in printing our boarding passes. The hotel was perfectly located for the event we were attending at Lincoln Center. We were able to get a nice walk down 5th Ave. on our way to Central Park. BJ, RS & PS
user_name:
Ron S
New Smyrna Beach, Florida

review_body: From the check in with Rocco, all the visits to the bar/restaurant, the gift shop for snacks, even check out...Everything was great! The food and service at the bar area was perfect and the view was outstanding. Housekeeping kept our room super tidy and clean. The beds were comfortable and the view directly out onto Times Square was exactly what we were looking for! The room was so quiet which I didn't think was possible being that we were on top of Times Square but we never heard a thing. I will definitely be back.

Location scores for this hotel, just next to the Broadway. And well connected by the subway. However, not a favourite with taxis due to heavy traffic.Rooms are large, plenty of plug points - in fact 2 each on all the table lamps. Sufficient lighting. Soft pillows, comfortable sleep. And yes, free Wi-Fi. Breakfast in the lobby - nothing fancy, just a few options. Vegetarians will have to survive on fruits plus bread butter. And cornflakes.

Victoria checked us in and out. She was excellent; friendly, helpful and went out of her way to make us feel welcome. Consierge was also very helpful with many of our destination needs. The bar/food staff went out of their way to accommodate us. The location was great. Nice large room overlooking Broadway and it was never noisy! I will stay here again when I return!

Every April the company I work for will bring a group from all over the United States. This last group there were125 of us. Everyone is very happy with the hotel location, restaurant, and staff. Especially the staff. In the morning breakfast is included with our program, I would say that Ana the hostess along with all the waiters, Tofael, my favorite, are so accommodating friendly and go above and beyond to make you feel welcome! Karim Sharif the food and beverage manager will always come up to me to make sure our group is well taken care of.In the restaurant and bar area, again it's like you are old friends.. very friendly, and make sure you are well taken care of... my favorite Richie... the best!We have a group scheduled to come back 2019, and I know that everyone will not be disappointed. It is a fun week in New York, Crown Plaza it's the place to stay.

Location location location right?Was working about 8 blocks away at Carnegie Hall so was good location. No complaints really. ERIKA at front desk is an asset to this property as she was very friendly and helpful. LOVED the mattress....good support but also luxurious feeling. I have more status at Hilton and Marriott properties… I did not have a choice as the people I was working for made this room reservation etc but was happy with my stay.

This hotel was lovely. It was right in the center of everything, it had a very friendly and helpful staff, and a great lobby bar overlooking Times Square which was wonderful to go to after seeing Hamilton. Upon check in, we got an unexpected upgrade to an amazing suite. I don't know how since I'm not a member of any hotel points or rewards cards at all, but it was an awesome surprise and our contact Victoria was amazing! Friendly and efficient. I left my ID on the counter when we checked in and they were holding our luggage so we went out on the square, and Victoria ran down two flights of stairs and out onto the Square to get it back to me. I had to give her a shout-out. She made my week!

Hotel was in a great location, right in the heart of Times Square, staff friendly and helpful, house keeping very good, I would recommend this hotel. Be prepared for the extra resort tax which they charge, 34 dollars a night, which can bump up the price of the hotel.

The hotel staff was helpful, rooms were clean, and beds were comfortable. We appreciated little food kiosk where one could get an excellent breakfast wrap, some fruit and coffee. I wish the lounge stayed open a little longer because they made the best chicken quesadilla but we often got in too late for a midnight snack. The view from our room was excellent.

decent facilities, expensive 60 dollar resort fee. not worth the charge. breakfast too expensive, go elsewhere.Signs of age, front of house management and hotel management rubbish at replying to emails/failed to address issues. Rude and ignorant.

I got a better price at this hotel by calling them directly than I found on any of the travel websites. The AARP discount was better than the AAA discount.The service was excellent - especially the service at checkin.TIP - If you want to book a hop on, hop off bus tour, don't go to the concierge. He was quoting me prices well over $200 for two adults & two kids for two days of tours. When we walked out of the hotel, there were representatives from two different companies on the sidewalk and we booked three days of bus tours for only $130 (Same company the concierge was offering)You can skip the expensive breakfast buffet and go to Szbarro right across the street. They have a breakfast buffet for only $9.99 per person.The room was excellent and quite spacious by NYC standards. We enjoyed a great view and everything was clean and comfortable. If I can get the same price for the room I got on this trip, I will definitely stay here again.

Drove into NYC for 2 nights to see a museum show and a Broadway play. The staff here at Crowne Plaza was helpful and courteous with a special mention to the valet staff who welcomed us and took care of our car quickly and efficiently. Check-in was fast and the room had an amazing view of the city. Super-clean room and linens with a very comfortable bed. This was a special trip for us and our stay here helped make it memorable. We hope to return!

Had 8 days alone in NYC and wanted somewhere near theatres which was safe and had restaurant, room service etc. This was one of the few hotels which had everything, plus friendly front desk staff, good tour desk, lovely room overlooking Times Square etc. As an IHG member I did not have to pay the Resort/Hotel fee ($34US per day, covers wi fi, gym, pool etc.) It's right on Broadway, has all the stuff you expect from a big hotel (baggage storage, airport shuttle calls there, good restaurant, good breakfast, good bar), I thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

This is the 2nd time I’ve stayed at this hotel. Location is fantastic you literally couldn’t be any closer to Times Square. It was my mums 60th and when we checked in Evelyn in front desk was amazing. She gave us a room with a view. Complimentary breakfast buffet vouchers and even there in a couple of drinks. She was fantastic and really helpful so thanks to her again for going above and beyond. I’ll be back again later in the year

We had stayed in this hotel 18 moths ago and it was great so decided to return as it was a special occasion -ie my 60th birthday.The location is spot on and could not be better as you are actually in Times Square and can easily walk to the Rockerfeller centre and Empire State Buildings.Our stay was spoiled however by the the fact that our 1st allocated room stunk of cigarette smoke coming from a grill in the bathroom-this is a non-smoking hotel of course-I complained twice before we were moved to another room and given 2 complimentary breakfasts which was fine.The room we were moved was not fine as it was an adjoining room and the people opposite seemed to spend their time screaming and playing loud music as well as coming in at 3am.I complained once more and insisted we be moved. Following an afternoon out we returned to the hotel to be told we had been allocated another room-I checked it and found it to be ANOTHER adjoining room !!! -Hope you are keeping up with this-we were now 3 days into a 5 day holiday.The final room (4th one) on yet another floor was fine and we had 2 good nights sleep there.The staff were very polite and helpful and there was no quibbles but I would have liked an explanation as to why fag smoke was present in the 1st room and precisely why we as a couple should be allocated an adjoining room with strangers on 2 occasions-this is certainly not how it works in other hotels I have stayed (and worked) in.

Well what can you say about this place? It's big, bright, busy and exactly how I've seen it on tv!Visited it through the day and at night. At night don't be surprised if you need your sunglasses, as the screens are big and bright!Also be aware that it's not an actual square, more like a stretched triangle over 3 streets!If you are in the area and have time, try and catch a Broadway show?

The location and accommodations were great, but I was hit with so-called "resort fees" at the end of my stay, which I was not aware of when I booked this hotel on Booking.com via Southwest Airlines.I will not stay here again because when it costs more than 400 bucks a night to stay there is no need for added b/s resort fees. I am so angry about this hidden scam and I will never fall for it ever again.

The hotel is clean and neat, great location, very friendly staff, actually the staff was simply AMAZING!!! I was told about the $30/day extra room charge upon making the reservation but the WIFI was spotty and we were suppose to get bottled water everyday. It was in the room upon check in but it was never replaced. So all in all I'm still not sure why I had to pay the extra $30/day. You don't get anything for it other then the felling of being ripped off.

I had the extreme pleasure of staying at this outstanding hotel and the staff was second to none I have ever experienced in all of my travels. From the moment I checked in, Thanks to Edith, I had the best and most outstanding experience I have ever had while traveling for business. Eidth is an absolute asset to the Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan. She treated me with a since of kindness I have not ever experienced and will probably not ever experience again in my travels. I would ABSOLUTELY recommend this hotel over any other hotel in Times Square! Thank you Edith for an amazing NYC experience. You and your staff are AMAZING. I will be back to visit soon.

This is the only place I stay, it is in a great location, has a great staff which is very accommodating. For New York the rooms are a good size and are very comfortable and comparatively priced. It is very close to all Broadway shows.

Great location for tourists, situated on Broadway a few yards from Times Square. The Lobby area is very good; the receptionist checking us in was very helpful and efficient, and the bar/lounge area is very smart and serves a wide range of very good food, from soups and sandwiches to entrees. The bistro was closed for dinner, open for breakfast though we didn't use it - lots of decent, cheaper diners nearby. Our room was sizeable, a nice corner window though facing the back towards the river. The only downside was the décor was a little tired, with threadbare blankets, a worn headboard and definitely failed the 'fluffy towel' test - bath towels were undersized and pretty thin. Time for replacement methinks.Otherwise no problems and can recommend this hotel for a few days' stay.

We heading into city to grab some dinner and drinks and started at Crowne Plaza to plan where we would go next, the service, especially the bar tender Jason was amazing that we ended up staying there all night! The food was great with a lot of nice choices, reasonably priced and the bar atmosphere was also really good. Can’t say enough about how we were treated by Jason thank you will definitely be back !

When you're staying in the city, you expect to be taken for a ride. Especially if you insist on staying right in the middle of Times Square. So you pays your money and you takes your chances. This hotel has great location. And for the city, location is everything. I wouldn't stay here though, if you are on vacation. Because this is not a place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the city. It works better for business, because you can get in and out efficiently, and they are (presumably) close to where you need to be.

Excellent facility..Expense is worth it for the luxury..location and great view from room. Plus services and courteous staff, right from bell hop to reception to room service are just great. Room amenities are excellent

This is my 2nd stay and I love this place! It’s clean, has an amazing gym, the staff is friendly and check in is easy. You can’t be more central in Times Square. Close to subway lines, Broadway shows and all the lights of Times Square.

My husband and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square for a long weekend in Dec 2017. The Crowne Plaza is in an amazing location – right in the middle of everything in Times Square. This is our second time staying at this wonderful hotel. What brought us back to the Crowne Plaza is the exceptional service we received in the hotel restaurant and bar area. Karim Sharif, the food and beverage manager, was extremely helpful and accommodating. Jason behind the bar provided exceptional service, along with the lovely servers. I have to say the half-chicken in the bar area was AMAZING. We ate it 2 nights in a row because it was so good. We also had the breakfast buffet at Brasserie 1605 each morning, and received exceptional service from the friendly staff there. We also took advantage of the NY Sports Club gym during our stay. Our room had a lovely view of the Hudson River. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again on our next trip to NYC.

This substandard hotel is in a great location directly at the hub of Times Square which is an easy walk to Rockefeller Center, 5th Ave Shopping, Jewelry row, and many great restaurants. Unfortunately, the property itself is not well maintained and my room was, well filthy. The front desk staff is argumentative and surly which I might even tolerate at a First-in-class property but pretentious in a chain hotel that cannot get even the basics right is laughable. It’s just too bad that this hotel takes up such a great location that only leads to disappointment. Fortunately, my dear fellow travelers, there are so many other truly great hotels nearby. I’d recommend you pass on the Crown Plaza.
user_name:
ipurchaseonline
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I paid $40 for a buffet breakfast yet I was told I could not have two fried eggs. Fried eggs are the essential part of a New York breakfast yet I was told that the only egg available would be scrambled egg. That wouldn’t have been a problemIf the scrambled egg had been hot and fresh but it was only lukewarm in temperature and looked very sorry for itself in a ban marie where it was looking very unpalatable not having been livened up, I’d say, for about an hour. The waiter’s main interest appeared to be wanting to get the bill settled as soon as possible, having presented it to me a few minutes after I sat down, before I had even barely started to eat. Most disappointing; the New York Sheraton just a few blocks away offers a far superior buffet breakfast at a similar price and the attitudes and flexibility there are far superior to the Crowne Plaza’s at best mediocre offering. Moreover, the place wasn’t even busy yet it took the staff such a long time to clear and tidy up tables which had been vacated, as can be seen from my photos. And by the way, for the bread to come out as toast in the Crowne Plaza, one has to waste time passing it through the toaster about 5 times.

..celebrated our first wedding anniversary..I requested for a city view and to my surprise they upgraded our room into a suit!!..front desk staffs were awesome, so approachable and given us a warm welcome..kudos to the receptionist.

I have had cause to come to New York every month for the past year with my trips varying from 2-14 days. This is now my 10th visit to this hotel and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.I am not a huge fan of Times Square and the hotel can get very busy (hence outside and in the lobby) it can get quite noisy. I read another recent review where it was mentioned that the cleaning staff are noisy. They might let doors slam but other than that (and mind you not until later morning) I have not encountered noise from the cleaners. I find them to be extremely courteous.What keeps me returning here is the staff from EVERY level of the hotel. I have traveled for years for business in very highly rated rated (5 star) hotels and have NEVER encountered such a team of helpful, courteous, caring hotel staff.I want to mention several people by name as it seems the least one can do... In management, I'd like to mention Agathe (who has gone well beyond the call of duty on multiple occasions), Karim, Allison, Amanda, AJ.At the front desk (I can't possibly mention everyone so here goes) Donald and Imran - who have helped me so much with reservation issues (and everything else) Vera, Sandra, Robert (from the night shift).The restaurant and breakfast food is very good, particularly for a hotel this size. Joanie, Tony, Richie, Jafete, Travis, Filipe have all been absolutely marvelous. Considering the amount of persons they have to deal with daily, I am stunned by their professionalism and kindness.There is a wonderful quick food/coffee counter called the Grab and Go where you can get a quick take away breakfast, lunch, snacks coffee and drinks. There you can find Guillermo and Rahi (amongst others).At the bell desk, they will help you with anything and are happy to do so! Those that come to mind are Michael, Marvin, Abraham and Manuel.The security team is second to none. Traveling on my own, most of the time and sometimes at odd hours, I feel entirely safe here. They know what they are doing and are approachable. As you can imagine, you can have outsiders and some guests who go "a bit too far" but the security team treats everyone with respect. Very impressive...those that come to mind right now are : Sokoli, Marlin, Tyrone, Havier, Juan and Spencer.I have had occasion to have contact with Dorca from the cleaning staff and she is very thorough and courteous!Finally, I must mention the doormen downstairs...Joshua (Josh) has been helpful on so many levels. In addition, there is Junior, Sam and Eugene (to mention just a few).I realize that these names will mean little to someone reading a review but I wanted to review some exceptional staff members who have made the difference for me.Everyone needs to choose what they consider important in their choice of hotels. The rooms can be a little worn down in places but they are absolutely fine. The views are magnificent, there is a great gym and pool, loads of fast elevators and folks here will help you with anything. There are all kinds of restaurants right outside the door from take away to lovely quaint sit-downs.I whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza some 18 years ago on our first trip to NYC. On returning for the fifth time we decided to stay there again as its' location is superb. We tried to book adjoining rooms (which they do have) as we were travelling with our two young boys. We were told that we could not reserve adjoining rooms but they had a family room which we booked. The room is no larger than any other and simply has two small double beds crammed in as opposed to the king size normally used. The room was very dated and had paper peeling off in the bathroom, the light switch was fitted incorrectly leaving a gap at the top to the hole in the wall and the shower tap was lose and at an angle. The furniture was shabby and the bottom clothes drawer fell out when opened as it had detached from its runners, we reported it on day one, still broken after 4 days when we left. The staff were generally helpful and the restaurant / bar food was very acceptable if needed. Overall the service outside of the room was quite good but the accommodation was terrible and in desperate need of refurbishment.

I'm not sure how I feel about this hotel. It's close to Times Square and the Theater District and the room and bathroom were a good size. But something just seemed 'off' to me. Everything just seemed a little worn. The housekeepers were noisy. The TV wouldn't work because of the storm. There wasn't even a bottle of water in the room, despite the amenity fee. I had a really good stay at a nearby hotel last month; perhaps I'm comparing this one unfairly.

From the moment we set foot on the property to the moment of our departure it was an Excellent experience. The Valet that stored our bags for our room check in to Victoria at the front desk ( She was unbelievably accommodating, and super professional ). The Lounge and wait staff were top notch. Breakfast and the staff were great. When we have the opportunity to return we'll be staying again! Not to mention the concerge was fantastic!

The hotel has great location, right in the center Times Square. The rooms and washrooms are decently big size considering its New York.Now coming to the front office reception. The entrance to the hotel is dark and dingy with black curtains on the ground floor. The reception is on the 1st floor oddly located behind some columns. It's one of the most indifferent front offices that I have seen. The staff doesn't show any interest in their customers.Would I visit again - maybe simply for its convenient location.

I travel rather frequently in Asia but rarely to the US, so my expectations are different and my opinion below are based on my experiences with hotels in Asia. At the same time, the price of the Crowne Plaza Times Square hotel is easily 2-3 times that of a great hotel in SE Asia.1) The location (right next to times square) was great.2) There was no slippers, toothbrush or toothpaste provided in the rooms. Nor was there any means to boil water - how to make tea then? (this is probably standard for US hotels as I've heard).3) In general the room felt clean but the ceiling was low, which made the room feel smaller than it is.4) The bed was too soft and the mattress was probably due for replacement?5) There were only US sockets and no adapters can be borrowed - although the front desk would gladly sell you one.6) There was an inexplicable per-night service charge in addition to my pre-paid room rates. Considering that not much service was rendered I do wonder how that could be justified. Again, this may be common for US hotels in recent years, as I've heard.7) I stayed for 2 nights so my room was cleaned once during my stay. In Asian hotels, the staff would neatly fold your clothes into a nice pile, tidy up your laundry and cables etc and make the room look good. Here my pile of clothes (which was on my bed when I left the room) was moved "as-is" to the sofa. How's that for service?8) There is no central control for lighting in the room - something which I thought was standard for all modern hotels. Each and every light need to be switched on - off individually.I do admit that I've been spoiled by the hotels in SE Asia, where the staff are always smiling, friendly and welcoming, where there is extreme attention to detail to make your room look and feel good, where amenities are provided whether you use it or not. Here, however, the staff wishes to dispatch of you as soon as they can and although I appreciated the efficiency, the hotel did not make me feel welcomed.And then again, there was the service charge on top of the non-cheap room rate, plus taxes.

The rooms aren’t large, bathroom was tiny, but we didn’t care, when in nyc you go out... we were on 32nd floor with Times Square view, probably would pay for upgrade again didn’t really spend time to appreciate it. But our room was quiet, pretty clean, bathroom could use an update. But over all this was a great place and I will return.

I've stayed in a couple other hotels on Times Square before in New York and this is by far my favorite. It's in a perfect location. The staff is very professional and welcoming. And the room is spacious, clean, and comfortable. I will definitely be returning.

My husband and I visit the hotel numerous times throughout the year and would not stay anywhere else. From the moment you walk in, you are greeted and made to feel welcome and at home. It is very obvious that Mr. Harris leads his management team and staff by example. The staff are always very approachable, professional, and friendly. The team genuinely cares about your stay.   The chef for the breakfast buffet does a great job and offers many items to choose from. The food is delicious, coffee is hot, and the servers are awesome! Everyone has a smile on their face and goes above and beyond to make sure you have everything you need. The Food and Beverage Manager's, Karim, Agathe, and James are always on hand to help. They readily seat, greet and clean tables if needed. They are friendly and always stop by the tables to make sure all is well. The same goes for the lounge. I can’t say enough about the food and beverage team. Jason makes the best drinks in Times Square! Marteen is awesome! Tony is always smiling, Phil, Keith, Kim and Marcus also do an amazing job behind the bar and the food is good!   Isis and Daniel do an awesome job with housekeeping. The rooms are very roomy and always clean. The top of the line beds are so comfy and the pillows are my favorite, I love them! (Thanks to Sylvia's help I was actually able to buy them for my bed at home!) It's very important to not only have a comfortable room, but that you feel safe while there. The security team led by Al, is always on watch by the elevators. Whether I'm traveling with a friend or my husband I always feel safe here.    Every year my husband and I celebrate our wedding anniversary in New York City, this year was our 30th! The staff made us feel very special and our day did not go unnoticed. They even gave us a sweet card that everyone signed! We could not thank Karim enough for the thoughtful amenities we received. From the cheese tray, wine, champagne, and desserts. ( the yummy chocolate covered strawberries!)  He is great at what he does, and it is obvious he enjoys his job. Karim is a true professional while being caring and kind. The Crowne Plaza at Times Square is by far the best!

Evelyn at the front desk was amazing! Super welcoming, friendly, and very helpful. Hotel overall has a great location if you want to be in the thick of things, and room decently sized, especially for NY. Only drawback is definite worn and aging furniture in room, and dirty (varnish wearing off, but actually had sticky smutz on it) desk.

As other reviews have noted, this hotel is right in the middle of Manhattan and, depending on what you want to do, the location is great. The R subway (and others) is very near, Juniors diner is even closer and great for breakfast, there are superb restaurants within walking distance.We stayed for five nights on the 36th floor. The views were spectacular! Our rooms (we had two) were very quiet, clean, well furnished and well equipped and very comfortable. As always, Crowne Plaza staff were efficient, friendly, helpful and very quick to sort out problems. We had a problem with the heating in our room and it was resolved very quickly (a portable heater!). This is obviously a popular and busy hotel and there are signs of wear and tear; which is really all that you could expect!The hotel has just about everything needed. It is at the heart of Manhattan and therefore you couldn't expect it to be cheap but it probably represents very reasonable value for money given the quality of accommodation and service. We ate breakfast at Juniors (on the opposite side of the street) on all but one day. Breakfast in this hotel is eye-wateringly expensive and nothing special in quality. We didn't try the restaurant for our evening meals; there are too many outstanding restaurants very near. There are more plush and more expensive hotels in the area; this one however is reasonable value and a good base for exploring New York.

Stayed four nights for a city break and this hotel was well priced in an Expedia flight/hotel combo. The location is fabulous, just moments away from many theatres. Check in was quick and efficient.Our room was on the 32nd floor, with no view. It was billed as "city view" but I would say that is misleading. The view was of an office block. The lift is very efficient and there is a useful ice machine on the floor.The room itself was very nice and very clean, and a very good size. Excellent large bed, beautiful linen, very comfortable. Very happy with the bathroom; modern fittings, good towels, plentiful toiletries. Great TV.There is no fridge or mini bar. And no kettle. There is a coffee machine which I did not try to use. The wifi was very efficient. The reason I won't stay here again is the temperature of the room. The outside temperature was 10/11. Room temp 26! Called an engineer; he said air con would not work if outside temperature was less than 15. He did bring a fan, but still the temperature did not drop below 22 even with the window open and the fan on full. We were sweltering and very uncomfortable. A real shame, because that's a deal breaker for me.Check out was quick and efficient, and our bags were kept, no problem, as we had a late flight.

We stayed in this hotel in January while attending BroadwayCon. It was the recommended hotel, and we had a great experience. Very convenient, Times Square location, but surprisingly a little quieter than other hotels in this area. Great value, very comfortable beds. Friendly staff. We used the business center. It was small, but easy to use. We would stay here again!

We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel spans the block of 48th and 49th Street on Broadway. It is in a very convenience location at the North edge of Times Square, right across from M&M. The subway Red Line is at 50th St on Broadway. Yellow Line is at 49th St a few steps East of Broadway. Blue Line is at 8th Ave and 50th St. As for the Red Line 1, 2, 3 to go South (e.g. Penn Station), you have to go down to the station on West side of Broadway, to go North, take the station on East side of Broadway as there is no crossing over once you are down there. Note that a street block here is around 200ft. There is no grand entrance so you have to look up to the sky to find the hotel. The lobby is on the second floor. It is within walking distance to most attractions (the Rock, Central Park, Times Square, etc). The hotel is nice and clean. The room is quite a good size for NYC. It has a TV. There is coffee making tray hidden behind the cabinet doors along with a safe. The room has a desk, table, and chaise. The bathroom has a large glass door shower type. Toiletry, hairdryer are provided. There is a small closet with two luggage racks, iron and board. Plenty of outlets and UBS plugs are found around the room. There is an input panel for the TV on the side of the dresser that accepts RBG, HDMI, etc connections to hook up laptop to the TV. The health club is on the 15th floor that the local goes there. Admission is included in the $35 hotel fee. The hotel has a bar, restaurant, and coffee shop. The coffee shop opens with limited hour (close at 7PM). We try the buffalo wing at the bar restaurant and it was good. We got there around 12:30 pm and were allowed to check in. It is a decent and convenience place to stay in Time Square.

this hotel is awesome because of its location and price.You just o down stairs and times square is a hop, skip and a jump away.i enjoyed my rest and sleep. the staff were friendly, professional and hospitable

Coming to NY City 2-3 times a year.Stayed at several Manhattan hotels.Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is the Best!!!Top Front Office service (Amanda the QUEEN!!!)Very very very clean!!!Super GREAT new Buffet Breakfast!!! All around personal professional and very very kind service!!!What a great city view!!!Please continue AS IS!!!

Great hotel in the heart of Times Square, handy for everything, big comfy rooms with a great view of Times Square. Hotel staff very helpful and knowledgeable. Good concierge who can book anything for you. Would stay again next time in NY.

I travelled to New York as part of a large group in December 2017. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for 4 nights and I would recommend the hotel. Location is fantastic and the room that I stayed in (can't remember which number!) had wonderful views of Times Square, right down Broadway.Lots of great places to eat nearby and a short walk to the main shopping areas eg Macy's, Fifth Avenue.I would definitely stay at this hotel again based on my previous experience.

I attended a conference here and was horrified by the conditions of this place. Carpets and bathrooms were ancient. Even the tables and chairs were old. Staff was incompetent. Several colleagues made the mistake of staying in the hotel and had similar feedback about the rooms. Time for a major overhaul.

Poor service, not proper for Crowne Plaza. The staff is super unfriendly! especially at the lobby bar and at the coffee house !! so unpleasant staff that you feel they are doing you a favor for your own payment! Also at the reception - the staff is “not service oriented” if you know what I mean. The staff is tiered and looks like do not want to work, so why not to replace the bidder employees - they are making guest stay very unpleasant.The Hotel is too crowded and feel like central station inside. Apart from that, the rooms are clean and big, although a little old and need some renovation.I would not recommend this Hotel and will not come back, for such value you can find a Hotel with qualified service and pleasant stay!! Which is a huge deal.

We stayed at this hotel on a recent trip for a doctors appointment. We ended up coming a day early for the snow and since I used my IHG yearly free room for one night, and points for the second night I had two reservations. Since we trying to beat snow, we were able to get it worked out once we got there. They actually upgrade our room to one with a view of time square. Service was really good.Where this hotel lost points, is the room had some wear. It wasn't horrible but some things needed fixed, cleaned, replaced, etc. As far the dining, this hotel was really lacking. The breakfast was a typical overpriced buffet. You are better off going somewhere within walking distance, but it was snowing and slippery so we just ate there. We got room service one night, while my wife said her chicken quesadilla was the best she ever had, my pasta was absolutely horrible. First the room service did not arrive like I would have expected. It came like a cheap take out restaurant in cardboard boxes and plastic ware.serrvice in a plastic bag (not even a tray). Second, my pasta was dry with saice like plain ragu, a few nickel sized meatballs, and strands of shredded cheese I could have counted. The bread was a stale breakstick, about a quarter of the size of one you get at olive garden. Bottom line, stay at the hotel, just don't eat the food.

I arrived 25 February for 10 nights, and my favorite room on the 44th Floor was waiting for me in perfect order. I unpacked, and after 24 hours of flying and lay-overs, being exhausted, I stretched-out on my oh-so-comfortable, king size bed, and in a flash I was sound asleep. When I awakened, I ordered from Room Service a cheeseburger rare with french fries. And since the guest soft drinks and ice machines room was just a short distance from my room, I decided to purchase my Coke Zero with my dinner from there, because you get a larger bottle and for less. Super. Home, again.

I needed a last minute booking for mom, sister, niece and nephews visiting NYC Easter weekend. Too many people for my small NYC APT lol! Called Crowne Plaza at 2pm and got a last minute booking for that evening 6pm! Very accommodating, very clean, and great location. Nice hotel lobby/restaurant/bar (try the molten chocolate cake), swimming pool and gym available to hotel guests. Can't beat the Times Square location.

My friend and I stayed in a corner room on the 40th floor of the Crowne Plaza Times Square. Yes, it was a bit more expensive than we might have reserved in the past but the room was spacious, spotless, quiet and well appointed. . . AND the views from two sides were very impressive. In addition all of the staff were very friendly and guest-focused. In addition, the reservation policy would have enabled us to cancel the reservation up to about 4 days in advance without penalty... a feature less and less available in mid-town.
user_name:
Jean T
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This hotel does not care about their guests. They are so complacent because they are in Times Square. Go get a lovely hotel out of the TS and you’ll have a much better experience. We checked out after 2 nights (we’re staying 9) because it’s so awful. Rooms are so tired, air con doesn’t work properly, handles on windows broken, paintwork peeling! Asked for an engineer to come to the room to look at AC, they never came. Asked for bigger towels, they never came. Breakfast ok but waiters literally threw the coffee in The cups so it spilled everywhere, plates not cleared. Considering we were paying over £4000 to stay here it is totally unacceptable. We were offered a better room but tbh the damage was done. We checked out having stayed 2 nights and they took one night off for the hassle. So in summary everything is walking distance or an Uber away so spend your money wisely and stay Elsewhere!

This hotel has a great location. Located in the centre of Times Square it is within walking distance of Times Square, Central Park, Rockefeller, Empire State, grand central and the fashion district. We took a shuttle from EWR which took around an hour. We stayed in room 4618 which was a king with a view. We received complimentary upgrade upon check in. I personally would feel disappointed had we have paid extra for this room as the room was very small without extra amenities like a fridge. The room did come with two robes. Hairdryer and iron. We were on the top floor with a view out of the back of the hotel. The breakfast was $32 per person which was not included.

Overall, the hotel was a great experience. All of the staff (front desk, concierge service, and bar manager) were very friendly and helpful to us & our needs for our 3-night stay. Kudos to the concierge team!! They were totally awesome and helped us with several things that we were interested in seeing in the Big Apple!! (ask this a lot, whether the concierge or out in Time Square: “what/where do locals go?!?! You’ll find places that tourists just don’t!!) One evening we were passed by in the hotel bar lounge but spoke to a manager and he more than made it up to us! (wish I could remember his name). If you’re hungry when you first check in, jump across the street to Hurleys Irish pub for some excellent Irish-“Americanized” food!! Cons:* Toilet paper was like sandpaper * A curtain handle was missing* Shower curtain: water leaks through* Washcloths and coffee we’re not restocked on the 2nd day

Had a fab stay here, in a room overlooking Times Square up on the 32nd floor. The reception team staff were amazing also, as we stayed for my wife’s 50th birthday from the U.K., and wanted it to be extra special.The location is perfect for Midtown attractions, and Central Park. Only a few blocks away are Rockefeller Centre, St Patrick’s Cathedral, Central Park, Empire State Building...plus you are right there in the hustle and bustle of Times Square. You are also close to 50th street subway, which can link over to Penn station.

This is our 2nd time in New York but first time here in Crowne Plaza.. We stayed here from March24-25, March26-29. Were checking out tomorrow. From the time of our arrival, the front desk is not accomodating, and very slow service in check in process to think that theres no one checking in but us. We have to check out on the 25th because we have an overnight tour at niagara falls but we have a reservtion which is already paid on the 26th to 29th. We then asked the front desk if theres a way we can just leave our luggage since we will be back on the ff day, they told us that they cannot help us but refer us to a luggage storage which billed us almost $150. We are accredited in Crowne Plaza and have stayed a lot of times in Philippines, but the Crowne plaza here in timesquare is the worst. One more thing, im sure this hotel caters mostly tourist, but how come they dont have weighing scale in this hotel for their client use. We also have ro ask for bottled water everyday, these are not automatically given in the room.

We had a great time at this hotel, mostly due to the absolutely fantastic location. The hotel itself is a little bit dated. There is a significant and mandatory surcharge for the use of the gym, located in the hotel. Also, the hotel charges to provide a fridge, which seemed a bit odd to us. The price of the hotel was, however, very reasonable, so all in all I can recommend staying at this hotel.

Seriously the best location! What a great view we had. It was clean and the staff was super friendly. I would love to go back! Bar was also a great little environment too.. pricy drinks but then again it’s time square so what do you expect.

We stayed for one night after seeing a show at The Belasco Theater, which was just a ten minute walk from the hotel. This property’s location to multiple theaters makes it ideal. The center of Times Square is steps away.We were impressed immediately at check in, where we received impeccable service from Evelyn who had a very pleasant demeanor. Due to us being IHG Platinum members we received an upgrade which was much appreciated.I requested a late check out from Imran who gave it to me. He was also very pleasant.There is a coffee bar which sells pastries so it’s good for a quick breakfast. We did not use the restaurant on site.We would return here if in the city again due to the staff.

We stayed here for 3 nights in room 2103 with a beautiful view of Times Square and the staff were all friendly. The hotel was either dated or needs repair but I'm not sure which applies most. Maybe both. For the price we paid I was expecting a lot better. Trip Advisor only lets me post 10 photos but I could give more than that. The TV was extremely slow in responding to the remote, one bathroom light was out and the shower light was very dim, we had to hold the toilet handle down to make it flush properly, the bathroom vent was bent and filthy, the bathroom counter had an unknown stain on it that looked like rust, a cabinet handle was broken with the cabinet door also loose, no mini fridge available, the desk chair was clearly worn and so was the padding on the headboard. One morning we put the do not disturb sign on the door because we were choosing to sleep in and relax and housekeeping called us to ask what time we wanted our room cleaned. It was a nice gesture and we agreed to 1pm, but I thought the sign meant we were fine for the day? Either way, this hotel needs some updating, especially for the price they charge.

directly on Times Square, the location is one of the best,as a platinum elite member, i got a free room upgrade and complimentary drinks. the staff is very professional and helpful, breakfast was ok.beds were comfortable and room of good size,i would recommend this hotel

It takes time to check in and out of this hotel. I think more staff at the reception would help. But the restaurant staff are extra friendly and were willing to take time out to talk to me as they served food. The location close to Times square is a huge plus! The views from the room is not legendary but you get the typical NY feel.

Yes, it's in Times Square in the heart of Manhattan, and very conveniently located to many, many attractions, but it is far too overpriced for what you get. Yes, the rooms are clean and comfortable (the bed was great!), but there is nothing -- NOTHING -- that warrants the $650+ price tag that the room comes with! I do think that they were price gouging because there was a snowstorm that was threatening to blanket the city and the public transportation system was rumored to be shutting down because of the storm. (The storm turned out to be a big zero, BTW.) The biggest thing that upset me the most about this hotel is VERY THIN WALLS. I could hear the entire conversation of the people in the next room as if they were sitting in my room, talking directly to me. The sound wasn't muffled; it was as clear as day. Thankfully, they knocked off for the night around 11:30 so I was able to sleep, but if they hadn't, my night would have been very disturbed. On top of the thin walls, the thermostat in the room was not working properly and it was too warm. I was eager to check out, and was relieved when I did.
user_name:
Sooz I
Briarcliff Manor, New York

review_body: I was there for one night for work. Room was comfortable. Bathroom was nice. Internet was good quality. few too many floors for my taste. The checkin line was a bit too long. Breakfast is a bit pricey. But, on balance quite nice.

Best Times Square hotel! Nicest staff throughout hotel, clean and updated rooms, excellent location! Special shout out to “ANA” from breakfast food area who went OVER and ABOVE to accommodate my special needs daughter. The customer service at this hotel in general is excellent - front desk manager was also terrific!! I would return anytime!!!

A friend and I stayed here for a Broadway theatre trip and enjoyed it very much! 48th/Broadway near TKTS/M&M World, but you don't feel hectic. Easy walk to Rockefeller Center and MOMA (5-6 blocks). Top rate service from front desk, housekeeping/maintenance (I had many requests). Excellent breakfast buffet and wait staff at hotel restaurant. The Grind coffee shop also excellent food. Only issue was heating/AC system. Not able to adjust heat, but staff brought in a fan, which helped a lot. Several elevators for different levels so no long wait. Definitely, would return again.

Nice hotel and the location is absolutely fabulous. The staff was courteous and helpful. The concierge were exceptionally helpful with recommendations of restaurants, directions and other points of interest. We were able to walk to our chosen restaurants, shows and attractions. We found every single employee of Crowne Plaza to be warm, friendly and exceptionally efficient. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to everyone want to stay close to Times Square NY.

To be more accurate, the 4 nights were 2 recent stays, one in March, the other in January.  For the record, we are also priority club members - so that comes with certain benefits, such as free internet, discounted breakfast, and late checkout among others.There are lots of hotels in NYC and in Times Square, so there are lots of choices.  For us, coming in for the theater - this is the perfect hotel.  It's very convenient and well located.  Literally, out the door you are in the heart of the theater district.  If you are seeing Springsteen or Bronx Tale, you can literally walk out of the hotel - through the covered driveway and be at the theater in less than 5 minute. They are on the same street.  Other theaters are also relatively close.  This is really amazing, especially in the winter months -  but would be nice anytime of year, especially if the theater is your reason for travelFor a hotel of this size, we never had a wait for the elevators, our room was very spacious and the buffet breakfast was excellent - and with the discount, affordable.  We also had rooms on high floors, which was nice - but honestly, when you are in NYC you are going to be out most of the day - so having a nice view is a bonus if you have time to look out the window.  Everyone at the front desk was friendly, our check in was quick and our room was ready early.As for the neighborhood and restaurants, avoid "the touristy" spots in and around Times Square - unless you like that sort of thing.  You'd be better off heading to 8th Avenue or 9th for more variety - or other areas.   We will definitely be back at the Crown Plaza

We came to NYC especially to see the Ball Drop on New Year’s Eve as part of our wedding anniversary, and we choose the Crowne Plaza at Times Square in Manhattan……And we were not disappointed. Not at all!!We were there for NYE 2017, and did the Ball Drop package that they have on offer to purchase, which started off at 7.30pm with as much food (Massive choice from the Buffet) and drinks (Cocktails, Wines, Spirits as well as non-alcoholic), you could want, followed with a DJ, and then at 11.30pm, you are encouraged to go outside to watch the ball drop in a private fenced off area in Times Square, not public allowed in there, just people all form your function that night. The view was perfect of the Ball drop. Then it was back into the hotel to party on to the small hours of New Years Day.We had a small problem initially which I will cover later, but the whole experience of the hotel was fantastic. The food quality in the restaurant was outstanding, complete with the friendliest service you will get anywhere from the restaurant manager, who frequently came over to the guests tables to check on everything. I am a bit of a coffee snob, and only drink the Australian/European style coffee, and can’t stomach the filter stuff usually passed off as coffee in the USA, so I was pleasantly surprised that when I asked if they had any real coffee, I was met with ‘would I like a latte or espresso’? And the coffee was fantastic. Admittingly, it was not included in the buffet, but $3.50 extra, which is nothing to pay to have a decent coffee to start the day off with.Housekeeping was also faultless too. This hotel is sooo conveniently located to Times Square, it is so convenient. You walk out, and you have the ticket booth at the top of the square a few hundred feet away at the most, and also the shops etc. of the square at your fingertips. The last time I can to NYC and stay at Times Square, I stayed at the W which was fantastic too, (a totally different styled hotel), but it was nearly 3 times more expensive for the same location! – Hands down, this hotel is the best value for money you will get within Times Square’s precinct. Now, the small problem we had, which was no fault of this hotel, but their reservations center, based miles away in another state.We initially book the hotel room via their reservations centre, which unknown to us at the time, was based in Utah and not at the hotel. So when we saw of the hotel’s website a room titled “Times Square View”, we thought perfect that we book that as we could watch the Ball Drop from our room requested. We confirmed this with the lady at the reservations centre that this is the case.Well, we received an email a week or so later, telling us that this is not the case and that there is no view in the whole hotel that offers the Ball Drop view, just a view of times Square.Obviously we were upset and angry at this, and complained directly to the hotel. Then in steps Varary Henry, an angel. She realises that there was a big miscommunication and that the fault lied with the reservations centre, and offered suggestions and remedies to fix this problem to make our stay enjoyable and unforgettable. That she did. Valary didn’t just stop at making things perfect before we got there, but also whilst there, she gave us a courtesy phone call to make sure our stay was going well too.Brilliant service. Valary should be held in high esteem by management – Staff like this, who are loyal and passionate about the brand and company, are very, very had to find.

Very disappointed with this hotel, especially when the price tag was 370 usd for a standard room. The room was old, wood veneer coming off the bathroom cupboard, window not being able to be closed, light next to bed not working (I assume the bulb had blown). Limited toiletries (no cotton tips, toothbrush). The bed was saggy from overuse. Booking the room via the phone was arduous. Took 7 phone-calls just to amend the reservation. Staff were not trained, twice the phone “cut off” and hold times were too long.

Very clean, very comfortable. Although very, very busy. Some people go to NYC for just that tho - the hustle and bustle. There's an amazing Deli - Carnegie bit further up towards Columbus Circle - found myself there more than a few times.

The room had a great view of Broadway theatre district, right in the heart of Manhattan, lot of restaurants, lot of stores, lots of shopping. The Bar was great, complimentary 2 free dranks . Room service was great also.

Greeted by a friendly staff, this clean, comfortable hotel is highly recommendable. Right in the heart of the theatre district, we could walk almost everywhere. I have already suggested my extended family book here when they visit.

Very nice central location especially if you want to spend some time in Times Square. We will definitely stay here again. The young lady, Victoria, that checked us in was amazing. Great personality and quite funny. Had fun chatting with her while she promptly got me checked in.

Easy access to hotel. Very clean and right in the middle of all that Time Square has to offer in restaurants and all of the plays in 5-10 minutes of a walk. Very nice area. Lots of sights to see great view of the Hudson from the room

I was only here for one night because I needed a place to crash, knowing I had to work very early the next morning in Manhattan. I booked through Hotels.com and a lot of times I feel like hospitality staff treats you differently if you book through a 3rd party. However, this was not the case here. The customer service was second to none. Check in was smooth. The young woman who helped me was courteous and polite. She was knowledgeable, clearly explaining the hotel’s facility fee and even gave me vouchers for a complimentary glass of wine. My room was spacious, clean, and comfortable with a beautiful view of Times Square from the 36th floor. It is conveniently located as well. I’ll definitely book here in the future.
user_name:
AlishaConcreteRose
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for one night while seeing a show. The location is right in Times Square, which is great for walking to the theater, and not too far to walk out of Times Square to look for restaurants, etc. The hotel has a large gym and nice staff (they gave us a late checkout and were prompt about bag storage and valet parking retrieval). The room was inexpensive but pretty basic, especially the bathroom. The coffee I bought at the coffee shop was barely warm at all. Overall it was a bit disappointing. We had stayed here before and had memories of it being more comfortable.

Whenever we come to the city we stay here. Sometimes the cost is high but if you book it on the right night you can get a decent lower rate or use points. The room was fabulous. They upgraded us so we had a nice view of Times Square. The only issue I have with that is that it was a handicap room so there was not a lot of space to put anything. Like a shelf would have been nice in the bathroom. But it was very clean. The front desk service was impeccable. Freddy was amazing and very helpful when we came down asking questions about the check-in that we had done earlier in the day and we did not receive some of the things we normally do when we come here as IHG members from another front desk person.At the bar Jason and Martin and Phillip were fantastic as well. The server Japheth was also so helpful for my friend who can be picky. sometimes. Lol. Even the custodian in the bathroom was polite and helpful. The only issue I had is that we were using using an anniversary night and we had to use our anniversary night on Friday night where the rates for as low as $99. Saturday night we paid cash which was extremely expensive. We asked if we could swap the night out of course they wouldn't let us but we still enjoyed our stay.

Last year my family and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Hotel as we celebrated my Birthday in New York City. We had an incredible experience courtesy of MD Niles Harris, his exec Sylvia Geronimo and several other staff members we thanked in my review .This year, even with the weather anticipated to be blustery and cold, my family wanted to celebrate again and requested the Crowne Plaza. Last year was awesome and I had no idea that MD Niles Harris, Sylvia and his staff would once again remind me why this Hotel is so special in its treatment of guests, not just Platinum Elites (and a shareholder) like myself!!!Sylvia worked tirelessly to have all of the room requests met even though it was a sold out weekend, and accommodating adjoining rooms in 1 request. The front office managers on duty were great to have at check-in/out and taking care of other requests (Pablo Pozo, Amanda Nelson and Juliet Chang among others). F&B James Indiviglio arranged for nice goodies to all our guests and a spectacular Birthday cake for the evening celebration (a special thanks to our old friend Zhi Chen). James also arranged for a seating area for us Saturday evening after the Birthday cake celebration for all 14 of us to have cocktails and “chill” which was an awesome family experience. Breakfast buffets were awesome (thanks for keeping an area open for my family Sunday) and it was nice to see the Hostess greeting us, and another friend by now Agathe Texier working several areas at once and taking care of special requests. A shout out to Eddy Joseph for his special requests for my family Saturday and Sunday and of course servers Rahman Tofael and Isis Tony James check-in and so many others.Of course none of this would have been remotely possible without MD Niles Harris who kept in touch even on his weekend to ensure everything was taken care of. His leadership, warmth and culture of excellence is evident throughout the organization which is why I stay there so frequently and have also had my Company senior management all stay there recently for a Corporate Event at Nasdaq. I am an Elite member of Marriott and the Hilton but in Times Square there is 1 Property that is our favorite and it’s the Crowne Plaza. MD Niles you and your team Rock!!!!

We were doubting among some similar hotels and now we are so happy to have chosen this one. Lovely renovated room in 45th floor with views to times square was incredible. Staff and rest ok, 4 stars. Price also ok. So exciting to see times square from above and skyline morning and night)!!!

After very careful consideration when planning a trip to NYC with my husband, we chose the Crowne Plaza Times Square and booked a King Suite with view of Times Square. We arrived early in the day, well before rooms would be ready and were able to store our bags so we could hit the city! That was an easy process and the front desk clerk was so friendly and welcoming. When our room was ready, the baggage clerk delivered our bags to our room promptly. If you use this service, I do believe it is customary, or at least courteous, to tip. I was thrilled by our room. We were on the 32nd floor and two walls were covered with windows for an expansive view of the city. It was everything I had hoped for. Our bed was super comfortable and we felt quite at home our entire stay. We did have an issue with our shower not draining properly and had to have someone come twice to fix it. However, the problem was resolved and that made things a lot more pleasant. We were given complimentary breakfast bar passes with Times Square view and it was marvelous. We likely would not have been able to pay so much for breakfast otherwise so it was such a nice treat and we are so grateful for the passes. The little grab and go cafe is great too. We visited it twice during our stay. As far as noise when in our room, we were located near an elevator, but because the King Suites have a little hallway, we heard nothing from the rest of the hotel. The only noise we heard was from Times Square but you can't really escape that even on the 32nd floor. It wasn't bad, though, and we had no trouble sleeping. I have a small fan I like to use to provide white noise so that helped too. When we checked out on our last day in NY, we were able to leave our bags until our evening flight. That made life so easy for us so that we could have nearly another full day of exploring the city. I would highly recommend this hotel that is in the heart of excitement!

My husband, an IHG platinum elite member, booked a 2 day trip for me and our daughter as we had tickets to a show and shopping to do and were looking forward to enjoying our limited time together. We booked a Times Square view with breakfast. The room was spacious, comfortable bedding, hot shower... all good. We were on the 28th floor corner room. Buildings in the way, blocking most of the view. A large column in the corner preventing us from seeing out the window and what was worse, preventing the curtains from closing. So don't expect to get much sleep with the lights and sun shining in your eyes.Don't expect slippers, bathrobe, turndown service or the light in the long hallway to work. So you must walk into a dark room with a long L-shaped hallway.The first night we used the (1) drink ticket in the lounge and I asked how late they would be open the next night and what time the kitchen would close. 12 AM and 11:30 PM were the answers. So we planned our day around that. We had lunch around 1 PM and we had a show to go to at 8. We weren't hungry but we knew we would be having drinks and food in the lounge after the show. We arrived at the lounge at 11 PM. We were turned away and told there would be no tables for a half hour. I guess the table with dirty glasses and no patrons and the tables behind the bar with the young children playing and sitting on them don't count. I asked if the kitchen would be open then and was told "no, sorry". So we hadn't eaten since 1 PM and went to our room to look for a local restaurant. Everything closes at 12 and we were not going back out in the freezing cold to possibly be turned away and we were certainly not wandering around any strange neighborhoods off Broadway. So we ended up getting room service just in time before they close at midnight. So much for enjoying our last night spending time together before my daughter has to leave.After reading many of the reviews of people being given upgraded rooms on high floors with views after mishaps, multiple drink tickets, use of the fitness club without a fee which we were not offered, water bottles in the room, etc I'm wondering what good it is to be a platinum member. We've been true to the brand but the brand has not been true to us. We paid a high price to stay here, but maybe I should've gotten a Groupon.

Stayed at this Times Square hotel because the event I attended was held here. Unfortunately the hotel room was much less than I expected. It was dark and dated. The headboards are worn with the design peeling off. The bathroom was a disaster. Bathtub clogged and I was ankle deep in water. Disgusting! The hotel plumber came up and fixed it but the “damage is done”. The tub had an insert, something I’ve never experienced. Felt like the entire tub was moving. Not a nice feeling. The amenities are not high quality. The front desk staff is pleasant. My tax exempt info did not make it to the billing department even though I sent it to the hotel. This happened the last time I stayed here. In the end, this is the last time I will stay here. Too much trouble and totally uncomfortable.

The Location was perfect& we were given an upgrade on arrival. The room (4307)was spacious & gave us a great view of Times Sq , not the hotels fault but we had an adjoining door in the room & the neighbours were quite noisy at times. Bar/Lounge service could improve, took 20mins to get my first drink! however Jason on the bar was a great guy & obviously took pride in his job. The reason I did not give 5stars is because a couple of local street sellers came in counting money laid out on a table Playing music on their phones loudly & harassing the female guests. The staff seemed to know them & ignored them when they should’ve thrown them out. I did report this to Amanda the manager on duty and she did monitor it the rest of the evening she assured me since but that was a big negative and made us not sit in the bar again, a complimentary round of drinks on the evening or something left in the room would’ve gone a long way on the last evening (Sunday) as our wives would not go to the bar/lounge again. I work in hotel management & didn’t feel much empathy. All in all though a positive experience ,though I did have to chase the hotel for feedback over the later issue. Would I go back there Yes I would the location and accommodation were great but sorry to say I did prefer the Rui Plaza last year.

I stayed here in February and thought instantly upon arriving and chatting to a few staff that it was a friendly place to stay. We did experience a problem with our first room but nothing the hotel had done wrong. We were moved to another room without any trouble. Whilst in the second room we experienced a shower fault. Yet again without any trouble we were given a complimentary breakfast whilst the issue was sorted. I highly recommend this hotel and have paid more in New York for worse customer service. The breakfast was great and I would happily return. I can say i have nothing negative to say about my stay!

Room was large by NYC standards, great view of city/Hudson. All staff was helpful and pleasant. Added bonus of a free wine/beer was a nice touch. Only negative comment would be that toilet in room was very difficult to operate. Actually had to flush 2 or 3 times for paper to disappear. Huge waste of water.

Our trip started with Nor’easter Quinn so getting from Kansas City to New York was a challenge. However because of a very, very late check-in (3:30am) the hotel had given our rooms away. This would have upset me but within 20 minutes the night manager had us reserved in another hotel, returned all our money for the first night, given us vouchers for free breakfast in the hotel, upgraded our rooms for the next day and gave us a ride over to the new hotel. Originally our rooms were just standard double bed rooms but in the first hotel we transferred to, we got a Time Square view on the 21st and 33rd floor. When we transferred back to the Crowne Plaza our rooms were upgraded to a view of Time Square from the 45th floor. Knowing when you’ve made a mistake and correcting it without me having to barter it with someone is huge in my book! Crowne Plaza hit it out of park correcting their error and helping us end a very long travel day plus adding a great start to our trip once we got in. Turns out the women who worked all this magic for us, had gotten stuck working a double because someone couldn’t get to work. She had been at work for almost 24 hours but never stopped smiling.

We loved Crowne Plaza NYC. Convenient location. Right in Time Square. Close to theatres, shops, restaurants and subway. Safe. Great breakfast buffet. Special thanks to the Tofael for his great service and friendliness. Best hotel gym. Clean and big rooms. Great for families. Everyone was courteous and helpful. Highly recommended.

Great location, Step out on to Times Square. When we arrived around 5pm our room was not ready, however, after we got past the initial hiccup the stay was good. Martin at the bar was very friendly & knowledgeable.

I stayed here a week for a conference. The location was everything! It is walking distance to many restaurants and the Broadway theaters. It's also close to the subway stations. The hotel room was clean the bed was comfy. I would suggest signing up to be a IHG member so that you can use the gym facilities for free and you will get other discounts on food and drinks at the hotel. Only thing I didn't care for is the walls seemed to be a little thin and not ideal if you have noisy guests. Overall, I would stay again.

Stayed 3 nights for recent Big East Tourney. Very happy with everything except ... the two times we needed a doorman for a cab there wasn’t one and no one else (porters) would take care of it. A very minor inconvenience but not what I would expect of a major chain hotel in such a prime location

Rooms were very nice and well serviced. Check in area chaotic. Bar and restaurant area far too small for the number of rooms and bar staff quite abrupt and unfriendly. Nowhere to sit if you didn’t want a drink but a huge restaurant area unopened in the evening. Needs to be remodelled

worse hotel ever!!!! I call to make a reservation... when I arrive they told me they didn´t have any room available... The recepcionist was rude, not helpful at all... He didn´t even help me to get a cab... it was 4 in the morning and I was all alone!

Stayed here for the first time for five nights. Great location, super convenient to all that the Theater District/Times Square has to offer. The majority of theaters will be a 5-10 minute walk. Even the south end of Central Park and Columbus Square can be reached in 15-20 minutes walking.Loved that part of it.About the hotel itself. The room was a bit more spacious than other hotels we've stayed in for not that much more. The room was clean, smelled good, and there were no glaring signs of wear and tear. The bed was super comfy. One of my favorite hotel beds ever. That's a big deal for me. Always hot water for a shower. Everything in good working order. Very pleasant experiences with Rosa's at the front desk she is very kind, always with a smile and with patience, excellent person.

Many thanks specifically to Ali - our breakfast server in the restaurant. He was attentive, professional, and kind - making every effort to make our stay enjoyable with his attention to detail and special birthday cake and champagne delivery to our room!

We stayed here for five nights whilst on a family holiday. Our little girl was one years old as when we stayed there . All the staff were great, especially with the little one. Hotel was great throughout our stay, and the location is second to none! Right on Time Square!

I was just here for a conference and the space and food were excellent. I have a food allergy and the staff were able to accommodate at short notice. Great location in the middle of the city, and near transportation. Everything about the hotel was top notch!

This hotel is in n excellent location. Times Square is literally right outside your door. Friendly staff. The room were clean and these was lots of room and great city views. You can rent a fridge for $30 per stay. What your bill as we were changed 30.00 per night but upon contacting the front desk our bill was amended immediately. We were given completely drink coupons for the bar upon arrival and as we were staying for a week they gave us a couple extra free drink tickets which was greatly appreciated. Complimentary bottles of water were only provided for the last couple of days. It would have been nice to have this at the first of our trip. We would definitely stay here again. We booked this hotel under Hotels.com using the e-bates app.

If travelling on business avoid Times Square hotels as the traffic is a nightmare. Expect to be heckled by cartoon characters and people peddling CDs as walk down the street. The Crown is located in the heart of Times Square. The hotel is a bit rundown but passable three star if you are in jam. No minibar or coffee in the room. Mattress and pillow are firm. The bar at the lobby level is decent.

I personally expected more from this hotel. The photos on it's website looked a little different. I thought it was bigger. It's not bad, it's clean and have a great location just a couple of blocks from times square, theatres and subway!

This was my second stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. The first was back in 2003 blackout and the Crowne Plaza was the ONLY hotel in the area to have working backup generators!I visit NYC once a year or two, usually as the lead chaperone of theatre students. I usually stay at a competitor a few minutes away, but with enough IHG points, I opted for a 3-night stay here and could not have been happier with that decision. Location is key and this hotel couldn’t be better. It overlooks Times Square from the restaurant and many of the rooms. You will be walking distance (2-15 minutes) from the Broadway theatres, 42nd Street, NBC, St Patrick’s Cathedral, Carnegie Hall, Central Park, and a 20 minute walk from Macy*s and The Empire State Building.Hotel staff is absolutely friendly and genuine in their desire to see you happy. Ask for Ali during breakfast, he will take great care of you!

We had a brilliant time in New York the hotel is comfortable with courteous staff.They were really helpful with any situation or question we asked .They were so kind to me when I lost husband in Macy's for 7 hours!!, and wasn't sure how to find him.That aside the rooms are clean very comfortable and the food we did have in the bar was good and plentiful and they didn't mind we shared it.Once again Thank You to the Crowne Plaza .

The location was great for what I wanted.Service during the day was great and very proactive and polite however ,in the evenings not so much ( reception area ) needs more work in terms of being polite and helpful with clients especially when people arrive at 4 am from a 9 hour flight due to the snow weather that we had in January.Bar staff excellent and very polite.Hotel room quite equipped,beds were very comfy all good Would recommend without a doubt ,well done !

Great size of room, very clean comfy queen size bed, tea & coffee provided, central location. Bar staff very pleasant.Customer toilets in bar area could do with being cleaned more regularly as had to check 4 cubicles until found clean one.

Upon check-in, Imran was very helpful, efficient and courteous. I really appreciated the way he works. The hotel is fine, it was a good price and had the basics down. The price point was fine, in fact, inexpensive by NYC standards. I gave it a 4 overall, not for anything they did, but this is not The Four Seasons. I would stay there again without hesitation if my needs were just a clean basic room.

Close to Broadway, Central Park, and wonderful restaurants. Excellent hospitality and great buffet breakfast. Was perfect to view the Christmas decorations. The Gershwin theater is a stone’s throw away. Will stay there again sometime soon.

Booked last minute not wanting to travel home in bad weather after a show. Was very convient right next to Springsteen on Broadway. Rooms were clean and bed comfortable. Stop for a drink and late night snack in the hotels Bar 49- server Tony was a pleasure- friendly and great service. Would stay again.

Stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights. Hotel is brilliantly located on 49th and Broadway, just around the corner from Times Square. There are plenty of restaurants within easy reach. Rooms are spacious and was not loud (however we were on the 34th floor). The view from the room was better then expected. Could see straight up Broadway.

A great place, awesome breakfast and so easy to get everywhere in New York. Restaurant Row is on the doorstep with access to some fantastic places to eat . We got the tour buses across the road and saw most of the sights over our weeks break.

I booked a trip on Orbitz for my partner. It was a great package, and the staff was accommodating about finding a quiet room. Apparently the pool & fitness area is leasedor not exactly managed by the hotel or this review would be A LOT WORSE.My partner and another person, a guy from Norway, were swimming laps at the fitness center when a staff person came over screaming and waving his arms. He continued to scream at them both because they did not have swim caps. He did not offer a swim cap and apparently waited for them to get out of the pool , tapping his foot and lecturing them about wearing a cap.Who knew? My guy had gotten in late the night before and went for a swim, like he does EVERY day in a variety of places. He is 67 and not a long hair... The staff member then waited for him to leave the 15th floor. Needless to say, he won't be back and neither will I.

Hotel is well located for my business conference and dinner location the night before. I have stayed in this hotel for same business event 3 or 4 years ago, Since I have Ambassador Spire status with IHG I expected elite treatment as advertised.Actual experience was more like that accorded to tourists flocking to see the sights in Manhattan. After switching rooms 3 times I gave up. rooms are small, shabby, wall paper is peeling, No slippers or robes in spite of IHG status. No complimentary water bottles. So called breakfast dous not offer eggs or omlettes to order. Orange juice was really bad. Assitant manager by name of Amanda tried her best. But even she could not fight the system.

Amazing hospitality. Fabulous location, great rooms but above all the service was excellent. Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends, and will stay there whenever I’m in NY. Karim, Jason and Kim went above and beyond to make our stay so lovely. Thanks guys, see you soon x
