Have just spent 4 nights at this hotel. I stayed here for one night some years ago on business and loved it, so decided to stay here for a sightseeing trip. The location gets 5 stars for being in the thick of Times Square with a choice of subway lines 5 mins away. However, there is a lot that lets this hotel down. It has not been decorated in years and it shows, tired and dull looking rooms and corridors and a thick black seedy looking curtain over the entrance, I presume a barrier from the cold. Not nice and certainly not becoming of a hotel claiming its stature! The pool was grim, looked dirty and old, the sky light roof was disgusting. On the plus side, the room was a good size and the shower hot and powerful and the bed very comfortable. This was a trip for our 25th wedding anniversary and I did ask for a high floor room to get the best views and also to look down towards Times Square. We did get a high floor but not the view which was a shame. Working in the business myself I was rather disapointed that the hotel didn't leave a small token in our room for our anniversary. Maybe it's an English thing but a fruit plate or chocolate is a typical gesture for special bookings.. There wasn't even a bottle of water! All in all, as we were out from early morning to late evening every day so the quality within the hotel didn't affect us..But to the management of CPTS don't rest on your laurels with a great location for too much longer!.. And find a better solution than that seedy black curtain to keep the cold out!

The place is very nice with beautiful view of the city, service was good from the help desk to room service and restaurant, rooms are nice and clean, TV has a lot of entertaining programs, the stay was very nice comfortable and enjoyable.

This hotel is in the heart of Times Square. Great location if you want to be close to the theatre’s, 2 blocks from 5th Avenue, 2 blocks from Rockafeller Centre. 10 minute walk to Central Park. Staff are friendly and pleasant throughout the hotel. Rooms are in need of a refurbishment. It’s not a 4 star. Unfortunately I wouldn’t return or recommend as there are lots of hotels in the area to choose from.

Well how do I start this review. Check in was fast, fast because the man who checked us in didn’t even look us in the face. Just said credit card for fees, didn’t explain what these fees were, although I’d already read online about them. I was told we’d get a drinks voucher which we didn’t receive. There was no mention of it, he could of at least explained the breakfast options. Although we wasn’t booked for breakfast we would of probably tried it had someone explained.The room was nice and big, we upgraded to a Times Square view. For the price the rooms could at least have a fridge and proper kettle. We had to use the window to keep drinks cold. Bed was comfortable although we did wake up after the first morning with bite marks on our legs. We had the bed linen changed and that never happened again. The tv in the room could have more channels, as a couple travelling myself being pregnant we didn’t want to be out at night time and the tv was absolutely boring so we spent most nights going to bed early.First night we ordered room service as we was knackered from the flight. To say the food was disgusting would be putting it politely. 2 main meals, a pizza and 4 drinks with a pudding totalling nearly $130. And most of it was inedible. Meatballs were rock hard and the pasta was nothing good. Certainly wouldn’t recommend it, we didn’t eat at the hotel after that for this reason. The man behind the counter of Grind and co is so rude. So we even stopped buying stuff from there. Hubby asked him if he had a good day and he just ignored him. We even found the men at the baggage hold down stairs rude. On the day of check out we had a bill pushed under our door for two separate bills we apparently had. One of them was room service which we had, the other was for sitting in the bar having dinner which we didn’t do, so make sure they bill you for what you actually had. We had to speak to front desk about it who removed it but she looked at us as if we was lying. I don’t mind paying for something we’ve had. We tired to get a late check out as our flight was a late one, the latest they could give us was 1pm with no extra charge so I suppose that was ok. When actually checking out the women didn’t even look at us, just gave me a bill for the room service we’d ordered and that was it. No thanks for staying with us. Hope you had a nice time, have a safe flight home. Seems no one in the states has manners as we’ve came across no one here with them. Apart from the room cleaners maybe. For the price we paid I at least expected some manners. On the whole I wouldn’t return and wouldn’t recommend staying here to anyone.
user_name:
Danielle R
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 9yr old son for 4 nights in February and it really is in the best location to explore the city. It was our first time to New York and the staff are very friendly and helpful from check in to check out. There is also an information desk if you want to book tickets for a show or need some guidance. There is an ATM in the reception area but it didn’t accept our debit card from the UK, it did accept our MasterCard though. The hotel bar is average priced for a hotel bar and did some very nice cocktails. I got given vouchers for 2 free cocktails as I was celebrating my birthday whilst there. The table service in the bar was a little slow but there was a lot of people to serve so bear it in mind to be patient. Some great views of Times Square from here. The Location was the main reason for us to book this hotel as it was walking distance to the main attractions. From the Flatiron Building to the Empire State, Chrysler Building and Rockefeller Plaza all just a few blocks away. There are plenty of great places to eat too. I would recommend Ray’s pizza for a grab it n go slice, just around the opposite block, up from M&M world and also the Majestic Diner on the corner of the same block. You can get a large can (1 & 1/4 pints) of beer (coors light) here for just over $5 and the breakfast was delicious. We booked our New York Passes before we went and picked them up next door to M&M world and I would highly recommend this. They gave us access to most attractions and also a queue jump at the top of the rock which was really beneficial. It also included the hop on hop off bus tours with 3 different loops, uptown for Central Park area, midtown for all the central attractions I mentioned before if you aren’t a walker, and downtown for the financial district and Statue of Liberty. The main pick up was just outside of M&M world too so very handy. The theatres on Broadway are all within walking distance whatever you choose to see. We saw the Lion King and it was absolutely amazing. The hotel rooms are very spacious, we had a room with 2 double beds (so so comfy and plenty of pillows) there were loads of power points around the room and a radio alarm/Bluetooth speaker too. There was also a large flatscreen TV with pay per view movies available. There was central heating/air conditioning. A cupboard for hanging clothes also had an ironing board and iron, there was a safety deposit box in another cupboard and a small fridge. Tea and coffee making facilities were also provided inside one of the cupboards. There is also a hairdryer in the bathroom. Small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, shower gel and moisturiser are provided too along with hand soap and a shower cap. There were plenty of towels available in the rooms which were changed regularly too. I think the room was maybe a little tired and could do with a freshen up in places but it’s not something that bothered me. It certainly wouldn’t put me off staying here again or recommending to anyone. Thank you Crowne Plaza, we hope to visit you again.

Stayed at this hotel for my wife’s bday. Hotel was great, and service was awesome. I want to say Ana, from the breakfast restaurant was outstanding. I watched this lady serve, clean and converse with customers. It was my wife’s bday and she made her feel so special. Thx for the great trip Crown Plaza/Ana.

Fantastic reception with Sandra esp. great greetings in check in. She was very amazing person with us! If you want to get a especial attendance go to Sandra. Hotel has a big nice breakfast and a big gym and swinminpool. And very close to central park and times squares. Excelent location

My husband and I had such a lovely stay in the hotel it was amazing The staff made such a good jobWhen it comes to the room they were really cozy and two of us had a amazing time Keep the good job we will be back in near future

I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square dozens of times over the years and there's a reason that I keep coming back. I'm a business traveler that travels to New York City several times a year. The hotel is located on Broadway between 48th and 49th Streets, which is perfect for me because I can walk to all of the offices I need to visit. It is located on the edge of Times Square which puts you close to all the excitement of the area without making it difficult to walk out the front door of the hotel. I've also found there's less road noise at this location than other hotels that I've stayed in that are just a couple of blocks away in the middle of Times Square.The rooms are large for New York City standards and they're always fresh and clean. There's plenty of counter top space in the bathrooms and the showers always have plenty of hot water and great water pressure. I've never had trouble with a clogged shower drain at this hotel either. From Robert at the front desk to check-out, and everything in between I've always found the staff to be professional, efficient, and friendly. I almost always eat breakfast in the restaurant and it's always such a pleasant experience. Travis and all the guys are quick to refill your drinks and will even send me off for a day of work with a bottle of cold water for my walk. In the evenings it's hard to beat the bar for a place to socialize, catch the game of the day, or just unwind. Jason, Marty, Kim, and Phil are all pro's at keeping up with the pace and still find time to joke and laugh with you. Karim is usually close by checking on guests and saying hello. I've become friends with guests from all over the world at this bar. The atmosphere makes it so easy to meet people and chat when you're feeling social but it's also pretty easy to find a spot to sit quietly with a glass of wine if that's important to you. From a safety and security standpoint, the security personnel are very visible and are diligent about checking room keys in the evenings before anyone is permitted to head up the escalator to the main floor or the elevators to the guest rooms. I like this hotel and the staff so much that I'm planning to bring my family here for our next family trip!

had a room on the 42nd floor, view to the Hudson river. the view was fantastic. it makes sense to take a room on the higher floors. rooms are ok, but u can see the hotel is older. furniture not so fresh any more. the bathrooms are very small like in any hotel in the US. here the age is also visible. the bathtub was not in a great state.if you need something there is a small shop on the groundfloor. there you can buy water, basic cosmetics etc. next to the reception there is a bar where you can have a bite or drink. food is not the best... better go and eat outside. and be careful not to have the key cards next to your mobile phone. they die the moment they see a phone in the distance. and then you have the hustle to redo the card on the front desk....on the plus side is it's one of the cheaper hotels on Times square.

We were very pleased with our stay. Check in - even though it was busy- was quick and friendly. Our room was clean and very up to date - modern bathroom with plenty of space and a large screen TV. We had a view looking north along Broadway and an extra window with views of the Hudson River. We had breakfast both mornings of our stay. My wife has food allergies. Karim Sharif, the manager of the restaurant, went out of his way to make sure she didn't have to worry about any ingredients used to prepare menu choices. His staff kept checking at our table making sure everything was okay. The second day we had a nice table with a view of Times Square.

We just stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan. I strongly recommend this hotel if you are in the area! It is perfectly located right at Times Square, close to everything. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I can't speak highly enough but this hotel. I recommend strongly.

Took the kids to NYC for a few days. Staff accommodated request for a Times Square corner room and it was perfect! In the heart of it all, close to Broadway show and food. We were worried the lights could be too bright, but from the 35th floor it was not a problem. Surprisingly quiet. We didn't use the pool or club and we ate other places. Great stay!

My mother passed away suddenly yesterday.  We had to cancel our family trip to New York City.  I emailed the hotel if they could cancel. As we had just booked 2 days before my mother’s passing and was promptly sent a generic sorry your plans changed you need to pay full amount due to the no refund selection I made.  Really ??? I didn’t plan for my mother to die. Where’s the compassion ? Fail.  FYI. Same hotel chain in Newark gladly refunded us promptly along with their deepest condolences. Thank u Carlos !

Being a Platinum Elite IHG member, I booked my stay directly via IHG. When I booked it, I wasn't sure if the Resort Fees were included, but beared this in mind.A few days prior to arrival, I emailed the hotel to request a higher floor room and check on the Resort Fees. Rather than a "welcoming" email back, I simply received a "strong" email saying the fees were payable from Elizabeth C! Not quite the introduction I was expecting prior to the stay.Upon arrival at the hotel, we got dropped off and proceeded up the escalator. As expected, it is a large and busy hotel so lots of other guests always around.We went to the priority check in, and after a 5 min wait or so, Rocco checked us in. He was very professional and offered advise on where to go etc. He deserves a credit!We were on the 33 floor - and the room was large and what appeared to be a new bathroom. No faults with the room at all. The shower was powerful and hot. It wasn't until the 2nd day that we realised the hole in the shower glass was so we could control the shower without being in it!!The rooms do show signs of lots of traffic, but this can only be expected. Windows also open, and we did find one of the handles was broken, but this was something we managed with.Housekeeping were friendly and did a very good job!On the last day, Rocco did an excellent job and arranged for a slightly late check out, although when we did go to check out, we again when to the priority desk and was then shouted to other end of the desk to do the check out! No "how was your stay" etc, just thanks!

Apologies but I have to give you only one-star. Stayed at the end of Jan 2018 for business. My stay was ok, did not get enough time to spend in the hotel but location is great. It's tuck in the middle of Times Sq itself. However what I'm very disappointed with CPTSNY is that MY SECURITY DEPOSIT IS NOT REFUNDED UNTIL TODAY! and it is almost a month from the day I checked out, and I've emailed the hotel 4 times, with only 1 email that was responded but NO ACTION!

We were in NYC for a symposium and stayed here. Fast check in. Prompt delivery of our luggage room were we stored it in prior to check in so we could see the city. Beautiful view of Time Square from our room. Breakfast buffet was fresh with a great variety.

Having traveled all across the world I get to stay in hotels ranging from budget to luxury. I stayed here in early December and it was an "okay" stay, we had a few issues with our room such as the TV not working, lots of dust on the tables, the office chair being broken etc. The hotel is in an excellent location! the breakfast was very good at $10 per a person. After having made a complaint to the General Manager, we feel his response made up for the few issues we had. The staff here including the general manager are excellent at their jobs and really made our stay a much better one.

We were visiting NYC with our kids and specifically booked this hotel because it had a pool. The website is misleading, no where does it say there are only 4 laps and you have to book ahead to use them. The pool is also cold. The kids have to wear swim caps, so you can either bring your own or she’ll out $$ to purchase them here. The pool closes early and there is no seating! This is basically a gym pool that guests can use—nowhere was that made clear on the website!One of my kid has sensitivity issue and wearing a tight swim cap is out of the question. There were other families trying to “use the pool” during our three day stay. We were all very disappointed and felt a bit scammed. I spoke with one of the lifeguards and they stated that hotel guests are often disappointed and frustrated when they get to the pool. The hotel is ok for a Time Square hotel. Relativity clean, ok views. Our room was really hot and we couldn’t cool it down. The window was broke and didn’t open and only the heat was working.

The hotel has a great location and very nice team working there. Clean, safe, and near of many Broadway theaters. I specially thank Victoria, in the reception desk, for her detailed information when arriving, and friendly welcoming to NYC.

Stayed for four nights in a room with two double beds. No complaints with the size of the room. We paid extra for a Times Square view which I am glad that we did. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on in a hotel. It would have been good to have had a fridge in the room although I believe you could have hired one. Housekeeping did a decent enough job. We found all staff friendly and helpful. Location of the hotel is perfect as it is within walking distance to many attractions and tube stations. I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel and will certainly consider it for my next trip to New York. The only issue I have is the fact that I had to pay $30 per night service charge and we didn't use the gym, bar or phone so I felt this money was a real waste but it wouldn't put me off staying again because the location is just perfect. Thank you Crowne Plaza for a lovely stay.

Good location and convenient to TS and many theaters. Shopping and restaurants are nearby. Rooms are clean and appointed well for this flag. Check-in is on the floor above ground level. They will stow luggage if you arrive early (thanks!) A small safe is in the room; coffee maker; hair dryer. No refrigerator.  We had some issues checking in, putting us in an inferior room vs. our reservations. Dear Reader - don't waste your time calling the desk like we did. They won't get back with you. Just go to the desk. The desk staff was very helpful solved our problem in 20 seconds as compared to waiting forever for call backs while in the wrong room. In spite of this, we would return.

Have stayed here about 5 times, as it is one of the locations one can stay yearly for free using IHG credit card Rewards Program. Plentiful breakfast buffet. Lobby bar has wonderful and inexpensive onion soup and excellent beer choice on tap. The only negative experience was due to non stop barking by a dog abandoned in a room. Security was called and never showed up. The front desk later told me that no hotel policy existed about badly behaved barking dogs left alone in rooms - and that they would do absolutely nothing about it.
user_name:
AllenFein
Southampton, New York, United States

review_body: The location is indeed unbeatable...directly at Times Square and just nearby everything....that is also the downside....so many people coming and going from the hotel, it reminded me more of a train station than of an hotel...and it is nothing for people with light sleep, as it is pretty loud if you are in one of the lower floors...on the other hand, if you get upgraded to corner room on a top floor...that is for sure a different story. Rooms are spacious, with all amenities. The hotel also has a gym, a cafe, a restaurant and a bar. The place is already a little bit dated, but clean and well maintained.Staff super friendly despite all the tourists coming and going...Will I be back? I don't think so, as this is too large and busy for my taste. But if you want to be "near the party", this is definitely for you....

My kids booked this for our Christmas present and the location was super. We had a corner room looking out to Times Square that was awesome. The room needs to be updated, leaking sink and worn furnishings are not in line with the price and location of Times Square

Loved the location for getting around. Easy to get tickets to a play, and get sight seeing bus. Room was clean but only had a shower. I had a bad foot and really wanted to soak it. No bell staff when I came in and I struggled with luggage in the entry way up to the second floor lobby. Saw others with same issue. The front desk staff looked busy and tired. The lobby was load with the bar next door. It was always busy Was surprised by $30 fee for wifi and free bar drinks. The bar was nice for pre theatre drinks and snack. Waitress was very friendly.

Stayed overnight over the holiday weekend and was pleased. Clean. Cordial staff. Nice breakfast buffet worth the extra price. Complimentary drink vouchers for the adults. Beds are small-definitely double size, not queens. Also the room was too warm for my liking and there was no way to turn the temp down past 60 degrees. Kids were looking forward to pool, but beware: it’s a lap pool and everyone needs to wear swimming cap/shower cap. It’s not a family pool so don’t expect one. They were disappointed but we did so much in our two days in nyc that it didn’t matter. We’d stay at Crowne Plaza in Times Square again.

Had a fabulous time in New York. Certainly recommend the Crowne Plaza in Times Square. The hotel was spotless the staff were very helpful and the view from our room was amazing. Very central taxis are cheap food is quite expensive in around Times Square but if you venture a few streets it gets a lot cheaper. Look out for the grade in the windows of restaurants grade A is best, grade B is ok & grade C is possible venture to a doctor! Check out Avenue Q show on Broadway great adult humour very funny a must see. We also really enjoyed The Ride a tour bus with a totally different twist loved it. Check out Juniors Cheescake restaurant best milkshake we ever tasted

I am disappointed with the service that I received on trying to follow up and having some costs explained to me. Managed to speak to quite a rude and abrupt lady at front desk who ended up putting the phone down on me. Hope this is not a good indication on what our stay will be like.

We have just returned from New York having stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 7 nights. I have based my review rating on what we paid for the week. We arrived at 11:30pm NYC time and keeping in mind our local time in the UK was around 4:30am, it was disappointing that we had a 45 minute wait at the check in desk. There were only two people working the desk and quite a queue. Keeping our two children awake was a challenge. Upon checking in i asked if a room upgrade was available and i was happy for to pay for this. I was told i couldn't upgrade at that time of night....not sure why. Anyway, we were placed on the 18th floor overlooking Times Square, something i had prepaid for. We proceeded to make our way to the lifts which incurred a further 10 minute delay. Due to the hotel having so many floors they operate lifts specific to those floors so you have only maybe two lifts that you can get in. With a hotel that size and so many people staying there we waited a lot for lifts throughout the course of the week. Out of interest i timed it on our second to last day and it took 13 mins for a lift (that wasn't already full) to become available. This was more of an inconvenience then anything else. Prior to booking we were encouraged to stay at this hotel due the security and the fact hotel key cards were checked to ensure no one could access the hotel. We were in and out of the hotel daily and our cards were ironically only checked on the very last night we came back. Other than that we were never asked to show cards at either any entrance/exit or before we entered a lift. The room itself was a great size with plenty of storage. In general the room was a little run down. The headboards were ripped and peeling, the bathroom seals had come loose and there were chips out of the bath. My youngest dropped something behind a unit and it was clear that cleaning only happens in areas which you can see. There was plenty of lighting and we couldn't hear the noise from Times Square with the window closed. Different story if the window is open and it's likely you will need the window open as the room was very hot. I called the front desk and requested a fan which was used every night for the rest of the week. The blackout curtains are also great in blocking the bright lights of Times Square. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of plug sockets. We always had plenty of hot water and the tv was a good size. We rarely used the tv but there was an option to rent films. A little tip for the room key cards, dont put them near your phone, ipods or some other cards. I had to go and get mine reactivated because of this which isn't a quick fix when you wait 10 minutes for the lift and then queue again at reception. We didn't use the restaurant or the bar at all so cannot comment. There are so many places in and around NY that we just chose to venture out. We did use the little shop on the lower level to take a few snacks to the room. We were also able to jump in a yellow cab outside of the hotel very quickly. The hotel will offer their car service but it is much more expensive. The yellow cabs have fixed pricing for the airport runs. I would also point out that we were made fully aware by the third party that additional costs were included so this wasn't a surprise. We didn't use the pool or the gym as there wasnt time but the wi-fi signal was very good. You do have to keep reconnecting though. There didnt seem to be a limit to the number of devices you could connect either which was great. The concierge desk was brilliant with helping us out, a special shout out to Joanne Miceli @ City Experts who was so efficient. Our other experience with the employees wasn't so great. The check in desk just seemed so miserable each time we spoke with them, not sure why. The location of the hotel is perfect, cannot fault it. Surrounded by loads of shops, restaurants and within walking distant to most points of interest. There are also a number of subway stations near the hotel which was so useful as we used the trains all week. Overall it didnt impact our week much because NY has so much to offer. I would however look around for another hotel next time as i have spoken to a lot of people that stayed in similar hotels at a more cost effective rate. If however this hotel still looked to be a good deal then i would stay again. Lastly, i am having to contact the hotel as they have charged my card approx £55 and i have no idea why. If you have booked here dont be put off, it wasn't terrible by any means, there are just a lot of improvements i would expect for the price paid. New York in general is amazing!

Have previously stayed at the Westin , which is near by but thought We would try something different. After along flight arrived before check in the hotel was kind enough to let’s us in early. Our room was cleaned every day , and breakfast is great lots of choices. The fashion bar and restaurant was great and such good value for money. Would stay here again and recommend to friends

Victoria at the checkin was lovely and friendly and got us off to a great start. Was a little disappointed to have a refrigerator only available for $30, but they then offered to waive the fee and brought one, which was much appreciated. Location was terrific and central. Rooms older and outdated but fine and clean. Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed for 3 nights as we got caught in the snow bomb in jan18, we ended up in chicargo for 1 night sent the hotel a e-mail telling them we were stuck. Arriving the next day we told the man on the front desk what had happened and i asked if we could not pay for the first night as they had booked our rooms out for people who could not leave new york, he said no as i booked through booking.com. said i would have to sort with them,booking said I sould sort it with crowne plaza, having been waiting for ether of them to reply not heard a thing, note to self book direct so you can just sort out with the hotel!! the hotel was nice with good size rooms and nice bathrooms, we liked the restaurant and bar it was very busy the first night but that was becouse so many people were stuck in new york. We had a lovely time in new york, will be going back sometime in the year.

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, you couldn't fault it one bit. Was clean, members of staff were very polite and it's in the perfect place! Would def stay here again. Room service the food was lovely aswell.

We stayed at this hotel, which is in a fantastic location on times square, check in was quick, recognised us as IHG rewards members straight away, we got 1 20% off voucher for the bar, I had read on other reviews some people got a couple of free drinks vouchers, but we did not get these. We were on the 30th floor, good views, I had emailed the hotel priror arrival and asked for a corner room, we were not given this, but the room was ok, although a little hot, we turned down the heating but was still rather warm. Beds were super comfy and had a great nights sleep, yes we heard the odd siren but its New york. Rooms were starting to look a little dated but ideal for what we needed it for, as we were out sightseeing most of the day.First time in New york and would recomend this hotel for its location, but we thought bar prices were a little expensive.

Very nice hotel in the middle of time square. Hotel staff was very friendly and attentive Within walking distance to all things in time square. Recommend this hotel if you want to be in the middle of it all.

The hotel is very well located and has an incredible service. They were accommodating on specific request for a room change. You can walk out from the hotel on Time square and are immediately surrounded by the magic of NYC. Good value for money!

A rip off and a con. Stayed a week having already paid through booking.com only to find a bill under door of room on final morning for more than $200 for what they call service charge. This is for internet, and gym. We didn’t use gym so therefore bloody expensive internet. Could have stayed elsewhere with better accom and no extras. It’s the Hilton for me next time. Cheaper over all. The staff at reception very rude. There were four disgruntled customers before me and by the time I got there she couldn’t even look me in the eye. Said it was policy and take it up with agents. It’s a con. I’m used to paying a tourist tax or city tax. I’ve been to NYC for past twenty years but this place is a CON. Avoid. The management need to take notice!!!!!

The hotel is the perfect location for Times Square and for transport links around the city. The reception area is bright and modern and check in was very straight forward.The room was ok, a good size but very tired and dated and in need of a good revamp. It was very quiet and everything worked. The in room coffee is lovely and must be tried. The lifts were a bit of a nightmare, only 3 lifts went to our floor which meant up to a 10 minute wait on busy times.The street level entrance has some old black curtains which are dirty and seem to be there all the time.I would recommend but just make sure you get one of the rooms that has been refurbed! Location is perfect and staff very friendly.

Location and price were the reasons for my selection; it is right on the Times Square, close to several metro stations, easily accessible to everywhere. Unfortunately, the entrance on the Broadway street leaves a very bad impression, with a heavy/dirty curtain (!!!!) covering the gateway!..The rooms are comfy, spacious with bare essentials (no refrigerator), and upper floors grant phenomenal views; the service, the attentiveness and the accessability of the employees, at reception, elevators, all around, was exceptional; the main reason I can not give a top mark is due to the old, at times decrepit appearance of the interiors, decoration, furniture, walls; ..needs a thorough renovation that would match the excellence of the personnel.

Absolutely outstanding service, perfect location, this is a very well looked after and run hotel. The in house buffet breakfast was very nice. I will definitely return, and recommend this place to my friends.

The Crowne Plaza is perfectly located for exploring Manhattan being located almost slap bang in the middle. The hotel itself is clean but starting to show it's age and the room we were in could do with redecration, that said it was fully functional and comfortable. Like all big hotels in major cities around the world this one is extremely busy in the public areas but does seem to cope well enough.

Very good stay. The room was good although the bathroom was old and had hair in the shower. The service was great. We opted for the breakfast package which worked out to be very convenient and the staff there were extremely helpful especially Mahfuz, very attentive and welcoming. The location is excellent. Times Square view with everything in walking distance.

The only positive thing I could say about this hotel is that their breakfast (and restaurant service) was great!. Besides that, the front desk associates made no effort to assist people with check in/ out requests based on status (they just don't serve anyone for early check in or late check out requests) unless you insist and request to ask with a manager (which made very little difference). The gym is good but because its not owned by the hotel they closed a 9:30 pm which doesn't support business travelers. There are much better options in NYC for sure.

As soon as we walked into the Crowne Plaza hotel, its wonderful setting, immaculate bar area, with the lights of Time Square flashing behind the windows, friendly bar staff and upbeat ambience, we we knew this was the type of hotel we had imagined spending our trip in. Sandra Esp on Reception was extremely helpful in assisting with us in trying to find a room for that night, as we had only been in New york for one night and our first hotel was not at all what we expected, and having been up since 6am on our first day, and having walked 33,000 steps from mid down to down town, in the rain, we wanted to have a hot shower, in a hotel that met what we had initially expected. Sandra Esp was really informative in giving us advice and explaining how the tax's worked etc, and what the best approach was to securing a room for that night being that we had not walked into their reception until 4pm that afternoon. We secured a booking for that night for the rest of our trip and it just made out trip that extra special. The walk in piping hot shower was amazing, and after long days out walking around the city, it was a treat to come back to our clean room on the 42nd floor, with a view of Time Square below, a fabulous comfortable bed and an immaculately clean room. The bar staff too were extremely friendly and helpful and it was a nice relaxing spot, with light jazz music and the TV with the winter sports, and backdrop of Time Square behind us. We would definitely be staying here again! Sandra Esp, you are a credit to the Plaza, you were a friendly face on a day that we really needed one and made sure we were totally looked after, a true professional in the excellence of Customer Service. Thanks so much for your help. Mr and Mrs Murray xx

Great hotel in Times Square, central to everything. Super helpful staff and clean room. Second time here. Upgraded to a corner room with great views of Times Square. Highly recommend staying here and can’t wait to return again!

Can’t thank them enough, while waiting over 40 min on the phone with my bank. The staff were extremely patient and more than helpful to assist me with what that could. I’d personally like to recognize and thank Rhonda & Milia for their patience and persistence. My room was comfortable and view was great but, once again their staff are the best!
user_name:
BigRo77
New York City, New York

review_body: For the sixth year in a row we have stayed at the Crowne Plaza. Not only is the location perfect for enjoying Times Square, but other parts of Midtown as well. In that time we have come to know many of the staff who continue to greet us year after year. Ali in the dining room is super attentive and remembers the beverages that we request. But it's more than that, he makes you feel that you are the most important person and we appreciate that so much. Tony in the bar is also one of our favorites! He asks about our day as we finish up with a nightcap. He always has a funny quip or a quick story or a complement to, once again, feel like you are part of the Crowne family. Kim is also a very good bartender and is always quick with a smile. For the first time ever we used the Concierge- I failed to print tickets for a show- no problem- the concierge did it with no fuss and it relieved the stress for me once I realized I had someone to help me out! I requested a particular room and the desk fulfilled it with no problem. Will we return to the Crowne next year? You bet and we look forward to seeing our "friends" yet once again!

I stayed this hotel in Feb. 2018. 4 days.Room is good. Large writing desk and sofa, king size bed.50 inches TV.Restaurant is reasonable. Taste is good. If you need options, there are many restaurants around the hotel.The most valuable thing is location. You can walk to Central Park, MoMA and so on.
user_name:
tangoOscar94
New York City, New York

review_body: The location of the hotel is in the heart of it all. We could walk most everywhere. Our room was big enough but not that clean. We had to ask for the bathroom to be cleaned again and have the phone fixed, which was done. We booked through Expedia and when we arrived at the hotel we learned we could not earn IHG points because of the second party booking and we had to pay $30US daily resort fee! Breakfast is a bit pricey too, look for restaurants close by.

Great place to stay and amazing location. The rooms are very clean and you can walk to every restaurant. Traveling with family here is a great option as well as bussines trip. The attention from staff is great.

Me and my partner decided to travel to New York and after careful consideration we booked the Crowne Plaza Times Square as the location looked amazing. Booked through our travel agent and was told everything was included including resort fee (which gives access to pool, gym and WiFi. Also a voucher for a welcome drink would be included)We arrived earlier than expected and the woman on the check in desk found us a room that was ready. Checked in and everything was fine. (At this point we forgot we didn’t get a drink on arrival due to us travelling from the UK and we just wanted to rest)Room was amazing. Great views. Big and spacious room and no complaints whatsoever about the cleanliness of the room. However, from that point, we found the staff in the hotel to be very rude and very unapproachable. We usually stay in Crowne Plaza hotels and we also have a membership for when we do visit. We find that the attention to detail and customer service is great wherever we stay. On this occasion, very disappointing. I approached a lady on reception to advise we had not received our welcome drinks. This was because we have to pay $39 a day for us to get a welcome drink and use the pool and gym. I challenged why we didn’t receive this and the lady said that we had no right to this offer and we had to pay extra for this. I tried speaking to the manager but was told they were not available so. Instead I was shouted at by the lady and a man approached and also started getting angry with me. At that point I decided not to even interact with the staff at the hotel. From looking at recent reviews , people have had this issue before. It seems as that if you receive a “special gift” or a “gesture of goodwill” like cake or a special message, these things are overturned. As previous. This whole trip was only marred by the sheer unprofessional staff who did not want to listen to me or take on board what I was trying to say. Also. I would advise if anyone wishes to get a car or taxi through concierge, it’s easier to book yourself and save a few dollars instead of tipping for someone else to do it for you. Views from the room were exceptional. The comfortable bed was also amazing as we did a lot of walking throughout our trip. The price of the breakfast was quite expensive each day so we decided to go to Juniors on a couple of occasions as this was far cheaper than over $30 a day. The review would have had more than 3 if we had not been let down by the staff at the hotel.

This was a lovely week in New York .the service good and I loved "my" room" the restaurant and the food so lovely ,I miss the breakfast And I would like to say thank you to Agron and Aaron/Tofael ..a special thank you for all your kindness ,,,and the lady in the restaurant ..Kind regards Ann

We spent just a night (almost 2 full days, though) here pre-cruise. The hotel was very nice, rooms were very clean and comfortable, the staff were fantastic, and it's absolutely perfect for a quick NY getaway, as it's close to everything (including the port).Kim in the lobby bar was a lot of fun, great service, and is a great ambassador for the hotel.Next time in NY, I know where we're going to be staying!

Hotel is beautiful and very clean. Great location. Price is competitive. At check out, I ended up paying $100 less than when I made the reservation. That was a great surprise and made me very happy. At check in we were greeted by Victoria. She was a pleasure. She was very helpful and she was able to check us in early. Thank you Victoria for the great service. I will definitely be back to Crowne Plaza when I travel back to NY....

Stayed here for 4 nights the start of February and couldn’t have asked for better. Was a little worried after I read some recent reviews but I guess they’re the people that are never happy!!! Warm friendly staff, shout out to Vanessa on reception for the bottle of bubbles for my birthday Rooms are immaculately cleaned every day. Drinks and Food hearty and filling. Would highly recommend the location too. Would definitely stay here again ❤️

We booked this hotel at NYC during the week of february, the services were good the hotel accommodations are good, quality of the services also represent big portion of this evaluation. All the requests were attended with high attention and cordiality.Many attraction close of the hotel and easy to move to the subway, taxi, bus and others to the main attraction of the city. I highly recommend.

Easy to locate and affordable prices.Thank you for providing proper guidance on the local area.Each to reach the market place and the club house's.Hygiene is observed all over in and around.Online bookings are allowed.

My hubby and I went for a quick Valentine’s Day getaway. First time staying at the hotel. I would highly recommend it. Can’t beat the location. The hotel staff at the front desk were amazing. They upgraded us to a larger room with a view of the Hudson. It’s a huge hotel. Would definitely return. For Springsteen fans, it’s right next door to his broadway show. .

We have just returned from 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza and it was perfect! You can not beat the location, right in the heart of Times Square, within walking distance of Central Park and the Rockefeller centre. And the rooms were nice, spacious and well maintained. What really made the experience amazing was the staff. They were all so lovely especially Victoria who checked us in. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning after a 11 hour flight and she tried her best to get us a room as soon as possible. Also as soon as she heard we were there to celebrate my 30th she organised an amazing room for us and gave me special treats :) my husband left his life saving medication in Hawaii and after hearing this Victoria went out of her way to find a clinic for us to go to and get his script filled. I am a travel agent and I will be recommending the Crowne Plaza to all my clients who visit New York. Thank-you Victoria for making our amazing trip that much better :)

This has been my 5th time in NYC. I have stayed in Midtown near Chelsea, Lower east Side, Queens and the Upper West Side. I loved all of my locations because we are a family of 3 and we walk everywhere plus hop on and hop off the subways. We are like the locals, we know our way around and we just love NYC, it is so inspirational. We travelled to NYC Jan 27-30th 2018, to celebrate my husbands 50th Birthday. I chose the Crown Plaza due to its location right in Time Square and we didn't have to go far to do anything. The hotel is beautifully decorated, and always clean. The maids were always at our door waiting to clean our room when we left. We didn't spend much time in the hotel but when you check in you do get 2 vouchers for a free drink up to $15.00, at the restaurant/bar. When I checked in , I had given the lady my name and reservation number, and proceeded to give her my visa card to pay for the resort fee. It declined twice and I said that's ok we will just use my husbands visa. The lady remarked to my husband that " That maybe your girlfriend doesn't have any money in her account", my husband said first of all she is my wife and we share the same bank account. We were both mortified with her words, but it didn't seem to matter to her for being ignorant. I know not all people are like this, so I let it alone and proceeded to go to our hotel room. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. it was nice to have a coffee maker in the room but I wish there were small fridges so we could buy milk or cream for our tea/coffee. We bought a little bottle of milk and placed it in the window to keep cold but went sour. And the other thing was once the day came for us to check out , a knock came to the door around 7am, to pass us our bill for the resort fee, which had been paid when we checked in and the balance was 0. So when my husband checked out at the front desk, they charged us again for the resort fee. I would suggest the agent at the desk please follow up with notes on the confirmation number so things like this would not happen. We had to get to the airport and my husband was at the front desk for over half an hour when it should have only taken 5 minutes. Other than that, I would definitely stay there again, but without the comments or remarks from the agents at the desk and I will make sure there is a follow up with notes on my reservation.

The best hotel I have by far experienced. It's the first time I've been to the United States and first time in New York City. The staff are always smiling, happy to explain things and when I explained we were on a slight budget they discounted our fees. I also came back to the hotel after a long day walking round Times Square and shopping and bus tours, to find they'd left 2 bottles of coke and a cake with a card as a happy birthday! Nothing is too much trouble and house keeping are brilliant!

We wanted to book a five night break in New York to celebreate my 40th birthday and our wedding anniversary, having enjoyed staying at other Crowne Plaza hotels over the years we decided to pick this one right in the heart of Times Square. The location of the hotel really is perfect as you have everything basically on your doorstep - theatres, excellent restaurants and 50th ST subway station to take you downtown. Your a 10 minute walk to the Rockefeller Plaza and about 20 minutes walk to the Empire State building.Our first room had a nice view over the city to the Hudson river. A handle on the window was loose so one side wouldn't close tightly causing a draught with it being on the 26th floor, I guess the work would be too much while we were there so they offered to move us to a room with a view over Times Square, and kindly settled our bar bill also. On our last day our safe developed a fault and would not open, so after a quick call to reception again a lovely chap named Ruben from the hotel security came to reprogram the safe and get our passports and cash out for us. He was an absolute gentleman and kindly gave us vouchers for a buffet breakfast and arranged for a late checkout for us. Because we were normally up and away early we would get breakfast where we were going that morning, we would not have tried the hotel breakfast. I think it is $35 for all you can eat continental, cooked and a good selection of cakes. This was my first time in NY and I absolutely loved it! We are hoping to return next year and if so we will of course come back to the Crowne Plaza Times Square.

Recently stayed here and was satisfied. The location is the best feature. It is smack in the middle of the theatre district and easy walking distance to many shows, stores and restaurants. The price I paid through Priceline was low for a NYC room so I was okay with the fact that the room was shabby. The bathtub literally had a layer of paint peeling off the bottom. The bathroom needs to be redone. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the room is not as small as a typical NYC room. There seemed to be a lot of amenities, such as restaurant, bar and gym, I tried to use the business center but the printer was out of ink for 2 days, although the manager did print for me when I had a need. The blow dryer didn't work and they replaced it. Don't seem like a big deal, but between tipping for the people who helped me print - which was deserved and person who brought me a new dryer, also deserved, it was money I shouldn't have had to spend. I'm really unsure as to whether or not I'll return for my next visit.

A very nice hotel , we had a lovely room with two double beds incredibly deep mattress and very comfortable . My only gripe is a usual one , the tea stroke coffee tray . I know that Americans can't get their heads around anyone wanting to drink tea but we can't be the only British visitors they have ever had. I always take tea bags with me anyway but on asking for fresh milk was told they can't provide it and was presented with some white dust called creamer eventually getting a glass of milk from room service for $5 !!On a positive note we were checked out with a lovely lady called Victoria who is married to a man from Devon .

A great central location but rooms and furnishings could stand a facelift. First room the toilet did not flush properly. Front desk accommodated me with another room and while it was a nice room, headboards in ill repair and since they are fabric and tufted it appears as not the cleanest. No tell tale signs of "critters" but furnishings not in the best repair. Light on desk did not work properly unless you held the harp of the fixture in place. Temperature very chilly and thermostat changes did not seem to hold or function properly. Front desk staff not very friendly and never had a smile on their face. OK you say it's New York... I say a smile goes a long way regardless of where you are. I had just completed a stay at another Crowne Plaza where customer service was SUPERIOR.

Recently returned to the Times Square Crowne Plaza and found the hotel better then ever. Of course the location is the same and perfect for a New York visit. Had the breakfast buffet that was also improved. Our server was Ali and he really made us feel at home. All in all, the hotel is still our Number 1 New York City hotel.

We stayed at Crowne Plaza during NYE 2017 and we got a room facing Times Square. Even though it was partial view but we still can see the concert stage with videotron, no ball drop view. We are so thankful to get this room because the weather outside during NYE 2017 was bitterly cold with temperature almost minus 20C. Check in was long due to full booked hotel during NYE. The hotel gave bracelet to wear all time during NYE because of tight security around Times Square area. With no hotel bracelet, we couldn't access to the hotel. Room is spacious with two queen beds and a bit dated but well maintained. Even though outside is cold, our room is warm enough which make us decide to stay at room. We didn't take breakfast because of long waiting lines. People at Crowne Plaza work professionally and handle all their guests even during busy NYE event without any problem. They also quick to response for any request we had during our stay on Dec 31, 2017. Hopefully we can return to this hotel if we are in New York because of execellent service and fantastic location in Times Square.

Stayed here for four nights in January and it is in a perfect location for all the major sights and razzmatazz of New York. I am an IHG member which was recognised and had requested a king bed but on arrival there were non available so we were given 2 queen beds which was rather disappointing as I had sent the request months previous.The room had a good view over New York and was in a quiet hallway. It was slightly shabby but very comfy and the bathroom was super clean with lots of nice toiletries and towels etc. We were given vouchers for free drinks at the bar and telephone calls were free and you get the use of the sports club. All the staff were helpful and friendly especially the concierge desk and doormen. We used the Grind cafe where they serve good coffee and breakfast/ snack items. Housekeeping was very good and efficient and overall we enjoyed our stay here.

Never been so dissatisfied with the customer service of a hotel. Crowne Plaza part of IHG group, you would expect minimum standards and service levels to be met by such a reputable chain...Not so at this Hotel. Checked in given our first room of which was tired run down and filthy. Complained, demanded a manager of which it took almost an hour for one to come, she looked at room and agreed it was unacceptable. She went away... more waiting. New set of keys sent up but not by a Manager as you would expect with such a serious issue, you would expect a manager after such a serious complaint to personally come with you to your new room to ensure it was up to standard and your guests are happy, not at this 4 star Crowne Plaza. Made our way to the new room, on our way the lift dropped a floor and shuddered between the 25/26 Floor... we were petrified. We got out of the lift shaking went to the new room to calm reception. The room cards wouldn’t work to the new room. Tried to call for help on the phone by the lifts and waited over ten minutes in a queuing system!!!. Exposed bed what happened absolutely no care in the world. A new set of keys sent up by yes you’ve guessed anyone other than a Manager ... A security officer after another long wait. What a complete joke!. Got to new room, awful room was tired and scruffy. Tried to get a Manager and more difficulty, the customer service at reception had to message management who finally spoke to us after a further long wait. Was told no other rooms and pretty much told had no choice but to stay and we would be moved the next day. Yes we were moved the next day to a much more satisfactory room, however we were only on a 3 night break and it took almost 3 hours after check in to get to a clean room after all the waiting around and trying to speak to Management. The general attitude of staff at this hotel throughout the remainder of our stay was dreadful. Another poor example of customer service was one of the many occasions room cards stopped working. There was a huge q at reception, went to the gold priority area where there was a female member of staff who told me to go join the q rather than simply rectify the issue. At breakfast you would think they would explain the procedure rather than just sit you at a table... it was a buffet but the buffet was completely out of sight so you couldn’t work out where it is unless you ate told!. On check out there was no question about did we enjoy our trip, cab we assist you in any travel arrangements to the airport etc, just simply leave the keys there!This hotel is an embarrassment to the IHG group, do not go expecting a decent 4 star hotel with good service just because it’s got Crowne Plaza over the door. You wouldn’t believe we were paying guests the attitude of the staff there.

Beautiful hotel. Centrally located right on Broadway in Times Square. Great restaurant. Great Grab 'n Go food for quick meals to take to your room or out with you. Exceptional check-in, check-out, baggage handling.

Stayed here and went to a Broadway Show. Great price, clean room and great service. Clwae view if Times Square from room. Left a valuable behind and it was found and sent to me within days. Highly recommend and thanks again Al!

Ana was very nice with Our family and friends, the rooms were very clean and confortables all the time. The service of the restaurant was excellent, their address was perfect and had a good view, and was close to every thing.Thanks!

I must say that my stay at Crown Plaza was just amazing & super perfect as it's located right at the Times Square and you must stay here if you are visiting for the first time, as you wouldn't want to miss anything at all.I would love to stay here again whenever I plan NYC trip.BTW our room facing Times Square was cherry on the cake. It will be expensive but worth it... Everything is so close from Crown Plaza, you are in good hands if you stay here.See you Soon! :)

Stayed at the Crowne Plaza celebrating my 50th year, while taking in Springsteen on Broadway. Got a great deal on the Penthouse suite with amazing customer service from Rocco at the check in desk. We spoke briefly about our visit and we were thrilled when we were surprised with room service delivery of cake and champagne, pre-show! True class! The hotel was steps away from Walter Kerr which made our stay simply easy and safe. Valet Parking was convenient, though priced for NYC. Highly recommended!

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square this weekend for my birthday. The front desk person made sure we got a nice room with a great city/river view. We had drinks and az great Margarhetta pizza in the lobby bar for lunch. The hotel was really clean, the room was big with a king size bed and a great shower. We also worked out in the NYSC gym, which was huge by NY standards. Thanks to the front desk manager! Awesome hotel for a great NYC stay!
user_name:
Frank B
East Meadow, New York

review_body: My mom came for a mid-week/mid-winter visit. Our goal was to take advantage of NYC's winter restaurant week and Broadway week. Because this is an unpopular time to come to town (cold) I was able to book a 2 bed room here for about $110 night a night. It was a steal. Victoria checked us in and she was a complete delight. While we chatted a corner room opened up and she switched us into it. She was very friendly and made my mom feel like a VIP. Our corner windows over looked Time Square with clear views of the Empire State Building. 30 floors up, we couldn't hear a thing from street level. The bedroom room and bathroom were well appointed and VERY large by NYC standards. The beds were very comfortable and clean. The room over all needed some TLC as the wall paper was peeling in the bathroom and the shower didn't work as well as we'd like.We didn't eat on site - but we did get coffees from the Grind and it was quite good.
user_name:
Terry Lynn L
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here on my first visit ever to New York. Check-in was efficient and I was welcomed back as a Spire Ambassador member. I did think it was strange that Ambassador members don't get water in their rooms daily. Minor niggle. My Times Square view room was nice. Clean and a decent size. I was slightly wary that I would be disturbed from the noice below but being on the 40th floor, I heard nothing and I slept like a baby!Breakfast is great - a massive selection of food and some friendly staff. The bar staff are similar - a credit to the hotel. The bar has some nice views over the streets below - great for people watching. The service in the bar is very good - as soon as as server sees you have sit down, they are straight over to introduce themselves and ask what they can get you. Unfortunately the hotel couldn't give me a late check out which would have come in handy. Again, minor niggle. So, a good hotel. 5 mins walk from Times Square which is really handy. I would definitely return if I was back in New York.

We stayed in the Crowne Plaza for 4 nights Its a nice hotel and very central. We stayed on the 36th floor which had great views of the city. The hotel has a nice bar and was very clean and tidy. Time Square is a great location for broadway shows bars and restaurants it can get a bit hectic outside but it’s nice to be in the middle of the action for a few night. You can walk to Central Park in about 15 mins or get subway. Central station is about 10 mins walk and Maddison square garden is about 10 mins walk. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The picture is a view from our hotel room
user_name:
Ross M
New York City, New York

review_body: Located in the heart of Time Square this hotel is the place to be. Hundreds of things are walkable. Short 10 minute walk to Rockefeller square to see the Christmas tree and ice skating rink. Any broadway show is walkable along with 100’s of restaurant choices. The rooms are also great and quite large for Manhattan standards. If you want to be in the heart of the city then this is the place to be.

Great hotel in a convenient location on Times Square and near Restaurant Row. Room and bathroom were large and clean. Fantastic breakfast buffet though a bit pricey, so eat up - Tofael the server was terrific!

We visited New York on the spur of the moment Stayed in the crowne plaza Times Square Excellently situated for any activity in New York Spoke to managing director Nile’s Great team he has produced for this hotel every member of staff are excellent in their courtesy to customer care Could not do more for our comfort and expectations Rooms large and spacious immaculately presented Nile’s thank you for making our stay excellentWe will return

Went to NYC for a mother & daughter birthday trip. The hotel has a great location. The room was a good size, no different than others. We had a Times Square view (don't try to sleep with the window open). It was in need of maintenance. The tub was peeling, the toilet roll holder was coming off the wall. But other than being a little dated it was clean.

We book the hotel online for 165.00 booking.com be aware they add the following to your bill state tax, city occupancy taxoccupancy tax - NYS Javits center feeservice fee $30.00 service fee taxesservice fee city tax so the real cost per night is 227.25 not 165.00so at this price i would have stayed at the new York Marriott Marquis without all the invented taxes and fee's undisclosed to the customer..look elsewhere is recommended , you can do allot better

I have been to New York a dozen times in the last 2 years. Have stayed at many hotels. My fifth time at the crown plaza. Large clean rooms, great staff. Excellent bang for your dollar. Will definitely be coming back again and again.

The Crown Plaza hotel made our stay great. It was my sons first trip to New York for his birthday. Victoria (front of house) welcomed us both. Gave us a great room with a view of the square. I had booked a king room but she swapped us out to a double twin which was much more comfortable. The room was clean and really nice. Victoria even gave us a compimentary breakfast for my sons birthday. The hotel is central to everything and reasonsbly priced. Thank you Crown Plaza.

Have not stayed here for a couple of years and the place has suffered from lack of maintenance. In my room the wallpaper was peeling off in places, the headboards on the beds were scuffed and the finish coming off, the towel rack in the bathroom is falling out of the wall, etc. The common spaces seemed reasonably maintained but my room was not in the best shape. The location is convenient if you want the insane Times Square experience, but it's not quiet -- as many Manhattan hotels are not. Please note this: if you need transportation to an airport, do NOT take what the bellmen try to push as the "hotel car." I did not use it because it was about 30-50% more expensive than a taxi, but the taxi driver I had told me that these are not really "hotel cars." They are black cars driven by independent drivers who work out a kickback deal with the bellmen who get money for every time they put a guest into the "hotel car" for a trip to the airport. Apparently this happens at a lot of NYC hotels, so be cautious. These "hotel cars" also want cash and claim not to have credit card capability. That is so they can keep the cash and not report it on taxes. Take a taxi or Uber.

The Crown Plaza Times Square is my ideal hotel in New York. The location within the theatre district enables me and my spouse to attend as many theatre plays as time allows without any question of transportation. The hotel staff is very helpful, rooms are very comfortable, breakfast is great.I always come bback to this hotel.

Location is excellent, room was surprisingly quiet. Check-in and Check-out were smooth. They quickly replaced the TV remote as the batteries were dead. Would definitely stay here again! Got a good package through Expedia.

We spent two nights at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. We’ve stayed here before and, liking the proximity to theaters, we chose it again. We are Spire Ambassadors. We do expect a standard of care with that status. We were disappointed with the lack of attention and care. Upon arrival, there was no one available to help with our luggage. We unloaded our bags, pulled them inside, and the proceeded up the elevator. Other reviewers note the lack of early check in. We experienced this as well. While they held our bags for us, they didn’t text when the room was available, as they promised. So, the whole arrival and check-in process was fumbled. Our room was nice and comfortable. There are no complaints about that. Unfortunately, this Crowne doesn’t offer bathrobes in the rooms, a small luxury that is noticeably missed. Our biggest complaint is the climate control. Other reviewers noted this problem as well. THE ROOMS WERE TOO HOT! The solution - open the window - is hardly reassuring, and because the windows only crack open, it took over 24 hours for our room to cool. So we spent our first night in relative discomfort. The bar area is nice with a fine selection. Service was a bit slow, but we attribute that to either being under-staffed or unexpectedly busy. All in all, it was an average stay. Management should take note of these issues and work to correct them as quickly as possible.
user_name:
BRIANandRONNIE2010
New York City, New York

review_body: Had a great breakfast buffet and excellent service from Tofael, and the view from the dining room was right into Times Square. The hotel price in the winter is quite moderate, and the building is in very good condition well-maintained, excellent front desk. And Tofael!

Outstanding food but more importantly outstanding service by Tofael. Was here a few times before. I Always ask for Tofael to be my waiter. He’s very very good. Top notch. Pays attention to detail. Always pleasant and kind. Would give him 10 stars if I could. I miss the made to order omelets which they used to have at the buffet but always very good and fresh food. If you come ask for Tofael.

I occasionally travel with my boyfriend when he travels for work. I had never been to NYC so navigating alone while he was working was a bit intimidating. Not only the location of the hotel, but the service made my first big apple experience incredible. I felt so safe walking to and from the hotel due to its proximity to everything and we were greeted by our new friend Tofael every morning for breakfast. He was a great asset for directions/suggestions and truly gave 5 star service. This hotel was excellent and we will undoubtedly be coming here whenever we travel to NY.

Its really in center location hotel..near by all transportation..nice breakfast..very good staff..in kitchen.Feel like home..its really nice hotel to stay with family.rooms arewith goods view.its really good hotel.to stay..mr.TOFAEL IS NICE GUY..TO HELP GUEST.

Very good stay for the week at a conference. 2 blocks to the conference at the Marriott Marquis yet significant price difference. I would do this again. Central location and easy walk to everything in the Times Square area.

So reserved a suite as we have done before with early check in. We got here and no early Check in. Ok no problem. Our “suite” was 2 bedrooms with an adjoiningDoor. Each room ridiculous. We tried to get a manager which took 4 phone calls and we were given voucher for 2 drinks and breakfast. Wait, there’s more-the rooms were 76 degrees! We called because air conditioner not working. We were told to open the window and turn off the thermostat. Roasted all night. So very disappointing.

Grateful to Victoria and Rocco at the front desk for their kind help as I checked-out; they prepped my room for a second visit later in the week with my preferences and I enjoyed speaking with Victoria about her visits as a child to my home area. She was genuinely kind and personable, as was the great front desk agent who checked me in the day prior. I was under the weather, and she managed to find an open room for me, despite an unexpected early check-in. Many thanks to a top-of-the-line front desk team for your extra welcome and efforts!

Location, location and location. The room rates are pricey but is worth it. Larger room and bathroom. Excellent buffet breakfast and what else, you are in Times Square! Remember to ask for a higher floor to see the view,

They so professional very helpfully and smile no matter how hard your trip they make your stay comfortable and fast check in room so clean specially bathroom .room size it's good for 4 person. Views excellent thank you to make are stay wonderfull ps they sold aut but they give attention for everyone

We got a really good deal with this hotel in the middle of times square! It was the perfect location for our 5 day NYC holiday. The rooms were comfortable and big, they were cleaned daily and the maids were really efficient. We were lucky to have breakfast included which was a delicious array of american andn continental cuisine with something for everyone. We really enjoyed the choice of pancakes, french toast or waffles changing daily with maple syrup and bacon! My partner enjoyed his smoked salmon and cream cheese bagels too. Breakfast was filling so we usually filled up on that for most of the day! Check in was efficient, and we managed to check in at 2pm rather than the 3pm it states. Our room overlooked the School of Rock Theatre and Ellens Stardust Diner. Breakfast room overlooked M&M world, and the hotel bar overlooked other parts of times square. We were give tokens for a welcome drink which was a lovely touch too. Although we didnt use it the hotel does have a sports club and swimming pool which is included in your additional rates you pay at the end of the holiday. Overall, i would recommend this hotel again especially if it is on offer, as its location is unbeatable!Tip: As its america remember that the room rate you pay is not the final total you need to add daily service charges and tax too which you will pay at the end!

The Hotel is very well located in heart of time square. Its very accessible to get ro tarin station or siteseeing bus or walk through the city centre and no needing to take any taxi to go around unless needful. We arrived at lunchtime but were not busy in check-in and were very quick and smooth however there is no smile or welcome which you always expect or get when you go to any hotels. Im a part of IHG Rewards club points but i was never asked and i had to mention that and then she put my membership number on system. The check-in lady explained that we get free wifi and phone calls were included in our room rate. However not told anything about breakfast and is location, rates and times. Also hotel facilities were not explained e.g. pool and gym access which i didnt know they had one until checkout. The basic introduction was missing about the hotel. Guess had to figure it out myself. The rooms were very spacious and we had 2 double beds with a time square view which was amazing as per how be booked. The bathroom was nice with bath tub and good hot water. Housekeeping was prompt and very well. Breakfast option was continental and American. We went for full American breakfast which costed us $35 after tax per person. There was good selection of hot foods but no bake beans or omelette but usual bacon, sausages, scrambled egg, pouched egg, coldMeats, various selections of cheese and soup and salads. The boulevard bar is lovely which is located in the hotel lobby and has good selection of cocktails with a lovely view of timeSquare area. Remember in usa every prices shown are before tax hence you have to calculate final amount to get accurate value.The hotel is easily accessible from airport as we took a shared bus shuttle from outsideJfk arrival to penn station (about $20) and walk to hotel about 15mins walk or you can catch any yellow cab from penn station to hotel (less than $10) or jfk to hotel (more expensive >$65 plus tip) the journey about 45mins from airport to penn station. The hotel vicinity has good selection of restaurants around offering variety of cuisines. On our last day we had options of taxis to get to airport e.g. a yellow cab, an airport prebooked shuttles online, or hotel suv cabs which you can get from reception at entrance of hotel. It worked out $8 diff between yellow can and suv private cab hence we took suv private cab which was ready on time with our name board early morning 4am as we were couple it worked out reasonable for us $42 pp. checkout however was quick but on receiving the checkout bill i was charged for accommodation and my hotel was already prepaid. Luckily I noticed so please check bills carefully. On my booking i was mention inhave to pay $30 per night service fee but then on receiving invoice i saw that i had to pay for tax on service fee plus city tax hence it was about $5 so total is $35 per day extra on top of your hotel booking payment. It was then I understood what services fee was for and that included pool use, gym use and telephone calls, WIFI. However this was never explained on check in and my hotel room pre-paid rate had free wifi included and regarding pool and gym was never told hence never accessed it but i felt i paid for something i didn’t use which was mandatory as service fee. At checkout there were no apologies for the incorrect charge but also “no smile or thank you for staying with crowne plaza” which i always hear when i stayed in other crowne plaza hotels and IHG partners over the world. I also heard when going that the checkout person was discussing that i was complaining about service fee and service and city taxes and accommodation incorrect charges with another colleague. This was our experience at crowne plaza times square Manhattan. Overall had a good time New York and had good comfortable Rooms and housekeeping.

Myself and 5 friends visited New York for my friends 40th birthday. We stayed here for 4 nights and it was amazing. The staff were so friendly and very helpful especially Jim the conasuare. The beds were pure heaven and the room very very clean. I will be back again.

Would highly recommend this hotel. Rooms are spacious and beds are very comfortable. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Sandra Esp checked us in and was very friendly and polite. She also kindly gave us a room over looking Times Square and informed us of all the hotels facilities :)

Stayed here for the first time for three nights while my daughter was in the city for college auditions. Great location, super convenient to all that the Theater District/Times Square has to offer. The majority of theaters will be a 5-10 minute walk. Even the south end of Central Park and Columbus Square can be reached in 15-20 minutes walking. Same with Rockefeller Center and MoMA. Loved that part of it.About the hotel itself. The room was a bit more spacious than other hotels we've stayed in for not that much more. The room was clean, smelled good, and there were no glaring signs of wear and tear. The bed was super comfy. One of my favorite hotel beds ever. And pillows that didn't mush down to nothing. That's a big deal for me. Always hot water for a shower. Everything in good working order. Very pleasant experiences with front desk, housekeeping, and bell services.There is a grab and go section with reasonably priced items just off the lobby near the elevators. The lounge also had some well priced food and beverage choices. I didn't look into the more fine dining restaurant. Also didn't try the fitness center. Believe there was a $10 charge to use. Had a room toward the end of the hall and never heard the elevator or inside noises. You are right off Times Square and will hear some sirens and such from time to time. Still, got good sleep. That's the trade-off for being so close, right?Several good restaurants within walking distance (Carmine's, Juniors and loads more). A Starbucks a block and a half down Broadway. Convenience is a big reason to stay here.

This place is great... love the staff and the amenities are great. I had only one issue. The shower curtain and the hooks were very cheap. The hooks had rust. Why would a hotel with this level of service god cheap like this. This hotel has a great location for all you would need to do in nyc. You are in walking distance to all major attractions. You guys were great but, the little things are important... keep up the good work and I hope you guys make those small changes. Thanks

Hotels should be service business. CP times square is just business. It is hard to complain about the service as it doesn't really exist.Funny how you just feel like a pain to the employees, disturbing their cell phone activities.Not only the front desk folks but also the concierges appear angry and annoyed if you dare to ask a question. Assume the hotel survives because of the great location that doesn't get more central.Rooms are quire small compared to US standards.I do acknowledge that thisbisba very busy hotel and don't really need to please guests as they will be there anyway, BUT I wouldn't pick it again.One exception though - staff at breakfast were actually quite human and the 2 stars is dedicated to those guys.
