Otherwise it would have been 1 for location.

I loved this place. We go every year at this time and I am always looking for a hotel that I can return to yearly . I have found it I don't plan on looking for a deal anywhere else !.... Pretty , clean , centrally located , nice staff, and a couple of free drinks in the lobby bar . I can't wait until next year.

We very much enjoyed our stay. The restaurant were breakfast was served had great staff. Especially a server named Tofael. He was very courteous and polite. The breakfast was included with our stay we ate well in the morning and last until the evening the food was well cooked and tasted perfect

Stayed here from 16th Jan to 21 Jan with my husband and 18 year old son. Fantastic location and breakfast was great with exceptional service from Tofael. Very attentive and polite. Would recommend a stay!

Husband & I drove to NYC for a Sunday matinee Stories by Heart starring John Lithgow. Once we found the entrance for the hotel it was also the parking garage I had found online & had a coupon for. Luggage check-in very easy. Needed early checkin to obtain a card to use restrooms. Received coupon for complimentary drink and was greeted warmly at reception desk. Went to show, returned, checked in and decided to stay here at Broadway 49. Had hummus & pita and the salt & pepper calamari. Both were delicious. Easy walk in the am to the TODAY show. Good coffee at Grind & Co.
user_name:
Patricia P
Albany, New York, United States

review_body: Just returned from a fabulous 4 nights at the Crowne Plaza, this is our 4th trip back and was not disappointed! Check in was quick, rooms big and clean...the hotel was amazing however, the staff absolutely made our trip! The manager Karim was friendly and made a point of taking time to speak to us, and the bar staff were fab! Martin and Kim were our bartenders who were fun and very lovely and chatty and then Tony & Japhey (aka vin diesel) were great fun! Absolutely made our holiday! Can’t wait to return! Great job Crowne Plaza Times Square you should be proud of the fab team you have! We will return!!

Well, a lovely hotel room, very cosy and the room had great views. The cleaning service everyday was great. The same could not be said for the breakfast, poor coffee, average foods, not great when you are paying top dollar for the stay.The concierge, well a mixed experience, the theater booking to a broadway musical (Aladin) was amazing.However the suggestion for the booze cruise for New Years night was horrible and miserable, aswell as a rip off at $150 each!We would have been better to watch the Times Square atmosphere from our lovely high up bedroom window.The concierge also booked us in at a local Italian which was above average food but a total rip off at $168 for two of us eating off the normal menu.- Hotel room great - Avoid breakfast- Careful with concierge giving bad info and booking you into places which they get a back hander and you get a bad experience. - Swimming pool is in a poor state and cold water.

The staff ruin this hotel. They are rude, unhelpful and discourteous and it begins at the front desk. I have written a review about this before and management clearly do not respond; despite their protestations that they will. We did the new year’s eve pen package...what a scam. Extortionate waste of money for mediocre food and a pointless and unentertaining disco. Asking staff what was happening was pointless. Our event was in the ballroom...the guest services person on the telephone sent us to the wrong floor; the security people, by the concierge desk didn’t know where anything was happening. Despite paying $1000 per person to get a wrist band to go in the pen, there were people in there with no wrist bands or the wrong colour wrist bands. Breakfast is chaotic and the restaurant is clearly too small for a full hotel with queues of 15 to 20 minutes every morning and the food is not that good and the service is poor. The only redeeming feature about this hotel, is its location. Get a grip IHG.

We have been here for only 5 days, and we had a great time. The Hotel Is in a really good location if u are looking for a centric place, the rooms are clean and the staff is nice and helpful. We didn't like the first room that they showed us they changed without any problem. We really recommend this place. Have nice holidays ;)

You couldn't be more central as right in Times Square, although this created delays getting to/from the airport as traffic is manic there. Allow plenty of time when booking your journey. Entrance is hard to spot as only a small door then upstairs to reception. We got upgraded to large corner room with views over the Square. We didn't hear any traffic noise though. Bed comfortable, hairdryer, toiletries. Was unimpressed by the tea making option... Great internet connection. Downside of hotel is small size of bar/restaurant. This seems the only seating so seats often taken by non drinking or eating people. However plenty of other options close by. Staff always very friendly & helpful. Location was perfect for walking to main sights. Loved our short break.
user_name:
Di B
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

review_body: Great place right next door to the Walter Kerr theater. Friendly staff, clean hotel, not a single complaint. Buffet breakfast was nice and 2 free drinks at the bar... If you are staying in NYC for any of the big shows, this place was in a great location.

My wife and I spent 3 nights at the hotel right in the heart of theatre land. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast excellent. When Victoria on the desk heard that we were here from London celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary when enquiring about a parcel I was expecting, she said that that the hotel were not aware of this. She went on to say that anniversaries are very important and gave us complimentary drinks to the hotel bar and breakfast. Thanks for making our stay not only comfortable, but very memorable and me getting my parcel from family in Miami delivered to my room.

Stayed here for a college orientation that was held in the hotel. Room was clean and comfortable but a bit on the small side but I guess that is typical for most NYC hotels. We did not eat at the hotel because there are so many other options in the area which gave us a chance to walk around.

Stayed here with my parents for 5 nights. We were early to check in, and knew our room would not be ready and were just looking to leave our bags and go explore. The reception staff were very welcoming and apologetic for our room not being ready (no apology was needed) and they gave us free breakfast vouchers for the inconvenience. We stayed in double room, and reception gave us a city view room which was fantastic. Being 3 adults we were concerned about the space in one room - however we didn't need to worry there was plenty of room. Breakfast was a buffet and lots of selection and food was good. The hotel was situated right across from m&m shop on Times Square and was in a fabulous location for exploring. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

the location of this hotel is awesome in the heart of times square, we visited between xmas and new year and the hotel was extremely busy. checkin was quick . the service at the hotel was great. rooms were huge as we were 4 adults sharing, huge thumbs up crowne plaza, oh did I forget to mention the telephone calls are free to anywhere in the world ! I will definitely stay here again when next in the Big Apple. crown plaza you are highly recommended !

Centred in busy Time Square. Expect huge crowds when you exit. The hotel is situated opposite M & M building which is also the stop for Big Bus tours. Numerous metro stops are within a 100m walking distance so it is easy to access most tourist attractions. The Rockefeller centre, radio city, restaurants are also close by. For the metro, it is cheaper to buy a 3 or 5 day pass if you are visiting a few tourist places. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. It was simpler to pop out and have breakfast.The beds were comfortable. Even though we were on a high floor the emergency siren services could be easily heard through the night.We found most of the front desk receptionists a little abrupt and rude. However house keeping were always smiling and pleasant.

rooms:3/5 location:5/5bathroom:2/3lobby:2/3pool and gym:3/3service:3/3exterior design:2/2extra:5/16 (large hotel, skyscraper, view, multiple dining, full gym)total:29/40-price:600-2300/rooms:795/stars:4my rating (experience): Good

My husband and I absolutely love the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan! We visit the city numerous times throughout the year and will not stay anywhere else. The rooms are clean, the security is top rated, and the restaurant and bar are ran to perfection! We had the privilege of meeting James who is new to the Food and Beverage Team last week, what a great asset he will be! My husband and I can't wait to return in March to celebrate our "30th" wedding anniversary.

The Hotel is in a Perfect spot, right in the middle of Times Square. Close to everything. Theaters, Restaurants, Department Stores. Shopping, there is literally everything you need close by. I would definitely recommend (and stay again). Hotel staff was great, Brunhilda was a delight at check in; Thank You!. Hotel offered to hold my bags since I had a later flight than my check out so that was a definite plus for me (more shopping).

I have been staying at Crowne Plaza for a long time, and I generally land quite early and its has been absolutely a dream when Sandra checks me in.She is pleasent and does everything to accomodate your needs including early check inThanks Sandra

Stayed here in December for my partners birthday. The location of this hotel was amazingThe attentiveness of the staff wasn’t so impressive - on arrival we mentioned it was a birthday visit. Most hotels I’ve been to normally would have done something just small to notice this to show that they are interested. The hotel didn’t even acknowledge this (which to me made me feel not very impressed) Paid for a Times Square view, we were on a very low room with not such a great view. We asked after checking in if we could have a room on a higher floor as it was noisy and the reviews say the higher the room the less noise, also I’d imagine the views would be a lot better the higher up. We were told they’d let us know the next day if there was any more availability on a higher floor, we heard nothing more from the hotel so just left it. Feel it was a lot of money for this hotel and didn’t feel the staff made it feel worth it. However I would recommend this hotel for the location and also the room was nice. Just try and get a higher room if you are paying extra for the Times Square view. They took money from our card without letting us know and we have tried getting in contact with the hotel since as we would like this money back and we have heard nothing back after trying to contact them numerous times - this is highly disappointing and not what you would expect from this type of hotel.

I give three stars because of the location which is a stone throw away from Times Square. However, the check-in procedure was horrible because the room given was occupied by a couple! We were surprise when we were able to open the door and someone is already sleeping (around 11pm). What if those guest did something to us? How about if we place on their situation, if we are deeply asleep and someone just walked in to the room and get all our things? The system needs to be reviewed

Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and daughter , we were on the 23rd floor and the room was lovely , great views , the room was cleaned every day , we were barely in it , went out first thing in the morning and back late at night , so much to do and see , this hotel is in a perfect location , would defiantly come back and recommend to friends

Been to NYC many times, never stayed at this hotel. GREAT location, Juniors is right across the street and Ellen's Stardust Diner is only 2 blocks and several quick blocks to the theatre. And Lillie's, the most beautiful bar is on the same street. Perfect!Checked in with a sick young adult son, sadly he stayed in the room. I told housekeeping that he was in the room, no need to clean it because he is sick and my daughter and I would be out for awhile. The housekeeper came by and was SO NICE!!! Gave him extra tissue, cups for medicine and was very kind to him, said ring if you need anything. Then when it was time to leave allowed for a late check out so he wouldn't have to get out of bed.So grateful for a caring and kind staff!!!As for the hotel, excellent security, nice restaurant, breakfast buffet was very good, the beds are VERY comfortable, awesome shower water pressure! And again the location was great! I was a little worried about some replies and photos. Yes, the headboards are a little weathered from people leaning up against them. But the room is clean, comfortable.We will definitely be back!

Pros: The location was excellent for us, and I was surprised at how client our room was even though we looked out over times square. We were on 35th floor. I am a light sleeper and still found it quiet. We were there for a play that was just next door. The room even has a window that opens which was nice to cool it off. Room temp was too warm and would have been described under "cons" except that with window open, the room cooled off. (Had to close window to sleep/keep noise out, but left open during day.)Cons: Bell hop experience in getting taxi--to go to Newark for early morning departure. I asked for a taxi, and he kept trying to persuade me to take the "hotel car". I asked several times for a taxi, and he never did call a taxi for me. The hotel car would have been more expensive, and he kept telling me I would have to pay for tolls over and back with taxi--not the case, and the toll is like $1.25. I did not have to pay it. I took an uber which was easy to set up--and $30 less expensive that the "hotel car".

The front door is directly on Times Sq so you’re staying in the chaos and noise that surrounds it.A wide mix of guests - many with mobility scooters.A popular Gym used by the locals was very well equipped.Lovely sauna and steam. Thrilling room view looking down on the masses of people.

Loved the hotel location. Times Square right there, shows around every corner and Hells Kitchen with a ton of amazing little restaurants just 2-3 blocks west. Definitely check it out! Food at hotel okay. A little dated, but, every thing worked fine and was clean. We used the pool but forgot swim caps - you must wear swim caps. We wore the shower caps in the room. Not the greatest look for us but we had fun & pics were hilarious. Kids loved just walking around looking at the lights every where.

This was an amazing hotel in an amazing city. We had the best week of my life. I would go back like a shot.Hotel was huge, clean and trendy. We were on a high floor in a family room with river views. Lovely to come back to a clean comfy room after a long hot day exploring. City tax was a strange one. We had a cocktail or 2 in the bar and people watched. We didn't have breakfast as wanted to explore the food joints. A fridge in the room would have been good. But all in all an amazing hotel in the middle of Times Square. Try it you won't be dissappointed!

I just visited the Crown Plaza, I had a free night and thought I'd get a so so room but to my surprise I was greeeted like a queen, they gave me a room on the 45th floor, the view was amazing, we had a discounted breakfast, drinks and a real pleasant stay. Our check out with Victoria was flawless. It was great.
user_name:
BobbiB64
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for four nights over new year, so a busy time. We had a room on the 43rd floor with amazing views. It was a great size and very clean. No fridge, or coffe, just a herbal tea sachet, improvements could be made here. We had vouchers for breakfast for ten dollars each which was good value. However the usual price of 32 dollars, you would be disappointed. It was a good breakfast but needed to be warmer. The heating system in the room was also very noisy..The hotel is in a fantastic location in Times Square you are so near to everything. The lifts are great, super quick. The staff were always friendly. I would definitely stay again. Loved it.

The location of this hotel is great, but this hotel should be completely ashamed of itself for the $30 daily mandatory "Service Charge." This charge is supposed to cover things like the pool, gym, and internet... What is the point of being an IHG platinum member then? Internet is supposed to be IHG rewards members, by the way. I will never again stay in a hotel that imposes these types of scam "service" or "location" charges. It's bad enough when a hotel in Florida or Hawaii has a "resort" charge, but to move these charges (just under a different name) to NYC is ridiculous. The hotel/chain should make the daily rate $30 higher if they are going to do this. By putting this charge as a service charge instead of including it in their daily rate, the hotel may find itself ranking better in search results because it looks like their rates are cheaper. They are also banking on people not paying close enough attention during the booking process. If you stay a full week at this property you may end up with a $210 extra unexpected charge.

I have travelled a lot in the past and this hotel is one of the worse experiences I ever had with a hotel. The staff is super rude and even so they are 5 of them at the desk they wouldn’t start checking people in or asking how they can help . I seats we had got a rude answer and had to wait 40 mins with other people to be ready to check in and ask for local advise. Such a let down! For that price you find mich better hotels close by. Our room had a broken window and cold air was blowing in. It was so noisy that I had a hard time sleeping. The floor was so uneven that you would feel a bit drunk while walking around the room and the tap was broken off. The staff at the front desk did not help to fix the problem, fortunately the Handy man of the hotel is very friendly and helped us out. Another let down was the gym and pool. They were reserved for people and you couldn’t use it. I’m very into sports and the pool and gym was one main reason why we booked the place.Please don’t wast your money and good mood on this Hotel!

Nice hotel in a good location. We stayed two nights over New Years Eve. We had some trouble checking in due to New Years Eve security but overall had a pleasant experience. Talked to managing director Neils Harris about the problems we had and he dealt with it very professionally and quickly. He truly cares about his guests. Also had a great experience with the super friendly concierge staff.

This hotel is right in the centre of the times square, close to broadway and a number of subway lines. The hotel room was a good size and quiet, we stayed on the 37th floor where the bed was comfortable, great block out blinds and housekeeping was good. There is no bar fridge or minibar which i found inconvenient however. There was a coffee maker and herbal tea provided. I was provided black tea when I asked. There is also a resort fee here of $30USD per day, which I was not aware as I had booked through a travel agent, but you don't really get anything for this other than free wifi. I really find additional fees like this frustrating as I find it deceiving when it is not added into the price when booking, considering its another fee/tax that must be paid upon staying. The other challenge I faced was that the printing in the business centre did not work, creating stress when I needed to print tickets off for that night. After waiting forever in line at the lobby, a really lovely staff member who worked in concierge printed them for me. Overall, the hotel is quite well priced given its location and provides most of what you need for a comfortable stay.

We staying here from 17 November for four nights, the hotel is huge, we were on the top floor, 46th corner room looking onto great sights of NY. As this is a huge hotel there are separate lifts for part of the hotel, our life started at the ground floor, only stopping once then continuing to the 15th floor upwards. It has a small takeout area which sells breakfast and cakes etc as well as drinks. The hotel bar is amazing the good is great, very large portions and the cocktails are amazing. We sat here, watching the world go by, great view of Times Square.Housekeeping was good and left extra towels when we asked. The room was always clean.The Christmas tree and Christmas decorations were beautifulReception area is large enough, check in was very quick with us receiving a free upgrade. On leaving on the morning of our departure day, we gave our luggage to Bell Services who were again excellent and went out for the day collecting this later at night and taking one of the hotels town cars to the airport.

The location was very good. Everything was walking distance which I loved it. the hotel has nice lobby bar and restaurants as well. Only thing we were disappointed was housekeeping services... We stayed for 3 nights. 1st morning, housekeeping called us and asked if we want our room to be cleaned... I was so confused why they even asked such a question to woke us up in the morning?!?!?! and 2nd day, we called housekeeping before we left a room to ensure they clean our room. However, when we came back at 6 pm, nothing was done.... We called housekeeping and asked why they did not clean the room and she had no idea. So, we had to go to front desk and spoke to front desk manager (i think her name was Alison). She said she will go speak to a housekeeping manager personally and get it done... But after they have cleaned our room, the garbage was left on the floor and an empty soda bottle which was not ours was on the floor.... the bed sheet has blood stain.... I must say the hotel's housekeeping management is horrible....

Can’t beat the location. Shame the hotel has closed the entrance onto Broadway. Access to reception is by escalator which is a bit messy with bags. Rooms good and well appointed but not very soundproof. $10 Buffett breakfast for platinum members was good. Good service for transport to airport.

Stayed at this hotel in November on a 4night 5day break as it was our first time in New York. The hotel itself is in an excellent location central to everything. When we arrived around 5.30pm we were told the room was not ready which I found extremely odd as we had booked well in advance through Expedia. We were given a token for 1 drink at the bar by way of compensation but quite frankly all we wanted to do was go to our room and have a shower as we had been travelling for 15 hours from the UK. When we eventually got to the room I went into the bathroom only to find it was not in a very good condition, the enamal had come off the bath the grouting around the bath and handbasin was brown and horrible and the toilet did not flush properly,not a good start. I went downstairs to reception and asked for a change of room. When asked what was the problem and I explained to them that the stanstard of the room was not acceptable they said they were refurbishing the rooms and the room that we had been allocated had not been refurbished so I asked to be transferred to one that had, the receptionist said the hotel was very busy but she would try. Eventually we did get another room and we were asked if we need help moving our luggage which we accepted. I went back to the room and we waited for help to arrive but after 20mins when no-one turned up we moved ourselves.We were absolutely exhausted.the room that we moved to was alright. The coffee maker was a bit of a joke,you could only get 1cup at a time which seemed to take for ever.You are allocated 2 pods of coffee and 2 pods of tea per day.I couldn't believe the cups were plastic wrapped in plastic and the sugar ,stirrer, and serviette wait for it were also wrapped in plastic in a seperate packageI would have thought in a Hotel which cost £220 per night we might at least have got proper cups and saucers.One bonus was that we were on the 400 floor which gave us fantastic views and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in.We didn't eat in the hotel as we were on a mission to see as much of New York as we could. I can't say i would particularly recommend anywhere in particular as we found the food wasn't up to UK standards except for the RIU hotel I beleive it's on 6th Ave. we found the breakfast there to be very nice and lots of choice and at a reasonable price. we had booked a 3 day trip with 5 attractions included from the Big Bus Co,and initally we thought it was expensive I can assure you it was the best thing we did Fantastic well worth the money as if you paid for rach attraction indvidually it works out very very expensive. New York is an extremely expensive city but absolutley brilliant loved every single moment of it.We also booked whislt we were there to see ashow at Radio City It was a Christmas Special it was amazing. The New Yorkers are wonderful people and I can't wait to go back

This time I stayed at the hotel with my family, we’ve received 2 room which were next to each other.As always great rooms, the size was great for us.The hotel was full of guests, but it didn’t had any effect on its operation.This time I used the hotel parking which is extremely expensive.As always I am sure I will be back.

Victoria in reception is our guardian angel in New York. This is our second time to the magical Crowne Plaza because they are kind, caring and look after you during challenging times. We had two disastrous days getting here and the moment we met Victoria in reception she did her everything with ease and Grace to make our stay better so we thank you from the bottom of our hearts! ❤️

We were not planning on staying in the city, but our other arrangements fell through, so why not? There were very few choices, especially in the price range I was looking for, but the Crowne Plaza looked like they had rooms online, but at that late a time and when online says "only a few rooms left" I know to call directly. What a great, central place to stay- we didn't eat there, just stayed. Very clean, quiet, easy. Parking lot was initially hard to find, it's NOT on the same street, but just around the corner. Figure that out before you drive there. I'd stay there again.

I brought my daughter to NYC for her 16th birthday we chose this amazing central location!! We got snowed in when all flights were cancelled out of LaGuardia thanks to a nor’easter snow storm. We weren’t expecting the expense of another 4 nights but the hotel was amazing in helping us get it sorted and we were able to stay in the same rooms. Sandra Esp. was our service representative at the front desk and she gave us the most excellent service!! I will stay here every trip to NYC!!

We often stay at this hotel when we go to see a Broadway show as it is an easy walk to all the theaters. Our last stay there was exceptional! Upon an early arrival, the desk found us a room that was ready for check in which was very important to us as the outside temperature was 8 degreesF. The breakfast bar was good but the male waiter was exceptional with taking care of my special requests. We also had to head home a day early due to an impending blizzard and the main desk refunded all of our prepayment for our "non-rufundable" night's stay. Did I also mention that they have a lap pool, sauna and other health club facilities? We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to the Big Apple!

I’ve stayed in three other Manhattan hotels but this one tops the lot. Our room was clean, large and well equipped with plenty of room for three adults and a lot of shopping. I was a bit unsure of being in such a central location but it was fabulous. The views from our double aspect corner room were superb - Times Square with the Empire State Building in the background. The blackout curtains and double glazing ensured that despite the noise and lights outside, our sleep was completely undisturbed. It’s my number one choice for return trips to NYC.

We stayed here mid December for a week. We had our two young daughters with us and found the hotel was in a great location to many of the main attractions. We had a time square view and were on the 38th floor. The hotel was lovely and had an onsite small convenience shop, coffee shop with salads and sandwiches and a bar/restaurant. We had room service 4 out of the 7 nights mainly because we were too shattered to go out but also because it was delicious. Rooms were cleaned daily and everything replenished. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

I was expecting more from here based on the price. It looks 4 star online but in reality it’s 3 but a good 3. Staff so far have been very helpful. The way you have to go out around the back to leave is rather annoying

I stayed here for NYE.1. I wasn't offered an upgrade when I checked in or at least, Teddy the front desk didn't explain why I wasn't offered an upgrade. It took us extra hr to get in due to the time square security. Few of my friends checked in earlier and they all got into the Elite level. A group of ladies in front of me got a room on the 43rd floor after flirting with the front desk so I couldn't assume all the rooms were out. I ended up on the 28th floor. 2. The wall around the bathtub in my room was filthy. We didn't realize that until 1am. There was also no hot water! I have attached a picture of the wall of the bathtub. I have attached pictures. We were so tired so we didn't call for cleaning or asking for a new room right away3. The room service messed up our dinner order. We decided just to stay in the room since both of us were still sick from flu. We order two crown burger but then they gave us one crown burgery and TWO cowboy burger. We request medium well but all burgers were rare. One of them even looked like uncooked in the middle. They also didn't give us ketchup for our french fries and they brought regular coke instead of coke. We called few times but we were only got the diet coke. 4. The housekeeping came in around 945am next morning, which actually woke me up. Isn't check-out time at 12 o'clock?

We stayed at the Crown Plaza in between Christmas & New Year. It’s superbly located to get around, all the staff we encountered were friendly & helpful. Our family room was clean & spacious by New York standards with fabulous views over Times Square. My only comment would be areas of the hotel do look tired, as was our room, however it’s fairly priced & this certainly wouldn’t stop me from returning.

Experience many issues with the room from cleanliness hair in the sink leaking pipes in the bathroom stains on the wall and a buildup of water by the window sills, very slow complimentary internet but the customer service was always polite and try to accommodate us as best they knew how it was just disappointing that many of these items could be taken care of if a closer look at the rooms was done beforehand.We had to switch rooms and I guess I determined that their rooms are in desperate need of upgrades. Love the personnel had to deal with seem to work really hard to try to address the problems to the best of their ability not sure it is worth the price for the New Year Eve weekend unless using point.The bar area is fantastic atmosphere for the NYE events

Stayed here 22nd to 26th of December and we thoroughly impressed. Hotel was clean, staff were welcoming, beds were super comfy, the location is amazing and the view from our time square room was unreal! My only gripe was the sockets in the walls were loose so they didn't feel very safe to plug things into but apart from that everything was perfect! I also thought being in time square it would be rediculosly loud but we couldn't hear much outside noise which was fab! Already planning our next trip back!

The location of this hotel is unbelievable with the most beautiful view of Times Square from the breakfast area. Checkin staff were fantastic, and rooms were well appointed (though ageing in places eg headboard, bathtub). Breakfast was fine although buffet pastries could be refilled more often, and with my Platinum status was decent value for 10 dollars. Porters okay, though very busy, as was the business center. I didn’t visit the gym, but my brother in law said I missed out on a fantastic lap pool!If in New York again, I would stay here again...

A fabulous hotel right in the middle of the action . Our bedroom had fabulous views of Times Square , the Rockefeller centre and we could just see the Empire State Building ! Very helpful friendly staff on reception and everywhere in the hotel , the breakfast was very tasty and filling , can't comment on the other meals . The bar was lovely with more amazing views and friendly staff . Our room was very clean and had clean towels every day . The hotel is perfectly located for the sub way and lots of bars and restaurants ,

Thank you Karim Sharif for making our family get together more special in the hotel bar/ restaurant!! We had a wonderful time and you made all the difference! Also thank you to Jason the bartender you were great!
user_name:
madiG3
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel on arrival was lovely although, when we got to reception I had to give my card details because there was a $30 a day service fee (for what?!) and on top of the price we had already paid I was fuming! Although, when we got to the room it was beautiful! Good views and kept clean and tidy.

I always stay in IHG hotels but I am very surprised and disappointed. First, the room is fine, I like the Shower , the water temperature & water pressure is really good, especially during winter like this time, showering with a mild warm shower & strong water pressure is cool thing to do before going to bed. I don't like the housekeeping going in and out of our bedroom when we were still sleeping. I do understand that they want to know if we want the room cleaned or if we are okay. But once you know the guests are still in bed sleeping, I think you should wait til we say "go ahead!". It was just uncomfortable we were still in the middle of sleep while the housekeeper enters our room screaming if we want to get our room cleaned. Atleast, coordinate with your frontdesk that would prevent inconvenience to the guest. The bedcovers were not cleaned everyday,incomplete toiletries, no complimentary toothbrush,toothpaste, & some cotton buds. No complimentary waters when they know we have a kid who still drink milk. Another, when you request something it takes almost half or an hour before they arrive or you also have to keep calling their phone and no one will answer. I don't think all the staff are friendly except the Frontdesk lady who checked us in, she was friendly and nice to us , we checked in late at night. No microwave, no fridge & their coffee maker is not updated yet to keurig. The rooms are not updated, its old but its fine. Their heater don't work well i guess, it was already on 80 for the whole night but the room never get warm, my whole family are still cold & comforters doesn't help, we usually use the fluffy brown blankets that actually keep you warm but seems like they do not have it, I am so surprised that Crowne Plaza didn't meet my expectations. You don't feel welcomed as an IHG Platinum elite member, actually both me & my wife were elite members, you are not recognized, not greeted, the service they have doesn't show any recognition for elite or all club members. We were glad to stay here because it's obviously around the tourist areas. But I would hope the management improve their member recognition, services, and faster service. We went downstairs to get some dessert around 11pm. The restaurant was serving in room service as well, they have the menu in the room, which is supposed to be available after midnight. We went there and ordered and the server told us that the restaurant is closed but we can order in room. My wife and I with our toddler just left, went to the back got some soft-drink and snack (nobody informed us that there are vending machine somewhere,we found it ourselves. Anyways, so we were like, it doesn't make any sense, like we are here in-front of the server, why would he tell us to go back to our room and order? So far,the expectations wasn't met, service is poor & the only thing we like is the hotel location. Lastly, their lamps look broken I dont know why they're slanted. On our third day, the key suddenly didnt work, we were freezing trying to-get into our room and our keys was deactivated. We were told to go down to get new keys, although someone opened the door for us.To the Manager-please Feel free to contact me if you like to talk about the issue. Thank you!

So well located, with the spirit of NYC: speed service, personalized, efficiency with kindness. Rooms are comfortable and what a view. Totally close to everything: Times Square of course, the big tree on Rockefeller with decorations on 5th avenue. Perfect location.

My wife and I came here a few weeks before Christmas. We were easily able to check in early at 11 AM without any problem. The room was much larger than I expected and very comfortable. The bed was great and we both slept well. Moderately priced for the location. The one breakfast we ahd was very good. Whats not to like!

Spent a few days here in December, ideally located hotel just a stones throw from most attractions. The hotel was very clean and the room was big and roomy, we had s side room facing away from Times Square. Think the other side would be better so you face Times Square but overall great location. We only had food once in the bar and it was good but pricey, but found food was expensive in New York generally.

Outstanding views; beautiful rooms. Staff very efficient and helpful.Great location for Times Square. Facilities in the hotel are great although we would of liked to of used the pool during our stay and only found out the relevant information on this when wonted to use it. Reception although lovely and very helpful more guest information would of been nice.Food is very delicious and we would not hesitate in staying here again

Location location location, seriously cannot get any better, staff very friendly and rooms spacious and clean. Will stay again on our next trip to NYC and will recommend to family & friends. The hotel upgraded up to a fab corner room on the 45 floor, it definitely made it all extra special.

We love this place. Been coming to it for years. Rooms big and perfect. Clean. Friendly staff. Great bar tenders. This time platinum check in and out was awful Had to ask for an attendant for check in and only two on front desk for the busy 10 am check out and no one at the priority station. Shame shame . We still love it but let's get the priority stuff sorted for next time

the staff there is very nice. very pleasant . Brunilda and Millie were exceptional. it was my five year old son's first time in NYC. he told them that he wanted to do Christmas in new york city and they helped make it an awesome experience for him. when he told them that, the gave us a room on one of the top floors with a view overlooking times square for him. he was delighted. i wasn't sure what to do with him in times square so they told us the best things to do in times square with a five year old. the room was very nice and well kept. felt new. the breakfast was delicious and you have a lot to choose from with the buffet. i wouldn't stay anywhere else.
user_name:
Al C
New York City, New York

review_body: Nice size quiet room...great location opposite the m&m store on Times Square. Only downside was despite checking 3 times .. no one told us you had to reserve to use the pool. One of the reasons we booked the hotel. Our two young children were early and dressed for the pool ... then told by the attendant of the empty pool we could use it in two hours ... that was after our check out time It is part of the service fee that you pay but no one tells you and it is not written down anywhere

My husband is an IHG Spire Elite member and had enough points for a 3 night stay in New York, so we chose the Crowne Plaza, Times Square for a quick city break at Christmas. We stayed on the 45th floor (there are 46 in total), and for us it was a good floor to be on as you are high enough up to cut out the noise from the city below. Room was facing the Hudson River and the 2 best things about the room were the very comfy bed and the excellent shower. The rooms probably could do with a few dollars spending on them as they are looking a bit tired but we had a great nights sleep each night and that was the most important thing after walking around the city all day. We did eat in the bar a couple of times, the food wasn't great but the fact you could come back to the hotel and get away from the mass of crowds in Times Square was a great relief! The best and worst thing about the hotel is the location..right next to Times Square, near the 49th and 50th subway stations, easily accessible.....however the front of the hotel is on the path of all the CD scammers, ticket scammers and unfortunately lots of homeless people. The homeless people are a sad sight and you cant help but feel that there is a lot of homeless people in New York, however the scammers, particularly the CD scammers are intimidating, they are they to rip you off and get your money...and if you say no they are very rude and call you out for being racist..etc.. We ended up giving $30 dollars to 2 different men just to get away from them....unfortunately they 'patrol' right outside the front of the hotel...so be warned. So would we stay at this hotel again....erm...no. My advice is although you think being in Times Square is the best location...find somewhere just a few streets off it...

We just stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square this last week for 3 nights. Excellent Hotel, location, and price. Only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because we are kind of hotel snobs. There was absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel at all. Didn't get 5 stars just because I have stayed in nicer but not too many. I reserve 5 stars for the elite like Ritz Carlton, One Hotel South Beach and the Fountainebleau in Miami. For the price, definitely top notch hotel. Great location in the heart of times square. Endless dining and entertainment options right outside the front door. Hotel bar and restaurant are excellent and very accommodating staff. Have stayed in many nice hotels all over the country and I doubt you can find anything as nice for this price in Times Square. You would probably be paying $500-$1000 a night for anything nicer. Definitely recommend if you are staying in Times Square.

I visited Time Square Dec 2017 to see the Christmas lights etc. We were 4 adults and had 2 rooms at the Crowne Plaza. The rooms were 16th floor 1607 and 1609. The rooms were ready by 3:15pm. The lobby is very clean and nice, Elevators were fast and plenty of staff to check in quickly. The rooms were 2 queens and a decent view of Time Square. You could see some of the square but not the ball. Bed mattresses need an update as it had a divot that you sunk in but still ok. Bathroom was nice. The hotel is a 1 minute walk to Time Square.

Location was perfect for first time visiting New York. Room size was good, a little dated and poor lighting but very comfortable beds and housekeeping done a great job, plenty of towels in the bathroom. I was disappointed with our welcome when we arrived to the hotel, felt the receptionist was uninterested and gave minimal service, not only on check in but a few days after when I had a question about the restaurant. I wouldn't recommend the food in the restaurant, much more choice in Times Square. Concierge were helpful on booking a car to the airport but felt it was a bit hit and miss with the staff. I would only recommend this hotel because of the location. New York is an amazing city and we did not let the service we received in the hotel spoil our trip.

We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the crowne plaza time square and had a fantastic whirl wind stay here. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel had a perfect central location.It was noisy at nights with the outside traffic noise but we were so tired it didn’t bother us.We didn’t eat or use any spa facilities but it looked nice.

I visit this hotel around same time every year, but not sure I will be returning. Upon checkin we was greeted by unfriendly staff (in particular an older lady with black hair with grey streaks and glasses who has worked there for some time as I recognise her. She was very abrupt and rude. Once we was assigned room we went in and instantly realised we did not like the room... it felt very odd. Upon further inspection what we felt become evident... the room was slanted! When we open draws they would come fully out by them self as the room with off center. Also the headboard was so scratched, it looked like they left a tiger in the room and used the leather headboard as a scratch pad!We went back to front desk and was assigned a new room, much higher up, although first impressions was room was better we discovered that it wasn’t. Their was dirty socks, a pen and a pair of underwear by the side of the bed. Bathroom wasn’t clean either. Disgusting to think they can not even clean rooms to a decent standard, but do not mind charging premium pricesVery disappointed highly unlikely would be returning to give my business to this establishment, left bad taste knowing I have paid the amount I have for very poor quality

Stayed here for 3 nights and was a good hotel in a perfect position. The rooms were a good size and the hotel was clean and exactly what we wanted as a base to sleep. We requested a high floor room but could still hear noise outside but didn't worry us too much.

We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for a 4 night stay before Christmas. The hotel is located in an ideal, central location and is within walking distance to the Rockefeller Centre, down Broadway to the Flat Iron and many different Broadway shows and restaurants. There are subway stations for most lines just a short distance away too. The room was adequate enough for the 3 of us and was always clean and with fresh towels every day. The staff in the hotel however were just a bit abrupt and unhelpful at times. Even the Concierge who was supposed to be helpful to guests had a very unhelpful air about them which was disappointing. The bar area was always busy and it was difficult to find a seat which was a shame as there is no other communal space at the hotel to sit and enjoy each others company. Think when they designed the hotel they could have thought about the position of the bar a little better. View from the restaurant tables was fab.

The quality of the family room was 'well worn'., not enough lighting or bedside storage. The $32 charge for a breakfast you can get for $20 outside the hotel was poor quality. Beware the Service Fee of $27 a day for use of the telephone, internet, gym.. When you check in you are told about the service BUT not the cost , and as you are out seeing the sights of New York all day so you never use it! BEWARE....Added $189 to a weeks stay..

We stayed here the first few days of December. It was very convenient for going to Rockefeller Center and the Rockettes show. We also looked at Christmas displays, and went to Mass at St. Patrick's Cathedral. I took cabs or used Uber if things were too far to walk, as I have a bad knee, but it was a great central location to stay at. The breakfast was very nice with lots of choices at the buffet. Room was really quiet for being in such a busy location. We would use it again in the future!

We stayed here in October for 5 days and left underwhelmed. It’s a fantastic location and you are right in Times Square and minutes walk from the majority of places in the area.We have stayed in a lot of IHG properties across the world and found the service and staff here to be lacking in the IHG appeal. None of the staff seemed friendly, there was no welcoming smiles.I had a package delivered to the hotel the day before I arrived but it took 2 days and over 8 calls before it arrived in the room and they still charged me for this service!The pool is in need of an upgrade. It’s all lap swimming which is great as that’s what I wanted to do but then told you have to “reserve” lanes to swim in. This is heavily used by the club members as they don’t like hotel guests using it!!! The lifeguards on duty prefer to play games on their mobiles rather than clean. It’s funny really as they make you wear a swimming hat (or hotel shower cap) but in my opinion the pool and it’s surrounding area could benefit from a really good clean!The maid service is ok but takes ages. We asked for our room to be cleaned at 11am and when we returned at 1630 it still wasn’t cleaned and it was often late afternoon (sometimes) 6pm before it was cleaned!This hotel is busy because of its location but it could really be a great hotel if the staff were more friendlier and efficient!

We recently stayed at the Crown Plaza Times Square for a quick 2 night stay before Christmas. The Crown Plaza is situated in an ideal location since it is within walking distance to many Broadway shows, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and restaurants. All of the staff that we met were genuinely friendly and cared about our needs. One of the employees that works in the parking area went out of his way to help us find a taxi or Uber to Penn Station. He didn't leave our side until we were safely in a taxi and on our way. It was a very busy time of day, and we really appreciated his help since maneuvering around the city can be tough. Last night, after a long afternoon in the ER with my daughter who fell while ice skating, we found ourselves dinner-less at 6:15 pm with 7 pm tickets to Wicked. We called room service to order a quick bite. I explained our time crunch and the room service employee expedited the order, and it arrived in 15 minutes. We ate and were out the door to make it on time to the show. We were so appreciative of their fast service and for recognizing our needs. While we were leaving the hotel to go sightseeing, one of the cleaning staff asked if it would be OK to clean our room while we were out since we had our do not disturb sign hanging on our door. We responded that cleaning wasn't necessary and that we were fine. She offered to provide clean towels, make the bed, and/or empty the trash. We were totally fine...and were impressed with her commitment to make sure that we were taken care of. The check in went smoothly and the employee at the front desk was friendly and helpful. I wish we had taken her advice to grab a quick lunch at the Green Apple Deli rather than having chosen to eat at Juniors. However, I went to the GA deli for breakfast this morning and it was great! Quick service, good food, and reasonably priced. So, all of the employees that we encountered were excellent which we really valued as just being in NYC at this time of year can be stressful with the crowds of people. The hotel is clean and inviting. This is our second stay, and we will return.

Their is excitement in the air. Its a great atmosphere. People from the 4 corners of earth. Walk outside and it’s also tingling with excitement. Right in the middle of happening Central. We walked a short distance to a fabulous restaurant. Cannot ask for a better location or hotel.

Stayed here on recent trip paid for by my son for Xmas present.Crowne plaza times square is fantastic hotel overlooking the hustle and bustle of Times square.great base for all fab sites to see in New York. Although be aware $30 per night resort tax .

Ate In house restaurant server “Richie Rich” took my food allergies seriously. He offered me a safe choice and confirmed with the chef. Richie went out of his way to make sure I was going to be ok and not end the evening via the ER.Also ordered from Room service the chef called me back to discuss safe options and then cooked my food according to my allergies.Awesome customer service from the food service. Would highly recommend this hotel to families with allergies. We will return in the future

I recently took my granddaughter to New York City for her first trip. We stayed at the Crown Plaza and could not be more pleased. The room and service was very good. But, what made the trip so much more enjoyable for us was the help and advice we received from Sandra Esp at the check in desk. Within a few minutes, we felt we had made a new friend. She was helpful in every way. When it was time to leave, we could not go without stopping by and giving her a hug. More hotels should have more friendly, helpful people like Sandra!!Kay S. Ryan1740 English Knoll LaneBirmingham, Al. 35235205-901-1780

Great location to Times Square, Broadway and Rockefeller Center. Room was a little warm which did not cool off with a decrease to the thermostat.I stayed for a conference with work but I will be back with the family.

Spent 3 lovely nights here for my birthday. This was our third visit and it was just as good third time around. The hotel was very full when we visited, however the service was still good. This hotel is very well located in the middle of Times Square. Only slight disappointment was the lack of an upgrade (I’m a platinum member )

This is my 4th stay at the Crown Plaza Times Square. The location is fabulous; a block away from Times Square, walking distance to Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, and the Jewelry District. Broadway plays are all around. The hotel staff are friendly and so accommodating. The rooms are spacious compared to other NYC rooms. There is a safe in the room for your valuables. If you stay here, you won’t be disappointed.

We stayed in the Crowne Plaza the previous year during the same week (Dec. 11-14) and had a wonderful experience, thus deciding to return again this year. Upon checking in, we were greeted by Evelyn at the front desk, who proceeded to find us the best room available. She located us a room with a Times Square view and offered us 3 free drink coupons for the hotel bar. Thanks, Evelyn! What a great way to begin our stay! We will definitely be returning again next year. The perfect location to walk to Broadway plays and great restaurants, with the added benefit of a great staff throughout the hotel.

I really don't complain much, and haven't with any of the dozens of hotel stays we've had over the past few years. But our experience last week was so bad as to deserve a full report/venting. At check-in we were told they only had rooms with two doubles available; all their king-sized bed rooms had been given away. When I pointed out that my reservation said my bed choice (king size) was guaranteed, they said it wasn't guaranteed by them (the guarantee appeared on the Hotwire confirmation--Hotwire will be hearing from me as well), even though I had paid my $1300 or so three months earlier in reliance on the promise of a king-sized bed. After a lengthy discussion, we had no choice but to accept the room we specifically didn't want. Our initial room featured a window that didn't fully close, allowing very cold air (it was in the twenties outside) to blow in, along with the noise from Time Square. After a trip to the front desk, we were given a room with a functioning window. But that room was overheated and could be cooled only with the window open and a fan they supplied. They eventually came to shut down the overactive heating system; heat from the adjacent rooms kept us reasonably warm thereafter.. And we were treated multiple times each night with a howling sound from the hot water fixture in our room. Initially, they treated my complaints with skepticism but I was eventually able to call the front desk during one of the lengthier howls and, having heard the offending noise over the phone, they assured me someone would fix it the next morning. Great. The problem was reduced, but not eliminated the final two nights of our stay.The hotel is undeserving of a four-star rating (I'd give it maybe a three, provided they fix the plumbing and windows). This was our third stay there. It was also our last.

Located right on Times Square and Broadway and also close to the New York Subway, this is an excellent hotel and location. The concierge is really helpful at sorting out all of your (tourist) needs and there is an excellent bar, Bar 49, located in the hotel with really friendly and welcoming staff and where the bar prices are not excessive for the area.Highly recommended.

The location of this hotel is the most central we have ever stayed. It is not right in Times Square just Off near M&M World. Taxi’s can pull in via an underground car park or out the front on Broadway. We were on the 33rd floor with a view at the back of the hotel and we didn’t have the noise that could come from the Times Square area. The room was a good size and so was the bathroom with a good amount of fresh clean white towels. Lovely large walk in shower with an arm hole so you can get the temp right before going into the shower. When you say let’s climb into bed you literally had to climb in it was so high off The floor!! However it was sad to see a sad shabby headboard which was a little Off putting as it was near the head area and the cover round the handle for connecting room Door was hanging off. Also the inside of the draws have not seen a duster or polish for awhile. Which put you off using The coffee making facilities. You’d be better off with a Kettle cups and coffee tea and milk on a tray on the table top. Really inspections should be made on a regular basis to pick up on this sort of thing and if you say you are 4 star this really doesn’t show that you are. Also my pyjama top went missing. After my nightwear being rolled in a ball and dumped on the bedside table instead of being laid nicely back on the bed. A training issue that needs to be addressed with housekeeping staff. I reported it staff apologised and was told that they would look into it for me and someone from Management would get back to me. Well I kept chasing and no one did come back However on the last day as we checked out one person took hold of the situation and tried to sort it. Her name was Victoria on the Front Desk and without her as we checked out I think I would have left a negative opinion of Hotel but Victoria changed that with her helpful friendly charming attitude even saying that I should have reported being ill and the hotel could have helped. We would now consider, if we ever re visited, staying at the Crowne Plaza again. The Christmas tree was beautiful at the top of the escalator. A TV guide to what is on the TV stations in the room would be helpful as the telly is nice to have on as you are getting ready.So from going to have a low rating I upped it due to Victoria but not a 5 due The areas that need to be upgraded and looked after regularly

Stayed here in December and location is excellent.Not a particularly friendly and welcoming hotel but it is New York City.Check in was fast and rooms great and quite large for NY. All facilities were good and overall cannot be faulted.Sadly bar staff are extremely rude. Waited over 20 minutes to be served while the guy at the bar looked at me and ignored. Even tried sitting at a table and the waitress ignored us - until she had a rant and was swearing about number of tray - not appropriate with children in earshot! Tried again next evening and same thing!! Eventually got served by another guy who didn't even speak!! Saved at last by a lovely lady KIm who was cheerful and happy and polite - she honestly was only member of the bar staff who didn't look at you as if you had arrived on someone's shoe - assume both men think a bar is not the place for the female species.Have to say the lady who checked us out was appalled and apologised and passed my comments on.Good hotel and I would certainly stay again just such a shame the bar men let the team down.

We stayed two nights in this hotel. The hotel is very busy. It is a standard 4 star hotel on the broadway. We had a room with two queen size beds. The room was clean and in a good condition. We had a room in a high floor with a spectacular view to the city. The lobby of the hotel is in the first floor. We went one night to the Springsteen on Broadway Show. The Walter Kerr Theater is just next door from the hotel (2 minutes). There is even a merchandising shop for the Springsteen on Broadway Show from 6 pm to 10.30 pm in the lobby of the hotel.

We stayed here for Thanksgiving week because we had enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza in Washington D.C.. BIG MISTAKE. The trip was a disaster because it turns out you cannot control the temperature in your room, and the room was too warm for us to get a good night's sleep. And if you can't sleep, everything else is a struggle during the day. That shouldn't happen on a vacation, and certainly not at a hotel that charges these rates. If I did not have a "non-refundable" rate, I would have changed hotels. We could not get the temperature in our room below 71-72 degrees at night. I need to have a room between 66 and 68 degrees when I sleep because my particular CPAP machine's nasal mask will not seal above those temperatures when my body heat is added to that of the room. I called down to the desk the first night about 3-4AM and asked to be moved to a room that is cooler at night. The clerk said she would leave a note to change me in the morning, and that we should turn off the heat and open the window to let in the cool air. We did, but that didn't help - the temperature was still 73 degrees in our room. We did not get moved. I asked three times, and it was only on our 5th sleepless night that someone FINALLY listened to us and changed us to a room the next day that was on a lower floor on the other side of the hotel and had a larger window that opened and actually let a cool breeze in. So for 5 nights out of 7 I was not able to sleep. If you need a cool room to sleep in, find a newer hotel that has FOUR pipes (two for A/C and two for heat). This hotel, we discovered, only has TWO, so they can only have EITHER heat OR A/C, and apparently you cannot effectively control (reduce) the amount of heat you get. They did bring in something they called a "portable A/C" unit, which had a small vent to suck in outside air, but it cycled off when it got down to 71 degrees and then the room heated back up to 73 degrees. I brought a portable room thermometer with me because having my CPAP mask seal properly is such a critical issue for me (see the pictures).

From Evelyn at the front desk upon check in (easy) to Rickie in the Broadway 49 Bar & Lounge, everything was very personal and wonderful. The staff does a great in making you feel comfortable. The rooms are nicely done and comfortable. Great location. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Left credit card as deposit on room (big mistake). On departure, we paid cash in full, I have the receipts to prove it. On return to the UK find we have been charged the amounts we paid in cash. You would think this would be easy to solve, THINK AGAIN. Tried ringing accounts, no one answers the phone, I am talking about 20 times in a two hour slot, left messages, no one gets back to you. Emailed several times, total waste of time as I have been waiting a week for a reply. I am disgusted in this hotel and must warn others, it is totally disorganised and has let the whole trip down. I will be posting this on a regular basis to warn others.

Stayed here for a pre Xmas break the location is perfect The hotel is in the middle of Times Square just a very short walk away from the Broadway theatre shows and shops The staff are friendly the rooms are ok ours had bath / shower no fridge, hairdryer,safe Had meal in hotel bar fish and chips very nice If you want to be near all the action this is the hotel for you

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza and were very disappointed.The rooms were shabby, not very clean and certainly they weren’t worth the £340 we paid for room only. We were shown 3 rooms and eventually took the first room been the best of a bad job.Reception area restaurant/ cocktail lounge was so cold aircon blasting out cold air.The only saving grace and why I’ve given to stars is the location. Would I stay again doubtful.

We stayed here for 6 nights for a week in December and just got back. We were given a room which overlooked the Hudson River and were able to check in early which was great. The hotel was recommended by several friends of my husbands due to the location but this isn't somewhere I would have chose myself. The hotel itself was dated and could do with a bit of work. The windows didn't fully close so without the curtains drawn there was a draft and the noise from the streets wasn't masked by the windows, I thought that they would have been thickened glass to help with the sound proofing. Our flight was cancelled due to the recent snow and we were able to get another room for another night. It meant that we paid on a way in rate and was quoted one figure by a member of the reception staff and then when I went back I was given a much lower rate (approx $80 dollars inc. taxes),

This hotel is extremely close to Time Square but technically isn't directly overlooking it. None the less, you can still see it however, when you are in the restaurant having breakfast, lunch or dinner. The service in the hotel is great and when I checked in I asked the lady on reception some questions about the location of things like Tiffanys and USS Intrepid and she was very knowledgable and was able to give accurate directions.The room as nice, comfortable and the breakfast buffet was great with a good selection. The only real issue was the price, which is expected in a hotel in such a prestigious location.

The customer service and willingness to go above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction is by far the strength of the hotel staff - especially those working on conferences.The location is ideal and couldn't be better if you want that "big city, center of the action, picturesque view" of NYC and Times Square.However, I will agree with some others that the hotel seems to be in need of a face-lift and a thorough cleaning. As a note, the way the HVAC unit in this hotel works --- if they have turned on the heater (as they will in winter months), all the rooms will receive heat regardless of how the guest sets the thermostat. Likewise, in the summer months, it would not be possible to have the heater on as the hotel has turned on the AC. During times when the weather is in between seasons or for a guest who is sensitive to temperatures, it may be wise to care a small fan or blanket to ensure comfort.

Stayed 3 nights on a business trip. My room had no view, beat up furniture. The bathroom had mold, rust and a bad smell. The staff was rude when asked for basic items like water with room service or when ordering a drink at the bar to take back to the room. This is an overpriced Holiday Inn. If you want Times Square - this is it. If you want a quality hotel, with great service don't stay here.

I gifted my Anniversary Night stay to one of my former student-athletes so he could treat his family to a holiday adventure in New York City. Kendra helped me by noting that a room with a view was preferred. Donald came through big by treating my friend’s family very well with a great city view, coupons for free drinks, and coupons for breakfast for the family. My friend said he and his family were treated great by Crowne Plaza and I appreciate a hotel representative like Donald who comes through for the brand and for an IHG member like me. Thank you!

We stayed here for a week. The first room we were given was so filthy we requested another one. Our new one wasn’t much better but we realised all rooms were probably the same... The room was tidy, old, dated and unclean. See photos! The window was open when we arrived and would not close without the assistance of the maintenance man. The temperature had a mind of its own - hot to cold. No fridge, no kettle. Given the price of the hotel, this was all unexpected.Then it came to the mandatory service charge. We were told on check in that if we wanted to use the swimming pool, gym, telephone and WiFi there would be a daily charge of $30 which we declined. On check out, we were then told this was mandatory- meaning we may as well have used these facilities!!The icing on the cake though was our departure. We booked a minivan for our airport run- specified the time, flight etc. It came 35 mins late- during snow and heavy traffic which is nothing new in New York- and so we had to rush through the airport.All in all, a dated, unfriendly hotel which really lets down the Crowne Plaza usual standards.

Two nights in NYC for a little Christmas shopping. Let’s first acknowledge the key points: location is great and service by staff was incredible. I had a room with a great view on the 29th floor. Now, the downside: A/C in hotel doesn’t work when outside is below 50? I like fresh air. They helped with a portable AC unit with an exhaust that fit out the one window that would partially open. (Interesting). Shower had good pressure, just odd config so when you opened the door, water gets outside of it. No soap/shampoo tray anywhere. Room needed a little TLC but all in all, it was very good. Big flat screen and spacious by NYC standards. Finally, did I mention the great service from the staff? Incredible.

Just got back from an amazing first time in New York. This hotel is in the perfect location and convenient for everywhere we wanted to visit. We chose this hotel because of its location but also the brand. I was a little concerned prior to our stay as I always check trip advisor. Although the beds were very comfortable I did see staining on the mattress, wall paper was falling off, the toilet roll holder was hanging off and the carpet was quite dirty. The shower was also tempremental. We asked at reception for a room upgrade and was told guests don’t stay here for luxury and that boutique hotels are located nearer Central Park??? I understand that this is more somewhere to lay your head but for the cost I would expect a little more. I rate it a 4 purely for its location, the hotel without its location I would rate 3. On checking out we were also been charged someone else’s bar bill!! Travel adaptors also don’t fit securely in the sockets.

At this hotel it is all about location.We got a corner Times Square view room. The view was excellent. It is a quick walk to Rockefeller Plaza, St Patrick's and Saks.N R Subway stop is also right across the street. Room was clean and cozy. My biggest issue was that the largest beds they offer in a double room are full size. At least in these corner rooms they could fit Queens.Wi-Fi was so-so and the tv remote did not work well. But for this trip it worked well, all we needed rhe room for was to sleep. Having walked 10miles in the city during the day, we slept very well.Valet runs about $70/ day. We got there before 10am, checked our bags to check in later. We left around 2pm the next day and the parking cost $130.

This is our 4th time here and we still love it! Check in was very quick and the staff were very friendly. Our room was lovely we had a corner room on the 33rd floor overlooking the river. It was spacious with a big television. The bed was really comfy and it was very quiet.We had a couple of drinks in the bar and found the staff to be very friendly.Fab location in Times Square with easy access to the subway.Can't wait to return!

Our room wasn’t strong warm and Anthony from engineering came up brought a portable heater, extra blankets, robes and some water. We were warm in no time and snuggled in with a great selection of movies.

I would never have chosen this hotel since it's in the middle of Times Square. But we had a conference there so I stayed. It was amazing.The room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was very adequate and had a nice walk in shower. We were on a higher floor so maybe that helped but it was quiet too. The staff were nice and accommodating as well. The product was good and the linens of a higher quality. It was much nicer than many places we stay in smaller communities. Highly recommend.

Staff very helpful. We arrived early in the morning after disembarking from QM2. We realised that we were too early to check in but were able to store our luggage and after registering we were able to leave our valuables in the hotel safe which left us free to explore the city. Came back late afternoon and checked in, Room wonderful overlooking Times square. Quiet and very comfortable.Had quick meal in the bar which was really good and the staff were very nice faultless service.Next morning after checking out were able again to leave luggage in storage and used the hotel safe to leave passports etc so we could have another day in the city. Staff called cab for airport. Everyone very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay here again if in New York. Brilliantly situated for sightseeing and near subways and Grand Central Station.

The hotel lobby was a bit chaotic as I was there to tend to a sick child in intensive care. The woman who checked me in, Victoria, was very kind and helpful.My room had a wonderful view but the water in the shower and bath did not work well. Things were worn and not in tip top shape for the money.

I’m a frequent client here and everything was good always, best location (everything is walking distance),good rooms, great beds, delicious breakfast. I wanted to extend my stay just ONE more night when I was already there for almost a week and this guy in the reception told me they were sold out, he didn’t even had the courtesy of checking in his computer just to make me feel like he was doing everything possible, but no... he was rude and told me they were completely sold out and that my solution was to go to another hotel nearby. A friend of mine that was staying the same days as me wanted to have another night there and this lady that gave service to him was all friendly and ACTUALLY made everything possible so that he stays for one more night and he did. Another thing, I asked in concierge for ticket for Lion King and they told me they had only the last row of the whole theatre, I went right through my cellphone and in the webpage I got all the tickets I wanted in the first orchestra. They just don’t want to give the bet service, they don’t care about their customers. This is the las time I will stay in this hotel even though I did for years.

I would like to specially recognize four individuals at the bar server staff for their attentive, energetic, and generous service: Rhoda, Taueska, Yasmine, and Alnethia. This is a large tourist hotel, and to find such personalized service in that environment is a rarity in my experience. Thank you!

Yes the lobby is small and perhaps check in was not fast but the staff was pleasant and my room is lovely! Clean, spacious, renovated, quiet, good in room coffee and great views of Times Square and the Hudson. Lots to do right outside your door including the TKTS booth for last minute shows. Enjoyed our second annual stay for business/pleasure trip. Have stayed in many hotels in various parts of Manhattan and am very happy here.

The Hotel was a fantastic choice , for a city Hotel the quality and standard were excellent. All Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, warm and comfortable. The Hotel is located in Times Square so right in the heart of the hustle and bustle.

I was starting to become sceptical about the Crowne Plaza after reading some reviews on here.. DO NOT BE PUT OFF! Having just stayed here for 4 nights for a girly week with my mum I can honestly say this hotel was perfect!Location : this could not be better. Right bang in the middle of Times Square and Broadway. Everything you need is on your doorstep.The Room : we had a corner room on floor 32, the views were amazing of the East River and Broadway. The bed was so comfortable and the room was kept clean daily! Service : Everyone we came across were polite and friendly. The lady on the concierge desk just couldnt do enough for you! I will definately return to this gem of a hotel on my return to NYC! Do not be put off by the guys hanging around outside trying to sell bus tours, these are also a must!! Happy stay :)

This is the best hotel we’ve stayed at in NYC. The location is ideal in Times Square and it has a bar and restaurant so you don’t have to eat out. We found the staff to be very helpful and polite. The room was well decorated and clean. The only downside was you have to pay a fee of $210 as a service fee which includes free WiFi all free telephone calls gym etc. We’ve been going to NYC and this is the only hotel that has charged this fee. So it adds to the cost of your trip. We only used the WiFi but didn’t need it as you can get free WiFi in Times Square

Stayed in September and was impressed by the service. Inman made check-in a breeze. His courteous and professional service is highly appreciated in this day and age. I love that everything is convenient to this hotel. JR’s is right across the street and most theaters within walking distance. The restaurant is fabulous for breakfast and well worth it. Make sure that you ask for Ali, he’s a super waiter and will remember how you like your coffee or hot tea. Will be staying again this month.

The hotel is right in the heart of Times Square, there are plenty of restaurants, shops and fun things to do a walking distance, the service is average, it feels like people in the front desk feels stress probably for the amount of tourist they receive every day. The restaurant have a nice view to Times Square and the food is good. Rooms are average size just like any other crown plaza.

My husband and I were in New York for the 1st time — along with my mother. We had an amazing time! The Crowne Plaza was really perfect for us! Location-Location! I chose for the ease of my mother getting around- and was not disappointed. Right on Times Square— plenty of places to walk to. As far as the Crowne Plaza itself, we were also very pleased. Room very nice (we had a corner room-beautiful views!!)Check-in Staff helpful, maid service fine, Bellhops great. We went to the bar when we arrived to watch the GB Packer game—- and had a great time with Jason (or Justin..)!He was friendly and very helpful with info and tips on what to see and do. Went back to see him again before leaving— also had a bite to eat— good food, great service!***My husband did get pick pocketed while out and about.. nothing to do with the Plaza—- but travelers beware....(his back pocket was cut so a wallet could fall onto ground, fortunately my husband not dumb enough to carry wallet in back pocket!)Will stay again next trip!!

We booked a corner executive room and were not disappointed by the room. It was comfortable, offered great views across part of the city and was clean and tidy.The hotel is busy but check-in was quick and efficient. There are two banks of elevators one serving up to floors 30 (or something) and the other for floors above.
