It wasn't immediately clear to us so we ended out having to get out on another floor and change elevators!We didn't eat in this hotel and no breakfast was included (for the room rate it ought to be), nor did we have any drinks in the hotel so can't review any of those facilities.The hotel is located smack bang in the middle of times square so it's very central for exploring that area. We found the room to be fairly well soundproofed and we certainly heard very little of the noise outside. We had a great and comfortable nights sleep.would certainly stay here again.

The hotel is just feet away from Times Square. Very nice, clean hotel with lots to offer, Starbucks, pastry shop, several restaurants, shops. Very reasonable priced and comfortable beds. Would highly recommend
user_name:
Penny C
Florence, South Carolina, United States

review_body: Our company was recently selected to do a closing Bell ceremony and approximately 20 senior management staff were invited by the CEO to participate. Given NASDAQ's location in Times Square, Chain Hotels were solicited such as Marriott, Starwood and Hiltons. When I saw the rates, I Urged that this Property be included in the list as I have firsthand experience of the Property and know its MD Niles Harris very well and their staff is first rate. As I expected, the bid back was extremely competitive and the courtesy discounts on breakfast sealed the deal.As I expected, the hotel with its mix of business and residential customers, its proximity to NASDAQ, the Lobby Bar to relax, awesome breakfast buffet, awesome gym, the way staff took care of my colleagues...Sylvia, Karim, Ali, Ana, Rodney (no longer there), Janet, Juliet, Yang Zhi and of course Agathe in the Restaurant (who always takes care of my family and I), close proximity to restaurants and nightlife was a BIG hit with my colleagues and I received rave reviews from all.I know this property dos conferences but I would add to anyone looking for a great Property to attend events around the area, that this Hotel, under MD Niles Harris should not be overlooked by your travel department. You and your colleagues would miss out on a superb property, very competitive and the best staff in Times Square.

This hotel is tired and in need of a good refurbishment. Housekeeping not very good. 4 if us in one room and serviced for only 3 people. Don’t book a taxi for airport via lobby concierge it’s a rip off. Book through the one where you leave your luggage. Photos show the state of the sink in the bathroom and one of the headboards!!!

Excellent location, central to the theater district. Beautiful rooms with plenty of amenities. The bar staff and food were great. The only thing I would recommend is, do not eat the breakfast buffet. It was over $150 for four of us to eat and the staff was pushy and rude. Grab a coffee & pastry from Grind & Co. instead!!

Enjoyed a trip to the city with my girlfriends and want to say close to Time Square, but wanted to avoid a noisy hotel. The Plaza was the perfect hotel as it was quite and the staff was wonderful!The breakfast at the hotel was outstanding! Each morning we were greeted by the happy upbeat staff. We were given fantastic service from our waiter, Tofael, every morning! He made us feel like we were royalty!

They had a pathetic service...we’d booked online for this hotel and they gave us handicapped room.there was such a poor quality cleaning service.we paid for a high quality service but got a pathetic one..bad experience with crown plaza guys:(

Really brilliant location smack bang in the middle of times square. The rooms are lovely and kept nice and clean. We did make a complaint due to being kept awake one night with loud construction noise that started about 12am and went on for a while. We had not been informed of this and had a very early start the next day. However the staff were very understanding and moved our room to a higher floor, they also wrote our room service charge off! The food is great as are the friendly staff. The only thing that was surprising is the cost of the breakfast ($30 a head)it seemed to us a bit expensive for a buffet style breakfast. Overall i would definitely recommend and stay again.

There's one thing to know about the Crowne Plaza Times Square - they will ABSOLUTELY GUARANTEE connected rooms. I have not been able to find another Midtown Manhattan hotel that offers this. Other than that, it's very comfortable. Rooms a little larger than most NYC hotels. Very busy but that's what you expect in the Times Square area.

An amazing hotel right in the heart of Times Square. You really do just step outside the front door and it's all there. I had a room on the 38th floor and it was spacious with a big bathroom. It looked over Times Square and yes there was some noise but that's what we wanted. Even in the hotel room there is a buzz. The room also has a huge TV with loads of channels, plenty of electricity sockets, good air con / heating and loads of towels etc. The hotel also has a lovely bar, restaurant, coffee shop and stunning reception area. All of this and an incredibly pleasant and professional group of staff. At check in I was helped by a wonderful lady named Sandra Esp. She grouped all my reservations and sorted all my problems and at the same time made me feel so welcome. She was caring, professional, incredibly helpful and one of those ladies who just made you feel good. Quite clearly when you go to NYC you have a huge choice of hotels but you would be crazy to miss out on this one.

This hotel is located at the most popular place for tourists. Place is very crowded and busy, but very exciting for tourists. Hotel is clean and comfortable. Staff is nice and helpful. Only negative comment is that there is no refrigerator in the room.

Right around the corner from Macys and other shops. Courteous employees. Really large bedrooms for NYC. Hotel is being remodeled, but it is not intrusive. Very clean. The main purpose of our visit was shopping and we were close to all.

We stayed at this hotel in 2015 and gave it 4/5 and chose it again for our latest visit to New York. However we found the room much smaller and "tired" looking. The carpet needed a good clean, the bed head was badly damaged (scratches?) and the wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling away in places. However of most concern was the shower. This often took several minutes to get to the desired temperature and would subsequently become either too cold or too hot with little warning. There would appear to be no thermostatic control making the shower dangerous to use. It was uncomfortable to sit near the window because of the draught coming through the glass.

Have stayed at this hotel three times now and each time it has been for a week or more. On the last occasion it was very disappointing that 1)the main did not leave any coffee or tea but left a note suggesting we contact the from desk 2)someone had entered our room without prior knowledge and or permission to replace the radio alarm unit. After asking management to explain several times we had no response.

The location is phenomenal. The staff is nice and professional and helpful. Kim at the lobby bar is AMAZING. She has an amazing heart and spirit, will give you the scoop on the city and will take great care of you. Such a great experience. Thank you! - Rachel

I travelled at the end of November 2016This was a special birthday trip for my Mum's 60th. I had booked earlier the year through my Travel Counsellor, Jodie. I went all out to surprise my mum booking Business class seats with BA.FlightFirst experience flying business class with BA and I have to say I was disappointed. The layout was appalling and matched the terrible service. The seats are uncomfortable and you have to climb over peoples legs to get out to go to toilet. However flight was uneventful and we arrived safe and sound to JFK.Hotel Arrival at the hotel it took a little while for us to get our bearings. But we soon realised what a perfect location we had staying at this hotel. Room was comfortable and had all necessary amenities. We did eat within hotel as well as out and it was all great. Staff at the hotel were welcoming, friendly and approachable they must be asked the same questions everyday yet continued to help in anyway they could. Location PERFECT!! We were thrilled the hotel was an ideal location. It was only a couple of minutes walk to Times Square. we often used the starbucks at the corner in the morning, we were a minutes walk from a bus tour stop and within 10 mins walk from where we went to watch Wicked. I literally could not have chose a better venue and location to stay during our break in New York. Once we found our way around we felt comfortable walking around where the hotel was situated.

Love this hotel! I paid $146 for a one night stay during Thanksgiving week. When I got to the counter to check in I was informed that we had been upgraded to a corner king suite. YES!!! After a long flight from Rome I was thrilled. About an hour after we were in the room the front desk called to make sure the room and everything was okay. How NICE is that?!?! I am so happy with the hotel. The bed was heavenly. We got a few hours sleep before we had to head to the airport again for a 6am flight. The doorman flagged town a taxi for us early in the morning. All in all - great hotel. I recommend it and will be back.

I had a great stay at Crowne Plaza Timsquare. Thanks to Imrane the Front Desk Imrane who made my stay wonderful. As a membership I felt like exceptional no line for check-in, coupon for breakfast at 10$ instead of 26$.....

We stayed for 4 night for thanks giving and had a great time. Check in was quick and easy. The reception staff were very helpful. We were on the 43 floor and had a great view and a lovely room that was cleaned daily. Good choice at breakfast with great views of Broadway and Times Square. Fantastic location. Away from the hotel we were a bit disappointed with the food in NYC . But overall had a great time and will return to Crowne Plaza, thanks for a enjoyable stay

Our 2nd time in a Crowne Plaza and we were not disappointed. Quality corner room on the 39th floor with 2 views overlooking Times Square and the Hudson River. Very quiet considering it's a busy hotel.

We had 3 rooms at the crown Plaza Times Square and we have no complaints about staff or location because they where perfect but the size of our room was even smaller than our friends who paid the same for the same type of room. Letting the size aside, the rooms need renovations to bring them to 2017 and if they did that this could be one of the best places to stay.

I chose this hotel for its location. The facility is nice, and my corner room was spacious and clean. It seemed updated, even though the furniture was old. The fitness facility is super nice. It’s huge, and it’s got lots of current, well-maintained equipment. They’ve even got a lap pool. You can easily walk to lots of nearby good restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

I am a regular IHG hotel customer traveling all over the USA and abroad This hotel is one of the best I've ever stayed at. Location is perfect if you want to stay in the theater district and times square. Also, the people who work there are incredibly service oriented, wanting to make sure you have a great stay at their hotel .... always friendly and responsive. Breakfast buffets are excellent. The hostess, Ana, at the restaurant couldn't' have been nicer, wanting to make sure our needs were always met ... even if she had to go beyond the call of duty to be responsive. Kudos to all the staff at the breakfast buffet as well, and in particular, Mahfuz, who we had the pleasure to meet. On a scale of 1-10, I give this place a resounding '10'! Keep up the GREAT work!!!

stayed here again although check in quick this time still nobody at platinum check in this time to their credit they did upgrade me to a nice room on 42nd floor with view of the Hudson as ive stated rooms are large even for New york otherwisw everything ok this time hope to see you again in January 2018

Clean, professionally run hotel in Times Square. First class staff with attention to detail. Rooms are surprisingly large for New York City. We had a great view of the Hudson River. Close to Central Park and Fifth Avenue.

Spent an amazing time in New York with granddaughter and best friend. As always our stay at the Crowne Plaza was fantastic and convenient to all amenities. It is located within walking distance to Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Rockerfellow Centre, St Patrick’s Church and much more. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Hotel is very clean and rooms are spacious. Will definitely return and would highly recommend to anyone.

It is still a big hotel, but the atmosphere has changed…. New Management…. I do not know, but this time I have an issue with a lying staff. We have been IHG member for a long time, but that does not mater, we reserved a room with a view over the city and pay for it, and we had a rom without heat with view on the back of the hotel after my husband complain about the room they gave us just in front of the elevator and told us they upgraded us….So if you want to save money on time square reserve a room at the cheapest price and you will probably get upgraded…..and if you are not on budget but like nice and friendly staff go to the intercontinental few blocks away. Otherwise the hotel has a nice location. Mr Manager if you read this one teach your staff how to be honest and say we are sorry but we gave away your reserved room….

In the Brasserie Tofael really took good care of us. Greating us with a smile, starts our day off right. Even though they have backed off of some of the item availability, the breakfast is still good. Last visit it was great when we could get omlett with the buffet.

I love the Lexington! We have stayed there about 5 times, and each time it proves itself to be a great hotel. When you arrive, the jazz music being played in the comfortable and welcoming lobby, make you feel relaxed and ready to enjoy your time in the city. The lounge is great and also offers a delicious continental breakfast in the morning. The rooms are clean, classy, and comfortable. The staff never disappoints. This past weekend, they surpassed their call of duty my making several accommodations for us after a longer than usual wait for our room. We were more than pleased with the extras they provided for us. Juan, one of the managers and Lismary, were incredibly helpful to us and made our stay memorable and wonderful. If you're looking for a centrally located hotel, this midtown Manahattan hotel, really has it all. A little bit away from the hub of the city, but close enough to reach Radio City in a 5-10 minute walk. You will not be disappointed with this hotel!

Pros: Location is Great for first time visitors to NYC. We were in walking distance to a lot of the places we wanted to see. Beds were very comfortable. Cons: Expensive hotel with little perks. There is no vent in the bathroom, no real sitting place to wait if you are waiting to check in. You could not sit in the Lobby or in the lounge for you had to buy something. Time square is very crowded with lots of people coming and going. Food is expensive, Over all service was decent... but they did not go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

As a Spire Elite member I can not praise my stay at this hotel enough. From reception to housekeeping we were made to feel so welcome. The bedroom was immaculate with the most comfortable beds and the breakfast buffet was simply amazing. We spent several times in the Broadway49 bar just relaxing, watching the world go by. We were here for a much needed rest but this hotel is in a fantastic position, within easy walking distance of all the main attractions.

I stayed at the Crown Plaza Time Square and also attended a conference in the same hotel for 4 days. The venue is well located, the room was clean and spacious. The Front desk service was speedy, courteous and efficient. My commendation for Rosa working at front desk! The only issue was during the conference, between the change of rooms and sessions in 2 floors, the AC was too cold, really freezing and worse than the outside temperature. As a result I got a cold, only on the day I was leaving the hotel that the heating was turned on inside the hotel. Wonder why it took so long to adjust the temperature in the hotel...

I am due to check in on 22nd Nov and I can only hope and pray that the service will be better in person compared to what I have experienced so far. After emailing the hotel numerous times to ask 2 questions regarding my reservation, I haven't even had the courtesy of a reply. I would try to phone but as I'm in UK the cost is too high.I will post another review after my visit and hope that my Crowne Plaza experience improves!!!

I wrote a review of this hotel when I stayed in April and it was a glowing review, the staff couldn’t have been more friendly. I stayed again in October and it does go to show how the staff can really alter people’s view of a hotel. The check in man we had was nowhere near as friendly and seemed to just want to get us checked in and be done with us. I will stay at this hotel again because of its great location but interesting to have two such different experiences.

Great hotel in a perfect position for Times Square. Staff are great and helpful rooms comfortable and clean. The bed is one of the best I have ever slept in! Wouldn't stop anywhere else, we will be back!

Although this is a very busy time of year my check-in was quick and easy. Being a Spire member has its benefits as I was given a corner room on the 45th floor looking right out on Times Square. The staff really took care of me here. The room was impeccably clean. This hotel has a fantastic location literally right next to the theatres and great restaurants. Victoria made sure that my checkout was quick and seamless. Parking was $73 for 1 night at the hotel so next time I will take a train in.
user_name:
David G
Cherry Hill, New Jersey

review_body: Victoria Martin front office delivered outstanding customer service, I am now checking in and I will def comeback and visit.. overall all staff have high energy and made my stay amazing!!! Great place
user_name:
jeffdagod
New York City, New York

review_body: A very nice hotel, in excellent location. Breakfast buffet with plenty of options, but sometimes the dinner room was to crowded. Friendly and helpful staff always. The room was spacious and very comfortable, in my case with a big and comfy king size bed.

Great location if you want to be in the middle of the action. Lots of choices for different subway routes to get around. Great staff and awesome housekeeping service. If you don't mind walking a block, you can get here via Airtrain and Subway from JFK Airport. Free wifi. They also have a great restaurant/bar on site with great staff as well.

Room was very nice as we had an upgrade for my birthday! Our thermostat was broken and room was often 76 degrees and uncomfortable. We did open the window and were given a fan that helped some. The gym looked nice but we didn't use it as we walked so much every day I would stay here again!

A perfect location for us, right on Times Square. We had two double beds and whilst the room wasn't huge it was certainly big enough, with an armchair, a desk and chair and a decent sized bathroom. The staff were lovely and the reception area modern and large. We have stayed twice before at the Edison just around the corner which we have enjoyed but this is a higher standard of hotel, more expensive though but worth it!

First, I have to say that the staff and service we're excellent, but the facilities are lacking. The rooms are smaller than some other local hotels I've stayed at, and the room could afford some renovating. Unfortunately the worst parts though we're 1) Occasionally when the air turns on, the whole room begins to smell like cigarette smoke. Without the air on, the room smelled fine but it's hit or miss. Despite the hotel claiming the facility is smoke free, either some guests or staff are smoking somewhere because the stench is real. Just as I turned off the light for bed, the air came on and made the room pretty unbearable. 2) I went to take a shower during my two night stay, and the nob and cover literally just came off the wall, exposing the rather ugly cylinder behind it. I didn't really expect the cylinder to look clean, but it definitely looked like it had been around for awhile. Given how easy it came off, I suspect a lazy maintenance job on it instead of a replacement. While I normally enjoy my stays at the Crowne, this experience was rough and I'll probably move back to the Marriott for my next NYC trip.

The room was very clean and maid service was very good. Our hotel concierge Corrine was very helpful with show tickets and recommendations for local restaurants. Our only issue was an annoying noise in our room that the hotel did eventually correct. The hotel is well located and convenient to shopping, shows and everything around Mid Town.

Overall very good, right next to Broadway and within easy reach of all the shows etc. Room was large, big comfy bed - but on 41st floor which took some getting used to as I don’t like heights - but that’s New York for you, so just draw the curtains if it’s a problem! I was confused and overwhelmed by how much there was to do, and the fact that the shows I wanted to go to were sold out - but Corinne, the concierge, was amazing in every detail - she advised me on a great show very nearby, and I got the last ticket - Kinky Boots - brilliant and funny! Corinne told me exactly how to get there, and also advised on other useful things - she was really friendly and helpful, and it made my stay much easier. Generally very good things to say about this huge hotel, very friendly and helpful with plenty of food and drink available, in or out. No bottles of drinking water in the room, so remember to take your own and save yourself a long ride in the elevator!

Recently visited hotel for 2 nights with my family of 4. The location was great, right in the heart of Times Square. The staff was fantastic. Victoria at the front desk was great. Got us checked in very quickly. She upgraded our room to a great view of the city and was just a pleasure to work with. The rest of the staff members that we encountered were just as friendly and professional. Concierge was helpful with dinner recommendations. Bartenders, waitstaff, coffee shop employees, etc. were all great. We will definitely stay here again when visiting NYC.

Just returned home from a 3 night stay at The Crowne Plaza.We both thoroughly enjoyed our visit to New York and we feel we chose the perfect hotel to rest our weary feet!Perfectly positioned in Times Square, the check in was prompt and professional by a really nice chap on reception. All the staff were great, the rooms were nice and clean. The main bar area was really nice, a well stocked bar with the option to order food, a real nice atmosphere. Check out was quick and courteous. This would be my first choice should we revisit New York. You will not go far wrong in choosing The Crowne Plaza in Times Square for your stay.Many thanks to all!

We stayed over the Halloween holiday with our two children. The receptionist took a little while booking us in. We booked the holiday through Virgin. The room and facilties appeared to be great. We has an issue with a broken window latch which let in a draught and was dripping water near to the lampshade socket so I unplugged this until the rain stopped. I reported this problem straight away to reception (Bethan I think?). A maintenance man came up to take a look. I asked if it was safe, he said it was safe and gave the choice to fix it that night or the following morning. As it was late and we were tired after being on the road for 20 hours I said to call back in the morning.We never saw anyone for the rest of our stay so the loose latch and draught remained. I took photos at the time and just before we left just in case.Apart from this our stay was very good. The housekeeper was very efficient. Room number 4305.

Great location. Only 2 blocks from Times Square. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Broadway shows close by. Subway close by & hop on hop off buses close at hand. Despite a problem with our initial room, the matter was resolved very quickly and efficiently.

The room was extremely clean, and the staff friendly and professional. The only issue is that the walls were very thin and i could hear the couple next door having sex all night. I heard every detail, and it was uncomfortable. Personally I don't know how they carried on for so long, I didn't get much sleep at all. But I would stay here again, but get hear plugs.

Our first visit to NYC for our 25th Anniversary and we chose this hotel after ready all the reviews. It live up to its billing, great service, food, a view over looking the city from the 43rd floor and the list goes on. Well pleased. See you again on our next visit.

The location of this hotel is excellent. My friends and I were walking distance to everything and were able to enjoy the Times Square night life without going to too far or having to take a train or Taxi. The rooms were relatively clean and the cleaning staff was nice. The front desk staff was not very helpful and seemed to not know anything about touring in NY, we couldn't even get a city map. The rate was high for such a hotel but you're paying for location.

I had stay with Crowne Plaza for 2 nights and it was a wonderful stay at Times Square. The location is good and staff is very friendly. We were served breakfast by Mahfuz and he was very good and prompt in his service. All the best to him....

We only chose this hotel as it was close to the Bruce Springsteen Show we were attending. Best thing we did. We have stayed in New York quite a few times before and this is the best hotel we have stayed in by far. We arrived early for our check in and we were welcomed by Victoria in reception. She was friendly and went out of her way to get our room for us as quickly as she could, which was appreciated by us after travelling for over 20 hours. She gave us a drink pass to use at the bar and also a complimentary pass to grab a coffee and a muffin. The room was was clean and the bed comfortable, we had a great view of Times Square. Only negative it does not have a fridge which we would have liked and a few technical things that happens in hotels, one day we had no hot water and some of the stations on the TV had no sound not a huge issue but was noticed. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would definitely stay again.

Rude and very slow check in staff who will deny good room . Wifi is very slow although they claim 5mpbs speed for free . Breakfast is poor and for 32 dollars there are a lot of alternatives within 25 metres and much cheaper specially hot food. Staff is not bothered about amenities and facilities and package that they have booked and promised . For everything you have to speak to Duty manager ms Amanda on this occasion who could do little except offer verbal apology . Gym is very very good . Rooms facing Hudson River are good but the ones facing Times Square are poor . Toilet is pigeon hole and most inconvenient to even shave . Porter takes forever and bell boy and concierge are never there on desk and not very helpful . Best part is Phone’s try calling anybextension of hotel service like guest services or in room dining or house keeping or simply the operator the phone will keep ringing and after ten min of continuous trying you might get somebody . Better go to the reception and tell them what you want and hopefully they will do something . AVOID THIS HOTEL TILL THEY IMPROVE SECVIE

It's not a bad hotel but quite basic U can only have breakfast no restaurant in the hotel meaning you have to go out after a long day also no fridge The rooms have doers into the adjoining room yes locked but you hear everything The staff are mostly foreign as they don't talk English most of the time which I find rude also not very friendly I won't stay here again

Check in smooth friendly and efficient by the lovely evelyn. Breakfast good as was bar food. Comfortable bed and very clean. Staff all helpfull but lady on checkout, in the early hours of the morning seemed as if couldnt be bothered and we still havent received refund of$75,held incase of breakages etc, we had already paid via british airways and guy assured us the night prior to check out that there would be nothing to pay!!
user_name:
disgruntled186394
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: First time to NYC, only went due to the hurricane in Miami, from our whole trip this was the best hotel we stayed in by a long way, room was spacious and the view of time square made it all that more special. staff were really good the only downfall was the restaurant food was average at best! But who eats in there anyway.. Overall i will be going back there on my next visit.

27/10 Super service provided by Evelyn on check in desk on arrival at hotel . Problems with credit card we're ironed out quickly and professionally by EVELYN and her supervisor. Many thanksHotel very Central right on times square Great location in comfortable surroundings

We had a wonderful break in New York enjoyed all aspects of hotel. However this has been marred by the fact a payment taken at initial check in has yet to be refunded despite never having had any extras. We have emailed the hotel several times regarding this matter which still has not been resolved. Please deal with this asap thank you.

Returned a few days a go from a 9 night stay at this hotel and to say I was highly disappointed with my stay here would be an understatement!It’s was my 6th time in New York, I wanted to stay at the Westin however was fully booked for the dates I wanted so chose this hotel based on photos on website and it’s location. I paid extra for what was supposed to be a larger family room with two large double beds. Upon check to my shock discovered the beds to be a couple of inches bigger then the single beds we have in the UK, I have never experienced this before in any hotel in New York always had large beds in the room. The beds were way too small for two people to share! The head board had a plastic type coating that was all peeling. There was a really bad damp smell in room and the bedding felt damp. After all of us had a shower I discovered cause. The extractor fan did not work in bathroom so after we all had our showers the windows were dripping with water, window ledges became wet with condensation, bedding once again damp. For a family room the room had one half size wardrobe with 6 hangers and there were 3 drawers to store clothing! No fridge/mini bar available. On our 3rd night there they were able to change us to a different room with one king size bed and a roll away bed that was not as damp, had a lot of dust though to which we took pictures but by this point I had given up on complaining as on our second night there we ordered room service I was the only one to order pizza and after eating 2 slices I thought something didn’t taste right so I didn’t finish it. Around 4am I woke feeling extremely sick and began vomiting non stop and had severe stomach cramps. I phoned guest services and they sent security to take an incident report and they took away the remaining pizza and I was told it would be tested and that the manager would contact me, I received no contact at all! I was ill for over 48 hours! I wanted to settle my account the night before departure as was leaving very early and I saw I had still been charged in full for the meal which had made me sick and I asked for an update on my food poisoning complaint and was told that the restaurant manager was not available, the manager working at the time Michelle said she would take $50 off of my bill but when bill was posted through my door later nothing had been deducted. I have not bothered to contact the hotel to argue this as it was never about the money. I got food poisoning from the hotel kitchen ruined over two days of our holiday and not once did the manager have the decency to contact me. This hotel in no way offers value for service and their guest service is appalling. Only positive with regards to the hotel is it’s location. I will never stay in this hotel again on my return to New York and would never recommend it to anyone in no way does this hotel deserve its 4 star rating it’s a very poor 1 star in my opinion!

Location was perfect but there was no shampoo just conditioner and shower gel. For that price the coffee cups in the room were disposable not real cups. So we couldn't drink another one in the morning. No more cups. Room was big and twin beds were comfortable. There was no fridge either.

Arrived October 26th 2017 checked into hotel at around 8.45 pm . The member of staff who completed our check in had a bad attitude and couldn’t really be bothered . We booked through virgin Atlantic and our documents stated that we were entitled to complementary drinks vouchers on arrival for wine or beer . Of course they never materialised and we didn’t even get a bottle of water in our room , after a long days traveling . The room was a good size but dated and the only good thing was the bed which was very comfortable . The room was cleaned daily to a good standard . It mentions a coffee maker which is in the room , good as long as you drink it black as there is no milk or cream . Also the maid doesn’t always replace used satchets. The hotel concierge was totally ignorant and deserves sacking for her bad attitude . Overall this hotel was a big disappointment

Hotel is in a good location. It's clean and has pretty spacious room from NYC.I would never recommend the hotel for one reason - the staff.Extremely unhelpful and unfriendly.Upon checking in the total for our room + a $300 deposit (we were never told about) was taken from one credit card, despite 3 been handed over. We had to ask was money taken from the care. No information was forthcoming. When we questioned why this was done we got a very rude and short response - it's the hotel policy. Which is fair enough, but we weren't made aware of this. Furthermore another $400 was held on another card after, one that wasn't presented to reception. When this was questioned we were told it was nothing to do with the hotel. Even though it had the hotel reference. Very unsatisfactory service.

On arrival in Nyc our apartment we booked via trip adviser was awful and not fit to stay in, we quickly checked hotel availability and crown plaza was cheapest option. Got to hotel and checked in for 5 nights and what a brilliant decision it was. Location was just brilliant. Staff were so good from reception to house keeping. Bar staff were great, food great. Bar staff even gave us all a drink on the house whilst we were waiting in the bar for our transfer back to JFK. I just can’t fault this hotel at all and will definitely return. They met all our requirements considering we just turned up at hotel having made tr reservation half hour earlier. They gave us a great price , gave us 3 rooms next door to each other. It’s not luxurious but it was clean , comfortable beds and meets all your needs for a New York stay !

There were 2 reasons for us to choose this hotel: its excellent location right at Times Square and it being one of the few NYC hotels to offer relatively spacious double rooms (of which we had 2). The rooms we found there we indeed spacious enough, but were (as the entire hotel) pretty run down (paint in the shower splintering off, furniture falling apart etc). I would say it dates from the 1990ies (if not 80ies) and it shows. The other big draw back: you feel ripped off: a 30 USD service per day per room (Q: „Madam, what is it for?“ A: „Internet, Sports Club etc.“, Q „And if I don‘t need this?“ A „You have to pay it anyway“) I found it in the small print of my Expedia reservation, but it did not show during price comparison. 420 USD plus tax for unspecified services regardless if wanted or not, I find this not ok. Another example: using the so-called business center for printout of tickets: first 5 minutes and 2 pages free (I barely made it), but guess what: you are being remembered and the second time they charged me 7.50 USD for 2 pages of print. That‘s what I call a margin. In Europe, Crown Plaza hotels is a relatively up-market chain and they would never get away with an offering like this. When I was young, I used to stay at run-down hotels in NYC, but al least they were cheap. This one was not.

The hotel is very pretty and location is awesome. I want to thank the staff front desk Donald Mei and Victoria Harrold for making our stay so wonderful with all their service.I will come back. The room are very spacious and clean.

No issues with the rooms or the service. However, despite having booked through British Airways, handing over the 'voucher' and being provided with a room account balance of zero, I was subsequently charged an additional £3,000 on my credit card (which was provided only for additional items such as mini bar). Since the charge I have emailed and phoned the Crowne Plaza, but have not received a response. I can't imagine why it hasn't been sorted out, but I wouldn't not recommend staying unless you literally want to pay twice and have the hassle of trying to claim back the money you're owed. In my case I am still waiting for a response from Crowne Plaza and British Airways. I would advice people to stay away.

I have just returned from 5 nights at the Crowne Plaza , it's right in the hub of Times Square but once inside you don't notice any noise! Our room on the 37th floor had amazing views of the city and the bed was super comfy! Good size shower but no bath , no drinking water in the room which is unusual , had nice bar snacks in the happy hour in the hotel bar and 2 vouchers for 2 free drinks was a nice touch , especially when a glass of wine in NY is 12 dollars! Would recommend.

Highly recommended!Reasonable price for a nice hotel in the center of the city.Pleasant and helpful staff at front deskSpecious room with a shower only (no bathtub) Stayed on a corner room facing times square.

We had a fabulous stay in The Crown Plaza hotel. Lovely large rooms with great view over Times Square. Staff excellent especially Karim the Food and beverage manager. He helped to make out stay so enjoyable. Highly recommended.

My wife and I called in to the Bar and Lounge at Crowne Plaza Times Square and even though we were not residents we were made very welcome and the quality of drinks and food was excellent but the main reason for this review was to praise an employee there called Yasmin who made our evening so special as her attention and service was on another level to what is normally recieved and in our view deserves recognition

On vacations my wife and I generally don't spend a lot of time in the hotel room outside of sleep/morning prep, so the biggest thing for us is a clean room, comfortable bed, and a clean/well appointed bathroom. The room was not giant, so if that's something you need I suppose it's a minus, but it was more than big enough for the 2 of us and it was exactly what we were looking for. Everything was in good repair, modern, clean, staff were helpful, amenities in the hotel were great. The location is excellent, as you're just a short walk from the heart of times square, and about a block from a subway station that will take you quickly to any of the larger hub stations which will get you literally anywhere in NY.

Hotel was great, clean and spacious.Had a lovely room with a Time Square view, thanks to Frankie on the front desk.Joanne on the concierge desk help us with all our sight seeing, shopping and theatre needs, she was so patient and helpful.Will definatly be back.

Just returned from 6 night stay , loved our comfy room with three large windows over Broadway and times sq great view from 29 floor . Bed comfortable room large, daily maid service room very clean ,very large tv also safe and wifi No problem with lifts etc full breakfast in hotel 30 dollars , so we used the coffee shop in hotel and got coffee , bagels, Danish , muffins for about 14 dollars and ate them in bar We got our free wine and international calls from room overall happy with stay staff helpful avoid shop in hotel 4 dollars for bottle water

a good hotel, very near to to times square you just have to go down from the hotel and you are in the times square to enjoy the hustle and bustle excellent breakfast and bar and they also give you coupons for the barrooms are very nice spacious and with good views

what a great hotel right in the heart of time square.from the moment we checked in with Evelyn we had the perfect holiday . our only issue was the safe wouldn't work so when we reported it a new safe was installed within an hour. lovely rooms, comfy bed and excellent food and drinks.A real jewel in the heart of Time Square would definitely recommend to friends and family.i look forward to my next visit

stayed on the 43rd floor the week of Oct 9, 2017. the view was amazing! location is central to most of our activities. the room was good, not as nice as I was hoping for, for this price. not even an in room fridge! we had to ask for towels almost daily but the room was clean. bed was comfy. I wish the curtains weren't so sheer, lets all the lights in & I prefer a dark room to sleep. the 2 staff we encountered were nice. very busy hotel. we did not eat or have drinks here so I can't comment on that. we didn't use the gym or pool either.

Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights This time and loved my stay . The hotel has lovely atmosphere with decent sized rooms , very clean environment and comfy beds . Most of the time when I m in New York I stay in this hotel . I would definitely recommend this hotel

Spent a Saturday night here. Weekend rates are almost double. Clean room. Comfortable bed. Great flat screen. nice city view.Would have liked a tub but had a great shower. Centrally located on Broadway, Times Square. Parking is $70 a day. Take the train! LOL

Awesome hotel, lovely rooms, comfy beds, lovely bathroom, amazing view out window, restaurant very good, very close to time square which is brilliant. Definitely recommend this hotel, brilliant and helpful staff. :)

This hotel is interesting. First impression, was where is the entrance and lobby. After our journey looking, we found the front desk. They were very nice and helpful. It also helps if you are a IHG rewards members. So sign up to get stuff. I love free stuff. I ask for a room with a view and a firm bed. Got them both. We had a corner room on the 34th floor, with windows all around. Nice bathroom, the door wouldn't close properly. That was the only thing wrong. The safe needed a card with the magnet strip. I just use our cruise key card. It work just fine.

You can't beat the location; for sure being at Time Square is great, and you can easily use the metro as preferred medium of transportation to move anywhere in Manhattan, but it comes at a price, and you would expect a certain level of service from such a prestigious hotel.Lobby queue was incredibly long to check-in or check-out; fortunately the staff was very firendly.But the real problem I had was the level of noise in the room. The windows do little to save you from the city when you try to recover from your long days of walk. Putting pressure on the windows I could tamper the noise, but I can't hold the window all night long. My friend located at a different floor at a similar problem, so I believe this is not an isolated case.

We stayed at the hotel 2 weeks ago for 2 nights and it was great. I was a bit worried because of the reviews I read about the decor being tired. Our room was clean and lovely with a great view of Times Square. The bed was quite comfortable. The room was actually quite large for a Manhattan hotel. We later traveled around New England and on our return to New York we stayed at another name brand hotel a few blocks uptown because I wanted to be closer to the Park and Rockefeller Center. That room was so small we could barely walk in the door. I was sad that we didn't come back to the Crowne Plaza. I also liked that the window opened a couple inches to let some air in the room. It was unusually warm for October and the air conditioning was turned off as most hotels do in New York in Fall and Winter (I have no idea why). Just that little bit of air made all the difference and kept the room from being too stuffy. I was also worried that it would be too noisy being so close to Times Square but that wasn't the case at all, at least no different than any other hotel I've stayed at in New York.Everyone from check in to the help in the Lobby Bar were pleasant. Not exceptional but I have no complaints. It's New York so expecting people to bend over backwards, as some reviewers expect, is not likely but everyone was quite pleasant and helpful.I was very glad we stayed here and will stay here again on my next visit.

Thank you IHG and Crowns Plaza. I've stayed in NYC, somewhere near Times Square every time and this was by far the nicest room I've ever stayed in. I travel for business so often that I was able to use IHG points for three nights. The location was amazing, the room was clean and appointed with modern furniture. We had a corner room on the 41st floor with a king bed and a spectacular view. The restaurant was great for breakfast (just make sure you have IHG certificates) and the bar was nice. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. I ran in central park, but I think the NYSC gym looked pretty awesome too. Just a great stay. Thanks.

This was our third stay at this hotel. Two couples had two comfortable rooms with great views of Times Square. The Hotel staff is excellent. From Evelyn, who checked us in, to Kareem, whom I think is the bar and restaurant manager treated us courteously and warmly. We ended each day with a nightcap at the bar and bartenders Jason, Keith and Martin were wonderful.

Crowne Plaza was in an excellent location, all the big bus tours started just next to this hotel, uptown goes all round central park, midtown goes up to the piers and downtown busiest goes right down to 9/11 location, right in the centre of times square in the heart of it, the hotel was very good didn't use the restaurant but did have a drink and that was very pricey so only got one drink and we decided to go swimming but found out the pool is not affliated with the hotel and hotel guests get to use it but I had to book and had to wait nearly two hours and the pool not that big, is a roped off pool 4 lanes so not a fun pool for kids I was with my grandson 10 but my hotel room was very nice and the concierge service was very good and helpful

We stayed here for one night and were blown away with the hotel. The staff couldn’t do more for us friendly, helpful anything we wanted they helped us. The location is just something else easy walking distance to most of the attractions. And if you want something to eat then try the diner adjoined to the hotel we had breakfast and it was great. Will certainly stop here again on our next visit to New York.

I have been here twice in the past month and had a very enjoyable stay both times. I asked to change room types after 3 days because I was getting a guest and they were very helpful. Staff was friendly and professional. I loved the pool, hot tub and sauna. Spent time at them daily. They were clean and the temperatures were just right for all 3. My room was cleaned very well daily and they took the time to make sure the little details were covered. They straightened out my toiletries. The only concern I had was the parking garage. It had multiple areas roped of and major pot holes. Not enough to ruin my stay.

Very nice hotel in the middle of Times Square. Clean rooms, good service, and efficient staff. The only problem was a $75 charge I discovered on my bill after my stay. It's been four days after I inquired about, I have still do not have an explanation.

My husband, who is originally from New York, picked this hotel based on a good rate and location. I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the room was; clean, large for NY and comfortable bed. You are right in the theatre district, which was really convenient. We also got 2 coupons for free drinks downstairs. I highly recommend this hotel.

I done so much research into this Holiday and decided to book the crowne plaza times square.Rooms are a decent size for NYC.The hotel is clean, staff helpful and great bar if u wanted a drink after a long day. We never tried the restaraunt but looked nice.  This hotel is close to all the attractions of times square and the subway which we found really easy to use. Would definitely look to come back and

It did not bode well when the receptionist on the IHG check in desk shouted past other guests “Don’t wait in this line, I’m closed.”Then the person who did check me in, after waiting 20 minutes, did not put the room key in the card holder and I had to go up and down to the 44th floor with my luggage. I have to agree with other reviewers; this hotel is tired, its staff are unwelcoming, service is mediocre. Lobby bar food is good but the servers openly argue over who gets the bigger groups and this is unprofessional.No water provided in the room.The breakfast restaurant staff are not friendly and at busy times the service verges on chaos.

We were on the 22nd floor over looking Broadway. The view was great and aside from emergency vehicle sirens we were high enough up that you couldn’t hear the regular street noise. There was no noise inside the hotel at all and frankly I never saw another guest on our floor. The location was perfect we walked to our Broadway shows in just mere minutes. Times Square was just a couple of blocks the other direction and also just minutes away. The room was clean and nicely decorated but had a little wear and tear on it. The headboards of the bed were scuffed up, the wallpaper in the bathroom bubbled up in some places and our bathroom faucet dripped. The beds were super comfortable and the pillows a fluffy delight.The room was very average in size nothing huge nor was it super cramped. Just your average double bed hotel room. Room service did a nice job each morning making the bead and refreshing the bathroom.The gym had a lot of equipment to offer and my daughter utilized the facility to keep up with her cross country training while we were out of town. We were there over a weekend and they open later than during the week so check the times and don’t get up early on the weekend thinking you’re going to get a workout in. Everything in NY gives me sticker shock so it goes without saying the nightly rate was no different, but it is about par for this level of hotel in this area of NY I think. We enjoyed our stay here and would come back for the excellent location. I didn’t use the bell service, room service or anything else. I made the mistake of buying an individual size bag of smart popcorn at the little convenience store at the base of the elevators inside the hotel. It was $4! The chocolate croissant was less then that! Ask about pricing before you buy anything!All in all a nice stay.

This wonderful hotel is situated on a perfect location in the center of Manhattan,at a stone's throw from Times square!Very clean and spacious rooms with comfortable beds!If I ever go to New York again,I will definitelly stay there too!

Plus - check-in was friendly and efficient with no line at mid-night to checkin: AC/Heating in room operated fine; Bed was average comfortMinus - The tub was dirty with hairs in it; the nightstand was visibly dirty and the CD player sitting in the middle of it was downright filthy. The outlets at the nightstand didnt work, so my phone battery was dead in the morning. The charging port near the TV also failed to work. I know it's Times Square, but the price for such low quality is really appalling.

This was our second visit to the Crowne Plaza Time Square. Upon arrival at 1 p.m. the personable clerk informed us that our room was ready and at that time we were offered a complimentary upgrade to a room that overlooked Times Square if we wished to wait. We decided to take the initial room that was offered and were absolutely thrilled! The corner room overlooked the Hudson River and we were able to view cruise ships departing for their weekly journey. We took advantage of the morning breakfast plan that the hotel offered and we were not disappointed, it was very good each morning. We look forward to our visit next year and hope to stay at the Crowne Plaza again!

Two things I really enjoyed about this hotel: there is full New York Sports Club gym on the 15th floor that hotel guest can use, and that is a nice change from the typical tiny hotel gym.Secondly, IHG Platinum members paid $10 for the breakfast buffet instead of the normal $30. That's a nice touch and I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Evelyn at the front desk was also super nice.The rooms were pretty dated but based on my whole experience my rating went from a 4 to 4.5, so I just rounded it up to a full 5.

I was actually a little disappointed in this property. I went there for a work trip and typically they book events at high end hotels and I realize it's NYC and it's expensive but I expected a little more. The lobby is in need of an upgrade. It's older, but not charming old. Everything seemed clean though. The room itself was fine- nothing exciting. It was a smaller room (typical for NYC standards) and they only had rooms with 2 doubles (no queens) and kings (we brought our children so we had to make do with the 2 doubles). The beds were ok- not amazing. We did have a room on the 46th floor and we had a magnificent view of Times Square. The area is right smack in the middle of Times Square. There are LOADS of restaurants, theaters, and stores all walking distance. If you're going for that experience it's a great area to be in!The service was not that great. No one was very friendly...the bellhop was rude. We gave him our ticket (we had the hotel keep our luggage while we explored the city after checking out) and he brought back our cart and just left it for us to deal with. No one helped us with the cart or our luggage as we loaded into a cab. I was so suprised! And it wasn't like there were tons of people waiting for their luggage- there wasn't anyone there! The front desk could work on being more friendly. I've been to NYC many times and it's not like it's a NY thing to be unfriendly at hotels. We did have an amazing server in the bar/restaurant right in the lobby. I forgot her name, but she was warm, friendly and a complete gem. She was wonderful with our boys and was super attentive and she should train the rest of the staff at the hotel! I went there for a business trip so I spent a considerable amount of time in the meeting rooms and again- there is room for improvement. The podium was so hideous- knicks and scratches all over the wood and the bottom of it had duct tape on a part of it. I was actually really surprised they would still use it. During the meeting the hotel was doing some construction which was super distracting. If I planned the meeting I would have been upset.Bottom line- if you get a great deal and aren't planning on staying in the room too long then go for it...otherwise...keep looking. There are a ton of amazing hotels that I would consider before this one. Also- this isn't a 'luxury' hotel by my standards- but it was expensive, perhaps not $600 a night, but it was pricey.

The Crowne Plaza is an oasis of calm right in the hustle and bustle of Times Square. It is an easy walk to many Broadway theaters, including Hello Dolly, Phantom of the Opera, Lion King, and School of Rock. My wife dropped her credit card on the floor when leaving the room, and we returned to find it on the bed. Our stay was awesome. We will go back.

We had a great room, did hear some sirens at night, but it didn't really bother us. Room was always clean, and nicely appointed. The Breakfast Buffet is well worth the extra dollars! Always had a nice selection of fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, and wonderful pastries! And, the coffee was excellent, as well.Great way to start your day! I strongly recommend this hotel, and would stay here again!

Have stayed here a few times, most recently in Mid October. Folks in the hotel are very nice. It is a busy tourist hotel, not a place for a quiet business stay. This is as you might expect given it's location near Times Square. Had a couple of issues with a clogged sink and the bathroom vanity not being very clean at check in. All was nicely handled by staff.

The hotel location is awesome! You have Time Square a few minutes up and the subway around the corner. The room was very nice and the bed was comfy. They have a cafe in the lobby if you want to grab something to go. I would suggest if you want a view ask for anything above the 15th floor.

From the moment we checked in, our 5 day stay was fantastic. It was obvious that creating a positive customer experience was job 1 and they delivered. The breakfast team really did a great job starting our day with a warm welcome and great food. Our room was clean and comfortable. Huge thank you to all our friends at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square.

Stayed here for 7 nights recently with my elderly mum. Location on Time Square is the hotel's main attraction. Our room located on floor 26 (2 double beds) was spacious although the room itself could do with an update i.e. carpets and furniture drastically need upgrading. The room itself is dark (even with 3 lamps on). The bathroom door wouldn't shut fully cause the door doesn't fit the doorframe. The taps/faucets were leaking after use and the standalone mirror was rusty. Overall it didn't bother us too much but faults like this are noticeable from a first impression of the accommodation. Room was cleaned daily and tea/coffee facilities were welcome. Receptionist was very helpful when I called seeking assistance. Restaurant is only open for breakfast and lunch. "What no evening meals to enjoy the ambience to Time Square???". Sorry no you have to avail of bar menu. "Ahh FFS we might as well ramble out to a restaurant or bring back food to our room". Every time we exited the hotel we were ambushed by bus sales reps - not the fault of the hotel but it affects your mindset regarding location of the hotel. My main impression is that this hotel caters for mainly short term visitors.

The location was great - super close to Times Square but if it's first trip to NYC I think I would stay near Central Park instead. Way more interesting things to see as your hoofing it. This hotel is about a mile to the park so we walked there anyway but I feel like I couldn't have taken in Times Square in two hours or toddled down for one day/night to see a show and been good. Wouldn't recommend setting up shop here. The hotel was okay but staff didn't really care about our stay and didn't seem knowledgeable about hotel grounds and amenities. We called to asked about early check in and was told about 1p would be okay. We got there at 2p and was told otherwise. No early check ins possible and told to come back at 3p. Called down to see if we could bring a drink to the pool. Transferred three times because no one knew the answer. We gave up waiting. We had a loud horn type noise that would go off periodically from the vent in our bathroom. It was so loud we assumed a fire alarm was going off. This thing went off several times early AM our first morning. We were exhausted and figured it was a fluke so we kept ignoring and going back to sleep after it shut off. When we returned to our hotel mid evening it continued. The front desk took no action on call 1. Called again an hour later and was told someone would be right up. Nope. We left for the evening and ran into security on the way and played a video of the noise. He laughed and said engineering would have to come up - we would need to wait. Or we could just try calling again when we returned. What a hassle. Never resolved the noise issue for us. Also I left some keys in the room and no one seems interested in helping us locate them. Called several times and was being told to just try back later. No offer to check with housekeeping or help a guest stressed out about items left behind. Still waiting but I think I'm just better off to head to the dealership and get a new car key. Not interested in staying at Crowne Plaza chain again.

We stayed two nights, Oct 8-10, and had a great stay. The location is perfect, the staff was always very nice, and the room was roomy and clean. I will definitely put this on my favorite list for my future NYC trips

I stayed in the Crowne plaza on times square 2 years ago and really enjoyed the experience. I felt staff were very helpful. Unfortunately my second time around that wasnt the case.When I was returning to New York my obvious choice was to stay at the Crowne Plaza. I convinced my group of 8 that it was the best choice as I honestly felt at the time that it was.Upon arriving the reception staff were very good. Really helpful and gave us tons of information. However, the bar staff were very rude. The service was also very slow! I felt the bar was very under staffed and our waiter that was with us was busy with another table and when I asked one of the staff members that was passing our table for a drink I was told your waiter is over there, he will get it for you when hes ready. I work in hospitality myself and in our hotel the number 1 rule that we have is everyone helps eachother so I was surprised to hear her say this! (Also, i know the hotel doesnt have anything to do with this but the public were very uphelpful and rude also.)On the day when we were leaving we all had our bags down stairs and were asking the gentlemen if it was possible to get a taxi where he replied a simple 'no'. I asked why and he said all 8 of you wont fit in a taxi. My reply was I understand that, so we are fine to get 2 or even 3 because of baggage. His reply was ok and just walked away. So rude!! honestly never felt as stupid in my life as I did when I was just standing there. So i returned to my group and told them that we just had to deal with it ourselves and as 8 ladies were dragging 12 big cases out through the revolving doors the 2 men just looked at us. I get that sometimes a big group like ours is annoying when we have questions etc but honestly a little bit of kindness would have been appericated. It just put a dampner on our holiday and every single one of us agreed that we would never return to New York and were delighted we were heading to Boston (where we find the people to be so much nicer!) Reception staff were brilliant in this hotel and so were the concierge staff. Maybe New York is a one hit wonder because I enjoyed my first time 2 years ago alot more then this time around.

Stayed here with daughter for 5 nights 6 days fantastic hotel everything about it was first class staff. rooms. service .everything lovely clean rooms towels changed every day can fault it at all . Staff were very helpful with everything free wi fi tea making facilities and TV .

First stay in New York City and first stay in the Crowne Plaza and it was one to remember. The hotel is in the center of Time Square and is a fantastic location for tourists. The whole experience was completely amazing. The delightful receptionist was so helpful and gave us a map indicating where we were and the locations we asked her for. She recommended local diners to us and provided information on purchasing Broadway Show tickets and reduced prices. Then the fun begun.... to squeeze everything in there is a LOT of walking involved but we managed to do all we wanted and more. The tour tickets sellers are everywhere and can be rather annoying but the trips are amazing and worthwhile. We had already purchased 3 trips and needed to activate our card, after some confusion we obtained the ticket and needed to get the ticket seller to activate it... unfortunately he failed to tell us he had activated the "hop on hop off" all day bus ticket and gave me (what i thought) was a receipt so we lost one excursion. We did report this and the manager was brilliant offering another ticket without any problems. Just be aware if you have a pass for more than one excursion ensure they understand exactly what you want. Juniors diner is opposite the hotel and the food is totally amazing.. mum was hooked on their cheesecakes! Be aware of the portion sizes though please they are massive!!!  I seriously can not fault this hotel at all, if you intend to visit New York then this place comes 100% recommended.Thank you Crowne Plaza and thank you New York... BRILLIANT

When our room wasn’ ready they told us it would be by 1 pm and would call us if it was ready before. No call and we went back to check at 2:30 Room still not ready. Said they were preparing a room on a high floor when we had requested a room on a lower floorThey found a room on a high floor which we accepted because we were tired. Next morning call because there was only decaf coffee in the courtesy coffee tray. It took 35 minutes to bring regular coffee. Later at about 1pm we noticed the replenishment was only decaf. Called again . They promised to bring regular coffee but it had not arrived by early evening when we had to call again. We also brought their attention to a security issue but the response was slow if they ever responded.Everybody was very polite and friendly but I expect more from IHG

I’ve stayed at the Crowne plaza time square many times it has always been a wonderful experience located right across street from the subway right in the heart of time square the rooms are beautiful and the restaurant downstairs the buffet in the morning is absolutely wonderful but who makes it absolutely wonderful is a gentleman by the name Tofael there’s nothing he wouldn’t do for you the reason why we come back is because of him the most wonderful person server and he add five stars to the Crowne Plaza New York New I recommend staying highly and definitely eating in their wonderful restaurant and having Tofael serve you

Being from NJ, I stayed over at the Crowne Plaza for a stay-cation in the city. This hotel is in an AMAZING location for tourists, unfortunately not so great for those who are from the area.LOCATION: The CP is right in the heart of Times Square, near where Broadway and 7th Avenue intersect. The hotel does have an entrance from 48th and 49th street as well (good to know if you want to skip entering through the crowds). The hotel looks very nice, has many floors, with amazing views of the city.CHECK-IN: Check-in for me was easy. Being an IHG platinum member, I paid with points and was able to check-in at the IHG member area, however even the regular check-in would have been quick. Check-in was incredibly quick, and I was in my room within 5 minutes (yes, 5 minutes).ROOM: The lobby to the CP is on the 2nd floor, and elevators are right around the corner. The elevator was quick, and my room was really nice, with an extremely comfortable bed, nice walk-in shower, and very clean. I saw some wear, but overall the room looked great.SLEEP: The bed was really comfortable and the shades draw tight to block out all light. The A/C wasn't amazing for me like other hotels, but it was still absolutely adequate and I slept comfortably. Also, very quiet hotel, at least on my floor.OVERALL: As mentioned, for tourists, this is a great hotel, in a perfect location. For anyone doing a stay-cation, it's right in the heart of Times Square, so be prepared for an annoying walk there. Or take 8th and cut down 48th or 49th - there is a walk-through garage for the hotel with an entrance.

My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Crowne Plaza for a weekend getaway in early October. We really enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic - right in the heart of Times Square. Our room had a beautiful view of the Hudson River and was just what we needed to wind down and relax. The best part of our stay were the restaurant and bar areas and their staff. Karim (the Food and Beverage Manager) was extremely helpful and accommodating. We were treated as if we were VIPs. Jason (bartender) was very pleasant and attentive and made awesome drinks. Michelle (server) was a joy and took great care of us. I must say I was very impressed with the breakfast buffet at Brasserie 1605 in the hotel. It was one of the most expansive buffets I have ever seen. Basically anything you could think of eating for breakfast was available. The wait staff during the breakfast buffet were great as well - very attentive; had coffee on the table right away; and always smiling. It was nice to greet smiling faces early in the morning. Overall, we greatly enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square and hope to do it again in the near future.

It is true that the location, just on Time Square, is really great for people who are looking to be in the theater district, in the middle of the animation of Broadway. But apart from that, for 450 USD a night, we deserve something else ...- rooms : to hear door slams the whole evening is not what you expect in such an hotel. Rooms are OK but not "fantastic" for the price. They did not even put shower gels, etc. the second day ...- Service is not poor, it is really bad; always a queue of 15 people at reception (one or two staff members maximum). And even if i am a gold member, i had to wait for a while before somebody decides to take care of me (without even looking at me, no smile, just the industry without any consideration for guests).- same attitude at bell / luggage service. Don't expect some help if you don't ask (they prefer to chat between them).- at the bar, same. You wait, nobody comes. I left ...One exception: concierge Corinne, a professional. Such a service is just unacceptable. Overprices, bad service ... Why not to choose a boutique hotel a bit further or change brand ? That is what i will do next time ...

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza w/e of 22nd September as a Birthday getaway. Neither my husband nor I had been to New York before and were a little apprehensive about what to expect. The hotel is very easy to access by cab (take a yellow cab from the airport for a fixed fee for ease) and by Subway, and Grand Central Terminal is only 5-10 mins walk away. Once we arrived at the hotel, check in was smooth and easy, the reception staff were friendly and helpful, and we were given a room on the 44th floor (4406). The higher floors are better for those who don't like the hustle and bustle, as although it's never totally quiet in the city, it's easy to switch off and sleep being so far up from street level. The room itself was a reasonable size, there was plenty of room for my husband and I to get around without falling over each other or our luggage. The bed was vast and very comfortable, the large window allowed us to get a full view of the Hudson (rooms on the other side of the corridor look directly over Times Square - great for views but you'd need to use the blackout curtain that is in the room!). The room had all the amenities you would expect - large flatscreen TV with a good choice of channels, coffee machine, hairdryer, iron, air conditioning (the fan was slightly noisy on the higher settings, but nothing that stops you sleeping after a busy day of sightseeing and shopping, and given that the temperature was in the high 20's / low 30's during our visit, we were very thankful that we had air con!). A nice touch was the USB charging point next to the bed, so that you don't need to use an adaptor to charge your tablet or phone. The room (and the hotel in general) was very clean and tidy, and the maids were in every day to top up the toiletries and give the bathroom and the room a general clean and tidy-up. All the staff we came into contact with were helpful, friendly and polite.We didn't make much use of the dining facilities in the hotel as we wanted to try as many local places as possible, but there is a bistro / restaurant that serves breakfast as well as lunch and dinner, and there is a coffee shop on the lobby level that sells cakes, pastries, boxed salads etc for you to take away. There is a bar area opposite reception also - we did have a cocktail here, but the choice on the menu was limited so you'd have to ask the barman to make you most things from scratch, and be prepared to pay for the privilege (we paid over $30 for two cocktails). The location of the hotel can't be faulted - it is right on the edge of Times Square, on Broadway, and centrally located for East / West / Uptown / Downtown visits. With 5-10 mins walking you can get to Grand Central Terminal, the Rockefeller Centre, Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Macy's, the Hudson Piers for the main boat tours and Water Taxi, and many other attractions. Our check out experience was straightforward and stress free, and the hotel offers luggage storage for guests on their check-out day so you don't have to cart your baggage round the city waiting for your transfer. This is quite handy, given how busy the streets around Times Square are, it's good to know that you can wander the city to get in some last minute sightseeing whilst your luggage is safely stored away. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay at the Crowne Plaza - it served as an excellent base to explore the city, and gave us a comfortable place to retreat when it was time to unwind and escape the city buzz. We are already talking about returning!

The room was perfect. The location could not have been any better. I want to especially thank Brunelda. Her service was refreshing and impeccable as she assisted me with checking in. She was professional and friendly. She looked well put together as well. I am thankful for such great service. I will be sure to book more Crowne Plazas because of Brunelda.

Hotel reviewThis 4 star level hotel is located on Broadway and is very convenient to other destination downtown. However, its service didn’t deserve four star level.Last Saturday I and my two friends arrived in New York. When we arrived to the hotel to check in the front desk said there’s no 2 bed room we booked before available that night so we had to live in one king bed room instead forgot one night and then move to the 2 bed room, and she comped us breakfast for one morning. It was understandable after all sometimes there are problems happened in the management system.But when we opened the door of the room they gave us. We found there was someone living in that room!!! We had to go back the front desk AGAIN to let manager double check the correct room number. We felt so scared what if we are the customer in that room but others still are able to come in directly?? That is not the only upset thing happened during livings this hotel. The double size bed—I was told that two people could sleep through the BOOKING.COM—is very narrow. It seems that the width is 1.2kmand not to be enough for 2 people to sleep ( Thanks God we are slim. And the third morning We were disturbed at 0600 but we hadn’t ordered any morning call yet.Then, last night whenever we came back to the room, we found a FLY in the room!We are so disappointed since we are looking forward to the travel to New York City and enjoying the luxurious hotel on famous Broadway. Unfortunately its unprofessional services make us feel so uncomfortable. We are not going to recommend others to live in this hotel forever, to book Hilton or Marriot instead.

We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza again and as 3 years ago , it was a very pleasant experience.We stayed on the 41st floor with a fantastic view and as we had the best weather in 30 years ,every sunset was awesome.The location is great and within walking distance to all the popular restaurants, shops ,Times square ,bus pick up points and subway .We were extremely disappointed that Hersheys is relocating-we missed the lights and the chocolate !!!

This was our fourth or fifth stay at the Crowne Plaza near Times Square, right on Broadway between 48th and 49th streets. The check in process was quick and efficient. The rooms, in my experience, are larger than many other similarly priced hotel rooms in NYC. The breakfast buffet was always good, but now it is even better. They've added more varieties of eggs and they are real, freshly made and taste good. Our server was Ali who is fantastic. He's a warm, personable guy who enjoys pleasing his customers. A really nice experience.All in all, this continues to be our "go to" hotel choice in NYC.

Have stayed at this property numerous times. Location is directly on Times Square, great views, nice restaurant and bar right on the property, comfortably sized rooms. We arrived prior to our room being ready, but they kindly held our luggage for us until such time as we were able to check in.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for a quick get away. The rooms and hotel were very clean. The staff was very accommodating. Karim (manager) & Jason (bartender) made us feel welcome. Karim was on point with everything and made sure we had everything we needed. Not only did Jason make amazing drinks, he also had us laughing the whole time. I would definitely recommend Crowne Plaza to my family and friends. Looking forward to seeing them again soon.

Spent our wedding anniversay here. Magical time, will definatley go back again. Great staff, brilliant views from room. Hotel is very centrally situated for Broadway shows, shops, resturants & different types of entertainment.

We were at the Crowne Plaza November 2016.. this hotel really is situated in the best location right in the heart of Times Square. You step out of your door straight to Times Square. The hotel is clean, modern with very friendly staff. Unfortunately I’m scared of heights and was freaking out when we got placed on a high floor. However, we spoke to reception and they were more than happy to accommodate us and moved to a lower floor within half an hour. I imagine some of the views would be amazing but I don’t venture to the windows. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Next time I visit New York I will almost certainly choose this hotel, fantastic location right at the heart of things, couldn’t fault the staff from reception, concierge (especially helpful with arranging our transport back to the airport) and at the bar - cashed in our free drink coupons & had a very nice light bite. Our room had everything as expected and was lovely and clean, only slight disappointment was the view from our room (3420), they state you either have a view of Times Square or the Hudson but we basically had a view of another tower block & some air conditioning ducting, but this is a minor point and I would definitely consider staying here again.

This hotel was the perfect choice for our four night stay in New York. The breakfasts were very tasty with plenty of choice even for a coeliac such as myself.We were fortunate to look out onto Times Square which was a joy to watch day or night.The staff (especially Kim who worked behind the bar) were so helpful and friendly.

Stayed last week 10/3/17 in room #4114 and received bed bug bites on both feet! left foot toe swollen, right foot ankle swollen and multiple bites. Stay away unless you like bed bugs.
