Hotel group IHG was contacted and no response from them or the property itself. I sent pictures of both my feet, no one cares. Stay away, stay away, not a clean property!

We only had one night's stay here as we were returning home from a long trip around the USA & Canada so it was adequate for our purpose.The room was really large with a lovely en suite with piping hot water which was absolutely great.Did not fancy the breakfast in the restaurant as thought it to be very pricey and the alternative snack bar did not offer a great choice.Times Square itself was extremely busy and noisy and I think for a longer stay we would have preferred to stay a little further out, but it is a great location for Broadway and the many restaurants.

Thank you for the lovely holiday with you, the hotel is close to every place, we used the big red bus hope on hop off for 4 days which was a block from the hotel. Considering that times square is a very busy area the hotel is reasonably quiet. Thanks Victoria for your lovely service and great smile.

for my first trip to NYC I wanted to stay in Time Square. such a nice hotel but very pricey. wish now I had found a cheaper one but it was really good! roomy and clean! view wasn't the best even tho we paid for a time square view, that was disappointing. but all in all a really nice hotel. we did have one day where there wasn't any hot water.

We stayed at crown plaza the 2nd week of March 2017. On the day we were supposed to return to California there was a snow storm shutting down all transportation. Bellman Meng went to the hotel manager and explained our problem. The manager reassured us we will have a room until we can travel. He also comped us meals.Great people working there, very helpfull

We could not have asked for a better location for our first trip to New York. We were less than 2 blocks from the subway, right at the edge of Times Square, a 15 minute walk from Central Park, and a short distance from Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, the Chrysler Building, and Grand Central Terminal. Our room did not have a renovated bathroom or a great view, but we got a last minute deal on Priceline so I did not expect to have a premium room. What we did have was more than adequate for the time we spent in the room, with comfortable beds and much more room than I expected from a New York hotel. We were on the 41st floor, but we never had to wait for an elevator and the elevator ride was quick and efficient. Housekeeping kept things nice throughout our 5 day stay, and there were plenty of towels and toiletries. We would stay there again, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to stay close to Times Square.

We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Time Square after boarding a plane to escape a category 5 hurricane gere in Florida. First and foremost I would like to congratulate the front desk woman Evelyn for being the nicest, kindest, most compassionate person and understanding our situation. Once checking into the hotel, we found our Room had a number of problems with it and she did everything she could to correct them during her shift. The most evident problem was the drapes had been ripped down from the East facing windows which meant the Sun would be coming blasting in at 6:00 a.m. and we asked her to attempt to correct it. She immediately sent engineering up, who proceeded to basically nail the curtains to the window so they could never be opened again. After that we found 2 lamps did not function and one which was broken and would fall over every time you even passed it. In addition,The only electrical outlet in the bathroom was not functioning and the shower would not drain till well after a shower was done. We were told we could not be moved because the hotel was at capacity due to fashion week and the evacuees from the storm but were promised things would be fixed. Nothing was fixed for the remainder of our 5 days there .Upon returning home and dealing with the mess we have here. I took the time to write to the hotel and explain that this was not acceptable for a $400 night hotel Room. The only response I received was a brief note from the hotel manager saying thank you, glad you enjoyed your stay. A very arrogant and patronizing email at best.I Travel extensively and all hotels of any star level treat you better than this supposed luxury hotel had the courtesy to do.

My stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square was a 13-hour disaster for a room that cost me more than double what I normally pay at a two star place with great service. No sign for valet parking. No bell man to indicate where to go. Had to negotiate an escalator with my bag and cane to get to the lobby. The front desk is only accessible by going around a huge pillar blocking the view of it from where the escalator drops you off. They did not have the kind of room I reserved (king bed). They added a $30 service fee for wifi, gym, and two free alcoholic beverages in their lobby bar. The room thermostat was set at 78F and took haolf an hour to cool the room. The bell man when I went to get a cab was helping an able-bodied young man get one. The guest actually hailed it, but the bell man insisted on placing his luggage in the boot to justify a tip. Then, the bell man walked off into the hotel and into a closed door without assisting me. I waited five minutes then went to the lobby to complain. The manager tried to make it sound like it was my fault for not calling out to the bell man when he was dashing to the door. Another bell man went down with me and took almost five minutes to get a cab. I was almost late for my meeting despite giving myself 35 minutes to get a cab for a 15 minute ride. When I returned I saw the manager again and let him know I wasn't happy he tried to blame me for my issues getting a cab. he agreed to delete the service charge. Next morning, I went to take a shower. No shampoo. The bar of soap kept falling through the metal wire of the soap dish. The water surged on for cold in the shower and mysteriously turned off when moved to hot. After a few tries, I gave up and went to wash my face. The faucet dripped out water when the handle was turned a quarter-turn and then immediately went to gushing and splashing beyond that. I went to check out and the person told me I should have called down for shampoo and to get the water right in the shower. This was 5 a.m. and I needed to get going. He persisted in telling me they would have fixed the problems if I had just notified them and I explained again that I didn't have time to wait for things to be fixed that should not have ever been an issue. Then I saw I was charged $73 for valet parking, more than double what I am charged at my usual hotel 15 blocks away.
user_location: East Greenbush, New York, United States
user_name:
Ruff B
East Greenbush, New York, United States

review_body: Right in the centre of all the action, surrounded by fantastic and diverse restaurants and close to 50th Street Station. Got an upgrade to a great corner room. Efficient check in and check out process. Skip the overpriced breakfast at Brassiere 1605 and take advantage of many local diners where there is great food for half the price. It's a winner.

I've stayed in many many hotels over my life and the Crowne plaza has most definitely took the top spot. Location? Amazing! It takes 60 seconds to be standing in the middle of Times Square. Room? Great view, big tv, lovely and extremely clean bathroom, and the most comfy beds and pillows. Staff? Super friendly and attentive. Honestly the one week I spent here was just total bliss. I have never felt more of a VIP. Karim, the food and beverage manager was extremely lovely and spoke to us on many occasions throughout our stay... he answered all our questions about where was best to go in the city. One thing especially was that when we were sitting at breakfast or at the bar, Karim came over and asked us about our day and really made effort which made my friend and I feel very welcomed and special. The bar tender Martin was also very friendly, he became our best friend over the week, knew our drink order before we even sat down. All in all, this hotel is amazing in many different aspects. You'd be an idiot to stay anywhere else.
user_name:
Taylor H
Northern Ireland, United Kingdom

review_body: Not quite sure what to make of the hotel. Centrally located for sure - but that meant being hassled as soon as you left the hotel by panhandlers and hucksters of all description. Nothing threatening, I hasten to add, just very irritating and a bit 'Third World'. The ground floors were very noisy and busy - which was to be expected considering its location. I was concerned about security as it seemed that the elevators were not operated by room cards and were accessible to non-residents. Considering how open the lobby areas are to anybody coming in off Times Square I would have hoped for much better security to the residents' floors (as I have experienced in almost any other comparable hotel). There seems to have been some kind of deal going on which didn't include us, so there is nothing exclusive about the Crowne Plaza (except perhaps the price we paid). I certainly would not rate it the 4* it has. `More 3*. I'm glad I experienced it but would not stay again for the price we paid.

This hotel was right in the heart of Times Square, I have no complaints but it was pretty average overall. The price was fair, the room was adequate but just nothing special. Probably more of a 3 rating, certainly not a 5. Location however was a 5. The best restaurants we found were 2 blocks over on 9th, There were a lot of local type places we enjoyed. Something for everyone.

I cannot fault the service and facilities at the Crowne Plaza,Times Square. Centrally placed for all sightseeing locations. Attentive bar staff Felipe in particular. I would highly recommend you visit this hotel.

Had a wonderful weeks stay at the Crown Plaza. Can't beat the location. Close to subways, plays, restaurants, Central Park, Rockefeller Plaza, and don't forget Times Square. Had a room on the 27th floor and was never bothered by street noise. Theres a safe, coffee pot ( don't drink coffee), iron and board ( who irons on vacation??) . Room was kept nice and clean and toiletries stocked as needed. Bed was quite comfy also. Check in was a breeze. We never ate in the restaurant but we did order late night room service 3-4 times. Each time it was delivered by Mohammed Hossain who was very pleasant and friendly. He made sure we had everything we needed and told us not to hesitate to call if we needed something else. Thanks Crown Plaza. We'll be back

This is the 2nd time we've been to New York and decided to stay near Times Square. The hotel was positioned perfectly. The room was a corner room on the 20th floor so we had an amazing view. The room was cleaned every day with clean towels. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The only problem we had was our room key deactivating if you kept it in your pocket next to your mobile phone so we had to get it reset on a number of occasions but it didn't affect the overall experience of the hotel. The air con was brilliant which was a god send as it was very warm when we stayed there rof 5 days.

Great, centralized hotel. Close to transportation. Staff was always very helpful. Breakfast buffet was one of the best. Was within walking distance to theaters, restaurants. One block walk to Time Square.

I was apparently given an "upgrade" on my room. This apparent bonus gave me a view over Times Square. I don't know about the other rooms, but I really wish I hadn't been gifted this - the noise was abysmal. I was on the 30th floor and the noise from the outside was horrendous! God only knows what it sounded like at lower levels.Not only was the noise from the street unpleasantly loud, but from the wind noise you could've been forgiven for thinking that there was a gale force storm outside.The rooms a therefore in serious need of soundproofing updates.The room itself was nice. Shower, not bath, which was disappointing. But the bed was comfortable, the room spacious and with the facilities you might expect.

I reserved a king room, times sq view, high floor, away from elevator. I was given a room with a view of an alley, on a low floor, right next to the elevator!!!! When I complained, they told me that was the room that I booked - showed them my reservation, which didn't say I booked a hearing impaired room next to the elevator (like they had given me!) and they said that the system must have sent me the wrong confirmation, but what they had in their system was correct. Called IHG rewards and they told me that they could see that the reservation had been changed by the hotel on the day I checked in! What a bunch of crap! Don't stay here - you clearly won't get what you paid for! When you try to address it with the staff, they will lie to you!
user_name:
jamesg988
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This was my 5th visit to NYC and my 3rd to Crown Plaza Times Square and my last.The welcome at reception and attitude must have been one of the worse i ever experience during my travel.A disgrace to the City and in particular the IGH group.Never Ever Again will i book at this hotel.I notice Herches closed and with that attitude it will not surprise me if the hotel closes soon.

The location and the room size is the best part of the property. A minute walk to a couple of subway stations. Most of the midtown attractions are within walking distance and so are most of the meetings in offices of park avenue, fifth and lexington. Hotel can be used for business travellers too. Has a very good gym.

The Crowne Plaza at Times Square is a very good hotel. We stayed there with our children and we had a pleasant time. The room is comfortable and clean. It is a walking distance from many attractions. I strongly recommend. However, the pool is from a Gym and for practice exercises and they demand to use swimming articles, such as swimming cap.

Right in the heart of midtown (Manhattan) and theater district; well kept, nice, clean and comfortable (given the location, I actually expected it to be a bit more run down); awesome gym ... would definitely love going back to this property!

Stayed here with my girlfriend for 5 night. We were provided with wrong room due to issue with travel agent however Gabby (front desk) was excellent and resolved issue with no fuss. Would stay here again.

Great view of the Hudson from our room, we were one block from time square and the host Miliha was the best. Try the restaurant in the hotel, the food is excellent. Great atmosphere in the bar. Staff at the front desk were very nice and will do all they can to accommodate your request.

Our family experience with the Crowne Plaza Times Square was unbelievably perfect from the time we checked in with Adelize to Checkout.Everyone from the General Manager, Agatha, to Karim and Rodney who are the Food & Beverage Managers made the 6 days most enjoyable of any hotel that we have ever stayed in.We consider Agatha, Karim, Rodney and Adelize not as hotel employees but rather our New York City friends. They did not treat us as an interim bother soon to be gone but as family. Nothing we asked was considered an inconvenience but eager to help, assist and advise. From Karim's Carmine's to Rodney's Strip House recommendations to Agatha's overall willingness to help wherever was amazing.To not stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square will be doing yourselves an injustice.Connie & Jim Franklin, TN

Can't say enough how our stay was made not only memorable but very comfortable & pleasant by Gabi, the front desk manager. She made sure that our check in was very quick & easy. So pleased abt it after our long flight, and was even more thrilled that our room had an amazing view & was located farthest from noise (honks, siren, the city"s hustle & bustle). She is very attentive to our needs & all the other guests. Giving excellent recommendations where to eat & what to do while in NY and assuring us that she is there to help. Her front desk staff was amazing as well. Freddy & Lionel were very friendly & engaging. I would definitely come back & stay here again.

We upgraded to a corner room on the 37th floor and had a terrific view of Time Square area. We were in walking distance of so many attractions, restaurants, theatres, etc. The staff were very helpful. We had so many things planned that we didn't talk with the concierge till our last date. I would recommend calling on him/her earlier in our trip to get good advice and assistance. Wonderful trip!

Just a quick review. Nothing has changed, which is a good thing! The staff are superb, the rooms clean and well-appointed apart from having no mini-bar. (the horror!)Never got a chance to try breakfast as it the restaurant was too crowded and then when we got to see the menu it was a two choice affair as opposed to a proper buffet. That being said, it's New York, you can't walk 100 feet without standing outside another diner, so we headed outside and ate at the Cosmic Diner.

The location is good if that's what your after but it's so ridiculous and full on that it's hard to enjoy. I've been to New York a few times and will never stay in Times Square again it's a nightmare. We were booked in for 8 nights getting married in New York so looking forward to a nice hotel. The first room was so dated, the bed was a fold out bed coming out of the wall and no safe or fridge. We asked to change room which they told us couldn't happen till the next day. They switched our rooms while we were out, the room was better but still not the room they promised us. No mini fridge but at least we had a safe this time. This hotel is very dated and old and in serious need of an upgrade. Rooms are small but so are lost in New York. Another thing that is seriously lacking in this hotel is security. Anyone can enter this hotel with no dramas at all at any time of the day and night. There is meant to be someone at the bottom of the escalators checking room keys after a certain time at night but ours were never checked and the desk was often unmanned. No key required to use the lifts either. Did not feel safe at this hotel. I would not stay here again on my return to New York. For the price there are so many better options available.

Reception staff is very condescending, not helpful whatsoever. During check-out, I was overcharged for some random TV cable, which was eventually refunded. But, it was only after a bitter discussion, whereas she accused me of actually using the cable TV. Location is in the middle of a crowd, which wasn't helpful to really enjoy the city. Room is not that spacious. Overall, this felt more like a tourist trap.

We've come to NYC on our honeymoon and I couldnt be happier. The staff are excellent and the location of the hotel couldnt be any closer to Times Square, directly opposite M&M World.The rooms are massive with double beds topped with a memory foam mattress topper. Large tv, coffee machine, walk in shower and air con.Free wifi which is excellent even up on the 25th floor.The only two faults I have are the windows and the shower. The windows are almost paper thin. When securely locked I can still hear the wind outside and the traffic. I sleep with earplugs anyway so it doesnt affect me but others may struggle. The shower dial is loose. Finally got it to a temperature I was happy with and the dial slowly drops, dropping in temperature. I like a long shower but this has me jumping out as soon as possible.Nevertheless, Id happily book the Crowne Plaza again should I return.

This hotel is wonderful. We loved it. The staff are very friendly and professional. The rooms we had were on the 42nd and 45th floors, and the views were incredible. The room was spotless, the bathroom too. The food in the bar was tasty and the drinks were very reasonable to say this hotel is on times square, NYC is expensive anyway, so be prepared to spend . We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thankyou for looking after us, we had a fabulous holiday.

I travel to NYC often for work and my company puts me in different hotels all the time. This was my first stay at the Crowne Plaza and I must say, the staff was incredible. I need to give a shout out to Erika at the front desk for empathizing with my trip in (train fire, rental car and serious delays) and making a very nice gesture to help ease my mind. Then, Mohammed in room service delivered the complimentary gift and was so kind and thoughtful with our quick but lovely exchange - i just felt very good about the whole thing. To me, with so much travel, these little details are HUGE. Thanks Erika and Mohammed for adding so much value to my stay.

This was my first visit to new NYC and this was a great place to stay. The location couldn't be beat. The subway was just a block away and so many things were within walking distance. We upgraded our room to a nice corner room on the 37th floor that had great views of Times Square in addition to a water view. The room was a big and very quiet. The staff were all very accommodating. They even sent a frig up so we could store our cheesecake for the flight home the next day! I would definitely stay here again.

We reserved one room for 4 adults. We asked for early check in and the lovely reception clark Sandra helped us to get a room really early in the morning. More than that, the breakfast was perfect! And the hotel has great location!

Having seen New York on tv and in films I figured it about time i went to see what it was all aboutWOW if you've never been then go , it's like London on steroids it's simple crazy We stayed for 4 days at the crown plaza time square, the location is perfect , most things are within a 15min walk or close to a bus/subway so you'll be able to explore this crazy city but be prepared to do some walkingThe hotel was very clean and tidy, staff where very friendly , beds wheee uber comfy. We never ate there so couldn't comment on the food but the restaurant seemed busyThe only negative was the decor appeared some what dated ( not worn just a bit 1999 ) but all in all a great value for money and I'd stay there again If your reading this and want any tips on NYC I'll happily reply

I stayed at Crown Plaza recently for One night.. totally not impressed .. the Location is basically what you pay big Dollars for.. first bad experience.. the Front desk Girl had a bad attitude.. not a very pleasant person.. then when we got to the room it was fair... a basic room nothing worth 400.13 Dollars a night.. well it got worse ... we found a dirty Q-tip on the Bathroom Floor and also found a Purple Pill on the Floor... and forget trying to get help with anything because the Front Desk don't ever... answer the phone.. so then to make matters worse.. when I got home I went to check my Credit Card Statement.. and they had taken another $ 75.00 Dollars without my permission or Knowledge.. so therefore called their accounting Department and asked why I have this Charge, and they said oh... it's for incidentals in case you purchase something .. they do it to all the Customers... .. I never ordered or purchased anything there.. .. so I demanded it be taking off my Credit Card... So my Question is? how many People actually check their Credit Card Statements like I do ? definitely got Scam written all over it.. Shouldn't I purchase something first .. before I am charged... So the accounting department blamed the Front desk that they should of let me know.. What a joke.. Well I will never .... stay there again.. I don't care if it is conveniently located...

I had the best front desk help and understanding that I’ve had in years! I travel domestic and international around 10-15 times per year and the help I received from the front desk employee named Rhoda was by far above and beyond expectations. She assisted me with getting the perfect room for my honeymoon stay as I was weary from a long early flight across the country. We were a bit more needy than I ever have been when selecting a perfect room for the occasion. She never made me feel like a burden... even though I knew I was being picky and felt bad for being that way. She accommodated us and was extremely professional to us the entire time! Best front desk ever! Thanks for finding us the perfect room for our honeymoon, we really appreciated it!

Great location for upper and Times Sq.Few issues first night - no water on floor but soon sorted.No glasses in bar and when we did get one - glass wasn't clean.Other than a few dirty glasses -Spotlessly clean and noise from outside no issue.Upgraded to Times Sq view - well worth it.Never ate in hotel.Breakfast not worth the price as lots of choice within 2 minutes.

The location of this hotel is perfect. Times Square - Broadway and 48th/49th. A short walk to everything! The staff was friendly and helpful. From the from desk, to the bell desk for bag storage, to the bar, and parking attendants. Views from the room were spectacular. The room was a little dated - wear and tear on the head boards and in the tub - but clean. Needs some TLC & updating. Still, the location made up for the aging room.

We stayed her for our 5 day visit to New York. We found the hotel to be a little dated. In need of some redecoration and new furniture. Staff were helpful and friendly. Bar prices were a little steep but then again we were in the centre of Times Square. Bar food was nice and plentiful. Room was good. Bed very comfortable and the view from the 42nd floor was great. Would stay here again if visiting New York.

On arrival, the reception desk was chaos. Room had seen better days but was clean. Room service food was disappointing. The location is great for Broadway. Good view from the hotel bar, but it was so busy that could not always get a seat. Front entrance suffers from street hustlers targeting tourists, so it was often better to slip out of the car entrance. Service at breakfast was messy. I had to correct the waiter when I was charged the wrong amount.

This review is for our front desk agent Evelyn. She was very welcoming and made my gf and I felt right at home. She gave us a beautiful room on the 43rd floor. The room was very clean and the view was awesome! Thank you Evelyn again for your great customer service! She is a great asset to your company.

From the moment we arrived until we sadly had to say goodbye to this fabulous hotel, we could not have felt more welcome and valued as guests. Every member of staff from the check in desk to the cleaners, were unbelievably friendly and helpful, going above and beyond to ensure we had the trip of a lifetime whilst we were in New York! None more than the food and beverage manager Karim who made sure we felt like true VIPs throughout our stay. Whether we were at the bar, asking for directions or discussing how to cure our hangovers, Karim was beyond helpful! When we first saw our room we genuinely spent about an hour taking photos of the view from our window because the view of Times Square was so incredible. The location of this hotel could not be better with countless tourist attractions only a few minutes walk away.I have also never slept better than I did in the hotel's beautifully luxurious beds... I was tempted to try and squeeze one of the pillows in my suitcase to take home!Overall, I can honestly say that our experience at this hotel was unbeatable and took our holiday to the next level!
user_name:
Lauren H
Leeds, England, United Kingdom

review_body: Great central place, staff very helpful. Even though I'm very high up 37 floor the lifts are very fast and plenty of them.Bedroom is a good size, bath on the small side, I'm 5'4 and I can't lie down in it! Pillows are soft and so's the bed.Would come stay here again!

Fantastic hotel in the center of all the action! Very nice spacious rooms especially for New York City standards. Everyone was very friendly and polite from check in to check out. They also noted it was my birthday as when checking in asked if we were visiting for any special occasions, they sent cake and wine to our room on my birthday which was a lovely touch.Very safe and central hotel, will stay here when I go back! Highly recommend this.Times Square View is highly recommended! We had the absolute bets view!

I commend Victoria Martin of the Crowne Plaza Timesquare for excellent service. After a grueling redeye flight from San Francisco with a stopover at Denver, I arrived at the hotel at 7:30am - not having slept a wink. Victoria was sincerely accommodating and not only checked me in early (normal check in at the hotel is at 3pm), she upgraded my room to the 24th floor with a view of Timesquare. She and staff also took care to call my room and see if there was anything else they could do for me. What a delightful experience! I would return to Crowne Plaza Timesquare in a heartbeat!

They were so incredibly difficult with every tiny request we made, totally inflexible and not helpful. The location is too close to TSQ for our liking which makes it loud and a little bad vibes late at night Would recommend staying elsewhere

Great location if you are sightseeing New York. Just meters from Times Square and Broadway theaters. Almost all NYC subways will pass near.A true Crowne Plaza, with the typical amenities, deluxe rooms. You can get better for the money in NYC, but this hotel won’t let you down.Location at its best.

A good quality hotel with good quality and helpful reception staff. Our room on the 26th floor was spacious, clean and well supplied with both bathroom products and coffee making. Bed was very comfortable. Only improvement is that in this class of hotel I would have expected bathrobes. Is the perfect location for tourists. Parking good service but expensive.

I am not at all a fan of this hotel. The sheets are god awful and anyone can walk in off the street and just punch your floor and knock on your door. It feels very unsafe, and I used to be a New Yorker living just a few blocks away! The food is also quite bad, the gym doesn't open until 6am and has no water stations, and the nightly rate is astronomical! Even for NYC. You can do a lot better even in Manhattan. Trust me. BUT, Tanesha in the lobby bar/restaurant is THEEEE best server. She's friendly and attentive and really knows how to connect with her guests. I wouldn't stay in the hotel again but I'd go back to that bar just to visit Tanesha. She's the reason for all three stars in this review. So if you find yourself trapped in this hotel cuz you didn't have a choice go see her. If you're passing through Times Square, go see her.

So I'm staying for 6 nights at the hotel, no complains from the front desk, the girls in the concierge were so helpful, always smiling , I bumped into one getting out from the hotel and she greet with a smile, they did all they could to meet our demands, rooms big and clean, it was jus awesome. So here I am in my last night, tired and hungry, so I decided to go to the lobby to the broadway 49 bar and lounge just in front of the front desk to have a pizza and a cocktail. The places was at its 60% capacity, three waiters and a bar tender, one would suspect it could be a fast meal. Well it was not, no one sited me, so I took a table, one waiter passes , I tried to say something and I was interrupted by a "someone will be with you in a minute" he didn't even care if I was going to ask where's he menu or what the time is, so the minute became 7 minutes, and another waiter comes to me and I asked a stupid question, he decided to tell me all is in the menu and he will come back to me then , probably he was in a hurry, I'm unsure why, the place wasn't full. Some 15 minutes later he returns and takes my order, he takes too much time being friendly with other people in other table, except with me, so someone else brings my pizza ( how complicated could a pizza be ) pizza getting cold, drink badly done, service terrible. What a shame to ruin the whole experience that was going so well thanks to other people working in this hotel , to be ruined by this one waiter. Do not come unless you really don wanna go out to take something to eat , but who wouldn't like to go out except me who has to pack.

My husband and I planned a weekend to NY to celebrate my birthday, we live in Miami Florida. This trip was planned weeks before we learned Hurricane Irma will hit Florida and our community was greatly affected. We arrived to NY prior the storm and because of the impact to south Florida, our return flight was cancelled and we were not able to return until 5 days after our original return date. The idea of staying longer seemed great but would impact us financially. We spoke to two managers, AJ and Juliet, and asked for their help since staying longer than expected was outside our budget. We did not want to move to a more affordable hotel. They were very sensitive and did all they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is pretty, in a perfect location and the staff extremely sensitive. We truly appreciate all they did for us. Will be our place next time we go to NY.

We went for a one night stay just to walk around. We left really early and went to the hotel to drop our bag off so we could enjoy the rest of the walk more. To our surprise, they found a room ready and gave it to us. That was a bonus. The room itself is a nice size for NYC hotels. We also had a corner room it was a nice view. The room was clean and well kept. They have a gym, Sauna, lockers and a lap pool. The steam room is long gone. I do use the sauna it was nice and the showers at the lockers. We also ate at the restaurant and enjoyed the breakfast. (Separate review) They have a small store and also a coffee and pastry stand that was priced reasonably. The location is in the heart of everything. I would definitely stay again. They also kindly let us check out one hour late also! It is things like that, that make you want to keep going back. Thank you

Room was very nice. Close to the theater and fine dining and/or casual dining. We had a room upgrade too....which was great. Concierge service people were very nice. Baggage handling and storing bags were a convenience too.

Great location, literally right there at Times Square. The room was nice and the bed even better, I didn't want to get up. I woke up pretty late and made a mad dash to find breakfast int the city before it was too late. I would like to take the time out to appreciate the front desk staff who come through in a clutch. Cheri-an professionally and patiently took care of an elderly French couple who didn't speak any English. She assisted them by coordinating their stay with the chauffeur they had scheduled to take them to the airport the next day, and in the same breath helped me find a place to eat breakfast and even saved me $40. Now, thats what I call customer service at its best!
user_name:
BigRo77
New York City, New York

review_body: When we arrived at the hotel it looked good as we walked in. But then we were told that the swipe card would not work on our door. Twice we had to go down so that they could send security up to open the door. But it was sorted by the morning.That night we had food at the hotel and found that the waiter was quite rude and had an attitude problem.The room was a disappointment, the wall paper is starting to peel off in the bathroom, there is mildew starting to form around the bath edge and behind the door there is thick dust forming on the door hinges.In the bedroom itself the carpet looks dirty and smells and we could not open the windows to air the room. Don't know what the other rooms are like but ours needed a serious upgrade Sorry now that we stayed there as it was our 40th wedding anniversary and we had saved a long time for this holiday just to have rude staff and an outdated room. Spoilt our holiday really. Won't stay there again.
user_name:
Tony N Gwen S
Ceredigion, United Kingdom

review_body: I would say this is a typical Crowne Plaza - from a distance it all looks beautiful; close up it's a little shabby, HOWEVER, the service is excellent and the staff are lovely, which is why I like to stay in CP hotels. Side note --- if you are booking to be near to Hershey's World you will be disappointed as it is no longer trading. M&Ms world across the street however does the job for a chocolate hit. The room - very comfy (although high!) bed, large shower, black out curtains. Huge TV which pleased my bf, chaise lounge which pleased me. I would say functional and spacious, but not particularly luxurious. For a good view ask for a higher floor. Breakfast has a view of Times Square, a lovely Spanish lady to greet you and find you a table (apologies cannot remember her name!) and our server, Tofael was very friendly, helpful and efficient. The breakfast spread itself was very comprehensive, highly recommended the French toast, turkey sausage and the mango juice. Hotel location is really good, near quite a few theatres and lots of restaurants and shops. There is a drop off / pick up point you can drive into from the street, and a valet service if you require it. All in all we had a lovely 4 night stay and I would recommend this hotel :)

HighsQuick check-in when we arrived at around 10pmBed was really comfortable after long days of travelling and walkingRoom clean and up to date with very large tv and great view of the cityLocation was superb - very central to everything and loved being on time square Bar was good with a great atmosphere in the eveningStaff were friendly and very helpfulGreat that we could leave our luggage in the hotel while we adventures out on the last dayNo room service but you could get a drink at the bar and take it to your room and there were vending machines dotted aboutDownsThe breakfast was very expensive (buffet style) so we asked to order from the menu but the waited seemed reluctant and told us that the food would be 45mins - the food came out after about 10 minutes!Would recommend to anyone going to New York and won't hesitate to stay at the Crowne Plaza again!

the room is comfortable but basic, the location is good, in the reception most of the staff don't have patience,they just want to give you the key room and don't explain nothing ,the food in the dining room and the stuff is very good especially Ana.

Me and my husband stayed at this hotel recently for 5nights. Reception is very crowded with restaurant right next to reception. Staff are polite but they have no time to smile or have extra talk. They give you the hotel keys and off you go! Paid close to $450 Aud per night including tax and everything, comfortable beds but very basic room, bit run down needs some makeover big time. Location is what you pay all that money for. Very close to everything and easy to catch taxi n subway! It wasn't the best but it wasn't the worst as well.

Stayed here for 3 nights and booked and paid ahead of time through expedia. No mention of any extra charges at check in and check out, however found $30 per day resort fee charged to my credit card. Would have been nice for them to be honest and advise me of this ahead of time than last minute money grab.

In my opinion, best hotel for location! Right on top of Times Square, would definitely recommend booking a Times Square view room if you can. One thing which did bug me (at no fault of the hotel) was the number of "Big Bus Tours" reps pushing for sales outside of entrance of hotel, some of which had a bit of an attitude if you declined!

We were booked into the hotel for three days prior to a transatlantic crossing. We were on the 32nd floor. The lifts considering there are 46 floors and an adequate supply of them were so very quick to get to your floor. It is impressive how fast they were! Our room was a good size. The bed and numerous pillows really to die for!The reception and room service people were pleasant and always helpful.The breakfast very varied and tasty to cover all tastes. You queue to be given a table which of course if you have to choose a busy time you sometimes had to wait a little. If you were up bright and early there was no waiting but is not a criticism. You are quickly served with your coffee or tea and then visited two areas for your self served breakfast. The first area has the cereals and fruit juices of which there are numerous choices. The second room contains ingredients for a full English or continental breakfast ,again the choices are unlimited. I noticed a small store where you can buy soft drinks sweets etc. There is also a nice looking restaurant which we didn't use wanting to go out instead. The bar however was very good and provided very large and tasty snacks. The view from the hotel afforded views of Times Square or the Hudson river. The hotel works closely with Cunard and the transfer to the port was also efficient

Stayed for 5 nights with a good friend in a 2 dbl bed roomReceptionist was ok but stood at platinum elite desk and was ignored.Was given std room no upgrade or preferenceRooms were satisfactory no fridge or mini bar Beds comfy bath a bit tired and very lowEvery time at reception 3 times platinum elite member desk ignoredAt luggage storage staff so rude its incredibleReally can do better

This is convenient if you want to stay in the middle of the bustling sounds of Times Square and visit one of the many theatres. It is also within easy walking distance to 5th Avenue and Empire State Building. There are so many excellent restaurants to choose from around the hotel, but sitting on the first floor of the hotel is worthwhile.

I work in a University in Houston Texas and had to book a 2-day meeting for my Director; My initial contact was with Mr. Tim Olohan who provided me with all the details and accommodations for 6 rooms, meeting space, audiovisual and coffee break service. Tim was AWESOME and make the planning less stressful. Being from another State, Tim sent me photos of the rooms and meeting space. I had to rely on Tim and the 2-day meeting was a success. The collaborators who attended the meeting stated that the accommodations were excellent as well as the service. I would also like to thank the audiovisual team for their assistance. Many thanks.

Only stayed for one night but it was a fantastic hotel. The rooms were excellent, clean, beds really comfy and no noise from the street below. We ate here too and it was excellent. Breakfast had a really good choice and the staff were all really friendly,
user_name:
Jennifer W
Halesowen, England, United Kingdom

review_body: We arrived early. They held our luggage for us free of charge so we didn't have to worry about carrying it around while doing the sightseeing in the city. Breakfast is buffet at 10 dollars a person. They also provided two complimentary tickets for drinks. When I told the waiter I don't drink alcohol, he mixed a cocktail with no alcohol in it. The service is good, and the location is great. The first night we were there, we watched the musical Cats at a theater just two blocks away from the hotel.

Great hotel, great location but the room was full of dust! Dust on all the lamps, dust in all the air vents, dust on all the furniture, even though it was 'cleaned' every day! Apart from that, everything else was good.

excellent customer service, especially Elan, the housekeeping manager. All areas of hotel functioned beyound the call of duty. Excellent location on times square, close to restaurants and shops. Great meeting rooms

very cenrtal but nil service. Even to get water you have to go down to the resturant. Service is only till 8 pm, Concearge is also till 8pm. Resturants are very expensive but open till late. No personal touch. Acute staff shortage. Concearge is never available as he is one person to cater to 100 people

The location is great. We splashed out at this motel. For 6 nights, with a times square view, we paid $3050.00! Totally not worth it. Go with a lesser price room. The view isn't worth that. Our room was small and very average. There were chips in the bath tub, and pubic hairs on the roof of the bathroom. I did complain, but they were fully booked, and I seriously couldn't have been bothered to repack and move. I would, however stay here again due to the location, but would get the cheapest room I could get.

We paid top dollar, but we also really enjoyed our stay. Beds were very comfortable. Atmosphere throughout the hotel is really nice. You can have peace and quiet in your room and then return outside to the world of NYC. Very close to the theaters, easy walking distance to many good restaurants. You can find less expensive parking at several spots nearby if you drove into the city. We would definitely stay again. Sometimes you can get a deal -- so keep checking back on sites like trip advisor or check their site too.
user_name:
CLDLSLCL
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Victoria at the Registration desk was so kind and accommodating when we arrived early. Appreciated her help so much! Our trip started out rough and to have her help us out- was wonderful! Times Square Crowne Plaza- our second stay and always great!

Facilities although nothing to complain about, we found very it very average. Considering the price we were very underwhelmed. The rooms were similar to any premier inn. We found the bar very expensive. Reception staff very pleasant.

Thought I liked the people when I check in and I liked how they treated was very friendly for the first check in of my trip for 3 night i extended the vacation for more 3 nights i went to the reception after very long working day asked to update the key they insisted to pay the taxes first my reply was I'll change and come back to pay the lady insisted to let me pay first I had to pay I extended again my stay and had the same experience again all what they cared about paying the taxes while I asked only for 1 hour rest then I'll pay more over moreover my colleague checked in they did an upgrade for him and he was satisfy and everything was smooth while it's the same reservations company I feel really disappointed

Second time I've stayed here. Two weeks this time . The staff here are very attentive and super friendly ! Thank you especially to the bar staff , Phil, Anthony, Al, Jason, Keith and of course Kim. The breakfast buffet is excellent !! Ana took great care of us, excellent wait staff also.

I stayed here for 5 nights with my daughter. It is right in the middle of Times Square which means you are well located for the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, 5th Avenue and Central Park. It is an extremely busy hotel and outside on Times Square/Broadway it is congested with tourists and there is a lot of noise. Our room was on the 32nd floor so with the double glazing it was fairly quiet although you could always hear the sirens from the emergency services vehicles. The room we had was a King Size room overlooking Times Square. The bed and pillows were really comfortable and the shower was large. A bath would have been nice after long days walking New York's streets. We booked room only and only ate breakfast once in the hotel. This was complimentary following a major problem with our in-room safe which refused to open and needed to be drilled open and replaced. The security staff and engineers who dealt with this were really good and persisted until it was sorted. I don't think the breakfast is worth the money as there are lots of places to eat breakfast outside the hotel. Check in was quick as I am an IHG member. We had to check out by 11am on the last day but our luggage was safely stored until we left. The only criticism I have is that we wanted to get changed before we left for the airport and you have to get a room key to access the toilets. By UK standards the hotel was expensive but being in Times Square this is the price you have to pay. There are a lot of taxes added to your bill so be mindful of this - this isn't just hotels but in shops and other places. As an IHG member you do not pay the resort tax but if you aren't a member you will be charged this on top of your room rate. We didn't use the swimming pool or gym.

My 73 year old, unsteady father decided to surprise me for my elopement wedding by arriving in NYC the night before my wedding, much to my surprise. On depositing him at his original hotel, I was left in tears by the state of the hotel and had to get him out of there immediately.My hotel was totally unhelpful but friends staying at the Crowne Plaza spoke to their reception who immediately sprung into action, honoured the best available room rates and looked after my dad from start to finish - he was thrilled. On check in he was given drinks vouchers and as they knew it was the eve of our wedding, we were even offered a complimentary cocktail - we got a small bottle of water at our hotel!!!His room was great, he had amazing views and despite being in Times Square, it was very quiet.Not only would we stay here if we are lucky enough to visit NYC in the future, we are also considering an Intercontinental Credit Card so we can build up points for future stays.Well done CP, you save the day and the service was second to none.

I loved staying here for our trip. We paid the extra for the view and it was worth every penny. The bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable. The room was a good size and clean. Perfect place to make home base.

The people at CPTS are fantastic, from the big guy in the lobby, I never did get his name who was always there with a friendly smile, to the Management Avi, the front desk welcome, the boys and girls that run the bar that over looks Times Square and not forgetting the ladies that maintained our room during our 8 day stay.The concierge service missed the boat (with 4 non returned calls from the UK), but once that had been highlighted, they proved to be very helpful. Although we had by that time made alternative arrangements for our visit.The team lead by Avi Yesawich at CPTS proved to be just that "a team". They made myself and family very welcome during our stay in New York. Once they knew our family had reason to celebrate our visit to NYC, they organised complimentary cake and wine on the very first night of our stay, celebrating our children's 18th & 21st birthdays and our 23rd wedding anniversary. It's worth paying the little extra to request a family room facing onto Times Square, The team organised that we had a room on the 37th floor (3701 on a corner), with great views over the city. It took 3 days for my wife to notice that she could see the Empire State building from her bed. Times Square is busy, busy, busy and the gentle buzz of activity can be heard 24/7, so if your head can stand it, go high. New York is a living working metropolis, so don't be surprised to hear traffic and construction working taking place... IT'S A CITY THAT NEVER SLEEPS!.If you're going to use the pool, I believe you have to book a time slot in advance (it's part of a gym).What else can I say about CPTS? Tip 20% for good service, you're going to get it!What can I say about NYC? To enjoy NYC you're going to walk and walk a lot. Take a good pair of trainers and quality socks, your feet will thank you each and every night. Every family has someone who plans the holiday, let them do it. They'll love doing it and you'll get the benefit of having your days filled where you don't waste a minute. we did 8 days and could have quite easily done another five or six and not repeat a visit.Drinking any form of alcohol in NYC is 21 and up, so go with it. Don't embarrass yourself or your server by asking (they could lose their job). To be honest the beer is not great anywhere you go. It's lifeless and flat with five minutes of hitting the glass. Avi if you're reading this review invest in nucleated glasses (google it), your European customers will thank you for them.In closing a huge thank you to the Crowne Plaza Time Square Team, we hope to be back sooner rather than later. Thank you so much x

Ok it's New York, prices are high and this hotel is all about location, which is great if you want to stay right in the center of Time Square, nothing wrong with that, if this hotel would provide accommodation up to par the price is justified for 4 stars and this location, and everybody who is well travelled is willing to pay that!Beside totally unpersonalized, rushed and service with an attitude by the entire front desk which you might can expect traveling in New York and which did not really bother us, but what rally made me to write this review here is the condition of the accommodation, which is so below par that it is frightening that this is actually allowed, and I ask myself how this hotel is still able to get a 4 star rating....I stayed already 20 years ago for several times at the Crowne Plaza and it was always a pleasure, yes it was already busy, loud, noisy, however great service and the standard of the rooms were nearly impeccable, but it seems at least the room we stayed in, except a change over of the television set and a new AC control unit, never has seen any major maintenance and refurbishment for the last two decades...The condition of the room we stayed in could be the perfect example for a case study on any hospitality college what happens if the management does not follow up basic check procedures.Given the condition of the room there are apparently close to zero checks of the floor line staff, total lack of attention for basic procedure, not even mention "eye for details", which actually can be expected of a four star property.Maybe the room division management should check back with house keeping supervisor and executive house keeper from time to time, otherwise I have no explanation why a hotel room in a four star property looks like the one we stayed in.I let the pictures speak for themselves..., could have taken a picture of the mattresses as well, which apparently also have not seen any change over over the years given the softness and instability of them...I trust as any other business it's all about maximizing the profit, which is fair, nothing wrong, however sorry to say, but the standard of the room we stayed in is so below par and below value for money that I only hope that the management at the Crowne Plaza starts to enforce their SOPs, trust they have a SOP in place, and start to reevaluate their checking procedures and consider to start maintenance before more and more reviews like mine eventually pour in.Honest feedback is never intended to be damaging, it should be productive, so I will also send a copy of the review to cooperate head office which eventually might lead to future improvements which should take place without any further delay in order to come up to the advertised standards.@ Crowne Plaza management, in case you should be interested which room I stayed in, you may pm me and I am happy to share the room number with you.

We stayed at this hotel, as our friends were also there. We had a twin double room with a Times Square view. Good points first:Great location, if you want to be right in the centre of things - at the top end of Times Square. Busy and buzzy location.Very nice reception area, which we hoped was a good reflection of the bedrooms (more of that later).Helpful and swift check in. Not so good points!:There were hairs in the bath.The shower fittings felt loose and unreliable, although the shower worked ok.Some peeling wallpaper.Marks on the headboard.Torn chair fabric and foam.Dresser unit drawers not working.No minibar/fridge.Generally, a drab, unwelcoming room. We couldn't wait to get out of it each day.OtherThe reception staff offered us another room - I viewed the and it was the same.The very nice and helpful reception manager (Gina?) showed us yet another room - again, no real improvement and we didn't bother moving.The gym facility itself was good - weights, machines etc. The shower and (tepid) sauna was poor.On the Friday night, there was a room full of late-teens, who partied until late and then made a ruckus when they returned at around 3am. The hotel security responded promptly with a knock on their door and they quietened down maybe 20-30 mins after. Not conducive to a good night sleep.You should check with the hotel reception if they have booked a room on a friday night, next to your room - apparently, they will often book a cheap one night room on a friday night to party.Hotel doors shut loudly and the lift makes a loud "bong" - a noisy hotel.The reception manager kindly offered a discount, to compensate us for the room issues. Frankly, I would rather have had a nice room and paid full price.I would not return there, unless the rooms were given a really good makeover.

First timers in New York, you can do this if you stay in this hotel in the most central location for the whole of Manhattan.Also great bar,excellent staff+great front office manager Chris Diamantakis who goes that extra mile.Cant recommend highly enough.

Hotel Building is perfectly situated in Times Square ... we took a room with a view since it was our first time in New York City. The building itself is very impressive but the room that we paid $500 canadian for(labour day weekend); was nothing special. You really pay for the location and not the actual room. Elizabeth who takes cares of guest services when you phone the hotel was so helpful and kind. I believe I kept her on the phone for at least 20 minutes with all of my questions and she was very patient, informative and nice!Michelle at the check in counter was also very helpful, cheerful, kind and generous. She gave us some extra bonuses because of our wedding anniversary. (which we proved to her with our certificate,lol)The staff at Crowne Plaza are all exceptional.Thank you very much everyone

Myself and my husband stayed for two nights at this hotel. It is in Times Square and we found this so useful as it was pretty close to everywhere we wanted to go.The bed was fantastic - so comfortable and huge. I had to climb up onto it! Our room wasn't quite ready when we got there (had to wait half an hour) and they gave us 4 free drinks vouchers for the inconvenience which I thought was very good customer service.The only reason it isn't 5 star is because the cleanliness in the bathroom wasn't very good. There was a long hair on the floor when we arrived which was still there when we left! Plus we were a bit stung by the overnight fees that were posted through the door on checkout day. I knew about them because I had read on here but I do think we should have been informed at check in.None of this marred our stay, however and would choose to stay again if we were in NYC!

so upset tried to call the front desk today about 10 minutes ago to resolve a issue the lady was so rude and then hung up the phone. nasty lady. i paid almost 400 bucks for a room that was falling apart.never again. i will let every one know about this hotel. the wall paper was off the wall as well as the paint. the head boards where dirty and the leather of the head board was falling off on my pillow. and calling over the phone is a horrible experience.
user_name:
heavnunez
New York City, New York

review_body: This review gets 5 stars because of the great service we received from Robbie on the front desk. We are from the UK and came to New York to celebrate our friends wedding. When we arrived at the hotel we had spent 8 hours on a plane, 2 hours clearing immigration and then had one of the worst taxi rides. We were tired and hungry just wanting to get to our room. Robbie was welcoming and friendly. She checked us in quickly and sorted out the vouchers we needed for breakfast. Later that night the brides father needed to change hotels as the one he was in was sub standard. Again Robbie was on the front desk and was able to arrange a room with great efficiency. The hotel is clean and well maintained and what I would expect from a Crowne Plaza but the great service we received makes it stand out.

I had to come to NYC for work so my husband and I came out two days early to do some sight seeing. Our room was on the top floor which was very neat. The room was clean, bed and pillows were comfy, and the hotel itself was quiet. Plus the location was awesome! You can really walk to most of the main NYC attractions from the hotel! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC. I was worried about noise being so close to Times Square but it was quiet and relaxing stay. The only noise that we actually noticed was when police, fire trucks, and ambulances went by.

Just back from New York and our stay at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan was excellent. The rooms were a normal size as was the washroom. They were very clean and the air conditioning worked excellent. The location was great and I would definitely stay at the same hotel when I return to New York and I would recommend it to anyone.

We were especially pleased by the excellent service of our waiter, ALI at breakfast every day.Our wonderful treatment by the entire staff at this hotel made our visit most enjoyable.We will not hesitate in visiting this property again.

Hotel is located right on Times Square so of course the price you are paying is for the location as the hotel itself is not all that glamorous. It is in need of of some updating in the rooms. Check in wasn't to long and staff was friendly. Even though we asked for a room with a view of Times Square they didn't have any available..Our view was of the roof tops and a little glimpse of the cruise boats. Our room was clean and did the job of a place to lay our head after a long day & night out and about. I would compare it to a reg. Holiday Inn Express room. Downstairs there is a bar/restaurant with great views for people watching but no outdoor sitting. We only had beers so can't report on food. The breakfast they offer seems a bit over priced for what is served but we got the $10 discount tickets per person so in that case it was worth it. We did notice the tip for the waiter was already included where I'd rather be charged for the food and then let me leave a tip based on service. Our waiter basically explained how it worked and that was it except to bring us the check.He never checked on us. Probably because he knew he got a tip automatically. Food was good and they had a great selection. We will probably take a cheaper hotel off the strip next time to get more hotel for our money.

I stayed in New York crowne plaza for 6 days in August and we got upgraded to the better room. Room service was good and was a lovely place to stay. Hotel was clean and in nice shape. Thanks very much :)

Everything was perfect... Nice room, service and very clean generally... Corinne from Concierge department was very kind and helpful..., without her we wouldn't be able to complete all the Tours we did in such few days that we had... Upon arrival at the check-in (Hajar if i remember correctly and all the girls) helped us a lot and very quickly... ;)

This hotel is only one block away from Time Square. Hotel parking is expensive. But you can find less expensive parking if you are willing to walk a couple of blocks. Room (headboard) shows unsightly wear but it was clean. Breakfast server Ali was super nice and made all the difference for the experience.

We were welcomed by friendly staff. Hotel has everything you need with a decent sized sports bar, restaurant, all day coffee shop and a large gym. It's a large hotel but it didn't feel as though we were overwhelmed with guests even with a convention on. The Queen room was a very good size for all of us. The location is great for sightseeing as it's on Duffy Sq that becomes Times Sq within 100 yds of the hotel entrance and in the middle of Broadway for theatres. Plenty of bars, restaurants, coffee shops, cheap eateries close by and a Wallgreens a block down the road where you can buy sandwiches, snacks, wine & beer.

Front Desk:We arrived after a long trip from the UK to find that our luggage was delayed. When we informed the hotel check in assistant of this she completely lacked empathy and was more interested in continuing her conversation with her co-worker. Considering that this is the first point of contact with the hotel, she didn't make a good impression-we got the impression that we were actually inconveniencing her. (Maybe this is not representative of all the front desk assistants-perhaps we were just unlucky.)I asked if she could provide essentials (toothbrushes and toothpaste) to which she replied "There are toiletries in the room." I asked if we could have extra shampoo, conditioner and body wash as we were a family of four, so we could shower before we went out to purchase basics, but an hour after we arrived at the room, this hadn't arrived so I had to call the front desk to request them again. When our cases arrived a few days later, no-one called us to say they were at the hotel. It was only by chance that I called to be told that they were there. I don't know how long they had actually been there!Efficiency:As soon as requests were made by telephone, (for toiletries, luggage, room service) the items arrived at the room promptly with staff being extremely helpful and courteous. The room:We had a Times Square view with two queen beds. Room was average size. Cleanliness generally was fine but, as another person has previously posted, the cleaning staff seem to have an aversion to dusting. The radio alarm was covered in dust, along with the surface of the table it was placed on and the lamp bases. Beds were ok-if you don't mind a firm mattress. Pillows were amazing-I wished I could have brought one home!Bathroom was average-there was a big chip out of the bath but the shower was good. Position:Excellent location which was why we selected this hotel. We walked to Grand Central, Public Library, Rockefeller and 5th Ave. Hotel bar:There seemed to be only two staff serving in the bar area. The lady who served us seemed quite stressed with number of people she was trying to serve which led to brusque responses for food orders and for the bill. Summary:Visit if you want an excellent location, with ok rooms and can accept a very impersonal, laissez-faire attitude from the front desk.

Its my first visit to the states with the family so all the hotel choices had to be safe, we choose the Crowne plaza times square given the name. The location is the best you can if you want to stay in times square, the rooms were small and staff were extremely not welcoming and didn't know they actually existed if it wasn't for the check in & out. The toilets were too dirty and there was a problem with the sewer or something we've asked for help they came immediately but with no use. Im going back to new york 3 weeks from now, but definitely not staying @ the Crowne Plaza ever again.

THE Crowne Plaza! Why?!!I called almost a week before my arrival date asking them for connected rooms because I'm traveling with my kids and the answer was disappointing, that they can't accommodate my request until I check in. And when we arrived I was given two separate rooms and they told me that they're, at least in the same floor!! And to be fair the front desk clerk, I think her name was Rohda, went somewhere to try to find me other rooms. And then I was promised to move the next day. It was really inconvenient especially that I'm traveling with KIDS! And I think my request was legit. I couldn't sleep all night walking the corridors to check on my little ones. They did moved us the next day and it was smooth. Though I was staying for three nights only. The rooms were clean and unlike most of the hotels in the area they're spacious. My struggle was with the bathroom in the room, it was small and has few towels. And the cherry on top was the clogged shower drain and the water was over-flowing to the bathroom floor :(. But they fixed it. We spent our stay moving and calling maintenance. The location is perfect for those who want to spend few nights at the Times Square area. The hotel is accessible but has a VERY crowded lobby. I might go back again only if I'll book one room, just to save the hustle.

Right in the heart of the theatre district. If you are looking for non luxury accommodations in NYC, and want a "reasonably priced" place to sleep, this is as good a spot as any. Staff is friendly and helpful and location is central. Beds are small for a family of four and the mattresses squeak with every roll over but it's clean. NYC is expensive. Accept it or move along.

Stayed as a family of 6 in 2 rooms for 4 nights. As an IHG member I had advised the hotel well in advance of the need to have the rooms on the same floor and that we were there celebrating a birthday plus a number of other family celebrations.On check in there was zero acknowledgement of the birthday - not even "happy birthday" and this relative impersonal service was maintained for the whole visit.The rooms were dated - marks on headboards, paint peeling from mirrors etc and the bathrooms had seen better days. However, we had a great view of Broadway from the 38th floor.The hotel location is superb - we could see the subway station from the room so great for getting around. The concern was that there was no security on the doors - anyone could walk in off the street. You did not have to pass through reception to get to the elevators and you did not need a key card to access the elevators. This did seem strange.We did not use the dining facilities- $32 for breakfast x6 was more like a charge for dinner in other places and there were more than enough places to eat close by. There is a coffee shop and we did use this once for breakfast - but service was so slow we only used it the once.We used the hotel as a base - basically to sleep - as we were out and about for 14 hours per day! For this the hotel was fine. Would we stay here again? Possibly - but there are lots of similar hotels in the area so it will come down to price as there was nothing here that sets it apart from others.

This hotel is well positioned in the centre of time and handy for Broadway and the Rockefeller Centre. The hotel has reasonable sizes rooms with clean bathrooms and very quite. This contrasts with the sheer volume of people in Times Square and noise specially at night. There are many local restaurants and bars in Time Square but the price drops if you try a few blocks away. We did not eat in the hotel but colleagues did and had no adverse comments

This is near the theatre district and Times Square and right on Broadway. Room 4127 was a corner room--quiet, large and view. All the things you would expect with good help for such a busy hotel. A manager--Christopher Diamantakis was a delight to work with.

The room was nice but the service was the pitts. You would ask one question and get sent to about 4 people. Concierge staff were very unfriendly and had very little information. We spoke to one manager who was very nonchalant and of no help. I will never go to this hotel again.

We stayed in here for five nights, on the 37th floor, and initially had mixed emotions about the hotel and our room. The hotel is in a brilliant location, which is why we booked it, and the staff were extremely helpful. However, the hotel is definitely a little tired and in need of a refurb. We arrived on Sunday, late afternoon, and were promptly checked in by a very nice man, who asked if we would like a room with a view. I was thrilled at that. Unfortunately, we were evidently a bit naïve as we thought he meant a view of Times Square. We should have thought to ask! What we got was a bit of a view of the Hudson river, between neighbouring buildings. Our room was large but the wooden furniture had definitely seen better days. The large, flat screen TV (very nice) was on top of a unit that housed the coffee/tea maker (pods supplied), a safe, and some drawers which didn’t shut properly and looked like they may break at any minute (not so nice). The bed was large and extremely comfortable, with bedside cabinets whose drawers didn’t shut properly either. The air conditioning wasn’t great, which meant we found the room quite stuffy, and was very noisy too. The bathroom was large and bit like a wet room. The shower did have a curtain, and a ‘lip’ to it, presumably to prevent water from going in to the main part of the bathroom, but we needed to put towels down to mop the water up every time we showered. However, the shower was extremely good and much better than our one at home! There were toiletries, and a hair dryer, but no dressing gowns or slippers. The plumbing did need seeing to as every time we turned the cold tap on it made a noise similar to a ship's horn when it leaves port. Perhaps a nod to our view of the Hudson?After the first night, we had a conversation about whether we should move rooms, as I was quite unhappy. However, after looking at the photo gallery on the hotel website, we realised that we probably wouldn’t get a better room. We ended up having quite a comfortable stay, and decided our room was simply quirky. Would we stay here again if we came back to NYC? Probably. Would we recommend it – yes, we would. We would just advise you not to be too disappointed by the hotel’s frayed edges. It’s obviously well used, and judging by the reviews on TripAdvisor, well loved.

Pluses: very near to times square and since on Broadway near to a lot to shops and restaurants for every budget and feel. Helpful staff and courteous. Nice nice rooms not very big but just perfect.we took breakfast inclusive rates which was not but not too many choices for vegetarians, but its ok as there were a lot of option just outside the hotel.Negative : not any thing we could notice

Our first visit to this particular hotel and I must say the first thing I was impressed with was the overall customer service experience which was excellent from checking in to leaving, room was cleaned in a decent time window as well. Breakfast if you are a Platinum or Spire IHG member is only $10/each instead of $32, the check in staff will give you the vouchers on check in. The $10 also includes your tip - brilliant value. WiFi works well, the hotel is very busy due to location but that's 'Times Square' for you.

We visited this hotel for a week August 2017 as a family. From the moment we arrived we were treated very well by all staff. The rooms are excellent and everything available.Gym is fantastic in hotel. The location is excellent for all hot tourist attractions and if unsure the hotel has a concierge service that assists in a way that fills you with confidence and direction of course! Nothing is a problem to any of the staff. It has a lovely restaurant and bar also. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a very pleasant stay at a central hotel. Easy access in New York to everything
user_name:
bernadetteconnolly
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: great location we r right next to times square and heaps of great city sites r just a few blocks away . and the subways r across the road . if you want great views try to a room up on a high floor were in the level 30s and its awsum looking down on times square the hotel has great things to do theres a pool etc would stay here anytime

Arrived close to Midnight on a Friday--checkin staff were friendly and efficient. Upgrade to an upper/corner room was a nice surprise. Rooms are clean, modern and large (by NYC standards). Location is in the middle of the theatre district so catching the subway, a train at Grand Central or walk to your destination with ease. Luggage storage was available which was incredibly helpful as we had an evening flight on the day of checkout. Staff also arranged for a car service to take us to the airport for the same price as a cab. First class treatment from start to finish!

Our stay in this hotel was great! We enjoyed a lot being next to Times Square. The breakfast buffet was the best we ever had in America. I still keep in mind the best hostess of the world, Ana. I truly recommend this hotel :)

This is the worst experience I have ever had. I waited for over 30min for check in, and even was asked to leave the elite member lane rudely even though I showed the security officer my Platinum membership card. Room is dark and does not come with some amenity like slippers, bathrobe and fridge. Never see a Crowne Plaza like this. I tried to call for slippers but none of the lines to through, so I went down to the reception and guess what, I get a pair of slipper ONE HOUR later.Breakfast is average with little variety of food and no egg station. And I was told to write down my name and room number myself on the breakfast voucher in a very unfriendly manner. Seriously? Is this my job?If you wanna go for a swim in this hotel, you will need to bring along a swim cap and your own pad lock. Wow. Never ever.Upon check out, I was found that I was over charged by 240usd.The worst thing of all, none of the employees care or apologize. They seems to be busying socializing with their colleagues and they always educate their guests how to behave in order to make their work easier.

We stayed on at the Crowne Plaza Times Square from August 8 through August 15, 2017. First of all, I wasn't ready for NYC hotel room sticker shock, and definitely unprepared to pay $350 night for a hotel room. But, with NYC hotel prices, we didn't have a choice. More limporantanly, I want a safe hotel--and the name of Crowne Hotel was definitely #1choice. The hotel is clean, vibrant, and energetic--just likeTimes Square. Although it's a fun hotel, it's a well-controlled hotel and we didn't hear loud revelers in the middle of the night. We stayed on the 45th floor, which eliminated elevator crowds It appeared to me that there were more people on the first 15 floors. I'm glad we got the 45th floor with an excellent view. Check-in was fast, efficient, and organized. The hotel has a snack bar that includes pastry, coffee, salads, and beverages. We enjoyed having lunch and dinner at the restaurant--we always sat by the bay windows over-looking Broadway. The only not-so-positive comment that I have is that there is only one waitress taking orders She's courteous but it's just too much of an area for one person. Our order did take time to arrive. The best thing about the hotel is its location--right smack in the middle of Times Square activity. You can jump on a subway only a block away. We didn't have problems with check-out and weren't surprised by additional prices. The room itself is modern, clean, and well-stocked. There is no microwave but the hotel will provide a small fridge for baby bottles, etc. One particular thing: the lobby is attractive but there are only four chairs for guest to rest on. My guess is that they want guest to patronize the bar/restaurant. Food prices around Tims Square are steep so you have to shop around for delis, where you can buy food by the pound. Often we bought our food in delis and ate at the provided tables. Would I stay there again? Yes, but again it hurts to pay $350 a night. But, having checked NYC hotel prices for December, You can not beat the safety and location of this hotel.

Great location, Very Clean and confortable rooms,Very nice, polite and friendly staff. We really had an enjoyable time at this hotel. Excellent service in the restaurant, we had a very friendly waiter who gave us and outstanding service everyday, his name is Rahman.I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.
