The staff in this hotel, especially a woman named Juliet, were excellent. We had some problems at check in, but the staff handled it great. The hotel was very clean and well kept. The only drawbacks we had were in the room itself. While there was a small coffee/tea maker, there was no refigerator. The television had next to no channels that were of any choice, unless you were there for business. There is a pool, but if you have kids with you, they charge you to use the pool.

First and foremost, special thanks to Evelyn, front guest services and Lyonell, hotel manager for taking the time to make our New York experience memorable by giving us a room with a breathtaking corner view of Time Square (I reserved a time square view and we were given the room with the best view of Town Square). They went the extra mile to fulfill our requests and all the while remained incredibly dedicated to making us feel welcomed, which we very much appreciated as it was our first stay in NYC. We planned this trip for over 6 months trying to decide which hotel to stay. Upon seeing other hotels around the city, my family and I have reflected that this must truly be one of the best, not only for its convenient location in the heart of all the action of New York, but also for its excellent service and hospitality; the next time we visit, we'll be sure to stay here once again. In all honesty, one of the highlights of everyday was always being able to come back to our comfortable hotel room after a tiring day of exploration. The comfy bed and most specially the fluffy pillows just hit that aching spot. The hotel itself, aside from located in the heart of time square, just a block from subway station, theaters, restaurants, shopping, not to forget the weekend market on Broadway. The hotel lobby is great, always clean and not too crowded. We would like to thank housekeeping too for keeping our room clean daily. The front desk staff, with such great smile and customer service. Until then, we definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking to enjoy all the city has to offer under the care of people who go above and beyond to ensure that our stay is as amazing as possible. P.S. Evelyn, you're the best!.... when I was in line to check in, as I observed everyone in the front. I was hoping I'll end up with you. I wasn't disappointed. You excel in what you do! You deserve a promotion! Again, thank you!

I sometimes wonder if I stayed at a different place than some of these reviews. so my wife an I arrived August 16th on our 37th Anniversary , we were dropped off in front an walked in from Broadway Ave and up to the reception area. There we were met by a guest receptionist named Vera WOW !!!! this girl was so nice and friendly and welcoming she answered all of our questions, was very polite and accommodating . She should give training to other hotels we have stayed at on guest services as she is fanstastic. She gave us 2 complimentary drink tickets which everyone seems to get on arrival, which not to many hotels that we have travelled to in North America or Europe do so that was nice. She then came back with complimentary breakfast for us "thank you Vera". from Canada!! We got to our room and it was a good size and clean, the bed was comfortable and we had no issues with cleanliness or service. The view was average but again if your in New York your not living in your room, and your also not paying $$$$$ your there to be comfortable and enjoy the City , if you want to over look Times Square then pay as you would any where else otherwise enjoy the hotel. . We had no issue with Wifi and as to the lobby washrooms they were clean and yes a key card opens them, geez your in New York do you want anyone using the lobby washrooms let's be reasonable it was forthe guests as well as safety. As to to the cafe we enjoyed the coffee and muffins but again your in NewYork an it's basically the same price everywhere else within the tourist area. This Hotel is great location friendly staff both at front counter , restaurant, and conscierge. The only thing I would recommend would be a doorman at the door on broadway to help persons with luggage etc as they do at the breezeway as we noted several people getting out in this area as we did but trying to manipulate the crowds etc with young kids is very hard. Yes we would not hesitate to return or recommend, excellent service and clean facility .Doormen were helpful and polite as were all staff we encountered great customer service !!! Very enjoyable stay!!!! And yes enjoy your drinks over looking Broadway Ave with friendly bar service . Also maybe the hotel should have a list of which company's are allowed access to drop off an pickup in the breezeway for future customers we travelled Go Airlink so not sure if they are allowed on property as we had to walk out of breeze way to get to our ride, so maybe a list of shuttles accepted by hotel on their website would assist future customers. Anyways by far an enjoyable time at this Hotel.

I have stayed at this hotel for 25+ years. I've went thru many, many general manager changes and many renovations. I've brought groups of 30-40 people to NYC and stayed here. Bottom line....a great place to stay!! You can't go wrong. The one negative (why I gave it 4 stars) would be how they treat Platinum members. Not good at all!! Prob the worst of any IHG hotel I've ever stayed at around the world. One front desk lady once told me the philosophy of the GM was they fill the hotel up no matter what - so why give special treatment to platinum members. I continue to consider this hotel when I travel to NYC because it's a great location, clean and a safe place to stay. Many times tho, I choose Marriott Marquis over this hotel because MM upgrades me every time, gives me concierge treatment and I'm not even Platinum at Marriott. I'm just Gold level.

Hotel on outside looks great inside not so good..staff are unhelpful n don't explain things correctly when you check in..Wifi on s rubbish and wont let you connect..Plug sockets are all out dated and plug wont sit right in the wall..keeps falling out..so unable to charge items..You need your key card just to go to the toilets in lobby..the toilets in lobby are in need of decoration and need of a good clean..the floor they are selling in the cafe in hotel is so expensive..$3.50 for a yogurt..it's a jokeCupboard doors don't close properly either..I booked this hotel thinking from the pictures it was a really nice hotel ..but it's a let down and wont be booking again

We were fortunate to have Sandra E assist us. We told her we just arrived from a long trip prior. We were given a twin sharing bed (vs original booking of 1 king) and admitted to our rooms (among the few that were ready). Such kind gesture made the start of our trip great.

The Crowne Plaza is located right in the middle of Times Square in the centre of all the magic. It’s a fantastic base with large comfortable rooms. We stayed on a room only basis and though food is available there is much more nearby to cover all tastes and budgets. Immediately outside are several companies operating bus tours and theatres are close by. The hotel is sizeable with conference rooms, large lobby area and multi level entrance. The staff were all exceptionally polite though I sometimes thought the structure was a bit chaotic though it was very busy when we checked in. This could have been because we were part of a large twin centre group. All in all a pleasant stay with no hidden charges.

I stayed here for 2 nights for a business conference. Conference facilities are excellent. I was pleasantly surprised by my room, I had a corner room with a spectacular south and west view. If you are a tourist and you really want to feel like you're in the heart of it all, this hotel is for you. I was also very pleasantly surprised by the room - everything seemed new, bed was comfortable, bathroom was modern and updated, it was much more than I expected. It was also totally quiet. I felt like I was in a little Manhattan penthouse, very chic which was not what I would expect in midtown. The drawback: you're smack dab in the middle of Times Square. Which I avoid at all costs. It is crowded and noisy (no New Yorker ever ventures on purpose to Times Square). So to get away from it you have to immediately head west (my tip, walk over over one or two blocks west and then head north, you'll be to Central Park and start of UWS - much more civilized and quiet). But the plus is, if you are a tourist, you're right in the heart of Times Square! So it just depends on what you want, like, if you have kids, this is probably a great choice. It gives you a real "New York" experience. Also keep in mind the elevators are crowded with tourists too. That's the vibe till you get to your room. So I stayed in my room, went to meetings and then got the heck out of Times Square when I needed to get some fresh air. There's a Starbucks in the hotel and coffeemaker in room.

We stayed for a week and can not rate this place highly enough. The location is smack bang in the heart of Times Square, within walking distance or cheap uber ride to all the most iconic locations to visit. Plenty of eateries close by and can recommend Juniors across the road with plenty to choose from. Rooms are getting a bit tired but value for money is unbeatable. I have rated at five stars aw our stay was memorable, absolute in awe of Times Square at night, that's when it's at it's best!

Stayed here 3 nights from 4th July. Rooms were lovely. Beds so comfy. View wasn't good but I hadn't asked for a good view so didn't bother us. Breakfast in the hotel however was an absolute rip off. $105 for a buffet and that's 2 adults full price and 2 kids half price. Really wasn't expecting that. We ate out the next mornings. Hotel is in central Times Square so very hussle bussle but didn't hear anything from the room. Would definetly advise this hotel

Our double room was clean and comfortable if a little dated. Air con quite noisy and rooms not very soundproof. Served its purpose and very convenient for NYC tourists.Rigth in the middle of Times Square, so handy for shows, bus tours and night life, with a good selection of restaurants in walking distance.

Although the location is good the hotel is NOT worth the money. The light switches and bathroom fittings are all wonky and broken. All of the wood furnishings are scratched and chipped or falling apart. The hotel has a pool with a swim cap policy but doesn't sell or give swim caps. NO fridge in the room, no water in the room. Needs a serious update throughout. Having said that the staff like everyone in New York are lovely. I wouldn't stay here again though as there are much better options in New York to choose from.

Big shout out to Sandra! Thank you for the travel tips and for making our stay at Crowne Plaza a memorable one. Great location and nice clean rooms.The breakfast at the Brasserie is just ok. Not a lot of choices and I say it's overpriced at $32/person. Good thing our family got breakfast vouchers being IHG platinum members. I recommend to just eat outside. The bar serves good selection of wine.Use your wine coupons.

Did a weekend with the boys, for some good food.The Crowne Plaza is right in the middle of Time Square.The perfect spot to travel from.Many great restaurants in walking distance and close cab (Uber) to everything else.Place is a wee bit dated in the rooms, but we didn't go to be in the room.Staff was great, and very helpful. Bar was nice ( could be open a bit later)Over all would go back again.

Very niceGood wine coupons at the check out became handy before the showNice very quite too the middle of "hustle and bustle " of Times Square districtShort walking distance to all Brodsky showsSurrounded by many parking ( check Panda applications for best rates !!!)

I've stayed in this hotel many times for business. It is a clean and modern hotel and in the heart of Times Square. Service is always excellent. I usually have the breakfast buffet which is a minimal add-on cost if you're a guest at the hotel.

We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza for four nights as part of my sons 21st Birthday celebrations. On check-in we were upgraded to a corner room on the 41st floor with great views of the Hudson. We were also given some drinks & breakfast vouchers which was greatly appreciated. More than this though, the senior management at the hotel, Niles and Sylvia reached out and provided a cake and candles for my sons Birthday and also extended the late check-out for us as we had a late flight home.The location is great, this is the fourth time we've stayed at the hotel, and would definitely return. The staff were unfailingly helpful and pleasant, from the receptions staff, bar staff, restaurant staff, housekeeping and senior management. I stay in IHG hotels regular and this one is a credit to the brand.Sincere thanks to Niles and his team for making this stay really special for our family.

This hotel is a awesome place to stay at convenient location to the train and is in the heart of time square. The rooms here come in different sizes but the space for the rooms are large enough for a king size bed and then some. you can walk tot he Rockefeller center from there or you can take the train to get to where you need to go. Forgot to mention the amenities are many.
user_name:
jeffreytran28
New York City, New York

review_body: Recently stayed 2 times, both times in a room with a city view. Rooms had a bath tube, but no separate shower. Rooms are relatively small and somewhat old-fashioned. The location of this hotel however is outstanding, right at the center of Times Square in the heart of the city, whereas the city noise doesn't get into your room. The hotel does have a swimming pool, although that is tiny, doen't look attractive and dfinately needs a refurbish. Moreover, the hotel is massive and as such you feel anonymous. All together, perfect location, average hotel. Taken the location I will get back next business trip as I spent most of the times outside the room.

Where do I begin here. When traveling to New York on business I have a wide choice in hotels. Midtown Manhattan does not hurt for choices, so usually I tend to chose hotels due to brand loyalty, value and location convenience. As far as IHG chain is concerned, I've been an elite member for years, frequenting their brands around the world London, Hong Kong, New York, etc. unfortunately Crowne Plaza New York Times Square will not be getting my return business again. Main reason.....room cleanliness! For a hotel that boasts itself to be "newly renovated". I found the rooms rather wanting....to say the least. Upon my check in, I asked for a room in a "quiet zone" (a Crowne Plaza trademark).....yet the IHG front desk representative had no clue what I was talking about.....NONE. He offered a non-connecting room at the high floor (whatever..) Before I was even able to enter my room the housekeeper ran over as I was trying to open the door and informed me that the room was clean, but needed maintenance to change the shower curtain. I said it was fine, and indeed that was changed in the next 10-15 minutes as I was unpacking. However, almost immediately I noticed the room was not very "clean". However, being tired after the flight and being late Sunday evening I just went to sleep. Next morning I made sure the room was ready for service and even left a tip on the bed (hoping it would make the difference). The photos below was taken after I returned to my room after work on that second day.......First, let's talk about "newly renovated"......DVD alarm clocks went away in like what 2010? At the latest? Does anyone still travel with their CD collection? For an upscale brand like Crowne Plaza to not have Bluetooth alarm clocks with USB charging ports in 2017 is rather embarrassing. That little tidbit aside let's take a good look at those headboards.....both bed headboards are horribly scratched.....It's unsightly.....However, THE most Disturbing / Disgusting part is the actual cleanliness. Look at that layer of dust!!!! That nightstand, alarm clock, power outlets have not been wiped in weeks...weeks!!! Just look at that dust pile! Seriously. Are that green m&m candy and that plastic cover to some kind of box???? Neither were mine....they are laying in plain sight under the desk. Any amount of vacuuming (either before I got the Room Or the fist day of my housekeeping service) should have picked this up..... I left the do not disturb sign on my door for the remainder of the trip as I didn't want anyone messing around with my toiletries. I slept in my t-shirt as I didn't have a high degree of confidence in the cleanliness of my bedding...If I wasn't working long hours and coming back to the room to sleep, I would have found the time to complain, I guess I'll just vote with my wallet and let my corporate travel agent know about this experience.I did call during my first morning about the sink that wouldn't drain (see photo) and that was fixed......

As a part of vacation, we flew into JFK from Tokyo and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We checked in to a room about 7pm so we did not have to wait long at check-in. We booked a room with two beds and that was exactly assigned to us. The room was clean but found many bags of sugar and two sacks of snacks from previous guest in one of drawers. Housekeeping probalby missed to check all drawers or the guest returned after the cleaning and checked out. It did not bother us anyway. Wifi worked just fine. We were given drink vouchers so we used it at Grind & Co. on the lobby floor. Subway station for route 1/2/3/ was close so we could easily go to China Town (Canal Street Station) and Macy's and neaby shops (34th Herald Square Station), .

Run by immature children who band together in their lies and mistreatment of customers. Thankfully their security guard recommended the Marriot Marquis and showed us how to get there, because he felt bad for us. We had a wonderful stay there. .

We stayed the last week of July. We had a GREAT stay. The room was as expected with a Time Square View. There were plenty of elevators which meant we hardly waited. We overheard that the hotel was at capacity so if that is true, the elevators were really efficient. There is a subway stop 2 minutes up from the hotel so that was great. We used it to go to the 9/11 Memorial and Battery Park for the Statue visit. The bar in the hotel was a great stop for a couple beers and appetizers. Good views of Time Square also. I don't have any criticisms. Nothing is perfect but we had a great stay

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square for 4 nights and we would recommend it for its great location. The room was comfy and quiet and was good enough for our tourist purpose. I would stay again on future trips to New York. It is a big hotel so no personal touch from the staff as they are so busy but it didn't bother us as we were mainly out exploring New York.

We enjoyed staying here in the heart if Times Square. Decent rooms, clean bedding and towels.Good position in busy Times Square for site seeing, shopping, restaurants etc. The subway was just on the street. Talking to other people we never had the best room, they have far better. Lovely view from the 38th floor of busy New York. Down side our bathroom fan was not working and the toilet roll holder was falling off the wall !

we loved this hotel, we stayed on the 18th floor that has its own elevator... Great location so much to do around it We walked to times square, breakfast in the hotel is included, light but enough. Singing waiters and waitresses restaurant around the corner. Rooms with nice view of nyc

Stayed here for 4 nights with family. Great room on 46th floor, great check in service, great bar service and great job sorting a car to take us to the cruise terminal for the journey home.Previously stayed at the Inter Continental in NYC and the Crowne Plaza was on par given the price difference.

Wow, what an amazing time we had. The hotel is stunning!!!28 floors, we stayed on the 26th.The room we had, had 2 double beds, with massive TV, tea/coffee making facilities, an ice bucket with 2 plastic beakers ( there was an ice making machine room opposite our bedroom door) and an en-suite bathroom which had a bath and over head shower.Loads of towels but if your a larger person like me I would take your own as their ones didn't fully wrap around.You had house keeping come in everyday and make beds and change towels.There is a restaurant in the hotel but we didn't use it.The staff are very friendly and nothing is a problem.

This wasn't my first time in NYC but it was my son's and my father's first time so I thought, what better memory than staying in Time Square! I knew going into the trip that Time Square is more of a day trip rather than an entire trip, but wanted the lights and excitement of it all the be imbedded in my son's memories. We got a time square room with double beds. The room itself was average and nothing above and beyond, the view from the room is what really made be book the Crowne Plaza and that in itself was worth it. We didn't do breakfast at the hotel because of the price, in my mind no hotel should charge a $30 daily hotel fee and $30 per person breakfast fee for food that is your typical hotel fare. There are plenty of restaurants off of time square that are reasonably priced and the food is miles above what you would get at the hotel. If you are thinking of staying in Time Square be aware of I the hagglers and big bus tour workers who congregate outside of the hotel doors. At other hotels in Manhattan you don't have this problem which honestly at the end of the trip you'll wish you can walk outside and not be bombarded by throngs of people trying to put things in your arms and trying to guilt you into giving money to "feed the homeless". I love New York City and everything it has to offer but for me personally even though the hotel was nice I feel like there are other hotels that are higher rated and a more comfortable stay that cost less, don't have nightly hotel fees and don't come with the masses of people right outside your door every day that are more worth the money. The trick with New York is you need to branch out, every area is easily accessible by walking, subway or ferry so don't do yourself a disservice and by only staying in one area or only checking out the sites; embrace the city, meet some New York's and ask their advice on where to eat and what to do- no one gives better guidance and knows where to find great affordable food and things to do than someone who lives there. You might also find an area that you want to spend more time in since each burrow has its own charm and features. Also remember in the hustle and bustle of the city for you it is a vacation, take your time and enjoy yourself don't get caught up in the crowd.

This was my first time visiting NYC so we wanted to do it properly and seen this hotel advertised as right in Times Square at the heart of the city- they were not wrong!!The hotel gave a great first impression, the décor is beautiful and the staff were so friendly and helpful, was a great welcome!We went for the Times square view room and it was spectacular! We looked right onto the M&M world building and could see Times Square, the surrounding area and the empire state building through the buildings! We were very high up and the views were great!The hotel facilities were great, the bar and food area had great service, you had a constant buzz as you were in the heart of this amazing city. It was so easy to get about different parts of Manhattan as a subway station is nearby and also a short walk from major attractions such as the top of the rock. I was so sad to leave this amazing hotel an city, if I am lucky enough to return, this hotel will 100% be the one I stay in! It is so worth the money!

very good location , in the cen tre of Manhattan, modern hotel with all modern comfort , friendly staff. the room was large, quite and clean, with a large bathroom. Elegant public area., all positive, hotel to suggest and we aill do it

first time in new york and this was a good experience ,nice hotel in the heart of manhattan , too close to time square , quite rooms, friendly staff , beautiful lobby and delicious breakfast , I hope it was helpful.

My husband and I are frequent visitors to this hotel as we love to see Broadway shows. We have always been pleased with our stays. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. What really makes our time here great is the service. The staff we have met have been friendly and helpful. We love the breakfast and have been especially pampered by our new friends Food manager Agathe, Hostess Valerie, and our very dear waiter Tofael. We always look forward to coming back.

This was my third time staying at this hotel, and it might be my last. Starting with the positive, I was in a room that was nicer than my previous stays. I don't know if the rooms had been renovated, but the room was nice. That aside, the location of the hotel is in the center of midtown and it put my right near the theater district, where i needed to be. The bad... the service is simply not up to par. The front desk staff come off as hostile. I asked them to hold a pair of glasses at the front desk for a friend that had forgotten them in my room. They seemed as if I had asked for some huge favor and said they would only hold them for a short while. The doorman was completely unhelpful in finding a taxi or giving me directions. A hotel of this calibre and at this price point should offer better service.

LOVED THIS HOTEL. Clean, excellent service, great location, great restaurant/bar area, security, wifi, room with a view, front desk staff & manager, Gabriella was amazingly helpful and friendly. I wanted to stay longer & longer. Definitely returning to Crowne Plaza .

My son just turned 4 and is obsessed with Spider-Man. I told him we will go to Spider-Man's home aka NYC. I knew from past trips that spidey characters hang out in Times Square. Well, this location is literally perfect if you have a young child who likes characters. Spider-Man, Minnie, Mickey, transformers, batman, etc... were right out front at all times. This made his trip and is the perfect location if you want to be in the literal center of Times Square. It is total chaos on a Saturday night but that's what you get staying in TS. I paid extra for a city view which I incorrectly assumed would be either a skyline type view or Times Square. Nope it was just a few buildings partial obstruction view. Not worth that extra money AT ALL and had I not had a little one with me I would have taken it up with a manager. The staff was all nice enough nothing out of this world. The bell hops were the most friendly of everyone! In the end we don't have anything bad to say but also aren't raving about it. It's pretty much what you would expect.

Went to NY City for an overnight stay my wife and I., last time I stayed at the Crown Plaza it wasn’t the best of stays with Crown Plaza. Room wasn’t the best; customer service by the staff was so good. So this year I wasn’t sure if we should stay again. So I want to give the Crown Plaza another chance since I am a member of other hotel chains. As I was checking in, I went to Platinum Elite member check line and a Ms. Evelyn (I wish I would have gotten her last name, because management needs to know the type of outstanding service she is providing the guests) with a giant New York smile welcome me and asked me for my name. You talk about customer service. She goes out of her way to make me feel like a Platinum Elite member. As I thanked her and she ensured I am given my requested room away from the elevators, she provides me and my wife with couple of comp tickets for drinks in the hotel restaurant. Thanks Again, Ms. Evelyn!!!

Almost everything about this hotel is top draw. The staff are well trained and always willing to help. They go out of their way to treat Platinum Elite members as very special and their breakfast deal is excellent. The room we were given on a rewards stay was on the top floor overlooking Times SQ, perfect! There was one negative, in that there was no refrigerator in the room, and as visitors from Australia, this surprised us. On checkout I mentioned this and was told that they would have supplied one if asked. This is not mentioned in the services directory, so be warned. This was the only downside to our stay.

Outstanding location right in the middle of times Square-literally. We left our hotel room for a five minute walk to our Broadway play. How awesome was that? Very! Breakfast every morning with outstanding service from our server Tofiel, was a great way to start our day.

The hotel gave a corner room on the 37th floor. It was awesome! Great room, great shower, great bed and amenities - just super. The only complaint I had with the hotel was the price of the breakfast. Oh my. My 9 year old son and I ate breakfast there for a whopping $52. Yes, I had some scrambled eggs, sausage and potatoes, coffee. My son had a bagel with cream cheese, some cantaloupe and grapes, with milk. Yes, folks $52 + I had to leave a tip for the waiter. They thought they were giving me a good deal because the buffet was half price for my son. I understand that stuff is expensive in NYC, I used to live there... but that was just over the top for what we received. We ate dinner that night at a nice place for actually less money. Further more when I tried to get a menu to see what the prices were to order from the menu the waiter told me only the buffet and that it was cheaper. Beware.. go around the corner to Starbucks or somewhere else for breakfast especially if you have a large family.

The room was spacious and clean, needs a little updated but the pillows and crisp bed sheets make up for it.. The time square view is spectacular and the early morning coffee shop in the building is amazing I'll def go back

Great hotel with a superb location.Booked as a suprise birthday/xmas for my wife,we were not disappointed,room was big and comfortable with great views.Staff were efficient and friendly throughout.We only ate in the restaurant once,which was the morning of my wife's birthday,decided on the steak breakfast WOW best steak we have ever tasted,sat at a window table overlooking Times Square amazing.Situated right in the centre of Times Square couldn't be better placed to explore this wonderful city.Our only disappointment on this trip had nothing to do with the hotel but with a company called Carmel cars they were so late coming for us we almost missed our flight back if it hadn't been for Victoria from the hotel we would have she really stepped up to the plate for us so a massive thanks to her.

My wife and I took a 3 night trip to New York from July 27-30, 2017, as a way to celebrate her birthday and our anniversary. I had never been to New York and she had only been once, about 20 years ago.After much research, I settled on the Crowne Plaza as our hotel. I am fussy in terms of bed size and won't book anything without at least Queen size beds. On arrival, check in was very quick. The Crowne Plaza does charge an additional $30US per night service fee (not sure if this is a "tourism tax" sort of charge), but I knew from reading other reviews that, as an International Hotel Group (IHG) member, I could get an exemption from that. Membership with IHG is free and you can apply online. I asked for a room higher up, to create some distance from the street noise, and we were given room 2715, on the 27th floor. This was a corner room with a King bed and it had windows facing east, onto Broadway, and north, onto 49th St. We didn't have a direct view to Times Square itself, as it is a couple blocks south on Broadway, but we had a terrific view, none the less. Just a couple blocks east, we could see 30 Rock.Our hotel room was spacious, especially for New York, clean and reasonably modern. Toiletries provided were better than average and we had a nice, large, standup shower. Our room did have an adjoining door to the next unit and, unfortunately, we had some VERY discourteous people in the next room who, after coming back to their room around 0300hrs, decided to start fooling with the door from their side, locking and unlocking their deadbolt, waking us. They were quite loud the second evening as well, arriving at their room around 0100hrs and waking us again with their loud conversation on the phone. Thankfully the noise the second night was shorter lived than the first. So bear in mind the walls and doors may be a little thin from a noise point of view.We did not use the fitness facilities or pool....in fact, we weren't sure where they were until we were leaving and the elevator door opened on the 15th floor. We saw the sign for the athletic club there....too late for us to take advantage of. All in all, we were so busy seeing the sights, we likely would not have found time to, anyways. We enjoyed a couple drinks at the hotel bar, all very good...nice lounge overlooking 49th and Broadway.The hotel is located in an excellent spot for seeing much of the sights and definitely close to most of the Broadway theaters. We had tickets for School of Rock at the Winter Garden, which is almost directly across the street. Rockefeller Plaza is only a couple of blocks away, as is Times Square. On our second day there, we walked up to Central Park, north through the park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. It's a walk of a little over 3 kilometers, but we picked up a coffee on the way and sat for a while, enjoying the atmosphere of the park. For reference, after walking around the Met for a few hours, we took a cab from there south to Rockefeller Plaza and, with a decent tip, the fare was about $20. Over all, I found that everything seemed closer than I had expected...the city blocks are small, so to walk 10 blocks will probably only take you 10-15 minutes. We went to the 9/11 Museum which is a long distance south. We decided to brave the Subway which ended up being really quick and easy. From the Crowne Plaza, we caught the "E" train south at 50th St and 8th Ave, only a block away. Several other MTA lines are also close by. The fares were $2.75 each which you load onto a $1 metro card. It took us right to the WTC which is probably within walking distance of Battery Park and several of the ferry docks on the south end of Manhattan.If you have never been to New York, particularly the Times Square area, you will probably be a little overwhelmed, as I was, with the crowds, lights, and noise. The first night, especially, we noticed it, even in our hotel room. By our third night, we were growing a little bit used to it, but it may keep you awake, so earplugs might be worth bringing.We were very pleased with our stay I look forward to exploring more of what New York has to offer next time!

Very good location, extremely busy area. No bellboy at the Broadway entrance (this is the official address to which the taxi will bring you from the airport). Insufficient security measures in my opinion (during my previous stays a room key was checked at the entrance and a room key was necessary to go up the elevator). BTW - elevators fast and efficient. No offer to help with luggage at any time during checkin. Otherwise front desk acceptable.Consierge has relatively short working hours (starting at 9 AM Sundays). Freezing cold hallway A relatively small room. Very good A/C. Free WiFi - working well with only short interruptions. The toilet and (good quality) shower are separated from the room, but other parts of the bathroom are not. Multiple electricity outlets. Good quality TV.No rack for luggage. No fridge or minibar !! Coffee machine with poor quality coffee. No glasses (only plastic cups). Safe working well. Old and dirty furniture. No card in the room to ask for changing sheets. Generally poor Housekeeping. A coffee shop in the lobby area - generally ok, but the staff is touching food with their hands (no gloves) and putting their fingers into the cups before serving coffee. A shop on street level. Very good that it is there, but it is very small and not perfectly clean. Similar shops in other NY hotels are far more elegant. Annoying BigBus staff is often blocking the entrance to the hotel.

My wife and I keep thinking we have seen the best this Hotel can offer in terms of standards of excellence, courtesy, friendliness of staff and willingness to go beyond the normal, but with every stay (over several years) , we continue to be surprised by GM Niles Harris and his seasoned staff of Executive Assistant Sylvia, Rodney Booii (Food & Beverage Manager) and his assistant Yan Zhi, Karim Sharif all round Manager. Manager Juliet, Front Office Manager , Housekeeping and restaurant staff. Seems like a lot of people but we interacted with all of them.My wife and I were celebrating our Anniversary with her cousins who flew in from Mumbai and stayed at the hotel and our family who live in the area. With advance notice, GM Harris had his staff arrange for rooms on the same floor, took care of us and them during their stay so much so that they are encouraging all of their friends visiting New York to stay at the Hotel. As Elite Priority Club Members, my wife and I got a great corner room and a very special welcome from Management and an even bigger surprise for my wife from Manager Booij who surprised her with an Anniversary cake with wine for all of my family members gathered. It was spectacular and so very touching and personal. Really was awesome! Manager Booij took care of several requests with promptness, politeness and efficiency.The breakfast area under Manager Karim Sharif and Agathe were great. They may be managers but worked as hard as the staff to make sure we always had a table together, received greats service throughout and always came over to greet us as they did all other guests. It’s a tribute when everyone is made to feel special and Mr. Harris sets the tone by example. One note, they stopped making special requests BUT expanded the buffet with more choices. Housekeeping was wonderful taking care of providing extra towels and requests made, the front desk, operators and basically just about everyone. (P.S Please remember to tip Housekeeping. They work hard to do super work).For anyone who has not stayed there and thinking about it, no better place for location (right in Times Square), easy access to Broadway, museums, restaurants, subway, Uber/taxis and shopping in 5th Avenue.Great place for coffee/dessert/snacks as well as a bar in the Lobby level. Security to make sure your stay is safe is always visible.Has a membership with a huge gym (New York Sports Authority) with access from the Hotel. I have NEVER had a problem getting access to equipment which I always do at most hotels with its small gym access.BUT as I have noted above the true character of this Hotel lies with its staff and under GM Niles Harris, it’s a fun visit regardless of whether you are there for vacation or on Business. Thank you all for making this visit again exceptional and GM Harris you TRULY ROCK!

We chose this hotel for its central location and we were well satisfied with our pick! Close to Subway transit, and Broadway shows. We chose a room with a Times Square view. We loved how easy it was for us to get in and out during our two fast paced city touring days! This is where I would return to when we travel here again.

I was looking for a business traveler friendly hotel in the heart of Manhattan and found one in the Crown Plaza Times Square. Upon check-in, I was so pleased to meet Evelyn at the priority club counter, and her friendly smile and helpful demeanor was a great introduction to this hotel. Even though I was a few hours early for check-in, she found me the perfect room on the 40th floor. The hotel is located at the edge of busy Times Square in the heart of the theatre district, but it was beautifully quiet in my room. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable, and the experience enjoyable. I will definitely stay here the next time I travel to NYC.

Nice property excellent service however before warned that if you want to swim in the indoor pool it doesn't specify that the pool is leased out by a fitness center and that is not a recreational pool. So if you bring a little ones who want to swim they have to have a cap there's no shallow and and maybe lap swimming it is not a recreational pool. So beware other than that the property was nice right in the heart of everything service is great

A trip to NYC seems to be on everyone's bucket list. As is the adage with real estate it is location, location, location. But that only gets you so far. I recently had the opportunty to share a trip to NYC with a number of close friends. For many, this was their first visit to the big apple. Based on location and ammenities, we selected the Crowne Plaza - Time Square. The hotel is ideally located in Mid-Town Manhattan, and with a little effort in using the Subway system, you can get to anywhere in the city. With the extra efforts of the staff my friends not only enjoyed a great trip, but a travel experience. It started right at check-in. We were greeted by a friendly and knowledgable front desk attendant, Imran, who was able to assist in navigating thru a number of reservations and did not miss a beat. He constantly commented that it was his goal to make sure our stay was the best he could possibly make it. Checking into the rooms, we all experienced great views of Time Square. What really made the trip much more pleasant was the staff and their effort to accomodate a group whether it be cocktails in the bar or the morning breakfast buffet (which is an enjoyable feast). Whether it was the wait staff, to the concierge, to the person at the bell stand. Everyone made you feel like you were part of their family. Thanks for the great travel experience

Nothing about this place is unique. Its a well run hotel with nice clean rooms. Hotel has all the amenities of a big hotel and i've never been disappointed. Its central location makes it ideal for people spending a weekend sightseeing. For me its close to my office in NYC. Only complaint might be is that it takes a while sometimes to get an elevator, but that's a problem with any big hotel

When i was booked into the hotel prior to travelling, i braced myself for a tiny NY hotel room, masses of people everywhere and limited customer service and experience. This was not the case. The hotel is well organized to have business conferences, family visits and still manage to cater 1:1 for any body. The service was awesome, the hotel bar a great spot with a wonderful team working there and the food was great! the location is perfect!

We are a couple and three children and we arrived for 4 nights.The hotel's location is simply excellent, close to Times Square.The reception was pleasant although the room was not ready when we arrived.The room itself was clean and in reasonable size..The luggage storage service was excellent.Overall, the hotel is highly recommended and we will be happy to come back again in the future.

Myself, wife, 18 yr old daughter and 11yr old son stayed at the Crowne Plaza and we could not find fault with anything about this hotel. Step out right into Times Square so no worries about travel to NY attractions, hop on bus stop 20m away, Central Park 15 minutes walk. This meant we could nip back to our room and take a break before heading out for tea etc. Rooms had plenty of space with a huge comfortable bed. Special mention has to go to manager Karim Sharif, this man welcomed us every evening with a smile and took the time to chat with my family on our activities, although he actively encouraged my wife and daughter to do more shopping lol, he is everything a good hotel manager should be. The views from not only our room on the 23 rd floor but from the our table at breakfast were amazing. Times Square and New York at its best, we were delighted with our choice of hotel for an amazing stay in NY.

A short walk from Times Square, and right in middle of theatre district, the CP hotel is ideally placed for a few nights. Has everything you need, and the beds are soo comfy. Trains very close by for easy access. Concierges are very helpful.

We booked our trip through WestJet and deciding on the Crowne Plaza as our hotel. We were very happy with the hotel itself, the staff and the concierge were extremely helpful and friendly in every way. We were always happy to get back into a familiar place at the end of a very long day. This hotel is in such an excellent location, central to a whole lot of tourist attractions, that we ended up walking pretty much everywhere we went with the exception of Harlem, where we took the Hop on Hop off bus. Our room was on the 35 floor, with incredible views and was relatively quiet. We actually found coming home that we missed the honking and sirens at night!! The room itself was very spacious, which surprised us, as we were told not to expect a large room in NYC. This was very large, with a lovely king size bed which was extremely comfortable and with pillows that were exceptionally good. I do not do well sleeping in a different place and it usually takes me a day or two to get used to somewhere new, but I did not have one bit of trouble falling asleep here. The room could have used a few improvements, (sad and cracked headboard and the black out curtains were not easy to maneuver) but that is really quite nitpicky at best. If I had one suggestion, we would have really liked a mini fridge in our room as when we were there, it was very hot and we would have enjoyed cold water when we got up. I am way to cheap to pay $30 a day for a fridge so that is on me more than the hotel!! The one thing that I do have to question is that we purchased tickets from the concierge for Come From Away, which by the way, everyone should see. It is amazing and made us very proud to be Canadian. Anyway, when we did receive the tickets from the concierge, we found that the ticket price on the actual ticket was $89 per ticket. I just looked at our credit card statement and we have been charged $589.00, which is quite a difference in price and I know that our Canadian dollar is not that bad... so if I could suggest anything, it is maybe get your tickets at the actual Theatre and not from the concierge, who really are quite lovely, and I don't think this is their fault, but I am not sure how much of a mark up there is and we didn't check, so unfortunately we will have to deal with the price as it is on our credit card. I would have been much angrier if the play sucked, but it was excellent so it isn't as big of a deal to us. All in all, this is a great hotel and perfect for the first time in NYC!!

This hotel was in the perfect location, at the top of Times Square. It was the perfect place to stay to get the whole NYC experience. Centrally located so perfect walking distance to the Broadway shows we wanted to see, great restaurants nearby, subway access on the corner nearby, and we were IN Times Square, but not IN the middle. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The concierge was knowledgable and always ready to help. Loved this hotel, and it gave my daughter the whole NYC experience. We will definitely stay here again the next time we go to NYC, my daughter is in love with the city.

The Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan was a very good base to experience New York. This was our first visit to New York and the hotel was all we could ask for. Our room was on the 43 floor and the view out over the city was very good. Breakfast was self service with a plentiful and very good choice of continental and cooked breakfast. Special orders were cooked to order. Although the hotel was busy it was very friendly and the staff could not do enough for you. Staff who deserve a special mention are as follows.Corinne and Joanne on the Concierge desk. these two ladies could not do enough for their guest booking a Broadway show for us, advising on excellent restaurants, giving tips on what to visit and best way to get there etc. Superb service ladies thank you very much.In the Breakfast room the waiter Alfredo was excellent and the Food and Beverage outlet manager Karim Sharif was very helpful. Also a special mention for Christopher Diamantakis who resolved one or two problems we had with the booking made via Cunard.Our room was serviced very well by the room attendants no complaints there. Bar staff and waiters in the bar were very polite and again could not do enough for you.All in all when we go back to New York we will be staying at the Crown Plaza as I find it hard to see how our stay could be improved in any hotel with a similar rating. Value for money a very good choice.

My first time in NY and I have chosen this hotel for it's location. It's so centrally you can get everything nearby. The hotel has some points to improve. On checking in, the first contact, I didn't feel friendly approached by the reception. It was short and to the point. In the room it was a bit worn out. It really needed some renovation. The bathtub is old and although it is clean I don't expect this in a 4 star hotel. The bed has worn out head board it really needed to be replaced. The hotel won't give you the luxury feeling as expected. On checking out the reception had the same handling. Short and cold to customers.
user_location: Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
user_name:
charliec792
Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands

review_body: Keon was very kind to let my 8yo boy have breakfast with me and my daughter as we only have 2 meal stubs after telling him that My son will only have milk and cereals . He was very accommodating and friendly as well.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 2 nights. We were able to walk to Central Park, and the MoMA, check out 5th and Madison Avenues, jump on the subway to go to Battery Park and the Guggenheim. Their coffee shop was easy for breakfast the first morning, rooms were clean, staff was friendly and we felt safe with lots of security staff and measures to get to room. We also parked our car there. We were a little nervous about that. We had forgotten something in the car so they escorted my husband to it. He couldn't believe how tightly packed in they were- like one of those shifting puzzles! He was unable to open any door but window was down and he could reach in and grab the item. My husband and I had a drink one night at the bar- $35! I guess we paid for the experience because it wasn't anything special. The only thing we could have used in our room was a mini fridge! View of Times Square was perfect! Would definitely stay here again!

This hotel location was perfection. We were so close to everything and I was actually surprised at how big our room was for NYC. I was concerned about the extra 30$ day fee but that was waived for my IGH membership. The total for the room was supposed to be $896 but was initially charged $1124. After inquiring the front desk did inform me that this would drop off after check out which it did. The room was nice, but the air conditioning was less than perfect. It was extremely hot that weekend so that may have had something to do with it. The housekeeping was great. They came early every day and we never had to ask when they were arriving. The hotel staff was always super nice and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it was clean, the rooms were nice and the staff were helpful. I can't comment on food or anything else as I usually spent time outside the hotel and ate across New York, I would only be at the hotel to sleep or relax. The rooms were fine. I had no problems with them as they were clean and fit to standard and gave me a great night sleep. Also the TV was surprisingly big and had a lot of channels. The hotel is also slap bang in the middle of Times Square which was brilliant. The bar was fine as well as we waited in here for our shuttle to come and it was perfect and had a great vibe. Overall on what I experienced this hotel was excellent and I definitely recommend staying here if you're planning to explore Times Square and the rest of New York.

We recently stayed in the Crown Plaza. Boy. What a place. So nice. Clean, Central. Staff extremely helpful and polite. It's easy to get to shows, attractions, subway, restaurants, etc. If you want a great place to stay, look at this place. We unfortunately left some clothes in the room on checkout. The staff there were so helpful in assisting us in obtaining them by sending them via courier (we paid). Thank you so much.

This was my 2nd stay at the Crowne Plaza which covered a week this time. We arrived at hotel after a long flight late into the evening. Hotel reception weren't overly pleasant at arrival and no help with bags. Our room could have been better cleaned and now showing signs of age and need for maintence to bring hotel back up to a better standard. Example was toilet that moved and rocked every time you wanted to use it. The room was no where as good as the one I had at my last visit. Seating in lobby is all but non-existent and only way you will find a seat to relax on is to use the adjoining bar (which actually is very good and does great food at very good prices). The best aspect of the Crowne is it's location right on Times Square and the centre of everything and close to various key subways and Broadway shows.

Family was visiting NY and wanted a Time Square first view. I suggested the Crowne Plaza at Time Square I never been. Hands down it's wonderful and clean my room was perfect, everyone so nice Victoria my concier was really great I will definitely will stay here again.
user_name:
mariakahane
New York City, New York

review_body: The rooms are very good, neat , clean and well maintained. People at front desk are very co-operative. The best service I always got was from the lobby Bar, where staff was very co-operative specially Mr. Masud and his whole team.
user_name:
nomanpirzada
New York City, New York

review_body: very clean and comfortable beds. the location is fantastic right opposite M&M store, in the heart of Time Square. walk to everything. Nice friendly staff. You can get a good rate if you book early. Step out and have a blast the Sunday market is right outside the Hotel. It's worth a trip even for one day as you can get a lot done in a day if you have the right hotel.Only thing is I booked through Expedia and the Hotel charged me a 3rd party booking fee, and do not eat or drink at the Hotel its expensive but you have fabulous breakfast spots just few seconds away. Parking is extra too about $75.00 per day.
user_name:
skalua
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I spent seven nights in the Crown Plaza Time Square in July for my friends 30th Birthday. It's location was fantastic if your planning to make the most of the city and stay as close to it as possible. Every subway train uptown and downtown pass through the stations on time square so it's very simple to get around. We got the air train from the airport to Jamaica station then the subway to time square it was hassle free and much cheaper than a cab. On entry to the hotel we was greeted by the most welcoming reception team and also a makeup artist that works at the hotel he was just around the reception. We all ended up having a laugh as his makeup was more fierce than the girls on the desk and he was there makeup artist they where all glam. The girls gave us some cocktail vouchers and two breakfast buffet vouchers for a free breakfast in the week. Our room was huge and on the 41st floor. Two massive beds a view right over time square. The buzz out the window was electric. The beeps from the cars does quieten during the night so it's not as bad but it's constant. The room was cleaned daily the towels changed daily and the shampoo and conditioner was also topped up regularly. I would say the breakfast buffet was very good but at $32pp it's cheaper to go out for food.The hotel is perfect I would defiantly stay here again

The location is great for sure. Stayed at the 42 floor. The room was a bit tight compared to other hotels. The breakfast buffet is very basic. Reception staff were helpful. It was our first time in NYC and we enjoyed our stay.

Our room was good size, neat and clean. The bathroom was nice size also. Customer service was soulless. The lobby setting is very wired, small and always congested like time square.Despite of the location, the hotel is safe.

I highly recommend staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square in Manhattan. All of the staff was very friendly, courteous, and timely when we asked for things. It's the perfect location to get anywhere in New York City and the surrounding areas. The hotel was also very clean and accommodating.

This is just an update -- as readers will see in my previous reviews of the Crowne Plaza Times Square, this hotel is the best - beautiful property, outstanding location, and phenominal staff. My purpose of this latest review is to merely stress what a great group of people work here - the list is long, and on my most recent visit included Isis, Victoria, Robbie, and Evelyn. Visitors to NYC have many options, but the warm reception we always receive here makes this hotel our permanent NYC home-away-from-home!!

This was just a day trip for my daughter to see Waitress that her friends had been telling her about all school year. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by Victoria. She got us our room, told us about the restaurants in and around the hotel. Victoria took the time to talk with us and understood why we were in town. Our room was great. We order room service and fool was great and when we left we tried the Blueberry Muffins... They were delicious ...Cannot wait to do a weekend Broadway Show Trip. We are coming back to the Crown!

We are really happy to be staying in this hotel in the heart of Times Square New York. Room was really nice and looking over Times Square. Huge comfortable bed, TV, hair drier... Staff is very friendly especially in the front desk, we dealt with a lady called Evelyn, and during breakfast time called Tofae, who was very friendly and helpful and informative about New York. We recommend this hotel to anybody.
user_name:
kevinjw00d
New York City, New York

review_body: We recently took our first trip to NYC - was a short trip (Thurs-Sun) so we had very busy schedule each day to see and do as much as possible. My daughter turned 16 and wanted to go to NYC and also see Hamilton Show. This hotel was fantastic! The rooms were nice- very comfy beds- plenty of room, and we were on 18th floor and had a great view of Broadway. The staff was great! Very professional, friendly, and helpful when we had questions re restaurants, transportation etc...You cannot find a hotel in a better location than this one! It is right in the middle of Time Square, on Broadway, and within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Broadway shows, amazing restaurants, shopping, etc...also, we could see ABC's studio from our room. ( there's your 15 secs of fame going to their morning show). The hotel has a GREAT RESTAURANT & BAR, that was perfect after a day of sightseeing, shopping, LEARNING SUBWAY SYSTEM! Ha! Their staff was precious!!! Fantastic cocktails- great menu - we had few cocktails and appetizers. We had a lot to pack in during short stay so we did not have time to hang out at the pool, go to the fitness center- or comb our room w a magnifying glass looking for imperfections. We literally wanted to stay in very nice hotel- great central location- that was comfortable and great atmosphere. This hotel was perfect. Would like to add: Re taxi cabs, there are always plenty of them parked rt on the side of hotel ready to take you wherever you want to go. No need to get valet to call one for you. Also- most taxi fares were about $15.00 or less- for longer distance its best to take subway. Quick and easy. We plan to return to NYC .... soon. Will def stay here next time. Do your homework ahead of your stay to plan out your schedule- also, if you have an issue or need help, its best to not address that during peak check in checkout times, so that staff has the time to address your needs. This is a great hotel- great staff- and great part of your NYC experience! Lastly- just remember, Broadway is bright lights, busy, noisy, and a blast! If you are needing a quiet rest and relaxation vacation to get away from it all- you will want to stay in Maine.

I stayed here for 8 days with my parents last week. Great location for theater access. Craziness at your feet as soon as you walk out of the hotel but that's the trade off with a times square location. Had a few issues but Pablo, the manager, was terrific to deal with and very personable and accommodating. Also, I left my business suit in the closet. The hotel staff found it and arranged to ship it to me in Los Angeles. The rooms are updated and clean. I'd stay again, in large part to the personal service I received from the manager. The one suggestion I'd make is for the hotel to install soft close doors. The slamming doors are really irritating. With that said, the windows do a good job of keeping out the times square noise.

Times Square is beyond imagination with the big screens and people from all over the world marveling at the beauty that is New York City. A great spot to just stop for few seconds and take it all in - the vibe

This hotel was really nice. Our room was beautiful and the location is perfect. We walked around the street and felt very safe (but ignore anyone wanting to sell you music CD's!) Time Square has a lot to offer. Food, music, shopping, and just people watching makes the day fly. The hotel is very accommodating too. We bought the hop on hop off tour and although we may have gotten it cheaper somewhere else, it was convenient. We used their gym and it is huge. They invite the city residence to come too. It has a big pool and anything you can imagine in a gym atmosphere. Would stay here again.

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square from July 3-5 2017 having booked in February 2017. I checked in to discover that the request I made at the time of booking was not acknowledged. This was simple as having a room close to the end of the hallway/corner on the 40th Floor or higher (I booked Times Square View). The agent I dealt with advised that he didn't see any requests on file. Nonetheless, we ended up with 3409 on the 34th floor next to the elevator. The room itself of a good size and had a comfortable bed, but was clearly in need of TLC. The face basin in the bathroom has fracture marks throughout it, there was a tear in the blinds that forced sunlight through early on mornings and the shower curtain didn't look overly clean. The biggest disappointment for me was there being no fridge in the room as I had cold items I checked-in with and then had nowhere to put them. When I called and enquired about the fridge, I was told I had to pay $30 USD a day plus tax to get one? Really? I usually always stay at the Novotel two minutes away and all their rooms have fridges in them and they are comparably priced. Another thing that ticked me off is their $6 USD per package fee for collecting packages. That's the highest I've encountered in NYC to date. At the Novotel it's just $2 USD. Apart from what I've mentioned, the hotel was a good base to be at. It wouldn't be my first choice for NYC as staying here was an experiment but I will be heading back to the Novotel for my next trip in September. I can only suggest that there be more focus on customer service and less focus on excessive fees for simple services and possibly noting guest requests where possible with a view towards trying to honour them.

After a horrible experience with family at another hotel, we had the most amazing days at Crowne Plaza. The hotel is located at the times square, yet it still quiet and comfortable place. The staff are amazing; Sandra Esp is a great person who made our stay extraordinary and satisfying. another lady at the restaurant is amazing and welcoming she made every morning worth waking up. Thanks to them and all other staff. I highly recommend the hotel for couples or families.

We stayed here July 4 - July 7. Beds and pillows were so comfortable. Nice showers, clean. Helpful staff. The location is amazing. Easy walking distance from most landmarks. Subway station only 2 blocks away. We had a city view room on the 44th floor. Such a great view!!

We stayed here four nights. Good location in Times Square. The staff are friendly. Did not try their breakfast as we wanted to try different restaurant on the street. The room was clean. Wifi strong. The lobby was though too crowded and noisy. Their fitness center and swimming pool are in the 15th floor.

This hotel was chosen as we had been there before and the location is good.We started our stay here on a Thursday morning when there was a crossover of people leaving to get on a cruise and also people getting off a cruise and staying for a short visit. It was utter chaos! Unfortunately after queuing for a while, we was told that our room was not ready, so we put our luggage downstairs where they held onto it until we were ready to receive it in our room. Eventually, at around 3.30pm, we were informed that our room was ready. We were in an Executive room which overlooked part of Times Square and also the Hudson river. It was a fair size room and clean, my only issue was with the ceiling which was not pretty. It looks like an alarm or similar had been moved from one area to another and then patched up not very well, there is a rather large crack too. The bathroom was clean with a larger than normal shower which supplied us with nice hot water! Our stay was alright. We did not eat in the hotel, but chose to go out. There is a Bistro which is open for breakfast and lunch and also another restaurant that serves food in the evenings. We was near to the top floor and could still hear some traffic noise. This didn't affect our stay though.

Antonio was amazing and upgraded our room so my daughter had a great view of Time Square-she loved it!!! Very hospitable staff and clean rooms! Breakfast was awesome too!Thank you Crowne Plaza Time Square for the second time staying with you!!!Melissa WojtakPhoenix, AZ

Our room was very large. I wasn't expecting that much room to move around. Sink is separate from toilet and shower so you can get ready without taking up the bathroom. Clocks, coffee maker and hair dryer in room. Nice big tv. Comfy king size bed. 2 entrances. One off the main drag. The other is more private where taxi and shuttle pick up and drop off. Friendly staff. Food and dining available.

One of the most conveniently located hotels you can find. In Times Square, opposite all the attractions and shops. Next to the subway station. Rooms are generous in size. Bed is comfortable. Decor is tired. Rated very good due to location and size.

Clean good size rooms with amazing super king bed.The most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Perfect location in the middle of Times square. Downstairs café was very handy which has great coffee. The bar with restaurant, next door makes relaxing a breeze. The gentleman at reception was so helpful, pleasant and professional.

The safe in our room did not work as the internal batteries had failed. We reported it to the help desk. Ten minutes later Anthony arrived. He was polite and efficient, quickly confirming the batteries had failed and replaced them. As he left we offered him a tip which he refused. It was a breath of fresh air to have someone respond so efficiently without expecting a financial reward. The Crowne Plaza is lucky to have him.

Anthony in engineering was awesome. He came and fixed our TV and was super helpful and cheerful. We have really enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again. The location is right on times square and the entire staff from the front desk clerks to the bar tenders to Anthony have been amazing. Highly recommend this hotel.

This place was so worth the price. I was a first time NYC visitor so i wasnt prepared for the whole no parking lots thing and many other new york ways. Bug this hotel accomidated everything i hadnt even thought of like luggage after check out. As we chrcked out the receptionist let us know we coukd check in our bags and leave them there as we still weny out go sight see and shop! That was the biggest plus because i coukdnt imagin6 walking through times sqyare with our bags and luggage. The rooms sere nuce and comfortable the views were amazing and there wasbt any noise ! I will definitely stay here again!

My friend and I stayed here on a girly holiday for four nights and location wise, we couldn't have asked for a more central location and being on Times Square was just awesome. The hotel was super clean, and although our room was a little dated, especially the shower in the bathroom, the beds were comfy and the room was spacious enough for what we needed. We ate at the hotel restaurant on most nights as it was a reasonable price and delicious (try the nachos!) and the drinks were great, particularly the cocktails.
user_name:
graciet424
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: This hotel is right in the heart of Times Square, so the location is perfect. We had a corner room with a massive window, hosting a great view of the many sky scrapers and bustling streets below. We ordered room service a few times which I rate highly. We had breakfast once in the hotel, it was expensive but there was a good variety. There are so many restaurants around Times Square anyway so it's not like you are tight for choice. Our room and the hotel is very clean and modern. It was an ideal place to stay.

We travelled for NYC in June/July and stayed at the Crown Plaza, Times Square Manhattan. Great location and reasonable price. EVERYTHING in Times Square is EXPENSIVE....as a 20oz bottle of water cost us $4! Additionally, staff were kind and helpful. We asked housekeeping to change our sheets again upon arrival because they were stained AND I'm like Inspector Gadget when it comes to hotel rooms, linen, etc.... We also had to request more towels because our initial ones were stained and had hair on one....There were no additional issues with our stay or the hotel for the remainder of our visit.

Lovely hotel but the room we were in was in need of a redecorate, carpet worn, scruffs on the walls, definitely time for a refit.The rest of the hotel was lovely and the staff very friendly.The elevator was often not working.

46th floor corner suit, brilliant view, cosy bed, large bedroom, clean. No mini-bar, but coffee/tea facilities. Super service of Sandra at front desk, helping with a delicate issue.49th/broadway means, its never quiet.

Very clean and comfortable room size is fine but definitely not large there is a desk and an extra chair . Everyone here is nice and friendly . The hotel is about a block away from time square and Broadway it is in a fabulous location also nearest subway to 911 Statue of Liberty except a great stay at a great price The air-conditioner worked great which is a plus in New York City

This hotel is located just off Times Square. An excellent location for shopping. Close to subway station. The hotel itself is nice. The hotel food is way overpriced, best to eat somewhere else. One downfall is that you are not allowed to use the pool unless you wear a swim cap.

Recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza with my partner and a friend in a double room. We were given a room on the 45th floor, which gave a great view of Times Square and the surrounding area- though we did book a room with a view, and it certainly met expectations. It was the proper New York experience! And lovely at Christmas with a large tree in the lobby :)The room was very large with 2 double beds, desk space, a chair and a lovely large bathroom. There were also tea making facilities in the room. We found the room to be good value for money given it's super central location, and we stayed here for 3 nights during the Thanksgiving period. This hotel is located close to many restaurants, bars and the subway. Not to mention being right on Times Square and Broadway, and a short walk to many tourist attractions.The restaurant/bar in the hotel was quite small and sometimes very busy, and just a note but the little shop in the lobby is very expensive. It's worth picking up amenities at a little shop just around the corner of the hotel to save spending $6 on a packet of crisps! We didn't deal with the staff much, but leaving our suitcases in the hotel was a simple process, and the lobby staff were very efficient and helped to flag down taxi's for us as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and would certainly stay here again.

Fantastic location in the heart of Times Square. Staff very professional and friendly. Spacious rooms very quiet at night. Clean and comfortable. Close to the subway so made getting around easy. Walking distance from many attractions: Empire State Building, Grand Central Terminal, National Library, Macys and Broadway +++ Would definitely stay there again.

Very clean, I liked that we were right in the middle of the action in Times Square. Walking distance from the shows. 1 block from Walgreens drug store which I needed. The restaurant was convenient until we found others in the neighborhood.

My wife and I visit New York every year. We have always stayed at this hotel. From our first visit four years ago, the experience has always been an enjoyable one. The front desk personnel, Ms. Victoria Martin, in particular, welcomed us as family, not as hotel guests. Any adjustments with our accommodations were met with ease and professionalism unlike any place we've stayed in previously. The hotel restaurant more than exceeds the standards set by any hotels' requirements to satisfy their guests. Our favorite server was Ms. Christine. She was full of life and made the dining experience exceptional every time we sat down to eat there. I recall her incredible poise and professionalism when dealing with a "guest from hell", in my opinion. The bartender served tasty adult beverages and offered suggstions for sightseeing. In conclusion, the entire staff at the Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan deserves a round of applause for their enormous efforts in making our trip a successful one. Thanks a million!

Loved the service in the Brasserie 1605- Ari went above and beyond to serve us. Service was excellent by all staff here- enjoyed the hotel and, by the way, best location in Times Square you can get! Bermuda
user_name:
Sean and Tracy D
Oakville, Canada

review_body: We spent more than we needed to, but we wanted to stay right on Broadway and in Times Square. It was worth every penny for the convenience and the experience. We never had to catch a cab or subway because you are close to everything in walking distance. The rooms are nice and clean and we had a view of the Hudson river. We were on a very high floor.

Our stay could not have been better. Antonio at the front desk took care of everything, any question, any request! The restaurant and bar staff were friendly and the service was great. Location could not be more convenient, within steps of every theater. The concierge gave great advise about shopping, places to go in Brooklyn, etc. we go to the city several times a year and this is where we will stay. We're IGH members and the perks were so worthwhile, free resort free, late checkout. Comfortable beds and quiet rooms made for a relaxing stay. Going back soon!!

We stayed here for a whole week for a family vacation and I couldn't ask for a better hotel or location! It is right in the heart of Times Square and one block away from the Big Bus Tour stops and main office. It was also very conveniently located near many restaurants and attractions. The hotel itself is very nice, modern and upscale. It also has a nice restaurant and bar/ lounge. So, if Times Square, location and easy access to everything is what you seek, look no further.

Amazing service from the front desk, always were helpful in everything, from guiding us to all the way trying to accommodate. Hats off to Mr. Imran Khan. He was so nice I decided to post his photo. Rest of the hotel can be viewed at their website.

First time and definitely last one.Charges excessively in addition to your room rate.Make sure ask if your room has a mini refrigerator or not, Believe it or not, for $300/night, no slipper and you need to pay for refrigerator (or at least is my room)

From the baggage handlers to the front desk employees, we were pleased with the service. Sandra Esp. was amazing with her tips for a great vacation. My son was impressed with the shopping at ground level. I can't foresee any changes in the service and offerings, but will add an addendum if necessary.

Stayed here for 4 nights. Excellent experience. I had issues with the sink, the staff was very co-operative along with Antony, he helped me face issues that I was facing. Very friendly, they've good breakfast. Worth the visit.

Great hotel from the time we checked in Victoria Hajar was so helpful and provide great information about the hotel and location. Great Breakfast buffet nice overlooking Time Square - would for sure stay here again each time we come to NYC. Loved It!!!

Breakfast each morning was wonderful! The wait staff was mostly pleasant, but Marchelle and Tofael were superb! Very attentive with pleasing demeanors. It is a great way to start out your day with a a delicious breakfast and wonderful and warm hospitable service!

Stayed here for a conference in this hotel. Still such a great location right in the middle of it all. Room was nice on the 42 floor and great service. I was able to quickly get to the conference on the lobby level from my room. Times Square is right out the door.

Visited NYC in 2016 and stayed for 5 night at the Crowne Plaza. The hotel was modern, clean and perfectly situated.Can't find any complaints about the hotel. Would recommend.We got free vouchers for the bar, which was great. however never used the restaurant.

The hotel is ideally placed for Times Square. The rooms are spacious, the breakfast is good, even if a bit overpriced for what it is. The gym is a chain so I was disappointing how full it gets on any day of the week.My minor complaint is that I had some decoration issues - worn out bed cover, plain bathroom. For the price and the fact the room was "modern, newly decorated" I would expect the room to be spotless.In any case - overall great expiriance. Dinner at the bar is good for a rainy day when you can't get out much

Great Location, In-fact Incredible location and views over Time Square!The staff are always so busy though the service is not as good as a normal Crowne Plaza. Cabs on rolling demand outside its entrance is very handy but you are far better to walk round NYC!

The hotel is beautiful with great views and is right next to the all the stores in Times Square....what could be wrong with that? Well, if you don't like leaving your hotel and joining in massive crowds then this is not the place for you. Times Square has lost it's charm and is filled with "characters" with their heads off and "painted" ladies naked from the waist up as well as masses of people. So, if you struggle with a bad leg, or do not like fighting crowds when you leave your room then this hotel is not for you.
