With that said the hotel was nice, the staff super nice, and it is close to all the shows, If you don't mind busy, this place is great for people watching.

We have been with the family to celebrate New Year's Eve, and to be able to appreciate the most anticipated event of the year the countdown to the time square, the hotel has an exclusive space for their client and it was one of the most beautiful experiences to be done once in a lifetime!!!

My room on the 18th floor was clean, comfortable and offered an excellent view of Times Square. The accessible bathroom was large and the shower was easy to step into. All the hotel staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful. The elevators were set up in a very efficient way to move people quickly to their floors. The location of this hotel is Prime!!! It is right in the heart of Broadway and Times Square. I would definitely stay here again on future trips!!

This extremely kind woman gave us all the help we needed and more. We wanted to stay more days in the hotel and she managed to get us a reservation on the spot and gave us a great deal, she also explained to us all of the benefits that the crowne plaza have and more. We are very happy with the service she provided for us and thanks to her excellent service we could stay another day to watch the great play of Anastasia. We will definitely choose the Crowne Plaza at Times Square over any other hotel thanks to this wonderful lady. Thank you Sandra Esp. Greetings. Mr. Ocanas

Hotel was wonderful!. Room had a great view of Times Sq.Great location to catch subways to enjoy the sights of NYC. We enjoyed daily a wonderful breakfast at the hotel. Greeted by a wonderful hostess daily. Our server on day one was named Travis. He went above and beyond in making our visit enjoyable. He was very attentative and gracious. Travis, also assisted us with great information on how to connect with the various trains to visit the museums. That valuable information eased a lot of guess work on how to navigate in such a large city. Over all great experience.

We had Times Square view, excellent location if you don't mind the crowd walking outside the hotel. Inside the hotel is relaxing, we got complimentary drinks. The room was so spacious and clean. You can sleep on comfortable beds and pillows after a long day walking. Room temperature was cool, the bathroom with ample space, hot and cold water available. There's an indoor pool, lifeguard was friendly and helpful. All staff from front desk to custodians were friendly and professional. Family friendly. Subway train around the block, lots of restaurants outside door steps, Rockefeller and 5th avenue less than 5 min. walk. I loved crown plaza at Times Square, I would definitely stay again. Very safe place to stay.

This was a late deal we booked just a week before we travelled and it didn't disappoint.The Crown Plaza is right on Times Square and at the heart of Broadway an excellent location to visit all that Manhattan and New York City have to offer. Quite a large hotel but by no means the largest, with all the amenities you would expect of this calibre of hotel, leisure and Spa facilities available. All the staff we encountered were polite and very helpful in particular the maintenance, housekeeping and reception staff we dealt with. Even though are booking was very last minute we had a choice of rooms on arrival and the one we chose was superb. A corner room on the 35th floor with views of Time Square and across to the Hudson River. The check out was excellent with a luggage store available and a hotel transfer to JFK in their own cars extremely well priced. Overall a superb stay, I would highly recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone visiting New York.

Don't buy any kind of attraction ticket through the concierge- they don't tell you the important things, like- it's not a ticket, it's only a paper and you need to go to the main office and replace it by a voucher, and then replace it for a ticket.. We bought 2 tickets from the concierge in Crown Plaza hotel (Time Square NY) for 3 days, "5" track plans, and it supposed to include 3 attractions: a ferry to Statue Of Liberty, The Top of The Rock Building and the NY Museum. Only after we paid about 220$$$, we were told to go to GreyLine main office and replace the paper in a voucher.. in every Hop-on-Hop-off we were asked to give a tip to the driver and the guide, the wether was foggy so they cancelled the ferry to the Statue of Liberty, the 5th track plan was not connected to the others so we couldn't use it, there was a traffic every day all days, so we got to "enjoy" the bus only 3 times (it's faster walking), at the Top of The Rock we were told that the foggy wether is not good to see the city, and that we should wait at the (2hours) line to convert the vouchers to tickets, and than wait at the line again to get in.. the concierge at the hotel don't tell you that.. -they probably get commissions for selling..We turned to the concierge, they told us we should turn to GreyLine company, and I was promised by Antonia (by email) we will get a partly refund.. a 1.5 month after she broke her promise.. we get there are things no one has control on, BUT!!! We don't accept a bad service, a deception and a broken promise.. All I can do now is to worn you not to trust those companies..BTW- the GreyLine company is the activator for City Site Seeing NY.. we wanted to enjoy our 1st time visiting in NY, and Crown Plaza hotel & GrayLine company had ruined that for us..

Stayed here between June 15 - 23 2017. Cannot rate this hotel highly enough, my husband and I had a fab experience. Wonderful knowledgeable staff, location fab, cleanliness fab, and oh what a comfy bed!! It was a pleasure to jump into bed after a day's activity and slept so soundly. Housekeeping did a marvelous job, they work really hard. Big up to Nile (MD) for being so warm and welcoming and helpful in dealing with a couple of requests so promptly, really appreciated that. We were sorry to leave and would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

This is a really nice hotel, right on Times Square. Our room was on the 36th floor, overlooking Times Square.....high enough to not be bothered too much by all the night noise on the Square. We were members of IHG, which gave us free WiFi. This hotel is higher priced, but is a really great location for touring around Midtown NYC, and attending Broadway plays. There are quite a few varied restaurants around, as well as those inside the hotel itself. The hotel also provided (for a reasonable charge) SUVs to take us to the airport.

From the moment we checked in until we left we had amazing service. Rhonda, at the front desk, welcomed us so graciously! Nicely appointed room. Fantastic bar and food. We had a couple of nice evenings in there with drinks and really good bar food. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious! The buffet was simply outstanding. Perfect location. Close to everything. Cannot wait to go back!

Superbly located SMACK in the middle of NYC!!Rooms were fab.Wife and kids loved it.Busy but with character.Food good.Service better.Location best!!Would I go back.If you'll permit me an Americanism, HELL YEAH!!

Our room was wonderful. It was clean, roomy and great view. The lovely woman at the check in counter, Victoria Martin made our stay so pleasant. She was funny, interested, engaging and so helpful to us. Hope to see her again.

Checked 5 of us into 2 rooms on the 15th June for 6 nights. We have been looked after very well I cannot fault the cleanliness of our rooms, and after asking for a change of bed linen, was soon taken care of. Little coffee shop open early every morning did lovely breakfast items, and lovely cups of tea. There is also a little shop on lower level for fresh milk snacks and many other needs. Taxis can be booked if for 5 or more the day before, and for 3/4 usually outside.

This hotel opens onto to Times Square. The front desk staff were friendly and when I wanted to swap my method of payment from one credit card to another they were very helpful and got the process going soon enough. The check in and check out was hassle free and quick. We had requested for a room facing Times square - however that did not happen - may be due to the memorial day weekend. Request for an ironing board in lieu of a non-working one in the room were immediately attended to.Helpful and friendly staff.

Good hotel larger than average rooms well situated just on the edge of times square but there where it ends im a platinum elite member and besides quicker check in gave me no extra benefits just a waste of time being loyal to ihg rewards

I honestly can not say enough good things about this hotel! My husband and I LOVE staying at the Crowne Plaza while in New York, we have been visiting the city for "17" years and will not stay anywhere else. From the moment you walk in you're greeted with a smile, whether it be the bell hop, security, front desk, management or the sweet guy at the Grind and Go you will feel welcomed. Whether you're having breakfast in the restaurant or an appetizer at the bar the food and service is always great! Rodney and Karim are excellent leaders and work hard to make sure each and every guest are happy and receives top service. We are excitedly awaiting our next visit!

If you want to stay at a hotel that is in a central location this is the place to be. You can walk to a lot of attractions along with having a subway station that is around the corner. The view was great from the room. We could see the Empire State Building and look right down on Times Square from our room. The room was clean and very comfortable. We slept great. The staff was pleasant and very helpful in answering questions.

Super friendly service! Thanks to Tofael! Fresh fruit, awesome.e pastries. Great eggs. Wonderful lox! Good coffee. Amazing juice assortment. Oatmeal with all the fixings! Super ambience. Nice tableware.

I had a great time, the people at the hotel were very nice and helpful, especially Ana at the hotel restaurant, and Sandra at the front desk. They were both great and they took the extra step to make our vacation wonderful.

Stayed 3 nights with family. The only advantage of staying there is you get to stay very close to Times Square. Double beds are smaller than usual, small room. Very old bathroom with small bath tub. After shower, the bathroom is in a mess with lots of water on the floor. They provide you with two disposable cups at the basin, yikes! Breakfast choice was disappointing at best with hit and miss service. Ambience of Brasserie 1605 restaurant where breakfast is served is average. WiFi was slow and often disconnect me. Overall just feel like staying in a cheap motel. I do not recommend at all. Find another hotel if you must stay near Times Square.

I am giving Crowe Plaza Manhattan a 3 star based on my July 2011 stay. This would have been the 5th time I stayed here. There were a number of pros and cons with my stay. Firstly I was a Priority Club Platinum Member (now IHG Rewards Club Platinum Member) and had made a Rewards Night booking for 4 nights using my points. My room was good and there weren't any major problems. Bed was comfortable and there was good Keurig coffee. Despite the Brasserie being closed for renovations during that time, there was a makeshift area in one of the conference rooms where a complimentary buffet breakfast was served. I was informed that I could avail of this as I was a Priority Club Platinum Member. The breakfast consisted of small items such as muffins, croissants and cold cuts. Unfortunately this good service was marred by the attitude of the check out staff. Before staying I was aware of the policy that Crowne Plaza offers free local telephone calls to Platinum Members. I also was told that they didn't charge for toll-free (1-800) numbers. I made a total of 5 toll-free calls and 3 local calls. On check out the gentleman who dealt with me told me that the balance I owed was $30. I explained that the calls I made were not supposed to be charged as per policy, and he rudely told me that "it did not matter - any phonecall toll-free or local has to be paid for by any guest". I stood my ground with my argument and knew what my entitlements were as a Platinum Member. Eventually he waived the fee but not without a fuss. Another problem that I encountered was the rude attitude of the Business Center staff. Overall the guy operating it seemed lazy. I went down to the Business Center and there was no one present for 35 minutes. As I needed to use the internet to send an important e-mail that was work-related, I proceeded to one of the terminals and use the internet. There was no sign saying that guests had to pay to use internet facilities. From experience I have stayed at numerous other Crowne Plaza hotels, both within and outside the US, and I never had to pay to use the internet there. In fact the majority of business centers were unmanned. Nonetheless, about 15 minutes later, a staff member of Egyptian origin came to me and started rebuking and shouting at me. He said that it didn't matter how long he was away - I shouldn't have used the internet. I argued that there was no sign or anything up. I also tried contacting front desk but to no avail. I then presumed it was an unmanned business center - as with previous IHG hotels I have stayed.A bit disappointed about these problems, and it will probably be a while before I stay here in the near future.

First visit to NYC and couldn't have picked a better location. We were on floor 29 with view of the square and was not disturbed by the 24 hour constant buzz of traffic and people - too high up! The general cleanliness of the room was good but some attention to detail had been missed for some time...... lamps, back of TV, corners of room- thick in dustWe stayed during an extremely hot period and was disappointed that there was no refrigerator available in the room. No ,after, as there was ice making machines on each floor, we used room waste paper basket line and the ice bucket provided to fill with ice and keep bottled water cold and milk for our morning cuppa! Unfortunately the ice machine on our floor was out of order for the whole 5 days we were there, for which the hotel apologised for. We had to go up and down floors on a two e daily basis to get ice. Our flights didn't leave JFK UNTIL 10pm on our last day so we asked for late checkout. A little odd that we couldn't have confirmation of this until the very last morning of our stay - hotel reception said wouldn't know room requirements until on the day? Anyway, they kindly did give us an extended room stay until 5pm which was great and meant we could enjoy our last day out in the city, back to pack, shower and relax.

Stayed two nights using my reward points. Right in the middle of Times Square, can't beat the location. Loved being able to watch a Broadway show in the evening and just stroll back to hotel afterward. The room was pretty good size for a city hotel. We were upgraded to a room facing Times Square. The room seemed clean. Only minor complaint was the plumbing - slow draining bath tub and drippy sink. Being platinum members, we were given coupons to the continental breakfast buffets at $10 each. That was a pretty good deal since regular price is around $25 each. The buffet was pretty good. We were so full, we saved money by skipping lunch.

Stayed here during February and was really impressed with service and rooms. Though some reviews mentioned that the rooms were a bit dated, I feel like the room was just right. We booked two rooms with Times Square views and they both were pretty good. The breakfast buffet also was worth the addition of money as there were good selections for a hotel in America, though they could've changed it up a little each day. But the best part was the location, as you are extremely close to the center of Times Square.

Came to visit New York for my birthday and decided to stay here at the Crowne Plaza. Vanessa at front desk, an exceptional young woman and exceptional representation of IHG standards helped check me in early with no problem and made my stay even better with breakfast buffet vouchers for my birthday! I would recommend anyone to this hotel!

The Crowne Plaza at Times Square is the place you´re looking for when visiting Manhattan for the first time. Steps away from one of the most known touristic sites, it makes the hotel come in handy if you want to short-walk everywhere. As for the breakfast, it´s delicious and plenty of choices are served every day.

As always...this Crown Plaza Times Square exceeded our expectations.Very clean, very beautiful and spacious rooms.The FD personnel were very friendly and very accommodating....With special mention for Antonio.He gave us a very nice room with view.When you come and visit this hotelLook for Antonio...He will make your stay enjoyable andVery memorable.Thank you again Antonio for you Excellent hospitality
the lady sandra esp, was very very nice!!!!we are very grateful with her, because we received a lot of help for everything was ready in our reservaciónThe hotel very well locatedAll perfectThanks!

My husband and daughter know how much I love Stevie Nicks and Fleetwood Mac so they surprised me with tickets to Fleetwood Mac playing at Madison Square Garden in October and we stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Times square. The hotel was located in the best place if you want a taste of what Times Square is really about. The staff is great and the rooms are very comfortable. We stayed for a week and I must say, When we go back, we will stay at the Crowne Plaza.

My experience was awesome. My initial contact at the front desk with Edith was great. She was super friendly. My room was ready to check into as soon as we arrived. Our room had a fantastic view. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job. We had the breakfast buffet. I must say it was one of the best buffets I've ever had. The food was hot and fresh. My server's name was Tofael. He was absolutely great. He was genuinely kind, and spoke very highly of the hotel and the General Manager. Ali was our server the second day. He did not disappoint. He also was very friendly and answered all of our questions about the city. I also the Concierge service to research a Broadway Play. Joanne was a gem. She was patient and she took her time to help me find a play that great and within our budget. In a day an age true customer service seems to be a lost art. The team at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan have great vision and leadership. They seem genuinely concerned about guest satisfaction. I would stay at hotel again and again.

This is the second time I have stayed here and would definitely stay again. Friendly helpful staff combined with a great location make this an ideal stay. On both occasions we walked the short distance to Broadway shows. While the rooms are good size for New York, and the beds were comfortable although I have to agree with some of the other reviews that the headboards need update and or repair.

This trip was to celebrate my Daughter's 18th birthday and this was my Mum's first time to New York. The Hotel location was perfect, the facilites were fantastic and the staff were so friendly and helpful. A special mention must be given to Antonio who works on the front desk as he went above and beyond to ensure that we all had a really special holiday celebration and experience at the Hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The breakfast was buffet style and had a good selection and the general atmoshere in the bar area was relaxing and peaceful. Highly recommended for a family or couples stay. Great gym facility too.

We stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate an 18th birthday.Check in was fairly smooth on arrival. We were in a Times Square view room on 39th floor and the view was okay and fairly quiet considering where we were. The beds were comfortable but the rooms are fairly tired and in need of redecoration the headboards were all very worn! We ate here for breakfast once and only once due to the price and the service. Nothing was explained to us on how breakfast worked, all we were asked was whether we had any vouchers. At $26.00 for a continental breakfast we consider this to be way overpriced. You are better off going to one of the local diners that are in abundance. We didn't consider this to be a four star hotel.

We decided to walk from Penn station to our hotel in times sq. its only a 15 minute walk ... not when youre in NYC. 3 girls 6 items of luggage and Times square make for a lot of fun. Never have i been so glad to see my hotel. and what a location. right above the hershy store and across the road from M&M world you really couldnt go wrong with this location.We arrived to be checked in by Freddie. Seemed pleasant enough. We then make our way to room 1 of 3. That night. We got to our room and as big and roomy as it was, the headboards were worn down, looking like what i could only explain as been eaten. (let your imagination run wild) so we went to ask to move rooms. The next two rooms we went to were exactly the same. was no one listening to us? Freddie told us to speak to Pablo tomorrow morning. So our first night in NYC and we couldnt unpack or get out and see the city because we were moving rooms. The next morning we got up and went to find pablo. he wasnt in yet. Great. There had been a note left about us so the girl on the desk told us our luggage would be moved rooms while were out. we didnt want to waste a day in new york in a hotel. we asked for a guarantee that the room would be up to standards. This was given. We arrive back later that day to collect our new room key, and yet again the room was exactly the same. why was no one listening or going to look at the rooms???? i went down again and asked for Pablo. He listened and gave us another room and he himself came with us to see if this room was okay. AND IT WAS!!! why couldnt this have been done the previous night? why did we have to wait for a manager to sort us out? Pablo also gave us 2 mornings free breakfast for all the trouble and he really turned the whole experience around for us.Crowne plaza is a great hotel. It just needs the finer details tweeked.

We requested a room on a higher floor and our request was met. We had a room on the 29th floor with an amazing view. Our room came with free access to the breakfast buffet every morning downstairs and the food was amazing, with several options to choose from + if you didn't find what you wanted in the buffet, you could tell a waiter and they'd have the chefs cook it up for you without any charge. The staff was honestly so helpful and friendly. TRAVIS WAS GREAT! Travis greeted us with fresh orange juice and tea every morning, and went above and beyond his duties for us. My mother and I were on vacation seeing the city for the first time and were still slightly unsure about how to get places. Travis every morning asked us where we wanted to go that day and pulled out a subway map and showed us exactly how to get there and gave us some cool details about things that most tourists would miss. He seriously helped to shape our trip into such an amazing experience and we'll never forget him for that. Bless him!

We stayed here for a weekend and it really was the perfect location to view all that New York has to offer! The room was lovely, and we had the most amazing view of Times Square (49th Floor).The staff were really friendly, specifically the reception and bar staff. We did not eat here except for some bagels from the coffee place - these were great.Would definitely recommend!

This hotel was brilliant! It was in a perfect location for us to go exploring NYC. I'm sure there was still plenty we missed, but it was amazing to be staying right in Times Square - wow! We were in walking distance to many of the attractions we planned to see - a show on Broadway, an Ice Hockey game at Madison Square Garden. There were always plenty of people around, but it was never TOO busy either. All of the staff we encountered at the hotel were fantastic; very polite and accommodating. Our room was on the 42nd (if I remember rightly) floor, so it was quite a trip up in the lift/elevator. We did notice other guests, but the lifts were never incredibly busy, it was a very calm and relaxing atmosphere in the hotel.The room was a great size; wonderful shower and toilet facilities and the view was surreal! Very strange to realise we were that high up above the ground - although it certainly helped drown out any passing cars and street noise. We ordered room service during our stay and were very impressed with the quality and time it took for it to arrive. Delicious food, definitely what we needed after a long day of travelling round the city! There was also a small cafe/delicatessen in the lobby of the hotel which we didn't use but seemed popular. We should have tried the chocolate cake, it tempted us every day!We seemed to have perfectly timed with the Christmas season. The hotel still had its Christmas decorations up - the tree was amazing! However, they started taking them down on the day we departed. We had a really fantastic trip, the hotel certainly contributed to that!
user_name:
Rosie D
West Midlands, United Kingdom

review_body: At the north end of Time Square there could not be a location much closer to the landmark.Good hotel, with about average to above average condition and accommodations.Betty was fantastic in reservations and I have to say that Jason in the lobby bar was friendly, helpful, efficient, and all around nice.Everything in Manhattan has some age for the most part and this Crown Plaza is on the better side of most that I have experienced. Rooms were much quieter than I expected buffering outside noise. Our next door neighbor were busy socializing late on Friday and Saturday night so hallway and next door noise was typical for Manhattan but not particularly welcome.Room is modern and mostly comfortable with double beds rather than 2 queens which seems small when we have a king size at home.No refrigerator in the room so creativity with keeping drinks and food cold with ice was challenging.Ice maker on our floor and the one above were not working.Did not meet anyone on the staff that wasn't friendly and helpful when needed. I feel like this is possibly one of the best values for the location.

What can I say I stayed here before and thought it was great.So I booked my daughters honey moon here from 5thJune To 10th June 2017 the Hotel this Hotel was Fantastic they upgraded there room gave them Free drinks at Bar and a couple of Free Breakfasts .All complementary how great was that I can only give them 20 out of 10 .Thanks you Crowne Plaza Times Square to all your Staff for making this sutch a special week for my Daughter and Husband . I will always recommend your Hotel ,and will be back myself in future .Thanks againRegardsMike Martin UK

The location of the Crowne Plaza is excellent -- right in the heart of Times Square and the Theater District. We were easily able to walk to numerous restaurants, plays, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, etc.The staff was outstanding, in particular Travis, who took care of us at breakfast, Felipe, who took care of us in the bar, and Victoria, who was excellent behind the front desk.
user_name:
Soccerjell
St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands

review_body: Stayed here for 4 days in April. It is a nice hotel in a central location in NY. The only negatives that we had were:1. No fridge in room.2. Food in the bar was a little disappointing.3. Breakfast really expensive - we ate elsewhere.4. Took a large payment as a deposit without informing us.5. Noise from the streets below but this was expected and not an issue.The gym was excellent, the view of the Hudson was good and the staff were helpful. Pleasant stay. Would recommend.

My title describes the best thing about this hotel namely the free wifi.The location is not good unless you want to be in an area of New York which is now sadly,brash and seedy. You will be pestered by touts selling bus tickets and Disney figures wanting photos and in the evening they now have topless woman dressed in g strings and body paint for souvenir photos and big tip,of course! I arrived here as part of a tour and had to wait 90minutes for our luggage to be delivered to the room. The rooms are a good size with comfortable beds. Breakfast very expensive at 32 US dollars but there are a few places nearby where you can get breakfast at a fraction of the costThere are plenty of fast food places but if you want something more decent try 8th or 9th Avenue where you will find individual restaurants at reasonable prices.Prices are extremely high in the shops and I priced quite a few items, e.g. Tom Ford perfume which is considerably cheaper in the UK. Save your money and boost the UK economy.It is 20 years since I visited New York and It has changed, sadly, not for the better.

Wonderful time in Crowne Plaza,lovely hotel,Very clean had a two bedroom,plenty space for a three adults,big bathroom towels changed every day,beds changed every day comfy beds and very helpful staff.Nice bar, didn't try their restaurant quick lifts five in all.We were on 34th floor with Hudson River view very little noice at nightRight on Times Square, restaurants,shows and subways very close.Would stay again

We had a little trouble finding the Parking Entrance but once we did all was well. The front desk staff was terrific. Concierge Alex was most helpful and Tony and Abraham at the Bell Desk were so helpful!!! Their assistance was very much appreciated. We had a nice room overlooking the Hudson River. Only downside was you had to pay extra for a refrigerator. There was no Microwave either.

Beautiful hotel in the best location. Staff were always so friendly and felt the hotel was a home from home. The hotel is walking distance of everything and out of the 5 days there we only had to use a bus once and that was for our open top tour. The rooms were the perfect size and cosy after a long day walking round the city. We can't wait to come back again in the Spring next year and would always choose this hotel

The Hotel is great and definitely started with Michelle checking us in. She was very friendly and helpful, Top notch! I would recommend this to anyone that is staying in Time Square!!! So much going on and so much to do with all of the hustle and bustle, Michelle took her time and treated us like royalty.

This hotel is in a great location just north a block from Times Square. The staff is very helpful even when the housekeeper forgot to refill our cups, they brought them straight up when I called. Even though it is an older property they keep it up pretty well. There are lots of groups in and out so the registration can get busy but they handle the traffic nicely. I didn't like being so close to the elevator because it "bings" every time it came to our floor. I'll remember that for next time.

Just spent a few nights at this hotel on Times Square. We had a king room with a view of the square. There was just one hiccup when they tried to charge for breakfast which had already been paid for. The breakfasts were good. The hotel and location very excellent and easy to get about from there. The food in the evenings was good too. The bed was so comfortable.

Wow!! This hotel is in the heart of New York, there is no better location than Times Square! The rooms are lovey and contain everything you need. My only slight complaint was the shower, it was extremely hard to get the temperature right, it was either freezing cold or boiling hot! But all in all this is a great hotel! Highly recommended and I will be returning!

We stayed at Crowne in May 2017. The room was a modern corner room located on the 26th floor, so we had mega views.The location was PERFECT, central to everything.This may sound trivial, but the little touches are often the best, the pillows were amazing, so comfy and the magnified make up mirror was sensational. In fact, when I got home, I purchased one.I would highly recommend Crowne to anyone.

Such a classy and stylish hotel, with all the amenities you need. The staff were superb and extremely helpful to me and my family when we stayed for a week over the easter holidays earlier in 2017. Can't beat it for price, location and staff helpfullness.

We stayed here for 7 nights for my 50th birthday. It was our first time in New York and we really enjoyed it. We were given a lovely spacious corner room on the 41st floor which had fabulous views from two huge windows up Broadway on one side and down Times Square on the other. That was a nice surprise! The room was right outside the lifts though so I was initially concerned about noise but actually we were hardly disturbed apart from the odd loud group waiting for lifts. We could hear sirens from the street now and then (which was quite amusing as it's part of NYC!) but generally it was nice and quiet. The bed was fantastic - very comfortable and we slept well throughout our stay (but that might have been down to the miles of walking we did everyday!). The bathroom was a good size with decent toiletries although the shower was not that powerful. The room only had plastic cups for tea/coffee which was not what would be expected especially for a 4* hotel. They provided us with a kettle on request so we could make tea. There was no fridge in the room but we were told they would provide one if we wanted one. We also had bathrobes and one pair of slippers (the other pair never turned up!). The guest services were brilliant and happy to oblige requests! The wifi was also very good. The lifts were quick and efficient. We were even given a late checkout on our last day which was great! The hotel is in an excellent central location, it is easy to walk to many attractions and there are 3 subway stations very close by to get around to places further away. Broadway shows are right on the doorstep as is the half price ticket booth and we managed to catch a couple of great shows. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but there are plenty of eating options on the doorstep. The hotel has a coffee shop in the lobby which did reasonably priced warm bagels, muffins, coffee etc for breakfast.I was a little disappointed the hotel didn't do anything special for my 50th birthday but we had a good stay overall. It is a shame they insist on charging everyone a $30 daily service fee, even when you don't use the services. We weren't informed that this apparently entitled us to two free drinks on arrival (so we never had them!) and apart from using the wifi for a few mins each day to keep in contact with family we did not use the pool/facilities etc so it did seem rather expensive to have to pay a daily fee of $30 on top of the room rate (which wasn't cheap to start off with!) but we were aware of this charge before we got there so it wasn't a surprise. I guess it's what they charge you for a Times Square base. All in all a very good stay. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Good size room. Location is fantastic, right in times square and nice smell of Hershey chocolate everytime I head back to the hotel. Don't like the elevator set up (different elevator going to different floor). I found the $350/night a bit steep though.

Great location, super staff, and overall great hotel. I primarily stay in Crowne Plaza when I travel and this is one of the best managed properties I have visited. Will stay here again when I return to the city

Worst experience Bad service Unnecessarily expensive Not value for money Keep 100% tips ready on your tariff Staff are not willing to serve but only interested in tips You have much better properties available here on Times Square than this one

Visited New York in December for my 21st birthday with my partner. Hotel is in an amazing location, you walk out the front entrance and you're stood right in Times Square so it makes it really easy! The red city bus tours are basically right outside hotel (by M&M store) which you need to do! Apart from walking and cabs, it's your only other way of transport and getting around the city for attractions and shopping etc. The hotel was gorgeous and really enjoyed our stay, however the room was a little dated but the views make up for it! Would recommend this hotel :)

This trip was brief but we knew where to lodge. This property is on Broadway and very central to uptown and downtown Manhattan. The property is very safe. The staff is wonderful, as usual! We were able to speak to Al the security boss. That was another of the best things today was seeing him. We will be returning for New Years Eve. We rang in the 2015/2016 year there and it was a terrific time. See y'all soon!!!!

This hotel was a great find in NYC. We've stayed in many hotels in Manhattan but this one had great ambience with a very friendly staff.Special kudos to Michelle who checked us in and provided a sensational room on the 45th floor and a few perks since we are IHG members and I was celebrating my birthday. We also appreciated the service received from Rodney, the hotel manager, waitresses Michelle and Yasmine and bartender Keith. We had a fabulous weekend and we recommend this hotel highly.

We arrived at 8pm (2 hrs later than expected due to flight delay) and cleaner was still in room. room on 37th floor but had a terrible view. also window didn't fit perfectly in frame so could hear noise from traffic etc.lovely comfortable bed and nice bathroom. Great spacious room, plenty of cupboard / hanging spacewhen tried to talk to the manager re the above issues, he just gave us a free breakfast voucher without actually listening to any of our complaint. this was lovely - a great breakfast, but would have been nice to air our complaints.Breakfast at the hotel is extremely expensive.free wifi in rooms.The hotel is in Times Square so great location.

We are IHG Platinum Elite Rewards Members since 1988 stayed at the Crown Plaza soft opening in 1989/we reserved 3 reward nights at Crowne Plaza Times Square to celebrate our Anniversary. PERFECT hotel for a stay in NYC. Conveniently located within walking/distance Penn Plaza/Amtrak/Subway/Shopping/Restaurants and Theater District.We were pleased with every aspect of hotel & Team is one of the finest teams of friendly, knowledgeable, engaging & professionals we have encountered." First Class Experience"(fr check-in to check-out) If you are as fortunate & lucky to experience meeting the warm friendly & welcoming "Juliet Chang" Front Office Manager, you will remember her for a very long time, she has a amazing way of making you feel like very special guest and she is delighted to have met us. She surprised us on our first night with a special Anniversary Gift of Champagne & the most Deliciously Decadent Chocolate Cake delivered to our room. IHG Platinum Elite rewards members also receive (Discount Breakfast Coupons & Drink vouches) Our room was very spacious by NY standards- corner-end upper floor w/large windows(great panoramic picturesque view of Hudson River). well appointed accommodations-. My particular favorite was resting on the chaise lounge/ TV/ coffee maker/-The bed was so luscious & comfy (great for sleeping) large shower (YES!!)Definite plus a portable make-up mirror room safe & great wireless internet--Thank you Housekeeper Lucida for keeping our room smelling fresh & clean w/daily crisp linens & amenities. A special note of thank to Elizabeth for periodically checking-in with us to make sure our amenities/room service requests arrived timely & if we were enjoying our stay. Inviting Lobby Entrance/Registration Desk/Brasserie 1605 Restaurant (Breakfast/Lunch and Broadway 49 Bar/Drinks/Happy Hour/Apps and Dinner.) Compliments to Felipe, our server at the Broadway 49 Bar for suggestions & excellent timely service during our drinks/evening dining experiences especially during Happy Hour, always making sure our orders were timely & assuring us that we would make our evening Theater shows/plays. A special Thank You to Tofael our server at Brasserie 1605 for making our Breakfast experience exceptional-our omelets were perfectly prepared exactly as ordered (YUM!! Delicious!!!)Everything offered was freshly prepared-/fresh sliced fruits/breads/muffins/oatmeal/yogurt/condiments/& pastries- best tasting hot coffee!!Breakfast servers/attendants professionally keep the breakfast reception area well stocked/presented & extremely clean adding to our overall self serve cafeteria style breakfast dining experience. A special Thank You to Tofael & his manager, Agathe Texier, who totally surprised us on our last evening with a special Anniversary Gift of Champagne & the most Deliciously Decadent Chocolate Cake delivered to our room.. Make sure you stop & shop on premises at Grind & Company everything is fresh/delicious & great for snacks and on the go. The entire team provide outstanding service. Highly Recommend & already reserved our next NYC Mini Vacation at the Crowne Plaza:Times Square Manhattan Hotel.

Stayed here for 5 nights from May 29th. Absolutely perfect... Was ideally located for for everything that we wanted to see in the small time we we're there. Lots of major attractions are within walking distance of hotel. Those that aren't are just as easy to get to by subway. The weekly subway pass was a 'must' for just $33 as it took us everywhere. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Bar and restaurants were excellent for snacks and main meals. Overall would not stay anywhere else if we visit NYC again.

I have stayed in many hotels in NYC. While some are more luxurious, the Crowne Plaza is very comfortable and nicely appointed. The manager, Chris, is incredibly helpful and delightful to talk with. The hotel is so close to the theatres. I've now stayed here 5 times and it is my go-to hotel in NYC.
user_name:
retta96
New York City, New York

review_body: Large comfortable room on the 20th Floor. The main reason to review was to compliment the excellent service at breakfast by Travis, nothing was too much trouble, always on hand to refill drinks or bring more jam, honey etc., The concierge and bar staff were also very helpful. We thought being in such a busy area would disturb our sleep but our room was extremely quiet.

Premium location, right in the heart of Times square. Crowded area Clean and big room (double bed)The bathroom is goodReception is friendly and helpfulMuch of entertainment around the hotelGreat view from the room

We stayed in a corner room with a view of Times Square. We could also see the Empire State Building. We could walk to many attractions - Broadway shows, Times Square, and shopping. We had easy access to subway to go to Central Park, Staten Island Ferry, and Coney Island. Room was clean and comfortable with amazing views. Staff was helpful. Loved the express elevators to the top floors that skipped several floors.

Hotel is located in Times Square and perfect for exploring all the main sights. Rooms are quiet, spacious and well equipped. Toiletries topped up daily. Beds really comfortable. Shower was powerful. Hotel bar was pricey but very busy in the evening. Check in and check out was easy and straightforward. All staff we came in contact with were really friendly and helpful.Plenty of places to eat in surrounding area so did not make use of hotel restaurant so cannot comment on the food.If we return to New York will certainly stay at the Crowne Plaza.

I am not normally one to complain about hotels or airlines or write reviews but I literally made a tripadvisor account solely to express my terrible experience during my stay at Crowne Plaza Times Square. The only reason I needed to was because even after my complaints to the hotel, nothing was done to compensate me or to make my stay any more pleasant, especially considering I was there for 10 nights. - The hotel has no lobby or place to sit unless you are willing to pay for a drink or snacks at the bar because that's the only seating area there is. - We had to fetch our own cabs from busy Times Square because the bell boys would say "I'm too busy" or "go to the Times Square side it's quicker that way". - The staff were rude and unaccommodating - The escalators stopped working 3 out of the 10 days we were there - All 4 of our room keys stopped working and we were locked out of our room for no apparent reason- The air condition didn't work- The room constantly smelt like chlorine - Housekeeping twice failed to refresh our towels, hand towels and foot towels as well as failing to empty our rubbish bins - The housekeeping staff were extremely loud talking to each other right outside the room at odd hours when we were trying to sleep - The few times we tried to call concierge it would go to voicemail - The hotel didn't have scales to weigh our suitcases or scissors or anything else that we needed - Upon checkout we were not provided with a copy of our invoice confirmation that the hotel fee would be refunded onto our card, nor were we asked how our stay was. - Once we had checked out we tried to use the lobby bathroom and housekeeping refused to let us in because it was for "guests only" and we didn't have a key. Needless to say I am completely appalled by the service of the hotel and its staff and I will definitely be taking further action to try to seek compensation. I would never recommend anybody stay here in future.

The hotel was perfectly located right in the middle of everything on Broadway!! Timesquare was just a couple of blocks away. The M&M's world is right next door and Hersheys was literally right there, both stay open till midnight for that late night chocolate craving. The hotel itself was immaculate. The room was fantastic with a great view from the 39th floor. The bed was very comfy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you are driving in, valet parking is available for only $70 a night. Love this hotel and will return soon!

You could not get closer to the action of Times Square...this hotel is directly opposite M&M world and within walking distance of everything New York has to offer. The location was this hotels biggest attribute...the attentiveness of staff needs improving - I appreciate it's a busy hotel but that shouldn't mean service standards are lowered. Breakfast buffet is average at best as is the lunch / dinner. The bar was ok. The only reason to stay here is the location...nothing else.

Arrived here following a cruise on QM2. Settled in really well to our room on floor 42. Walked down and bought 2 tickets to a Broadway show. On walking to the theatre 100 yards away in Times Square my wife tripped on the kerb and managed to break both arms. The hotel could not have been more wonderful. Their first aiders quickly assessed the situation and called 911 for us. We spent most of the night in the Emergency Dept but on our return the night manager quickly organised a wheelchair and back we went to our room, extremely hungry. No problem, up came Marvin with a delicious yoghurt and fresh fruit as he felt we needed cheering up! Although we have spent three days locked in our room we have had regular calls to check we are OK and tonight was the crowing glory. After ordering room service, up came our server with a lovely bottle of French red wine and a cheeseboard which we have been supping all evening. So... A big thank you to you all for making our stay wonderful even though we have only seen New York through Room 42 window. Be assured we WILL return to your hotel to complete the trip.

Your concierge Corrine was the BEST! She gave us so so much information of things to do, maps, eating places, directions and we were so HAPPY she was there each day to visit, which we did. Actually got on the Stephen Colbert show and was asked to come up to talk to him which was a highlight of our trip. the rooms were clean and the beds so comfortable (great sheets) we were on the 45th floor overlooking Times Square and saw everything, very beautiful day and night. My husband is a Spire member so we got the upgrade. Lovely hotel and bar, food too. Can't wait to get back there again in the near future! Thanks Corrine!

Just returned from a very pleasant stay in the Crowne Plaza well positioned for day and evening activity in New York City whether it's shopping, Central Park or theatre entertainment. The hotel is modern clean and is staffed with an extremely helpful team be it reception, concierge or in the bar areas. Would highly recommend.

Absolutely always love staying here. The most cosy and warm feeling hotel in NYC. The beds are comfortable, decent size rooms with some of the best views of Manhattan. The staff are so generous and welcoming. Definitely recommend stay here. Best location for everything.

We had no complaints whatsoever about this hotel.The service throughout the property was friendly and courteous.The room was clean, comfortable and a nice size.There is a bar overlooking Broadway with great service.The concierge got us some dinner reservations.We would definitely stay here again.

We hadn't been to NYC for a while and looked at other options for price and location comparisons. Well we decided to return to the Crown Plaza because of the great location. We arrived early and were greeted like we were old friends that were missed and even was able to get us into our room right away. The room is nice and comfortable especially the bed and the pillows. The furniture and couch have seen their better days and probably should be replaced, looks like the same furniture from 10 years ago but not fresh looking.The subways are right there witching a couple of blocks depending on where you're going and very quiet. Another great visit to NYC with the help of the Crown Plaza.

It has been a few year's since we last stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square.As an IHG Spire Elite member, I have previously redeemed my points at this hotel, so had no hesitation in doing so again... how wrong was I?We booked two rooms for 3 nights for myself, my wife , daughter, son and future daughter in law who were on a month long visit to the UK from Australia, so I thought a weekend trip to NYC would be a treat.However, the hotel rooms are looking particularly tired in appearance ( room 4215 and particularly room 4217 ), no coffee machine in the stand, mini safe not working, dust and dirt behind the bedside unit and very tired bathroom with patched up tiles etc.As a Spire Elite member, I requested an upgrade to a room overlooking Times Square, which we had always had on previous visits, reception said " we have rooms with a city view", don't be fooled by this, very average.Restaurant staff were particularly unhelpful, eg when one of our party asked for directions to the rest room, the response was "outside!" I can't help thinking a little staff training wouldn't go amiss, all it needed was "turn left out of the restaurant, along the corridor and left again", too much to ask?In conclusion, I am very unlikely to uae this hotel again and what a waste of 300,000 hard earned IHG points on this hotel.

Hotel staff was very pleasant. The location for all our activities was perfect. Our roomwas very clean and ample size. No refrigerator in room. It did have a coffee machine.Bathroom was good size with one sink and shower. No complimentary breakfast butdid provide discount for breakfast bar.

I have stayed here MANY times. Can never go wrong with this location. Right next to the Hershey store and in Times Square. The rooms are clean with great views. I will continue to stay here every time I'm in NYC.

I was attending a conference the first weekend in May that was located at this particular hotel which was the primary reason I booked a room here. The day that I arrived it was cool and raining and I had gotten turned around a few times before arriving. Needless to say when I finally made it to the hotel I was exhausted; my clothes and luggage were wet too due to the rain. I wanted to get into my room as soon as I could to change clothes and I was met by one of the friendliest, most accommodating representatives that I can recall of in some time whose name was Sandra E. She was professional and very efficient at getting me checked in. I didn't have to wait and she had a room ready for me. Another staff member that I encountered who was courteous and helpful was Anthony R. I later had a question about my room and stay before checking out and I encountered Sandra again. She was just as sweet and obliging as she was at my check-in. I don't normally write reviews but because of this stellar service, I was committed to making my comments to give credit where credit was due.

Spent a week at CP Times Square. Easily accessible from GCS and is right in the heart of the action. Everything is central to this hotel, shows, restaurants, Central Park etc.Rooms were spacious with a great view..Front desk service and general staff were friendly and helpful

Amazing location right on times square / broadwayWe were given a corner room for our three day stay which had great views up and down broadway and Times Square... Food and drink in hotel not too crazy when compared to other bars and restaurants close by.Easy access to theatres and other world renowned landmarks

Mother's Day Weekend 2017 in Manhattan, what a Joyful Time! First, the staff at Check In were efficient and professional and friendly. Our Bellman brought our bags up in no time flat, even suggested where we could have a great meal. Our Room on the 18th Floor was beautiful with Neutral Colors with Traditional decor ( a little wear and tear on the Head boards). A great view of Time Square and the window opened about 3 inches (pop out). What a Beautiful Hotel. Easy access from both sides 49th and Broadway.  Rodney Booji Food & Beverage Mgr was a delight to talk with while having drinks at the hotel's bar. He was helpful in suggesting drinks and appetizer and places to visit while in Manhattan. In 2010 December I stayed at the Crown Plaza (23rd Floor) to attend the Fela Kuti Play at the Eugene O'Neil Theatre three doors down (on 49th), I was so impressed then that I returned to the hotel and received the same Wonderful Service and Experience. My suggestion is to reserve a room on the Time Square side and up as high as possible.

Very nice room with view of Hudson River. Quiet despite being in Times Square! Check in staff, Victoria and Hajar, were great and made us feel welcome. If in the area I would recomend this hotel. Very convenient for restaurants and Broadway Shows as well as excursions on Hudson River.
user_name:
QueenBess1
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Crown Plaza in Times Square in May for our Anniversary. We checked in with a lovely woman named Edith. She was so sweet and accommodating. We mentioned to her that is was our 16th wedding anniversary and she upgraded us to the Presidential Suite and gave us vouchers for drinks. She is amazing. The hotel room was beautiful and clean. The service was incredible. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in NYC.

Hotel is in a great location but that's about all the positive this hotel has. Front desk take over 15minutes to answer. No apologies. No phone calls returned even when requested. Room sleeps 4 and 2 towels provided on day 2. Waited forever to get bath towels sent to the room. Electrics in the room just about work. Had to 'fix' the bedside lamp ourselves. Safe does not work. Room can be sound proof if the windows don't leave a gap when shut to let in noise from Times Square. Ordered room service for dinner last night and flimsy take away containers provided with no plates etc. Worse than a cheap take out place. Service is very very bad!!

Stayed here early May for 5 nights with my sister. First impressions on pulling up were good - we wanted a central location and this place is great for that, close to lots of shopping, parks, theatres and easy Subway access. Staff were really lovely and friendly. Thing which let the place down was the tired, shabby look of our room - thinks we're chipped, peeling away, cracked, rusty. Our window wouldn't shut either so had to dial down for someone to come fix for us. View from our floor out towards the Hudson was lovely and the shower was really good - nice and powerful. No way is this 4 star though - check my pictures for proof of my gripes.

My cousin was visiting New York for the first time and I recommended that they stay at the Crown Plaza Times Square. It is located in the heart of Times Square with access to just about everything.Plus the service is wonderful. Working with Danielle Baruch who is the Global Sales for IHG and Pooja Pendse who is the Senior Sales Manager is always a pleasure. Excellent meeting space is a plus for me as I am in the Meetings and Events Industry. The entire staff made my cousin's first visit to New York memorable.. Thank YOU.

Excellent location, bathrooms in hotel room are lovely and clean, rooms itself large enough and clean, although carpet and windows slightly dated. Perfect for a place to sleep at night- beds were really comfy.

Great hotel, perfect location. Room was spacious, clean and the bed was oh so comfortable. A couple of things for information only. The Hotel charges a $30 per night surcharge for WiFi, use of pool and 2 drinks (first night only) . The pool is more for sport than relaxing and you are required to wear a swim cap to use it. We loved the place and would definitely return

I enjoyed it hence why id like to write a review. rooms comfy, views nice, good staff.It was not bad at all for the price, i would go again.I liked that the food was fresh in the morning, juices were nice too. And staff again very nice.

Convenience to Broadway Shows and the sites around Times Square are compelling reasons to stay here. If you have ever been to a Broadway Show or Radio City Music Hall& then tried to get a Taxi, especially if it's raining, you'll love the convenience of this hotel. I stretched to call this 4-star, would really place it 3.5+Good News:  - Convenient, reasonable value for Times Square.  - High floors are very quiet, you won't hear much street noise - In-room safe & coffee maker - Like the Hotel's convenient, covered taxi / drop off area running between W. 48th & 49th Street. Tips:  - If you are an IHG Club member, the $10. breakfast coupons are a great value - "Brasserie 1605: has excellent lunch specials daily. Great value for $16.05Not-so-good news: - Rooms are fairly small & lighting is marginal - Could use better maintenance. Example: our bathroom mirror was chipped in several places Service: - Overall friendly & helpful

This hotel met all of our needs and it is located among everything! Once you walk out the front door you can go left, and in just a few blocks, you are in Central Park! If you go right, you are right in the middle of Times Square! Our room was high above the night life, the room was very quiet at night. The hotel service was above par! Excellent food and drinks in the lounge as well as an excellent view, too. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Good, clean busy location.. perfect for those wanting to experience the location proximity to Times Square.. bit hectic as soon as you exit the hotel though.. loads of street noise .. taxis tooting horns etc..Great bar/lounge area for drinks and snacks ..

Everything I read in the reviews is correct. Perfect location, nice lounge, clean, everyone was very friendly. What I was surprised with and I guess for a pricey hotel, there was no minibar. We had a small refrigerator brought up but at an additional cost. What I found more disappointing was that there was not a chair in the room. There were 3 of us so we had to sit on the beds during down times. For almost $400 a night I want something to sit on besides the bed. I don't know that I would stay there again. I will look for more for the money. You are paying for the location.

Excellent service and central location. Food and Bev Manager Mr Sharif took care of our group! Occasion for this trip was a reunion of family members ages 3 to 92 and this team did a great job accommodating our trip!

It was a wonderful and clean hotel and the staff went out of their way to help us celebrate my grandmother 93 birthday. The location to Time Squire and Central Park is very convenient. Its location is perfect for people that have limited mobility along with its easy access to taxi service so you don't have to walk far to get one.

Amazing location with very nice staff and beautiful large rooms and bathrooms. I traveled with my infant child, husband and another couple from the 20th-22nd of may 2017. At check-in I asked for a fridge (to store my babys formula) which is at an additional cost of 30$ US but Gabriela at the front desk gave it for free which I was very grateful for. Plus the crib and fridge were quickly delivered to me that same day shortly after check-in. We requested a high floor and they gave us #23 with city view which was good, would've preferred a TS view but not a big deal. I checked out at 11 but asked the receptionist if I wanted to stay longer what would my max checkout be without additional charges, she told me I can stay till 2 since my room was not reserved yet (which is awesome). Rooms were a bit cold and we tried increasing the heat but A/C seemed to always be on no matter what. My husband called front desk and they said they will send someone but he cancelled since we were tired and wanted to sleep and not wait 10-15 mins. At checkout there is an additional 30$ US per day charged called resort fee it covers the use of wifi, pool, fitness center, phone calls etc. whether we used these services or not we were still charged... which wasn't a big deal since it was already mentioned in the confirmation email after booking. My overall experience was pleasant and I would definitely book at the Crown plaza on my next visit.

Comfy bed, great shower, and loved the corner room. Location is excellent if being in the centre of it all is what you're looking for, and the coffee bar downstairs made excellent lattes and pain au chocolat to start each of our days at the hotel. Thanks for a great stay!

We had 4 generations of family members travel to NYC for my grandmother's birthday and stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square. The staff and manager, Sharif, could not have been nicer to us or more accommodating. They made sure all of our rooms were fantastic and even helped us plan a birthday brunch for my grandmother on Sunday. Mr. Sharif even had a cake made for the brunch, which was a great surprise. Would definitely recommend staying at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square for any trip to Manhattan.

The perfect location for a long weekend break. We stayed there for four nights, and everything about the hotel was great. I would say, as with most city centre hotels that high is best ... ask for a high room preferably away from the lifts. We were on the 36th. floor overlooking the cruise terminal, and the room was clean, well appointed, quiet and comfortable. The bed was super comfortable with good quality pillows and linen. After walking round Manhattan you really do need a bit of comfort !! Our break was organised through Virgin Holidays, and there were no extras to pay at the hotel .... another bonus in New York.

Fantastic location,we paid over £660 for 2 night stay. however beware the bar staff are not helpful, very abrupt and extremely rude. there is no lounge area in the hotel for you to sit while waiting for transport once you have checked out. there is a window-sill!!!!. God forbid if you try to sit in the bar area and take too long to drink your drink, you are treated like a criminal and told to move. RUDE, RUDE Bar staff. would not return to this hotel. ( after 3 visits nothing changed)

Excellent in every way.Great staffSpeciallyPuja PendseRahmanKarin sharifAliLocation is excellent and rooms are HUGE for Ny or any standard.The view from. Yo room was of the Main Times Square area.Well done.

We stayed five nights in order to visit New York's best.Hotel was clean, with a comfortable bed although the room had a clear slope to it, which did feel weird. This was room only but we did eat in the bar once, which was no more than ok.The location of the hotel, right in the heart of theatre land was great. The subway to both the Statue of Liberty and the 9/11 memorial were only yards away from the hotel.We had a room on the 39th floor which apart from the 3am"Entertainment" from the amorous people next door on one night, was mainly quiet.

Hard to fault. The hotel is in a great location in Time Square with only a short walk to Broadway shows, the Rockefeller Center, Madison Square Garden and countless restaurants and bars. Central Park is only a 15 minute walk and there are countless Subway stations near the hotel which will take you all over the city. The rooms are comfortable and surprisingly quiet given the location. The rooms do not come with a fridge which is a little frustrating as you cannot keep refrigerated food in the room. I do believe you can request a fridge though from reception. Price is competitive when compared to other hotels in NYC that have such a great location. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed here at the beginning of April for the end of our honeymoon. We had an amazing view over looking times square, right in the center of the hussel and bussel. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had some issues with our hot water on the last evening, they fixed the issue straight away and even gave us late check out for the inconvenience. If you want somewhere were there is always something to see something to do here is definitely the place to stay. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends and family!

well the hotel is clean , quick checkin , nice rooms , nice lounge area, the staff are mostly friendly, but this hotel is busy, I feel that the staff may get a bit "tired" from the large number of people they deal with, they have always been nice and curtious, just that once in a while.. Only problem I had during 1 of my stays , was I had ordered the sliders at the bar , one of them had bad rancid meat (actually smelled like a decaying animal) don't know how it got past the chef , BUT the server was quick to take care of the problem and was helpful. I was just hoping that with such a potential health risk , I would have met with a manager or chef after asking. The stay was great other then this.

We've stayed here before (a year ago) and were so pleased we decided to return to the same location. So glad we did as you can't beat the central location for hitting all the Broadway shows. The rooms are good size, clean and beds are very comfortable. The staff is very efficient and professional and yes I would recommend this hotel to our friends. Good value!

I have the opportunity to work in and around NYC from time to time, so I have experience with a variety of hotels that offer wonderful amenities and opportunities for travelers. So, I know which hotels to investigate when traveling to NYC on a personal/family trip. Recently, my nephew made us all proud when he graduated from Mt. Sinai Medial School and we planned to attend the ceremony. I didn't have to think twice about which hotel to book for those five days. CROWNE PLAZA TIMES SQUARE is the Perfect Hotel for an extended trip. The location cannot be beat. Literally seconds away from Times Square which is such a happening place most of 24 hours every day. The facility is gorgeous and neat as a pen always. The layout of the hotel shows careful design with the bar/bistro area right next to the front desk. Very Classy. Most of the rooms are spacious and offer a view. Very Classy. Beds and bedding are comfortable. Very Classy, quiet elegance. Choices for food offer every variety. Food carts/trucks abound right along side 5 star restaurants throughout the area. Restaurant Row on 46th St. is a 3 minute walk. But, the restaurant at the Crowne Plaza is wonderful. We had the buffet breakfast most mornings and it was phenomenal. That being said, I must state unequivocally that the best asset provided by Crowne Plaza is its amazing staff. Literally every person we encountered working at the hotel was efficient, organized, prompt, and kind. They all exude a confidence in their respective jobs while showing genuine concern and warmth toward hotel guests. And, this is evident from the moment a guest enters the hotel. My family and I had contact with the group sales event manager, Gayle Richards, who personally looked out for us on several occasions in such a manner as to make us think we were the most important people in the hotel. Efficiency and style are the watch words to describe Gayle. The front desk has a team that works smoothly and quickly while always taking the time to completely meet the needs of the guests. When I arrived, Erika was on duty and, oh my goodness, what a delightful lady she is! She made several recommendations and took care of everything with meticulous care and concern for us. Vanessa was also on duty several days we were there and she always took care of any needs promptly and with a gorgeous smile. I observed that Evelyn not only always had a prompt, positive response to us, but attended to every guest in the exact same manner. Concierge, bell captains, food service, maintenance, and housekeeping work in such a coordinated manner that it is obvious they receive outstanding training and enjoy their jobs. I cannot recommend Crowne Plaza highly enough. It truly is the PLACE TO STAY in NYC!

Ali and Karim went above and beyond for our services this past weekend. Truly exceptional! Location was close to everything and walking distance to all the hot spots. Clean room and excellent food in all restaurants in hotel. Definitely will be returning.

Just spent the weekend in NYC. Great value for the location (center of Times Square), fantastic service, very comfortable rooms! Even free wifi! I highly recommend this hotel to all travelers! I would definitely come back.

We choose NYC as part of our celebration weekend. My husband booked us at the Times Square Crowne Plaza because of a great AAA rate. We had never stayed at this hotel on previous visits but the reviews were positive so there was no apprehension.Kudos go out to Victoria Martin for setting the tone of our visit when she checked us in. She answered our questions with patience and professionalism. We were able to get early check in and grab a quick bite at the in-house convenience store. We were within easy walking distance of the theatre and church. We also walked to a very nice restaurant for dinner. We finished the night with a drink in the Crowne Plaza bar. The morning buffet breakfast was delicious as well.Our room overlooked the river, and for a Times Square hotel was spacious. This visit to New York was a one day adventure and many of the good memories start with our stay at the Crowne Plaza.Definitely would stay there again.

First experience at the reception with miss Sandra Esp was great. A thorough professional made us very comfortable and easy check in a well equipped and popularly located hotel. Time square is just around the corner . Mr Freddy another front office staff who was really helpful at the desk . Thanks to pooja manager as well

We spent 7 nights here on a birthday holiday. The central location for Times square and theatre district was great but it is intensely busy outside the hotel with constant touters for sightseeing bus tickets and beggars, just like any major city centre I guess.Nevertheless it was a very pleasant hotel and our room was a decent size and on the 25th floor not particularly noisy. We never ate at the hotel, at $40 a head for the breakfast buffet we decided to try alternatives locally and found many choices at muhc better value , included the Times Square Diner a block from the back entrance of the hotel. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, we had a very pleasant stay.

This hotel is the worst hotel i have ever expirianced. Paid 4 nights 1100 usThis hotel has bed serviceBad smell in the roomIt has a dust odoreMidnight screaming and banging on doors. Strong hush smell between 1 to 2 AM, have complained but no security people where noticed altough i have called to complain. They say they handeling it, but nobody come, you can talk with the wall its the same.Bad service Dont go there.I will never go again to this hotel

Generally priced a bit less than other mega hotels from the big chains in Times Square, this one deserves a look if Times Square is where you want to stay in NYC.I booked this via AMEX (who apparently had used Expedia to get the reservation--oh the travel industry!) for $179 for a weeknight. Not a bad price for a weeknight in Times Square. The hotel is very comparable to the nearby Sheraton although I found the public spaces and amenities and restaurant offerings to be much more accessible and practical than at the Sheraton. The fact that it was over 25% less in price was a nice bonus as well.Check in was smooth. The worker was nearly apologetic about the $30 resort fee which includes access to the NYSC on the 15th floor as well as two free house drinks in the bar. Even though she said I would be charged the fee, I never was. My corner room was spacious for NYC, only slightly dated. It was facing the wrong direction for great Times Square views but the view was decent. The NYSC was nice for a hotel gym but can't believe anyone has to pay to belong there. The locker room was so small and crowded that one could barely change for the pool. Equipment was standard. There were no locker room amenities so be prepared to pack and bring your own. The sauna was entirely too small for a NYC gym. The bar had nice TS views. Service was a bit spotty. I skipped the overpriced breakfast buffet.All in all a good stay and a hotel I would definitely consider over pricier alternatives.

Rahi is the best waiter- incredible service for a birthday dinner! Definitely would come back here! Food was great and a very friendly atmosphere- flatbread pizzas, chicken wings, and mozzarella sticks are to die for

We stayed in the Crowne Plaza for our 20th anniversary trip. Check in was not ready for 3pm and we were told we would have a corner room facing Times Square. When we did check in, we had a room facing Times Square but it was not a corner room and it was a lower floor than first offered. The staff are very impersonal and I did not feel the usual hospitality you get when travelling around America. (Perhaps it is a New York thing)!The beds were fantastic, but we did. It eat there or have any other service (because of staff).

This was my first time traveling to NY. I stayed at Crown Plaza in Time Square.The front desk clerk Mr Anthony was determined to make my stay as blessed than any of my expectations! Thank you Anthony R. and Spencer. Best Birthday ever!! Mrs. L Jones

We had stayed with my extended family (Son, daughter and their family). Got two adjoining rooms on the Elite floor. View from the window was excellent. The rooms were reasonably clean and good, had basic facilities. No refrigerator in the room even at the Elite floor. Had to request for a hair drier, which took a while to be delivered in the room. Check-in took a little longer. The housekeeping service was not very prompt. The breakfast was quite good but again refilling service was a bit slow for a hotel of this size and brand. The attendant looking after our table Mr. Rahman and the Food & Beverage Outlet Manager Mr Karim Sharif were both nice & helpful. Fitness area opened only at 8 am ( being Sunday). The location of the hotel is fantastic for a family visit with small kids. On the whole, I will visit this hotel again.

I stayed one night at this hotel during my North America trip! It is so expensive as I paid nearly 500 dollars a night. The location is fantastic, right next to time square and very easy to access to all major attractions, shops and cafes in NYC. However, I think all positives are stopped there. Room is fairly small but functional. Bed is fine and wifi is working. The worse part of stay is service, no one seem cares you are staying or not. Hotel lobby is on first floor, you need to take the lift to go up. But at ground floor no one will direct you. Check in staff was so rude and unhelpful. She could be bothered to check me in, at least thats the impression I received. All staff I encountered are unhelpful and rude except the gentlemen checked me out. He is the only person cared during my stay. Considering the price I paid and the experience, I will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

What an absolute perfect location if you are going to stay in Time Square. The service here has been outstanding. When checking in Erika was the first person we met. She really set the stage for having a magnificent stay. I was thoroughly impressed with her friendliness and taking the time to tell me about things that were a must see in NYC. Her smile was contagious. Definitely choose this hotel on Time Square. Everyone that I have encountered has been tremendous. Five star service.

My first ever time to New York and my mum definitely picked the right place to stay! Situated right on times square you are central to everything. The open top bus tour is 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are spacious with 2 x double beds in the room we had. We had some prosecco when we arrived back from the theatre which is quite literally right outside of the hotel. We also had some nibbles, I think it was a sharing platter which was simply delicious. If you are looking for a place to stay in New York. This is the place to stay! :)

It's all about location . Right beside the M&M store and a block from the Times Square "red" seats , this hotel offers a lot to those wanting a central location . A special thanks to Victoria for helping us feel at home .
user_name:
John T
Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada

review_body: Had a quick one night stay last week, but I've stayed a number of times before. Check in was quick and easy, upgraded as Spire to a lovely high floor corner room with great views, excellent bed, drink vouchers very handy, very good breakfast, and very friendly service. If you're visiting NY as a tourist or just want to be in the centre of things, you will not find a better location. Look forward to my next stay for business, and I'll be brining my family to stay in the summer.

What can I say that I haven't said before about this hotel? However you will get the red carpet treatment by the excellent staff at this hotel. I have stayed here several times and will never stay at any other hotel in New York City. My friend Tone and I went to the city to celebrate Norway's Independence Day on May 17 and of course I decided to stay at the Crowne Plaza. we were immediately welcomed by the general manager Niles and his assistant Sylvia and they made sure that we had everything we needed. At the bar with the greeted by Karim The manager for the food and beverage department, he immediately approached us and wanted to make sure we were well taken care of. Martin at the bar makes the best cosmopolitans and is very friendly and make sure your glasses full and that you have a great time. Again I cannot express how thankful I am for such amazing service, outstanding food, comfortable bed, large clean rooms and excellent location.
