My brothers from Norway will be visiting this summer and of course all the bring them to the one and only place, The Crowne Plaza!
user_name:
Astri S
Longmeadow, Massachusetts, United States

review_body: Used this hotel as a base for our stay in NY. Nice room, very clean, comfy bed, maid did a great job every day, great shower and bathroom, all staff very helpful. Didn't use the gym, pool, restaurant as we were so busy seeing all there was to see in NY. Grabbed a take out coffee and snack in the mornings from the café which were very good. Spent all day in NY and collapsed in to bed each evening. Been wanting to visit NY for many years and loved it.

Very Good: In the morning Cafe, the Plaza provided a very fine buffet. In addition two people stand out as special: Travis, a wait person and Valerie, desk receptionist. Travis was incredibly pleasant, attentive and thoughtful. Valerie was kind, generous and so very nice. The Plaza could be very proud of these two employees. Not so good: We were in a disabled room. Noticed torn sheets first day. Complained on third day along with receiving no clean towels to Mgr. Reported to Mgr. again on 4th day Received clean sheets 5th day. Mgr apologetic and probably embarrassed. Treated us to dinner... a nice gesture.

The hotel is in a great location, it was about a 15 minute walk from Grand Central. We had requested a room with a view of Times Square. The room was VERY average and very run down. It was clean but there were holes in the office chair and the head board was worn down where heads would lie. The dresser cabinet door was broken and would not stay closed. The vent in the bathroom did not work and was filled with dust. The sink was rusty. The remote control for the TV was missing.Now if we were paying $100 a night I would have still been disappointed but for close to $600 a night this was just unacceptable.We called and told the front desk we weren't happy and they said they would call us back.The manager called back and told us that she had saved 2 rooms for us to look at and asked if we could meet her.We met up and she showed us another room and it felt much more together (I still noticed the holes in chair and worn out headboard on bed.)Then she showed us a corner room with view of the Hudson. This room was much better especially for what we were paying a night.We chose to stay in the corner suite and were very happy but even this room had the worn or headboard. She also gave us some vouchers for breakfast.So basically the hotel is in a great location and the staff is very nice and accommodating but the hotel itself needs a major upgrade.

From the moment we were greeted on check in to when we left the hotel was class. Great people working here from the MD who does his hotel walk greeting staff and guests with genuine concern to Keith the barman who is on top of his game. Thank you Crowne Plaza.

A super hotel in a super location highly recommended for anybody's first trip to Manhattan. You will have so many great attractions in walking distance. Time Square, the Theatre District, Grand Central Station, Central Park & so many places to shop!

We stayed here for a week in April. We were told we had a room upgrade to the 46th floor as we were staying for a week, however the room didn't really appear any different from a typical hotel room. It was clean and well stocked with a mini coffee and tea maker and a fresh bottle of water every day. We didn't use any of the gym, pool or restaurant facilities whilst we were there. We experienced quiet a few wet days and our window did leak. The hotel was very central, opposite M and M world in Times Square which was very handy for all metro stations and walking to several major sites. It was a most enjoyable experience.

I going to NY on business at least once a month, but this is my first time staying @ crown plaza- it's definitely not my last !!!Great location, clean room etc.The staff was nice and welcoming Especially Freddy ( reception lobby)Who made us feel like home in no time !!! I had a small issue that was taken care off right away by Gaby ( reception manager) .Thank you Gaby & Fraddy - I'll definitely coming back soon !

I enjoyed staying at Crowne Plaza! The staff was pleasant throughout my one week stay. I loved going to the restaurant, Brasserie for breakfast the food was terrific and innovative and the coffee was good as well. Just make sure you know the coffee is $4.00 so make sure you have more than one drink. The location is perfect, right on Times Square. The view from my room was great and with it being so busy my room was quiet and the bed easy to sleep in. I highly recommend this place.

We stayed here for my husband's birthday for 4 nights and everything was perfect from start to finish. We were welcomed by the wonderful Donald M at reception and he took care of anything we could have wanted. The breakfast is fantastic in terms of choice and quality and the views from both the restaurant and room were great (we were in room 4011). We normally ask for rooms away from the elevator but to get a view we took this room and once inside you couldn't hear the lift at all. The only noise was occasional siren outside but that's to be expected In a city and it was minimal. We didn't get chance to use the pool but if the cleanliness of the room was anything to go by then it would have been great. Finally, the location... so close to so many things and only 2 minutes from the subway so it really is perfect! We would definitely stay here again. Thank you to all the staff

I recently stayed for one night. We had a corner room on the 44th floor and it was perfect. The rate was reasonable for Times Square, the location was perfect and the bed was comfortable. The check in process was smooth, the staff was very friendly and we were allowed a 1pm checkout, which I can't even begin to tell you how convenient this was! I will definitely stay here again!!

This is a large but excellent hotel just north of Times Square. The rooms are great and many have excellent views. Reception area and bar are all open and good for hanging out. The food was excellent for a hotel bar and the service friendly.

We are IHG members and Crown Plaza is one of their brands. We have stayed here at least three times in the last three years. It is very well located if you are going to the theater. In addition, it has a swimming pool which is quite hard to find in city hotels. The lobby, rooms, etc. are all fine--just what you would expect in this mid-price range property.

It was a privilege to stay in this hotel right on Times Square. The rooms were extremely well laid out, the breakfast was extensive, personnel were very well mannered, polite, and accommodating. If I am ever in NYC again, I will be staying here.

As I understand as far as NY hotels go, this was a very good room for the money. The location was great as it was close to many things. Today Show, Rock Center, 5th Avenue, Subway and of course Times Square.

Our arrival at the Crown Plaza Times Square was about noon and we were very pleased to be able to go straight to our room. Brunhilde at the front desk was an absolutely charming ambassador for the hotel. The corner room was decent but there needs to be some basic repair work done.. Torn fabric on furniture, Headboard's faux leather material was torn in several places, peeling paint on doors, electrical outlets that have faceplates falling off, and a shower that drained so slowly that it almost overflowed the stall in less than 5 minutes. The windows were covered with sheer curtains (the blackout curtains were missing….so the room was never dark at night…..but a note to the service staff had them installed the next day)No in-room mini fridge and the cheap little plastic cups (covered with bits of plastic to consume with your drink) were a BIG disappointment. After calling the front desk we were finally told that we could have two real cocktail glasses but that WE would have to go down to the bar ourselves to get them. We washed them and hid them each day for the four days we stayed.We expected a hotel that labels itself and charges prices of a 4 star hotel in the heart of New York’s time Square would also at least have more than two sports channels on the TVs in guests rooms that only showed Italian soccer and golf. No NHL playoff games?? Whaaaat?? It was on the TV in the bar (sound turned off) so we were able to catch a bit of the game but had to purchase drinks to do it. Oh. OK. Now I get it.Over all, the hotel met our needs but not sure I would classify it as four-five stars.

Very nice hotel, great staff: friendly and efficient,The room was spacious and updated with a fabulous view. The bar staff were very accommodating and fun! Concierge extremely helpful..A great Breakfast Buffet was included as well as a couple of complementary drink coupons.

Let me start off by saying Vanessa at the front desk is amazing!!! The property is in the heart of everything, and staff are the most sweetest people ever from housekeeping staff on the 31st floor to the breakfast staff who works in the restaurant.

I was here for 1 night last week on business. I stayed in room 4511 which had an okay view of Times Square (you can see a little of it). But I didn't have a great stay. First, I checked in just after 5pm. I went to my room and the first thing I did was put up my Do Not Disturb sign (I do that every place I stay). I was getting getting situated and getting ready to go out for dinner. All of a sudden I hear "Housekeeping!" as a lady comes bursting through my door. I was really unhappy. She completely ignored my DO NOT DISTURB sign. What the heck is the point of those then? So much for privacy. I told her to get out. I was in a rush to make dinner and didn't complain.Also, the bathroom counter still had standing water on it when I got there and the counter looked like it hadn't been wiped down or cleaned at all. The shower wasn't clean either. I turned the A/C off because it was freezing, but it barely made any difference even hours later. Last, the $35 breakfast was VERY average and nothing special at all. Save your money, go somewhere else for breakfast. I would not recommend this hotel at all, esp for $403 a night after taxes.
user_name:
Ahmed R
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My room service at the Crown Plaza was the best. Daris M was so friendly and warm. I also used the fitness center while visiting. Full on fitness center that was open from 6:00 am until 9:30 pm. Stopped by the bar at the hotel and service was fabulous.

The hotel is in a great position next to Times Square, the rooms are clean and Comfortable, the bed is the best you will get a good night sleep, we did. the bathrooms are well stocked with free stuff and plenty of fresh towels. we were on the 43rd floor so there was not much street noise, don't know what its like on a lower floors, room 4325 is just great, its a corner room with plenty of space. you have a coffee machine in each room which is ok but if you are a tea drinker ask for a kettle. I think they have them at a charge. would have liked a proper cup instead they provide paper ones which is a bit of a let down, there is no fridge in your room so no chance of a cold beer or to keep milk fresh , they do have fridges at a charge of course. you also pay $30 a day charge on top of the holiday which is in case you want to use the gym or the swimming pool etc. so if you book this hotel look out for the little extras you have to pay. All of that didn't spoil our experience of the hotel the staff are great and will do their best to give you good service they always so hello or good morning which is nice and they do say it with a smile and mean it. There is a bar where you can have a meal, also you can have breakfast, on the first morning we had breakfast at the hotel, we had three American breakfast which was a self service section with bacon, eggs, toast, pancakes, hash browns plus cereals and fresh fruit, the bill was $90 for the three of us, for the rest of our stay we went to a café called Applebee which was great you get your breakfast cooked to order, Applebee is a round the corner from the hotel its on 234w 42nd street and it was about $45 for the three of us. All three of us enjoyed our stay at the Crowne Plaza Hotel and would recommend this hotel to any one wanting to stay near time square, so its a big thank you to the staff at the hotel for making our stay a good one.

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza hotel last November, this was my second time staying at this hotel because I enjoyed it so much the previous year. What's not to like? The rooms are really nice and very clean. The hotel is big, bright, spacious and modern. The food offerrings on site are great, from the lobby bar, to the full service restaurant to the little cafe that you can grab a coffee and muffin...it was all excellent. Check in and check out were all smooth. We had a problem with drainage in our shower and they fixed it right away. Hotel is in great location, close to everything, can't really get lost if you wander around because the hotel is in the hub of Times Square - safe area for walking around at night. As a female, I wouldn't feel concerned about security of the neighborhood or the hotel, I would comfortably stay here on my own. This hotel is not cheap so if you're looking for a nice, luxury hotel in a great location then this is it.

My father and I enjoyed our visit to the Crowne Plaza Times Square very much. We were in the city to see The Late Show with Stephen Colbert (excellent show by the way) and the hotel was very convenient to the show location and Times Square and almost everything you want to see in Midtown Manhattan. The fitness center was great, a bit crowded in the morning but that is just normal and only shows how good the facility was. The icing on the cake for us was the treatment we received from Ms. Sandra Esp. She was genuinely warm and welcoming and went out of her way to make my father feel special. Thank you Sandra. You made our stay worthwhile more than it already was.

Anthony was most helpful. He took us as soon as we arrived. He was willing to assist us in checking in quickly and was courteous. This was especially appreciated, particularly after having had a rough time with getting a room at a competing hotel. We really appreciate his going the extra mile with customer service.

We arrived at 11 am but we received the rooms at 3 pm by the book.The lobby of the hotel is the same with the bar which is very uncomfortable for guest waiting for check in and out. The location of front desk is on second floor so there is a need to carry the luggage on escalator.We had rooms on the top floor wich were nice and clean. The buffet breakfast was good. The gym is proffessionalBest Regards,

My wife and I are long-standing and regular visitors to New York City. This was our first stay at the hotel and turned out to be an excellent decision. The location, very close to the theaters, is extremely convenient, plus, good restaurants near by. We stayed at an Elite room which was also excellent, spacious, clean and comfortable, which can be said also of the bathroom. The service is efficient and all the staff very courteous.

This place is so convenient that takes literally 5 minutes to get to central park, empire state building and 5th Ave etc. We just park our vehicle then walked most of the trip. The room is nice and clean as advertised. Donald was very helpful at the front desk, really appreciate it. Everything was great!

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza with my friend while visiting NYC a few weeks ago. We stopped for a quick bite to eat at the hotel Bar 49 before an evening show and Tony was our server. I just have to commend his customer service. He was great! By far had the best personality and was the best server. We enjoyed him so much that we came back to eat more after the show. We were in the middle of Manhattan! I mean we could have gone anywhere to eat after the show, but he was so great that we decided to come back to the hotel and wait until we could sit in his section again :) If you see this .. Well done Tony!

The hotel room was good and clean and had comfortable beds. The building was very modern with cool interiors. Location , well you are in the middle of Times Square. That means a lot of noise at night. We had a problem with our room keys though and had to go back and forth to the room 5 times before our cards would actually work. I can recommend getting breakfast at Dino's right outside.

Hotel is right at Times Square, providing a very good location while visiting New York. The room was clean, but you could hear outside noises and traffic, even on a high floor. Overall a nice hotel, but not incredible.

After I stayed for the first few nights in Holiday Inn Express at Times Square, I changed to crowne plaza for the second phase of our stay in New York. It was more expensive as compared to Holiday Inn Express but right on the broadway avenue over the Hershey shop and much bigger room with sofa and enough room to move around.It was very convenient location and a comfortable room.However, I didn't quite understand the absence of any refrigerator in the room.....and of-course the absence of any water bottles in the room is something that I have to come to terms with probably every New York hotel, which is kind of strange for me who is a frequent visitor to IHG properties in Asia.The one annoying factor though was the accessibility to gym after 6AM only and that too gets delayed to 8AM or so over the weekends. So, if you are someone who are particular about not missing your morning workouts then this might be something for you to think about. Definitely a put off for me - but I guess, who for the purpose of tourism in NYC will be up so early anyways (except for me of course).

I recently attended a conference hosted at the Crown Plaza Times square, and I have to say that I had an excellent experience. Initially, it started out ominously, as my reservation should have been for a Monday + Tuesday stay, but was recorded as a Tuesday + Wednesday stay, so I had no room at 10:00 PM. I spoke with Gabi at the front desk, who not only booked me into the hotel, but did so at a very good rate. Gabi also provided additional amenities that made the stay even better, which almost NEVER happens in the Big Apple.I was also very pleasantly surprised by the overall cheerfulness and helpfulness of the staff overall, the folks in the restaurant were very helpful and seemed glad to have me as a guest. Again, this is semi-unexpected in New York City.I'd recommend the Crown Plaza for anyone staying on/near Broadway!
user_name:
William T H
Campbell, United States

review_body: Recently renovated rooms and free wifi makes it ideal hotel to stay for leisure as well as business travelers. Higher floors give the best view of city. Nightlife, restaurants, Broadway theatres, shopping ...everything is at walking distance. We completely enjoyed our stay.

Pro: this hotel is in the heart of Times Square Con: This hotel is in the heart of Times Square. The room was clean, bed comfortable. For a facility this large I felt it needed a better defined and more inviting lobby and gathering place for hosting large groups.

Family of five stayed in Crown Plaza and we walked and subway-ed everywhere! Fabulous location with lots to do close by... Hersheys store at the ground floor level. Great little coffee shop, good valet service, decent bar, nice restaurant. Rooms are clean and surprisingly quiet. Great views of Times Square and theater district. Staff was wonderful, helpful, smiley, quick to assist, tell you hello :) Would stay here again.

What a fabulous place to stay in NYC! Right in the heart of things! The Staff were welcoming and very helpful! Our room was cleaned spotlessly everyday! We were welcomed with 2 free drinks at the hotels bar which also served beautiful food and snacks. Brilliant location for Times Square and broadway! Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to be touching distance from the hustle and bustle of Times Square! The bed was extremely comfortable just what you need after walking miles around the city!!100% will use this hotel again! Thanks for such a comfortable stay!

Pros: Good views of Times Square and Hudson River (we paid to upgrade to this room), very fast elevators, free WiFi, and good proximity to theaters and Hell's KitchenCons: Concierge desk only answered the phone 1/5 times that I tried during our Thurs - Sun stay, room service is not available until 4:30 pm, the shower leaked and left large puddles in the bathroom

We stayed here for my 50th birthday. A lovely hotel right in the heart of Times Square. Perfect location and actually quiet in the rooms. We didn't eat here but had drinks. We were given free drink vouchers which was a nice touch. Beautiful room with a fantastic view of the Hudson River. Toiletries plentiful and great quality. Lovely clean room. Friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again

Just loved our girls trip to NYC & one of the main highlights of experience was the awesome front desk staff member Anthony! He took great care of our little trio. Thanks @IHG and Anthony for everything!

I was there 3 days for a professional conference of orthopedic surgery and found that the location was ideal to walk around in Times Square & Broadway.The Hotel has excellent facilities with their Ballroom to host a 300 attendants package.The bar staff is very friendly & professional , breakfast concept & team might be improvedA good experience globally

Room was a good size, bed was really comfortable. Lovely view of the Hudson River. Check in with Donald Mai was really quick and pleasant. Location is second to none, turn right straight into Times Square and turn left to a 10 min walk to Central Park. Hotel lobby and bar were all one which meant it was always half full of people coming and going and sometimes difficult to get a seat for a drink.Although told in advance we did have 1 day without hot water for a shower. It was not back on until mid to late morning. As a seasoned traveller, paper and plastic cups for beverages in your room is not conducive to usual 4/5* standard.

I chose this facility based on two criteria location and pool. The location is great, however the pool facility is very poorly run by an outside entity. They sell memberships to locals so using the facility is less than convenient for hotel quests. I was given several rules each day by different staff, to the point one individual was so rude with me I chose to stop using the facility. As this is the first time I have ever had an issue in a hotel I let the manager on duty know. I was less than satisfied with his response.

We got to the Hotel at 12:30 expecting to concierge our luggage and hit the streets. How ever we were thrilled to find there was a room available for check in! Our room was clean and nice sized. I was surprised that there was no mini fridge, that would be such a nice addition. The beds are so comfortable. We will definitely be back and I highly recommend!

Crowne Plaza does it right and makes a great base station for your NYC stay. The staff is friendly and the rooms are solid. I recently attended a conference here and it was managed quite well by the hotel. Kudos to the staff and management teams for a job well done.

Upon Check-in, Donald M greeted us with 4 free drinks, a room upgrade and a welcoming attitude! I'm impressed by the unobstructed view of times in our room, and even more by the kindness and generosity of the staff (haven't been greeted as nicely even at hotels where I'm at platinum level!)

Great location with an affordable room. the hotel was clean as were the rooms. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay, will be going back in a week or so and staying there again. It was so convenient to the theaters everything was within walking distance.

Beautiful well kept LARGE room here at the conveniently located Crown Plaza. All staff was very pleasant. As a priority club member, I got an upgrade with a view which was a nice surprise.I will be back!!

We have had an awesome experience at the Crown Plaza. We stayed on the 34th floor with a view of the river and a view of Time Square from a two sided . The bed was extremely comfortable, room well organized, facilities were very accommodating, but the staff were the highlight. Kindness, courteous, and simply friendly would be the best description of the employees. The entrance to Broadway and being right in the north middle of Time square is perfect for walking. It's a short walk to Bobby Van's grill where there is no better meal in Time Square. One awesome thing is the hotel is easy to find on Broadway because you just look for the Hershey Store which is under the hotel.Thanks CP for a great stay. By the way, the breakfasts are awesome and thanks to Tofael and the man who lives on the west side in our breakfast service and directions.Last, we highly recommend Yusuf as a tour guide of Central Park by rickshaw, his explanations and time taking pictures of our visit were above and beyond perfect service, book him ahead selirmag@hotmail.com

Awesome! Everyone is friendly, helpful. Richie the server in the bar area, he remembered me from the year prior, as well as the entire staff in the breakfast room, hostess, servers, all there to make sure you have a very good time!

This was our 3rd (and4th) visit here as we had two long weekends in April and may. We love it as it is on the doorstep to everything - Times Square, Central Park, the broadway theatres, the restaurants. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite spacious, and the beds are very comfortable.

Quality hotel in regards to location, cleanliness and amenities. We enjoyed our 5 night stay on the 24th floor...lifts were plentiful and quick. Although having to pay a large tax added on after already paying a massive amount for the room was a shock. The room was great, each day our room was tidied, towels changed etc...even the toilet roll end folded into a triangle yet our tea/coffee and cups were not replenished. Strange when also paying so much. Staff were friendly and very helpful with any issues.Be careful when looking for the Broadway entrance...blink and you'll miss it!

Stayed for an extended weekend at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. We arrived at the hotel before the allotted check-in time but the Front Desk employee got us into our room anyway. In fact, according to her standards, she did not process us at the front desk efficiently enough and provided us with vouchers for free breakfasts. Trust me, I've waited much longer at check-in and been treated without a care. (We didn't know the true value of these vouchers until the following morning when we learned this buffet breakfast was $32!)The rooms were a bit larger than anticipated and mostly clean. Found a bobby pin and some small trash on the floor as if the room likely wasn't vacuumed too well between guests. The housekeeping was mostly thorough and did a good job in the bathroom and replaced towels as needed. Again, we could've used a vacuuming in the room but it really wasn't worth complaining about. The breakfast staff was very friendly and welcoming. The buffet breakfast was very good albeit definitely not worth $32. The lounge staff was a little less prompt than the breakfast staff but the lounge is just that, a lounge, where you're not supposed to be in a hurry.The hotel was remarkably quiet. When we booked this room we just assumed since it was right near Times Square it would be noisy. Granted we were on the East River side and not Times Square, we heard the occasional siren and horn. Not at all what we expected. The hallway was quiet, too. The first night around 10pm there was a considerable commotion in the hall but it quickly quieted down and that was the only disturbance (if you want to call it that) all weekend.When we do return to New York City, we will definitely stay again at the Crowne Plaza Times Square.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights in April. We requested interleading rooms which caused a substantial delay during check-in. Our rooms were only ready around seven that evening and only after we complained. The rooms itself and subsequent service was good but I highly recommend you make arrangements for a late check-in. There are several restaurants on site and you can store your luggage if you arrive early or depart late. I found the concierge service desk really good and helpful. You can book most excursions and activities with them. We didn't include a meal option but it is available. The coffee provided in the rooms, is really good and housekeeping is very helpful.The best part of the hotel is the location. It is within minutes walk of Time Square, shops and theaters. We also decided to do the Hop on Hop off for 2 days and it worked well as it got us to most attractions without using other forms of transport. Buses were frequent and we hardly waited for any buses except one afternoon where the first bus was full. There is also the boat that does a tour of the harbor and takes you quite close to The Statue of Liberty but does not stop there.I would recommend this hotel but do keep in mind it is a big hotel and you may be delayed when checking in.

Karim from the Crown Plaza really helped to make this our best ever New Years Eve experience. We arrived in New York on 24th December 2016 and hadn't booked anything for New Years Eve and with so many different options to choose from we really weren't sure on what to book. When having a drink at the Crowne Plaza we met Karim and asked about the New Years Eve options at the hotel. He guided us through the options available and said he would look after us with his best recommendation. He was a true gentleman, was a pleasure to deal with and helped us enjoy the best ever New Years Eve. The Brasserie was an excellent night with live DJ, great food buffet and open bar with quality drinks all night long. There was a TV with live coverage of the New Years Eve broadcast and big windows that look down on to Times Square. Well worth it and I think the best value for money option we came across. (Karim, really a very big thank you for looking after us)

Have to say that the Crowne Plaza Times Square has been a very fun surprise. Knowing we were a part of a 200+ group of travelers, our expectations for excellence were low. The good surprises came one after the other, beginning with an exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Situated conveniently on Broadway and 49th, this hotel is clean, spacious and walking distance from a host of Times Square and NYC attractions. The comfortable rooms and amenities nicely appointed, though the bathroom fixtures need attention. Tighten this, replace that, caulk this etc.That said, their room service was consistently prompt, great food and though the goods arrived in brown bags, it was all hot and delicious.

This hotel appears to cater to large groups but works to provide individual service. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The Conciege manager was particularly helpful (I'm afraid I didn't get her name), giving us good directions and helpful inside tips to wherever we wanted to go and got us some last minute show tickets. She was a gem.They have a large buffet in the morning (rather expensive but lots of fresh fruit and choices) which lasted us through busy days until dinner. The staff was always courteous and efficient. Tofael was our favorite...always friendly and on the spot with service.Our only negative was the waiter Japhet in the lounge. He obviously did not enjoy his job, but even so, he was so curt, unsmiling and unhelpful that we began avoiding the lounge in favor of more friendly places surrounding the hotel. We enjoyed Hurleys ,which is just behind the hotel, after the plays.

Hotel personnel assisted me with maxima of efficiency kindness and concern. Michelle and Pablo 5 star help, especially give new meaning to the words customer satisfaction. Went out of their was to ensure stay of pleasant and accommodating with no STRESS. I will return because of their interest in my satisfaction. thank you!!

My friends and I were there last year in late April, returning this year we recognized many of the staff, always a positive sign. The breakfast buffet is generous, always fresh, well presented along with attentive coffee service.Our servers Val, Ana and Ali were always pleasant. The rooms are well maintained. This hotel is a great value in an expensive city in a great location. The bistro off the main lobby is a good place to stop for drinks and snacks after the theater. All in all a positive experience, hoping to repeat next year.

This was a trip for myself and my 17 year old son. Hanging out with mom is not something a teenage boy wants to do very often so I needed this trip to be everything I could make out of it. When we checked in to the hotel, our room was not what I had reserved. I could see the disappointment in his face. He wanted the view of everything his eye could see. When asking the front desk for assistance, we met Victoria! She was amazing, We ended up with a top floor, corner room with two walls being nothing but windows. The housekeeping staff went above and beyond for us as well. The room was very clean and they were probably the most friendliest people we encountered all weekend. (Friendly is not NYC strong point). Overall, we were very pleased and this trip turned out to be very memorable and everything he wanted it to be. THANK YOU VICTORIA!!

The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be at Times Square. Room service was excellent. Room was clean and comfortable. We had breakfast at the Brassarie restaurant and it was average, I would not recommend paying extra for breakfast.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza in New York and it's located in Times Square.As we walk out of our hotel at night the street is full of people and walk alittle further down there are people performing on the street. Just near the TKTS ticket office, there are cartoon character, street dancing and many more.There are theatres all over Time Square.There are lots of different hop on and off buses that take you to all popular places.Really enjoyed the stay at hotel which all staff are very friendly and polite, highly recommend.

From the time we walked in the door to when we left it was perfection. The staff was extremely helpful, rooms clean and comfortable. Breakfast was included in our stay which was a buffet and had a wonderful variety . The drinks, food and servers in the bar were excellent. I would highly recommend this to hotel and will stay again if I revisit New York City.

We stayed in Crowne Plaza for 6 days and what an unforgettable time we had. The best part of the hotel is the location, its right in the bustling Time Square and easily reachable to any part of the city.The hotel is very big with amazing dining options. Its a high rise hotel with stunning views of NYC. Its a kid friendly hotel with indoor swimming pool, gym, business center and free wifi. The parking is not free.Crowne Plaza has classic rooms and suites, as we were a family of 4, we stayed in the suite. Our suite was comfortable, spacious and had a wonderful view of the city. It had decent sized bathrooms.The quality of food was good in their restaurants. The service and staff were great. But the room was way overpriced.

Our room was large, esp by NYC standards and very clean and looked recently renovated. This was our first time at the crowne plaza and we loved it. It was in the heart of Times Square so every major attraction is a short walk away or subway ride. But what we loved most about this hotel is the staff, from the front desk, to the housekeeping and valet. They all went out of their way to welcome and answer our questions. Donald M. at the front desk helped us extend our stay and even beat all the room rates quoted online. He really made it worth it, not just because he was able to give us the best rate around, but also bc he was kind, friendly and wanted us to have the best time here. We've stayed at many different hotels in NYC and this place is a gem.
user_name:
doubleuvintage
New York City, New York

review_body: Great location and good staff. The concierge had helpful information about local shows. The bar near the lobby was a hoot!Only complaint, the hot water was turned off twice in four days, for 8 hours each time.

This was my second stay at the Crowne Plaza in NY. I really wanted this stay to be amazing since my last stay was not so much so. As with my previous stay the rooms are great – huge and the location is great. Great fitness center though I wish it had longer hours, but understand that this is a Club and more than a hotel gym.And I did have some better experiences than in the previous visit. The brightest part is the contact made with Isis Arruda, the Crowne’s Social Media Manager. She reached out after my last review and definitely seemed concerned with my experience. She told me to let her know if I had plans to return to the Crowne so I did reach out to her, very last minute, and she reached out to a colleague about my stay. She has been great in her sincere interest to help create a better experience.Anthony checked me in and was great; very cordial, professional and engaging personality. I had dinner in the bar/lounge as the restaurant continues to not be open for dinner and room service is still in a paper bag and more takeout. Found a good table; sometimes it is so busy that it is hard to find a place to sit. Food was pretty good and server was Yasmin, great service, very attentive, and very kind.There were some issues with some things not 100% in my room, which were taken care of pretty quickly. Chaise in my room probably should have been replaced as it had a number of very questionable stains. When I called about it, the person who came tried to spot clean it, but it actually looked worse. Hopefully it has been replaced or better cleaned by now.Not sure if I would stay here again or not…

The hotel was comfortable and location was great. If you need help with extra information Corrine at the concierge desk was the "go to" person. Ask for her. She is run of her feet, very busy, but is most attentive and goes out of her way to help. Watch the front desk when it come to final bill. They are not nice and tried to charge us for our phone calls which were included in the service fee. There is also extra taxes added to the bill, for us it was approx $55US per night

Booked a flexible reservation almost a year in advance. Hotel changed cancellation policy to non-refundable without notifying me, I only found out when checking my reservations. Contacted hotel regarding this, they would not honor original terms and stated I could only agree to new terms or they would cancel the reservation.

The food hit the spot and our waiter Rahman was excellent! Very accommodating!! I have celiacs and Rahman found me gluten free bread!!We were here for a race and needed good food and lots of water it was perfect!

We stayed here for 5 nights as part of a British Airways holiday package. The hotel is huge and located right in the heart of Times Square which proved invaluable for sightseeing and made us feel like we were really experiencing NYCAs it was our wedding anniversary the hotel kindly upgraded us to a corner view room overlooking Times Square which was fantastic. The room was comfortable with everything we needed for our stay; two double beds, en-suite, TV and tea / coffee making facilities etc and was cleaned daily and supplies replenished. We were on a room only basis and didn't eat in the restaurant during our stay, however we did grab a croissant or granola and yoghurt pot from the coffee shop most mornings for breakfast which set us up for the day nicely. Couldn't fault the friendly staff who always seemed genuinely happy to help; when we had a problem with the hot water in our shower one evening the hotel reception desk sent an engineer up to our room promptly to fix it. The baggage storage with the concierge on the ground floor was also really helpful and meant we could still do a full day sightseeing once we had checked out of our room on our last day as we had evening flights back to the UK. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are planning a trip to NYC and want to be based within easy access to a lot of the main attractions and good restaurants around Times Square. Booking this holiday package through British Airways meant that we weren't asked to pay any of the additional taxes for internet and gym use that other reviewers have talked about as we were told on arrival that it was all included and there was nothing additional to pay :-)

Staff not very friendly. Breakfast at $40 very poor. Limited choice.Hotel bar and lounge area open plan with busy,noisy lobby no where to relax, plus it was cold, people sitting with coats on! The room was very good, the bed very comfortable.This was its saving grace as we walked 8 miles a day. Great views out across the city. No complimentary biscuits.No hot water for one day? Great location.

We checked into this hotel one evening and the carpet in the room smelled like a dirty old sock. As I was unpacking I decided to wash my hands and realized that there was no running hot water. We proceeded to the front desk to see if we could switch rooms and then we were told by the front desk that there would be NO HOT WATER until 8am the next morning. They said the city of New York turned off the hot water to the whole city for repairs and we were assured there would be running hot water by 8am the next morning. We found it odd that the restaurant on the main floor was busy and how did they wash their dishes in cold water. Anyways the next morning came and no hot water by 8am. We again called the front desk and this time they said it could be 10 am to noon when the hot water would come back on. We could not wait for this uncertain hot water so we checked into the Marriott Marquis hotel which was one block away and they had functioning hot water for the whole hotel ( the Crowne Plaza had told us the whole city had no hot water). I will never book with the Crowne Plaza chain of hotels again. It was not a cheap room being $350 a night and NO HOT water! I will book at the Marriott chains in the future.

Brianna in Guest services was a charm to deal with when our AC quit working, as was Fabio, the engineer who fixed it. Although it wasn't an easy Fix, it was remedied so we didn't have to move. They both went above and beyond to assist us on a very hot NY day, accompanied with a personal note of apology from Fabio for the inconvenience.Travis, in the restaurant, always greets us with a smile, and brightens the day at breakfast. 4 years here and we will continue to return

Fantastic location and very friendly staff. Rooms were spacious and very clean and comfortable. However, I was dissapointed. We arrived about half hour after check in time. They could not give us two rooms next to each other as we had requested. The furnishings in the rooms looked very worn. Headboard's faux leather material was torn in several places (in both rooms!). No coffee makers or mini fridge. Our room's bathroom had a nonworking light, chips in the sink, no shower fan/vent and a few other minor issues. We didn't report it as we were there only one night and changing room would have meant being on a different floor from the rest of the family (who were already way down the hall!). For the price, and considering we are IHG platinum members, I certainly expected more. We will be going back to Double Tree next time we are in town.

We were originally booked in to some dodgy place in Tribeca & I couldnt stay there. It was terrible so I called Crowne Plaza in Times Square. On arrival (we were so stressed as we didn't want another bad experience) we were checked in by the fabulous Gabby who upgraded us to a much higher floor. She could see how stressed we were & gave us free breakfast. This just made our trip instantly better. The Crowne Plaza is right in the heart of everything, what an amazing experience. We will be booking all of our trips back to the Crowne Plaza.

Great spot! Right in Time Square!! Paulette in Housekeeping was amazing and Victoria at the Front Desk was so helpful and friendly, they made our stay great!! Buffet was delicious and hotel bar was fun with great views.

I had a two day biz trip to NY with a meeting upon my arrival the first day. Unfortunately the flight was delayed 4 hours from LA to NY, due to weather . I was going to miss the meeting but called the client and agreed to meet at Crown Plaza that eve for meeting . It took almost 2 hours from JFK to Times Sq. And added a lot of stress to the trip . Upon checking in I had a wonderful Front Desk Manager, Gabt, that upgraded my room to a junior suite . As a Platinum Ambassador it was a great benefit and one that came at the right time. I had my meeting in the parlor area so I had a more professional setting than in a standard room with much less room. It made my day and helped turn the quick 2 day biz trip into a positive experience. Thank you
user_name:
SAM s
New York City, New York

review_body: Me and er indoors made our first and well overdue visit to NYC in April 2017.Due to having seen so many movies based on the Big Apple, it was pretty much as we expected. We stayed at the Crowne Plaza due to its close proximity to Times Square and all that offers. We were very impressed with the location and the look and feel of the hotel. Walk out the door and you are slap back in the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. Obviously a bit more expensive than other places but you don't get much nearer than this. Didn't eat on the restaurant so can't comment. Had a couple of drinks in the bar and whilst more expensive than the UK, no more so than other bars in the city. Very large rooms and well decked out. Everything you would expect from a IHG hotel. If coming back to NYC, would certainly consider this hotel again.

We have just returned from the Plaza and had a wonderful time there. The position of the hotel is perfect - right in the action of Times Square. You can walk to many of the main tourists spots including Central Park, the Rockefeller Centre and the Empire State Building. Our large room overlooked Times Square and was very clean with comfortable beds. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel!

Nice clean hotel but rooms need some TLC and refurb.- great views though Staff very friendly and helpful however had to request additional bottles of water after the first day as these were not automatically replenished. Disappointed that there was no Club Lounge ( being a Spire member ) as thought this was a requirement of all Crowne Plaza hotels under their Franchise agreements but partially compensated for by the perks given on arrival. Very central and convenient location.

The hotel has excellent location, but the staff are so rude! Bell desk staff was shouting at us after questioning him why the hotel taxi price increased! The manager was no help we didn't even get an apology.Reception staff literally kicked us out of the room upon checkout. Went downstairs to ask for an extended hour (late checkout) and her response was "you have 10 minutes to remove your bags from the room or i will charge you a full day rate". What the hell? I was never treated this way even in 3 star hotels!!? The hotel management are relying so much on their strategic location they actually forgot how to treat customers well. Anyways it was my first and definitely my last time in crowne plaza, there are better hotels in the area. If it wasn't for the insistence of my friend I would've booked somewhere else.

Besides being a fabulous hotel with clean, very large rooms ( a rarity in NYC), this trip was made for me because of the excellent staff. Beginning with my front desk experience, Victoria Martin, my check in agent, could not have been nicer or more accommodating! She got me checked in early ( at 9 am!) which after a long flight was very much appreciated. In all my years of travel I have never been checked in so early anywhere! She also upgraded me to a room with a wrap around view of Times Square when I wasn't even a club member and gave me two drink vouchers for the lobby bar. Her professionalism and generosity are what prompted me to add this review. That said, there was no lack in professionalism from the rest of the staff either. My bell hop offered to fetch me ice and gave me a 5 minute presentation about the room and things to do. The concierge told me the ins and outs of getting discount tickets to see The Book of Mormon on Broadway while Smiling the entire time. And all of this was extended to me when I basically looked liked a bum in a sweatshirt and yoga pants as opposed to the usual business attire you see in NYC. All in all an excellent stay experience on all levels!

We booked 9 nights to see Come From Away and other shows on Broadway. Checking was great, I booked through the rewards program and was offered an option for an upgrade to a corner room at a reasonable per night fee. The room was huge and beautiful. Very much appreciated after a 'broomcloset' experience at another hotel two blocks away last month. Water view on one side, Time Square on the other. With 9 days it was nice to have an extra nice room to come home to each night.Concierges were helpful and lovely. Housekeeping were friendly and efficient.Bar staff we personable and fun.Location had us only a few minutes stroll to the theatres we visited and a 15 minute walk from Madison Square Gardens for a hockey game. Came home exhausted every night and slept well on the 45th floor.No hesitation to recommend. We booked months ahead and had what averaged out to $300 per night during Easter/School break peak, taxes in.

Beautiful property stones throw away from the Times Square and the hustle and bustle of Manhattan. You can walk to the uptown and the downtown as it is very much in the heart of the city. Discover manhattan on foot and eat from the pavement food vendors - awesome

I traveled here having booked using IHG points. It was a 5 night stay. 4 of us in a large room. The welcome from Brunilda was terrific. A special letter for welcome from the GM ensuring that we had a point of contact if there were any issues. Brunilda provided us with drinks vouchers as well as Breakfast discount vouchers. This made a tremendous difference to the affordability of the breakfast option. which was great. Housekeeping service was great and the hotel is brilliantly placed for 50th Street subway for JFK as well as 42nd street for general subway travel. I stayed last year at the more expensive IHG Intercontinental on 8th and 44 but this was a much more friendly and welcoming experience. i would recommend it.

This was our first trip to New York and the Crowne Plaza was the perfect hotel. It's right in Times Square, easy walk to Broadway shows and great restaurants. Short bike ride to Central Park. We rented bikes at a place that was walking distance from the hotel. Corrine at the Concierge Desk was amazing! She made reservations at two fantastic restaurants and got us last minute tickets to a show and recommended a great Blues bar. I would definitely stay here again.

We had a great experience while visiting this past weekend. Our room was very nice with a fabulous view! We were upgraded to the 40th floor for no extra charge. Check-in was very easy. Very nice lady who had just come on her shift. We checked in on Thursday, April 20th around 2:30. It was a breeze. Very nice and friendly staff through out the hotel. We would definitely recommend the Crowne Plaza and when we visit again that is where we will stay. Also the location is amazing. Step out the door and go wherever you please!!

My girlfriends and I stayed early Dec 2016. Weather was cold & windy but we had a fabulous time! Hotel in great location. We walked to many places and took taxi to others. It was hard to flag down taxis at certain times especially if we were not going very far which was frustrating due to weather being cold. Rooms were very nice and breakfast was awesome! We booked our rooms in Aug or Sept so we got a good rate which included breakfast for $15 which was well worth the money. There were 4 of us so we had 2 rooms with 2 queen beds. They had everything you could want on the buffet; the wait staff were excellent especially Tofael. They suggested places to eat and we're just SO helpful. The restaurant was small but food was good and they gave us coupons for free cocktails! We will definitely stay there on our next trip which will hopefully be later this year.

Tower block hotel in Times Square, step out of the door and there it is, bright lights the lot. Ideal for exploring Manhatten, north south east and west. Shuttle tube to Grand Central Terminal for 3$, not to be missed.

My daughters and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Crowne Plaza. The hotel and location is brilliant. Rooms cleaned daily, free welcome drink on arrival! Staff lovely especially Donald on reception. I'd definitely stay here again!

Everything was super nice. Especially the staff. The lady who checked me in, Brunilda, was incredibly friendly and welcoming. Also the rooms were spacious for New York hotels and there were good views of Times Square. Would definitely recommend!
user_name:
nflippo
New York City, New York

review_body: We had the most amazing time while staying at this hotel over the Easter holidays. The rooms were spacious and warm, we were extremely comfortable the whole duration. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and clean. The check in on arrival was quick and we were very happy with our room, the food in the Broadway restaurant was very nice .

Had 5 nights here and hotel itself is ok. Fantastic views of Times Square (if you pay extra), rooms are average size for NYC although the beds are really comfortable. All staff were extremely helpful when needed. Food and drink is expensive but then you are paying for the location. One piece of advice, this hotel charges a "resort fee" of $30 a night. Not being Americans we thought this was a standard charge for all hotels, this is not the case. The charge is not negotiable so be aware before booking and read the small print.

From start to finish hands down the best stay we've had in NYC. Staff was very friendly and professional. The requests that we had were handled in a very timely fashion. The room itself was very clean and nice with exceptional window views. After leaving, we realized that we had accidentally left our you sons favorite blanket in the room. I called and spoke to Sylvia Geronimo who is a Manger at the Crowne Plaza and she personally saw to getting this "very" important blanket from the room before it ended up disappearing. She also personally contacted me to tell me the good news and make arrangements to get the blanket overnighted to us. Hotel in itself was exceptional. The fact that Sylvia took time out of her day to ensure our sons blanket was returned was just the cherry on top of the cake. From here on out when we're in NYC we'll be staying at the Crowne Plaza.

Comfortable room and great location for Metro access to the various sites. The dining options worked well and there are also some fine restaurants within a few blocks. The hotel staff was very acommodating and very pleasant. Ana and Valerie in the main dining area were exceptional with their sincere effort to make us feel welcome. Also, a first class health club.

Just come back from a weeks stay at The Crowne Plaza. Hotel approx 45-50 min from JFK depending on traffic and a breath away from Times Square. Reception area busy and bright. Rooms a little tired and definitely in need of a refurb for the prices charged but housekeeping staff very attentative. On the downside, they charge a resort tax which we were not told about so was a little shocked to get an invoice for $210 dollars for a weeks stay on the day of departure. Be warned also that there are bus ride touts literally camped out on the doors steps of the hotel which can be a little overwhelming as there approach can feel a little aggressive. I'm surprised the hotel has not addressed this. The hotel is well positioned for access to the Empire State Building, theatres and Central park if you do not mind walking.

We stayed in the crown plaza for 4 nights on a recent trip to NYC. We were greeted by the very helpful staff. We were served by Donald Mei, who was extremely helpful on our arrival. We stayed in room 3202, which had amazing views of Times Square. The room was spacious, clean and modern. The hotel is close to all theatres, bus tour stops, shops and restaurants. The bar and restaurant were both great, and we often ended our day of sightseeing with food and drinks in the hotel bar. Highly recommended for a central location in the amazing city.

I just wanted to say what a great time we had at this hotel. Excellent location, opening welcome at check in and complimentary breakfasts for us all, staff at bar especially last night when we met up with family from Boston. And such comfortable beds, helpful staff with queries on travel and taxis, all so so good. Highly recommend

Generally the hotel was ok to stay, however in our hotel the bath needed re doing it was chipped. The room was kept pretty clean and tidy. The hotel bar was nice with lovely cocktails. The staff were nice and helpful.

Our room wasn't ready upon our early arrival, so our bags were taken and stored for us while we went out to see the sites. When we got back, our bags were brought up to our room for us. The room was clean and neat and we had a view of Times Square. We did get charged for using the hotel bar, which we hadn't used, but the front desk promptly took care of it when I brought it to their attention. Check out was quick and easy. Other reviews had mentioned that Time Square rooms were noisy, but I did not find this to be true for us. As in any city you could hear an occasional siren, but that was about it. Be aware that the parking garage is at the hotel, but not part of it. Parking is on your own and is valet only. The hotel is within walking distance of many great tourist sites as well as all Broadway shows. Further sites, like the statue of liberty, can be accessed by taxi or subway.

We have just arrived and everyone in the hotel has been very pleasure. Victoria the women who checked us in even pointed out a few great places to eat when I asked. Victoria also saved us $90 dollars by getting us signed up for the IHG rewards programs. Can't wait to get out on the town

I've stayed at this Crowne Plaza a number of times and it always delivers. The rooms are clean, it has a great health club on 15th floor, and the staff are especially helpful.It is a block from the Subway (1 line) and convenient to everything. I'm not a big fan of Times Square but make allowances to stay here as an IHG member.I had lunch at brassiere and our server Franc was terrific. The food was very good - my colleague had fish tacos and I had a burger. I've had breakfast here in the past and that was also very good.I expect to return on my next trip.

I stayed here in Aug 1st 2016 for a night... I arrived approx. 8pm... Checked in, checked my room, checked in with the hubby back home and out I went to soak in the NYC night vibes. Having Times Square on your door step is amazing - I've stayed in various hotels during my almost annual NYC visits and this was one of my favourites!The Room/Hotel: beyond spacious considering it was just me and very clean. I loved the view, the toiletries and the chaise. Easy to navigate and always felt safe. Extra: They were more than happy to store luggage after check out so I could continue sightseeing with no time frame.The View: I got an awesome shot of Times Square from my window and it's nice to see it from that high up in both the day & night.The Location: PERFECT! You're literally swept up as soon as you set foot outside, there's Hershey store right next door, MAC literally at the front door, M&M's World across the road and the iconic red stairs a block to the right (1 minute walk) that look toward the famed NYE ball drop site. Plus what seems like an endless supply of eateries and shops.

This hotel had nice size rooms by New York standards, with access to a large fitness center, and a nice bar area that also serves post theater dessert. Very well located to every major theater, and a few blocks away from the heart of Times Square so the noise is kept down to a minimum.

I would love to compliment Victoria. She was amazing! We flew in on the red eye flight and arrived early. She was able to get us into our rooms earlier. Her eyes smiled as she helped us, warm, friendly and very professional. She was a great way to start our vacation.

Service before arriving was excellent. We travelled for my partners 30th Bday and they went the extra mile for me pre and arriving at the hotel. They arranged prosecco /cake and ballons with a card for my partner. This was offered complimentary which was very kind. Arrived to check in - Donald was fantastic. Made us feel welcome and looked after us from the start. Offered us drink vouchers and a great room. We didnt have a river view - but the room was still fantastic didnt matter. being in the centre of the city i quite like the building views. Location - spot on.Right where you want to be. Downtown easy access and uptown very easy access. Room was quiet - barely heard any street noise. Thanks again CP - Times Sq. xx

We are one night into our four night stay. The guy that checked us in was wonderful and worked hard to find us a room with a good view. I booked this hotel specifically because I wanted a view of Times Square. If I get right next to the window I have a partial view, otherwise I am just looking at a building. I definitely would not pay for this view again. Also, my room is right across from the elevators so we hear a ding every time it arrives. We also hear people talk while waiting for their elevator. Most of the employees have been very nice so far. Our waiter in the bar was fantastic. We did pop into the gym at 9:25 pm to check it out and were rudely told by an employee mopping the floor that they were closed. When I said, I thought you closed at 9:30, the desk lady was very polite and told us to come in and the person mopping the floors rolled her eyes at us. We just wanted to ask a question and had no plan to use the facilities so close to closing.

We stayed for a week with our children aged 13 and 8. Hotel staff really friendly and helpful, great relaxed atmosphere at this hotel. We got upgraded to a corner room with brilliant view over Times Square. The Grind & Go breakfast cafe place is really useful as our schedule was packed and this made grabbing breakfast and getting on with the whole tourist thing much easier. My husband and kids used the pool, our only criticism is that you have to book and get a half hour slot in a lane which you have to share. This was fine as it was just them in the lane, but there were other guests who were less happy to do this and some people get snotty about kids being in the pool (ours are swimmers so weren't larking about and it's no good as a play pool if that's what you'd like to do). Also you have to have a swimming hat and had we known we'd have packed our own, it was an expensive half hour swim having had to buy 3 hats at roughly $25. Overall would recommend and stay again as it's a great location, comfortable and friendly.

IHG call center sent me an incorrect confirmation for the number of guests for my (IHG points/money) bookings. A midnight call to the hotel taken by Elizabeth detailing the problem was passed to Gabriela Guzman the Front Office Manager. At 4:18am I received an email from Gabriela assuring me the reservation was updated. Upon arrival she upgraded us to a king room with a rollaway bed. Hotel has it all including a perfect location.

We were not happy with the size of our double bed so upgraded to a King room plus rollaway bed for our daughter with no problem.The room was lovely and quiet. Bar served delicious and very fresh pizza. Hotel is in a brilliant location. Would definitely stay again.

From the minute we arrived to the final check out the hotel was excellent. The staff at check out were fabulous and explained everything about the hotel and what to do. We only waited for 1/2 hour for our room to be ready and the room had great views of Times Square. The room was large and bright and the room was modern. The shower and toilet room was ok could of done with a little bit of an update but was clean and usable. The chamber maid was very good and we had bed made and fresh towels and our room was cleaned everyday. The bar restaurant staff were fun and friendly and we had a laugh with the staff, food and drinks were great. On leaving we left our bags in holding room and the gentlemen that looked after our bags were superb such lovely men. Credit to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel as it's on Times Square and accessible to most attractions in New York. Thank you for a great, welcoming stay. Mrs Peccol

Read the reviews but went with an open mind Not a great start due to having to wait for our room until 430 pm when check in is 3 pmTwo reception staff very helpful but one was not To save us waiting we left our valuables etc in the hotel safe to save us waiting any longer for the room It was worth the wait as we were a.located a cirner room 3501 What a view,good size room great view of top of the rock and Empire State Very clean only negative no fridge Great location on Times Square but door way is constantly blocked by the bus tours The staff in the bar and doorman were friendly and helpful It was my birthday whilst there but the hotel did not respond to my email That was sent before we arrived,but we did get a room upgrade, when we arrived Being an ihg member we had extras from the hotel which were great Wifi and free phone calls are a great addition Beds were very comfortable and shower large

Rooms are very big and modern and have all the amenities you would require, The wifi is free! and is very fast and reliable. The hotel is situated in the perfect location only a 2 minute walk to times square and a 10 minute walk to central park. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I will be staying here again.

Stayed for a week. Great location in the heart of Manhattan. Had an amazing view from our room over Times Square. Breakfast not great value, many places to choose from outside that are cheaper. Only criticism is the hot water, have to run it at least 5min before the temperature becomes constant, especially for the shower.Very happy to recommend & would stay again.

I stayed at the Crowne Plaza hotel in Times Square.. Location.. Location.. Location!!!! The location is great, close to all the action and fun stores which was a hit with my family. Check in was quiteEasy, my room was very nice and a good size for a NY hotel. The staff was helpful especially the waiters in the lobby bar/ lounge.. The one concern I had was the back entrance that's open to anyone that wants to come in. I feel this feature of the hotel is dangerous, I realize the NY Sports Club is inside the hotel but I feel for the safety of the hotel customers, that back door should be better monitored ALL day. I was a little fearful riding the elevator up with various people not sure who was legitimate hotel guest and club members. Aside from this issue and the "Pool" I like the hotel. The pool is really part of the NY Sports Club and is more like a Olympic style pool not very family friendly so my familyOpted not to go in although I was charged a $30.00 fee. The employees were nice at the health club but the pool dynamic seemed so serious that my kids opted to skip it. We loved being able to step out and be right in Times Square and near the Hershey Store and the M&M store. We will stay again.

Very pleasant stay, very welcoming. Erika checked us in and was very helpful, offering us good advice and a very warm reception. Location is perfect, great views from the lobby and just a stones throw to get to center of Times SquareConcierge very helpfulRooms very good, guest services extremely helpful arranging rollaway bed and extra towels The only negative point (which is why I have not give full stars) is that at the bar/lounge area near the lobby I ordered a tea. When it came I asked for soy milk (traveling the world in recent years I have never had a problem getting soy milk in a world hotel such as one would expect at the Crown Plaza). I was told they didn't have soy milk. So I walked to the coffee shop just around the corner beside the lobby to ask if they did, I ended up buying a take away from there and going back to the bar. I don't see why, when it is in the same hotel why this soy milk couldn't have been arranged for me (soy milk is available also in the main restaurant). The server wasn't helpful, answered me quite abruptly when I asked. So I ended up wasting $6, yes six dollars for a tea that I didn't drink at the bar. Next day back at the bar (other members of my party wanted to go there) had a fantastic service from Mahud. All in all a great stay, just the one issue at the bar.

Stayed for a visit with two adults and two teenage children. The position of the hotel is brilliant. Pretty much in Times Square and easy walk to all the theatres. Close to subway stations and easy walk to Rockerfella building and Fifth Avenue. Rooms are small and were quite noisy - could hear the children screaming in the room next door, neighbours talking and we heard the neighbour's doors thud every time they closed (which was annoying when trying to sleep). Bathroom was renovated and had plenty of room. No refrigerator in the room so we had to hire one at a surcharge and it took four calls to the desk and management for it to be delivered. Staff not as helpful as other hotels I've stayed in.

For our 2nd leg of a family vacation, we went to NYC and stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square. I have to say I was very pleased with the hotel from top to bottom. The rooms were clean, the staff helpful & all the small things that make any hotel stay worthwhile was done. My son had a birthday during our visit & they surprised us with a desert and balloons in our room after we got back from a long day. They didn't need to do that - it brought a smile to our faces. Thanks Crowne Plaza - you did a great job!

We stayed here with our daughter and her family for two days prior to our cruise. Located on Broadway Street, the hotel location is perfect for viewing all the sights in Manhattan, particularly Times Square. It's also just a short walk away from a Central Park. We reserved two rooms and had no problems with either room. Our rooms were located on the 30th floor so we had great views out of our windows, and the morning of our cruise, we could see our ship docked at the Manhattan Cruise Terminal. Our rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet. With so many restaurants in the area, we didn't eat at the hotel but there is a very nice looking restaurant at the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again the next time we visit New York.

The location is awesome! Great customer service in al areas, we arrive super early at the hotel, the check in hour was at 3 pm and they allowed us made the check in at 8 am! Super comfy room, great beds! I recommend this hotel 100%!

Centrally located in Times Square. Very helpful staff from check in to housekeeping. Lounge in lobby great spot to wind down after long day. Good drinks and food. Want to recognize Japhet in food & beverage that was especially helpful with places to see, where to find local good eats and spend time. Highly recommend.

We love New York City,especially Broadway Shows.Before we send for our tickets wealways call the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan to get our room reservation. Thehotel is ln a great location and really shows the excitement of the city.The staff is super friendly and really helpful in every way. The hotel is always spotless as are the roomsand all the restaurants and lounges.The food and the service is excellent. If any problem arises you can an immediate response. New York City to us means the Crowne PlazaTimes Square.Barbara and Bernie Hoffman

We had an amazing stay at the Crowne Plaza! Donald M was so helpful in accommodating our requests and worked hard to ensure our stay was fantastic. The rooms are clean with great beds and plenty of space. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the city.

Stayed for a few days on our first visit to NYC. The best aspect of this hotel is the location, hard to imagine any better. Our room, whilst spacious and clean was a little tired looking. On arrival the tv and heating in the room were not working, tv was fixed straight away however the heating wasn't so the room was on the chilly side. All staff we encountered were great, very helpful. Our room was quite high up so the noise from this 24/7 city was not a problem.
user_name:
stephen0654
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: While checking in to the hotel, I had a problem at first with getting the rooms I had been promised for my family. With the help of Adaliz at the front counter and her supervisor, Miliha, we were able to resolve the issue quickly and better than my expectation.
user_name:
nwollenman
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza multiple times in the past and I will stay there again on my next trip to NYC for sure. The rooms are really spacious for New York, clean and really nice. I always had rooms with fantastic views. Internet costs extra wich is the only bad Thing I can say especially considering the already high room Prices but then again, that's NYC. I love this Hotel and I will be back for sure.

This hotel is in good location but the bed's and pillows are terrible, not clean as well. Make sure you always add tax and tips to your bill, this hotel is quite expensive we had to pay extra they said there is a tax on top of the hotel price which we had to pay and in the restaurant there is a 18% tips is automatically added to your bill so please be prepared.

Stayed in this hotel for a week while staying in NYC. When we first arrived at the aiport, people were there to help us if we needed. As we checked in, we were asked if we wanted to join the rewards programme which would relieve us of the $210 resort fee. Great free Wifi and when it was down for maintenance, they set up a internet cafe within the hotel due to their perceived idea of it being an inconvenience. The room itself was very large, we had a corner room looking out over the Hudson and we could also see part of Broadway. It was a great location, close by to everything but also very quiet (which we were not expecting). The room was very clean our whole stay and they were very accommodating and would come back later if we were having a relaxing morning. We did not have much interaction with the staff during our stay, as we didn't need to but when we needed to print our boarding passes and it wouldn't work in the self-service business area, the front office manager let us use his computer to print them. Would definitely use this hotel again for any more trips to NYC.

This is the 3rd time we have stayed here at the Crowne Plaza. We love the location and the great price of rooms....The check in is always fast and very friendly. Access to all that NYC offers is also a plus.....My one negative...and it is the 3rd time it has happened...Service for breakfast is horrific. On this occasion I ordered Pancakes, when he brought them I let him know that I needed Butter and syrup....He said one minute and proceeded to take the order of the table next to ours and we never saw him again....no more coffee or juice, no butter or syrup...I had to go to the buffet line and grab both items.....I will never go to this eatery again As far as the hotel, we will vist here always, just never have breakfast here again.
user_name:
Michael T
Danbury, Connecticut, United States

review_body: Hi I went to this hotel, I will tell you it is so terrible. We walked in and there was toothpaste from another person's mouth on the mirror, there was also a used bar of soap and a used washcloth. So we called about the cleaning services and they took away the dirty bar of soap and washcloth, but they did not take care of the toothpaste. So we went to the front desk and they said that they would clean it, so we went back into our room and it was still there. So then we finally called again and they cleaned it. Also I wanted to go to the pool and we found out that it is a SportsCenter separate from the hotel even though it is in the hotel. Also you have to wear a shower cap or something to cover your head. And the head caps or $8.50 each. Also the food here is really expensive.

Right in the middle of Times Square, very convenient location. The hotel seems a little dated and could use a bit of upgrades but it wasn't bad at all. We stayed only for one night. The best thing about this hotel too is that they have their own parking lot. It's $59.99 to park overnight with the valet and can be charged to the room. It was very convenient for us. We also checked in kind of early and they were very accommodating and called me as soon as a room was ready about 11:00 am well before check in time. I would stay here again if I'm in New York City again.

Spent 4 nights in this hotel. Fantastic location, rooms were huge but only had a shower. We had a Time Square view which from the 25th floor was fab. Bar staff were very friendly. Would recommend it and will be staying there again.

What a fabulous choice this hotel was for the last 3 nights of our NYC vacation. Superb location, very near restaurants, shopping, site seeing and subway stop if you wanted to move around. Staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Bartenders are outstanding and provided great tips from real New Yorkers. Top this off with a great view of TS from our room (4203) and an incredibly comfy bed that allowed us to rejuvenate for the next day of trekking about. This was definitely a winner and we'll be back!

We took two rooms for a week. Ended up a little disappointed.Fortunately we were on the Elite floor,but it is getting tired. The service was poor at best in the bar area, I.e.coffee ordered and the waitress spent time on her IPhone rather than get our coffee! We cancelled it.There was a guy and one lady serving there who were excellent, this lady who did the coffee was poor. As for room service,we asked for more coat hangers, it took 24 hours. They don't deliver room service cappuccinos " as they will be cold"? But we went down to the street collected coffee went back to the room - still hot! Went to the coffee shop in the hotel same again-hot for when we got back to the room! Front desk service manager was excellent helping get items printed. Room was a good size and "not bad". A good location but tired, I would have liked to have given a great review but it is relying on its location too much.

I come to NYC at least 6-7 times per year and I always stay here. Last time I was here there was no heat and my room was freezing. This time they barely had a room ready for me by 3pm (one person at the front desk told me 3pm was not guaranteed).
