In both cases management stepped in and provided free drinks (I don't drink alchohol) and breakfast. That was nice, but I wish they'd just get it right. The location is outstanding but the gym is "public" so it's hard to find a machine etc. I will continue to stay here but... come on guys,

Excellent service. Great manager! Close to Times Square. They have a great breakfast, both buffet and regular.Price was excellent and everything was clean.Beds were comfortable and room had a great view!Would stay there again in a minute!

While in the city to see Book of Mormon with my wife we arrived a little early and parked with time to spare before the show. Imagine driving into the city from Jersey on a Friday night and not sitting in traffic. While we weren't staying at the Crown Plaza we parked at their lot and were greeted by an attendant in the lot and a receptionist in the lobby who could not have been more pleasant and helpful. After taking the advice to kill some time with cocktails at Bar 49 we got a table where we met Tony our server. Between the excellent service, the big smile and personality, and the genuine interest in our plans for the evening, not to mention Tony's knowledge of the show, our night in the city could not have kicked off any better. By the time we finished our drinks we were more excited then ever to see the show. We're back in city next week for a concert and you can bet we'll be planning to arrive early with the perfect place start an evening out. Randy H.

Stayed here beginning of April 17 with my husband and teenage daughter. We had a Times Square view room on the 38th floor which had a great view. The room was clean and a good size. Bathroom was fine but they were a bit mean with the toiletries, only leaving one tube of shower gel, shampoo etc each day for three of us. Eating and drinking in the hotel was expensive, as was the rest of Times Square! We had a great time exploring Manhattan but we're shocked at how expensive food and drink were
user_name:
Dawn O
High Wycombe, United Kingdom

review_body: Spent 4 nights here while seeing shows on Broadway. Great location. We were no more than 4 blocks from any of the shows we saw, with multiple theaters just a few steps outside of the lobby. Customer service was wonderful! Offers delicious room service at reasonable prices as well as a grab and go food station with high quality pre-made salads and sandwiches as well as baked goods. Did not try the full service on site restaurant that overlooks times square. Rooms were a little small, and the beds a titch hard, but more than adequate, especially since we really only slept in the room! We were on the 44th floor and the buildings lit at night were lovely. The lower floors probably have a better view of the neon signs and digital billboards at street level which is probably equally great.For future trips we will most definitely stay here again. LOCATION CANNOT BE BEAT!

The hotel is outstanding , the location right in the heart of timesquare which reflects on the price you pay. The room was comfortable and clean , the view of timesquare from the 34th floor was good. Breakfast was included in the room rate and the warm buffet was basic. Cold buffet was standard, waiters in breakfast were very good. Most helpful was Tofael and order anything from the menu at no extra cost. After a long day , it was great to have a seat in the bar. Here the atmosphere was great and the bar staff were attentive. Complements to staff and management on a great stay and greatly run hotel in a fantastic city.

I get that the location on Times Square is good and it's in NYC, so it's expensive...but at least give me my monies worth. Our room was around $300 a night, stayed 4 nights. Where do I start? The shower started out warm, then went ice cold for 3 or 4 minutes then would slowly warm back up. So there you are all soaped up and you get to rinse off with ice cold water unless you wait for it to heat back up. All around our room, it looked worn down. The bathroom sink was cracked and there was a weird stain on the counter. The headboard was worn out and crummy looking, as well as the chair. (See pictures) They also hit you with a $30 resort fee. What exactly does that cover? I have no idea. It doesn't cover even the business center, which charges you to use the computer and print at the rate of $7.50 minimum, price per minute .50 and color prints $1.50 a page. We couldn't sit near the window to read the paper, as it was so cold and drafty. We did notice a Hampton Inn and Hilton Garden Inn nearby and will definitely check them out for our next trip to NYC in June.

The hotel has a great location at the north end of Times Square. It's convenient to anything you might be in New York for: work, or play. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful from arrival to departure. The physical condition of the hotel is excellent and housekeeping staff takes evident pride in their jobs. I had a corner room on the 45 floor with spectacular views of Times Square and the Hudson River. Even the bathroom had a view. The hotel bar had excellent service, tasty food and a view of Times Square. I usually stay at the W Times Square, and the Crowne was nicer and a better value.

THE GOOD: On my first visit the hotel placed me in a room with a corner view which is the PERFECT SPOT to view Broadway from afar and yet feel the energy coming from the street and people below. And on the following 3 visits I asked for and was given the corner room. Thrilled.THE BAD: Before my last visit with grandson and daughter I again asked for corner room and was told I would have it again. BUT upon arriving was told my request was not honored. HOWEVER the clerk told us to pack our suitcases the next morning and leave in the room and that we would be moved to the corner room when we returned from out day of touring. Not happy but still had 4 days of stay left.THE UGLY: Upon returning that evening after dinner there was no new key. We were told we would be staying in our room from night before. The clerk who had told us that had his day off so was not available for comment. The assistant manager was called for by me but just reworded what clerk just told us.EVEN UGLIER: When we return to our old room a maid was there waiting for a bellhop to come up to take our suitcases to the corner room but she had been waiting for 20 minutes and no bellhop. She called down to see what was going on, got no answer after trying 3 times, needed to go off duty, and we were dog tired and told her to go and that we needed to settle for the night, and truly believed we were not going to be moved anyway. THRICE DISAPPOINTED! To not ever return to Crowne Plaza Broadway.

Visited this hotel in September 2016, the best location in New York Times Square, would visit again. The room is modern and very clean, check in and check out was very quick and staff are very friendly.Will visit again soon

Crowne Plaza Times Square is a typical huge American hotel. The rooms are quite large and comfortable as all other Crowne Plazas but don't expect much from the rest. Restaurants are always crowded and the gym is open for non guests. The reception area is quite busy and noisy the whole day.

The room is dated but that bathroom gets a 2 star rating. The bath tub is warn and the coating has huge holes. Looks disgusting and it should be fixed or replaced. The counter top is stained with well I don't know and Don't want to know. I placed a towel over it to cover it. The bed was comfortable but the sheets look shabby. But here are the good things The service is 5 stars. The gym is 5 stars. Breakfast was included and both the service and the food selection is 5 stars.

We have decided to only use the Crowne Plaza Times Square for our frequent stays in New York City. Our most recent stay reaffirmed our decision. From check in to check out, we received outstanding service from the front desk, the bell desk and maintenance. Two people in particular stand out because of the service they provided us: Erica at the front desk and Valerie at the restaurant. Both are outstanding, long-term employees of the hotel, and management could not ask for better people. Rooms are well maintained and very clean. Public areas see a significant amount of traffic, yet these areas are always clean and well maintained. The location is perfect for us, close to great entertainment, good restaurants and plenty of transportation.Our only complaint is that the hotel controls either heat or air conditioning (depending on the season) and individual controls in the rooms do not enable you to change the temperature. Nonetheless, we will be back soon.

They get this rating for their business center policy alone. We wanted to buy theatre tickets and just print them. One would think that you could do this without being nickel and dimed and DOLLARED to death. Nope. I paid $300 for your out dated room perhaps I could print a couple of tickets??? So much for IHG loyalty rewards..

This was at least our third visit to the Crowne Plaza and once again they didn't disappoint. What a delight to be able to check in immediately on arrival being we had an extremely early flight. Our bags were promptly brought to us and we were off to enjoy our day. The hotel lobby bar has a spectacular view overlooking Times Square for great people watching. We enjoyed a couple of glasses of wine and delicious truffle fries recouping before heading back out for an evening show. The room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel. We will be back when visiting "The Big Apple"!

This was definitely not my first trip to NYC but I really enjoyed the location of this hotel most of all. We have stayed close to Times Square before but staying right there is a whole other experience. When we go we walk a lot as most do in NYC but we usually try to avoid taxis because of the costs. It made it great to stay right there when walking back at night not having to walk very far. We spent our days exploring the city and the nights relaxing in Times Square. The hotel was clean and had great amenities but we didn't take part in many of them. The room was good sized but we didn't spend much time at the hotel. Overall it was nice to be able to run back to the room or split up with a good meeting point when exploring the city.
user_name:
Nicole L
Fife Lake, Michigan, United States

review_body: Overall, the hotel was a very nice and convenient place to stay. Service in the bar/restaurant was a bit slow due to the crowd size on a couple of nights but overall, things were o.k. They had a great concierge named Corrine Paternesi. She was very helpful with dinner reservations, play tickets, boarding passes, etc. She was very friendly and helpful and made our trip much better!

Just returned from a brief stay in NYC. Although time was limited I was able to access all the attractions of Times Square, Theater District and more from the hotel! The spacious, well-appointed rooms provided great city/Times Square views. On-site dining, lounge and coffee shop were suitable options for all tastes. The friendly and helpful staff enhanced our stay as well. I have used this hotel for tour groups as well who have voiced the same praises. Looking forward to returning!!

Fantastic location, staff were friendly and helpful. Beds were a bit soft but that's personal preference. Room size good for NY and bathroom size was average.Overall a decent hotel and I would come back if I managed to get the same deal.

The hotel has a great location, near to Times Square, theatres, 5th avenue and Subway. The room is bigger and the services are goods. The hotel is huge, but the recepcionists should be more friendly. I love the coffe machine in the room!

Went to NY celebrate my 50th Birthday on St Patrick's day and we had a blast in the city, hotel great location, room ok but stayed in better, hotel waiting staff were excellent and on the whole a decent hotel. My trouble as a IHG member was there was no attention to the fact I was celebrating my 50th Birthday even though the hotel had been contacted. I have stayed in a hotel quite a few times for my birthday and always received a bowl of fruit, card, some pastries, even been upgraded to a suite by Marriott but Crowne Plaza you were abismal. So as I said great location, good hotel but was a little disappointed by the lack of any response for the Birthday and especially as an IHG member.

What a SUPERB experience. The CROWNE PLAZA Times Square is a terrific location in the centert of the Broadway show area. The excellent experience was due to:• Very competent, accommodating and friendly staff• Clean and generous sized room for NYC• One of the best showers in a hotel anywhere• Wholesome breakfast buffet• Contemporary and classy sleeping room and public spaces.Stay here.

Not a bad hotel, not a great hotel - just a hotel, average, not sure how many stars they claim this is but at best it is probably a 3-4 star place, luxury it ain't - except the price.The room rate is high, but then you are pretty much in the middle of Times Square, just far enough away that you can walk out of the hotel without walking in to a crowd.There is a subway station around 2 blocks uptown on 50th street so well connected depending on where you need to go.Don't eat breakfast in the hotel, even as a business traveller and not paying it out of my own pocket I can't justify the price. I can't recall exactly but i think it was over $30 for the buffet and then they expect you to tip the waiter who didn't do anything to bring you the food, just took the order - and then took 15 minutes to bring you a cup of tea.Save your money and go to the Times Square Diner, it's on the opposite side of 8th Avenue, just south of 49th street,head out of the rear entrance of the hotel, it will take you 3 minutes to get there.You better hope it isn't windy when you travel there, the windows howl in the wind - very poor.

What a great 5 days.Landed on Monday, blizzards on Tuesday but still managed to get around. They are very organised with snow ploughs out all day. Visited Empire State Building,Rockefeller Centre, Trump Towers, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and Tiffanys of course. Phantom of the Opera on Broadway was awesome. It is a must do if possible . What an experience The Crowne Plaza is in the middle of all the action on Times Square .Our bedroom was on a corner on 24th floor with panoramic views all round. Clean , warm and the bed was very comfortable. Amenities are a gym and swimming pool , would definitely recommend this hotel

Wow what a city.. totally awesome place yes it is as good as advertised, as for the hotel absolutely fantastic location and beautifully modern the only down thing was the gym and pool be ready to wear a swimming hat if you want a swim in the pool that is if you want to pay the 10 bucks to use it per day... but saying that the staff fantastic and great value for money... go here it's great

We stayed at this location with friends as a celebration of our high school sons both graduating this year and had an awesome time! This motel is the perfect location if you want to go to lots of Broadway shows! The rooms were bigger than prior hotel rooms we stayed in while in NYC. We got a corner room and the view of the Hudson River from our room was gorgeous! We were in town for the blizzard of 2017 and were so glad we stayed at a hotel in walking distance to theaters because it was very Cold and slippery outside! The staff at the hotel were very welcoming. The maids were excellent! The lounge was comfortable to sit in and enjoy a glass of wine at the end of a busy day. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

This place is in a great location in the heart of Times Square being only a block away. The hotel is slightly dated and a little worn. The staff were awesome including the bar waiters and the check in girl was very friendly. She recommended places to eat that were very good. The shower ceiling had cracks in it and the toilet was installed crooked as noted in the pics, but overall enjoyed ourselves.

If you are planning to see plays on Broadway while you are in New York, the Crowne Plaza is where you should be staying. You are within walking distance to the theatres,and if you ever tried taking cab crosstown, you can understand the value. The rooms are spacious, and the staff we ran into during our stay all seemed to be happy in what they were doing. If you haven't stayed there, it's definitely worth looking into. We will be back.

We stayed here for 1 week in January. We had a corner room overlooking Times Square. We were warned before hand of noise from the city but there was nothing, it was bliss.The room was comfortable and modern. It was very clean and had everything you needed.The staff were very friendly. If I went back to New York I would stay here again. I would highly recommend it as a place to stay.

Everyone here was so friendly. The check in with Donald at the front desk. The fantastic waiter by the bar/lounge i forget his name. The awesome breakfast ladies and the waiters there. Everyone so pleasant! I am definitely coming back and staying here. I was here with my friend and her kids for a friends 40th birthday.

Stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights and was worried by some previous reviews, however this was largely unfounded. The location of the hotel is excellent and the staff were generally helpful. The hotel has a long way to go to truly be 4 star though. The shower head in my room was coming away from the wall and the hotel rooms look very dated and tired and in dire need of some tlc. Other than that it is still a good hotel and location.

lovely room, great location, great bar. Good concession in foyer for snacks and coffee. Brekkie a bit expensive at $35 per person. We went to green apple about 50m north on broadway and both had coffee and cooked breakfast for about $8 each. If you want a cab DONT get in one outside the stopping area for the hotel- they dont come up the ramp for a reason. Get the concierge to hail one and they are safe and dont rip you off. Wifi not great but free.Mega busy hotel at all times. But its location is awesome. Next door to hershey's world times square. It doesn't get any better.

We stayed here on a weekend break and were certainly impressed. The staff were most helpful (especially Corinne on the conceirge desk), the room was great, comfortable, clean and spacious, and the location was amzaing - right in the heart of Time Square on Broadway. Only slight downside was the prices in the bar. As someone who is used to Spain, Portugal or France where a bottle of wine costs less than €5, paying $26 for two glasses is a little bit of a shock.Overall though a great hotel and great experience

We booked last minute. Got a reasonable rate. But the location is perfect. Being on Broadway one is very close to the Square,theaters and great dining. Rockefeller Ctr is a quick walk away. Fifth Ave is 2 blocks

Our long weekend getaway was fantastic. Checking in with Victoria was a breeze. Our room was ready early and we got to check in around 11:30. Free drink and breakfast vouchers were given to us. The king room was one of the biggest we have in NYC. And the location can't be beat. This will be our hotel of choice from now on.

very nice stay..great room great view and very convenient location..we r def going back again . restaurant was great w complimentary drinks..access to kiosk for discount shows was right across street..room was very roomy w large bathroom..great experience

Stayed here for a mother daughter trip over spring break. We had plays booked for each night of our trip. This was a perfect location to walk to all of the theaters even with heels and in the cold. The theaters are all within a few blocks in either direction. It's also an easy location to get to public transportation to get around the city. The bell captain was very helpful in getting taxis and arranging cars. The rooms are nice but not 5 star. They are nicer than you usually find in NYC. The service was good. The food on the property was over priced in my opinion but it was probably appropriate for the city.

Well, all IHG hotels are expected to be really good. I say this one is good enough. Perfect location (if you really want to stay in the heart of Times Square). Comfy beds and pillows. Spacious rooms. The only thing I didn't like is that there's no fridge. Also, you still need to call if you like slippers, toothbrush and water.

We had a wonderful stay at the Crown Plaza in February. We have been staying here every year for a family getaway since 2001. We also had exceptional hosts in the bar and restaurant area. Rahi at the bar was especially friendly and attentive. We liked him so much we came back three nights in a row just to be served drinks from him. Thank you!

We stay here quite often with business travel. We are able to have comfortable business lunches and dinners. Broadway shows on every corner. Walking distance to The Palm :) Franc A. always provides friendly service. Staff is so welcoming we will always bring our business here m

The service was excellent, the room large and the location was perfect.When asked they let us check out later and keep our room until 5pm.The cafe had nice cakes and other tasty items.I have to commend the breakfast too. Fresh blueberries, gluten free bread and tasty bacon gave us a great start of the day!

Stayed here for four nights. My husband had a conference in the hotel and I came along to see NYC.The beds were made and the room was somewhat picked up everyday but the trash was never emptied, coffee cups stayed dirty, plugs didn't work, and the conference facilities were fair at best.

I have been staying at the Crown Plaza for the past 10+ years and they never let me down. The staff is what makes me keep coming back. I travel alone a lot and the bar is a safe an pleasant place to dine. A couple of my favorite are Keith, Martin and Philip. They go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable.

Can't adjust cooler temperature in rooms since they are only running heat. No soap in their lobby bathrooms. Too long a wait for front desk. Room not ready on time. Bar staff not friendly. Location good. Very busy hotel off Main Street, but no security we saw.
user_name:
whodoyouknow
New York City, New York

review_body: Ideal location and one friendly bar server, unfortunately these are only the good things I can write about Crowne NY. The front staff did not exude warmth and were disorganized. Found a pistachio nut on the carpet floor and hair on the tub and toilet when we checked in. The room provided was small for a family of four. I requested an additional towel and it arrived 2 hours later after I called them again with a more serious tone. Bathroom faucets (hot and cold) didn't work well. Couldn't sleep due to noise. Will definitely not go back to this hotel.

We arranged this trip for a few dozen students and accompanying faculty to experience the performing arts in NYC. The faculty with the group remarked many times on the how smoothly everything went and how courteous and helpful everyone was at the Crowne Plaza (we have not always experienced this on other large group trips at other hotels). They also remarked on the convenience of the location, as it was in walking distance to the Broadway shows they attended and the other sites they planned to visit. I worked with Tim on the arrangements for the trip, and he made things so easy! He was very prompt when responding to questions and really friendly. This was truly a hassle-free and pleasant trip to plan as a result of his assistance and courtesy. The Crowne Plaza really made the experience a positive one, and we plan to use the Crowne Plaza for future trips to New York.
user_name:
krl201112
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: first impressions count and Freddy at the check in desk made a great one. Professional, warm, welcoming, efficient all describe Freddy. With so many choices of hotels in NYC things like a great check in expierence makes a difference and I will stay here again and will also recommend it to friends and family.

Although I booked the room because it was available from a rewards program, I'd certainly look at booking it again if I were paying cash. The hotel is only a block or so from Times Square, so you are right in the heart of the action. It was a 15 minute walk to the Intrepid Museum, which I enjoyed immensely. We had 4 adults with cruise luggage in a double room and there was enough space. Our room was on a back corner and one window looked towards the docks, so we were able to see our ship arrive. I had no issues with service. Check-in was quick and friendly and the room was well cleaned.If I was to offer one suggestion to the Hotel, it would be to clean up the grout and caulking in the bathroom. Everything was immaculate except for that, but it's something your eye is drawn to, and leaves a poorer impression than the room deserves. Even so I gave it 5 stars and would stay again!

Was able to use points - which was my first surprise that it was easy to book using points. My next surprise was when, because of my gold status they put us up in a corner room, with a view of the Hudson, amazing! Location was perfect for walking to and from the train (both Penn Station and Grand Central were 15/20 minutes walks) Also around the corner from many broadway shows. Staff checking in and at the bar could not have been nicer. Will stay again - even if I do not have points to use.

In the heart of Manhattan you can't argue with this hotels great location. The public areas are grand and awe-inspiring. However, the rooms are nothing special, small and typical for an average hotel room,but not a 500 dollar a night hotel. The hotel staff was patronizing and snobbishness, although this could have just been a NY thing.

Best location possible to be in time square .This was my daughters first visit ever to New York we just happen to be there the week of march break when the city was shut down by a snow storm .We went down to the hotel restaurant and met the best waitress ever Takesha they were short staffed and busy but she took the time to treat us like royalty and answer all of questions . The manager was also amzing that day he greeted us evey time he saw us and remembered what we were doing that day and asked how it was . Being at hotel has a bed and breakfast feel in a giant hotel . It was an amazing experience !

We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza in time Square for the weekend we really enjoyed are stay rooms were very clean and there staff was wonderful thank you to the manger Juliet Chang for making sure everything was perfect I would recommend this hotel thank you Mr & Mrs Mcdonald

Booked the penthouse suite for our family March 3rd to 5th as we met up with friends who came over from England to elope. Was so excited to be staying in Times Square in such a nice room. However we arrived to a filthy room with crusty white stains on the couch (so embarrassing as our friends came to visit us), food crumbs on the table, wet feet marks on the bathroom floor from the previous guests, in a room nearly 80 degrees. We were unable to get the thermostat to stop blowing hot air despite multiple attempts to turn it down and off, so we called the front desk who said they were sending up help. Help never arrived!!!! We had to pry open tiny window gaps with pillows to bring in some cool air so we'd stop sweating and our infant wouldn't feel sick from the heat anymore. He was so overheated we had to strip him down and hold him by the pried window in a desperate attempt to sooth him. And he's an easy to please baby. It was just that insanely hot in the room. The crib we asked for at the front desk upon check in never arrived. The bathtub drain was broke and maintenance stayed in our room for an hour working to fix it Friday night. He never could, he was a very friendly man though. We finally had to ask him to stop for the night as we were supposed to be getting ready to meet our friends and it was obvious he couldn't fix it at that point. We had no place to bathe our baby. The shower knobs were all broken and loose. The toilet paper dispenser is dangling off the wall..... There is no microwave, nothing. For a penthouse suite? How disappointing! Had to warm the babies food in hot water from the bathroom sink. The manager of the front desk Chris, who was very polite said he could speak to us Saturday morning after he also came to the room Friday to check in on the status of the broken bathtub drain. We had last minute wedding plans to wrap up as my husband was the minister doing the wedding and I was the photographer. So we couldn't meet. The front desk called Friday night for a time to enter the room Saturday claiming they had to order a part to fix the tub. We said 11am would work as we would definitely be gone after eating and getting everyone ready (we have 2 kids) They never showed!!! Came back to a still broken drain. We tried to rig it with a washcloth so we could wash the baby. The view was NOTHING like the one showed online for Times Square. I was heartbroken to see that. It was very bland and dull. After the tub aftermath when maintenance finally left and we rushed to get ready to meet our friends for dinner and wedding discussions, we went downstairs to meet them at the bar to see they were already closed??? Ha!!! One thing after another. We wound up going out in the cold and wandering down to Applebee's who saved the day so we could have some food. So much for searching for a hotel with food downstairs. We never got any. Upon check out we were so disappointed with everything in our room and had to rush out for the ceremony Sunday morning that we didn't get to meet with Chris to see if we would receive anything for all the trouble. Instead we had the wedding and took the train home. When we came back to grab our luggage to hit Penn Station, we paid cash to take one of the vans from the hotel instead of a cab which cost more. We were shocked that they sat there in front of us fighting over who got stuck taking us. Even after we got in a vehicle they were still arguing. I was so uncomfortable sitting there with my baby on my lap I damn near wanted to cry. I just wanted to go home and get away from that place. The whole weekend was a disaster at the Crowne Plaza. I will never stay at the Crowne Plaza ever again nor will I recommend it to anyone. Wish I had gone back to the Hotel on Rivington I had stayed at before. Or stayed at our friends hotel, The Row around the corner. Less money, cleaner room, things not broke etc. Sounded like heaven after our weekend. I am a former housekeeping supervisor who later became a front desk evening manager/ night auditor years ago, I am quite familiar with the hospitality business and what could have been done for us to make us more comfortable. Nothing was done. Nothing. We were nice and understanding the whole time. Our infant got stuck sleeping in the bed between us since they never brought his crib either and we grew tired of asking for things that never showed. Maybe that's where we went went wrong. Had I been more "assertive" perhaps we would have received better service.

We have just returned from a very enjoyable 5 day stay in the Crowne Plaza. The hotel is centrally located to everything in Times Square and beyond with subway stations close by and Hell's Kitchen - ideal location for food just a couple of blocks away. We could not complain about this hotel and would have no problem staying here again.Our room was located on the 45th floor and overlooked the Hudson River. The room was large enough for the two of us and was well maintained throughout our stay. Bathroom was fine with a good strong pressure from the shower. The bed was comfortable and large and the room was warm which was important as it was minus 9 degrees on Sunday.We had an initial problem checking in, they could not find our booking for 5 nights, but as we had our paperwork with us, this was quickly resolved and we were given drinks vouchers to the value of $30.00.We did not eat breakfast formally in the hotel as we are not big breakfast people but there is a small snack bar just beside the lift which enabled us to grab and go with pastries, hot breakfast wraps etc. I believe it opens at 7am to 7pm. We were celebrating a special anniversary and the hotel left complimentary wine and cake which we really appreciated.We had dinner one evening in the hotel and that was fine and reasonably priced. We found the reception staff, particularly Sandra and the doormen (esp Jim) helpful. The hotel helped us find a good car service to bring us back to JFK which was both comfortable, clean and reasonably priced.All in all a positive experience of the Crowne Plaza which made our time in New York more enjoyable.

My husband did not travel with us. I chaperoned a large group of high school students. We stayed five nights, then switched hotels after Stella hit because our fights were cancelled and the airline directed us to another state. The staff has got to be the most professional, caring group of hotel workers I have met on any of my trips. I am a regular traveler for work to major conventions and I know excellence when I see it.I would like to specifically commend the front desk and the cafe workers. We had 150 teens, most away from home for the first time. When they needed something, the staff was very friendly and helpful every single time. When I needed to find medicines and groceries to ride out the blizzard, the staff helped me come up with a plan. I felt like they went above and beyond.The cleaning staff did an amazing and full cleanings of the rooms. I recommend this hotel to anyone. Also, I need quiet and they have excellent soundproofing and comfy beds.

I chose this hotel based off its proximity to Times Square and it was great. We were directly across the street from M&M World and right be t door to the Hersheys store. There's so much in that area that you don't have to walk far to get to anything you need like great restaurants, shopping, Broadway shows, etc. Xhexkin was smooth. We arrived about 1p and check in time is 3pm. Our room wasn't ready yet so we went over to the lounge and had lunch. The lounge is lines with windows for views up and down Broadway. Great staff, food was wonderful but pricey. We found out pretty quickly how pricey everything was in NYC. By the time we finished our drinks and lunch the room was ready. The hotel was pretty quiet and clean. There are different elevators to take you to different floors so make sure you look at the wall plaque next to the specific elevator to make sure you can get to your room from it. We were on the 15th floor. Our room was at the end of the hallway, directly across from the ice machine and soda machine. The room was clean and smaller than I expected. Im from the south so I'm used to larger rooms, but it was still a nice room. I understand the lack of space issue in NYC,so it was fine. The bathroom,is tiny even under normal circumstances. When opening the bathroom door it almost touches the sink. To get to the shower you have to close the door completely. The shower is roomy though, but the seal at the door wasn't good so we always had a soaked towel on the floor after showering. We had breakfast downstairs a couple of mornings which was good. No pancakes on the menu just fyi. I was a bit disappointed, but I opted for the breakfast quesadillas which was really good. If you don't want tk sit down to eat, there's another eatery that sells bagels/muffins/breakfast burritos/etc on the first floor. Overall we had a great stay and would recommend it to others. Great stay for the money.

I stayed at Crowne Plaza for 4ngts.Check in quick and easy and given corner room on 40th floor which had 2small double beds.There were 4 of us in room so 2per bed which was fine but beds could do with being abit bigger.Not a bad view,nice big tv and coffee maker.Clean and comfortable but the bath could do with upgrading and would be nice to have a mini fridge.Drinks at bar very expensive so only used it once.Didnt eat here so can't comment on food.Used this hotel as a base as was up and out everyday with so much around that you can get to by foot.All in all a comfortable stay.

Had really high hopes for this hotel, however couldn't have been more disappointed to have arrived and had the experience we did. For a start the hotel staff, in my opinion, are only interested in the tips. They are expecting it for the least thing. The clerical staff that we dealt with were nice. Especially Rhona who was obliging especially when our key wasn't working. However on arrival our rooms were not 100% ready as we had arrived early due to our flight. This was, of course, not their fault. I was disappointed, however with that fact that we weren't even offered a drink or a place to sit so therefore were pushed to the side and just expected to wait. When we eventually got into our rooms, it was evident - the place needs a makeover! The hotel is still stuck in the 90s in my opinion. It's very old looking and most things within are very grubby and used. Don't get me wrong the views are stunning from the landings and you're in NYC so you're not getting caught up with the rooms. However you certainly do expect a certain standard! On first inspection of our room I was shocked at the condition. Our shower tray had a huge chip out of it and our sink area was badly stained. The beds were fairly comfortable but the rooms were nothing special. Our view, also was pretty poor. We faced into an office space so there wasn't much to see.Overall my experience of the hotel was rather disappointing and I doubt I'll return.

Nothing about this hotel was above average or below average, I just expected more. The rooms were nice/normal/average. The bed was great. The bathroom was a let down. The mirror was a really nice expensive mirror with the lights in the mirror, but the lights were out of the right side of the mirror which was the main light in the bathroom. Not a deal breaker for me but more of a pain for my wife to get herself ready. The wall paper was pealing away from the wall all the way from floor to ceiling. The caulk around the counter had holes/gaps, needed to be redone & the shower head was really low, I am under 6' tall and had to bend over to fit underneath the shower head. The door had at least a 1" gap on the bottom which let in a ton of light in the mornings when we wanted a dark room. The walls were paper thin, we could here the conversations in the room next to us and could hear them using their hair dryer in their bathroom. None of these are big deals, just part of my expecting more. The lobby/check-in was very nice. Elevators were fast, never had to wait more than a minute. The location was great, right in the middle of everything. But for my money there is nothing that would make me come back here if/when i return to NY.

Was in NYC for a class for work, but Stella interfered with the plans. Was grateful to make it to the hotel ahead of the storm! Snuggled in and stayed at the hotel most of the 2 days snowed in. The room service is faster than expected. The front desk was very accommodating and friendly, which you don't expect in the Big City. The restaurant and bar were convenient and well staffed - even after the storm kept Starbucks closed! Tanesha was the cocktail server and she's wonderful! Comfy beds, great views! I would stay there again for leisure.

Stayed here for a business trip in February. It was clean and comfortable and very reasonably priced for a decent hotel in the area. The bar food was very tasty. The only thing I didn't like was the business centre makes you pay $4 approx for internet. I know that unlimited couldn't be free but it seems a bit mean to me not to have at least ten minutes free.

I was a bit wary about booking a hotel right by one of the busiest and brightest places in New York but I really should not have worried. Our room was on the 33rd floor, was clean and "quietly" decorated - lots of muted colours which is just what I wanted. Good clean bathroom with a good shower. We hardly heard any noise - even the police fire and ambulance sirens seemed to switch off at night - and with black out curtains there was no light from outside. Lovely to wake up and have a great view. We had not intended to eat in the hotel at all but at the end of the day we had one breakfast in the dining room and two evening meals in the bar, all of which were just as good as we got when we ate out, and much the same price. It was also useful to have the little deli on the lobby floor where you could get a cup of tea and a cake after a hard days sightseeing. The location is amazing - step out and there is Times Square - and the subway is very close by. I really cant fault this place and would definitely stay there again

Right at the Times Square, not to pricey.The rooms are really nice and clean.The service was really good as well.It's right at the theater district, lots of stores and restaurants around, right in the heart of manhattan.Bottom line the hotel worth the money!

Went to ny with a large group, 4 families. Booked four rooms. Arrived and by check in time two of the rooms were still not ready. After a long day's travel this was not ideal. The hotel sent us to the bar with some vouchers and that's where things turned around. We met Keith the bartender and he was a delight. The bar/lounge was very nice. He was very friendly and attentive to all of the quests at the bar. He helped make a stressful situation a great time. The hotel is in a great location near all the action in Times Square. Easy to walk everywhere. Great views. Nice rooms and comfy beds. This was our third stay here and I will surely stay again. Go see Keith in the bar. Be warned though, the parking is $70.00 per day.

We had made plans to be in NYC from Tuesday - Saturday but STELLA the blizzard forced us to change our plans. American Airlines was gracious to change out trip at no charge to Monday-Friday but we were unable to get the Crowne Plaza to do so. Went through a nightmare reservation process with Orbitz and Hotels.com and ended up with 3 reservations. HOWEVER...when we arrived at the hotel we were assisted by Donald Mei and, after checking with the manager, he cancelled all our reservations and got us a better price for our 4-night stay...including a corner room looking out on Times Square.

My favorite part of the Crowne Plaza Times Square was our cocktail server Tanesha!!I went with a group of 7 friends and we all stayed at the Crowne Plaza and, every night we all went to the lounge. Thankfully we met Tanesha our first night. Her service was above and beyond (we are a very picky group). Her personality was great. She treated us like old friends and we applicate it.

Stayed here for five nights with my family and it was our first time in the NYC. So we chose the hotel by location. Location was right there in the Times Square. We had a hotel room over looking the Times Square in 33rd floor.Hotel was nice, but we found it a bit outdated. Some of the staff in the reception & bar could have been more customer oriented. But some of the staff were really nice and friendly. We even got a drink vouchers when checking in.Overall a great stay!

I have stayed at the hotel a number of times and I keep coming back because its one of the best located hotels for seeing Broadway shows - no large theatre is more than a few minutes walk. Sitting right on time square you can't beat the location. It also has a nice bar area on the 2nd floor that has good food, reasonably priced for New York, and a decent view. The breakfast buffet I would pass on - didn't think the food quality or service was very good - i tend to just grab coffee at the coffee bar. The rooms are generally larger for New York and clean with the Internet also being good. If you want to be in the heart of the action, you can't beat it. Service is ok - nothing to write home about. Lots of other hotels are friendlier. Also if you are an IHG member, don't expect anything extra from the hotel. I think they are busy enough they just don't need to go the extra mile unfortunately.

Stayed here last Friday and Saturday with my college-aged daughter and loved it! The location is PERFECT! Very clean room, comfy bed, big clean bathroom, plugs for phones everywhere! Very quiet room on the 41st floor. No wait for the elevator. The breakfast in the Brasserie restaurant was good, and the setting is fantastic! The service was superb. Get a table By the windows looking right onto Times Square and enjoy coffee, juice and buffet. Will definitely stay here next time we visit NYC!

What started out 6 months ago as a quiet "Big" Birthday celebration with my wife and I in NY quickly grew into a group of 17 relatives (including TJ) and we couldn't think of a better hotel than the Crowne Plaza Hotel, a hotel I have stayed for several years, has always taken care of us on my many Business and personal Trips, is in a great location but most importantly of all is run by its Managing Director Niles Harris, who in my opinion is one of the most effective, efficient and customer friendly management leaders of a Hotel not just in Times Square but anywhere in the World that I have stayed.For weeks as more and more of my family decided to stay, sent room requests and special considerations (for example a baby ), MD Harris turned me over to his Executive Assistant SYLVIA GERONIMO who worked tirelessly to ensure all requests were taken care of, rooms blocked with great views of Times Square or the River and even proactively suggested a crib, fridge and microwave for one of my cousins who was travelling with a 10 month old baby! She was amazing.On my check-in, MD Harris and Sylvia came over personally to meet my wife and myself, and other family members, congratulated me on my Big Birthday while Sylvia worked with the front desk to check on all the rooms and have them put under my credit card. I should point out that while MD Harris was chatting with us, other guests were greeting and thanking him for their stays. While I have been treated well in other Times Square Hotels (I am also a top tier member as I am with IHG), this is the ONLY one where the top guy in the Hotel made a personal appearance and this is one of the reasons why he stands out among so many senior executives running their properties.Well the surprise appearance didn't just stop there as I soon found out. No sooner had we checked in that Rodney Booij, Manager F&B, showed up with Yanzhi Chen, to drop off a really nice tray of goodies that was as perfect in style and appearance as I have received from Hotels around the world that we have stayed. But it wasn't just for me! Each of my overnight quests not only received a great room but received also the same tray of goodies (see picture). And to top it all, we had waters and soft drinks all during our stay.Thinking already what really generous gestures MD Harris had provided for us, after returning on Saturday night from a wonderful meal at Tao's, my guests were shocked and amazed at the Birthday Cake accompanied by Champagne and Processo that was wheeled in by Manager Booij, with candles, plates and cutlery! My wife who celebrates her Birthday every February at the same time as Basket Ball All Star, and who gets a cake every year for the past 5 years, was stunned at what I received on this special Birthday because it was no doubt the most delicious, colorful, moist Birthday cake we have had at any Hotel celebrating Birthdays. As you will see by the pictures, it was a wonderful surprise for all of us.Later in the evening a few of us went down to Bar that was just about to close and guess again, Manager Booij to the rescue who helped us get our drinks at a lovely Bar overlooking Times Square served by very efficient bartenders.Sunday morning as we were all having breakfast before going our separate ways, Manager Booij coordinated with the Manager at Breakfast to hold aside a few tables for our group, who came over to introduce himself and all of our guests enjoyed the Buffet Breakfast and service by staff (BTW please remember to tip all these staff whether it’s the Bar, Buffet, Housekeeping, Room Service ..).As it came time to leave, what initially seemed like a really unseasonable cold time to be in New York for a weekend (it was cold) was far outweighed by the warm, friendly, generosity of a Hotel that made this definitely my Best Birthday Weekend ever. My extended family and I thank Manager Niles Harris for showcasing the Crowne Plaza at its usual Best and for the leadership that he clearly extends to each one of his employees for their superior customer friendly service. Niles YOU ROCK!

The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It's just on the north corner of Times Square right on Broadway. It has it's own parking deck which is a bonus for those driving in. It has a fairly large lounge/bar area next to the reception area which is not memorable but good enough. This hotel can often be booked at a low rate for Manhatten so thats always very attrative. The rooms are ok, very useable but fairly bland. Rooms will need a refresh soon but are well kept. Staff are friendly, and the front desk will often provide you with drink vouchers when you check in. Overall, this is a good place to stay in the City if all you're going to do is sleep there and use the place as your base of operations.

I stayed here for 7 nights, first week of July. Big room on the 25th floor looking out over the river in between the other sky scrappers. In the heart of times square and walking distance to plenty of subway stations. Room cleaned daily, free WiFi, facility to print boarding pass for free, gentleman who stored our bags got us a taxi. Only slight negative the odd waiting staff in the bar could have been friendlier.

Stuck in NYC due to storms. Had a great stay at the Times Square Crowne Plaza, but had difficulty booking an extra day through third party booking site. Freddy on the front desk got all of this sorted for us with zero fuss - superb service, a great ambassador for Crowne Plaza, and one of the reason's I will continue to stay at their hotels. If you want a great hotel in the buzz of Times Square, this is it.

Stayed there for a couple of nights. The rooms are large and very nice. The buffet restaurant served a good breakfast each day. Our waiter, Ali, was wonderful. The location is great - right in the middle of Times Square. Great for people watching.

Just got back from a 6 day stay at the Crowne Plaza hotel, the hotel was right in the middle of Times Square in the theatre district, there is so much to see and do I don't know where to start.If you are thinking of going to New York buy the New York Pass as it gets you into all the attractions and you also get the Big Bus hop on hop off which takes you all over NY.Another thing when we arrived at Newark Air Port we jumped on the Air Train then onto the NJ train To Penn Station it's so easy and a lot cheaper than a taxi.

We stayed in a Traditional King room with a view facing north. The room was decorated nicely and was very clean. Some of the furnishing were showing signs of wear but that's to be expected in such a large hotel in such a busy location. I was pleasantly surprised to find a stand alone shower instead of the traditional bath/shower combo. The room was quiet and the blackout curtains blocked the incoming light. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning planning to check our bags but "Sandra Esp" was able to get us into a room. She was warm and welcoming and made my daughter who was celebrating her thirteenth birthday feel very special. She also gave us vouchers to enjoy the breakfast buffet and have two complimentary drinks at the hotel bar. Whenever we would see her throughout our stay she would make a point of speaking to my daughter to ensure she was enjoying herself. All of the bar staff were amazing. Our only disappointment with the hotel was the pool. The pool is located in the fitness center and is a lap pool only.

My husband and I came to NYC to see Rolling Stones exhibitionism and booked hotel and air. Didn't know what to expect but the crown was awesome. Corinne at the concierge was even more AWESOME!!! She helped us plan the day with ease. From broadway shows to sightseeing. All in all I'd stay again without hesitation. Room was nice with a lovely view and it was surprisingly quiet considering the location. Highly recommend.

le location is good : very close from time square, but located enough away for not having too many noise... But Inside, everythink is old, very old. he really have the feeling we pay the locaiton ... and Nothing else.Checkin was painfull... they gave us the key for a room with people still Inside !at bar, long to wait before having someone coming to take the order... this hotel need reall to be re shape.

Stayed here for 5 nights with my two friends. When checking in look out for Evelyn who gave us the most amazing customer service from start to finish! We are IHG members so got room upgrade and free wifi. Felipe in the bar was also very friendly and helpful. To be honest every member of staff we encountered were helpful and smiling!! We loved our room on the 45th floor it had a great city view. The breakfast buffet was delicious too. We ate in the bar one night and we were happy with our food and also ordered room service which was good too and reasonably priced! I cant wait to book up again!!

We have stayed at the Crowne Times Square many times and are never disappointed. At checkin our front desk attendant(Victoria) could not have been any sweeter! She was kind, patient and very informative. We got to chatting about my son who lives in NYC and I happened to mention it was our 30th Anniversary trip! She immediately congratulated us and gave us a few comped drink vouchers. Our room was upgraded to a corner room and breakfast vouchers too. We had no idea any of this would happen. Victoria went above and beyond for us and we really appreciated her kindness. She phoned up to our room after checkin to be sure the room was fine. Victoria is a definite asset to the IHG family! Another great stay at the Crowne in Times Square! Great location, plenty to do and see all within a few blocks of walking. In the winter weather its more than convenient in the center of all of the action.

I booked through central reservations, and they failed to tell me they booked a non cancelable, non refundable reservation, non changeable reservation, which was fine, however they failed to tell me at the time of booking it was an ADA room. Prior to my arrival, I got the run around regarding the room that was booked for me. I was contemplating just not showing up and staying elsewhere (the description of the room scared me lol). I came to terms with the situation and realized I would literally be there a few hours to sleep. The gentleman who checked me in was extremely friendly and extended me a warm welcome. I was given a very lovely quiet room. I don't care for views when my main focus is sleep. This hotel is situated in a perfect location to Times Square. Honestly, this location should be an InterContinental.

First off, the location can't be beat. You're centrally located to virtually everything: Times Square, the Theatre District, Hell's Kitchen, etc. I was thoroughly impressed with the staff... everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff were all incredibly courteous and very professional. Unfortunately, the room itself had several issues. My central heat/air didn't seem to work, so the room was constantly either too warm or too cold. The bathroom sink had a constant drip & and the shower leaked. And there's no mini-fridge in the room... so forget about trying to keep any food cool. Other than that, the room was fairly nice overall. And let's face it... if you're spending tons of time in your hotel room while being in NYC, there's something wrong with you.

Great location right in the heart of the tourist area. Be aware that if you book a Times Square view room then you will have the bright lights flashing 24/7 and as the rooms dont have complete blackout curtains the light can be annoying. No fridge in room.beds were exceptionally comfy. Jephet in the lounge bar was best barperson we have met in years. Our booking was direct with ihg but if done through bookings.com breakfast was included. Strange that. If arriving at hotel on Broadway side then reception is up escalators but no signs show you. Concierge guys very helpful.

We stay at this hotel regularly. The location is great. The rooms are decent in size (not a given in NYC) and the staff work hard to provide great service. The health club is first rate. Book a room rate that includes breakfast buffet.

The hotel is centrally located, which is for me the only good thing about this hotel. The check-in counter had a long queue and if not for my husband's ihg platinum membership, we could have waited for a long time. The room was nice and clean but we could not make the airconditioning work. We called for service and the grumpy man told us not to switch the ac on as it is for heater and we should just open the window as "natural airconditioning" but it did not do the trick as our room was too hot! We had breakfast at Brasserie 1605. The food is good and has variety as well. Upon checking out, we requested for a bellman as we have eight luggages with us, but we waited in vain. We ended up taking our stuff down ourselves. The valet and luggage persons didn't even offer to help and even told us they won't be responsible for looking after our belongings while we went to collect them a few at a time! We won't even have to do that if there was help! Seriously, the service in this hotel greatly needs improvement.

We have just checked out of this hotel after staying for 1 week, and we travelled all the way from England. We came to New York to celebrate my birthday, and on our day of checkout 11th March our trip was ruined. We were not aware at all we had to pay $210 resort fee for our stay. Not only is this absolutely ridiculous as the price to stay here is already incredibly expensive, but we did not use ANY of the facilities which they charge for. We did NOT use the pool/health club/fitness centre and we did NOT use the telephone.I understand why they have this fee, to keep these facilities going, however I find it absolutely shocking, when you do not use these facilities, that you have to pay for their upkeep. There are plenty of other guests who use these facilities, that will cover these charges.I reluctantly paid the fee, but I am disgusted with this charge and the poor service from the hotel regarding this issue. I came to NYC in November 2015, and stayed at the Marriott Marquis Times Square. My stay here was fantastic!It was only £200 more expensive to stay there for this trip, but I wanted to try something different. I will not make this mistake again. The Marriott had fantastic service and I would rate it 5 star. Crowne Plaza could learn a lot from them. This experience has completely ruined my birthday and the New York experience for us and I will definitely not be staying here or at any other Crowne Plaza again, or recommending this to any family and friends.

Stayed at the Crown Plaza last month for a business trip. The location was excellent for seeing time square. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. The hotel is very clean and well kept. Rooms were nice and spacious and appear to be recently renovated. I would recommend this hotel if you are planning to stay near time square

Hotel room was available and I was allowed early check in. Great! Room was decently clean and the service was good. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant and Tofael was our server. He was very friendly and helped us with our selections. Overall, the stay was great for just me and my friend. We enjoyed ourselves as it was a girls trip. The location was walking distance to shops and restaurants too. I would consider this place again should I decide to return to NYC. I booked a flight/hotel package with Expedia and thought the hotel price was fair for about $224 a night, which includes the resort fee that I paid at the hotel.

This property has very old rooms that are not very spacious and also have very small beds for two aduls. Also free-wifi was not available in the room so if you need free wifi you have to go to the hotel lobby.The location of the property is amazing, right on Times Square.

Our first stay in New York. We were quite excited and our room was ready late afternoon when we arrived. Nice desk staff. The room 2603 was clean and okay for our four day stay. We had a front street view and could see Times Square. Breakfast was included and was nice. This is a very busy hotel and there always seemed to be people hanging around the foyer. Very noisy but our room was quite except for the yapping dog in the room across the hall. We complained several times as did other guests. The people seemed to leave the dog all day and most of the night. It just barked every time someone walked past the door. Not a cheap hotel, feel sure they could sort the dog people on a particular floor away from guests trying to sleep after a long day site seeing. The other thing that surprised us was no evening meals only room service.

We went as a family trip and decided to stay in the thick of time square because we had teens with us. I was very hesitant about the quality of the hotel being so convenient to everything in time square and relatively inexpensive. We stayed in Times Square at another hotel last year and paid double the price. Hotel was lovely, so convenient to Broadway theaters and to see Time Square -it is right next to the Hershey store and across the street from the M&M store! Kids absolutely loved the location. Hotel was clean, everyone was friendly and helpful. Concierge was great. I would recommend for a family that wants bright lights and big city and who is on a modest budget.

We stayed here for five nights. Check in was early for is about 1pm but our room was ready as soon as we got there.I mentioned my IHG rewards membership and the daily resort fee was waived.We were on the 31st floor, room upgraded to a corner room, with a view of the Hudson and part Times Square. The room was very quiet, the bedroom was very spacious, bed was huge and very comfortable.We didn't really use any of the facilities as spent most of the days out and didn't dine at anytime either.The hotel is bang in the centre of Times Square so such an ideal location!Towels and toiletries provided, in room safe, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, coffee maker.Really couldn't have asked for more!Thank you for making our stay so wonderful!!!

Hotel is lovely! The staff are amazing and so friendly. Rooms are very spacious & super clean! Maids came in every day and the one day we had the do not disturb on they phoned to check if we wanted clean towels which was lovely as usually they just wouldn't bother! High pressure Shower which is a god send when your away from her. Brilliant location with it being right on Times Square, ate in the restaurant once had chicken wings (v spicy!) and pizza both lovely & took the leftovers to our room. Would highly recommend!

I recently visited new York for the first time with my 16 year old daughter and stayed in this beautiful hotel. After booking, people were putting me off staying "stay clear of times square" and actually it was the most amazing place to have the hotel it was central to everything we needed. Bus tours and subway on the next street,port authority bus station a few minuted walk. The Broadway theatre 3 minute walk and times square at the front door. We didn't spend much time in the hotel which was a shame but we were so wiped out after being out all day we had ten minutes of TV and a hot chocolate then asleep. The room was gorgeous,spacious and the staff at front reception were lovely. The first room we got on the 20th floor didn't have a great view but after going to reception she assured us if our bags were packed in the morning we could go about our day and the bell hop would happily move our bags to a new room and to our delight we got back that night and our new room was on the 46th floor (top floor) with some amazing views of the Hudson river and more of manhattan. We didn't get to use or even see the gym or swimming pool as we were too busy being tourists. You do get a complimentary drink each at the hotel bar which also looks out onto times square so that was lovely. There's a kettle,tea and coffee facilities,hairdryer,iron and ironing board all in the room and a gorgeous bathroom. The maids were in everyday and hopefully enjoyed the shortbread we left them everyday. Thanks for an enjoyable stay it made our holiday extra special knowing we were coming back to a lovely warm clean room every night x

The location of this hotel is totally fantastic. It is literally on times square, so it makes it really easy to get out and about in the city! Rooms - Really clean, large and comfortable. Brilliant views of the city and time square. The bed was a 'king' but in the UK I would judge this as a super king! It was extremely comfortable and got some brilliant nights sleep. The bathroom was clean and the shower was really nice and powerful! Towels changed daily and you could opt to change the bed sheets whenever you wanted by putting the card on the door. Had a built in safe to also and loads of room for your clothes to be stored. The only downside I would say is that the room did get really hot at some points. We addressed this with reception and guest services who provided us with a fan to start and advised they could put a portable air con unit in the room if we wanted. Was dealt with really quickly and in an excellent manor.Staff - Everyone would go out of there way to help you. The bell boys downstairs would get you a cab if you needed one, they stored your bags and took them up to your room when it was ready. There was a coffee shop in the lobby of the hotel so you could go down and get one, it opened pretty early so that helped, as we were up really early with get lag. We used the concierge a couple of times also, and they couldn't have been more helpful!Bar 49 - The bar was brilliant - reasonably priced. Some of the waiters were more attentive than others, but the drinks were a generous pour!! Great views overlooking the square! If I was to come to New York again - I would 100% stay in this hotel! It was brilliant!!

We booked the Crown Plaza Times Square and got a great deal through Expedia. Our trip was in February which I think helped with prices but I was very pleased with what we paid per night in Times Square. Our flight arrived early and we were dropped off at the hotel before 10am. We were prepared to store our bags until check in at 3:00 or 4:00 but we were told we may want to go ahead and check on our room. Sure enough, we checked in and were able to go straight to our room, unpack and be out to see NYC by 10:30 am. Once again, I feel this was due to the mid February and off season for tourists. The room was very nice, clean, and modern looking. The entire hotel was very clean and well maintained. We used the small cafe near the elevators a few times for breakfast and had a drink in the bar which offered a great atmosphere. We did not eat at the restaurant but it looked very nice with a view of Times Square. We also used the concierge to order show tickets. We were both very pleased with the hotel, staff, location, and price. We also used my IHG (International Hotel Group) membership and got great points. This also allowed us to skip paying the daily resort fee of about $30 and we saved around $120.00. I recommend this hotel and would highly consider staying there again on a future trip.

stayed for 5 nighs what a great hotel .lovely veiws from the room .great service from the staff .breakfast a bit pricey but theres a italian buffet all you can eat for 10 dollars over the road very good .if i ever go back to new york i would defently be staying at the crowne plaza

Really nice hotel in an amazing position right in the heart of Times Square but really impersonal and for such a big hotel I was surprised at the lack of decent amenities in the room.Basic rubbish coffee and tea maker and no fridge ! You could hire one tho at a price !The charge for use of the wi fi , gym and pool should also really only be a pass if you want to use them (we didn't)I couldn't fault the rooms for cleaness and no one bothers you once you check in which was quick and polite . I would stay here again if only for the location

Grateful. I left my purse in our room at this hotel. When I realized it I got in touch with Crowne Plaza security and Albert Valdes popped that thing in a box, cash, cards, life and all and dropped it of off at UPS on his way home on the train.

We're newly weds, first time to NYC. We were served by Donald Mei and HE MADE OUR STAY!!! He was so helpful with all the arrangements, treated us so well, was so warm and made us feel right at home!We're def coming back!! Thanks Donald.

We visited at a slow time of year so the cost was great and we asked for a quiet room were upgraded to a corner room with a view of both times square and the Hudson river on the 43rd flow that was super quiet. Staff was very friendly and efficient and the gym was fantastic. You could run at Central Park in the morning, visit attractions during the day and hit plays at night mostly on foot. Only cons were the sink was clogged when we arrived and the ironing board was broken but they quickly got those fixed. Would stay there next time we go.

Senior couple stayed 5 nights; comfortable and accommodating; can't beat the location; all the amenities you would expect from a large hotel; housekeeping is swift in the morning; very busy during the off-peak season; will return.

We were celebrating our daughter's 13th birthday with a family trip to NYC. The hotel was very nice. Rooms are as big as they can be for being in NYC. Super clean. The corner room view of Times Square had everyone at the windows when we weren't outside. The location was perfect for the shows we planned to see and the subway stop was right there for everything else. My husband and son enjoyed the extensive gym facilities. But what really made it great was the staff. They had so many little niceties and surprises at every turn that made our family feel comfortable and our daughter feel like a little princess. The restaurant staff was very attentive. And we really enjoyed chatting with Ali and Gloria. They made our daughter's birthday weekend extra special.

Wonderful experience. Great customer service. Excellent amenities. Great location for tourist attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very helpful, they went above and beyond to help us when our room was too hot. Sandra E. gave us upgrades and vouchers since we were IHG Elite Level. The restaurant breakfast buffet is excellent.

This was our first visit to the Crown Plaza.The room was very clean and comfortable, breakfast was great with lots of choice. The highlight for us was the warm, friendly service, particularly in the bar, Broadway 49. Our host Richie welcomed us every day, was extremely helpful and surprised us with Champagne and Strawberries, delivered to our room for our wedding anniversary, we were very touched. It's this care and detail that makes your stay memorable and gives the hotel it's great reputation. We will certainly return to the Crown Plaza,.

We had a great experience at the Crown Plaza over a long weekend in NYC. The people working in this place are top notch and so friendly and helpful, especially Richie in the bar/restaurant. The place is clean, comfortable, nice, and a great location. So close to theaters, Time Square, Central Park, subway, the Rock, etc.

Well what can I say apart from how fantastic this hotel is. The staff on reception are outstanding and very helpful. I was given a corner room on 40th floor which was just incredible. Spacious and clean with a huge TV on the wall.Breakfast was stunning with a good selection.The location of the hotel is perfect. Times Square is on the doorstep.The only complaint I will make is being told that I couldn't sit by the window in the bar unless I had waitress service. I was a paying guest at the hotel and was refused a window seat to have a birthday drink. But that is the only complaint. Other than that everything is just perfect .
user_name:
Kevin J
Rhondda Cynon Taf, United Kingdom

review_body: Room had great view of Times Square, great location to everything. Staff upon entering the hotel was great. But I have to say that Victoria, on check out, was very personable and took great care of my sister in law and myself. Thank you Victoria, you are an asset to the company.

First time in this hotel with my daughter for two night,we were received with a great smile from Evelyn,she was quick ,efficient,and very friendly,our room was very clean and the view we have from it is quite amazing. We would certainly come back again !

The room location cleanliness were all excellent. However, the staffing is phenomenal here. We arrived early and really wanted to check in early, Michelle at the front desk was so friendly and accommodating. She looked and found us a room that was available so we could go freshen up before hitting Times Square. She was excellent! This is and will continue to be my go to spot in Times Square.

We have just returned from an amazing time in NEW YORK. We stayed at the Crowne plaza and couldn't fault it. It's a great location for being right in the middle of it all but once your in your room you don't hear anything (we were on the 31st floor facing the Hudson). There are all the bits and bobs you need in the bathroom, towels, shampoo, shower gel, etc.. there's a hairdryer, safe, charging sockets for phones and tablets and a coffee/tea filter in the room which gets replenished every day. We found the staff to be friendly and pleasant especially Alex the concierge he was fabulous, very patient when we fired 100 questions at him and he also helped us by booking our rangers game and helicopter flight, which were both amazing. Also in the bar Jason, nice guy, he was great to talk to and made us feel very welcome chatting away while we sat there, making us feel very relaxed.I would definitely stay here again and recommend to all.

Clean rooms/beds, shower worked, beds lovely and comfy. Does what it says on the tin. Great hotel. Had one small glitch though, they forgot to leave clean bath towels (not noticed till am) and didn't rush to the rescue either. Other than that to be fair we had an amazing time. $30 fee charged per night per room on top of your bill. Location is really good and everything is within walking distance. Even Central Park. Bar prices are very expensive. 3 straight jack Daniels came to $42. We never ate in the hotel at all as there are so many places to grab a bite to eat. Would recommend the New York Pass if you are thinking of doing the touristy things. We saved quite a bit. Try "The Ride" absolutely hilarious and included on the NY Pass. Also the big red bus is included on the pass. They do 2 routes. Uptown which goes up by Central Park area and beyond and downtown which goes by the Hudson River, 9/11 and ferries that go past the Statue of Liberty. You can hop on and off as many times as you like. The roads going across are the numbered avenues and the roads off those are the streets and are numbered. If you can remember this you will get to places a lot quicker. Hotel is only 2 avenues away from 5th Avenue. Very pricey city so you will need lots of dollars but you will have an unforgettable experience.

We booked with this hotel for our first trip to NYC. Upon arrival, we were told that there was a system error, which meant that we could not check-in at this point. IT issues are inevitable, and we were promised that we'd be 'looked after' by another member of staff, so this was fine. However, we were not 'looked after' at all; 3 hours later and we had no updates regarding the system, and the member of staff was clearly not in a helpful mood. This was from from ideal, given that we'd just travelled for 9 hours, and couldn't even find anywhere to sit and wait. Eventually we checked-in and were satisfied with one of the rooms - after all, this is a fantastic location, and definitely serves its purpose (comfy bed, coffee machine and lovely bathroom). The second room was slightly grubby, and the bath was chipped. In all fairness, the rooms look like they could be doing with updating, but they're certainly not unbearable. The maids are very attentive too - in fact, they're far more attentive than any of the reception or hotel staff who're supposedly trained in customer service. I think our stay would have been far more enjoyable had their been better communications. We tried to contact the hotel beforehand via email/social media on several occasions, yet never managed to throughly clarify any of our queries. We also noted that we were visiting as part of a 21st birthday and how special it would be to have a nice view - something we didn't manage. Again, this is completely fair enough, but a bit of correspondence would have been nice. Not sure you're considered to be priority if you book as part of a package holiday. Another example of this is when we approached reception regarding paying for a late check-out. The member of staff was extremely dismissive, and I feel that this sums up the attitude of most of the staff there, which is really disappointing. There were a few exceptions to this - again, the maids were fantastic, and one of the younger members of staff was so helpful in giving us contact information for reception should we require anything for the rooms (something the 'receptionist' herself failed to mention...) Overall, an average hotel which could be vastly superior if the staff could learn to treat non US guests with a bit of respect.

Shout out to Richie and Tanesha in the restaurant who made the Crown Plaza look GOOD! They were truly the exceptions to everything else I have to say. Polite, courteous and personable in each interaction. NYC is always a blast, and when you're looking to experience Broadway; there is no place better to stay than Time Square. I've big to the Big Apple more times than I can recall; so I know what it looks like when it's Right. Our experience at the Crown Plaza was as indifferent as most of the service. The front desk staff truly fit that bill. Not rude; but definitely indifferent. During our stay it was apparent that "customer focus" was NOT apart of their culture. We had the opportunity to observe them as we sat in an area of the Crown Plaza's "pay to play" restaurant, hoping not to be asked to leave while we waited for our room. I can not believe that the hotel has only 4 chairs in their lobby. Guest were forced to either stand around or grab something from the restaurant while waiting in the lobby. I feel this is ridiculous, especially for a hotel that charges a resort fee. No morning paper, coffee, pool, etc. All of which are typically associated with such daily fees - but only 4 chairs! Are you kidding me?
