I stayed here a few times now. Nice, comfortable, quiet hotel right in the heart of Times Square. Great big bar with windows overlooking the action. Bar food is excellent. Never tried the restaurant (Brasserie 1605). Staff always helpful in my visits.

We stayed here in early March 2017, the location is superb if you are being a tourist and also good value. We had a little problem with our room when we checked in which was sorted out quickly and efficiently by the staff. The breakfast is decent too.

Normally stay at the four points but this time opted for the crowne plaza in Times Square for the NYE celebrations. From the outset Emily Borg was outstanding with her assistance with regards bookings etc. her assistant Alexander was equally outstanding especially with passes to be able to enter Times Square on NYE. Had a brilliant rooms (x4 pax) on the 36th floor which unfortunately did not overlook the Square. Found a welcome basket with fine wine and cheeses as personal welcome gesture from Emily (we hail from the same rock in the Med ). Breakfast in the hotel was brilliant. However did not try hotel restaurants.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for 3 nights February/March. The hotel is modern, busy, and in the heart of Times Square. Booked a room with Times Square view, this was an upgrade I can recommend warmly. Spectacular view with skyscrapers and billboards from your window. Great help from the staff with our luggage at both arrival and departure. Room clean and with all facilities except minibar (could have used a refrigerator). Perfect location for the theatre district.

This is the second time my friend and I have stayed here and we really like the convenience of it. We spend most of our time at the shows and there are plenty of restaurants and shopping near by. The rooms are clean and we've enjoyed drinks and apps at the bar but we have not tried the other food venues within the hotel.

I have been 5 times in this hotel in 5 years, it is affordable and really well located.I tried all the "views", times square, city, hudson. Times Squares is on the east and you have the sun in the morning, the view is great and not too noisy. Hudson view is on the west/south and you have the sun the afternoon/evening. City view on north never get sun which is ok in summer because the room can get hot.Location? You are on Times Square, you can do some shopping there and get back to your room just by walking. You can easily take a walk to: Bryant Park, Grand Central, Rockfeller Plaza, Central Park, even Macy's. Lot of restaurants behind the hotel.There is diner in-room, I did not tried it but the menu is affordable, way cheaper than Hilton, there is even a kids menu. There is a bar in the hotel where it is nice to relax the evening taking a glass of wine while watching outside.The room are ok, small coffee maker, no fridge/microwave, we didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel except for sleeping, so that's ok. Only problem I noticed is the mattress is really too soft, with two people inside you both sink in the middle. Pillows were great, looks like feathers' ones.Service is top notch, valet, bellboy, lobby, etc after 5 years I recognize people there and they are the same, like Eugenio at the bottom door who is greeting you and help with luggages. In this hotel, if you need something, you just ask :)Parking is through a 3rd party, at $70/day is basically the most expensive in Manhattan :-( so if you can avoid it, do it. There is a big fitness center and even a swimming pool.All in all I will return to this hotel for sure.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Time Square June 2016Location was faultless!!! directly across the road from mnm world and 1 minute walk to the middle of time square.I emailed the Crowne Plaza prior to my arrival to inform them we were heading over from Australia to celebrate my auntys 60th birthday if they could accommodate us in any way maybe a free upgrade only to get no response We arrived at 8am after traveling 24hrs and had requested early check in. We were greated unhappily with our systems have been down all night no you cant check in early come back at 3pm leave ur bags down stairs and no you can not have a upgrade we are fully booked.When we finally got to our room it was a decent size for 3 people, very clean, as we had a high floor the noise was very minimal. would of loved a mini bar fridge but other then that the room was great for the price we paid in the location we were in. The day before we were checking out we went to the concierge/bell boy to book a big car to take us to the airport in the morning as we had a 6am flight and the 3 of us has 2 large suitcaes each. we checked out went down stairs and paitently waited for our car to arrive, after half hour we started to panic thinking we were going to miss our flight as the traffic was crazy, when we approached the bell boy for the second time he said oh i just looked again there's no car booked for you ill hail you a cab!!! blood levels through the roof. he hailed the most smallest hatch cab i've ever seen and cramped us all in like a tin of sardines! The breakfast at the hotel was delicious and the staff in there were friendly much friendlier then reception. over all our stay in New York was amazing and this hotel is located perfectly

I'm a business traveler that travels to New York City several times a year and I always stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square. The location is hard to beat as it's on the edge of Times Square which makes it just close enough to the fun but I can still walk to work without fighting the massive crowds milling around the heart of Times Square. The hotel staff is always professional, friendly, and efficient starting with Robert at the front desk. I always look forward to seeing his welcoming face. The rooms are clean and rather large, unlike many hotel rooms in New York City. You will have plenty of space for your suitcases as well as any shopping bags you pick up along the way without having to step over anything to walk around your room. I mention this because I've stayed in other hotels in the area that have tiny, tiny rooms. The bathrooms have plenty of good lighting, counter space, and decently powered hairdryers which I really appreciate! In all the dozens of times I've stayed at this hotel, my rooms have always been clean and well stocked. The Wi-Fi signal is strong and reliable, which is also very important to me. Should you need it, there's also a small safe in every room to lock up your valuables. The breakfast buffet is quite large with a wide variety of options from traditional American dishes to European meat and cheese options. There are also quite a few bread and pastry options as well as oatmeal, juices, cereal, fresh fruits, and yogurt. The restaurant is usually quite busy in the mornings, cut I can honestly say I've never had to wait more than a minute or two to get a table and the servers are very quick to take your order and fill your coffee mug. The restaurant also has windows all around so everyone is treated to a nice view.The hotel bar is a really nice atmosphere. Over the years I've found Jason, Marty, Phil, Keith and Kim to always be professional, yet fun! They do a great job of making everyone feel welcome. I see it over and over again, whether there is a first time guest or a returning guest at the bar, they take great care of everyone. Karim, one of the managers, is often nearby and is quick to share a laugh as he checks in on the guests and the staff. I've met so many interesting and wonderful people from all over the world at the bar. Stopping by for a drink is always a highlight of my trips to New York. I really can't say that I have any complaints about this hotel. Over the years, I've stayed dozens of times and had a really good experience at every stay. There's a reason I continue to stay even though there are countless other options in the area.

This was my 5th time staying st this location and they have never disappointed me! Checking in was easy. Our room wasn't ready yet, so they upgraded us to a higher floor. The view was amazing! The room and the bathroom were clean. The location can't be beat. Right in the heart of Times Square, you can easily get to Rockefeller Center, theatres, dining, shopping and the subway. If you don't want to leave the property for food or drink, you don't have to. The 1605 Brasserie serves a full service menu and the menu at the bar is also very good. The bartenders will take care of all your beverage needs.

We were lucky enough to have a room on the 46th floor with an incredible view of Broadway. Yet, even in the lobby level dining room with the wide open windowsource, the view was still vast. The breakfast was quite good, too.

This hotel has one of the best locations on the planet which means they have an enormous amount of traffic all year around. This results in making the service extremely average if not below because they simply do not care. You will not find anyone to help you with luggage coming in or going out. Parking is extremely expensive at $75 a day and there is no special rates for the hotel guests. Still for me the location make up for it all and worth the stay as this is my 5th time to stay here and value for money overall is good.

Victoria Martin spent an hour with me working through reservation issues. She was patient, kind, and persistent in solving the problem.The hotel gym is the best I have seen. They even have a pool on the 15th floor!

This hotel was great; fantastic location, staff are incredible and very insightful. During check in we watched staff deal with business groups and families effortlessly. We stayed up on the 22nd floor and received a few complimentary vouchers for drinks. Take note of when the bar is showing sports though as it can get busy! Only bad point is the food/breakfast is extremely expensive compared to how easily/cheap you can buy similar items outside in the cafes!

Well positioned on Times Square. Handy to the subway, restaurants and theatres. The Rockefeller Centre is an easy walk and if you walk a few more blocks you can check out Grand Central Station. It was a large room which gave us some space. The bar downstairs was a lovely spot to have a drink. We also enjoyed the buffet breakfast each day. Overall a great hotel with great service in a great location.

All a bit tired but fabulous location right by Times Square. Despite a lick of paint needed, nice toiletries, really good shower, good hairdryer and very comfortable beds. So it ticks all the important boxes. Even the coffee maker is pretty decent - just take time to read the instructions and don't try the tea!There's a nice bar area with really helpful staff. The concierge was lovely and when our room wasn't quite ready offered us drinks and breakfast tokens without waiting for us to even mention a complaint. Good customer service.We got a really good deal with British Airways and I can recommend it.

We decided to bring the kids (6) to NYC and made The Crowne Plaza Times Square our base of operations. It was a great central location to see the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful with understanding the subway system. Our two youngest LOVED the room service menu.Based upon a snow storm prediction, we came in one night early and they were able to accommodate our needs for our two rooms.

We stayed at the Crown Plaza Times Square two nights during a family trip. The staff was very pleasant. We had great service in the evenings at their bar area as they would always try to accommodate our large group. But one employee really stood out as exceptional. Her name was Joan, she took care of our room each day. Joan greeted us each morning with a beautiful smile and positive attitude. Our room was always pleasantly clean when we returned. These employees really made our stay nice, we will definitely return!

The location is excellent, breakfast is nice, staff is friendly ... highly recommended Room was clean & suitablef or 2 adults & 2 kids (13Y,9Y) .I will definitely choose it again if I visit NW in future .

Just stayed at the Crowne Plaza for our first visit to New York- the hotel is very good, we had a room overlooking Times Square which had two double beds - more than adequate for a family of three. Staff were excellent, breakfast good with plenty of choice, bar food and drinks good and all in an excellent location for all main attractions. Would definitely recommend!!

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We were on the 22nd floor with a view over Times Square - amazing. The room was warm and cozy. The Bed was huge and very comfortable and pillows were a dream to sleep on. All staff were happy to help.

The location was central to all we wanted to do. The staff was courteous and helpful for the most part. But what we really want to say is thank you to Maria Santos who was our housekeeper during our stay (Dec 7-9th). She was receptive to our requests and was always pleasant and kind. A special thank you to Maria for making our stay very comfortable!

We stayed at the hotel during February 2017 and had the most amazing time. Not only was the view from our room breath-taking - waking up to the Empire State building and Times Square every morning this trip was made extra special by the Food & Beverage Outlet Manager Karim Sharif whose hospitality was simply outstanding. His bar staff Jason Moreland and Kim were friendly and professional and really did make our stay one to remember! Thank you SO much. we really were sad to leave. Lucy and I will be back one day! Love Christie xx
user_name:
ChristieJBarlow
Barton under Needwood, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed for a few nights in February '17. The hotel staff were VERY friendly and professional. The rooms were very clean. No funky smells like I've found in other NYC hotels (usually air freshener to mask the must or smoke smells). The shower curtains don't work too well - too much water coming out where it doesn't meet the wall. We had to put towels down to keep that from happening, but the wall paper was already peeling back. The sinks were cracked and there was a lot of noticeable dust in the vents. Our shower would only get hot after running the water for at least 20 minutes. We did have to call maintenance as soon as we got there to fix the HVAC - they were VERY quick to respond, though!! The beds were very comfortable. Parking is $70 a day, which I find to be a bit expensive, but we were staying right in Times Square so you have to expect to pay a bit more. It's a great location! Be warned, if you can't sleep with noises, don't get a Times Square view room! We loved it! The noises and lights did not bother us AT ALL!! I would definitely stay here again. A great location in Times Square!!! Our teenage children loved it, we loved it!

I have 5 grandchildren who I adore .I've been saving up my points for one last trip to New York. My grandchildren have a love of New York that I have and I believe I instilled that love in them. I tried going through the IHG rewards program and couldn't get any satisfaction,in fact the woman who made the original reservation didn't have it correctly at all. I asked to speak to the hotel direct.And was given an angel by the name of Alex Mrsa.( I hope I spelled the last name right ) Alex was so understanding and compassionate about my situation I felt so relieved and grateful for his understanding . I want my grandchildren to remember the majesty of coming up the escalator and seeing all the bright lights of Broadway.And when I'm gone I want them to know that Alex helped this happen .And that Crowne Plaza Broadway NYC will be their destination for their families.Thank You dear Alex..Thank You Crowne Plaza Broadway

This was our first visit to NYC. I was grateful to get a great deal on staying at the Crowne Plaza. I really wanted to be within walking distance of most of the places that we wanted to visit & this place was the place to stay! Although it's in the heart of Times Square, it's very quiet inside. Rooms are large & beds are comfy. Victoria at the check in desk helped to make sure to make check in/check out go smoothly. She even gave us vouchers to enjoy free pastries & drinks at their on site grab & go bakery....what a gift! I would definitely consider staying here again!

I recently spent 3 nights at the Crowne Plaza and I was very pleased with my stay. The check-in process was quick and efficient. My room was spacious and very neat and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Moreover, the hotel was ideally located just off Times Square. There was a wide variety of breakfast options and all of the staff in the restaurant were friendly and provided excellent service. The Crowne Plaza certainly provided excellent value for money in my opinion and I would definitely stay there again the next time that I visit NYC.

Just back from a wonderful holiday in NYC. Stayed at the Crowne Plaza, floor 38. Lovely clean rooms, good selection of toiletries, plenty of towels, clean bedding. Rooms cleaned daily. The reception area is a bit impersonal, the bar is very expensive...but you are right in the centre of time square and everything you need is on the door step.It was my birthday while there and I was left a bottle of fizz and a huge slice of cake courtesy of the hotel.Would definitely stay there again.

Monday nights at the Crowne Plaza are fantastic. I travel in for work and I look forward to going to the bar. The ambiance is great but most importantly I look forward to seeing my favorite bartender Keith! He knows everyone and makes us all feel like locals. He also mixes a great cocktail! Even if you aren't staying here stop by on a Monday. It is guaranteed great fun!

We booked DIRECTLY through the hotel...NOT A THIRD PARTY BOOKING COMPANY and we are IHG members. I am left with no choice but to post a rating on Trip advisor and maybe I can actually get a response. I have called customer relations now 3 times and all but 1 of the people I have spoken with was rude. Act professional please - articulate and try to resolve my issue instead of mumbling, speaking as though you have a 7th grade education, and also disconnecting my call multiple times. Please don't argue with me and tell me my email and confirmation # are not my confirmation #. My room for 2 nights was worth the almost $600 I paid but it was NOT WORTH $1200 and I'd appreciate you fixing this once and for all (credited the money back THEN re-double charged me again 2 days later!) WHAT?!?!?! Good thing we are members. I'd hate to see how you treat your non IHG customers.

Nothing super special about the hotel itself, but you can't beat the locations - right in time square! The rooms were clean and well maintained. The hotel restaurant was just alright, a little spendy and the food wasn't that great. Other than that, everything was great!

Loved staying here! The hotel itself is beautiful, offers bar and restaurant settings while staff greets you at every turn. The Crown Plaza is perfectly placed in Times Square Manhattan area, allowing for easy travel and beautiful views. What struck me the most was the ability of the hotel staff to recognize and acknowledge me every morning and evening when they saw me. Our very first breakfast at the hotel we were served with diligence and attentiveness by Tofael. Highly recommend!

Crowne is clean. Efficient. Helpful. Nothing super spectacular to speak of or to complain about. It is great for a first or second visit to NYC when you want to be in the thick of the Times Square action. So close to theatres if you are a Broadway buff like I am. For business, it isn't a great location because of all the tourists. The whole area caters to it. You have to navigate around it too much when grabbing a cab or looking for a quiet place to eat.Rooms are a good size and no long waits for elevators. Just wish the lobby bar was open later. 11 or 11:30pm is just too early in the city that never sleeps.

This is a very busy hotel and somewhat impersonal. However, I ate breakfast in the restaurant. Our server, Alfredo Mejia, was a true treasure. His attitude was exceptional, and his service was above and beyond. As a hotel owner, I wish all my employees were as enthusiastic as Alfredo. Give him a raise before he finds a better paying job.

I have just finished a stay with my family (wife and 2 kids 17 & 15 years old) and stayed in the Crowne Plaza in Times Square and have only given it 3 stars as I've stayed in other Crowne Plazas and had a much better experience. First of all the hotel is ideal for being close to all the Times Square attractions but far enough away to not be disturbed by all the noise. We stayed in room 3227 which is 32 floors up and has a view of the Hudson River and Cruise Ferry terminal. The room itself could do with updating as it seems as though it hasn't been updated or decorated for a good 10 years or so. The room we were given had 2 "double" beds in which were quite small, which seemed to be a theme as the bath towels/sheets just about wrapped around any of us. There is no kettle in the room for drinks as there is only a coffee filter machine, so if you like milk in coffee or tea then you have to pay for a glass of it or use the powdered creamer supplied. The first couple of days the temperature was about -3 degrees C so we needed the heating on at night but it rattled that it kept us all awake so we either froze with the thin sheets on the small beds or were kept awake with the noisy heating. We did manage to get an extra thin grubby looking duvet after 2 nights. Be aware that they ask for a credit card to take a deposit for any breakages or films/services used and they actually take $100 out of your account rather than just a holding charge. They also tried to bill us for watching 2 films when we only watched one, and at $17.99 a film they are pricey. We will visit New York again soon but will probably look to book somewhere else rather than stay back here. Don't get me wrong it's not a bad hotel - it's just for a Crowne Plaza it is poor.

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel many times. For the first time we encountered two minor problems in our room. We brought these problems the front desk manager (Pablo) and he immediately resolved the issue by moving us to upgraded room with a Times Square view. Another example of a well run hotel.

If you are a Theater geek this is a perfect hotel to stay at! Easy walking distance to many theaters. Lots of restaurants (all price points), TKTS Booth if you want bargains on tickets. The hotel food is pretty good, albeit pricey...of course. Rooms are a good size, showing their age a bit but clean and well attended. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. Assisted with a conference here and the Convention Services staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating. I would consider staying here again without question.

Keith!!!!!The best bartender in Times Square ! He recommended a great sushi place for dinner and treated us with excellent service Highly recommended!!!!My husband and I love great food so to get a great recommendation we are always appreciative. Keith went above and beyond

The title says it all really.You are in Prime location within Times Square. The hotel is vibrant and the rooms are really nice too. The staff are jolly and helpful. Would highly recommend to everyone. The concierge is there to help at all times.Look forward to staying here again soon

Just got back from staying at the Crowne Plaza for 5 nights.We booked our trip through ebookers and paid extra for a Times Square View room. Checked in at 11.30pm- our booking was 2 x rooms for 4 people. We were asked if we would prefer to be on the same level or recieve a 'better' room on different floors. We said we didn't mind but took the offer of the better room. Arrived to a outdated room with a 'City' view room- even though we paid extra for Times Square. The bathroom and decor in general was very outdated. The bed was very comfortable. Went back down to reception for the receptionist to be very rude and say that we requested a city view- even though we did not. After a while a very lovely lady said she would swap our rooms in the morning.After swapping to a times square view room (43rd and 44th floor) we were happy. Bathrooms were more modern. Lobby is average- no seating area unless you sit in the bar. Asked about the pool at reception and was told you can only use if you swim with a shower cap on?? Never heard this before and have stayed in many hotels! After this we decided not to use the pool.Location is great- right in times square, could not fault this. Alot of hawkers outside the hotel. Also bar service is poor- they charged 4 x drinks to my mastercard as originally I said I would pay by card then as the waitress Michaela walked away we called her back as had cash. She took our cash but upon check out was charged to my card!!!!!!! Did not have time to query with reception as there was a queue and needed to leave for the airportTip: Do not bring currency to change at hotel. We were told to use the exchange place over the road and were completely ripped off by a 1/3 of what it should be!!

Booked to stay here thanksgiving weekend for Christmas shopping. Considering there are a lot of similar class hotels with matching facilities for a lot less money I wouldn't recommend staying here, I would book elsewhere. The receptionists and concierge were not rude however they certainly had no warmth and friendliness in their approach. We paid extra to sat on a higher floor with a Times Square view, again I wouldn't recommend doing this. You'll be in so many places higher up with a view the novelty in having a room with a view isn't really worth it. We didn't opt to pay extra and have breakfast as there are a lot of cheaper alternatives like deli bars within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, with decent and comfortable beds but nothing luxurious. We didn't have a bad experience or stay but it certainly lacked the luxury and extras we had anticipated it would have.

First we find parking is $85 for 24 hours. Then discovered hotel is $100 less then price I paid upon arrival. They will not honor current prices, only booking price. Booked hotel only for pool since I have children. Upon checking in I was told pool is lap only pool and you need to reserve a time to swim and need a swim cap. I go to 15th floor as required to book lap time (in a very tiny pool) and was told I needed to request time 24 hours in advance. I only stayed for 1 night! While at pool another family arrived trying to swim (in their swim suits) to discover same problem I encountered. They also booked hotel only because of the pool.

This hotel is set in a perfect location. It's a 10 minutes walk from Columbus Circle and Central Park. Times square is a step outside the front door. There are great places for an affordable breakfast around the corner. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. We couldn't turn the heat down enough in the room but the window did open which helped with the temperature. Great place to stay.

You can't get better than this as far as location goes! Great service, super comfy bed and well equipped rooms. Only downside for me was WIFI quality which could have been better. Other than that, I'd return anytime.

Stayed here with some school friends for a joint 40th celebration. We received a lovely welcome pack with bottle of bubbly on arrival and I was surprised at how spacious the room was as I had read that most hotel rooms were tiny. We paid a bit extra for a high floor corner room with times Square view. Spectacular! It all felt very plush, clean and new and every single member of staff was very professional and friendly. I will definitely be back as we were within walking distance of everything we wanted to see but we took advantage of the grayline stop just across the road for a tour around Manhatten. Brilliant stay.

Had dinner at the restaurant Bar 49, and could not have asked for a more friendly waiter Tony was our server and he gave us excellent service, very friendly and accommodating. He made sure our glasses were filled and the food was properly prepared. He made dinner a delight with his sparkling wit.

The Crowne Plaza is on Times Square so is the perfect location for discovering Manhattan. ( if you love chocolate, it is next to the Hershey store and across the road from the M&M store!)The staff at check- in were great and very helpful and the rooms are very spacious for a hotel in a New York.Clean and comfortable bed with free wifi in the room.If you want to keep fit while enjoying your stay, there is a fantastic large gym on the 15th floor + an excellent swimming pool.The Breakfast buffet is really good but at $40, try to get some of the $10 dollar vouchers or go for a walk and find one of the many places to eat.The bar staff are great too and very friendly.Would very much recommend this hotel.
user_name:
Burtonram
Burton upon Trent, United Kingdom

review_body: Just stayed here for daughters sweet 16th, emailed before arrival to say coming to celebrate and was told they would upgrade if possible and they sure did an excellent room we got with a fabulous view of Times Square room 2501 it was my daughter was thrilled .. We didn't get to use the pool or the amenities as so busy seeing sites but the free wifi in room and free uk mobile and landline calls was also an added bonus so all in all I cannot fault this hotel and shall definitely be returning thanks

We just got back from a 5 night break here. The hotel is perfect location for Times Square. Really clean and fantastic rooms. Very spacious and comfortable. Staff are so friendly. We started each night with a drink in the bar. Your waiter Tony has to be one of the nicest men I have ever met, he really is a credit to you. Room service was delicious also. When we return with our children we will be staying here.If I was to say any negative it would be that guests should be told they have to provide a swimming hat to use the pool and a lock for a locker, staff were not helpful at all when we went to the pool saying we needed to go back to our room to get a shower cap to wear, safe to say we did it go in after that.

It’s my first time to stay here, defiantly IHG standards rooms, very goods. My disappointment? they don’t have rooms crevice, it’s only a delivery by a cafe, not sure how it works. If you are an IHG aspire like me, please don’t expect anything special here. But the location is very goods, short walk to Fifth Avenue, and all the fine shops and restaurants.Its for surevalue for money.

This property is ideal for visitors to New York. Great location, clean good size rooms.Just a couple of little things stopped me from awarding it 5 stars.Firstly, our party of 6 reserved 2 Times Square view rooms, each having 2 adults and a child in each (age 6 & 16) somewhere along the reservation this was changed to a standard and a Times Sq room. A little annoying but the hotel stated there was no availability to move the standard to a Times Sq room and taking into account the time we'd be in the room and the only difference being the view we left it as.Upon checking in when we arrived at 2pm one family checked into the standard room with no issues. The family checking into the Times Sq room were told by the receptionist that a room on the 17th floor was available but if they didn't mind waiting until 3pm (which is the check in time) a room on the 25th floor would be available and this room had, in her opinion, a much better view. We decided to do this and wait.Upon returning at 3pm we were told by a different receptionist that we could check into the 17th floor room. When we said what the other receptionist advised us the original receptionist was asked and denied ever advising us about the other room !The other slight issue we had was the coffee shop in the lobby closed at 7pm. Which is something we looked forward to after long days sightseeing. We found this strange for the city that never sleeps !Having said earlier these issues would not prevent us from recommending this hotel for anyone looking for an ideally located property.

We spent 5 days here on a girlie shopping spree. Hotel is in best location in new York. Hotel booked private transfers for us to Woodbury common shopping outlets. Driver waited all day so we could take bags back to car rather than carry them around all easy. All staff in hotel were very helpful. Drink and food prices very expensive in hotel. Would recommend this hotel and would certainly stay in it again.

We stayed at the Crown Plaza Times Square from 10th Feb / 15th Feb. 2 staff who are most certainly worth a mention are Ali breakfast waiter and the glorious Gloria the hostess at breakfast. Gloria was a little star and Ali was very attentive. We had a marvellous holiday and stay and will be returning loved being on 43rd floor overlooking Manhattan.

This is my "go to" hotel. Sure there are many other wonderful hotels (I've stayed in a few) but this one is my usual pick for a host of reasons. A great view of Times Square usually from corner rooms (typically the ones with double beds). A snack bar serving various fresh fruit, protein bars, salads, muffins, coffee etc. A nice bar/lounge to spend time in. Best of all (for me), they have a huge (by hotel standards) gym, New York Sports Club. I took a free class "Workout like MMA fighter" with Roxanne who was a wonderful instructor. Lots of machines, weights and places to workout in your own style. Anytime I have a special request, the hotel staff are quick to respond. The back of the hotel has an interior drive through which is great when it's raining or snowing.

Lovely comfy beds in spacious rooms. Nice facilities within the hotel and staff that are happy to help. Corrine was so helpful with setting up our broadway show (Kinky Boots) and other activities.This hotel was the perfect location. We were within walking distance to a lot of our activities. This was my first time in New York and was so happy with this hotel. I will recommend this place to everyone. I plan on bringing my granddaughter to New York and will stay here again.

Overall, this is a very nice hotel, and we would definitely stay here again. The location is fantastic and very reasonably priced. You are just off Times Square but not into all of the pedestrian and tourist activity for that busy part of town. In addition, you are a few blocks away from all of the major mid-town Manhattan attractions. Numerous subway lines are also a short walk.The rooms were very clean and well maintained. However, the decor is starting to show its wear and should be upgraded. The staff was very friendly. We enjoyed a drink at the lobby bar and breakfast in the lobby restaurant. Prices were typical for a downtown hotel and offered quality food and beverages. Both offered a nice view of Times Square.We spent extra for a city view, which was a mistake. All of the rooms seem to have a view of the city. Our view was nothing special, and it appeared that it was the room that was available upon our check-in.

Good experience with staff and excellent location! Everyone was very accommodating and very friendly! Our first room we were assigned was not cleaned appropriately but the front desk promptly gave us the option to stay in that room and have housekeeping come to fix it OR move us to another room on another floor. We chose to move to the 35th door. A bellman was also sent up to help us with our 5 large suitcases since we had two younger kids during our room change. It was very warm in our room and we prefer to sleep on the colder side so my husband called maintenance. Maintenance was very gracious and sent up a portable A/C unit that worked wonderfully!! We slept very well each night! Marie on the 35th floor did an OUTSTANDING job keeping our room fresh and clean! She catered to our every need and worked around our schedules to clean our room! She always had a warm, greeting with a big smile! On our last day, our bill had two additional charges for phone calls that were local and should have been free. We called the front desk and explained. Again the problem was quickly rectified and the additional charges were removed! Honestly, at first things weren't looking great for our stay but they very quickly turned around. I gave Crowne Plaza 4 stars, even though there were "issues" and it wasn't a "perfect stay" because I believe the true mark of greatness is how the mistakes are handled! Great job all the way around fixing any problems and keeping your guests happy! We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to NY! The location is PERFECT to gain access to just about anything! We also received two free drink vouchers for the bar or coffee to use!

Very good location .staff here very good nice and friendly the rooms are ok clean and tidy my only gripe would be more music channels that you dont have to pay for and more coffee for the coffee maker other than that this hotel met all our needs .

I visited here for 4 nights in December along with my 2 sons first trip to nyc upon arrival I found the check in staff very rude and unfriendly the room softened the disappointment of check in until we decided to have a drink in the bar in the lobby we waited and waited to be served my sons were getting impatient it was a good twenty minutes until I politely asked the waitress if we could order her abrupt reply was I will be with you in a minute again another long wait I'm afraid the service was unacceptable so we decided to leave , I found this hotel as I've seen in someone else's comment very pretentious will not be staying here in the future.

In celebration of my 50th me and my sweetheart planned dinner and an overnight stay in the city. The staff at The Crown Plaza Times Square were lovely & amazing. My sweetie arrived ahead of me with balloons etc. in hand. As a result of the special celebration our room was upgraded from a Traditional King to a King room with a beautiful City View. Our front desk reservations associate Adaliz was so kind, she arranged a lovely birthday cake display for two to be placed in our room when we returned from dinner. Overall we give our stay a 10. Thank you again Adaliz for making my birthday a bit more special.Signed-Feeling Fabulous at 50!

Karim Sharif- Outlet ManagerOutstanding Service!! THE ENTIRE wait staff were superb and provided optimal Customer Service.Alfredo Megia- Exceptional!Check-In Antonio- ExceptionalRoom View Exquisite!Manager Juliet has been very accommodating to my concerns and request (had a heating issue)!Nice place- would recommend to anyone! I have 3 more days to go- will tell you the rest later!!!

I was very impressed with the level of service I received at Crowne Plaza. I was very warmly welcomed and also told I could order free bottled water at the ease of a phone call.My only gripe would be that the internet was not good at all. When I checked out I told the lady and she apologised, told me they were in the process of upgrading the whole system and waived the nightly service charge because of it. She didn't have to do that, but she did.I would definitely stay here again, the location was perfect.

Rooms were nice but the service was outstanding! From the concierge to check in to check out, every single staff we came across was polite and well spoken. Walking out literally takes you to the hustle and bustle of NYC. Will always be returning here when in New York

We found this hotel very clicky as an outsider we found them very pretentious.They did not tell us about the $30 a day surcharge for room cleaning, rooms are nothing special but prime location square Staff in bar area were rude and disrespectful even after being given a large tip

Stayed at this location for a daughter's modeling event. Location is awesome. Due to my membership level, my breakfast was included. From other parents in the group, they paid $40/person for breakfast which can add up to a heafty total. I recommend this hotel and location.

Always stay here when in NYC. Perfect location and nice rooms. Restaurant is ok but who eats in hotel when in the big apple. Subway close by. Location lets you really enjoy Times Square without a lot of the noise and crowds.

We have just returned from spending another fantastic week at the Crowne Plazza, I would strongly recommend this hotel it has a great location and the staff are all so helpful & friendly, we had a room on the 44th floor with a fantastic view of Times Square the rooms are nicely furnished and very comfortable we could not have asked for better. Looking forward to returning next year.

The hotel is in the middle of the city. Close to Time Square. So it means that booking a room in this hotel give you the opportunity to move everywhere in a simple way. The level of the room is good but not so high level as other hotel i visited in my life. The price i spent was included of taxes 167 $ .....so good price for the level of the Hotel and the location.

My husband and our two children and I spent 3 nights at the Crowne Plaza, it was amazing. We couldnt have asked for a better location. We were on the 34th floor with a view of times square. We will be staying here again!

We had the best stay! Keith at the bar was absolutely AMAZING! Catered to our every need. Drinks were amazing. Great food at the bar. Highly recommended. Right in timesSquare. We couldn't have planned a better stay. So close to all the attractions. We will definitely be coming back to stay. Hotels rooms are clean. Great views.

Check-in was a breeze once I finally found the front desk --through 2nd set of doors, down a hallway, up the escalator, and then around some. Pretty room was unique corner room. Bed was comfy. Had to move the tv quite a bit so both of us can watch tv in bed. Bathroom was a tad small. All in all pretty much everything says luxury BUT the plastic cups and paper cups. I can understand paper cups for coffee/tea on the go but... Where's the glass glass that belongs with this kind of room??

Amazing hotel in Times Square, our room over looked the sort after sights and on arrival set the standards for our holiday.We stayed on the 20th floor and was facing the to screens and lights yet at night you wouldn't know once the curtains were drawn, the bed room was extremely clean and maids came every day to clean.Bathroom was a large shower and an iron &board provided as well as a hairdryer.Hotel staff very friendly and helpful, we were able to do a late check out with no extra cost.The hotel is in the middle of the busiest city in the world and we will be returning when our pockets are filled again.

Naturally the location is great with an easy walk to Central Park. Quiet, good sized rooms as well. The lobby seating area is small, so no real place to just get out of your room but not get out of the hotel for a while. The bar area is great with great service from Tony. I ate and drank there two nights and Tony not only remembered me, but my brand of liquor! The coffee shop was very convenient, with friendly staff. Very nice stay.

Great accomodation and definitely location location location.. if you want to be in the hussle and bussel of the big Apple staying here is perfect.Nice bedding.The lounge bar area great place with nice snack food items.Easy walking distance to many attractions

This hotel is in the perfect location and had all the comforts and amenities we needed and expected. The outstanding feature of our stay here though was the wonderful personal service we received in the restaurant for breakfast. Valerie and Gloria made us feel very welcome every morning, greeting us cordially and with genuine personal and enthusiastic attention. The wait staff were also very attentive and helpful. It was so refreshing to be greeted and served by genuinely friendly staff who didn't just go through the motions, but actually made us feel very welcome and at home. Thank-you Valerie and Gloria! You made a very positive and memorable contribution to a wonderful New York experience.

Four girls, two of which had never been to New York so we wanted somewhere right in Times Square and this hotel certainly delivered. Great location. Having been to New York myself on many occasions I know how much the hotels can vary. The Crowne Plaza ticked every box for me on things that I want from a hotel in the city. Location, good size rooms, quiet rooms, even with the size of this hotel we didn't find ourselves disturb at any time when in our room by noise from other guests or from the streets outside, clean room, super comfortable beds.The coffee shop located by the reception was great, wonderful choice of drinks and snacks and a very friendly man who ran it, even at 7am one morning he was there with a smile.The bar is very nice, great views of the street below, comfortable seating, good choice of drinks and wonderful service. We were looked after very well by Tanesha, she was extremely friendly, chatty and very helpful. All the concierge team were also very helpful arranging a car for us back to the airport when we left. The only small negative I could say was that the reception team could be a bit more friendly. On two occassions at the desk (one was check in) we felt like they just wanted to get us processed and out the way. I would hesitate to stay here again or recommend it to others.

We really love Crowne Plaza. We've stayed a few times strictly for fun. We visited in January but the hotel was packed. We were there on New Year's day (not Eve) and the crowds hadn't really died down quite yet. Our room wasn't ready until around 7pm. We were offered complimentary drinks for the wait but they had very little alcohol compared to the drinks we purchased. We didn't expect our room to be ready right at check in time but we did have to wait quite a while which caused a bit of an issue with our dinner reservations. The bathroom did have some mold in the shower, not something we've ever seen before at this hotel. Usually, it's exceptionally clean. We were in good company so it all worked out in the end. We'll definitely stay again, we are always welcomed!

I am normally not one to write reviews but I truly feel compelled to rate this experience to help others make a choice for their travel needs. I traveled to New York from Los Angeles. We had taken a red eye flight and arrived at the hotel to just check our luggage in for the da until the 3pm check in time. We were greeted by the bell hop that recommended that we go speak to the front desk and see if they had rooms readily available. We arrived to the front desk and were greeted by Sandra with a great welcoming smile she told us they had a room available if we wanted to check in to just freshen up and begin our excursions. I was so pleased after a red eye flight my husband, myself and our two teenage children were so happy to just take a load off for a few minutes. Thank you Crowne Plaza staff for the welcoming feeling we had the entire visit to New York City.

This will be my 3rd stay at this hotel. I love the location of it and the beds are very comfy! I will continue to use this hotel when I stay in Manhattan. The staff is friendly and assist you with whatever you need!

This trip was a spur of the moment. We live in the area and had broadway tickets on a day of a huge snowstorm. We decided to drive to the city a day early. The staff was so nice, especially Antonio at the check in desk and Tony at bar 49. They went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Even housekeeping was very nice. Thank you!

We came to nyc at the last minute to ensure we would make Hamilton, as a freak last minute snowstorm hit the trio state area (normally is a day trip for us). The storm was so bad we wound up staying 2 days. Antonio at the front desk was AMAZING helping us out in extending our stay and making sure we had everything we needed. And Tony at Bar 49 ensued we had a delightful respite from the kids. His cocktail recommendations are spot on. The housekeeping staff keeps the rooms spotless. Even the rollaway bed was comfy, which is s near miracle for those things. We really enjoyed our last minute enforced stay and compliment apk the staff on an outstanding job.

The service was excellent.The people that work there are awesome.We met Jason last year and hoped he would be there yet.He was our bartender.Great guy.Also another gentleman named Alvaro Perez.They both made us feel welcome.Checking out was great.There was an issue with an extra charge and a great girl named Brunilda helped in straightening things out.They are great employees.Crown Plaza should be happy to have them there.

What Can I say the location only come second best to the service! Amazing team, especially Juliet and the front of house staff. I have stayed before but it was my partners first time in NYC The team made it so special! Even if you only do it once get the breakfast! The choice is amazing!!!Next time in NYC we will be booking the Crown Plaza!

Hello,Thank you for making our stay so memorable.We stayed for 10 nights 28th Jan - 7th Feb 2017. The hotel is in a great location for food, drink, shopping and entertainment. Also great location for subway, buses and open top bus tours.The hotel was equipped with tea and coffee facilities, iron, ironing board, bathroom toiletries and plenty of soft fluffy towels. The bedrooms have great views and a nice chaise lounge to enjoy the views. TV had great choices and lots of channels and movies to rent.Daily housekeeping and if you need some tea or coffee refills a small note to ask and they will happily sort this for you. We called guest services on one occasion and that was to hire a fridge. This helped if you can get one. The facilities fees were not an issue as we had done our research and knew this was common place. Wifi was great, the drinks coupons you get upon check in were a nice touch and easy to redeem. We used the resturant and bar on a few occasions and we found the service was great and food was well priced and generous in portions. Overall a great stay and we will be back again in the future.

Very Rude staff at reception act like they are inconvenienced by anything you need. Nobody lets you know about the $30 a day service charge also don't let you know about the fact it goes towards gym use free internet and two free drinks non of which we received and when questioned about it they just said you would of been told before and you would of had the vouchers like we was just making it up. Also took $ 260 as a security deposit and refunded only $210 back!! Im sure there are better hotels in the area.

I recently took my 16 year old daughter to NYC for her birthday. I booked through Air Canada holidays and did not know what to expect since I received such an affordable price. I was very pleasantly surprised.Firstly, the location is superb! You are right in the heart of Times Square, walking distance to Rockefeller, Empire State Bldg, 5th Avenue, Broadway etc..The rooms are clean, spacious, and very good for the price. We arrived early and were given an early check in which was great. Ask for a room on the highest floor available..the views are pretty nice. The safe was not working in our room and we had a difficult time connecting with the concierge or front desk from the phone. But other than that, there were no real complaints.I would definitely stay there again...really fantastic value for the price!

The hotel is idealy located in times square in walking distance of theatres, main starting points of all the hop on hop off tour buses, minutes away from the Rockerfella centre. We stayed in a double room with two double beds ample room, clean and comfortable right up on the 32nd floor with a times square view. The grind&co take out in situated in the lobby and offers a range of lovely sandwiches, bagles and much more. Also in the lobby is the Broadway bar with a times square view, relaxing freindly with some tasty snacks, the prices are reasonable too. We were foutunate to have Rahi take care for us, a very freindly geniune guy, told us lots about the attractiions and New York.Thank you Rahi for the directions to the Roozavelt Island cable cars, really enjoyed the trip across the river. We would definatly recommend the Crowne Plazza enjoyed our stay and been im times square very much.

The hotel staff always make me feel welcome, I'm often in NY for business, and I'm always guest at Crowne Plaza,the staff is always very friendly and try to make me feel at home every stay.The rooms are big and very clean.

Great Location. Clean inviting room. The only downside is the price. NYC in September is always expensive. For the price paid ($400USD+), it would have been nice to get breakfast included. The location is right at Times Square and in NYC it seems no matter what you do in the day, you somehow end up in Times Square.

If you want to be in the centre of town, with a comfortable place to stay, then this is the place to be. Beside Times Square, in the heart of Theatreland and close to the subway makes this ideal for all attractions.The front desk staff and porters all willing and capable of answering the many 'tourist' questions we threw at them and eager to ensure the stay was as it was meant to be.Thank you also for the 'very' late check-out it made the next leg of the trip a lot more comfortable

The hotel is nice. The room was clean and accomodating. We arrived early and they allowed us to keep our luggage in a locked room. We proceeded to have breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the food was horrible. Service was also poor. We had a room at the back of the hotel so it was not the best view. They also allowed us a courtesy room as our flight was later in the day but for a charge.

This was my third visit to this hotel. This time had a room 36th floow overlooking Times Square. Room was in great condition with nice decor. I feel it was much better that my previous visits, I also enjoy ed drinks ar the bar and on another occasion dined there. They offer to keep your bags on the day your leaving till 10:00 pm without a charge. Checked out with Victoria Marting who was very friendly and and helpful as was everyone during check in

Beautiful hotel but I forgot my wallet in the hotel room safe and called the hotel as soon as I realized and it was no where to be found. I had to call at least 15 times and leave several messages for different managers to get a response. Very unprofessional and disheartening.

no complaints about the hotel, it was ok but there are better Just be aware that you will be harassed from the second you step outside the hotel.Everyone wants to see times square which is fair enough, but stay elsewhere ! Soho or uptown will be my choice next time.The staff here in general were just ok except for Kim in the bar who was exceptional !No complaints whatsoever about the hotel, it was of good standard and clean (would give it 5 stars for that) it was just the constant harassing outside

I loved this hotel. This was the last place I stayed before ending my trip. The location was on point. 3 blocks from Central Park. I street away from broadway. In the middle of time square. I paid an extra $15 for a time sqaure view. Breakfast was good but I had to pay for it. And there is a room tax per night that you had to pay for. The rooms were large and spacious. Big bathrooms and modern. I ordered room service and it was pretty good. I would definitely recommend staying here.

From check in with Evelyn, to check out, our stay was beautiful. Our room on a corner of the 28th floor was clean and comfortable. My wife an I were in town to see Wicked and celebrate our wedding anniversary. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and drinks in the bar in the evening was a great way to finish the day. We were truly surprised to find a bottle of champagne and Chocolate cake with a Happy Anniversary message from the staff waiting in our room when we got back from the show. Its so close to the theaters and Time Square you couldn't ask for more convenience. We can't wait to go back soon.

I only stayed for one night but the room was very comfortable and quiet. The bar area was pleasant for afternoon tea and cake and check in and out was efficient. Great location - very easy to walk from the bus station which links to JFK and Newark airports.

Have just returned from a 4 night stay in the Crowne Plaza. The room was large enough and clean which is important to me, the bed super comfy also. I had requested a room with a view which unfortunately i never got but spent very little time in the room anyway.The hotel is convenient for empire state, 5th ave etc all within a short walk.Word of advice be careful of the bus tour tickets as they do not get u on the attractions as promised.... booked a tour to statue of liberty to be told the ticket we had was a tour that never went there!!Didnt eat or drink in the hotel as we were out all the time but found it clean n close to all the action only complaint would be the €30 daily charge for amenities that we did not use but had 2 pay for although this charge seems to be a theme in the whole of NYC so watch out for the 'extras'.All in all a good stay n would recommend to anyone.

Right in the heart of Time Square the Crowne Plaza is the perfect location. The staff were fantastic we arrived early and they managed to not only get us checked in but also gave us a room with fantastic view.We didn't stay in the hotel for very long as we explored a s much of New York as we could and for that the Hotel is the perfect location in the middle of everything.The only down side was no breakfast included and the price for breakfast in the hotel was very expensive, hence a 4 not a 5.If your happy to eat out and want a hotel good value in the middle of New york City this is an ideal choice.

Took my daughter to New York for her 21st birthday stayed at the crowne plaza Times Square which is central to almost everything, We ate breakfast in the hotel everyday which was fantastic everything from pancakes, waffles, fruit, even smoked salmon & fresh orange juice or coffee which was regularly topped up.If your going anywhere by taxi the doorman will call you one or there is a row of taxi's just round the corner.We had two double beds in our room which was great however the view from the window was disappointing but we spent such little time in the room it didn't matter.I am returning here in May for a few nights & am staying here again with my husband.

Pros:  What I liked the most was the location of this hotel. It´s 1 block away of Times Square! It´s very convenient if you like to walk, enjoying everything that is around this great area of NY. WiFi is free and the signal quality in the lobby was better than in the room.Cons: The size of the bed could be better: I asked for a double bed room (because we were in 3), and the width of each bed must be around 110cm (3.6 feet or 43 inches), uncomfortable even for a skinny couple. There is no minibar in the room. Maybe it´s not an important item for some, but for me it is, as I usually buy bottles of water, wine or beer and I like to keep them on the right temperature. As a workaround there is an ice bucket and you can get ice from an ice machine outside of the bedroom.

Took my 13 year old here in October for his first trip to New York. Upon booking I paid for a Times Square view room just to make it a little extra special for my son. The room was by no means cheap but it's New York and that's to be expected. Now I am lucky enough to work in the travel industry and have stayed in a few hotels in New York such as the Wellington, Manhattan and the Marriott Marquis but thought I would give this a go as being an IHG member I had points to use. To be honest the hotel was not as good as I expected, the rooms seemed very small for New York. The noise from the windows that did not properly shut was awful. I get that you are in New York and noise is to be expected especially being on Broadway and so close to the action but it was somewhat ridiculous and made sleeping difficult. The good things are obviously the location, it cannot be faulted! The beds were the comfiest I have ever slept in and the Lavazza coffee machines in the rooms are a welcome touch, front desk we're most helpful when requesting extra tea and coffee too. We had no problems with hot water during our stay.On our next trip back to NYC I'm afraid to say we won't be returning to the Crowne Plaza, very overpriced for what you get really.

In late January 2017, I went to NYC with 3 friends. Our plans were to catch Broadway plays, go to the Met Museum, Grand Central Station etc. It was your basic tourist visit. We found a deal on Hotwire.com which included a stay at the Crowne Plaza Hotel Times Square Manhattan plus airfare. Considering it's NYC, we were delighted with the location of our hotel. It was easy to get to where we were going by using the subway. I recommend the Crowne Plaza mostly due to it's location and value. Also, the hotel has a nice bar and restaurant with excellent service. The Food and Beverage Manager - Rodney Booij treated us to free drinks he was trying out. He asked us for ideas as to what to name them. He was delightful and friendly!! What a surprise.

The hotel is situated right in Times Square opposite the M&M shop and next door to the Hershey's store. It's a big hotel but not the biggest in the area. All areas are clean and tidy. The rooms are spacious clean and well presented.We had issues with a serious draught through the windows but one particular member of staff went above and beyond to help us out and after that all was well.We never ate there as found breakfast was overpriced and we could eat round the corner for a fraction.All in all a good place to stay and would recommend this hotel

If you are going to a show, dinner on restaurant row, or just visiting the city, this hotel is perfectly located. I found the staff to be extremely friendly, professional and attentive. I was given a room upgrade and the view was superior. Everything was clean and neat. I had drinks in the bar where the service was prompt and the environment lively. Breakfast in the 1605 restaurant was great with eager and professional service. I travel to NYC for business and I will return. Every amenity.

My husband and I had tickets to GMA today for my birthday. Living on Long Island we decided to stay Monday n take in the sights, dine and get a good nights rest. Beautiful hotel with awesome views and amazing service. Front desk was professional, friendly and helpful. Our room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. We were on the 23rd floor n the view was spectacular. I would stay here again.

Overall: The Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan (CPTSM) was a Great Place to stay. PROS:Staff:Baggage: Arrived to the Crown Plaza Times Square Manhattan (CPTSM) and was met, and greeted by Elever who was kind and informative.Desk Clerk: Sandra Esp; Was very, knowledgeable, informative, kind, and a joy to talk to.LOCATION: Great locationCOST: Cost Good for the season (Mid-January)CLEANLINESS: Room was Clean, neat, and orderlyBED: The bed was, very, very comfortable.PILLOW: Long pillows a puffySHOWER: Excellent (One wishes one could have it in ones own home.)USB: Electrical outlet, and USB plug-ins next to bed.Channel Guide: laid out in front of TV.Breakfast: We were given a meal voucher, which we used for our traditional Saturday morning breakfast. The breakfast was buffet style, and was very good.CONSInternet: A Service Fee, and Service somewhat splotchy.Headboard: Scratches found on headboard, asuumeingly from women's wedding rings.Hand towel: One of three hand towels had hair on it. (Towel was quickly replaced.)

Tofael in the restaurant is a great server. Very attentive and outstanding customer service. Great hotel. Great people. Great location.Tofael is the best. Plus Anthony at the front desk and Anthony at the bar - all made the visit wonderful. Highly recommend.

The hotel overall was not to bad. Location is great, so other hotels in the area.Room furnitures are low quality, less durable and run down, needs replacement ASAP. The rooms did not have a mini fridge "very strange", wifi is slow but free, it dropped frequently. Housekeeping are miserable, the just make up bed and replace towels and nothing else.Bathtub finish peeling! needs updating/upgrades. Very outdated. Wall paper peeling. Headboard finish peeling. Furniture wood veneers are coming off , doors on dresser were crooked and chipped. I am extremely disappointed and this particular hotel is a bad image to IHG, and will not be staying again at any rate. Terrible!!! Not worth the price.

I was welcomed at the bar immediately upon sitting down by the bartender, Keith. He is incredibly personable and makes you feel at home at the bar. His style of service isn't typical for a hotel bar, so make your way on over and be sure to ask for Keith.

If you are visiting New York for the first time, this hotel is in an amazing location to see this wonderful city.We (Family of 4 with 2 teenagers) enjoyed a 4 night stay in a family room (2 double beds) overlooking Times Sq.The room was comfortable, clean and well maintained with a fantastic view! We didn't use the bar or restaurant as there are so many to choose from on its doorstep. We did use the indoor pool and although a bit tired it was nice to chill after a long day sightseeing.As above, this hotel is all about the location. Situated overlooking Times square, it really doesn't get any better in terms of walking out of the door and you are immediately in the buzzing atmosphere at the heart of the most vibrant city in the world.You will find more luxurious hotels in New York but for what we were looking for, I would say it was excellent value for money and I would definitely book again.

Have stayed here in the past and it was a 3/5 - this time we received a room which was in rough repair! The fabric on the headboards was coming apart and would flake off on your head when you leaned up against it. When asked to change the dirty sheets (they were dirty upon arrival) the steward knocked on the door and handed the sheets to us instead of making the bed. When we were finally moved to a new room they said was "upgraded" - it wasn't. It was the exact same room as before with better headboards. I wouldn't recommend with so many other options.

We are still here so believe this is a very fair review.The location is perfect and in the hub of Times Square. Minutes away from Rockefeller, St Patrick's, a short walk to Empire State and Grand Central. The hotel itself is fine. Victoria on reception is exceptionally helpful and friendly but the wait staff in the bar are the polar opposite. I certainly do not expect to reprimanded by your staff when I have just arrived from a day out and take off my hat and gloves to be barked at that they should not be on our table!!! Literally just took these garments off to be squawked at! Our room is tired with wall paper peeling, very marked headboard and cupboards that do not close...but the view over Times Square is fantasticIt would not have been difficult for Crowne Plaza to be very good or exceptional but tired room and bar staff attitude mean it is not.
user_name:
ArmadillosRock
Dumfries and Galloway, United Kingdom

review_body: We were very pleased with the location of this hotel, right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Every employee we encountered was very friendly. The room was a great size and for the most part clean. Our room showed it's age, with stains on the chairs and scratches on the headboard. We had a corner room facing the Hudson River and the views were stunning. The gym was spacious with lots of equipment. We were surprised that for the price it did not include breakfast or a refrigerator in the room. There is a $30/night service fee, but each person does get a drink voucher for use at the hotel. Overall we had a great stay and would definitely come back.

Lovely comfy beds in spacious rooms. Nice facilities within the hotel and staff that are happy to help. Great views. Good choice of breakfast to set you up for a day shopping or sight seeing in an amazing location. Enjoyable cocktails at the bar too. Yummy.

Let's face it, New York is an expensive city so the cost of hotels is going to be high. In past times, I have stayed in more luxury hotels on Park Avenue and Lexington but this time with my husband we wanted to do the tourist things so I decided on Times Square as a location. After looking at various reviews, I chose the Crowne Plaza. The location is great. You have mid point between lower Manhattan for tours of Ground Zero and the 9/11 museum, and upper East side where you can stroll along 5th Avenue and the upscale stores. The metro stop is about 1 block away and there are so many restaurants within walking distance. Because the Crowne Plaza is at the upper end of midtown, you don't feel as much of the circus of Times Square. However, Times Square has certainly changed a lot from the last time I was there with putting in more family friendly stores ( M & M candy and Disney) and it has cleaned up nicely.The location of this hotel is the big plus. It is not a luxurious nor a really beautiful hotel. Walking in off Broadway, there were heavy black curtains past the door, likely to keep the cold from getting in but it was a bit of an eye sore. It also made me feel like we were going into a peep show. The reception area is average size and functional. The staff are very nice and accommodating. There is a Bistro open for breakfast and lunch and the morning buffet is good. The coffee is exceptional and the service very good. There is also a little cafe to buy breakfast items and coffee all day. Again great staff.Our room was on the 42nd floor. I had a king bed city view. The view was not all that good but we were not really there to stay in the room all day and look out. I found the room small but again it was functional. The decor is in need of refurbishing as the cloth headboard of the bed was becoming threadbare in places and the carpet is very dated. I also felt that the floor slanted in some places. It was kind of a strange sensation when standing next to the bed and feeling like you were leaning forward. The bathroom only has a shower, no bathtub. There are also no alarm clocks in the room (seemed weird as I always like to have one as a safety feature in case my phone alarm doesn't work). All that said, the hotel is a clean and comfortable place. A great location with wonderful staff. I would select it again if I was doing a quick weekend of shows and touring.

We stayed at this hotel for a week in Jan and had the most amazing time. We are very pleased we decided to choose this hotel as we were in 2 minds about this hotel and another but we chose well. The CP hotel is in an ideal location, very close to almost everything. The Rockefeller Centre, bus tours, Central Park, Macy's etc were all within walking distance which made it easier to get to places however the subway was also not too far from the hotel. We absolutely loved the atmosphere when we stepped outside the hotel onto Times Square. It really was a great experience and is truly a city that never sleeps. The hotel rooms were very spacious and clean. At check in, the lovely gentleman offered us either a room on the 40th floor or a corner room with a view of the Hudson river, which we thought was very kind and you also receive 2 complimentary drink vouchers. All the staff were very lovely however, there were two who particularly stood out and they worked at the bar/lounge (unfortunately we have forgotten their names). They were always very helpful and did there best to seat us where we wanted (which was on the tables closest to the windows, because of the view of Times Sq which was amazing from there). We would like to say a very special thanks to Rodney the Food & Beverages Manager. He was a lovely genuine gentleman and really looked after us following a minor issue we had with one of the bar staff. We were also offered breakfast vouchers as a result of this. Thanks Rodney:) We would definitely recommend this hotel as we loved NYC and are already looking forward to our next stay at this hotel again:)

Fantastic location opposite Ambassadors theatre on Broadway and W49th st: in heart of theatre district and close to Rockefeller centre as well as 3 subway lines...yellow NQR,red line 1,and CE lines. Busy, popular bar overlooking street....exciting to see yellow cabs and monster trucks whizzing past. Our room on 25th floor was large, with two comfortable but narrow double beds but no mini fridge (apparently this can be requested). Bathroom Ok although fittings dated, bath smallish and uncomfortable and taps badly fitted. . Most staff very friendly and welcoming, especially the manager, Gabriella who apologised profusely when our card keys failed (on 2 separate days).

Our visit to the Big Apple was a nice 3day trip and Crowne Plaza, along with it's staff, made the trip a success. Our accommodation were clean and fresh. The time square location was perfectly centered in the midst of all the lights, shops and restaurants. The lounge was set up nice with a view of the city and the drinks and appetizers were great. And I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC, especially if you don't want to rent a car and deal with that whole hassle.

Its all in the title of my review. I can't comment on price because I got the hotel as part of a JetBlue getaway package. It was very inexpensive as a package (flying from Cali).They had a business center which was free and a nice bar and restaurant. Location is literally a block off Times Square. Very clean and safe. They check your id at night.

Loved this hotel and I would 100% recommend staying here for your time in New York, it is a very central location perfect for bus tours, subway stations and you can walk to a lot of places close by! We went for a long trip in New York (10 days) as we wanted to visit this place once and see everything imaginable! The hotel rooms were very specious, clean and well maintained throughout our trip! The hotel staff were very accommodating and the concierge provided us with maps and advice! They were very helpful and booked us into 2 of the best restaurants in New York as we wanted to indulge a little while we were here! Anyway I don't have a single complaint about the hotel would recommend to friend and family and would stay here again myself!

Stayed here for 4 nights Location very good I thought they said this hotel has been refurbished , well not room 2909 , by the looks of things Bathroom was not the best , Mastic's all peeling away , sinks worn , shower and bath in need of replacement .On check in was meant yo be given drinks vouchers , this never happened , only found this out , by someone who was leaving and offered us theirs.Lot of money for what it is .Plus side , staff working reception bar, very good Mark R

I recently stayed for almost a week at this hotel, and was very pleased with the hospitality of each team member I encountered. We tried the breakfast buffet, dinner, and drinks, all of which ended in a pleasant experience with such great attention to detail. The team went out of their way to ensure we had a great experience. When we encountered the housekeeping staff, they were equally hospitable, proactively engaging us to see how everything was in our room, and if we needed anything. I would highly recommend this property, and look forward to our next stay.

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan during New Year's Eve. It was a great location! The property is within easy walking distance of everything - right on Broadway in the heart of Times Square. We easily walked to the Broadway theaters (saw Kinky Boots), as well as restaurants and shops. Upon check in, we were given complimentary drink coupons, and our room was upgraded because the reserved one was not ready. The staff is great!The rooms were clean and spacious, with a great view of the city, and comfortable bedding.We did not eat in the restaurant, but enjoyed the coffee bar each morning which was reasonably priced with light breakfast options, fruit, and protein & snack bars for the day. We spent time in the bar area. The beverages and snacks were great. The bartenders were attentive - just awesome! The energy was superb!We love NY and will definitely choose this hotel again!

Firstly let me say the staff here were excellent. Pleasant, friendly and very accommodating. Victoria in particular was very professional and helpful. I would give the staff 5 stars. The hotel location at times square and near the theatres is excellent.The traditional rooms are not huge but not small either. The bathrooms are somewhat old style and we found the hot water in the showers to be somewhat intermittent. A cold shower in the middle of winter is not fun. Also not a lot of water pressure in the showers. There are no bathrobes and no fridges in these rooms. There are ice vending machines on each floor along with drink vending machines. Wifi was not very fast but certainly slower than the local starbucks. The grab and go coffee area in the lobby is an excellent idea but the coffee is horrible. I think the male staff here need some serious training on how to make coffee. Although a non smoking hotel, there are plenty of guests who stand around the exit doors smoking which is very unpleasant for those of us who are non smokers.

We stayed this weekend when we came into the city to see The Book of Mormon. We walked from Grand Central, it took about 20 minutes. Check in was quick and Freddy at the front desk was great. He was funny and attentive and gave us drink coupons as we were celebrating my birthday. Our room was spacious with a view of Times Square. The curtains blocked the light out at night and we did not hear street noise overnight.We had drinks and a snack at the bar and coffee and breakfast burritos at the cafe. Both good and service was excellent.You can not stay closer if you are going to the Eugene O'Neill theater. It is right outside the exit.Looking forward to staying again on our next trip.

Great location and really nice hotel. Nice size room with comfortable bed. We asked the reception staff if they had any upgrades available and they upgraded us to a room with a view of Times Square which was really nice!! Would definitely recommend.

Started by being told to wait while the clerk reviewed & re-reviewed our travel voucher. Waited 30 minutes and went back to the front desk where they reluctantly confirmed that our voucher did in fact (and as I had explained) cover their $30 daily charge.Excited to finally get to our room and start our vacation the room we were given was being painted!! I couldn't believe it. Back to the front desk we (all 4 of us) went. Asked to speak to the manager and she gave us a new room. All in all it took us over an hour to get checked in and to a room free of painters.Other than that the room was fine, a little dusty but it meet our needs, 2 beds and a bathroom. The location is the best attribute of this hotel and the service needs to be considerably improved.

Great staff so accommodating friendly they went the extra mile.Definitely would stay here's again Super experienceA winnerCan't say enough Chris and Adaliz were fabulousLoved itComfy bedGood foodClean roomGoo good price

My husband and I stayed here for a week. The hotel is in a very convenient location to the metro station. We went and saw Kinky Boots while there and it was a very quick walk to the theater.
