We were able to walk to Hell's Kitchen and enjoy the night life and gay/gay friendly restaurants which were great. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was very good and did a great job. The bed was super comfortable. The room also had a very good view of Times Square! Definitely will stay there again on next visit.

We ( myself, my wife & 2 teenage girls) stayed at the NY Time Square Crown Plaza between 4th January 2017 & 8th January 2017.The location was ideal for what we wanted to do. The room had everything we could expect from a hotel room.. clean, reasonable size & friendly service staff.The welcome drink was nice and we enjoyed a meal on two occasions down in the bar/ Restaurant on Level 1 - nice atmosphere & alround pleasant experience.We requested a lower floor and the hotel reception were kind enough to give us one, albeit on Level 12. We were grateful not to be much higher as my one teenage daughter is scared of heights & elevators!It was snowing so been so close to all the sights, (not to mention the view over Time Square) , was awesome - Our two teenage girls loved it.We travelled using a combination of walking, the subway & cabs depending on how we felt on the day. One can get a 7 day travel card to ride the Subway & maybe next time this is a something we will consider.The snow added a bit of magic to the city. We had been to NY in the summer as a couple many years ago so seeing it all covered in sniw with our two daughters was truly beautiful!Overall a pleasant stay and we can recommend the hotel for a pleasant stay with a 'value for money' bonus.

Stayed here with our 2 teenage sons. Brilliant location, literally step out onto the street and so central for walking anywhere. Rooms lovely and clean and serviced daily. Nice and modern. Would definitely stay here again.

Sandra Esp was an excellent representative. She was very friendly and made sure to accommodate my family and I. Five star service. The hotel is very nice and gives you a real New York feel. You sill enjoy your stay if you stay here.

It was a rainy Tuesday evening after a long day when my husband and I reached the registration desk to check in for a (too short) one night/day visit. Our welcome by the Crowne Plaza Front Office Manager, Gabby, could not have been friendlier. Sincerely interested in our travel and plans, she recognized some weariness in us and went over and above to take steps to make us feel very welcome and ensure our brief stay was going to be a great one. We do have IHG Elite status and appreciate the greetings we typically receive at IHG property check-in, but this one was special. It was quite a treat to be upgraded to a corner room on a high floor with a view towards Times Square. CP properties usually do have some other nice perks for Platinum status and Gabby exceeded our expectations in that regard. She even gave us her contact information should we have any needs during this or future stays! How nice is that!  Needless to say, despite it being a too short stay, we enjoyed every minute of it. Such a comfortable bed and pillows, a nice sized bathroom with long modern vanity and a good soaking tub, and the view to both the west and south (Times Sq) The next morning we enjoyed a long, leisurely breakfast in the hotel's Bistro 1605.....a big buffet with many many choices, and some excellent coffee. After that, it was time to walk it off, so we did. We returned for a late, light lunch in the Bistro, joined by our daughter-in-law who works just across the way in the very visible BARCLAYS building.  After lunch it was off to a matinee THE FRONT PAGE (what a cast) then back to the Crowne Plaza for a 5 pm drink in the lobby bar and some food (crispy Kale flatbread and also Black Eye Pea hummus...both delicious) before journeying back to Philly. This Crowne Plaza property is wonderfully situated for access to theaters, shopping, Central Park strolls, and lots of restaurants (we enjoy dinner at nearby Trattoria Trecolori). If you are looking for discount theater tickets, it is just across from the TS TKTS booth for same day show offerings too. You can even keep an eye on how the lines are shaping up from the hotel breakfast room. We look forward to our next visit, a longer one, to the Crowne Plaza Times Square and enthusiastically recommend it.

Stayed at this hotel in May/June 2016 for my first visit to New York/America and couldn't have asked for a better stay! Friendly & helpful staff, rooms got cleaned everyday always spotless, and the beds are exactly what was needed after exploring all day! Would defiantly stay here again on our next visit to NYC

We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Times Square with three adults in a two-double bed room. After researching dozens of hotels in the Times Square area, I chose the Crowne Plaza based on the size of their rooms and the fact that there's a bathroom vanity. Most similarly-priced rooms have much less space and only offer a pedestal sink in the bathroom. We were very happy with the size and never felt cramped, even when all three of us were getting ready in the morning at the same time.PROS: Good-sized rooms and bathrooms, many attractions in walking distance, staff were very helpful and accommodating, concierge provided great suggestions. If you want to be in the heart of Times Square - this is it! CONS: There's no way to turn on the A/C in the winter. Our room was a muggy 76 degrees, and there was no way to cool it down. On the plus side, the front desk sent someone to help us open our window and brought us a fan to circulate air in the room. If it weren't for this temperature issue, I'd rate the Crowne Plaza 5 stars.If you find a room rate that includes breakfast, go ahead and book it. It's much more affordable to include it in your rate than to purchase separately. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, and it's fun to sit in the restaurant overlooking the neon signs of Times Square. Overall, I'd stay here again.

We spent 8 nights at the Crown Plaza over Christmas. We asked when booking for a room with a view of Times Square and wow we had a corner room on a high level with views of Times Square and the Empire State Building stunning. Would recommend highly.

A special acknowledgement of great, friendly, helpful service to Michella who welcomed us at the front desk on 1/6 and for going to extra effort to accomodate our requests.Also a shout out for the lunchtime bartender on 1/6 (did not note his name!). Fun and friendly guy.And on 1/7 Corrine, a concierge, was another friendly helpful staff member.

We stayed at Crowne Plaza as part of our "once in a lifetime" experience, booked in conjunction with Cunard. We extended our stay to include NYE and, as my wife has problems breathing when it is cold, we paid extra for a room with a view of Times Square. Yes we could see the square, or at least a small segment of it. No, we could not hear what was going on as the room was double glazed & had no windows which opened. The hotel has access to its own pen on NYE but this can only be used by those guests who pay extra for a meal & access. More than $1500 per room, which did give access for 4 people but there were only 2 of us! We watched on tv.For a normal stay the hotel is well positioned to see the sights of Manhattan, it is clean, comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful. I was a little surprised that for an upmarket hotel no bathrobe or slippers were provided (the bathroom tiled floor is cold!)

The hotel room was spacious (according to NYC standards) and it was. The bathroom was a good size as well and had many amenities. The room also had a coffee pot which is great when you bring back to the room the great pastries NYC offers. The hotel is convenient to the broadway shows, 47th street (the jewelry district) and of course, Times Square. The walk is also not far to Rockefeller Center, and 5th Avenue. I'm planning another trip back and plan on staying here again. A satisfied customer!

I went with my boyfriend for a 5 night Breslin New York and stayed at the wonderful Crowne plaza hotel.We were in room 1511 - initially I was concerned as you came straight off the lift and our room was right there in front of the lift doors but luckily there was a corridor as soon as you entered the room so your well away from the hallway noise.At the end of that corridor the most wonderful room greeted us - spacious, clean, and with an amazing duel aspect view over Times Square.Bed was made daily, with towels and toiletries replenished daily also.We would drink in the hotel bar most nights, and would purposely sit in the server Tony's section as we found him brilliant and had a lot of banter with him.The food at the hotel is amazing too, we would only really have appetisers to eat in the bar area - sliders, sharing platters etc. We loved this hotel so much we are returning this December.This place is much more than just somewhere to rest your head - book it now!

This was a great location in Times Square. Parking was easy to access. Brunch was excellent and the service was great. Juniors, known for their cheesecake is so close. Walking distance to Juniors for cheesecake, Top of the Rock and Rockefeller center, Radio City Music Hall, Del Frisco's, Sardi's, lots of theaters and Hershey's Chocolate World, and M & M World.

I've stayed with many of the IHG hotels while working in NYC.l and decided to try out the Crowne Plaza! The rooms are comfortable, homely, spacious and quite which is what I needed, with a lovely view. Lots of space to set up computers to work. Note there is no mini fridge. The bonus of having the pool and gym is great and for January the prices where cheap for NYC.However as it's such a large hotel it really isn't suited for business travel. Most staff where abrupt with a few exceptions and just seemed to want to get the job done.I went to print a document and none of the staff could help me, they told me to call a number. I asked for a late check out on departure and was told; 'I already gave you an hour.' There was also a mix up with my credit cards, they approved one without checking the number correctly and charged a U.K. card. The breakfast area was busy, rushed and staff again where abrupt. I believe there was also a mix up on entry, and I wasn't given the correct vouchers for my IHG spire status. This is a transient hotel with guests coming and going continuously. Maybe I should have been more aware of the fact it's a hotel for tourists but I did expect a lot more from this brand. It didn't live up to expectations.

What an amazing hotel. Location location location. Right in the heart of time square. The staff is very friendly especially Sandra that check us in. I would highly recommend the hotel. Views from our room.

Stayed here during the week of my 30th Birthday and couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel. The location is perfect to do all of the touristy stuff. Ground Zero is the only one that is a bit of a walk (roughly 45-60 minute walk both ways), but well worth the walk as you get to see a lot more of the city. Could easily get a cab if needed though. Everything else is, at the most, a 15-20 minute walk away from the hotel.The hotel itself is very clean and the service is superb. I was lucky enough to speak to Victoria (who has been mentioned plenty of times in these reviews) and have to agree, she was brilliant and incredibly helpful. Although Victoria does get a specific mention, I did find all of the staff helpful when needed.Would recommend people getting City Passes if they do want to do Empire State, Top of the Rock etc etc. The boat tour around the Island which departed close to the hotel was also brilliant.Plenty of bars and restaurants as you would expect around Times Square and Hell's Kitchen. Worth having a look on the Trip Advisor app for restaurants nearby if you are a bit more of a fussy eater. You won't have any problems finding something relatively locally!Got a yellow taxi to and from JFK (terminal 4) which is between $50-$70, thought this may be helpful for other people to be aware of as I couldn't see it in previous reviews.Would definitely come back to this hotel if/when I come back to New York.

I would echo TandMMelbourne's comments. The Crowne Plaza was booked 11 months before our stay. It was a nice location in Times Square. I was disappointed at check inn though to be told we couldn't have an upgrade as 'all those rooms were booked a while ago'. I emailed when I booked to ask if we could have an upgrade as it was a surprise stay and I am a Platinum Member. We weren't allowed to watch the Ball Drop from the front of the Hotel at 11.45pm on NYE as our wristbands were the wrong colour. It was really disappointing that we didn't see what should of been the highlight of our trip.

This property is in the most ideal location for tourists. I had a room on the 43rd floor and the view was fantastic. Everything that New York should be. The staff was professional and helpful (though lacking in positivity or even cracking a smile). The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the view from the lobby were all great features. Again, I wish the staff would have looked a bit friendlier, but it is New York so I can't hold that against them too much. The bar served up delicious drinks (though the man who brought them was quite rude. I didn't catch his name). To make up for that though was a wonderful staff of bellmen who were so helpful and even went so far as to put our food in a mini fridge for us until we could return to the hotel to check in. The cleanliness and location will bring me back again in the future.

Although we have been at this same hotel several times, this was not the best experience we had. The room assigned was in really bad cleaning condition, with stained spots on the vanitory and at the night stand with hairs included. So they changed us to another room where I must say the vacuum cleaner was not used frequently. However and in order to be fair, the manager was really helpful and did his best to solve fast and easy the room issue. Hope they improve to the way they used to be: a good hotel in a great location.

First impression ....dealing with a rude Vanessa at check in. We requested early check in and being Gold Elite status, we are afforded this at other IHG hotels. I was rudely told that no rooms were available (10h00) and we should return at NORMAL check in time at 15h00. No offer to message me when a room is ready. Immediately spoiled my mood and excitement at being in NYC.Room was quite big, accommodated 4 adults easily.Location is brilliant...in the heart and excitement of Times Square.Next visit, i will definitely look at other hotels in Times Square.

The hotel is brilliantly located in Times square but just outside the busy bit, check in for ihg members was good and quick rooms nice for new york and clean there is a pool which i didnt have time to use everything else was very good

What a fab hotel, shame the same cannot be said about the food served!! Will defo be back to stay here but will NOT eat in hotel. Not at all impressed with what we ordered. There's many much better food places round about so use them. Hotel room was very comfy & we had a great nights sleep in the beds,

Where to start with this disappointing member of the IHG brand...from start to finish, I certainly did not feel like a valued IHG platinum member. In fact, the customer service experience was so bad I would not stay here again.We chose the Crowne Plaza in Times Square for our New York trip due to the fact it was an IHG hotel and it offered a "Ball Drop" package for NYE.We paid a fortune for the Ball Drop package but thank god we selected that because it was our only positive experience of staying at the hotel (and that was because we saw in the new year in an exclusive pen out the front of the hotel, not because the hotel organised an amazing function).The customer service team were just disappointing. We don't expect a fuss but no one explained anything to us (as in anything; breakfast, the gym, New Years Eve arrangements, the lifts or even how to get to our room). We had selected an optional room upgrade (if available) but upon check-in nothing was offered (which is not surprising given it was "here is your room key" and that was it). However we must have been upgraded because my credit card was charged for it. We selected a non-smoking room but despite this we had the smell of smoke wafting in through the air-conditioning vents and resorted to trying to block the vents with paper after our complaints went unanswered.There is a gym in the building which IHG members get complimentary access to. It's quite good and worth a visit. The location of the hotel is good and a shout out to the lovely staff in the front bar - they were the only ones who made us feel like welcome guests.We changed hotels after our four night stay and the difference (starting from check-in) was unbelievable. We are so glad we left as it made our trip a much more enjoyable experience.Think twice before booking this hotel and IHG members, be prepared for a drop in normal standards!

This was my first trip to New York City and I'm sure not my last. Check in was easy had to wait until 3:00 to get into room which was okay since we decided to go out and do some shopping. The weather was terrrible 19 degrees, do not recommend going in January unless you like extremely cold weather. Our room was very clean and had a desk area, safe etc. We had lunch at the restaurant was good and reasonably priced. We enjoyed drinks at the bar downstairs as well, they give you 2 complimentary drink tickets only complaint with that you can only get One kind of white wine and I'm a Chardonnay drinker.The only complaint I had with our stay is that the hair dryer in the room was terrible, for the price you pay I would think they could have better quality.The location is great, close to shopping, restaurants, shows, etc.

I am not sure who is managing this hotel but whomever it is should be commended. This is my fourth stay at the hotel and that says something!! This is a very large property but somehow they have managed to make it feel personal with a very specific spirit. I was checked in (actually there were 8 of us in 4 rooms) once again by Victoria Martin. Victoria can be best described as lovely and incredibly competent! Nothing is left undone, what a way to start your stay! Rooms were organized, internet access codes handed out and directions given. All with a warm and gracious smile. Hard to come by these days! The hotel and the rooms can best best described as fresh, incredibly clean and up to date. Details have been addressed. I don't know the name of the gentleman who handled our luggage at the storage room but that was no small feat. It was 60+degrees and he handled coats, bags and 8 women with a smile and patience! I love that the staff makes you feel like you are the only guest they are dealing with--- this is five star service. Great job, highly recommend. The location is wonderful too!!

Some of the customer service here is bad ( very bad) , some of it is very good.Staff at check-in hate representing the Crowne Plaza brand name in my opinion. From personal experience and witnessing other reactions from guests, it was clear to me on more than one occasion that guests are just numbers and as long as you have your credit card and it works , that's all they need ( they don't have a passionate desire to serve you as an individual). I booked online and requested a bathtub. At checkin the staffmember was lazy and did not check the request. When I got to my room - there was no bathtub. I called room reservations and was told this would be looked into. After about an hour ( which was quite a long time to wait) I got a call from a Duty Manager who said sorry and I was changed to a room with a bathtub ( but not a king size bed room which I was initially in - I was put in a two double bed room). Clearly the duty manager was very embarrassed at this very poor customer service and I was given a free breakfast voucher and some drink vouchers. Although the hotel is quite expensive and I really think breakfast should be part of the room rate. At breakfast the staff were okay but they force you to sit at a particular spot - guests should be asked if they are okay with the table allocated. Some staff at breakfast need to be more attentive ( e.g. refill for glass of water needed?).Further on the bathtub - it was faulty. The tub empties itself as you are sitting in it - there was a problem with the drain stopper. I reported this problem and was told that it would be investigated - but I have no idea if it was ( I was not informed by email or a phone call - no follow up which to me means "we don't care"). All I know is that the same problem was present the next night. Obviously top standards of customer service that focus on the individual needs of the guest are not a priority at this hotel.The taps on the bathroom sink are loose and not labelled with "hot" or " cold".Toilet does not have a strong flush and can block easily.Housekeeping lady phoned my room once to ask when I was leaving. I responded and then she just hung up without saying anything!Not all the items in the room were replaced everyday. I appreciated the two bottles of water on the first night but they were not replaced for the second night. Ear buds and note pads were also not replaced.There was dust in the room ( e.g. windows and glass table).Inefficient billing processes were witnessed. I had a long distance phone call charge on my bill. The service fee you pay includes free long distance phone calls so I had to spend time getting this off the bill. The service fee is expensive ( in addition to high room rates).I found the TV remote hard to use - it does not easily change channels when you want it to.2 pieces of soap was appreciated. As was a Bible in the room.No green tea was provided - had to ask for it.The bar in the lobby has a very rude staffmember who created issues with more than one customer and questioned what they were asking for ( e.g. there are no plates that come with your cup of tea and coffee - to place your spoon on for example - staffmember was difficult about getting a plate.) I asked for a glass of water and this staffmember forgot - I had to ask again. When I asked for a long black coffee she had no idea and said she cannot process that request. No other business in the world has ever had a problem with that request. I then looked at the menu to try and help her understand what I was wanting - I was very surprised to discover that the different types of coffee are not listed on the drinks menu! She did not seem to want to help guests - acted as if she knew best and did not cater for individual needs. Some of the above issues I could cope with if the room rate was not about $200 a night. But when you are paying that rate ( plus service fee etc.) you expect better - really high standards and quality service.In terms of location this hotel is right in the Times Square area. Lots of other hotels in the area so compare prices.I did receive good service from the information desk when I asked for info. re how to get to the airport. They booked a bus for me. However other staff at the information desk did not really empathise with me on other occasions when I asked for directions - just casually said "it's over there , here" - using map. They need to put themselves in the shoes of guests here for the first time. I am sure they would hate the service they offer if they travelled in a foreign country for the first time.

My husband and I took a trip to New York to visit my old stomping grounds, since it was his first time-- we decided to stay at Time Square. Crown Plaza was very clean and it was very convenient to access the city. We walked everywhere, took cabs and subways to enjoy the city and the tourist attractions. We enjoyed staying at this hotel since it was very comfortable. We deducted two stars since we would hear the housekeeping staff talking loud early in the morning-- I got up and asked them kindly to please turn it down and they ignored my request. Also, as we walked into the room after check in-- our room was not made from the previous guest. So we had to wait a while to get our room cleaned so we can settle in.

While the staff at the desk was very nice, the hotel itself left a lot to be desired.First, it was a not so pleasant surprise to get a 5:30am wake-up call I did not request. Such a great way to start the morning after traveling the day before. Not sure how this would even happen, do they let guests schedule wake up calls past there stay and they are left on the room?The next major pain point was the shower. The valve for the water would slip (you spin it counter clockwiser to go from cold to hot), the problem is you would turn it to a comfortable temperature and it would slip down right to burning hot. The only way to keep it from sliding was to put the lever vertical which was ice cold. I was able to rig a rag around the handle to hold it in place, but this needed done whenever anyone in the family wanted to get a shower.The other issue was also the shower how quickly and deep it would pool several inches of water in the bottom. And standing in a pool of water in a hotel shower is really disgusting, I don't think periodically cleaning the drains is too much to ask.

Central location to everything a great base. The rooms were a decent size a bit dated but very clean. The beds were really comfortable, just what you need after a day sight seeing or shopping! I would definitely visit again. All the staff were friendly and Victoria Martin on reception was particularly helpful - a great asset to your hotel.

I have stayed at many hotels in Time Square and this one is top notch. The location is perfect. It is right at the start of Time Square. Walk out the door, turn right and 1/2 block and your there. Hotel has a nice large bar in the lobby area. This hotel is about $100 per night cheaper than Marriott and Double Tree and just as good as a location. The rooms are a bit smaller than Double Tree but are decent size. Clean rooms without any problems. Good WiFi, I did some work from my room. Walking distance to, radio city, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, MSG, 5th Ave shopping, Herald Square(Macey's), Bryant Park and much more. One of the best deals in the city.

This was the first time my husband and I went to New York. Due to a snow storm, our flight got diverted to Washington on Saturday and we couldn't make our first nights stay. I phoned the Crowne Plaza hotel at 23:30pm to notify them that we couldn't make it for the first night, upon arrival in Washington-Dulles Airport. After three hours of sleep, we made a second attempt to get to New York - La Guardia Airport the next morning and we arrived there at 2pm on Sunday afternoon. Although we were 1 hour early for check in, we received a heart warming welcome from Evelyn at the front desk. We explained what had happend the previous night and Evelyn immediately talked to Chris (her manager) and we were told that we would get a full refund. Thank you so much! But this was not everything...we also got a free upgrade to a corner room with an amazing view over the city and the Hudson River in the background. The room was spacious and had great finishes. Sunday night, we discovered that our heather wasn't working and my husband phoned the front desk. In the next hour we heard a knock on the door and the maintenance department made a temporary fix and told us that I had to phone the maintenance department the next morning and that they would then do a full repair. Since then, we didn't had other problems with the heather and the room was nice and warm.I loved the bathroom, it looked updated, had a calming fragrance and it was stocked with an abundance of towels in different sizes. The hotels entrance is right on Time Square and all the stores were within walking distance! I highly recommend the Crowne Plaza Hotel and I look forward to my next stay. I want to convey a special thanks to Evelyn and Chris! Both of you are amazing and we really appreciate everything you have done for us. You made us feel welcome and you set a positive tone that overshadowed our whole New York stay!

The service was great.. staff was always willing to help .the rooms were very clean. The hotel location is great you are in the middle of time square and I good walking distance to just about everything.. I will return .

Had a brilliant time here at the crowne plaza Times Square ! Cannot recommend it enough for location, cleanliness , friendliness and such helpful staff especially a huge thank you to Joanne at the concierge desk for helping me with my transfer e mail,,,Breakfast buffet is $32 per person excluding taxes etc so we didn't try it but we would if we ever got to go again,This hotel is near so many places to eat out, some expensive,,(Applebee's, $50 for two breakfasts not including tips,, wasn't impressed) some not so expensive like Mac Donald's ,$16 for two breakfasts,,,Numerous amounts of shops to choose from,, amazing location is all I can say!!!

We have stayed at the Crowne Plaza several times. It is a great central location - near Broadway, short walk to Rockefeller Center, plenty of good restaurants, and good views. I would recommend if you are planning a trip to NYC.

Great place to stay and be a complete tourist. We went at Christmas and had a great time. The staff was so friendly, from the front desk (Ann or Linda?) to my sweet housekeeper Maria Santos on the 35th floor. A great time all around.

For the last three years myself and my family have been making an annual visit to New York City together. Having previously visited the city myself a few times, we started to plan a yearly trip together. My mother had never been to America before, so based on location, we decided to try the Crowne Plaza Times Square. What a surprise! Thinking that the location would have its pros & cons, we wanted to get a feel of being completely immersed in the heart of the city. Especially as we were taking someone who had never been to New York before.To start off, Anthony (Tony) the doorman at the entrance is a credit to the company. This guy made us all feel so welcome with his warm and charming wit. My mom fell in love! He instantly gave the best first impression as he welcomed us into the hotel. He has some useful hints and tips about the city too. The girls at the desk were lovely and checked us into our room. The rooms are bright and cosy and so far away from the ground that you feel as though you are in a different location than times square. Its so quiet! There is a restaurant, bar, sports center, business center, convenience store and coffee shop all inside! Its a great atmosphere and perfect for what we wanted. I used the gym facilities early in the morning. The staff were lovely and attentive. The first time we stayed there was a faint smell of smoke coming through the vent in the room. We told reception to make sure they didn't think it was us. It wasn't bad, but unpleasant however for the amount of time we spent in the room it didn't really matter. We loved Crowne Plaza so much that we booked again for a second time. This time was equally as good and we were upgraded to a bigger room too! With all hotels, there are always some small issues. On the second trip we encountered some problems with the pluming and water pressure. The shower was blocked and the water wasn't very powerful. We spoke to someone at the front desk and they sent a lovely gentleman to fix this for us. The problem persisted for the last three days but as we were so busy we didn't have time to complain again. This was probably the only downfall of the hotel. But then again, we were up so high that water pressure is probably a generic issue. The store downstairs is a little pricey but there is a local Duane Reed and Walgreens in times square for room snacks/water etc. The food in the bar is amazing! The Cesar salad & the mozzarella sticks were so good! The barman was so friendly...the waiting staff can be a little impatient but I guess they are busy with lots of people to deal with. Overall I cannot rate this hotel higher. We love it so much that we have booked again and will be coming back this February. The views of the city are fantastic, although we have never stayed in a Times Square view room (I can imagine it is amazing!) we have stayed in a Hudson River view and a Skyline View room. Both of which were spectacular views of Manhattan. I love how central we are and how much staff are willing to help with directions or concierge related questions. The lady on the concierge desk was very informative. I would recommend this hotel to those who want the most from their visit to New York City...Amazing!

After reading the reviews prior to our first visit to NYC we were greatly surprised by how helpful, kind, gracious, and all around awesome our stay was!! Most of all the lady at the front desk named Victoria made our trip that much more meaning full her helpful tips and true kindness was beyond words!! Miss seeing her everyday now that we are back home. When we go back to the east coast Crown Plaza is diffidently at the top of our list to stay!

From the moment we arrived the service was nothing short of spectacular. Freddy at the front desk was incredibly helpful and willing to take his time to explain things to me and make sure we felt comfortable.Brunch was delicious but the best part was the service we received from Alfredo. He went above and beyond to make us feel special. He is one of the kindest men I have ever met. I'm sure he waits on many guests but he remembered us the next day which was just wonderful.The hostess also went above and beyond for us by contacting the front desk so I did not have to wait in the check-in line to get my question answered.Overall it was a fabulous getaway.

Visited with my wife for our anniversary and we couldn't fault the location had everything we wanted within walking distance. Friendly and helpful reception staff and concierge but must say wasn't impressed with the lack of attention and care given by the bar staff noticeably a lack of table service when we sat at the bar three times we waited at least 10 ministers before some took our order and this was at quite times. Overall as I said rooms tidy and well cleaned and a fantastic location it's just that 1 thing that lets it down.

The hotel is pretty, not like the W hotel or the Mariott Marquis Hotel. But the location is a total plus point because it is located at Times Square, you walk out and the beautiful times square is there. Another plus point is that the breakfast spread of the hotel was quite satisfactory and we had a good nights sleep.

The Crown Plaza Times Square was so good we are talking about going back in the summer. The front desk was super courteous , Donald Mei was an efficient and helpful front desk agent. During a snow storm he was able to accomplish the tasks at hand and went above and beyond what I would expect him to do for me. The room was top notch overlooking the city. During a snow storm the overall cleanliness of the lobby , room and the hallways was exceptional. The breakfast buffet was top notch food was excellent and the service was speedy and there was an attention to detail by our server/waiter Ali. As a person who works in Midtown Manhattan and is a frequent traveler to Midtown for overnights to see plays , I would recommend this establishment to anyone and have decided that The Crown Plaza Times Square will be where I am staying from now on.

I am coming to this hotel for some time to attend the Broadway show. Overall this hotel is good and convenient for various activities. Especially, during this visit we received great service from Joyce on 36th floor for daily service. She was very attentive, friendly and joyful.

Stayed at this hotel, a good number of times in the past and had mixed reviews. This stay was quite positive. Though I paid quite a lot for my 3 night stay, I was given a complimentary upgrade to a suite. I knew at the time I was a Priority Club Gold Member, so was not entirely sure what the rational was, but nevertheless I didn't refuse. The suite was really spacious, with a spectacular view of Downtown Manhattan from the top. Bed was King Sized and HD TV was large! Good choice of channels.The pool and steam room which was part of the New York Sports Club was the same as my previous stay.I could possibly be persuaded to stay here again!

We stayed here for a surprise Christmas present for my wife. The hotel were excellent. Fast and friendly check in was seamless and the staff friendly.Room was clean and facilities were good.We had a great view of the city and even though it was New Year and the hotel was packed, the room was quiet.The location is amazing with most big attractions in walking distance. If tour in NYC, it's a must.

Checked in the day after Xmas to enjoy New York City and Evelyn was my front desk attendant. She was super helpful, was able to make great suggestions for dining and site-seeing the following day. Hotel is fantastic and Evelyn made sure we were taken care of.Excellent customer service attendant and pleasure to deal with at check-in. Thanks for a memorable stay, Evelyn.

This hotel was bang in the middle of Times Square great view and great place to sleep. The rooms were clean and the bed and TV was great.The staff were helpful and the bar for a night cap was a pleasure.Overall if it's your first time in New York then this is a must hotel.

The crowne plaza Times Square is in a fantastic location for all your needs. It is a very clean modern hotel with great views of Times Square, the Hudson or 8th Avenue. There is a TKTS booth near by which is great for discounted tickets to the numerous Broadway shows. The rooms are spacious enough, we had two double beds in our room, which were very comfortable. The heating controls were easy to operate and soon warmed up after a cold day in the January weather. Overall a great hotel with the minimum of Fuss at checkout and check-in

It was my third visit at the Crown Plaza in Time Square, the checking was fast and we get a room at the 40th floor as request in the reservation, location is unbeatable right at Time Square. only downside is the parking at $70,00 per night.

We stayed here on out visit to New York. Central location, great decor and comfortable rooms; generously sized for NYC. Only had breakfast here, otherwise we dined out. It was OK but nothing special, there are many other places to enjoy breakfast very close to the hotel so it may be an option to consider this. Staff friendly and helpful. Great little cocktail bar overlooking Times Square.
user_name:
Helen B
South Shields, United Kingdom

review_body: We were not disappointed with our choice of hotel. The location was perfect and close to metro stations. The staff were very helpful and we would recommend it. Breakfast was good and again the staff were very attentive. The rooms were clean and we had a very good view over the Hudson.

The hotel is great but they are the people who make it so special especially Melvin, Rhoda and Freddie who met us well beyond expectations. Amazing service and delicious food too, great location and really show you are ready to host families. Whenever I needed help they immediately helped me. The room is great and the beds are very comfortable. Spending the end of the year here is sensational, they offer incredible entertainment packages

I want to say that from the moment we arrived we were thrilled with the location of this property. Secondly we were warmly welcomed by Tony M. he really made us feel as though we were the only one there and we were assigned a phenomenal room with a great view. I was there for a conference and would surely return to this hotel in the future. We had drinks at the bar overlooking Times Square and the drinks and food were great. There was truly nothing negative about the experience. The room was clean the staff cordial and welcoming attentive to every need. I loved my stay. Thank you to all the Crowne Plaza team especially Antonio.

We were worried that the rooms might be on the small side---we needn't . We had a double double,times square view and it was just the job. If i was to give a comparison, it was a little bigger than a premier inn, family room. Maid service was somewhat irratic( they missed us twice,in a week !). The hotel itself,has everything possible, you could want for a week in the big apple. Fine dining,good bar,gym,swimming pool,blah,blah. It is a tad pricey ,bar/food wise, but in New york,everything has it's price. The elevators have that annoying 'Ding', every time they arrive at the floor,so choose a room away from them. Otherwise, Highly recommendable.

We had our family of 6 stay at this hotel.Check in and out was great.Rooms were clean and big compared to other NY City hotels.Great location.We were disappointed after booking and paying for the hotel on last minute.com when we arrived at the hotel they charged us an additional $30 per room per day for their "service fee"So for this we got 4 drinks vouchers and free wi fi. Considering we had 6 in our party the 4 vouchers were a little useless.So in reality we paid $280 extra for 4 nights to get wi fi which is complimentary in most other hotels.We booked this place as they offered a breakfast included package. That was great but we didnt get enough vouchers and they wanted us to pay $16 for the childrens breakfast. Bit of a rip off considering they eat around $1 of food.The breakfast buffet i would consider very poor considering what we paid for it.Very basic and we had to continually ask our waiter to top up our juice as the glasses were very small. One particular waiter Travis was not very enthusiastic.Would consider staying again but would definitely not take the breakfast package.

We stayed here for 4 days and chose this hotel for the location. We were extremely pleased as the location was right in Times Square and accessible to everything. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is amazing and recommended including a view of Times Square. I called the manager (Juliet) to do something special as we were celebrating a milestone birthday and she went all out for my wife. In our final day my daughter got a little sick and Juliet allowed us to stay in longer until we were ready to leave. Thank you Juliet for your amazing service and looking after my family. We will definitely be back soon.

We booked the hotel for jan 1st for three nights. Weather was bad. Rainy and cold. Room temp was perfect. It did not get too cold or hot. Bathroom is renovated with all goodies. Water temp was easy to adjust. Bed was kind of soft. Not memory foam. The door has an inch opening at the bottom. It lets the light in. Location is great. Walks from the subway station and walks to times square. Will stay again since the price was very decent for the good service.

Fantastic location for Times Square, just walk out the door and you are there. Room was large with everything that you would need and it was cleaned daily. Reception didn't explain anything about a resort fee on check-in, and a unexpected bill was pushed under the door for $150 on the last night. After a bit of investigating we discovered every hotel in NYC does this. The concierge was brilliant at booking trips, but, using their computers to print anything off costs around £10 for 10 minutes. Hotel had security on the entrance to monitor people coming in and out of the building. Although expensive to stay, I would come here again.

Excellent location if you're doing the touristy vacation. Right in the middle of Times Square. Beautiful lobby, rooms were spacious, clean and bed were super comfy. We stayed in a corner room with a gorgeous wrap around window.

This is my second time staying at the Crowne Plaza. I had an incredibly beautiful handicap room on the 17th floor and was close to the elevator. My first impression is always that there is no lobby where customers can lounge without having to make a purchase. You can sit on a ledge, but apart from sitting at the bar/lounge, there is no normal lobby. The hotel is huge. I'm surprised that certain amenities that are located in less-expensive/smaller hotels don't exist. In the past, when I had to get connected(by phone) to the front desk, it always took a long time, sometimes not working ever. As a customer, the same thing seemed to happen this morning when the service person tried to contact the front desk at 7:30.... there was no response and my message had to be communicated... Frustrating.Positives:My room was spectacular- my bed was huge and very comfy-the bathroom was beautiful and everything in the room was spotless.The location for TOURISTS is incredible.I cannot emphasize this enough.Pablo at the front desk was a big hero after 20 minutes in the business center. Pablo copied and faxed documents for me with a smile, after hearing about my frustration with machines whose swipe cards DID NOT WORK (two of them). How can that be in a hotel such as this? Pablo is the man and I watched him interact yesterday, as well, with customers. Some negativesThe breakfast buffet ($40) was very nice, but there is NO provision (for $40) to have an omelet. I must disclose, however, that I had a $10 coupon for breakfast. The breakfast restaurant is spectacular. I did feel a little rushed, however, as the server kept asking if I had signed my check. Not ever having much vacation, I love to lounge during breakfast for an hour or so and I ALWAYS PAY THE APPROPRIATE TIP WHEN I STAY TOO LONG. My stay was very brief and I wish that I could have stayed another night for New Year's Eve.

My idea of a visit to The Big Apple is not to be holed up in a hotel room. This hotel offers ostensibly clean, basic amenities. The carpet in my room however left black marks on my feet. Mmm... No minibar was a disappointment for the price per night. Just a matter of basic convenience. HOWEVER! The location is this place's only plus. Clean carpets would be cool, but I only slept there. Be careful with the advertised free phone calls from your room. I double checked at check in that it was the case. Not so much to my surprise I was billed for calls. When I questioned it, they reversed the charges. Tourist trap? Don't know. Check your bill. But -great location. Do not stay here if you want to be cooped up in a pampered hotel room for a few days.
